review_body: This was a 10-star plus hotel! The staff was extremely helpful throughout our week's stay. The room was unbelievable with a great view. From an very comfortable bed (best night's sleep) to the heated toilet seats, cleanliness of the room, turndown service with chocolates and beautiful hotel grounds. This is a bucket list hotel for sure. There is a nice waterfall as you walk out of the back of the hotel, dolphins swimming around in their pond, incredible swimming pool area,great restaturant and the most beautiful private beach. Absolutely incredble hotel. Highly recommend!!!!

I have stayed at the Kahala twice including bringing a group of 35+ CEO's and could not love this place more. The service is impeccable, grounds are lovely and the right size so you are not walking a mile to get to the beach, the food is fantastic and the rooms are a great size with amenities. The little things like the housekeeper filling my ice bucket daily, making lei's into hearts on my bed, opening the gift store any hour you need all add up to a flawless vacation or event. Plus I love the location so you can easily reach Waikiki or less touristy areas. Grace in events and James in bell services are amazing at their attention to detail and the guest experience. Pete in the surf shop gives the best SUP lessons and everyone had a ball doing it. The retail shop has a ton of local brands that are thoughtfully curated and the BEST chocolate macadamia nuts anywhere on island. Plus it sets a nice mood every morning when you get to see the Dolphins swim. Seriously, I love this place!

When I first moved to Hawaii in 1992, it was a Hilton, but has been Kahala Hotel & Resort for a long time now. Has one of the top restaurants in Hawaii - Hoku's w wonderful food and an even better view, expensive but worth it, also wonderful afternoon tea in the main foyer also, Plumeria Beach House restaurant on the Pool level has a buffet to die for and Arancino has delightful Italian food. You really don't have to leave the hotel for grand dining experiences. PLUS there are still dolphins in the lagoon and you can watch them all day long from your lounge by the pool, finally the beach is tremendous too, put all of that on top of great rooms with sea views and golf priv's at the Kohala country club (right beside the hotel) and you simply cannot beat a stay at the Kohala Hotel and Resort. Disclosure, Paradise does not come cheap, check the rates to be sure you are OK with the cost of the experience. If you try it, I think you'll feel like it is worth every dollar spent. PS Hoku's is our favorite place for Birthday Dinners.

The Kahala is everything you would want in a resort. Amazing rooms, great beach, great view, great restaurants and spa.This stay was just as the Coronavirus was hitting the US. The staff did an excellent job in making everyone comfortable. Unfortunately it rained a couple of days and then we cut our trip short due to the increasing Coronavirus. Plenty of beach chairs no service but I think that was a safety decision. Bar was close enough and made great drinks. One staff person I want to mention was Douglas he was down by the pool area every day moving chairs picking up towels and already having a smile and good conversation. We ended talking everyday and he was a incredible employee.Finally one of the highlights was the Dolphins who live there you can swim with the dolphins it’s a great experience

My daughter and I had the pleasure of staying at the Kahala Resort. Upon check in, there was some confusion as to which package I reserved through a third party. It was determined that I would have no idea that the package was for Hawaiian Residents and both the front desk and the manager (Brian) dealt with it perfectly. They were wonderful and treated us fantastically. We were there during some rough weather and the virus looming. We had a wonderful time. We ate at the onsite restaurants and they were delicious. We were able to use the fitness center and the equipment was plentiful and very good The view from our spacious balcony was heavenly The bathroom was laid out great. Housekeeping was perfect. The entire resort was spotless, It was a lovely environment. We will definitely choose The Kahala again when we visit Oahu!! Thank you for a wonderful trip!

We had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Kahala for the first part of our anniversary trip to Hawaii. From the moment we arrived we received outstanding and very friendly service. The beautiful leis that we each received (since framed when we came home), the great recommendations for meals and activities and finally their help with arranging a day trip to Pearl Harbor was fantastic. We had a fabulous ground floor room, with a view of both the ocean and the dolphins. Our room was very comfortable. Meals were very nice - loved eating as the sunset, overlooking the ocean. Go early for breakfast, the buffet is plentiful but can get super busy. We also went early to the pool so as to get seats away from the pools edge and looking out to the ocean. Loved the service there, help with lots of chair covers, umbrella and towels. We ate lunch and had drinks by the pool each day. My husband relaxed with a massage at the spa. The Kahala is a treasure and we loved our time there. A great way to start our anniversary trip to Hawaii.

I just wanted to give a shoutout to the Kahala. I was supposed to get married here, and was basically on the 1 yard line but with COVID-19, my fiancé and I had to make the unfortunate decision to cancel. I still wanted to drop by and leave a review, because I had a 5 star experience planning. Anna Hinkley was our catering manager, and she is amazing. She answered all my crazy questions, is extremely knowledgeable, and made the planning feel like a breeze. From our initial site tour up until cancellation, she was professional and very warm. Also, I think the way the Kahala is handling the weddings and cancellations is extremely professional amid the Coronavirus nightmare. I know my wedding would have been amazing here. If you are planning a destination wedding, book here in 2021!!I can’t wait to visit in the future and stay at the Kahala.

It was a stressful trip with the "virus" looming and thunderstorms pounding the islands but the staff here was tremendous! Lynn at the front desk and the staff at the Plumeria lounge were beyond showing Aloha and how to make a stay at the Kahala Resort a great one. Thank you all for the great hospitality!

This is a nice change from bustling Waikiki Beach. It was quiet and relaxing. We took the free shuttle to Waikiki a couple times and the driver was great and gave a guided tour as he drove. We found the food to be extremely over-priced at the hotel. With tax and tip, the breakfast buffet is well over $50 per person... (That’s over $100 just for breakfast!) and the cocktails at the poolside bar are about $20 each after tip. Because it’s secluded, there are no other food options within walking distance so we stocked up on groceries while at Waikiki and still spent $100/day for snacks and dinner. One more gripe and then on to the good stuff. The coffee was awful. I expect that from room coffee but it was the same coffee throughout the hotel. The room was very pretty and comfortable and we had a view of the dolphins below. We ate at Hoku’s on our anniversary and at the Italian restaurant twice. Delicious and beautiful food. If price is no object, I definitely recommend it.

First time for me and need to say that the place was impeccable. I never wanted to leave! The staff is very professional and paid very close attention to even on the smallest detail or request. In particular I want to mention Jennifer Young, because her professionalism and work ethic were a very rare gem to find in this hospitality business and one of the primary reasons I will go back ASAP. We had a beachfront lanai room which stepped right out to the beautiful lagoon/ ocean. Great snorkeling & I loved their orchid wall too. Great to be so close to Waikīkī, but in a quiet residential area. No wonder most of the US presidents & celebrities choose Kahala also!

Wish we could have stayed longer. Could not fault anything. Lovely accommodation with extra large room and bathroom. Wonderful staff and beautiful beach. Nice and quiet but still with easy acces on free shuttle to tourist area.

At first impression, The Kahala had wonderful modern amenities with tasteful vintage touches. The atmosphere and staff were all very inviting from valet to front desk to housekeeping and room service. The concierge was great in organizing our 2 limos during our stay. The staff was very friendly, accommodating, and efficient. I felt that we were treated with respect and class, but also felt that our care was individualized and special. The resort is not located in Waikiki, which made for a much quieter and more relaxing stay. Despite its location, it is only a few minutes drive back to the hustle and bustle of the city. If you're not wanting to drive, they provide complimentary shuttles that can take you to Waikiki and other shopping areas. The rooms/suites had beautiful views of the ocean, city, and mountains. The view from our suite was amazing. The suite was well maintained and clean and the furniture and beds were comfortable and cozy. We appreciated that The Kahala offers a variety of highly rated and recommended dining experiences on property. We ate the breakfast buffet at the Plumeria Beach House. The service was great and the food and drinks were delicious! I enjoyed the spread and variety of foods and drinks.Overall, I would highly recommend The Kahala Hotel and Resort to anyone. Our stay was the best that I've ever experienced. I can't wait to return for another staycation!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and the Kahala helped to make it a memorable one. We traveled with another couple and stayed for 9 nights; hence, we experienced most of what the Kahala had to offer. The professionalism, courtesy and attentiveness of the staff is what truly makes this resort special. Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay the best it can be. Wendy, the concierge, was particularly helpful and kind. She knew this was our first visit and she helped us to get the most out of our stay. Mayumi, one of the assistant managers, even accompanied us to our car upon departure. The housekeepers (10th floor) were always cheerful and attentive. Every morning, we were greeted and wished "Aloha." Robert, one of the attendants at the pool/sports rental station went above and beyond assisting me with snorkeling equipment.  The food was equally amazing. The daily breakfast buffet at Plumeria had so many tasty options. You could try something new every day. We also attended the seafood buffet at Plumeria on Valentine's Day. While pricey, the quality and abundance was top notch. The food at Hoku's, their signature seafood restaurant was inventive and delicious. Next, Arancino served excellent Italian food with a flare. Kevin, our waiter helped us to navigate the menu and ensure we had a excellent experience. The Veranda is their dining area in the lobby that extends onto a porch that overlooks the lagoon which is home to entertaining dolphins, and myriad fish. They serve excellent drinks and appetizer fare. They also have a terrific afternoon tea. Lastly, the Seaside Grille, near the pool and beach isn't your typical "pool bar." They also serve amazing sandwiches and salads. They serve some of the best fish tacos around. The rooms are spacious and ours had a full ocean view with a juliet balcony. The view was amazing. Waking up to a sunrise every morning is restorative. The bathroom had a separate shower and tub flanked by his and her vanities and closets.  The location of the hotel is east of Waikiki in a quiet neighborhood next to Waialae Country Club. The beach is pristine and picturesque as are the hotel grounds. Although it is off the beaten path (thankfully), it isn't a far drive to all of the sites. We recommend renting a car. We highly recommend the Kahala to anyone who wants to experience Oahu in luxury.

We recently stayed at the Kahala with our family of ten and everyone enjoyed every moment of our visit. Everything from lovely rooms, to fantastic common spaces, swimming with dolphins and an amazing breakfast buffet made our stay here memorable. It is clear that the Kahala has returned to its finest form after a few years of less than stellar performance. We will definitely return to the Kahala whenever we visit Honolulu and would recommend that you do the same.

Although it is very expensive, having your photos taken by Yuji is well worth it! He is warm, friendly, and will accommodate your photo requests, but most importantly, Yuji takes gorgeous, romantic photos. My partner and I were extremely pleased with our sunset photo shoot. The colours, light, and poses were fantastic, and the process of ordering the photos with Yuki at the lower lobby photo desk was very easy. Highly recommend!

The best thing about this resort was the staff. Everybody was really nice and friendly. Wendy at the concierge desk was amazing, and Kathy, Errol, Angie and Aaron at the Plumeria Bar were wonderful to talk to. Our room was large and comfortable, with lots of windows, but the bathroom was smallish with one sink and a tiny counter. Food and drinks were very expensive and it was a $15 Uber ride to Waikiki to eat at an offsite location. The breakfast buffet was excellent but $108 for two, with a tip. The food was generally good but we did not like the Italian restaurant...it seemed more Japanese than Italian. With a bottle of wine it was hard for two to eat dinner in the nicer restaurants for under $250. The only pool area was nice but very small, and there were lots of young children. The fitness facility was well supplied and quiet most of the time. This may be a pretty nice place for Oahu but, in our opinion, is not as nice as the resorts we have stayed at on Maui and Kauai. We stayed at this resort for 11 nights.

I had my wedding during Valentine's Day weekend at the Kahala Hotel & Resort and I can't recommend this hotel enough. Leading up to the wedding, the staff was extremely helpful and responsive, especially our Catering Manager Kristal Kikumoto. She went above and beyond to make sure our day was everything we wanted it to be, from ballroom layout to customizing our banquet menu, and corresponding with our wedding coordinator. The food was exceptional. I have had multiple guests of the wedding tell me that the food was the best they've ever eaten at an event. The Plumeria Grove for our reception was beautiful, overlooking the ocean, and the ballroom was gorgeous having an old-time glamour feel. In addition to the wedding, we had a hotel room block with a group rate. All of my guests loved staying at the resort. They raved about the views from their rooms, and the exceptional service. I had the pleasure of staying in one of the one-bedroom suites and it was beautiful. We had a view of the pool and ocean. The bed was super comfortable. The couch is even a pull out sleeper sofa, and my bridesmaids were able to stay with me the night before the wedding. There was also more than enough room to get ready, including makeup artists, bridesmaids, mothers, videographers, photographers, and wedding coordinators. The hotel itself just felt luxurious. One of the reasons I chose the Kahala was due to its location away from Waikiki. The beach was quiet and not very crowded, even for a three-day weekend, and made for perfect sunset beach pictures. Also, how many hotels can say they have a dolphin lagoon onsite? We loved watching the dolphins. I can't recommend this hotel enough. I couldn't have asked for a better venue for my special day.

The Kahala Hotel & Resort is an excellent hotel with top-notch service, food, great location away from the congestion of Wakiki, and a low-key relaxing atmosphere. A special shout out to the concierge team, particularly Wendy, for being so helpful. Good seating available around the pool and on the beach, although it helps to secure a poolside lounge chair early for the best locations. The dolphin encounter experience on site is worth doing. The only reason that I have given the hotel 4 stars rather than 5 is because the management decided to hold a private event starting in the middle of the afternoon in the pool area on a Saturday, denying the hotel guests who have paid for full use of all the hotel's amenities access to the pool during those daylight hours.

We loved our 7 nights at the Kahala. The rooms are a little dated but they have a nice charm to them, are spacious and have good facilities and views (we stayed in 2 - a mountain view and a dolphin lagoon room). The pool area is lovely although could be bigger but then you have the beach right there. The buffet breakfasts were exceptionally good and I'm vegan and still found lots of options. All of our other meals on site were a high standard and featured great service and atmosphere (we dined at all except Hokus). The staff were incredibly accommodating and patient with our two young children (2 and 4 months). Prices are high (to us when comparing to home) but in line with other resorts and restaurants in the area and in our opinion better quality and service. Worth getting up to see the sunrise from the beach (and you can grab a complimentary coffee downstairs too before 8.30am). I also ran around Diamond Head from the resort. Thank you Kahala for making our first big holiday as a family of 4 so special and memorable. We hope we'll be back to explore the islands again some time in the future.

We were excited to stay at the Kahala having heard so many good things about the resort. Indeed, the location on a serene beach within easy distance of Honolulu was idea. Unfortunately, the hotel itself is in sad condition. Our room was large, but the carpet worn, bathroom dated, and furniture chipped. The public spaces are even worse - the lobby is an odd assortment of furniture and decor - nothing matches, especially in the lobby bar. I counted five different flooring surfaces in the lobby. It just looks tacky. Sad to see this beautiful midcentury, Killingsworth hotel in such bad condition. Despite the perfect location, we will not be returning. We stayed at the Halekulani last year - a lovely well-maintained hotel. We wish the Halekulani hotel was in the location of the Kahala.

Aloha!Our amazing experience began when we checked in. There were lots of confusions happened before and after check in. Thanks to the considerations of Reiko, senior manager of the hotel, we finally could fix the confusions. We really enjoyed the stay at the hotel. We would like come back to the hotel, hopefully near future.

Our amazing experience began well before our arrival. Hotel Concierge Wendy and I emailed ahead of time to make dinner reservations and explore activity options.. She was BEYOND lovely, and her excitement for us came through the emails. Upon entering the hotel, we were greeted by the happiest valet and check-in staff. The lobby is regal, rich with heritage. A highlight of our trip was the photoshoot with Pacific Dream which the Kahala offers to their guests. What an incredible experience and special treat! My daughter was so excited to experience a photoshoot. Yuki, the photographer, was accommodating, kind, creative and skilled. She found the perfect locations which created spectacular backgrounds for photos. We now have lasting memories for a lifetime. The beach was quiet and relaxing -- the staff made it so easy to set up our chairs with comfortable covers and large towels. We watched the sunrise one morning and that was another special memory we will have forever.Thank you to everyone at the Kahala for providing a perfect vacation!

Aloha! Im not sure where to start from but without a doubt one of our favorite resort that we have visited so far. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the lovely Carolyn at the front desk with a Lei and Oshibori towels which was so refreshing after a nine hour flight from Auckland, New Zealand and spending further two and half hours at Honolulu customs. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and even though the check in time was 3 pm, Carolyn very kindly checked us in around 2pm. As per our package we were checked in a scenic room with beautiful mountain views and golf course. Upon request and to our utter delight we were upgraded to the Oceanfront room with a balcony the very next day. Carolyn definitely went the extra mile with a smile and incredible customer care. Mahalo very much Carolyn. All the staff at the hotel right from the front desk, the bell boys, housekeeping and at the concierge desk too were extremely friendly and helpful. Nozomi and Wendy at the concierge desk were so flexible, helpful, patient and informative. They so patiently answered all our million questions about places to visit and helped us book all the activities and things to do in Honolulu. You guys deserve a special THANK YOU, MAHALO VERY MUCH. The gracious housekeeping staff always kept our room very well equipped with all that we required and very clean and turn down service provided fresh towels, a full ice bucket and chocolates everyday. We were spoilt rottenThe daily buffet breakfast at The Plumeria beach House was fit for a king topped with a million dollar view of the Pacific ocean. What a feast! Needless to mention, they have a great dinner and signature cocktail menu too. We had the famous Mai Tai cocktail at different places in Honolulu but Plumeria you pour the best Mai Tai ever. You guys take the prize. ❤Would also recommend their Kahala Sunrise and Coco Jito Freeze cocktails . ❤❤Alongside the Plumeria beach house restaurant is a semi private beautiful Kahala beach, swimming pool and the famous Kissing Point. Balmy shallow water, a fantastic place to relax and chill with a cocktail in hand watching the mesmerizing million dollar view of the sunset is a real treat for naked eyes. I must say the location of the resort is absolutely stunning and highly recommend it if one wants to avoid the noisy and busy Waikiki. Will definitely revisit this property again. Mahalo to Joe Ibarra and the whole team at The Kahala for making our stay so comfortable and giving us an incredible memorable experience.You all are outstanding. Happy Valentine's Day❤Much love to you all ❤⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Everything about this hotel was amazing!!! To say the staff was amazing would be insufficient. The staff is friendly, warm, kind and knowledgeable. The hotel and rooms are impeccable!! Can’t wait to stay again

Service at the hotel is great! But the building is in need of a renovation.The hotel employees are very nice and service is efficient. Food is so so. Though there’s a nice selection to choose from, hot items on the breakfast buffet were usually tepid. Dinner at Hoku was good, but the room is very noisy.Our Ocean View room was large. Unfortunately the garage was built on the oceanfront, which detracts from the view. The rooms are dated and a bit worn. There were mildew stains on the shower tile. Elevator carpets were filthy. The lobby could be spectacular, but there’s a mish-mash of furniture that just makes the place look junky.Aside from the service, the real draw here is the beach. I walked for a mile along the beach every morning and saw very few people. A free shuttle takes you into Waikiki at set times.On our last day, the pool was closing at 3PM for a private event. Not good.At this price point, I expected a nicer resort.

The pics of the hotel look beautiful and hotel is beautiful when you first walk in the lobby and then check in. As you walk down the carpeted hallway there is a stench of mold and mildew. Once in the room the mold smell is not present. The second day there my asthma was bad so I used an inhaler. My asthma was under control for one year. On the second day my son had bad allergies that kicked in due to the mold in the hallway carpet. AranCino, the restaurant at the front of the hotel looks nice but the food is sub-standard, service is very, very slow. The food is very over-priced. I felt ill after having dinner there. I would say to avoid this place. The breakfast at the Kahala at the other restaurant is wonderful. It is a fice-star breakfast with a beautiful view!

My daughter is a resident here in HI and my first visit to the resort in 2018 was plain fantastic!! I came and had lunch and had a peaceful day just sitting and watching the dolphins. The resort is just regal! From the colorful, eccentric chandeliers to the "botanical" staircase. I had visited the spa gift shop and saw you have your signature spa robe for sale. I do not own a robe and was standing there trying to justify why I needed it. I knew I wanted something that would remind me of my visit. As I stood there, a kind lady working the counter was listening to me talk it through to myself with a smile on her face. She was funny and mentioned that every room had the robes and most guests like them so much, they come down to purchase them. Colette was so kind to take the robe off the mannequin ,so I could try it on. I bought it! As humid and hot as it is out, you better believe I put that sucker on at my daughter's! It makes me reflect on my time at your place and allows me to feel a little more special ;). Colette is a true asset to your team. I will always return here every visit. :)

We did the complimentary photo session with Pacific Dream Photography at the Kahala and we are so happy we did. Our photographer Brynne made it so fun for the kids and we got some amazing family shots. Thank you!

10 Floor overlooking Dolphin cove. Great Sunrises. Huge surf at Wimeia Bay and Bunzi point. Its winter (mid January) which means, Surf's up.It will grab you off the shoreline and suck you out as fast as a blink of the eye. The sand crumbled beneath my feet like quicksand, as I gasped at the beauty of this huge ocean. I'm from Long island and grew up on the water. Just a reminder how deadly this awesome beauty can be. Stay behind any signs and barricades. Do not walk down to the waters edge and play chicken.Kahala and all the staff very efficient,courteous,kind. Excellant service.Great food at all venues but worth the $$$. The club sandwiches poolside at the Seaside Grille won the overall taste great. Easy quarters made it easy to handle, poolside, which is where we were. We kept going in the ocean and then floated in the pool,all day long. Beautiful Private beach. The place to be.Even the elevators were always there with hardly any wait.Special thanks to Enangilina,Theresa, our chamber maids Great Service.Alex, curbside, Good man thanks.And a lot of other people that were just congenial during our seven day stay.Mahalo.

Hubby and I spent a few days here this January and like the time before that it was heaven on earth! From the friendly check in counter staff, to the housekeeping staff. The rooms are 5*. Regardless of whichever "view" you end up with it's postcard worthy breathtakingly beautiful experience!The pool is lovely and heated. Staff there very attentive and friendly.Walking through the property is that of a tropical dream. Beautiful relaxing ambiance.In the evenings by the lounge area "the veranda " they have a marvelous piano player and singer who whisks you awsy4with his lovely selection of songs.They provide shuttle service into Waikiki which is great. Driver is bery friendly and informative of the hotel the area and places to go for food and recreation.All in all a wonderful experience.Aloha, hopefully till next year! ❤

The Kahala is a 50+ year old hotel famous for the celebrities that have stayed there. Beautiful place... service is 5 star , several restaurants that were all very good. The rooms are very nice even from today's standards. All of this would have me rating it 5 stars... however... Although everything is well kept and maintained, the hotel has a dated feel to it.. kinda like watching a movie from the 70's on TNN. The pool is small and there are limited loungers available. It creates that awkward situation where you feel if you dont run down there early enough there will be nothing left but empty chairs with towels thrown over them to reserve them which is funny because some of them end up not really being used. The Hotel is also a 10+ minute drive in Honolulu traffic to get anywhere. Workable with Uber but a little inconvenient. If the pool is not your thing go ahead and give it a 5 star and I think you will love it. I may stay there again but I would certainly explore my options a bit .

Somewhat disappointed from what it used to be. Service was indifferent, food was not at all exceptional. No longer dolphins or penguins in pool areas. Not likely to go again unless it improves the dining experience.

The Kahala was the best experience for me. I I felt beautiful and pampered at the Kahala. I went to the spa twice, lounged by the pool and ocean, ate fine food at the diverse restaurants, and used the concierge services to schedule some sightseeing. I look forward to returning next year for more fun in the sun.

Just had our wedding here and the it was amazing. Grace was our event coordinator and she was super helpful and friendly. The catering department was really nice and attentive during the reception. Always checked on us and packed us a bunch of food from the buffet to take with us. The cake was great and everyone complemented about the food and cake being delicious. It was a wonderful experience and would recommend it to anyone who wants a wedding on Oahu.

My husband and I had our wedding here and it was more amazing than we could have ever imagined. Grace Chan and the Kahala team went above and beyond for us... the food, the location, the cake. Just wow!!! They were very organized and detailed. All the guests loved the ceremony, reception, and especially the food! It was such an amazing day all around!

Our first time to Hawaii and we would definitely stay here again. The Kahala employees are very friendly and accommodating. After reading some of the reviews on this resort being older and dated, we did not find that to be true at all. We were very happy with every aspect of our stay. LOVED that it was a private beach, away from the hustle of Waikiki but only about a 10-15 minute drive away on a beautiful backroad along the coast. Only about a 45 minute drive from the North Shore and about 15 minutes from the Koko head side.

We stayed here for a week and are just about to check out. I am a very picky traveler and I have to say that this hotel is five stars!! The service is exceptional. It is smoothly run and the staff is just fabulous. I did not have one bad experience the whole time we were here. The setting is so beautiful and it’s set away from the bustle of Waikiki. Linda at check in was exceptional. I called before I checked in the night before and spoke to her and happen to have her at check in and she remembered me and made sure we got the room we asked for. Eric at the restaurant was fantastic and remembered our name after we hadn’t seen him in a few days. Food is excellent but a little pricey.The bathrooms are dated and the pool is a little small but beach area is so expansive and beautiful that I didn’t care. The hotel is beautifully maintained so it didn’t even bother me. I would return to this hotel and highly recommend it. The service is better than most Ritz Carltons! Thank you for doing it right where so many fail!

My Wife and I decided to have our wedding at the Kahala Hotel and Resort this past January 2020. It was a very busy time at the hotel with the Sony Open happening at the same time. You would not have known it from the incredible attentiveness of the catering staff and the wedding department, who were fantastic throughout.From upgrading us to a suite to the entire week, making sure we were constantly taken care of and thinking several steps ahead of us, our wedding went perfectly and smoothly. I don't think my wife and I could recommend the Kahala enough for a wedding/stay, we were completely blown away as were our family.I want to give a special shoutout to Grace Chan and her entire team at the Kahala. They were so thoughtful, kind, caring, helpful and just altogether great from the beginning of our wedding planning several months in advance to the actual day of our wedding. They thought of EVERYTHING and went way above and beyond what we could possibly imagine our wedding could be. We will continue to come back to the Kahala whenever we can and that is due in large part to the treatment we received on our special day.If you are thinking about getting married in Honolulu, there is truly no better place to do it. If you are thinking about staying here you won't be disappointed. If I could give a billion stars I would.

This hotel surprised me. It looks a little older on the outside driving up but then you walk in and it’s a very charming updated hotel. My room was huge, plenty of room for my husband and I. Very large bathroom with separate vanities, soaking tub, shower and a Toto toilet. The beach was very relaxing and very well kept. The pool is on the small side for such a large hotel. Wasn’t an issue for us since we went in January but I bet it gets very crowded in the hot summer months. I enjoyed watching the dolphins swim around every day. That was a fun thing to see walking to the beach. We could always get a table at Plumeria beach house for their buffet or it was easy to order food at the pool. Everyone was very nice and we had a great stay. I would say it is a little off the beaten path so you can’t really walk anywhere else but they do offer a shuttle to a few places.

We have travelled to the Kahala Hotel and Resort on most of our trips to Honolulu. Although we have not stayed there we have had meals there on many occasions from their upscale menu selections. It is a beautiful out of the way setting just outside of Waikiki, on the beach next to a golf course. One of many highlights is the dolphin pool in the centre of of the resort. Dolphin swims and feedings are available and a popular activity at the site. The surroundings are idyllic and the experience upscale. People spotting is also a popular pastime at this resort. It is possible to walk there from Waikiki although it is a bit of a trek. If staying at the resort, they have a shuttle to and from Waikiki.

Recently got married (July 2019) and had our wedding reception at this hotel.The Waialae Ballroom is the perfect spot for hosting a small and intimate wedding reception - we were immediately drawn to this ballroom as it had beautiful views of the waterfall!Food and service was amazing - we received a lot of compliments about our food! We also appreciated the take out containers that the hotel provided (at no additional charge) so that our guests could take home some wedding cake at the end of the night! And of course, all the hotel rooms are beautiful and have amazing views - we stayed one night in a regular room with mountain view and one night in a suite with partial ocean view. Anna Hinkley (Catering & Conference Service Manager) was extremely helpful and very accommodating of all our requests for our wedding reception!In my opinion, one major difference between The Kahala Hotel and other resort hotels on Oahu is their Dolphin Lagoon - Kahala Hotel is one of the only hotels on Oahu with a Dolphin Lagoon. If you like dolphins, I highly recommend booking a photo session to take some photos with the dolphins. The Dolphin Quest staff were very nice and made it a very memorable experience for all of us - they even gave us some extra time and extra (dolphin) jumps!Couldn't have been happier with how my wedding turned out!

We stayed 3 nights with my husband, 4-year-old, and 2-year-old for a quiet staycation. The room was spacious and clean. The was bathroom huge, by Hawaii hotel standards. The room was able to fit a crib with plenty of space to spare. The bathroom had 2 sinks with separate vanities, a soaking tub, and a separate shower. The bedding was comfortable. Service was good. The crib was already set up upon our arrival. There's self-parking and valet service for your car. We mostly stayed by the pool the entire time, and we never had a problem getting seating by the pool in the early morning around 8-9am - we stayed in the "off season" in October. Probably the only bummer is that they close the pool around dinner time. The restaurant by the pool provided pretty good food (simple burgers and fries and sandwiches for us) when we decided to eat lunch by the pool. We booked a special rate that included free buffet breakfast and that was simply fantastic; we ate outside on the lanai area and enjoyed the fresh air. For dinner, we drove to different restaurants and everything was within a 10-15 minute drive, so staying outside of Waikiki is still very convenient.Overall great stay!

Our room was very clean and large. We loved the beach area and the beach chairs they provide are so comfortable. The dolphins are so fun to watch each day along with tropical fish in the pools. Truly a wonderful experience and we would love to go back in a few years.

As a young local couple we really enjoy our time at the Kahala! The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating! Darrel and Gary made us feel right at home as soon as we stepped out of the car. Everyone’s smiling faces were very infectious! The brunch at the plumeria beach house has an incredible delicious variety. We sat at the bar and experienced amazing service and hospitality. I would recommend it to anyone trying to get away from the hustle and bustle of Oahu! We had the opportunity to be lucky enough to play with the dolphins, and each and every single one of the trainers, and photographers treated us with such care. It was an experience of a life time. We would recommend this place for any kama’aina willing to spend a little to get a lot. Thank you to all the staff for making us feel so at home. We will be back for more!

I was thirteen when the Kahala Hotel was built in 1964. My grandparents lived nearly & we have loved the property over the years. At a time when many 4-5 Star Hotels have lost their original charm, the Kahala Hotel transports me back to a calmer era. The grounds, service & food are all immaculate. The Aloha spirit is easily felt. On this visit we ate at Hoku’s, Arancino’s & the Plumeria restaurant. All were unique. (I previously reviewed all three.) The bathrooms are large & spacious. We were upgraded to an ocean view room but the mountainside rooms overlooking the Sony Championship Golf course are equally appealing. You can save on your expenses by joining the Kahala Club online which is free. Booking your room through American Express will give you many valuable benefits including a free daily buffet breakfast for two, early check in and late check out, and $150 in credits towards the spa or restaurant use. It is no surprise that this property is a favorite of Royalty & Presidents. Try eating at one of their restaurants and you will see the charm of this hidden oasis.

We return to the Kahala after a 30 absence and are only more delighted with what we experienced. I don’t quite understand some of the reviews talking about how the ‘ new owners ‘ have let the hotel become run down !Yes it is not as modern as some of the properties in Waikiki.. but who wants to stay in Waikiki? The rooms, the staff… All of them, as well as the general management are outstanding. The restaurants… We dined at all of them ..are superb! Indeed the hotel caters to about 80% Japanese visitors ....But other guests are treated with the same hospitality, courtesy and attention! A small point: While the adults Jacuzzi in the pool area says ‘adults only’ it is always occupied by children...On numerous occasions I had to go to the towel attendant and ask them to enforce this rule . I’m not quite sure why they couldn’t do this on their own. Yes, while the pool tends to be small for the size property and is frequently populated by children ..there’s a beautiful serene beach only a few feet away!Joe Ibarra, The hotel’s GM has done a superb job of having an outstanding staff who are truly an asset to the Kahala company! We very much look forward to our return ...and this time not wait as long as we have in the past!We highly recommend this property to all visitors to this island !

I reviewed the Kahala when I stayed there in the summer of 2017. This year I had the sheer pleasure of staying at the Kahala during the PGA tour’s Sony open! I love the charm and the feel of old Hawaii at this phenomenal resort. Greeted once again by Criag, who has greeted guests at the Kahala for over 40 years, I enjoyed one of the best weeks of my entire life!! My suite was gorgeous overlooking the golf course. The service and the feeling which they create is what makes this beautiful, very famous resort so great! There’s a wall of fame with pictures of heads of state, great artists and just very famous people who have stayed at the Kahala. It seems that any of those celebrities that visit the Hawaiian islands all make a stop at Kahala. The location is so very special. The tranquil neighborhood is one of the nicest in all of the Hawaiian islands and is just on the other side of Diamondhead crater from famous Waikiki Beach. Please also see my review of Hoku, the awesome restaurant in the Kahala hotel that is world class. Lastly the gift shop, which features Hawaiian candies exclusively produced by the Kahala, are the very best I’ve tasted in all of the islands!! This hotel is a definite winner and I can’t wait to get back there again!!

I love this hotel... or at least I used to. It was 5 Trip Advisor stars all the way. A classic landmark where you'd always see a Hollywood celebrity or two in the midst of an interesting group of world-class travelers who appreciated the cool 1960's vibe of the Kahala. It ain't that hotel anymore. I'm giving it 3 TA stars due to my affection for what it used to be and my memories of a better-run establishment. It was a unique 5 star city hotel that just happened to be on a beach (as opposed to a fancy cookie-cutter over-the-top outer island resort), which was its charm and why it ended up ranked CN Traveler's best hotel in Hawaii 20 years ago. Now it's not even in the top 30. instead, it's become a mid-level Japanese chain hotel that barely ranks as a 4 star. The owners/management either don't know how to run a world-class hotel (since they've owned it for 5 years or so, they should), or aren't interested in spending the money to do so. The latter is my guess.I've stayed here at least a dozen times in 28 years. First, when it was the fading old Kahala Hilton (which people loved even though it was falling apart...I guess history repeats itself), then as the newly redone and wonderful Mandarin Oriental, and now, as the sad flagship of the above-mentioned chain. I'm very sorry to say, this place is being let go. It looks tired and unkempt. Pros: The Location. It's on a beautiful, quiet beach 4 miles from Waikiki in one of Honolulu's best neighborhoods (or at least it was the best before a Japanese billionaire started destroying it house by house... but that's another fascinating story... he ultimately got sent to jail).The Design. If you love 1960's mid-century modern architecture, you will love the circa 1964 style. It really is a classic.Some of the Staff. A Front Desk Clerk named Given (which is his... given name) is a super nice guy who was extremely helpful with check-in.No Resort Fee. That really is appreciated... and it's the way things should be!Cons: Tacky add-ons and deferred maintenance!Where do I start? Boy, have they tarted up the pure, simple design. They have tacky Z Gallerie level brown (!) furniture in the beautiful, 2-story open air lobby, which is now lit from above with harsh spots that cast an eerie glow on what once was a magical area. There is a tacky metal awning over the outdoor deck off the lobby that looks like it cost $1.50. There is cheap all-weather wicker furniture strewn all across that deck... which was never arranged properly once during my stay. It's always just scattered about. They added tacky blue lighting to the entrance, which clashes with the warm glow of the tiki torches (which they turn off at 10 pm to save on... gas?). There is also incredibly cheap-looking strip lighting under the front entrance stairs. Let me not forget to mention the prison-yard spots that light up the beach area by the restaurant and pool at night. The palms on both peninsulas that frame the beach used to be elegantly lit up at night but all the spotlights have rusted and shorted out. The bulk of the beach area is really dark at night, and there was zero security (as opposed to previous visits). There are multiple cheesy plastic towel dispensers/receptacles blocking the view of the beach from lounge chairs and the rooms. The beach attendants also stacked little side tables on top of each other that block views from the pool. They were stacked there the whole week I stayed. The carpets in the elevator are filthy. There are dead bugs in the elevator's overhead lighting panels. The carpet in the hallway is not clean. The doors at the ends of each hall are so rusted they no longer close. The room carpet is dirty. They added fans to the ceilings and ran the wiring in plastic conduit tacked up along the walls and ceilings. You don't see this in a Hamptons Inn or even a low-rent apartment building. The room furniture cushions were stained. There is an odd chaise lounge in each room that is positioned awkwardly. In fact, all the furniture minus the desk chairs looks on the cheap side and is old and funky. Upon entering, the room smelled a little mildewy, to be honest. The AC makes a weird squeaking noise every time it cycles on. The one positive... the beds are very comfortable, as are the pillows. Alas, the sheets are discolored and don't match. The bathrooms are from 1996... literally... not touched in 24 years. The grout is coming off the white tile, the red granite counters are fading. There are hard water stains on the glass shower. There were the fewest towels of any beach resort hotel I've ever visited. At most, 2 or 3 in a room. And they are not plush ones. The Japanese washlet toilets are noisy and smell like burning plastic due to the heated seats. Also, they're so noisy in the middle of the night I finally had to unplug mine. To make matters worse, the bathrooms are painted a weird yellow color which makes everything look even cheaper. As for the staff, the bellhops/valets (and there's always 4 or 5 around who are usually not that busy) never said hello once -- well, maybe once -- as I entered or left the hotel. Isn't that basic etiquette for a 5 star hotel. To be welcomed? Other staffers were usually quite friendly, including Jacquie at the front desk and the very sweet housekeeper. They did seem to care about your stay. It looked like there was not much pool service, though. (And it's an absurdly small pool, but it always was!) There certainly aren't enough staff at the pool & beach to keep anything looking neat. All the lounge chairs are left askew at night with towels uncollected. Also, for some reason, there were several white couches left adrift on the lawn that get soggy when it rains and have mildew on their pillows as a result. Ewww.Some others have noted the Dolphin experience is upsetting... I'm used to zoos and I do believe they treat the animals well, but no one seems to be paying the exorbitant fees to swim with them anymore, so that suggests either attitudes are changing or maybe it's the fact that they are charging so much for the interaction. There is no resort fee, as I mentioned above, which is nice as is the free wifi. However, it costs $40 to park (self or valet) every night and there is NOT enough self-parking even when the overall garage isn't full. Employees are allowed to park in the same small self-parking area so you are fighting with them for parking during the day. Why not just let employees park on the top level of the garage, which was always empty of cars? Now that the Kahala is no longer tied into any major upscale hotel chain reservation system but rather is Japanese owned and operated, the vast majority of the guests were Japanese, which added an interesting, international flavor to the hotel, which I really appreciated. The downside is the room service and dining menus reflect a less American palate... which means some basics are missing in action. Have I mentioned the prices? If you don't have a car and leave the property for every meal you are going to spend a fortune for mediocre food.The problem is, the Kahala is just not very well-run any longer and the current owners are slowly letting it fall apart. If anything that's been updated, it has not been done with any sense of aesthetics that honor the original design. Perhaps the worst add-on is the tacky Italian restaurant under the rooms adjacent to the hotel entrance. It just looks so out of place and again, cheap. (But it's not!).Until recently, this was by far the most elegant hotel on Oahu. The Four Seasons chain was even interested in taking over after Mandarin left. But I didn't even realize how far the Kahala has fallen until I went to the Halekulani on Waikiki for a visit... that is the hotel the Kahala used to compete with for clientele and it seems those guests are now all at the Halekulani, not here. And the Kahala has such a much better beach and location. I really hope there's new ownership soon, because I don't think the current regime is capable of stewarding this Hawaiian classic back to its former glory. I doubt I'll return till new owners are in place, but I will always have a fond spot for the Kahala due to past fantastic experiences here. For now, it's disappointing and overall, a sad waste of a once-great one-of-a-kind property.I had an okay stay but my visits used to be sublime. I would only recommend the Kahala these days if you can see past all the myriad of imperfections and want to enjoy an Oahu hotel that's not in Waikiki or Ko Olina (don't get me started on that location) and if you can get a good deal, which occasionally appears to be possible. This really was my favorite hotel on earth, hence the lengthy review. I'm that bummed.

I stayed here and had no idea until I walked outside about the dolphins in the tiny lagoon out back. Dolphins in the wild have a range of 15 - 20 miles per day; these have a range of a few hundred feet per day. The sight of these dolphins made me so sad I literally sat down and wept. I will certainly never stay here again and I encourage anyone who has any empathy whatsoever for these highly intelligent animals to not only not stay here, but tell management your feelings.

I'm not sure where to begin other than to say "Wow!". Our family just returned from a week at this beautiful resort. From the moment I made reservations by phone almost 7 months ago, I had the feeling that this would be a special place. Never having been to Hawaii before, during the weeks before our trip, I called the concierge a few times to get ideas for the planning of our trip. All of the concierge's friendly recommendations were spot on: a luau at Diamond Head Luau, a private island tour with Kiawe Adventures, swimming with dolphins at Dolphin Quest, and a family portrait session with Pacific Dream Photography - all were top notch in every way!When we arrived at the hotel after a long eleven hour flight from New York, we were exhausted and hungry. We were greeted with a warm greeting at the front desk, and each of us was given a lei, while our luggage was delivered to our rooms. Special kudos to the hostess at the Veranda restaurant who welcomed us in on a busy night even though we did not have a reservation and who also gave us a warm goodbye on our last evening at the hotel! We found that type of sincere, warm, caring attention at every step along the way throughout the week, even though the hotel was heavily booked for the PGA Sony Classic golf tournament at the adjoing Waialae Golf Club. All of the hotel restaurants at which we ate were first-rate as well (we ate in all of them except for Hoku's which is the hotel's signature restaurant - we had most of our breakfasts and dinners at The Plumeria, two dinners at the Veranda and lunches at Seaside Grill and Arancino - all of which were excellent).The rooms were excellent. The arrangement worked extremely well - the adjoining rooms had a small common entry area with two sets of doors - outer and interior. For unrelated guests, the outer doors could be left open, leaving the conventional hotel room doors (the inner doors) closed. For related guests the outer doors could be closed, leaving the interior doors open to effectively create a quasi-suite. The beds were extremely comfortable, the bathrooms were large and elegantly appointed, the linens were exceptional. The flat-screen wall mounted televisions were affixed to the wall with a swinging bracket so that the television could be adjusted to any angle of the room (although we didn't watch it much). Housekeeping (both morning and turn-down) was extremely attentive and our rooms were immaculate.The beach is extremely beautiful. Although Hawaiian beaches are not private, this hotel's beach effectively functions that way because of the surrounding geography. One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was because we read online that the pool and beach are generally not crowded. Since we arrived after the holidays, we practically had the beach to ourselves most days, with just a handful of guests there. Since the large waves break over the reefs parhaps a few hundred yards offshore, the water is fairly tranquil. The pool is beautiful and warm, and there is a bar and casual outdoor restaurant adjacent to it. Again, the service for the beach, pool and restaurant are all top-notch.We made a reservation for our family with Dolphin Quest, which is at a small lagoon between the hotel and the pool. There are a number of options, but we chose the option that allowed the most time with the dolphins. The experience of swimming with, playing with, feeding and even hugging a dolphin is one of those bucket list type of things that I will never forget - special kudos to our knowledgeable and friendly dolphin guide Alexa! This experience is not to be missed!We also made an appointment for a family portrait session with the hotel's resident photographers Pacific Dream Photography - kudos to Yuki for squeezing us in on short notice! The pictures are fabulous!We had read about the fact that the hotel is a favorite among celebrities. I will not name names, for the sake of privacy, but my son spotted a very big name star having breakfast with friends at the table next to us in the Plumeria restaurant (which is excellent) and he was gracious enough to say hello to my sons and take a picture with them when he was leaving the restaurant after breakfast.There is a long corridor near the hotel lobby with pictures and/or autographs of many, many celebrities who have stayed there.The only thing I would have done differently is that I would not have rented a car - there is no need for one. The hotel has a shuttle, and Uber service is plentiful in the area. The hotel is close enough to Honolulu and Waikiki if you want to go there by cab or hotel shuttle, but it is located in a quiet, upscale suburban residential neighborhood and provided the peaceful tranquility that we sought.In summary, our stay was absolutely flawless and we look forward to future stays at this world class gem of a resort.

After a long flight from the East Coast, it was like arriving in paradise. Our room was ready and we were not expecting so it was a nice treat. We have been to different resorts in Mexico not the crowed ones, but this really did it. I have never been so relaxed in my life like in this place. They have incredible service and their sushi restaurant is over the top. Their lounge is also very entertaining with a great singer/ piano player (so much talent). Also, their restaurant by the pool is great, good service and good food. The hotel is well situated close to hiking places and other activities.

We booked this hotel as it was a member of one of our reward programs, so in addition to getting an awesome price on our stay here, we also received a free upgrade upon check-in, which was great! The rooms are nice, getting a little dated, but large, clean, have comfy beds, and are well-maintained. Every staff member we encountered, especially the front desk staff, was terrific. The service is really what keeps a nice hotel a step above. Parking is convenient, albeit pricey (but similar in price to other properties in the area), but we knew that when booking so it wasn't a negative. Grounds are beautiful and well manicured and the beach is terrific. It's not the best beach on the island, but its a nice little beach nonetheless and obliviously very convenient and enjoyable as a guest at the hotel. The neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful as well, which is nice since we didn't want a property on Waikiki beach or anything similar.What could be improved you might ask? Well, a few things; nothing major, but there's always room. First off, for the beach, simply have the beds sitting out; don't make me go to the hut and ask for one. I know some people might like that "pampered" feeling of not having to do anything at all for themselves, but I'd much rather save the few minutes and grab one that's already available. Self-parking is another thing with a similar issue; not enough space is available for it. I'd rather get in and out myself quickly than have to wait for a valet either way. There's plenty of self-parking space at night, but during the day it seems to be shared with employee parking, so as employees show up to work for the day the available spaces quickly disappear and you're forced to valet. Yes, it's the same price and I don't mind tipping a valet, I simply like to park myself. The Valets, which we had to use a few times, were all great though, don't get me wrong, just personal preference.Overall and great, fun, and relaxing stay. Would definitely recommend.

I just arrived at the Kahala Hotel to our Ocean View rooms - not!!Spoke with the Director of the front desk Bart who told me that these rooms were indeed Ocean View rooms and due to the Sony Golf Open there was nothing they could do!I’m feeling duped!Please beware if you stay here (even though you probably won’t after you read this and see the pics!) that their Ocean View is not in fact an Ocean View!!

The title sums it up. It really is an amazing hotel. That doesnt mean that there arent things that can be improved (read on) but we had a really lovely stay here. I had a good feeling before I arrived as for the better part of a year Leimomi at the concierge desk helped plan our trip which was to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Nothing was too much trouble for her and she helped make sure that it was a very memorable trip. The hotel itself is beautifully located on the water and whilst one might argue that parts of the hotel may need a bit of an upgrade, overall its very clean and the rooms are nice and definitely a comfortable size. All of the staff are friendly and helpful, and the food across the hotel is excellent.So where could the hotel improve? Lets be clear, this is a VERY expensive hotel and for the price everything should be perfect. For that reason, the wait to get into breakfast if you dont get there early is very annoying. There was an overflow on some days but not every day, and one day we waited nearly 30 minutes to get a table. Surely the hotel knows that during busy times they need to step up their game in this respect? For $1000+ a night, who wants to wait for breakfast?Secondly, they have a VERY weird system to get beds on the beach. You basically need to queue up and reserve beds at 8am. Once you have a reservation you are all set and you dont even need to show up until 12, 1, 2pm - no one else can use the bed. Its all very strange and it isnt explained to anyone on arrival. Again, who wants to pay $1000 for a hotel room and then have to go on a waiting list to get a sun bed? Finally, the food by the pool - which is EXCELLENT by the way - took over an hour to come. Again, surely the owners know that the hotel is busy over Christmas? Why not plan ahead and ensure more staff to give better service.Please dont let the negatives put you off though. We had such a memorable stay here. It really is a bit of paradise for a few days. We'd go back in a flash if we return to Hawaii. I just hope that some of the small negatives can be ironed out.

We stayed at the Kahala Hotel and Resort during the Thanksgiving Holiday period and had a wonderful experience.The grounds are gorgeous and the views are amazing.The staff is customer service oriented and attuned to meeting the guests needs.We enjoyed our stay immensely and plan on returning.I highly recommend the Kahala Hotel and Resort for anyone's consideration during their time in Hawaii !

We love the Kahala, and on this visit we had pictures taken with Macy at Pacific Dream Photography - it was a great experience, highly recommended! Such a lovely spot for classic photos, it was quick and easy, and we loved the results.

This is one review that makes me very sad to write. I grew up just blocks away from the Kahala (used to be The Kahala Hilton) in its heyday. It was definitely a five or more star hotel then. That was 20+ years ago. My parents still live there and this is a perfect spot to be able to return and work in a beach vacation over the holidays. However, I was expecting that five-star hotel at over $1100 per night and got what I would say was a three-star experience. While the location is still one of the best in the world, the hotel badly needs a renovation. The rooms are extremely dated, the plumbing can be heard through the walls and the layout of the rooms are awkward and funky to say the least. We had to move once during our 7-day stay, so we got a glimpse of two room-types. (The room-move was a bummer, but we appreciated Jacqui’s efforts to try to do better for us.). The bathroom fixtures are old and in disrepair and the stone work and tiles are from the 70’s. The air conditioning in our second room was permanently set to 64 degrees, so we would walk into what felt like a refrigerator, and the only way to warm it was to turn off the AC and open the door to our balcony. There was a window over our bed that had Venetian blinds which were obviously not black-out, despite the black-out curtains. Therefore we were unable to sleep-in on the one morning we had to relax. The owners should really consider hiring a great architect and re-working the resort. They should also seriously consider setting the dolphins free and doing away with the lagoon to gain some much needed space. It wouldn’t take much to gut the spacious guest rooms in the tower, transforming into elegant island contemporary rooms by changing the layout and furniture and modernizing the bathrooms. The restaurant facilities are wonderful as is the staff, but I’d like to come back and stay if they just spent a bit of money and effort on the rooms experience.

I won’t say this place is perfect as there are always issues where ever one goes, however, like Rocky said in the last movie, Rocky 48, “it now how you fall, it is how you get up”Rooms are big. Rooms are clean. View are great depending on what you pay for. Food is good. When it is busy you may need to build in wait time. Let them know ur staying in the hotel and they will prioritize.Beach and pool are a real classic. Just chill and enjoy. Bartenders remember everyone and are great. Just enjoy.Only recommendation- the hotel need to really do something about plastic. You are on the beach in Hawaii and still don’t get it!1) get rid of the daily shampoo etc in tiny little wasteful containers2) stop providing water in the little single serving bottles in the room. What a waste! Don’t say u recycle these. Doesn’t happen 3) get rid of single use cups. 4) extended morning coffee in the basement to up to noon and get rid of the Krups plastic waste. Great pace however u need to stand for clean beaches and oceans. Right now u don’t!

This property is located in a beautiful part of Honolulu with it's own private beach and Golf course.We stayed here for two nights prior to our cruise.The service at this property is excellent and the staff are so accommodating and very friendly.The breakfast buffet is very good and has a very large amount of different items to choose from. Service for breakfast was top notch even though it was very busy each morning.The property is very beautiful and very well maintained and the rooms are very beautiful, very clean and have very large Bathrooms with large walk-in shower and seperate tub. We had an ocean front room with Lanai/Balcony.I highly recommend this very luxurious property!

Came here on a friends recommendation and decided to give it a try given we usually stay in Honolulu at the Halekulani. We loved the solitude of the property and it's 'away factor' gave it a wonderful ambience. Lagoons on the property and some lovely walking areas make it very peaceful. Dolphins swimming on property. Really peaceful. We also loved the fact that they have transport to Honolulu, Ala Moana Shopping Center and other go-to places. The property is old Hawaiian and it's decor lovely. We found the rooms a little dated for our taste but they sleep comfortably, have lovely amenities, and fabulous views. I will tell you they also pour the best mai tai on the planet. Check in was swift though our room wasn't ready and they made us wait until precisely 3 pm. Not to quibble we had a lovely lunch seaside and our check in was smooth and easy. The restaurants on property are lovely though we had a not so great lunch at the beach-side property on one of the three days we ate their. We aren't a fan of their buffet and felt the food was so so. Their 'fine dining is actually a bit loud, no table clothes and service so so. The food was lovely but we had our best meals at the italian restaurant on property which isn't technically affiliated with the property. It's delicious.  Shopping on property was lovely and there is ample choices for everyone. I liked this property but i didn't love it. It would be hard for me to skip Halekulani when we go back. It remains my favorite but i get the appeal of Kahala which is quiet, out of the way, yet so close to everything. If the rooms were remodeled we'd be all over it. But i think for the money (we paid top price) and for the location the beach views should come with modernized rooms that feel fresh especially in the bathrooms which have dated closets, bath vanities and toilet area.The layout is little odd. Restaurants good but not 5 star. Good but not great. It's a very good experience. Solid 4 star. Lovely serenity and a great night's sleep. Views can't be beat. It's lovely and a great alternative for people who want to get off the beaten path.

Wonderful off-the-beaten path location with a lot of privacy. Large pretty rooms with very large bathrooms, and, believe it or not, lots of drawer space which we haven't experienced recently in our travels. The Kahala has the best--not one of the best--overall staffs we've have experienced in our many travels. It's friendly, courteous, results-oriented, effective and genuine. Let us not forget about the on-site dolphins which are sheer enjoyment to meet and watch.

If you can pop for it, the beachside ground floor ocean lanai rooms can’t be beat. Walk straight out to the beach and private lounges. Morning walks of a mile each way (low tide) and killer sunsets. Soooooo relaxing. And the restaurants, while expectedly expensive were great too. Highly recommend Hoku’s (seafood tower) and Arancino at the hotel and Alan Wong’s and Senia in Honolulu. Wish we could have stayed longer!

We stayed at a beachfront room on the second floor the Kahala. The room was clean and spacious, offering enough space for a family with 2 young children. The bathroom is large with 2 sinks and 2 closets on opposite sides, a tub and shower, and toilet/bidet. The staff members are very friendly, and valet was great. We've visited Hawaii many times, and the location of the property is perfect if you exploring the east side of the island and want to be near Waikiki without dealing with the crowds.The beach is small, but quiet. If you have a beachfront room, it's literally steps away from the room. Be sure to set your alarm for sunrise which is gorgeous as it rises behind Koko Head Crater.We did not have the opportunity to dine on the property as there are many options outside the resort.If you have a late flight, there is a courtesy lounge - just ask the front desk for access.

Just spent a glorious week in November at the KR. I went back and forth trying to decide between hotels on Waikiki Beach and the Kahala and I’m so glad I decided on the latter. Waikiki Beach is a little Miami-ish and not the vibe I was looking for. The Kahala is not in a walkable area, but when you arrive it’s heavenly and beautiful and that’s exactly what I wanted. If you rent a car, which you should if possible it’s not an issue.  The hotel is very impressive on arrival, the grounds are perfectly manicured, and the décor is amazing. While the style is not super modern it doesn’t take away from the elegance. The rooms are comfortable, and my room had a balcony that faced a golf course. I must mention the heated toilet seats/bidet which is becoming more and more common but since it was an older hotel, I didn’t expect it and that shower!! After a long flight and days at the beach that shower was a cure-all! There is even a lagoon with dolphins on the property! That was super cool! All the staff we encountered was polite and very kind. I don’t remember anyone’s name, but the front desk ladies were always friendly, the young lady out front by the valet counter and the valet guys were all great! They work hard and always have a friendly smile.  We tried as many restaurants as possible in the island but also ate in the hotel a few times. Arancino, which is in the property was very nice, I was pleasantly surprised at how good it was. We arrived on a Wednesday night and only chose it because of its location. I did not like that the hostess said there was no availability (on a Wednesday night) and it was clear that most of the tables were empty. She asked whether we were staying in the hotel and when I answered yes, she immediately found a table and as I suspected most of the tables remained empty for the rest of the night. The Asian restaurant was simply amazing, every dish we had was delicious, the service was just as great, and we would’ve returned had we not wanted to try different places outside of the hotel. The breakfast was a ripoff, $86 for two subpar egg dishes, you’re better off going out and trying local places, which we did and were happier.  The Beach is great, not as clear as Waikiki beach but calm and great for swimming and pictures. We explored the island and did not lack beautiful beaches so it was fine for just lounging around.This hotel is a winner for me and I enjoyed my time in Hawaii very much. I would definitely return and recommend it. If you are looking for a walkable hotel, near shops and restaurants or in a more touristy area, then Waikiki is a better option.
user_name:
Lamururira
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in the beachfront room, second floor. It is 30 second walk to the beach. The room is very spacious (we had two young children and they had a lot of room to play) and the bathroom is large and comfortable (2 sinks, tub, shower, 2 closets, toilet). The staff is extremely accommodating and friendly and go above and beyond to make you comfortable and relaxed. The property is not that large, which worked out for us so we didn't have to take the kids very far to eat, the car, etc. It is a very family-friendly hotel. Breakfast buffet at Plumeria is great, though kind of pricey (about $50). Their prime rib and seafood buffet on Friday and Saturday nights are delicious. Hoku's is very nice with delicious food.

Located in a very quiet neighborhood with private beach and dolphin lagoon. The dolphin feeding show was quite entertaining and loved by both adults and children. Totally the opposite of Waikiki beach. If you are trying to avoid the crowds and the bustling commercial streets then this is the place.

I first stayed at the Kahala Hilton in 1974. The grandeur and elegance of the hotel was amazing—of Course, I was only 12 years old. We decided to return to the Kahala because of its fabulous location (close to Waikiki, but in a quieter, private setting, away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki), and the “private” beach at the hotel. The property is definitely older, and can use some upgrades, but the elegance and sophistication still exists throughout the property. Most importantly, the service is five star. From the hotel manager, Bart, to the front desk staff, to concierge staff like Dean, to the housekeepers—everyone makes your stay enjoyable, and you do get to feel like royalty.  Our room—a one bedroom, two bath suite was quite large and very tastefully decorated, and was classical style, rather than modern as many hotels are today—big plush chairs, and a large balcony with great mountain and ocean views. The bathrooms were older—with white tile—but quite large. In fact, we had a large tub in each bathroom. We were welcomed with some chocolate macadamia nuts and fruit—a nice gesture. Housekeeping cleaned well twice a day, and constantly replenished water. The food and drink poolside was tasteful and served timely, they had a cool button to push at you pool chair when you wanted a server to come by. The problem with the resort grounds was the condition of the pool and jacuzzi, which definitely need remodel, but the proximity of the pool area to the ocean and beach (100 feet) is amazing for families with kids who constantly go between pool and ocean all day long. The seclusion of the beach also gives parents a feel of safety and security for their family—since The beach is essential private.  The big draw at the Kahala is the Dolphins—right next to the pool, and viewed easily from many rooms is the dolphin lagoon—there Are around 6 dolphins that swim most of the day in clear view. And then our kids did the Dolphin Quest—a great in water swimming experience with the dolphins—and All of this is just steps from you seats at the pool—so Everything is convenient at the Kahala. The reason I didn’t give a five star review was because of the condition of certain parts of the property. The management tells me they are planning renovations, and if they do, this property would be hard to beat in Oahu, both for couples and families. So, I definitely recommend this property as the “Waikiki alternative”

Amazing staff from the arrival to departure (valet,housekeeping, front desk,restaurant) a huge thank you to Deeneen she helped us check in and was amazing with recommendations on the island,was very helpful with our questions of the property, will definitely return hands down 5 star hospitality. Our family Hope's to see deeneen when we return.

If you don’t want traffic, noise and the high rises of Waikiki, the Kahala Hotel is located just outside of the city in a quiet, residential area. Hallways are without outside noise. Bell staff were always friendly, polite, eager to help with directions. Check-in was efficient and professional; though we arrived early using the American Express package we were unable to check-in early. Hospitality room was available to change etc. and luggage was stored behind the check-in desk. Our room, located in the tower, was surprisingly spacious. Pay close attention to room type and views, as some rooms face the ocean, but the view is blocked by parking structure. The bathroom and dressing area had two separate sink and closet areas complete with a set of drawers. Also, in the room was a Keuring coffee machine, empty fridge, ceiling fan in addition to A/C. Room was always kept very clean and turn down service provided fresh towels and full ice bucket. The hotel had a large beach area with plenty of lounge chairs. Pool staff was excellent with buzzers to call for service. Small pool, jacuzzi and separate kiddie pool, all overlooking the beach.

My husband and I recently stayed at Kahala in a scenic lanai room as part of his birthday celebration. A solid 4 star hotel in a quieter part of Honolulu, Kahala offers beautiful beach and mountain views. While other TA reviews applaud Kahala for service and pampering their guests, I did not notice anything "above and beyond" during our stay. We enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet at Plumeria which was part of our hotel package. Concierge was helpful when we were looking for the best sushi restaurant in town. Valet services were swift and friendly, but would have appreciated chilled water in the car at pick-up without asking. Live piano music in the open air lobby bar was an entertaining way to end our evening. With average service, smaller beach, and close proximity to heavy traffic, my husband and I will try alternative hotels during our next Oahu visit.

We stayed ten days this past November 2019 and it was an absolutely Amazing Experience! Everybody, and I mean everybody on staff treated us like royalty. Attentive to our needs. Going the extra mile with a smile. Caring of our experience and determined to make it the best possible. Each and every person on Staff. Special mention for Concierges Wendy and Nozomi and Dean. We interacted with them constantly and when we left, felt like we were leaving special loved friends. The food in all restaurants was delicious. Their swimming pool is a salt water pool! Did amazing things for our skin. Perfect temperature. LOTS of activities for kids. Location is ideal for our purposes - removed from the hustle and noise of Waikiki but close enough if we wanted to do anything there. Wonderful taxi service on site. Wonderful Hertz rental office on site. Ambiance is peaceful and 1st class. Hotel appointments are very exquisite and classy in lobbies and community areas. Pool and beach are well tended by staff meeting your every need and wish. Room service is extraordinary bringing your order on a covered table with all utensils and china plates. WE ARE RETURNING no question.

Away from the crowds of Waikiki, there is the Kahala Hotel. It's beautiful, peaceful, comfortable with great staff. You have a gorgeous view of the ocean without the crowd and people fighting for a space to lounge. The service was excellent. From the front desk, to the servers at the restaurants, the attendants, complementary shuttle service and housekeeping, everything was very nice and professional. Our room was very beautiful, spacious and comfortable with a huge bathroom with plenty of amenities. The view of the ocean from the room was spectacular! There is also a lagoon where you can interact with the dolphins. Highly recommended.

Where to begin. Wow. My husband and I are on our honeymoon, and I really wanted an authentic Hawaiian feel with our first island. From the start, valet service was amazing, so prompt and so friendly! When we checked in, we wanted to upgrade our room from a scenic lanai to an oceanfront suite and we did not regret it one bit!!
