They let us look at both the 3rd floor and 9th floor oceanfront suite to compare as there was a bit of a price difference when upgrading and we loved the 9th floor! I am currently staying at the fairmont orchid on the big island and the ocean front suite view is incomparable to the Kahala’s oceanfront. Everyone, from concierge, to check in staff, to housekeeping, valet were absolutely amazing. Really a gem of a place. My husband and I loved the live music every night! Thank you for an amazing stay!

We are finishing a five night stay at the Kahala and our expectations have been exceeded. As regular travelers to Hawaii, the Kahala rates in the top 1% of of our trips. The location is ideal with a serene vibe and view of the water.What really elevates the Kahala is the service. Bart was very responsive and professional with our pre-trip requests. All of our requests were meticulously taken care of without reminders.The twice daily housekeeping service was perfect and Delia, our evening turn-down attendant, was delightful. We were out of the room during the day and did not get a chance to meet the daytime attendant, but the room was serviced just as nicely.From afternoon tea and drinks on the Veranda (the manager greeted us by name each time) to room service, our stay was fabulous from beginning to end. We are sorry to be leaving tomorrow and will return.

-From Daneen at checkin through my housekeepers Jamaica and Marylou, the service was outstanding-The 2 room Fitness Center is excellent as is the steam and sauna-The hotel body lotion is high quality-The orchid wall gorgeous, with a chocolate orchid!We enjoyed out stay

It was our first stay ever at the Kahala. The hotel is located in an exclusive neighborhood with guests who are generally gracious and mature. It has grand decor and everyone loves their orchid staircase! We took advantage of the 55th anniversary kama'aina special and it was a very memorable stay! Our 8th floor ocean front room is very spacious, classy and has a spectacular view. We were welcomed with chocolate dipped strawberries, chocolate macadamia nut clusters, fruits and pastries, and a bottle of chilled brut for our special occasion! We had dinner at the Plumeria. The sushi platter was excellent, the miso butter fish was slightly undercooked but you can tell it is fresh. We loved the salad and dessert table. I wish I had room to try every piece of dessert! It was very relaxing to watch the changing colors of sunset over dinner without young children running around or the rowdiness of Waikiki. I soaked in the jacuzzi and tried the steam room after dinner. It was quiet and clean, and I feel safe on the property. Our room was probably near the loading dock and I could hear machinery noise by around 5 am in the morning. But it was fine since we needed to get up to watched sunrise at the kissing point. We took spectacular 360 pictures of God's beautiful creation. It was breathtaking! The breakfast buffet is included in our room special. It is one of the better breakfast buffets with AYCE miso butterfish, omelet station, ono thin pancakes, fresh fruits, pastries, lox of bagels, and all the fine breakfast offerings you can imagine! It was a perfect stay, and we would do it again! Mahalo to the staff of the Kahala!

We stayed 8 nights for our honeymoon.Room was right above the restaurant on the second floor. view of cars drop off/ pick up at the hotel entrance, gray asphalt view everyday. As we checked in, a couple next to us had free upgrade of room.In a room, there was a bottle of champagne to welcome us, which was nice, so they new it was our honeymoon. We asked 6 umbrellas for my beach wedding at concierge, night before the big day. A Japanese female agent refused that each room has 1-2 umbrellas and that’s it. I pursued its for wedding, we don’t have time to go to shopping, it’s for tomorrow AM. she reluctantly called front door /bell boy dep. to keep aside some for us for tomorrow AM, then next morning it was all gone. Non available for our wedding.BTW The rehearsal dinner at Halekulani, they told us to please take umbrella and all 16 of us got free without asking (rain was done for the night so we returned all of them). What difference in customer care! Daily coffee replenished, one day we had half open one, squashed ones that looks like they been discarded, they put it as if they were new. $500 a night hotel, really?I love Hawaii and Kahala beach, really regret to pick this hotel for our honeymoon. If you are not super rich or famous you are not treated well here is my impression they gave me.We will not return to Kahala hotel for our years to come anniversaries.

The Kahala Hotel and Resort, is One of the most exclusive, romantic and beautiful hotel in Hawái. The rooms are beautiful decorated. The service is excelent, and the beach is quiet and lovely. It’s the best option if you are traveling in cupple.

my husband and I stayed here in late October to celebrate our babymoon. We could not be more thrilled with our stay. From beginning to end everything was seamless. We scheduled a sunset photo session with Pacific dream photography and Brynne did an amazing job, capturing the beauty and excitement of our babymoon beyond anything we could have hoped for, and left us in tears (happy tears!) we will absolutely come back some day and recommend pacific dream photography highly.I also threw in some photos of breakfast, mocktails and more.

We were lucky enough to stay at this fabulous hotel while in Honolulu in September of 2019. Everything was top notch, employees were all very friendly, hotel was clean and the entire stay was pretty near perfect!

Been here many times over the past 15 years. The place is looking tired, rugs need to be replaced. Railings painted on veranda, room essentials are no longer top notch products. For the price we paid I expect much more. Too bad this place use to be much better..hope they pick it up a few notches for their discerning guests.

Have stayed at the Kahala for so many years, it has gone through three ownership changes in that time-Kahala Hilton, Kahala Mandarin and now just Kahala. My family loves this hotel, the only place we will stay on Oahu, its location away from hustle and bustle in Waikiki, near Diamond Head, great ocean views and staff that are great and responsive. Love having in-room coffee machine, What we have noticed with the new ownership are some subtle changes in amenities-no more slippers (at least for our room), quality of shower gel and soap provided not as good as before, no more fresh squeezed orange juice at the wonderful breakfast buffet and very little sushi. I do have higher expectations when staying at a 5-star hotel. But even with this, we will be back. It would be nice if they had some relationship with a golf course. But new owners-please do not go cheap, we love the amenities we have gotten used to over the last two decades.

Such a great place that welcomes kamaaina guests & their pups...we took advantage of their Kahala 55th anniversary special that threw in free parking, breakfasts & resort credits...they put us on the top floor...rooms are huge...it was wonderful...

We had a Conference at The Kahala and were so pleased with the hotel and all the staff that supported our meeting. Their hard work and dedication to our event is worthy of the mention!! So, thank you to:Banquet Manager: WonBanquet Captains: Roy (for Luau Dinner) & Iris (for meetings)Banquet Servers: Khai, George, Jacky, Jamiann, Victor, Gerald, Jerry, NormanAs well as Kristal, Susan and Dino - thank you all from the bottom of my heart for helping me. They were rock stars with the help in planning the events as I was working from St. Louis and the distance and time difference proved to be a challenge. I would HIGHLY recommend The Kahala Resort for a Meeting Destination. Reach out to Kristal - she's the best!! In addition to this, it is also PARADISE!!! The hotel and location are perfect.

From start to finish Anna Hinkley who is the Catering & Conference Service Manager for the Kahala Resort has been there for us! Anna is an OUTSTANDING source of experience, knowledge and professionalism - WE JUST LOVE HER!!! I recommend you all to contact Anna for all your wedding/party/function needs! Although very professional, Anna has become a part of my family for the past 8 months I got to know her while working my venue. She kept me calm and focused and our event went on without a hitch. Mahalo palena 'ole (Gratitude beyond measure) Anna. Now that the wedding is over, we will be planning a staycation before the year is up. You have made our wedding EXTRA SPECIAL!!!

I enjoy this property immensely - it's a gorgeous hotel in a quiet upscale neighborhood. A few minutes and a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Closer to Hanauma Bay than staying in town. Plenty of restaurants in the Kahala area.

The setting of this hotel is perfect if you are looking to get away from the craziness of Waikiki beach. It is a lovely historic hotel on a gorgeous stretch of very private beach with water shallow and sandy with no waves, so perfect for kids and people like me who can’t swim very well! The service here is excellent and the staff so nice. The room is very large and beds comfortable. They might want to update the carpets though, as they are a little tired. When we first arrived I was a little disappointed by the fact that our ocean view lanai room faced the ocean, but had a big parking garage in front of it and generators that hummed all day long. However, the manager Song met with us and showed us some other rooms and tried to make us happy. In the end, we decided to stay in our room because we had settled in by then and tried to just look past the parking garage. The staff can’t be faulted at all, just a poorly designed hotel that was built a long time ago. We ended up really enjoying our time here and will miss it when we head home soon. Mahalo to all the wonderful staff at the Kahalo.

Do not stay here!!!!!!!! They are rude and unprofessional! We switched hotels to the Halekulani which was a nicer hotel for almost the same price. Also when we complained they did nothing to fix the issues...Also they made us pay for the night we didn't stay there.UMMMMM what happened to hospitality?GROSS, outdated! Trust when I say I travel the world in luxury hotels and this one is a hard pass!

Well, here we are again. Just can’t get enough of the fabulous Kahala with it’s refreshing “ aloha spirit”. Doesn’t matter which month you come , it is always it’s lovely, peaceful, relaxing, inviting, welcoming self. Everyone at the hotel - and I do mean everyone - makes you feel so welcome. If there is anything special you want or need, no problem. It will be waiting for you in your lovely room and if you think of anything else you need, just ask and it will arrive before you hang up the phone. Amazing. The location of the Kahala is one reason I chose it in the first place. It is a perfect peace of real estate about 3 miles away from noisy Waikiki, on the beach but private and quiet. Just what we want. It is a very plush, first class hotel and they have a wall of royalty and celebrities who have stayed there. Yes, it can be expensive but they have some wonderful specials which we take full advantage of which makes relaxing in the lap of luxury possible. As I have noted, any time you come is wonderful. If you do have the opportunity to come mid December you will be awed by the extraordinary Christmas decorating. I have never seen anything like it. First class and exquisite. Everything at the Kahala is first class. It has always been peaceful and quiet but they do offer lots of entertainment and fun things to do - like swimming with the dolphins which is on my bucket list. They offer paddle boards, kayaks, snorkel and fins, spa, lovely Hawaiian music in the background, classes about Hawai’i . Several amenities they usually have were missing this time and I asked for them and they magically appeared. Amazing. Every time we leave we know we will be back. If there’s anything not to like, I haven’t found it,

The Kahala is the Best and only place to stay when visiting Honolulu! It’s very elegant and old school without being stuffy and still very simply stated and elegant without being presumptuous and is always comfortable. We are always greeted warmly upon arrival and also warm goodbyes that make you sad to leave but always anxious to return. In fact, one of the Kahala’s greatest assets is it’s totally relaxing and has an extraordinary staff who keep making you feel totally comfortable. Many of the staff have been there for over 20 years which always is the sign of a supremely managed hotel and the Kahala certainly is that!  Returning is often like seeing old friends, almost like coming home after a long trip after being away.

Absolutely the perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and relaxation! Views are simply amazing. Every aspect of our stay there was lovely. Front Desk service was welcoming, Bell service - Alex as efficient and friendly, Howard made sure we always had towels and chairs on the beach and he was delightful! The Tropical Deluxe pedicure by Loretta was fabulous! Food was wonderful. Would never consider staying anywhere else!

Stayed recently for a wedding, this is a very good resort. Parks and gardens as you would expect are in great condition. Staff are very friendly and the room service cleaners are excellent, they even turn your bed down at night. It is however very expensive, but if you are staying there im guessing you are not on a budget. The best part is the pool area, the two guys serving drinks liked to talk football and poured a good blue hawaiian as well. If you are looking for a true 5 star resort i highly recommend this place. The rooms are very large and the bathrooms are spacious and even have a 'his and hers' setup.

My husband, daughter and I had a wonderful stay at Kahala in July 2019 for our combined family vacation and wedding. The hotel speaks for itself and there are many reviews on here already to attest to the quality of the hotel and resort. My review is about our wedding and the quality of service we received from Anna Hinkley who helped us plan our special day. Anna is so lovely and working with her was very easy and enjoyable as she was always polite and responsive in all of our communications and answered every question no matter how trivial. We live in Australia and didn't have a Hawaii based wedding planner so it was great to be able to work directly with Anna and get things organised so simply and without any stress. Anna also accommodated our preference to communicate solely via email which was really appreciated.Anna even assisted us on our wedding day and helped with the ceremony. It was really nice to have her there to witness the ceremony since we had no family or friends present. She is also in one of our wedding photos which I was very happy about (and it is a great photo!).I would highly recommend Kahala, and in particular Anna, to anyone planning a destination wedding in Hawaii, especially if you are organising the wedding on your own without the assistance of a wedding planner. Thanks so much for everything Anna! - Lisa, Lloyd and Lilliana

We arrived at night. The check in was easy but we couldn’t help but be surprised by how early the bar was closed. This was the case for each night of our visit, everything shuts too early.When the bar was open and the lobby entertainment was on it was actually pretty good.It was in the lobby, however, where I noticed a bit of a cleanliness issue with the chair and sofa cushions which were all marked or covered in hair. This was the same for the couch in our room.Talking about the lobby, this is where you can find the reception and concierge. The staff there are kind and helpful, especially ‘Nozomi’.In our room, we had an incredible view with a nice view of the dolphins. Whilst the prices to swim with the dolphins were extortionate, we did manage to get a free experience with them when my hat blew into the water and one of the dolphins took it for a swim.Moving on to breakfast which I feel really lets the resort down big time, so much so that it doesn’t even feel like it’s part of the hotel. Just to name a few issues here, it’s dirty with birds bouncing everywhere and mouth outlines still on glasses. It’s also overpriced with not a lot of food options.The staff are also clueless on the whole. For example, if you ask for a normal thin crape, you are getting a stack of the thickest crapes you’ve ever seen.The only nice staff member at breakfast was ‘Carol’.To round off this review, the hotel also has 3 sources of wi-fi which is always good.

Still the premier hotel on the island. Away form the crowds and bustle of Waikiki, this is what a vacation is supposed to be. From the terrific bell staff, to the super front desk, to the friendly housekeeping staff (who knew my name) to the bar and restaurant staff, the spirit of ALOHA is alive and well at the Kahala. Class, hospitality and dedication to excellence was exhibited by all. Kudo's to the general manager for a job well done.

We celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary last month at the same resort we honeymooned 35 years before. The Kahala is the gift that keeps on giving, and that goes for the staff, the food and the service. The genuine Hawaiian thoughtfulness of everyone once again left a stamp on our hearts in a beautiful way. Mahalo!

Thank you Kahala Team for one of the best vacations of our life!We just returned from an unforgettable experience at The Kahala. We actually were booked at another five-star resort on Oahu and ended up checking out minutes after checking in. I had always heard of The Kahala Resort but had never stayed there. We inquired and Bart, the front desk Manager invited us to come and show us several room categories that were available.From the minute we arrived we felt like we were in an Oasis of peace and tranquility in comparison to the other hotel we had booked.Ying and Bart quickly and seamlessly checked us in even though we were a last-minute reservation. Bart brought us personally to the concierge desk to ensure we could get a table at the extremely-booked AranCina restaurant. We decided on a ground-floor ocean-front room with direct access to the flawless and pristine beach.Our luggage arrived immediately thanks to the wonderful Bellman Alex!It was dusk and we immediately jumped into the beautiful ocean during the magical hour of sunset. From that moment on I realized this was the best ocean-front resort I had been to in the North American / Pacific Rim region.Our room was beautiful and elegant. Our Housekeeper Venus was an Angel! She tended to every detail and took such good care of us every day!!! Thanks to Luce and Erlinda also from the Housekeeping team who helped with some special requests.We enjoyed a lovely meal at AranCina. Our Server Alben took extra special care of us and organized a personal customized pizza for us. Guillermo and McKenzie were also very attentive. Fantastic service and food!The Beach Team arrived everyday with smiles to put towels on our chairs. Thank you Amanda, Jenny, and all the team for taking such good care of us!We love good food and Nozomi and Cameron and all the concierge team made some fantastic recommendations including The Kahala Signature restaurant Hokus which we highly recommend.We would like to give special thanks to the Room Service Team! As we had a beach-front room we enjoyed a lot of room service breakfasts and one dinner. Thank you Helena, Eddie, Jay, John, Kwong, and the whole team for all the details and all the genuine smiles!!! So much Aloha in that team!!!The management team were all very engaged and present. During our stay we were graciously greeted by the Resort Manager Joey Ibarra. He had heard about our sudden decision to leave the other hotel and come to The Kahala and wanted to make sure we were enjoying our stay. Oh boy were we ever!! This was one of our favorite beach vacations ever!The Rooms Divistion Manager Steve Tabiolo and the Chief Engineer Pat Silva also made a point to introduce themselves to us and ask if everything was up to our expectations.Our response was: "No, our expectations have not been met, they have been massively surpassed"!! Thank you to the entire Team of The Kahala Resort for your most gracious hospitality and your world-class service with excellence!We look forward to our next visit to our new favorite Hotel /Resort in Hawaii and the Pacific Rim!!! Aloha!!!

Nice hotel with a storied history. I stayed here because I had family members who were at the adjacent condos. I had never stayed in the Kahala area and I liked it. It has a neighborhood feel, close to a shopping mall, and not too far from Waikiki or Hawaii Kai. During my entire stay the hotel entrance/lobby was transformed into a film set for the upcoming TV movie “Same Time, Next Christmas,” so I guess this year’s Christmas holiday season started early for me. Not a big deal. I had a comfortable bedroom and spacious bathroom. The hotel has a nice fitness room and men’s steam, sauna, whirlpool relaxation area, although it is separate from the spa treatment area which prevented me from getting a massage. I prefer they be in the same area. Management should know, if they don’t already, that the retail Chi Fitness room has a window that looks directly into the men’s hot tub area which is clothing optional. The window has bamboo blinds but they were open when I walked in. Totally inappropriate. In addition to this voyeur window, the hotel had way too many kids (which I expected since it’s not adults only) and way too many weddings (like 4/day). I had a better time relaxing at the adjacent condo pool area.

It's always disappointing when someone makes a management decision to allow a film crew to overwhelm their property for a six-figure sum, inconveniencing paying hotel patrons and putting a damper on holiday plans. Someone allowed a film crew (Freeform Studios) to film and dump their equipment on a busy Labor Day holiday week. We also were blessed with Christmas decoratiosn all over the lobby in August as the theme of this cable stinker is during the holidays. We were not happy spending over $7,000 only to be second fiddle to a film crew, I hope management was happy with their location fee.

Beautiful hotel with Hawaiian charm.I love going for their afternoon tea :)I disagree with having dolphins in the hotel doing shows and stuff....back then when it was Hilton Kahala or Kahala Mandarin Orientals, the dolphins were just swimming in the lagoon but now, they make them work for more money :(Christmas time, the hotel is decorated beautifully with seashells

My family has been coming to this hotel for over 30 years. The exceptional beauty and peace here turns a vacation into a spiritual experience. A perfect sand beach, beautiful trees and tropical flowers everywhere, so different from the noise and crowds of waikiki. A lush lagoon with dolphins and sea turtles. We have never had less than a wonderful trip here after 40 plus visits.

Very comfortable rooms. We had both the sea-view and the mountain-view one for our grown-up kids. We particularly appreciated the hotel's own beach and its location away from the crowded Waikiki area. We dined in and out and enjoyed ourselves greatly.

The Kahala Resort is secluded but not far from the action of Honolulu. It's location can simply not be compared, because there is no other resort near it. The beach is almost private. The grounds are beautiful and kept clean. The hotel transports you to an older era of Hawaii, but with all the modern amenities. Service you ask? They should be the standard for the entire hospitality industry! We spent a week there and only wished we had more time.

I would visit soon again. The staff was nice and catering. You get a great view of the ocean from your window. Plus I love swimming so it was perfect for me. so if you like the ocean this place would be good for you. Come and you wont regret it.

I booked the Kahala because the prices at all hotels that I usually stay in for less were as expensive as the Kahala. With that in mind, I decided go here. This is an island legend and known to be one of the best resorts on Oahu. It is away from Waikiki without being too far away from all that Honolulu has to offer. The Kahala definitely maintains a vintage feel with elegance, though some of the common areas are showing wear, particularly the furniture. The pool and beach area are great because they are within feet of each other and you park in your chair and go to back anf forth to both throughout the day. Additionally, they offer food and drink service both on the beach and at the pool.What impressed me the most about my stay was the incredible staff. every single staff member was always smiling and cheerful and learned my name. The housekeeping staff was very responsive cleaning my room early by request. I hosted local friends at the Hoku's Sunday brunch, and while expensive, it was excellent food and service and my guests ate their weight in lobster and crab and clearly enjoyed their meal as did I. I also particpated in the dolphin program. I was hesitant due to the price but in the end I booked the "Dolphin Encounter" and it was worth every single minute. We were in the water with the dolphins the entire time, but, (thankfully) at no time did we hold on to them to swim. It is trully an opporunity to interact alongside with these lovely creatures.

Totally recomendable! I spend 9 days in these resort with my family the hotel have a great location perfect for kids there is a great pool an awesome beach and a pool with dolphins. Truly amazing. The staff where wonderful and very attentive the food amazing and hotel decore contemporary and luxurious.Is away from the noisy Waikiki beach but close enough to get there for a stroll in 20 minutes by car.

Incredible property, private beach, amazing service, great food, great location.HIGHLY RECOMMENDEDYou won't be disappointed. Every one working at the Kahala is focused on making you feel pampered and having a wonderful vacation.

Last leg of our Hawaii trip and we really wanted to avoid the circus crush of Waikiki. Decided on the Kahala Hotel and Resort and it was a great decision. Pristine beach, outstanding rooms and amenities - peaceful and relaxing. The staff were outstanding. Thanks to all the staff for allowing us to have the perfect finale of our trip.

My husband and I stayed at the Kahala resort we were able to play golf at the Waialae County Club which was awesome, also I had my nieces that live in Hawaii come over and they loved watching the dolphins The beach is awesome great for swimming.

I'm a local wedding planner on Oahu, and used The Kahala to book a room block for the family of my bride & groom. While we were not using The Kahala for the actual wedding, the staff at The Kahala still treated us like VIPs from start to finish. I was able to check in with the booking department frequently and always received very quick responses. When it came to dropping off Welcome Baskets to our guests rooms, they didn't even blink an eye and handled getting each guest a basket in their room (which the guests adored!). After my guests checked in, the Mother of Bride was concerned about finding a private space to play some bridge with her friends while they were staying there, and the Kahala team gave her great advice and suggestions on how/where to do this. I cannot express enough my gratitude for The Kahala taking care of my guests like their own family, and I am not a lifelong fan of this hotel. Special thanks to Kelly, Susan, James (the concierge with the mostest!) & Janice!

I'm fortunate to have friends who live near the Kahala Resort. We make at least 2 trips to the Plumeria Restaurant at least twice when I visit. The service is outstanding and the food sublime. The portions are generous and presentations are quite generous. The restaurant is an open air beach side venue with both outside and inside service.

We had a difficult start to our stay at the Kahala. We came from the Four Seasons on the Big Island and it was an oasis with the most attentive service. So when we arrived at the Kahala we had expected the same type of service. Not so much. No bell man seemed interested when our taxi pulled up so we carried our own luggage through the busy lobby to the not so well marked reception desk. We waited in line and then while the person behind the desk was friendly she was not particularly helpful. We arrived around noon and our room was not ready. This was a big disappointment since we were only in Oahu for two nights so we had only a day and a half to enjoy the resort. We had planned to go to our room and head off to the beach and explore. They offered us the use of the hospitality suite while we waited for our room to be ready (after the bellman had already stored our luggage). The reception desk did not really give us directions to the hospitality suite or how it worked. So we had to figure out how to get our bags from the bellman and find the hospitality suite. The hospitality suite only had two small changing rooms (which were in use) so we had to change in the bathroom. It was less than ideal. Then we had to get the bellman back to store our luggage again. It was a hot and annoying start to the stay. When we got to the pool/beach area it was chaotic and busy. It was not what we had expected. We had lunch and played in the ocean and it made us feel a bit better but not really relaxed. We finally got our room at three. Which was just enough time to get changed and ready for our 4pm dolphin experience. The dolphin experience was awesome. We had a great time. And our room was excellent (1217 overlooking the dolphin pond). The room was large and spacious. The housekeeping was also super efficient. They got us extra towels within 5 minutes of asking for them and also got us a pull away bed - also within minutes of asking. I would highly recommend the rooms overlooking the dolphins. We were on the second floor and from our balcony had an excellent view of the dolphins swimming. In the morning we had fun watching them playing with each other for hours. Room service breakfast was fast and good. And the service at the beach was great. We did not get to the beach until around 10:30 so I was worried we would not find a place to sit in the shade. No need to worry. They found us four chairs in the shade under some trees on a grassy part of the beach. It was a lovely day at the beach. The water is great for kids. Not much sea life to look at but an easy place for kids to play safely in the ocean. On the whole we enjoyed our stay but would not plan for an relaxing check in and I would not plan on the hospitality suite being all that hospitable.

Quiet and beautiful with views that g one for miles. On-site dining was great and the staff a delight. A bit remote if you want the nightlife of Honolulu, but that's not why you're here, right? Easy to get out an explore the island if you don't want to deal with the city.

I always worry that this property will not be as wonderful as the last time I visited. Such worry is absolutely misplaced. It's still wonderful. The food is excellent and the grounds and rooms still beautiful.

For our 1st trip to Hawaii, we spent the first 4 nights at the wonderful and luxurious Kahala Hotel & Resort.Starting with getting leis upon check in, my 10 year and I really felt the Polynesian and Hawaiian spirit.The hotel is paradise but not stuffy and child friendly. As both of us love animals, my son spent an hour with the dolphins via the Dolphins Quest program. Yes, its pricey as are the photos we purchased, but I'm sure its something he won't forget anytime soon as where else can you say you swam with dolphins and got to visit them everyday in their lagoon. Breakfast at the Plumeria is pretty extensive as its both American and Japanese, so there is the assortment of omelets, waffles, bacon as well as rice, miso soup, etc. The restaurant is on the ground floor of the hotel and the pacific Ocean provides a beautiful backdrop as well as a gentle, yet warm breeze.The Kahala is not walking distance to anything and is about 15 minutes from Waikiki. The hotel does provide some shuttle service but we just called for an Uber whenever we left the property. I liked the secluded resort feeling as we were moving to Waikiki on our next stop.The hotel has a kind of Wall of Fame with photos of celebrities who've stayed at the Kahala hotel over the years and I for one am privileged to have stayed here and will definitely return on our next Honolulu trip.

My family stayed here for 4 nights in July and what an absolutely wonderful experience we had! We wanted to visit Oahu but I didn’t want to stay in Waikiki. I wanted a private beach and pool and quiet at night and this checked all the boxes. It is situated in a residential area of Honolulu away from all the hustle and bustle, yet close enough to everything that we wanted to do. We visited Waikiki several evenings for dinner and shopping but we all said that we were glad we didn’t stay downtown!The Kahala was truly a 5 star resort with impeccable service and a quiet beach. We booked an oceanfront room in the tower but ended up with a beachfront room at the very end of the Dolphin Wing as they didn’t have any more double/double when we checked in. We weren’t complaining! We were steps away from the beach and pool and couldn’t have asked for a better room. The room was spacious enough for 4 (kids 10 and 12) and housekeeping was topnotch. The dolphin lagoon was such a treat to experience (thru Dolphin Quest) and the kids loved seeing the dolphins and sea turtles daily. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet a couple of the days we were there as well as the poolside service for snacks and drinks. We were also only 7-8 min from Kahala Mall and a Whole Foods. I also took advantage of visiting Shangri La (a must see) thru the KISCA program while my kids and husband took the complimentary bikes for a ride. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our massages at the Spa. Everyone that worked at the hotel was welcoming, friendly and willing to go above and beyond. We hope to be able to visit again!

The Kahala surely does aim to please and their service is impecible! From the moment you arrive they greet you with smiles, open arms to help and go beyond to make sure you are happy there. I loved the pool service, they even blew up our pool floaties for us that we brought with us. They always had refreshing infused water all around the pool area. The private beach is a dream! It literally is in the backyard of the resort. The views are amazing from the waterfall to the sea turtles. The only kind of misleading thing is the dolphins. From reading I had the impression you would be seeing the dolphins swim, twirl and interact with them. That only happens if you pay to do an activity with them. Or you can watch them when they are interacting/performing for a group that paid for an activity. Otherwise you don't see them. I paid for my youngest daughter to get to do the dolphin experience and it was well worth the money though! It's a memory that will last her a lifetime!!! We surely enjoyed all the perks from the nightly turn down service, robes and even the housekeeping went the extra mile and folded the clothes we left out. Which I wouldn't expect of them but was pleased with the gesture. The concierge took care of anything we asked and even accommodated us for the Sunday Seafood brunch even though they were full. We also dinned downstairs for dinner and our server Cliff was AMAZING! Very helpful explaining the menu, offering tips and suggestions. They made a virgin style drink for the kids so they could drink out of the exotic pineapple. Cliff packed up all of our food at the end to go and treated us so wonderful! All of us left with smiles and very happy with our service. Lastly, the shuttle service is a great help. The drivers name is slipping my mind at the moment but he is very knowledgeable and very nice. They recommend scheduling a day ahead of time and that is smart to do. They only have one shuttle and it is on the smaller side. BUT they will try to accommodate you if they can. They entire staff seems to live by that train of thought. Very accommodating, helpful, treat you very highly and welcoming. This has been my best stay yet at amy resort and we will be returning again for our next Hawaii trip in 2021!

Spacious rooms, comfortable beds. Night manager Nandi along with his assistant really went above and beyond to accommodate our needs on the night we checked in. The very next day, the day time manager matched that of the night manager with her high level of hospitality and professionalism. Very, very friendly staff all around. On site restaurants were on point, excellent food and service.

I had high hopes. All my years on island, this resort has always had a certain prestige, an air, if you will. Last night, celebrating our anniversary, we took the plunge and splurged. Over a thousand dollars a night for an oceanfront room. The view was spectacular. Not unlike any other waterfront resort on island but gorgeous nonetheless. So the hotel is older so keep that in mind when looking at the finishes. The furniture, dated, as well as the tiled bathroom. Not a deal breaker. The grounds are quite lovely. Swim with the dolphins, watch the honu and tropical fish swim, relax by the pool or sit at the beach. All things we had hoped to experience. Unfortunately for us, we chose to eat on site. We ate at Plumerias. Noise level was acceptable. Our table was nice. View of the ocean. Not a bad start to the evening, so I thought. I was excited to see bone marrow offered at the carving station. I indulged in bone marrow, sashimi, lobster bisque, various cheeses and other items. Then the unthinkable happened. We headed back to our room because shortly after dinner, my husband and I fell ill. I spent the whole rest of our stay praying to the porcelain god. I will spare you the excruciating details. Long story short, I was dying to go home. I was miserable. We weren't able to enjoy the facilities, the whole reason for booking a room. No playing in the pool, no walk along the beach, no drinks at the bar, just balled up in bed hoping for the nightmare to end. Morning finally came and I, food motivated, couldn't even bring myself to eat. Exhausted and miserable, I just wanted to go home. Waiting for our car at valet, distracted by the sounds of tires squealing, our car finally arrives. The valet didn't even unlock my door. I threw my bag in the trunk and let myself in. Sad. I wanted so badly to love this experience. I'm truly disappointed on so many levels.

My family and I have been going every year to Kahala since 2009. Back then it was a 5-Star resort, but over the years the quality of the facility has gone downhill. The resort desperately needs renovations - inside and outside. I understand that Kahala wants to keep the essence of the Hawaiian cultural in it’s decor, but they can keep that while renovating as other hotels/resorts has done. They also need to re-sand the beach and make the pool bigger. One thing going for them is the service. Second to none. I would say, it’s on par with Four Seasons and that’s saying a lot. Anyway, once they get the renovations done, the price to stay there will be justified.

This has been a magnificent stay at this beautiful icon of honololu. The room was faultless and the friendliness of the staff especially the front desk was exceptional!!!My wife has stayed here twice in the last month and the last time she was here my eldest daughter had a medical problem and the staff was so fantastic it was solved and looked after without any fuss and professionally and expeditiously. This day they welcomed us and we felt like we were the king and queen of the country!!! The rooms are beautifully cleaned all the amenities are fantastic the beach is wonderful the breakfast buffet is delicious and no issue is a problem for them!! We have no qualms about recommending this place overnight over again. Enjoy your stay there

I live in the shadow of the Kahala Resort. Our family has been coming here for meals to celebrate special occasions for decades (my favorite was the Maile Room), but I’ve never stayed here. Fast forward to 2019. I won a stay at the Kahala as a silent auction prize. I had an amazing time! The staff at the Kahala know how to treat a guest, demonstrating excellent customer service. The Kahala has been the choice of Presidents, celebrities & royalty. They make each of their guests feel special. I hope to return very soon!

Our time at the Kahala wasWonderful. The staff: front desk, concierge, valet, housekeeping, pool staff were all a dream and made us feel so welcome. We got to make leis with the cultural director and learned all about the Hawaiian culture. We also got the chance to do a photoshoot with the Pacific Dream Photography team. The pictures turned out so beautiful and we had so much fun taking them. Macy did a great job at directing us and getting the right lighting. Jacob was so kind and helped us select the perfect pictures to take home! Overall, Kahala resort, we will be back, sooner rather than later we hope.Until next time,Mahalo

Once again the Kahala Hotel and Resort out did themselvesNever a disappointment If your staying on Oahu dont stay anywhere else but The KahalaThe service is impeccable, the views are breathtaking. A WOW at every turn

Excellent service, great room location and amenities. We ate at all the restaurants and they were all great. Valet and Bell staff great. Concierge services excellent. We were there for 11 nights and could have stayed longer if we had the time. Just a fabulous vacation.

We used Chase points for a three night stay here. Wow. What a place. The service was amazing. The hotel is Japanese owned and caters to a lot of Japanese tourists. So you will find touches not common in most American resorts. A hospitality suite where you can hang out, take a shower, change, have a free beverage and snack etc if you have arrived before your room is ready. Every room has a Toto bidet toilet seat. Japanese food options at the breakfast buffet. (amazing breakfast buffet). The grounds are compact and nicely kept up. A pool and Jacuzzi which we did not use. The warm pacific ocean is 50 feet away. Cocktail bar outside, kayak and paddle board rentals. Golf course, spa etc. My only complaint is that they have a "swim withe dolphins" program which of course means they have captive dolphins. This is not cool. Not sure why they feel this is a necessity. While we did see guests participating in this activity, I would guess the vast majority are not and there is plenty of great reasons to come here without this feature.

Keeping dolphins as pets in a hotel - nothing I can write will change your opinion. You either think it is the coolest thing ever or you are thinking that you stepped into a generational time warp and want the hotel to rethink the whole thing. The super tame beach that was built as part of the resort along with the obsession about its show biz ties all add up to a Vegas style fantasy land as opposed to a remote vacation spot.The physical grounds are lovely, as are the rooms. Staff was super helpful and nice. We were there for a conference - my wife was working and I was the plus 1. Not a great fit as anything the conference didn't pay for was out of range of most business traveler budgets. The remote location also makes it hard to use as a base if you want to tour O'ahu. Conclusion: If you want to spend a few days with family sitting on the beach, playing golf or by the pool go for it. If you are coming to Hawaii to experience Hawaii stay in Waikiki or better yet get out of Honolulu.

If you're looking for a quiet relaxing yet elegant resort in Oahu I would never suggest anything but the Kahala. Hotel staff always go above & beyond asking & truly make the entire experience amazing.

2nd time I've stayed. They offered us a big discount on a suite overlooking the ocean when we couldn't get two interconnecting rooms (which we had booked separately at different times, so not their fault)We love it here. The setting is beautiful, the canoeing around fish and turtles, swimming with fish around the coral.Love the lounge. The pasta is really delicious. David Swanson is a superb musician Tue-Sat I think. Really relaxing, all kept in immaculate cleanliness and maintenance despite the age of the resort.The bad - it's expensive to hire canoes and so on but you probably guessed that. Service in the casual restaurant at dinner was really lacking the one time I tried it. There were about three tables there at 8pm and we couldn't get anyone's attention, food was slow. Don't know if it was just a one-off difficult night but I'd go back. And the dolphins, OMG please discontinue the dolphin stuff, it's terrible. I don't know what you would do with those poor animals now but please don't raise/capture (??) any more of them. Please.

The Kahala Hotel & Resort is absolutely perfect. It is located in Kahala Town, just East of busy Honolulu. The resort is upscale. and well designed. The rooms are very spacious, and the staff are phenomenal. The property is the perfect size, super clean, green, and best of all... quiet!I had teetered back and forth trying to determine if we should stay in Waikiki, or in Kahala so we could slow down a little. Well... after a trip in to Waikiki... I put that dilemma to rest! After about an hour, I was completely done with that excursion... talk about crazy! We felt like We were in Vegas... full of traffic, commercialized, and way too many people. Waikiki Beach was super noisy, and looked like it had more people on it than sand!The Kahala has its own private beach, and the only things you hear out there are the wind and the gentle waves. The Kahala has a lagoon with four of the most beautiful dolphins, several restaurants to compliment most tastes, and its bordered by a beautiful golf course on the mountain side. You’ll need a rental car, or arranged personal transportation to reach the hotel. If you choose to go back and forth in to Honolulu... it’s cheaper than taking a taxi. The resort does have transportation available to certain locations about town as well. Just remember... Oahu is gorgeous, so you’re missing out if you don’t get a rental car. We are so pleased with our choice to stay at The Kahala, and my wife and I highly recommend the resort to everyone who is planning a trip to Oahu! Mahalo Kahala Resort... it was wonderful!

Let me start by saying I am a very picky/discriminating hotel guest. I am bothered by things that most people would ignore, so I am very difficult to please. So when I come across a hotel where I can't find anything to complain about it is a reason to celebrate. I read a few negative reviews on TripAdvisor which alarmed me so I contacted the hotel via email. My email was responded to promptly, my concerns were addressed, and I was assured I had nothing to worry about. When I arrived at my room (Beachfront Lanai) it was spectacular. It was spotlessly clean, beautifully appointed and very comfortable. Some reviewers complained that the furnishings were “tired” or needed updating, but I did not find that to be the case whatsoever. The furnishings were beautiful and appropriate to a Hawaiian hotel. In addition, the staff, from the general manager on down, were beyond nice and accommodating. The Plumeria restaurant is situated on the most beautiful ocean front site one could imagine. The breakfast buffet is delicious. The round waffles that are made fresh at the site of the omelette station during the week are the most delicious waffles I have ever tasted. They are different than the a la carte waffles, or the ones made on the weekends (which are also good, but not the same). The beach area is lovely and never feels crowded as it does in Waikiki, especially in the area away from the pool. I give the Kahala my highest recommendation.

My favorite hotel on Oahu, updated but still feelign like classic Hawaii. Just far enough away from Wakiki and downtown Honolulu, but close enough to allow exploration, dining, meetings, activity outside the property if desired.

3 first weeks in Hawaii everand one of Them spent at the Kahala. Thankyou allmost all there for an extravagant Beachholiday - we really did Enjoy the location. If to emphasise any of the staff it would be the nice men at the poolbar, the serviceminded friendly staff at the very frontdesk/outside/carservice and last but not least the sweetest maid ever, Jamaica - I only met her in the door now and then, but as sweet and serviceminded as she was - you/we could all learn from - hope you treasure it. MAHALO Voigt family

What a beautiful hotel! I had the best time staying at the Kahala from June 21-30th. Even though Honolulu was very crowded because of summer, the hotel was a quiet, peaceful oasis. Service was amazing and the rooms/balcony views were stunning. I ate a catch of the day sandwich from the pool restaurant almost every day! They also have delicious smoothies :) Loved to read my book facing the ocean and relaxing by the pool. Highly recommend this hotel - my family with young children (under 6) also loved their stay! The ocean was flat and safe and the whole family had a fantastic time. Love, Natalie / @dressmelikethat

We asked our travel agent to find us something a little bit quieter than right in Waikiki and he booked us here. Great decision. In Waikiki we found the number of people on the beach, by the pool, waiting to be seated at restaurants, waiting for trolleys buses etc to be overwhelming especially for the kids. At Kahala we haven’t had to wait for anything, there are plenty of deck chairs, the four of us had one each and the beach is not jammed with people. It’s great! The resort itself has great restaurants and service. A free hotel shuttle is there to get into Waikiki and to Ala Moana Mall if needed. There are dolphins and turtles on site, which I’m not sure I agree with but the girls at Dolphin Quest assures me they are fine....hmmmm. But if that’s your thing you can swim with them here for a price.

We had a very nice lunch at the cabana restaurant & bar. The service was excellent, the ocean front setting was very beautiful, and the food tasty and at a reasonable price.We started with a drink at the poolside bar during a short wait for a table in the shade. Lunch arrived shortly and we both enjoyed our meals. While not a big french fry consumer, they were the best I've had in a long time.

The Kahala is the Kahala. Old school traditional Hawaiian Hospitality out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Large newly renovated superb rooms, most with ocean or Mountain views. Excellent Breakfast and beach area, inc the famous Dolphin pool.The only negative is the pool, its very small and a little warm, making the pacific ocean more inviting a better swim.

This resort was a treat. The food was great. It was a good idea to have breakfast at the resort. Although the hotel was off the beaten track, a fact that added to its tranquility, a shuttle takes you anywhere of interest The rooms were spacious and very well appointed, but it was the staff helped make it a wonderful place. It was truly a vacation in paradise..

The hotel staff was accomodating and friendly. The location was ideal for my family with kids age 7 & 9. We enjoyed the beach and pool area. The outside staff will help you with chairs and towels. The food and beverages are pricey.

Loved this place. It’s deceptively small, but it’s super relaxing and set in a beautiful location. There’s several restaurants that are all top notch the grounds are beautiful. I’d spent the first part of this trip on Waikiki and it’s a little too busy. This was the perfect antidote. I loved it. Perhaps one of my favorite parts was going for runs in The kahala neighborhood the hotel is set in. Wonderfully beautiful are that’s just so much prettier and relaxing than Waikiki. Also, the rooms are really large. Just a regular hotel room, but wonderful size. I will be back.

We had the best time with our photographer Michelle taking some family pictures at the Kahala Resort in Honolulu!! My husband and I were married at the Kahala and I wanted to have some beautiful pictures to commemorate our return trip 16 years later. Pacific Dreams Photography did not up disappoint... they did an amazing job and we were able to view our pictures the very next day. Now that is fast service!! They are friendly and easy to work with and the Kahala Resort is gorgeous. There are plenty of great spots for photos. I would definitely recommend using Pacific Dreams Photography to help capture some amazing memories while you are in Honolulu!

Preston checked us in on our first day and he was amazing. He was courteous and friendly, and he wished us a happy anniversary and answered all of our questions. Every time we had a question, it seemed like he was there at the front desk to answer. The hotel itself was also spectacular. There is a lot of history built in, and the art around the hotel really showed off a lot of the history. It was fascinating. We loved the wall of celebrity pictures and signatures of when they had stayed at the hotel.We really enjoyed our stay here and will come back the next time we are in Oahu.

I really liked the Kahala. It’s not too big and everything is so easy to access. The pool is next to the beach which is close to the restaurant. It’s a lovely place. Nice quiet beach and nothing like the craziness of Waikiki beach. The breakfast buffet was great. The bathrooms are showing their age and so are the rooms (stained carpet, curtains, bath tiles) but the bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping was great. You can swim with the dolphins. The only thing to keep in mind is that the hôtel isn’t near anything so allot 20 minutes every time you want to go to Waikiki. One beef I have - they charge you $40 to rent a beach umbrella - seriously?

First time at the Kahala Resort for some and fifth time for others in our family. Ages ranging from 67 to 5 - and something for everyone. 5 y old LOVED the Kids Club. Amazing breakfast buffet, beautiful views, perfect location on the water, rooms were gorgeous, Ocean view room definitely worth it. Spa quite good, decent fitness room.One of the week’s highlights was the special experience having all of our clan meet at sunset with Macy of @Pacific Dream Photography for photos. She kept the very tired 5 yr old smiling and made all of us look beautiful. Totally worth doing!

So I did my due diligence before booking my 5 nights at this wonderful resort. I researched thoroughly for a wonderful place in Oahu when traveling with a 6 year old. I also didn’t want to be too far from the shops, restaurants, and action of Waikiki beach. I booked the night at the Kamala and boy was I impressed. We arrived hours in advance of check-in time but this first class place put a Lei on my kid and allowed us to check right in to the room. We couldn’t run fast enough to the pool area and the amazing views of the beach and the sand. Because my kid was traveling alone with me, I wanted him engaged with kids as much as possible. We signed up for the full day Keiki Club on three different occasions. Their execution is flawless, as my kid had a wonderful day under strict supervision while he enjoyed the resort with other kids from around the world. The restaurants are first class. This is evident by employees that have been there for over 40 years. That period of retention is almost unheard in the hospitality industry and it just goes to show you that they love their job. They offer a free shuttle service to the downtown area and the shops and restaurants. Thankfully, we decided NOT to stay down there as the quaint neighborhood surrounding the Kahala and overall service makes me wonder how quickly I can find time in my schedule to return.

My wife and I have stayed at the Kahala several times in the past few years, usually traveling with my in-laws. This most recent time we all took my baby daughter to the Kahala to celebrate her first birthday. It’s a wonderful place to stay for families, with plenty of kid-friendly accommodations and places to roam around. As would be expected for a resort on Oahu, the beach is beautiful, and not too crowded since it’s a bit removed from Honolulu. The rooms are comfortable, although the mattresses are a bit too soft for our tastes. The rooms included breakfast at the restaurant buffet, which was well-done as restaurant buffets go, with a wide array of options. Definitely try the thin crepes. You’re on vacation, and they’re worth it.The concierge was very helpful in arranging daytime activities, recommending among other things a drive up the east coast of the island that was breathtaking. Also, since it was our baby’s first birthday, we took advantage of the photography services offered by Pacific Dream Photography. They did a wonderful job. Our photographer, Macy, was especially good with our baby, bringing out her absolute best. Keep in mind that the photo packages are pricey, and unfortunately the price lists they provide are somewhat deceptive in terms of showing the full price. Fortunately the representative was understanding, and we were able to work out a package that was suitable for us. All told, we’ve been very pleased with the Kahala, and look forward to many return visits in the future.

I will not go back to Oahu if we cannot stay at the Kahala. It is sheer perfection. The staff are incredible, the food is terrific and the ambiance in every setting is sublime. it is a place you can relax and call home, albeit a very luxurious and indulgent home. The grounds are well planned and gorgeous. The beach is beautiful, the water is easy to get into and out of, there is no rush for beach chairs. We came here 3 years ago and were looking forward to when we could next come. We will not wait so long next time. We are coming back next year. The circle drive up to the front door is so welcoming with shallow long steps up into the side of the hotel. The lobby, reception area and front room next to the Veranda are gorgeous and just invite you to sit down and have a drink and enjoy the tropical breeze blowing through the hotel. I agree with the title another reviewer gave it, so I will close with it: BEST OF THE BEST.

5 Full stars no question. The grounds, room and staff all stand out as a cut above all others. Best beach, Resturant, food, the Brunch is to die for. Highly recomend this a a great couples or family get away...Ron & Ana

Stopped here just over a week ago with my husband as part of our three week honeymoon trip, this hotel was by far our favourite. From start to finish the staff were phenomenal and would go above and beyond to meet our expectations. We booked a dolphin lanai room which was breathtaking, we spent many hours watching the dolphins pass by our feet. The hotel sits in a quiet location with its very own beach. The pool staff deserve a lot of credit for how hard they work to make everyone feel comfortable around the pool and beach. You can’t explain the pure paradise and credit this place truly deserves, book up and see it for yourself.

Absolutely amazing experience! My wife and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and couldn’t have had a better time over the 10 days we were there. FIVE BIG STARS ALL AROUND!! The property itself is stunning with a beautiful secluded beach, gorgeous gardens everywhere, a great pool area, and a completely unique and amazing dolphin and green turtle sanctuary where a group of highly trained marine biologists offer educational and specialized emersion programs for hotel guests and visitors. A real highlight of the property! There are a number of outstanding restaurants on the property including Arancino’s for incredible Italian fare and Huko’s for more traditional Hawaiian cuisine. We highly recommend both! As much as we could go on about the physical features of the property, by far the most noticeable feature was the incredible service and hospitality we received from virtually every member of the resort team. From check in where Steve Tabiolo, Director of Front Office Operations, personally handled our accommodations, placing us in a beautiful ocean front suite with a great lanai, to Carlos Penaherrera, Guest Services Supervisor, who very politely helped us with a number of requests, to Anji at the pool bar and Dean at the concierge desk, both who gave us great recommendations of places to go and restaurants to try, the exceptional attention to detail and personal attention we received from every resort staff member we encountered made this trip one of the very best experiences we have enjoyed. We can’t wait to go back!!

In a world of uneven customer service in the travel industry today, Kahala is a shining exception. They set a high bar and then surpass it! We enjoyed 3 nights here last week, and the service & attention we received was outstanding. from the front desk, to the wait staff, to the dolphin team and the bell staff, everyone was genuine, friendly and attentive. One of the front desk staff saw me in the lobby with yesterday's lei on (we were leaving for a Pearl Harbor tour), and said, "Oh, we can't have you leaving with that on, here's a fresh one," as she presented me with a fresh lei. What great "ALOHA Spirit"! The quality of our ocean-front suite -- from the little touches to the housekeeping each day -- was impeccable. And you cannot beat the view! This wonderful resort is like a throw-back to better times in the hospitality industry, when guests were treated like royalty. We certainly were.Not only is the physical property a real beauty and spotless, but the team here really cares about service and guest comfort. What an oasis of luxury!

Excellent hotel. The services provided were all top notch. Jamie from the spa was especially friendly and helpful. The dolphin-swimming services were great also. Rooms were very spacious and the views were great. Make sure you come with some extra spending money though. You're going to pay for the excellent services.

Our stay was awesome. It’s close to Honolulu so you can visit Pearl Harbor, but far enough away that you don’t feel the crowd. The beach and grounds were beautiful (pool is a little small), and our room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was amazing every day. Lunch and dinner there was average. Dolphin swim on site is a nice option that kids really enjoyed. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall this place is highly recommended for an upscale, quiet and relaxing stay in Oahu.

The staff at the Kahala Resort and Hotel saved the day! We arrived to a dirty and dreadful airbnb in Waikiki. What a shock! As my son put it, "you go on vacation to escape your reality... but not like this". We would have rather stayed at home. Bad planning on my part I suppose. The pictures made it look so much nicer than it actually was. After no response from the manager, friends from Seattle recommended we call the Kahala Hotel & Resort. Lucky for us there was a room available for 3 nights. When we arrived at the Kahala we were greeted with the Aloha we'd traveled so far for. Such a relief I nearly cried when they place the flower leis over our heads. We could hardly believe the difference it made. From the moment we stepped into the lobby we knew we were in for a real treat. Gina at the front desk was so welcoming. The kids and I knew right away that our vacation had offically begun. All Mom's stress from the disappointment of the day drifted away in that moment. Sure, the resort was twice the price but it was well worth the spurge. Sometimes you get what you pay for. The room was clean and comfortable. The friendly and helpful staff provided a roll away made up nicely in the corner of our ample king size room with lovely views overlooking the palm trees. We immediately felt at peace. My daughter said it felt like serenity. Smiles all around. There was a mini fridge for drinks and snacks. The bathroom had two large vanities with separate sinks - one for me, one for the kids to share. There were to small closets and a large dressing area with shelves for all our things. The separate toilet closet had a heated seat that did everything for you just like a Japanese spa. We settled in and stepped outside onto a calm beautiful beach with lounge chairs and tables by the pool. This was a real vacation. The shuttle to and from Waikiki was an added bonus. We were able to enjoy the hustle and bustle of the city and then come back to paradise. Thanks to the Kahala for making this a family vacation to remember and for making the first few hours utterly forgettable. Mahalo!

My wife and I just returned from a week at the Kahala Hotel. From the moment we were greeted by the bellhop and registration desk personnel, we knew we were in store for something special. We were given keys to our ocean front suite and were amazed at the spacious and user friendly accommodation. We overlooked the dolphin pool and the Pacific and couldn't have asked for a more romantic and relaxed setting..Dean and Cameron, the Concierges, were most helpful and everyone made us feel very welcome. The exotic Hoku restaurant served delicious food as did the Plumeria and Sea Food facility...A small example of the pampered and caring way we were treated occurred when, due to my own error, we missed the shuttle to the local mall. One telephone call to the hotel and it sent a prepaid taxi for us.. We had occasion to meet Sally Haim, the Director of Sales, and like everyone else, she made us feel very special and seemed genuinely interested in our being totally satisfied with every part of our stay. The hotel offered us a dream vacation in a tropical paradise and we shall treasure the memory of the fantastic 7 days we spent there.

It’s not a new and modern hotel but a great historic place to stay. The room was clean and a beautiful view of the dolphins which my son loved. Everyone was very nice for our entire day. The valet was quick and courteous. The beach area is not too packed and the pool was a perfect temperature.

My favorite hotel that I’ve ever stayed at. The service was the most phenomenal I’ve experienced. Especially the bellmen, front desk, room service, restaurant staff, and concierge. They were so friendly, professional, pleasant, and accommodating. Cameron and Nazome (concierges) helped us plan more activities even though we already had some tours booked and made all the necessary calls while we were out enjoying our day. They made great recommendations of things we enjoyed doing and saved our trip when our prescheduled all day tour did not pick us up. They helped us rearrange and reschedule all the other activities we had planned so we could do our all day trip another day. The beach and pool area were beautiful and it was cool just to sit and watch the fish, dolphins, and turtles in the beautiful garden even though we didn’t participate in dolphin quest. The Kahala was so peaceful and quiet and service was much better and more personalized than at the hotels we visited in Waikiki. SO glad we didn’t stay at one of those- it was nuts and crowded, loud, and hard to move around when we were at the Hilton Hawaiian village for a boat tour. Most of our tours picked us up at the Kahala and the Kahala has a free shuttle into Waikiki so staying outside of it didn’t inhibit us really and we were glad we did. Occasionally we wanted to do something special or at a time when the shuttle wasn’t running a chose to take a can for about 30 dollars. Uber would be cheaper and you could probably manage doing activities without splurging for a cab. We have limited mobility so also chose to do that when we may have been able to walk to or from Kahala shuttle stops. Many of the activities the concierge recommends provide free or very discounted transportation as well/they know what companies provide transport from the Kahala. Totally worth it and glad we stayed here and not Waikiki. Close enough to access everything but far enough away to not be in the middle of craziness and feel more like you’re in Hawaii. This is is also totally luxurious hotel and we felt like royalty

It was my first time at the Kahala even though I m a kamaaina, a former resident. I stayed there with my son, a working adult who treated me as a Mother’s Day present. It was expensive, but worth it. Everyone working there was very friendly and helpful, and eager to please. I enjoyed their service. It’s a rather small hotel, so does not have the crowd in big hotels in Waikiki. It’s in a residential area, so it’s quiet, no horrendous traffic like Waikiki where everyone goes. It’s secluded. The beach is public, but it’s the only hotel in the area. All the restaurants have a view. I heard Costco have a package that includes the Kahala with air, rental car, and daily buffet breakfast. I will definitely try that next time. This is the only place I really want to stay on Oahu!

I had the most incredible Hawaiian vacation last week while staying at the The Kahala Hotel & Resort. It's not just a hotel resort but more like a home away from home. They not only had my Kona coffee ready the way I like it every morning at the Plumeria but they were so accommodating in preparing my food specifically the way I asked them to from day 1. I want to thank the hotel staff for taking such great care of me and I can’t wait to come back hopefully sooner than later! Mahalo

We stayed for 5 nights at the Kahala. We were in the dolphin lanai room. We loved the location. My son watched the dolphins every day. Even though we weren’t oceanfront we were still very close to the beach. Speaking of the beach, we really enjoyed Kahala’s. The waves were small enough for my son to play in. Our favorite part of the hotel was the pool. It was warm and not very crowded at all. The location was good. We weren’t far from downtown Honolulu. Service was okay. From the other reviews we were expecting incredible staff. No one disappointed us, but no one seemed to go out of their way either. This was just a minor issue. We would stay here again just to have access to the pool and beach. And to see the dolphins! PS- their ponds on the grounds have sea turtles in them! See if you can catch a glimpse of one :)

I’ll start by saying the staff here are absolutely fantastic - from the valet to the front desk to the breakfast staff. They couldn’t have made us feel more welcomed/ appreciated. The rooms here are dated - do not let the pictures on the website fool you. From the tile on the balconies to the carpets to the chipping on all the furniture - you can tell this place needs a renovation. The hotel has the most bizarre design you could imagine, with the parking garage being between the rooms and the beach. This results in “ocean view” rooms with having yes, an ocean view, but they also have fantastic views of the parking garage between them and the ocean. Maybe the rooms in higher categories don’t have this ridiculous view obstruction???The garage really takes away from your view. Another point - I never brought this up with the valet or hotel because I just knew they wouldn’t stand behind it, but I noticed scratches on my rental car that I don’t recall being there before I dropped it off. I’d also like to point out that there are several dolphins staying in a tiny (tiny for the size of these dolphins) pool within this hotel. I’m sure the hotel justifies it by saying this is actually good for the dolphins but just use your common sense - they’re charging $300 per person for you to get in that water and play with the dolphins - so whatever the hotel claims about the well-being of the dolphins, just know that they’re only here as a money maker for the hotel. The hotel has a wall of VERY famous people that have stayed here and I know that those people would NEVER have stayed in the room that I was put in, so I imagine their suites are nothing like the basic rooms they have. Overall, this was below my expectations for a 5 star hotel.

We had an amazing stay at the Kahala. Our room was large and quiet, facing the golf course. Staff were very attentive. Kyle at valet services helped us checked in and waved us good bye on the last day. Enjoyed the beach right in front of the hotel for swim. Seeing dolphins daily was a special treat. Hope to return soon!

I have just stayed at The Kahala again for the third year in a row. I travel a lot for business, so I stay in a lot of hotels. The Kahala is just very special. The Aloha Spirit the staff conveyed to me from the moment I arrived at the airport in Honolulu when I was picked up until my departure set the tone. James Kepa, The Front Office Manager, did an exceptional job providing my airport transportation, and getting me checked in quickly when we arrived at the hotel, and personally escorted me to my room. He was efficient, friendly, and offered to help me in any way to make my stay pleasant. He was very flexible to work around my meeting schedule in arranging my transportation details. As always, Kathy Morse, The Executive Assistant to Gerald Glennon, the General Manager, took care of all of the details of my reservations perfectly. My Hertz rental car was conveniently ready for me just outside the lobby in the circular drive, thanks to Dallas, their agent, and the parking attendants loaded whatever I needed for my meetings in the trunk before I picked up the car. The concierge staff was always offering to help, whether it was to provide directions, copy documents for me, or print my boarding pass. Also, the staff always addressed me by name, which I found incredible and exceptional. The hotel management and staff take a lot of pride in the hotel, and make sure that their guests experience its warmth and elegance. Mr. Glennon is an exceptional role model for the staff, resulting in the utmost respect for the guests, and every attempt is made to ensure that they have the best possible stay at The Kahala. He is well-regarded by everyone, and that positive attitude permeates everyone who works there. For families with children, the opportunity to spend time with the dolphins is very exciting. The pool and beach activities are convenient for the guests, and the staff seems to be on top of everyone's needs. The restaurant food is well-prepared and offers a large variety for guests to make their choices. The calm ambience in the main reception area where guests can comfortably sit and visit in this very elegant but friendly environment is very special. The hotel is just a few minute drive from the bustling Waikiki area, but it feels like you are on an outer island where it is quiet and removed from all congestion.After staying there these past few years, I have experienced a consistency that few hotels have on a continuous basis. Mr. Glennon's commitment to the hotel, staff and its guests makes it a pleasure to stay there. I definitely plan to return!Vivian H.

This is a very nice hotel, and we enjoyed our stay, but we will probably not return. The main reason we would not return is the quality of the beach - the swimming area is hemmed in by a big rock/reef area, and is quite shallow, although this seems to vary a bit by day. Also, the architecture of the hotel is very uninteresting - the lobby seems dated and the building itself is not very nice to look at. For the money we paid at the Kahala, we have stayed in much more impressive resorts in other areas.However, there are lots of pros as well. I think some families might prefer this hotel because of the dolphin program - I know my kids in their younger years would have liked this. Also, the resort is in a quiet area but is still very accessible to downtown, and there is a free shuttle to take you back and forth. This is nice, because sometimes you end up feeling trapped at your resort. You can stay here and have access to Honolulu when you want to get out. The restaurants are very expensive. We liked Hoku's, but were not happy with our meal at Arancino's. Overall, a good experience, but not the best we have had in our travels.

Time to introduce the 4th generation of our family to the Kahala! As always, an excellent time was had by all.We had our pictures taken by Macy (of Pacific Dream Photography, based at the Kahala). And she did an excellent job, and we had wonderful memories to take home.

Very peaceful and satisfying with great staff to make sure your trip is everything you dream of. You have a choose of a room with beautiful ocean view or a view of the dolphins which both are captivating.

Love, love, love this hotel. Dolphin show is so fun. Love the flowers going downstairs to the restaurant. Service is spectacular. Food is delicious!!! Fun watching the turtles and fish in the fish pond. Beautiful beach!!!

We recently stayed at this wonderful resort and we were very happy with everything. Our room was on the beach and was beautiful. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially the lovely lady at the front of the hotel who organizes the shuttle and taxis, she even gave us a water for our trip. We were given fresh beautiful leis on arrival with cool hand towels, a special touch that we appreciated. The hotel has their own dolphins and we loved watching them each time we went to our room. The money the hotel gets from guests for swimming with the dolphins goes into research which is awesome. Overall an amazing hotel we would return to.

This was my second stay at The Kahala and I was so happy to be back. The hotel is gorgeous and the service is top notch. It is far from the craziness of Waikiki which we loved but close enough to everything. The dolphin lagoon is by far my favorite aspect of the hotel as you can watch them all day long. The beach is clean and private, with the most comfortable beach chairs to take an afternoon nap while listening to the sounds of the ocean. The lobby is open and elegant to sit and have dinner or drinks. This is my favorite place on the island and we will be back again soon! Highly highly recommend.

During a recent trip to Australia, we decided to break our trip up by stopping in Honolulu. En route to Australia, we stayed in Waikiki; while the beach is iconic, the crowds were everywhere. On the way back from Australia, we stayed at the Kahala Resort and all I can say is "what a difference". We were fortunate to have an early check in and to receive an upgraded room. Our room was large, extremely well appointed, and it had a lovely lanai with comfortable chairs overlooking the golf course and mountains.The beach area was fabulous - quiet, plenty of space and complimentary lounge chairs. We had our choice of sand or grass and were able to find a lovely, quiet spot in the shade. All of the staff that we interacted with were friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning to this slice of paradise.

This was our 3rd stay on the island and our 1st stay at Kahala. The Kahala is amazing!!! The staff is so friendly and helpful, always smiles! They definitely make you feel like ohana and to us that’s important! The view around the whole resort is amazing whether it’s of the pool and Kahala Beach or the private golf course behind the resort. If you are looking for a quiet and peaceful place to stay this is the place for you! Although you are a little ways from the busy Waikiki, the shuttle service is always available free of charge to escort you into the Waikiki area for dinner.
