The hotel also has many dining options available if you do not feel like venturing out. The Kahala Hotel and Resort is now our absolute favorite place and will be the place we continue to come back to each year!

6 months ago, I had the opportunity to plan and coordinate a Canadian family friend's 3 day wedding in Honolulu. Although I have done events before, this was my first time planning an Indian Wedding Extravaganza. After visiting 9+ locations, the bride and groom settled on the Waialae Ballroom + Waterfall Garden to have their wedding reception and boy am I so glad they chose the Kahala Resort. Everything was exceptional From all my meeting with Anna Hinkley, the catering manager to the wait staff to the Banquet Manager, each and every detail and element was made to make the guests feel comfortable and warmly welcomed. The Kahala has a certain priceless reputation, but despite that no one displayed any airs or arrogance. Any request was never responded with a "no". There was always an effort made to accommodate and respect the request. The guests and the wedding party had 2 days of non-stop events, but Kahala ended on a high note. From the food to the ambiance, everything was exceptional. As a coordinator, I would HIGHLY recommend this venue for your special day and go talk to Anna Hinkley. You will not be disappointed with the hotel and her service. Already looking forward to the next one.

The minute you step into the Grand Dame of Honolul you are warmly greeted. if you are lucky enough your checking is with Carolyn Chung, the soul of the hotel for over 16 years.Warm welcoming and really the key to feeling home and cared for.The rooms are classic nice, great ocean view and you hear the crushing waves- but carpets smelly. No carpets if for me the solution. With proper isolation the argument of noise is not valid. Hygiene is more important. The location is a quiet oasis 2o min form shopping overload called Waikiki or Beverly Hills by the sea.....ALOHAp.s.breakfast: I would urgently replace the fake maple syrup with real one. This is below your standard and miles below mine.....

I booked a birthday party through Anna, the catering manager. The venue, service, and food were excellent. I also spent the night there, and their rooms are very spacious and well appointed compared to other hotels. Their Sunday buffet was delicious. The beach is beautiful and not as packed as Waikiki. Highly recommended!

I had an opportunity to spend time at the amazing Kahala Hotel & Resort and it did not disappoint. From their breathtaking lagoons to charming and elegant details throughout the property, this Resort epitomizes classic refinement meets modern day luxury.But what makes this property so special is the staff and their willingness to provide exceptional, warm Aloha hospitality. As a person who travels frequently throughout the year, this is the very reason people love coming back to this Resort time after time. Thank you for welcoming me into your home and I can't wait to return for another business trip.

My brother & his wife are celebrating their 60th birthdays & Myself 50th birthday. What a lovely hotel to celebrate my 50th birthday. The room overlooking the dolphin lagoon was spacious & had everything you need. Wake up on your birthday & have a coffee on the balcony watching the dolphins then go swimming with them, is wonderful. The Kahala has a shuttle, which can take you into Honolulu or Waikiki for free (limited to 14 seats), best to book if busy. All the staff, from the cleaners to management can’t do too much for you. All in all, a perfect holiday, just a shame it had to end

The Kahala Hotel went above and beyond every expectation in ways that I didn’t even think were possible. It is one thing for a hotel to accommodate requests. What the staff does at the Kahala takes it to the next level. They proactively anticipate guests’ needs and preferences. The attention to detail is stunning. The location of the hotel strikes the perfect balance between being close to attractions but being removed from the noise and chaos of Waikiki Beach. You are only a short shuttle trip to central Honolulu but the hotel feels like it could be on a secluded island. The grounds and facilities are kept up immaculately and seem out of a storybook. The pictures don’t do it justice. The beach is quiet and secluded with soft sand that is groomed daily and very gentle waves. The waves break about 200 yards off shore so you are still serenaded with ocean sounds but the water around the beach is very gentle. The lobby and public areas capture vintage Hawaiian style with modern, clean elegance. The lagoon in the center of the complex is full of wildlife and there is always a turtle or dolphin nearby. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. I can’t say enough about the bathrooms. They are by far the nicest standard bathrooms I have ever enjoyed. They would be nice for a penthouse suite. The bathroom had two separate vanity and sink areas across from each other with separate shower and tub areas. Each side of the bathroom also has spacious closet and changing areas. The hotel offers a variety of food options and each one we tried was delicious. We ate at the Veranda, the Beachside Grill, and the Plumeria. We could tell that the food was expertly prepared with fresh, high quality ingredients. What really makes the Kahala stand out are the people. Every employee we saw went out of their way to make our vacation special. The shuttle driver Gary turned every shuttle trip into a tour, pointing out interesting sites and explaining local culture along the way. Ms. Koki, the chief concierge, and Mr. Ibarra, the hotel manager were personally engaged in our service and making sure every detail exceeded expectations. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough.

This hotel is lovely. The staff is so kind and friendly as well as accommodating-and always with a smile! The service is excellent. I like the feel of intimacy of the hotel-it’s quiet and not located on a strip amongst other hotels. The feel here is very relaxing. The beach is perfect-it’s like a bay with no waves for easy and safe swimming and wading. There are plenty of lounge chairs so not like some hotels where one has to rush out early to reserve! I highly recommend this property.

Only hotel we will stay at in Honolulu. Service is exceptional and response time to our requests was super. All personnel knew our names and were professional in every way. We will not stay at any other hotel in Oahu.

This hotel is fantastic, very welcoming and somehow quiet even when busy. Staff are helpful and friendly. It’s a bit out of the way of Waikiki but that’s not a problem as it means the hotel part of the beach is quiet and the hotel provides a regular shuttle to get you around. I worried slightly about the captive dolphins when we got here but it doesn’t take long to see that they are really happy and well looked after by dedicated staff who the dolphins clearly dote on. It’s pretty pricey but I think that’s Hawaii in general so no marks off for that, and my husband didn’t really have much choice of food on the hotel ground but he is a very fussy eater so not the hotels fault there!

This is a truly wonderful hotel outside of the hustle and bustle of Honolulu! Everyone we interacted with were imbued with the spirit of aloha. We were extremely interested in learning more about Polynesian culture and our concierge, Ms. Koki, couldn't have been more helpful. Our visit to the Bishops Museum was an outstanding introduction to Oceania's customs and culture. Every aspect of the Kahala experience ensures that you're Hawaiian vacation will be memorable!

as a first time in honolulu, i couldn't have been more pleased with our choice of accommodation. my fiance and i had been in japan and taiwan before arriving in hawaii and we were definitely happy to have stayed somewhere quiet and off the beaten path. once we got out and explored waikiki more, we felt even more isolated since it's such a bustling place but zero regrets. the hotel room was spacious with his and hers areas in the over large bathroom. we had a room facing the dolphin pond so that was special to experience. the staff was super friendly and accommodating. we took advantage of the shuttle into town as well as the complimentary bicycles. we defintiely made the most of our stay!

My family has been staying at the Kahala every Easter for over 40 years. No hotel can compare. It’s private, quiet and staffed by the most friendly employees. If relaxing is what you’re looking for, this is the hotel for you. Can’t say enough good things about this place.
user_name:
Kim T
Oak Park, United States

review_body: If you’re looking for nothing short of worldclass experiences, then you can find it all at the Kahala. The luxurious resort offers unparalleled views of both the mountain side and oceanic panoramas of the beautiful island of Oahu. It offers pampering amenities, not to mention its first class hospitality and service. The Dolphins and various sea life on the property were an amazing added extra. Although already well known for its past distinguished guests, the Kahala still makes the impression of being a hidden gem, away from the maddening crowds of Waikiki. My daughter loved every minute we spent on the beach, offering the most serene and tranquil experience. Exactly what we were looking for in our family vacation! Lunch, just a few steps away from the beach at the Plumeria Beach House was exceptional with breathtaking views of the layered blue waters of the ocean. Afternoon tea at The Veranda was a delicious treat! The highlight of our stay at The Kahala was our family photo session with Pacific Dream Photography. What better way to commemorate our unforgettable Hawaiian family vacation than to capture the beautiful moments in photographs. And that is exactly what Macy did for us! We’re so grateful for the time and effort Macy spent with us as a family to get these timeless photos that we can cherish forever. Jacob was so accommodating when we booked, not to mention patient when it came to choosing the images we wanted. It sure was a challenge since Macy captured so many beautiful shots. We are already talking to our family and friends who plan to visit the island next year about all of our wonderful experiences during our stay and most especially with Pacific Dream Photography for giving us our most favorite souvenir to remember our Pacific DREAM vacation by here at The Kahala Hotel & Resort. Best. Time. Ever. MAHALO!

It has been many years since I last stayed at the Kahala. It is still beautiful & peaceful. Its nice being away from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki. We enjoyed the Kahala Mall which was accessible with the hotel shuttle. Some great eating venues! We stayed mountainside this time, overlooking the golf course & really enjoyed it. The rooms are large and bright with enormous his & her bathroom.

Spent two week nights at the Kahala Hotel in late April with my wife. We arrived at the hotel from our direct flight from Boston an hour early and my wife immediately asked to switch rooms (not uncommon for her) and the front desk staff promptly moved us to a room with a better view. We enjoyed a delicious dinner the first night at Hokus and had an amazing couples massage at the spa on both days. The breakfast buffet was really impressive and enjoyable and we spent some time at the outside bar while hanging on the hotel beach. They make a good drink and the food was solid. They letIs try a bunch of beers while we enjoyed edamame. The room was large and clean and reminded us of staying at the Breakers in Palm Beach. The room had a Japanese toilette (Toto Washlet) which was awesome. We have them at home. The staff was very accommodating. The hotel is in a great location a bit away from the bustle of downtown and close to a couple of great day hikes (which we did). This was the perfect base camp for us to orient ourselves before heading off to Kaiui for 4 more days of vacation.

We had our wedding at Kahala Hotel in Spring and the entire staff esp our hotel wedding coordinator Anna Hinkley was AMAZING. She helped handle every detail and did everything she could to make it as easy and stress free as possible! Our family had a great vacation and a wonderful wedding. THANK YOU SO MUCH KAHALA HOTEL & ANNA!

My family and I like this hotel because it's very close to Waikiki (and a stone's throw to Diamondhead) but is nice, very quiet and not touristy. The rooms are really lovely and big, and are well-kept. Their onsite restaurant Hoku's is expensive, but the poke appetizer literally gave me chills, it was so good. Spare yourself the craziness of downtown and RELAX at the Kahala!

We just got back from 5 nights at the Kahala. We had beachfront rooms and they cannot be beat. It was a 1 minute walk to the pool and the beach is your front yard. All the restaurants and buffet breakfast were fabulous. Jose at the pool was incredibly attentive and personable. He should get employee of the year. Manager Flora was also wonderful to work with on an issue we had. I really cannot recommend this hotel enough. To me the only con was location. The beach and view are beautiful but if you want to go to a restaurant or shopping outside the resort Honolulu area is your best bet. It would have been nice to have some restaurant and cute shopping areas close (not the mall but outdoor spaces). That being said I still would definitely stay at the Kahala again. It is a beautiful spot with impeccable service and wonderful food.

We decided to explore Honolulu with our parents and children, but wanted to stay further from the craziness of Waikiki, thus we chose the Kahala Hotel. The biggest selling point for us was the long beautiful beach, even though it was obvious that the hotel was old. We were prepared to forgo less than stellar hotel. But unfortunately our stay was overall a disappointment.First and foremost, the Beach turned out to be a huge disappointment. The ocean is pretty shallow, about 5 feet deep at the deepest point (near the floating platform). The water seemed to be noticeably dirtier and colder than at Kona, Big Island of Hawaii (which we visited right after we'd left Kahala). The beach extends for about a mile towards the Diamond Head crater, but as soon as you leave the hotel area, it becomes much dirtier. A lot of broken glass, - so beware if you decide to go for a walk on the beach.Since the ocean wasn't very attractive for swimming, you're left with an old, small and boring pool, which as you can imagine gets pretty busy. The food at the pool bar is OK, but definitely not a 5 star.The hotel itself (lobby, rooms) is very old, and you can see the signs of tear and wear, but I guess, they sell it as an "old charm'. The good thing about the rooms, is that they are clean and spacious. But the TV sets, for example, are 3 times smaller than those in Four Seasons The Italian restaurant in the hotel - Arancino is quite mediocre.The really good restaurant on the premises is Hoku's. Both the service and the food is very good.The Dolphin Lagoon (where you could have a swim with the dolphins) is a nice attraction, but is not enough to justify staying at the hotel.Overall, Honolulu in my opinion, is not a good vacation spot if you're looking for a beach vacation with the family. But if you have to stay in Honolulu, then find a better, more luxurious place closer toWaikiki.

We had a brilliant time at The Kahala Hotel & Resort, we hired a car and moved to here after experiencing awful mega keen time share sales people and zero customer services at The Modern. The Kahala team, especially Gina and Heidi made our stay here, everyone was friendly, the service and care was remarkable particularly for a largish traditionally styled resort hotel particularly. The beach and evening bars were great, I’m not a fan of animals in captivity but I must say resident dolphins and turtles appeared well looked after. This is a great place to stay if you are like us have a car and want to explore the island, or if just want a totally relaxing holiday and not leave the resort. We would definitely recommend this hotel for its outstanding service and care.

This was our second time staying at the Kahala Hotel. The hotel is in a secluded part of the island in a residential area. I would rather be in a quiet part of Oahu rather and the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We enjoyed the lay back vibe and excellent customer service. Additionally, the beach is very kid friendly with very little waves. There were many times we were the only family on the beach. This made for a great and peaceful family vacation. The room we stayed in on the first floor was great. The beds were comfortable and I like that they have two separate sinks on opposite sides of the bathroom. There was one night in mid April where the manager informed the guests that the air conditioner would not be working from 10:30pm through 5:30am and lets just say my husband was not too happy about it. He made a point to tell the manager he was not happy and the manager made it right! He gave us a hotel credit for the inconvenience and had chocolate covered macademia nuts delivered to our room. The customer service is honestly the best we've ever seen. The Breakfast buffet Plumeria was very delicious but yet expensive. I think it was kind of expensive but I guess if you are in Kahala (the Beverly Hills of Hawaii), you are going to have to pay to play. I had the Kahalsadas almost every morning and it was yum!! The tropical juices offered every morning were refreshing and good! Afternoon tea at the Veranda. Loved it!! Light and delicious afternoon snacks. They served the best Beach salad and even had pasta for my daughter. A+ Bell Boys: Props to all the bell boys and bell ladies who were always helpful in giving recommendations on where to go and where to eat. Overall, we had a great time. The next time we travel to Oahu, we will be back to the Kahala! A+++

We had a great experience with Macy the photographer who did our family photos. Macy was able to capture our kids being playful and smiling. The picture came out great and we will cherish the memories forever. I would highly recommended Pacific Dream Photography for anyone staying at the Kahala Resort.

We stayed at the Kahala for a week in April 2019 with two young kids (ages 5 and 1). I can't say enough about this hotel. Every aspect of their service - from checkin, to the bellman, to poolside service, to the valet, to the housekeepers, to room service, was incredible. I travel frequently for work and stay at a lot of high end hotels, and the service here was better than Ritz/Four Seasons/etc. The food is extremely good, the pool has plenty of chairs, so there isn't any need to fight for space like you have to at other Hawaii hotels. the scenery is beautiful, and the hotel's commitment to nature is admirable (rescue dolphins and turtles on site). this is my favorite hotel in the world.

We were hesitant to stay on Honolulu for too long as we read many reviews of how touristy and island is. We were so pleasantly surprised by our incredible stay at the Kahala. The staff was amazing and thought if your every need. We met so many amazing people staying there and we loved the bar tenders. I would do anything to have a Lava Flow in my hand right now. We loved the location, pool, dolphins and rooms. The beach was not our favorite and we had dinner at the Italian restaurant one night. The food and service here were average and overpriced, but other than that, our stay was incredible and we will definitely be back!
user_name:
dnulton
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked a photo session with Pacific Dream Photography to capture our first family vacation with our 8-month old boy. The booking process was super easy due to Jacob's excellent customer service skills.Jacob was professional and very responsive to all my emails. I was concerned about the weather forecast for our scheduled photo shoot, but he reassured me that he would accommodate any changes if I needed to reschedule. Thank goodness no rain but boy it was windy!Even with 15-20mph winds, Macy was able to capture beautiful photos of the three of us. Especially of our lil one. She knew exactly how to make our son smile. She did such a great job that it was difficult choosing the best photos since they are all great. I HIGHLY recommended Pacific Dream Photography. If you're visiting Oahu, BOOK your photo session ASAP!

We stayed 4 nights at the Kahala Hotel this past February, 2019. The hotel is exceptional, with exceptional customer service. Upon arrival, we were greeted with the friendliest customer service. We were given flower leis and warm hand towels, both a well received gift after a 10 hour flight. The grounds are gorgeous and well kept. The hotel offers a private dolphin quest and turtle lagoon, both of which are extraordinary. The restaurants on site are pricey, but the food is very, very good and is delivered beautifully with an artistic flair. The rooms at the Kahala are very large in comparison to other hotels in the area. We slept so well. It is located just outside of Honolulu, so it offers a quieter environment with a private beach compared to those located directly in Honolulu. It is a stone's throw from the action and very convenient to traveling to the airport, the city of Honolulu and most tourist locations. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay and hope to return one day. You will not be disappointed. Thanks for a great stay and for making our first trip to Hawaii a memorable one.

We celebrated our 35th Anniversary and a Beautiful Brunch at HOKU! Fortunate to have a second dining experience at this amazing restaurant! Service is wonderful but the food is what you want to experience! If you are near Waikiki or in the island of Oahu and looking for a gorgeous location and inspiring eating then make your way to the Kahala Resort, Visit the dolphins and enjoy HOKU! Thank you to our waiter Bob for a special meal and a wonderful Anniversary desert!

Stayed at the Kahala for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Customer service was fantastic, the whole staff made sure your stay was memorable. The room was spacious with huge bathroom. We had a view of the golf course and mountains and it was superb. It is situated in a residential area so its not as busy or crowded as Waikiki but that was just what we wanted. The beach was never crowded. They had several excellent restaurants on the property and we ate at all the them. Our favorite was Hoku's. Overall, very enjoyable stay and would definitely return and recommend!

The Kahala Hotel and Resort was just what we were hoping for... The resort is beautiful and the service was exceptional. Although it's just a few minutes from the hustle of Waikiki, the beach is pristine and we never had any problem finding available lounge chairs either on the beach or the pool. We scheduled a family photo shoot with @Pacific Dream Photography at the resort and could not be happier with the amazing family photographs we came away with. Our photographer, Elise, was entertaining and managed to get great shots of the whole family and the entire process of having the photos taken and then picking out the ones we wanted was easy and fun. Breakfast at the Plumeria was also a treat every morning and, all in all, and we can't say enough positive things about our stay. We'll definitely be back!

Had stayed at the Kahala twice previously. Years ago they had regular shuttle service to take guests into Waikiki, 20 minutes away. Now the service is spotty at best. The hotel is isolated and very remote, bored me to hang out there, took Uber to Waikiki each day. The resort has a deserted beach, small pool area, but more wind than other side of Diamond Head. Waikiki had better and warmer weather each day I was there. My memories of the Kahala 14 years ago were nice. I reminisced about the quality and warm reception you used to get. Not anymore!We had our choice of some premium rooms - 2 Dolphin Lagoon rooms and one beachfront room for additional $$$$. The beachfront room was awful, decor looked disheveled, markings on baseboards, furniture layout terrible - pass. The Dolphin lagoon room upstairs had a small balcony overlooking the lagoon. We selected the best of the 3, downstairs at the end of the lagoon with a small patio. Furniture was slightly better condition, but room was run down. Tiles in the bathroom floor had chips missing, scuff markings along walls and hallways, our carpet was old and musty. Wish I could have photographed but it would have upset my friend. The dolphins in the lagoon swim very close to the rooms. They flap their fins and clap their jaws which makes a noise that wakes you at night if the slider door is open.The pool bar was an utter joke! Unpleasant atmosphere, and charged the same price as beachfront Waikiki bars that make an excellent, fresh Mai Tai. I was disgusted when I tasted my Mai Tai, then saw that it was made from mixes - plus its served in a plastic dixie cup. The Hoku's restaurant was overpriced, stuffy atmosphere. Lobby outside of Hoku's had nightly piano music tho. The best restaurant was the Italian restaurant on site. Bummer that it's situated along the parking lot in front. Morning buffet was good, eating by the lawn area pleasant, service was slow.The small pool area always had a few kids in floaties in the pool, a few adults in the jacuzzi. The furniture and cushions were faded and worn, needed replacing. The hallways of the Kahala were dirty with skid marks on the walls and baseboards, the rooms were in run down condition. Not much attention seemed to be paid to comforts and nicer amenities for their guests. I'd never return to this resort! The only people staying here seem to do so to play on the golf course or want total isolation and privacy. The Kahala has had its day, go elsewhere if you want better treatment, updated rooms and nicer weather.

We had exceptional service during our entire stay-from bellhops to waitstaff to evening turndown service, everyone was friendly, helpful and made you feel welcome. Rooms are very spacious and it’s peaceful location 10 minutes outside the crowdedness of Waikiki was welcomed. Will definitely return

We were here in December and loved it so much could hardly wait to return. Just as luxurious and wonderful in spring even without the glorious Christmas decorations. This is a first class resort with lovely, spacious rooms, beautiful views, excellent buffet breakfast with to die for papaya! We also enjoy the poolside bar which serves up drinks and delicious sandwiches. The vegan burger is hands down the best I have ever eaten. Wonder how many times I’ll have to visit before they give me the recipe?! Beautiful ocean front without wall to wall tourists like Waikiki. So much classier. Dolphins to watch play and programs to swim with the dolphins which is on my bucket list. Fantastic resort with heavenly comfortable beds, quiet, wonderful housekeeping and best of all the extraordinary staff - all smiling, happy, helpful and willing to do anything you ask for. Oozing with that renowned “ aloha spirit” so lacking in the mainland states.Wish I could come and never leave but we will be back for certain. Nothing I’ve found to not like. Mahalo Kahala staff and management and we so appreciate your giving us the room and everything else we asked for!

I have just returned from a 10 day stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. It was absolutely fantastic! The resort is stunning! The lobby is exquisite and the rooms are beautifully appointed. The beach was calm and quiet which is a refreshing change from the hectic pace of the Waikiki beaches. The pool staff did an excellent job of helping guests get comfortable loungers, covers and towels both at the pool and beach area. We thoroughly enjoyed renting snorkel equipment for a very reasonable rate and taking it for the day. The most memorable part of the trip was swimming with the dolphins. I believe this is the only place you can do this on Oahu! The Dolphin Quest program focused on education and respect for dolphins and gave you an up close experience that is unforgettable. I highly recommend this. The food was exceptional. I was told by locals it is known for the best Breakfast Buffet on the island and the Seafood Buffet on Friday nights is not to be missed! The crab legs! Delicious! This is a must stay resort if you come to Oahu!

We spent our last few days in Hawaii with kahala. We loved it. They treat everyone the same and you feel like royalty. The rooms were large and comfortable, the breakfast buffet is amazing, the beach is calm and quiet, and the pool was relatively quiet. Exceptional service. Wandering the beach and dolphin lagoons at night as you listed to the piano being played above on the veranda is delightful. We sat next to a few well known people and everyone was down to earth and lovely. I think people come here for a laid back relaxing Hawaiian atmosphere that still is sophisticated. The staff goes above and beyond. After check out there is a hospitality room but we chose to sit on the lanai overlooking the lagoon. The staff brought water and coffee to us and blankets for my son who wasn’t feeling well. They called a taxi and had everything ready to go at our departure time. It is difficult to mention everything but you just feel well taken care of here. Exactly what We needed after taking care of two kids with a fever on vacation. We absolutely loved it. Would love to come back here again.This place is a hidden treasure.

We had a glorious 25th Anniversary vacation at the Kahala. Our room was amazing with an incredible balcony overlooking the ocean/dolphin lagoon/pool. We could see sunrises and sunsets from our balcony every day. Every single staff we encountered went above and beyond to make us feel very special. I was a little concerned about the whole idea of dolphins in captivity before we arrived as some comments have mentioned but after I saw how well they were taken care of and after speaking with some of the marine biologists at the facility I realized these creatures were right where they needed to be. And watching them play when noone was really watching or asking them to perform was a highlight of our trip. My only less than perfect score would be for the fancy Hoku's restaurant... overrated and not worth the price, but all of the other options were amazing. It was frustrating to have a lot of kids in the hot tub without their parents supervising (especially when there is a kiddie pool right there) but one of the staff said they were considering making the hot tub "adults only" which would solve that problem. Overall it was paradise for us, away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but close enough to enjoy what it has to offer if one is so inclined.

This resort is so heavenly. Pure luxury, professional services to all guests, perfect beach, pool and golf estate views from every room, matched with six healthy and happy dolphins to entertain and play with. Many thanks to Bart ( Assistant Manager), Caroline (registration clerk) and LONO ( the cheeky elder dolphin). All of you made our stay a definite five star.

My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon after staying at another resort right in downtown. The beautiful neighborhood away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu was welcomed. The Kahala is only a 10 minute drive to get back to the city, and you get to see the "rich" neighborhood full of mansions that this hotel is tucked behind. You are also super close to go hike Diamond Head, and then eat at the rave reviewed Diamond Head Market and Grill. We were greeted with warm smiles, a purple lei, dolphins swimming in the lagoon, and we even saw a couple of celebrities during our stay. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and decorated beautifully. We loved the fact that we had two sinks and a tub! The food on site was delicious! We even took advantage of the free* photo session on the beach. The shoot was fun, and our pictures turns out fantastic! Stay here if you want a romantic place to stay near the city, but want the peace that HI has to offer!

We stayed at the Kahala for a wedding. Brought the grandparents and kids along. We all loved the Kahala! The atmosphere and staff were wonderful! Swimming with dolphins was our favorite excursion of the whole trip. Wedding was beautiful and fun. We would definitely go back and highly recommend.

I love this hotel so much!! I have been coming here for 30 plus years. Through ownership changes and different brand changes it has always been fantastic. It comes down to the staff there. Some have been there 30 years and they make the difference. Obviously it is a beautiful hotel but it is the people there that make the difference. Always feels like home.

What a perfect celebration! The staff members were friendly, accommodating and patient. The food was attractively displayed and tasted absolutely delicious...we say "ono" in Hawaii. Anna Hinkley, the banquet manager, worked with me from day one until the evening of the celebration...she's great! Would return to the Kahala again for future celebrations...mahalo!

Absolutely amazing here! First I want to mention @Pacific Dream photography which the session was included in our stay. Our photographer Macy was absolutely amazing she was so much fun and made us feel so comfortable. My husband and I hate getting our pictures taken but Macy is so talented and made it feel so natural. Jacob showed us our pictures, you are not required to purchase anything. I thought he was going to push their packages on us but he didn’t! We had fun looking at the few hundred pictures Macy took and nothing felt forced you could tell they love their job! Everything was very organized! Thank you Jacob and Macy!! Kahala Hotel and resort; such a gorgeous place here and close to many many things! We stayed 7 days and we couldn’t fit everything we wanted into our stay! North shore is on the other side of the island but only a 45 minute drive. Every one here is so welcoming anytime you walk by someone they are smiling and saying hello. Deedee from the concierge desk was amazing and took so much time helping us. We didn’t book any excursions before so we booked everything the day we got in which was a little mistake because of how busy everything was but Deedee has connections guys and pulled a bunch of strings for us and got most of the things we wanted it took a long time and she was happy doing it for us! The only thing that was a bummer for us is we got pretty sick and our throats where raw and swollen so we wanted tea. Tea of course is complementary and they give you a kettle to use. I like drinking Tea with lemon and honey. At night I went down and asked if i could get a lemon wedge and honey and they wanted to charge me the room service fee now most of the people staying here are pretty wealthy but we use pretty much our life savings here and I’m pretty frugal and I just could fathom being charged a room service fee for a lemon wedge and honey (which they give out free at the breakfast buffet in cute little jars which was included in our stay)

Superb service. Nice, not great room. Strange toilet. Buffet breakfast fantastic, excellent other restaurants. Prize was the dolphin pool. If you stay in that area, we were in room 1231, the dolphins are amazing. Better than the anodyne sea view. Sunrise on the beach is great.

Honestly the rooms need an update, but what makes this hotel worth the stay is the staff. Everyone who works here is so helpful and genuinely nice. They always try to use your name and really have the Aloha Spirit. The breakfast buffet was pretty good too and only $39. Also rooms are huge and they greet you with a lei!

Beautiful, clean, attentive staff, private pool with dolphins and the opportunity to swim with the dolphins. Hotel is on a private beach so you can relax on the beach or in their pool. Shuttle bus to several locations downtown to shop, dine, and relax.

From arrival to departure, our stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort was fantastic. The staff, to a person, was personally invested in the welfare and happiness of every guest. We enjoyed delicious breakfasts at the Plumeria restaurant. Eric and Randy, part of the morning staff, were attentive to our needs. The concierge was always helpful. The pool personnel, especially Jesse and Amanda, were personable and trained in safety procedures. The housekeeping staff was efficient and thorough. Even the shuttle driver, “Cousin Gary”, was nice. Another positive was our exposure to the Dolphin Quest program. We were fortunate to have a room with a view of the dolphin lagoon – yes, a lagoon in the middle of the grounds – and we observed the trainers for 6 days. Their dedication, professionalism and enthusiasm were evident every day.It was difficult to pack and leave this beautiful resort.

The Kahala Resort lives up to its reputation. I felt absolutely pampered the entire time I’ve been here. Luxurious beds, divine views and even dolphins! You just can’t ask for more. And the cherry on top was my amazing photo shoot with Pacific Dreams and Maci. I truly felt like a star. I would recommend for anyone traveling alone! Mahalo and Aloha!

This is by far, the BEST hotel to stay at........EVERYTHING was impeccable. The service, the people, the beauty of the surrounds, the dolphins. I cannot wait to go back. You will not regret staying here. I absolutely adored it.
user_name:
Joy J
Toms River, New Jersey

review_body: What can I say.. the service was great, the food was delicious,(Rudy my server). Was on point and made us feel at home.And what a view!!!!If you find yourself at the Plumeria the bartenders were friendly and so attentive to my families needs..Ask for either Erol, Cathy, Gene or Steve. Smiles and aloha the whole time. If you find yourself at Hokus you will have a great time in an upscale restaurant. Brandon, Shae and Zack were awesome..If you're at seaside the bartenders Kanoa, and manager Jenny were super helpful in all our needs. Special thanks to James front desk manager, Lynn bar manager and also David. What can I say except thank you so much for all your help in making this vacation exceptional

The Kahala is perfect for families and has access to many restaurants within the building. Staff were good and the shuttle bus took you to the main places you would want to visit. We were on the bottom level with a view of the dolphins (who were basically in our garden) that was amazing even though some may disagree with captivity. However, being on the bottom floor allowed for people to walk into our patio and right past the windows to the bed, this was uncomfortable but also funny. The service was great and i would definitely recommend staying her if you don't want to be close to the crowd of Waikiki put have great amenities.

Came here twice once just with my husband in 2013 and another time with our kids. We loved that everything was taken care of. The rooms are tastefully decorated and the beds and pillows are so comfortable. We stayed here before our cruise with Norwegian and it helped fast track us into full vacation mode. the private beach is a bonus no waiting for beach chairs and the beach itself is not crowded. Great gym on the facility as well.

Valet scammed the guests! They closed the parking structure so cars had to valet, and off course that means more tips. I visited the hotel to attend a conference and discovered the parking structure was chained at the 2nd floor. I turned around and had to valet my car. I asked the valet why the lot was chained and was informed they were doing a major renovation so it would be closed for awhile. I did not think anything of it at the time until others told me they were able to self park upstairs in the structure when they drove in at 7:30 a.m. I got there at 8:30 a.m. and the lot was closed but I could see open stalls on the next level. What a deceitful thing to do. No class!!!

The Kahala Hotel and Resort is perfect for families or couples. My wife and I stayed at the Kahala for five nights and we both agree this is the best hotel in Oahu. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, the food and restaurants were excellent and the rooms are made up in a classy, elegance of Hawaiian style. The open air lobby with views to the ocean immediately gave us the feeling of vacation and relaxation. The lagoon is great for swimming, canoeing, stand up paddle or whatever water sport you like. A short drive takes you to fantastic hikes, beaches or surf spots on the south/southeast shores of Oahu. We can't wait to get back to the Kahala Resort with our family.

Should have done my research better and was disgusted to find on check in that this hotel keeps captive dolphins for the ‘entertainment’ of their guests!!! Not acceptable in this day and age.....I moved hotels

We have just enjoyed our third stay at the Kahala Resort. One of our previous stays was on our honeymoon, and after having such a memorable time, we wanted to relive some of those moments with our 9 month old (we brought my mother too for extra help). We were assigned two rooms on the same floor opposite each other, which made it almost seem like we had a two bedroom villa, it was useful to be so close as Grandma was baby sitting. Housekeeping did such a great job of providing a crib and high chair in the room so my mother could cater to the baby easily. The property is sheer perfection. Secluded enough to properly relax, but close enough to the hustle and bustle of Honolulu if you feel like a night out.The staff are the real star of the show. Eric who served us at breakfast at Plumeria became a dear friend, and made us feel like we want to return again solely to see him! We can’t recommend the Kahala enough. The price might be high, but if affordable, is absolutely worth the investment.

Everything about this resort is top notch. My wife and I had an incredible time on our honeymoon and would recommend the Kahala to anyone. The staff is friendly and very attentive, and the amenities are second to none. You won't regret staying here!

The Kahala Hotel & Resort is the perfect balance of privacy, elegance, size, location and convience to experience the best of Oahu. Located on a beautiful beach just outside Honolulu, with swimming pools for all ages as well as pools with fish, turtles and dolphins. The cuisine from breakfast through dinner is excellent. Your surrounded by kind intelligent staff as well a kind sophisticated patrons, newlyweds to families. From the front desk manager “Mr. Faatau“ to every employee on staff, they make you feel like family... a step above royalty in my opinion. While we enjoy vacationing on all the Hawaii islands, for us The Kahala Hotel & Resort makes Oahu uniquely special.

Really the most outstanding location and accommodation in Honolulu. Every detail is attended to - the beach, the pool, the restaurants, Dolphin Quest, the room - everything!! The only critique I had the last time we were there was that the toilet tissue wasn’t soft, lol. This time, it was delightful!

room was clean, stately, kinda old fashioned but ok. not sure if it was worth it. has exterior beams around building. checked in late so can not comment on view from room. you get a towel wipe upon check in and there was valet parking. did not have time to check out any resturants.

We stayed at the Kahala Feb 2019, for three nights, great front desk and staff, very family friendly. Rooms are very large with comfortable beds. We ate at two of the restaurants on site and the food was delicious. We use Pacific Photography to do family portraits on the hotel grounds and beach area. Macy was our photographer, she was wonderful, we were very comfortable with her. The pictures she took of us were so beautiful, we would use this service again! Just a wonderful relaxing experience.

Next to PGA golf course. Otherwise isolated from other hotels, restaurants and commercial areas - long taxi ride into town. On beach. Large rooms. About half rooms have nice large balconies. Bathrooms large with 2 separate rooms – one with shower sink (includes clothesline) and closet area; the other with heated toilet seat with built in bidet function (Japanese style toilet), sink and tub. Room has bar soap, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, shower caps, robes, pajamas, body lotion, vanity kit (cotton swabs, makeup remover pads, nail file), iron, coffee maker, mini-frig, large safe. Turndown service with chocolates. Large exercise room and outdoor pool. Central air and overhead fan. Free wi-fi. Large breakfast buffet includes Japanese specialties, make to order omelets, better than average selection of baked goods. Room is quiet only noise was rare emergency vehicle siren. Plenty of lights in room. Nightly turn down service with chocolate.

My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Kahala and we could not have been happier. Our room was lovely and spacious with a large balcony. The room was promptly cleaned twice daily and restocked with bottles of water and ice. The staff was exquisite - they even greeted my pregnant wife at dinner one evening with a stuffed toy for our baby. The restaurants were delicious and pleasure to dine at. The pool and spa were exactly what we hoped for and we have high expectations. Call buttons are provided at the pool so a staff member can wait on you without a moments hesitation. The hotel is over 50 years old, so it wasn't gleaming new but any moments hesitation over the facade disappeared the moment we got inside what is a truly impressive hotel. Obviously we are not alone in our appraisal - we encountered multiple A-list celebrities during our stay and it was readily apparent why they would choose to stay there.

We stayed five nights at the Kahala Hotel in February. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. We had breakfast included with our stay and it was fabulous. This is a five star hotel .

This hotel is absolutely amazing! The entire hotel from the grounds, the restaurants, spa, and room are 5 star, one of the best places I have stayed in. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend to others.
user_name:
TariTraveler
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I can't think of a better holiday in the US. It has everything including great entertainment in the bar/lounge courtesy of David Swanson. The breakfast buffet is a real highlight as is the beachside lounging. It's a true escape - a secluded as you want or moments away from downtown Honolulu. I love this hotel.

Not far from Waikiki, but more laid back. Service and food is excellent. Dolphins on site, for dolphin quest. Spa services are so relaxing. Pool is clean and refreshing. Lovely beach and golf course on site.

If you want to be treated like "Royal Hawaiians", then the The Kahala Hotel & Resort is THE PLACE! Near Diamond Head and away from downtown Honolulu. Cannot say enough for all of their staff. They are the best we have had given that over the years we have visited several of the Hawaiian Islands. The rooms are placed so that no matter where your stay, you have a view of the ocean and/or the beautiful mountains. Great for individuals and/or families and yet VERY QUIET even with families. Five wonderful and diversified restaurants (menus). Away from downtown and yes ladies, shuttle service available when you want to shop.My highlight was my swin with the Dolphins (Bucket List)!

This classic resort is sophisticated, elegant and quiet. After a long flight from the East Coast, it is bliss to sink into an insanely comfortable bed. Wonderful service. A blessing off of the beaten path.

We only had 4 days with the Kahala it was a quick trip and it was the most perfect hotel to stay in . You felt like you had your own section of hawaii to yourself . It was private , so you didn’t feel over crowded with people like Waikiki . The restaurants within the hotel were delicious. The staff were outstanding and the room was to die for ! By far the best hotel on the island . Can’t wait to come back !

I’ve been to Kahala Hotel in January 2019. Located a fez minutes from Waikiki Beach, Diamond Head Crater and Hanauma Bay Nature Preserve, it lies at Kahala Beach, with crystal clear and calm waters and no crowds. Very comfortable and spacious rooms. It has a lagoon where with guests can watch and swim with dolphins.

This resort is breathtaking - truly a beautiful location. Dined here in 2017, first time staying here and I am extremely pleased. The rooms are nicely appointed, staff are friendly and recognized me by name, service was impeccable, and the dolphins were fun and delightful. This resort is nothing short of amazing ! First rate all the way - will definitely recommend.

Away from hustle and bustle of Waikiki yet conveniently reachable within 15 minutes, it offered us the best balance of what we've longed for in Honolulu.Everyday during the week we were here, we enjoyed shopping and dining in central Honolulu while our little kid immersed himself in Kahala's quiet and beautiful sandy beach. Dolphins and turtles were his daily joy as well.We had the privilege to stay in one of the beach front Lanai on the lower level and that was the main thing that made our stay perfect.Nice, friendly and helpful staff at reception, bell, concierge, restaurants and pool. Housekeepers were excellent too.We had lunches and dinners at several restaurants in the resort and all were very good however we wouldn't forget the outstanding food and service at Arancino.There were a few things we didn't like about: slow wifi, occasional power problems and mystery about daily resort credits.But these don't make our special memories at Kahala any paler. Our family holiday couldn't be any better.

My husband and I just returned from a visit to the property to celebrate an upcoming anniversary. Our last visit was more than 20 years ago and yet, the elegance and level of customer service still is as present as ever. From the moment you arrive at the Kahala Resort , one is treated as an old friend returning ‘home.’ The décor of the hotel evokes the feel of timeless Hawaiian sophistication where soft hues of color balance upscale amenities without sacrificing to other 5 star properties which dazzle with modern décor. What truly makes a repeat guest of a visitor is the level of hospitality demonstrated by the staff to ensure that the hotel creates a ‘fan’ and a return visit. We were so fortunate to have been the recipient of such service and although would love to mention all we encountered, special mention should go to Josie and Liane at the pool area, Frank, Taryn, Georgia and Robert from Hoku’s, Joseph in Guest Services and the wonderful housekeepers whose cheery disposition was ever present. All food and beverage outlets were exemplary, however our ‘anniversary’ dinner at Hoku’s was a night we’ll never forget! When in Oahu, the Kahala will always be our home away from home…

Hotel was wonderfully located, set away from the madding crowd of Waikiki yet shopping and best nightlife in the islands 10 minutes awayCannot say enough about staying in a quiet tucked away oasis with private beach NOT on a strip of seemingly endless hotelsService was 5 star from limo pick up at airport to checkin with choice of rooms upon request.We had an exquisite suite overlooking the pool area and beach; absolutely beautiful and immediately relaxing All the pressures of the mainland world immediately melting away in pleasant temperatures, comfortable and luxurious decor, and ever accommodating and overly friendly staff.Loved the Toto facilities, which more US properties ought to invest in. Pool and beach were wonderful Could use cabanas on beach for shade24/7 sauna/ steam room. Pool also open without restriction. Restaurants/ food were exquisite from breakfast at Pulmeria House to lunch at truly phenomenal Italian restaurant (3 course meal wonderful!) to more elegant dining room/restaurant. Can feel at home in casual wear or formal attire. So happy we chose this hotel 20+ minutes from airport without need for flights to additional islands.Will definitely be back. Can’t wait to see what additional upgrades ResortTrust makes to this property though not sure any are really needed (though might lose dolphin quest or move it off the immediate property).Thank you Kahala for a truly memorable and relaxing stay.

My boyfriend took me here for our 4 year anniversary, and also planned a surprise proposal. Besides being the best day of our lives to date, the Kahala is our new favorite hotel! The staff was incredible, Jacob and Maci with Pacific Dreams made all our engagement photo dreams come true with a beautiful photo shoot and video they put together <3 Robert and Lynn were also amazing and made our stay special with incredible customer service and hospitality. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean, maintained immaculately with spectacular views of the mountains and ocean. Overall the Kahala has made an overwhelmingly positive, lasting impression on us!

Our third visit in 19 years for the Sony Open and still the perfect place to stay. Yes it’s best if you are visiting for the golf on the doorstep but more importantly this is a superb place to stay. Service is excellent, rooms very comfortable, a choice of good restaurants and good pool and gym, a beach, plus resident dolphins & turtles in pools. The only thing we missed was easy phone & laptop charging. Sockets were not convenient in the bedroom and similar hotels now provide USB charging points. Complimentary wi-fi was appreciated. A long way from home but we hope to return before too long.

I stayed here for two nights in December at the end of my week in Honolulu. The first part of my trip was business related so I stayed at a Marriott property in Waikiki, which I enjoyed. Two totally different hotels! Full disclosure, paying $900 a night for a hotel room was a big splurge for me so my expectations at the Kahala may have been skewed.The service here is wonderful! From the sweet valets to the front desk staff to housekeeping and the waitstaff, all of the staff I encountered were so kind, professional and did whatever they could to make you feel at home.The room was truly gorgeous - the furnishings and the decor were lovely. The bathroom was very nice! My only disappointment was being on the 2nd floor. For an ocean front lanai (again, $900 a night) I don't want to look out at the rooftop of the restaurant/lobby area. Those areas are open air so you could look right into the lobby from my balcony. If you only looked straight ahead or to the east, the view was much better. Since this was a big treat for me, I was disappointed a higher floor room was not available. I spent afternoons relaxing on their wonderful beach, swimming the in pacific and enjoying drinks while watching the sunrise. You cannot beat this beach. Compared to Waikiki it is a totally different experience. I enjoyed Waikiki, but this place is so quiet and tranquil. I only went into the pool once. Surprisingly, the water was super cold. Not many people were using it while I was there, but with this great beach why would you.There's not much around the resort if you want to get out and walk. Its located in a beautiful high end neighborhood. If you're looking for a relaxing/tranquil getaway, this is a great option in Honolulu.

One of the most beautiful and tranquil resort hotels you will ever find. Let alone on the island of Oahu.Fantastic beachfront setting. Rooms are spacious and elegant.Lots of solid food choices.Not a big fan of the Dolphin pool, but some might like it.

We had a beautiful dinner at the hotels signature restaurant Hoku’s after their wonderful tree lighting ceremony. What a delight to be served with professionals who understand the subtleties of elegant service. The food was perfectly cooked and presented with flair. A must stop for anyone staying at the Kahala or in nearby Waikiki. Oh, check out the dolphins in the nearby gardens. We watched them for over an hour squealing with delight each time they passed us by.

Took my 4 year old twins for an overnight stay cation. The loved it! The pool was great and there was a whirlpool and kiddie pool as well. The beach is right there and oh yeah, dolphins!The room was spacious and very comfortable. We ate dinner at the Plumeria House seafood buffet which was delicious and they did not charge me for the kids. They also gave my kids stuffed dolphins when we checked in and checked out! It is located close to Kahala Mall

I was visiting the Kahala with my (large) family for a "staycation." Not only could the hotel accommodate our large party with friendly service and spacious rooms, we had a blast exploring the tastefully decorated property, watching the hotel's six dolphins, eating at the on-site restaurants, and enjoying the pool and ocean.

The room was very spacious with a lot of amenities. The robes and slippers were nice to wear around the room and the coffee and espresso machine where a real treat. When we ordered room service at night, it was too the room in 30 minutes and delicious.Wally at the front door welcomes you so friendly that you think you have come home after a long time away. The staff was very friendly and helpful, from the restaurant's to the pool, to housekeeping, they made our stay very comfortable.My mother uses a walker and we were able to navigate throughout the property without incident.

We had a beautiful ocean view room that was very spacious and had a gorgeous bathroom! I was able to take a nice relaxing bath in their tub after utilizing their 24 hour pool and hot tub. Their corn beef hash at the Plumeria was delicious and the staff was very friendly and had great customer service! They had a pool with six dolphins that was always a spectacular show.

The location was perfectly secluded but close enough to the city to experience it in a short car ride. The amenities were immaculate but were also family friendly. The food options on property are exquisite and could accommodate large parties. Above all the service of the Kahala made a lasting impression.

Beautiful location and very nice hotel. My room was wonderful and I couldn’t see any issues with the upkeep unlike some other comments. I had one of the top class rooms on the beach and every morning I watched the magical sunrise from bed. I swam in the beautiful waters and I showered in the luxurious room bathroom which was only 1 minute from the waters edge. The staff are friendly and polite. At first I thought the dolphin pool was cruel and then I did some research rather than making some false assumptions. Turns out that breed of dolphin would typically live in a lagoon that size in the wild. The dolphins seemed very well looked after and recieved only the very best care. Of course I would prefer to see them in the wild but this set up also allows for important studies and research. My only criticism of the hotel would be the pool side and beach service. The staff talk to themselves and have their backs to the guests on most occasions. I sat on the beach loungers for 5 days and not once was I asked if I could be helped or if I needed anything. Very strange and poor service and so easily rectified with some good training. One morning I couldn’t find any staff so walked into the kitchen of the pool side bar to find the staff grouped together talking and resting. Not the best when you have a beach full of guests. That aside a beautiful hotel and I would stay again. Would be handy to have some service though :)

We had an amazing and beautiful Tea Service for my daughters birthday at the Veranda. The food was not only beautiful but tasted amazing. They were extremely accommodating with my dairy and gluten free diet. The Chef created amazing desserts and "sandwiches" that were the envy of all the others. Scott our server was the very attentive and accommodating and the hotel is simply beautiful. I definitely want to go back!

The Kahala is on a prime piece of real estate with excellent beach views and some good food options. The room rates for this time of year (early January) are astronomical and around 800 for a mediocre room. We booked a room block (10) for our wedding and had a contract locked in for a cheaper room rate. Despite having a contract, there was a dispute with the front desk and my parents - they tried to charge us full rack rate. After an argument and finally getting through to one of the managers they finally agreed to our original contract rate, which they should've done in the first place. Our room was decent but definitely not worth the price - the bathroom floor was damaged, looked dirty and did not feel like a 5-star hotel room like along the lines of the Mandarin or Four Seasons. The bed was ok but not great and luxurious like I was expecting. In addition, there was an incessant noise coming from the landscaping building, waking us up at 6:30 am on multiple occasions. I finally called down to the front desk and the desk clerk knew exactly what I was talking about but nothing was really done about it. His first solution was move us rooms, but it was 6:30 in the morning and that was a terrible idea as we were leaving that day. His second solution was to credit us with $100 off our stay, which was not much relative to how much we spent there for 3 nights.Our wedding however, was done well and was handled excellently by Kristal, the vendors that they have were good and that part of the experience was wonderful.One of the best parts of this hotel was the Sunday brunch at Hoku, an excellent array of fresh sashimi and tons of other great breakfast/brunch options for roughly $80/per person. Arancino was also a great option with some very good Italian food.Unfortunately I would not recommend anyone to stay at this hotel for the price you pay, but I would recommend coming for Sunday brunch or dinner at Arancino. For a 5 star hotel I expected much better service and courtesy from the hotel side.

This was my first time having dinner at Hoku's at the Kahala and it was simply amazing. The staff are all so friendly and welcoming. We started the evening with the fried ahi poke musubi which is a crunchy rice ball with fresh ahi poke in the middle which tasted so good. I got the chefs tasting menu and would recommend it to everyone. Each offering was so well thought out and delicious it had me looking forward to the next plate. I am already looking forward to my next visit.

One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Very high quality service. Friendly staff. Amazing food and amazing beach front. Not crowded and the hotel is really focused on quality. Amazing steam and sauna. Good pricing for the quality of service. The dolphins and turtles in the pool just put this hotel above any other. Close to a 6 or 7 star resort rather than 5. Would definitely recommend staying here!!

New Years Eve at the Kahala was a blast. Standing that close to the fireworks was a great experience all by itself. The drinks, food, and party favors made it even better. But the best part was that it wasn't crowded like Waikiki. New Years Eve at the Kahala will be a new tradition for us, I'm already looking forward for what they'll have install for next year.

I think this is the second review stemming from a visit to the Kahala Resort. The one about the dismal lunch we had on the patio at the Plumeria Restaurant garnered a come-back from the manager that pretty much let me know that I was not being fair. Yes, I was. And did he offer me any kind of free cocktail or even a 10% discount to come back in for another experience? No. I also wondered if he/she noticed in other reviews of that restaurant that the breakfast critiques were great and the luncheon ones were pretty bad. Hello.My sister and our BFF decided to go to the Lanai at Kahala for High Tea. You can see the dolphins from there, and the pool area and ocean view. Those things are great. However, the service was not great. We had to track down the waitress to get some more Creme Fraiche for our scones and she disappeared after the tiered presentation as if she said to herself, 'Okay, done.' I'm going to keep this as short and general as I can because this was just not a satisfying experience. First of all, we each ordered the $35 dollar menu, which gives you choices of the kinds of sandwiches you wish to taste. Don't get me wrong, but I do know that High Tea is meant to be a snack and not a huge amount of food, but this was ridiculous. The three-tiered presentation was set on the table along with beautiful tea pots and other lovely china for tea cups and personal plates. Really beautiful if it weren't for the pathetic and meager offerings of 3 tiny sandwiches (one for each of us) and 3 miniscule toast points (one for each of us) with salmon laid on them like they were the most precious delicacy in the world. These were each the size of a domino tile. Then there was a scone on the top tier (one for each of us) and some pineapple preserves that were very good. That was it. It came off incredibly skimpy, not that amazing as far as taste, and left us wondering if there was another tier coming. Not. Oh, there were some sweets at the bottom that were pretty and also tiny. There was a total of about $6.50 in ingredients and our bill was over a hundred dollars. There were three of us at $35 each so the math is not that hard. The bottom line is that I feel the food was pretentious and just not worth it. I feel ripped off.

This was a great family vacation. We opted for a room on the ground floor in an older part of the hotel. Our room had a sliding glass door and our own lounge chairs and was maybe 50 yards to the waters edge. This made all the difference as we had the ability to go in and out of the room. The hotel was great. Traveling over New Years holiday of course everything was crowded and it was difficult to make reservations for dinner and for spa etc. All this can be avoided with advanced planning and making reservations before you arrive. There were some great runs and walks from the hotel front door. Additionally, there was a free shuttle into town that seats about 14 I think so reservations were necessary but free ride. You can also Uber or cab into Waikiki for maybe 25-30 dollars. I don't think you need a car. We had a rental and used it to go to Whole Foods which was maybe 2 miles away and we were able to buy some snacks and wine for the room (good idea with three teenagers that are always eating). We also used our car to do an island tour. I would suggest that you download the app "Shaka" which will give you an island tour. We did the circle tour and it was awesome for $6.99 for app purchase. This way you can go at you own pace and stop at only those places that are of interest to you. The negative...as stated in other reviews we felt that at times they did not have the staff to accommodate the crowds. One day they did not have towels for us until 2-3pm as they said they ran out of towels. Also, sometimes during breakfast service we did not see our server much. It is a breakfast buffet everyday that is great but sometimes we needed certain things that only the server could get. Hotel property is great and you can walk for about one mile down the beach coast. Staff was awesome. I had a message at the spa and would highly recommend Reina (not sure if spelling is correct). My family loved our week here and I would definitely go back despite some of the staffing issues which I attribute to the holiday crowds.

The Kahala Hotel & Resort is by far one of my favorite hotels on the island both for business and pleasure. I’ve had business meetings, lunches with friends, and classy fundraisers here. Every single moment at The Kahala Hotel & Resort was greeted by excellent service.Joy, the Food & Beverage Manager is extremely friendly and will do whatever she can to accommodate your request. When you think of customer service, Joy is the golden standard. The Plumeria Beach House always has a long line and for good reason! The food there does not disappoint! I had a chance to enjoy Indian Buffet Day and I’ve been thinking of that food ever since. Drool! Cameron at the concierge table helped me find amazing lei making classes so quick, I didn’t even get a chance to blink. From the best lei making lessons on the island to the best volleyball groups to join, stop by and see Cameron at the concierge desk for invaluable local advice on what to do for your next adventure!Lastly, I want to note that presentation is always, I mean ALWAYS, perfect. Everything from the elegant sugar rock stirring stick with your coffee at the Plumeria Beach House to the beautiful ponds filled with sea turtles to the aesthetics in the lobby, you know that The Kahala Hotel & Resort wants you to feel and live the luxurious experience of not only being an amazing resort but also being on the most gorgeous island in the United States. P.S I heard whispers that they offer canoe trips to the little island a little ways from the beach. Something to consider for a special picnic?

I have been to the Kahala Resort several times within the past few years, and every single time it never fails to impress and delight me! From beginning to end, my experience there is nothing short of amazing. The valet staff are professional and courteous, the front desk is pleasant and friendly, the restaurant staff are genuine and warm, the pool/beach staff are accommodating and fun! The dolphins are always such a joy to see, they are happy and well cared for. I always feel like a VIP at The Kahala, it’s always a hi light of my trip to Oahu and I only wish I could stay longer! Nicely done Kahala ohana!

This is such a special hotel and location that I wish I could give it five stars but unfortunately the service level isn’t where it used to be. The pool is very understaffed with respect to servers and bartenders and the restaurants were all clearly understaffed as well. There were always long waits to be sat or to get food or drinks that we finally gave up and just ate at the Italian restaurant that is on hotel grounds but not affiliated with the hotel (their level of service was excellent). It just seems like the hotel was unprepared for the Christmas/holiday rush...they ran out of towels multiple times! It seems strange for a five star hotel to keep running out of pool towels. There were very many nice employees who were clearly trying to do their best but there seems to be something wrong with their management or ownership. There were many little details that just seemed to have fallen through the cracks like our windows in our room, which were beyond filthy and made it hard to appreciate the ocean view. Again, this is unfortunate, because the location and hotel is so beautiful...just not sure we would go back.

KAHALA is the best hotel to stay . When visiting OAHU as noted by the many celebrities dignitaries and families who return by generations .It’s was such a privilege to stay at the Kahala .I did stay in the past to différents places in Honolulu but the experience I had in December with my family was probably the most rewarding and amazing stay .My mum was telling me how people are so nice and the service was outstanding. And I’m so happy how people from the Kahala take good care of these dolphins . It’s remarkable . Now those that write such negative reviews are individuals that do not belong to this high calibre luxury iconic hotel . Thanks you so much to express myself because I really wanted to take the time for all the people and the good spirit in this beautiful resort ERIC .

What a lovely afternoon spent at the iconic Kahala Resort. Dolphins playing, children laughing. Spectacular ocean view while enjoying a curry lunch. Lingered in the lobby and got some great recommendations from the concierge on local cultural activities. Mahalo!

We were very impressed with the Kahala resort and had an excellent stay overall. The effort that housekeeping and the rest of the resort staff made in and outside their buildings was amazing and very noticeable. We really enjoyed all of their restaurants and beach accomodations. Was everything PERFECT? Well what in life is? I could point out little things here and there but I'd rather focus on the overall great feeling we have when we think back about our stay. I was worried about the resort being at capacity, especially over the Christmas holiday but it never felt like a zoo to us. Sure there were plenty of families with young children. We were traveling with our 20 and 17 yr old so we know what it's like to raise kids and we were happy to see everyone having fun. It was the week of Christmas so of course everyone young and old were excited!. We had reservations for our meals so we never had to wait too long to be seated even thought they were VERY busy. The resort is located an easy distance from many island activities as well. We had a dolphin lagoon view which we enjoyed very much. I highly recommend the Kahala.

It's really a shame that this hotel, which was spectacular for YEARS, has turned into something so generic. Many of the staff members are helpful, but the rooms are really sub-standard and the food is expensive and unimpressive to say the least. The pool staff is a mixed bag...several gentleman are helpful and polite, while others are incredibly rude and disrespectful. Just so disappointing. The staff does NOTHING to prevent certain guests and their children from behaving terribly...there are no standards anymore. Kids and young teenagers shooting poolside guests with water guns (I watched two women with babies get shot with water guns while sitting in their chairs NEAR the pool).Pool staff ignored this. I say this as someone who was there WITH young children, who DID behave. One child defecated in the pool and instead of insisting the child wear a swim diaper (the girl was probably 3 years old), she was allowed back in...without her parents even watching her. Definitely not what a five star hotel should be...and not what it was for YEARS. Just sad.
user_name:
nyctuna
New York City, New York

review_body: I wish I could be more positive about our most recent experience at the Kahala Resort. This is our sixth or seventh stay at the resort over the past dozen or so years. It is always a challenge to find anything approximating a true Hawaiian experience on Oahu, given how over developed and crowded Waikiki has become. We always found the Kahala to be an oasis of calm, located on a private beach in the Kahala neighborhood on the other side of Diamond Head from the chaos of Waikiki.But this last experience with a five-night stay in late December was so far below acceptable that I had to write about it. My wife and I had looked forward to our stay but by the end could not wait to leave. Check in process was fine – although the room was not available when we arrived at around 2pm, while waiting down by the pool area they upgraded us to one of their Beach Front Lanai rooms, which is their top room category, literally located directly on the beach. There are several problems with these particular rooms. The first is the overall disrepair of the rooms. The bathroom cabinets are decomposing badly and are seriously in need of being replaced. The carpeting is soiled and makes you uncomfortable to walk barefoot, which is totally unacceptable. But the worst aspect are the unpleasant smells. The hallway smells foul, even though it is open to the beach at the end. It must be an odor that has permeated the carpets and can’t be addressed with just vacuuming and shampooing. The rooms themselves smell appreciably better, but the toilet area is horrendous. It is not far from the odor you experience from a porta-potty. Also, the configuration is very weird in that it appears they attempted to upgrade the commode area several years back with high end Toto fixtures (incorporating air freshening, water cleansing, etc.) but the seats and bowls are too long for the small space for the commodes. So functionally the space does not work well. The rest of the experience was generally acceptable, but still not a five star experience. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating and cannot be faulted for the hotel and management shortcomings. The breakfast experience is marginally pleasant, provided you arrive early. The Plumeria Beach House is in an unbeatable location and seeing the sunrise over Maui and Molokai is a great way to start the day. If you are a fan of enormous choice, it is hard to beat. It is a massive buffet – like what you find in too many of the oversized hotels. But it gets overwhelmed with young children running from station to station examining their choices. An à la carte offering probably makes more sense. But I guess the hotel has to make choices and it appears that people like more choice. Our recommendation is to try and get their early and beat the crowds so you can get a table near the front of the lanai and have a less hectic breakfast.Most importantly, we remain uncomfortable with the dolphins in captivity. It certainly is a huge attraction of the hotel, but it is so bizarre and cruel to the animals. The island of Maui made these types of venues illegal, for good reason. The animals did not volunteer to give up their freedom to perform for dead fish. There is no reason for the Kahala Resort to continue this activity. Overall, the hotel looks quite dated and possibly they are in lease negotiations with the ground lease owner which is holding up the vastly needed renovations. In any event, I would steer clear of the Kahala Resort for the time being. Who knows if they will ever recognize how inappropriate it is for them to continue holding dolphins in captivity? We ended up heading across island to the relatively new Four Seasons at Ko’Olina, which was a vastly superior experience. It is sad to see this legend fall so far behind.

Aloha AnnaI’m sorry I haven’t written earlier but I don’t even know how to thank you for organising the most amazing function for us. Everyone was absolutely amazed and loved everything about the function. The decor and floral arrangements were a success - the intention of having the tropical theme was so appreciated and completely translated. The food was delicious and the seafood was the best we have eaten. The lobster was well received and the sashimi so fresh. My family and friends are saying I should quit my job and become an event coordinator. I know though that I could not have done it without you. Your patience with me and your professionalism and expertise made it easy. I know I was a little nervous at times so thank you for your tolerance. I really don’t know how to express my appreciation adequately. I will always recommend The Kahala and your services to anyone coming for a function. We look forward to seeing you when we return on the 31st. Thank you thank you. Adena

Try the plumeria continental breakfast us the way to go at discount. Salmon with bagel and all fresh fruits are great. Strongly recommend for breakfast and lunch and dinner. Best view to relax the view of the ocean.

Honored to be invited to the Kahala Resort's Annual Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony. This year's event was spectacular as always with entertainment, beautiful Christmas Tree and an Angel Gift Giving Tree as well. The holiday sprite filled the air with festive decorations, fabulous hand served pupu's and food stations ~ cotton candy, holiday cookies & treats and hot chocolate for the kids. Santa paid a visit which was a treat for the kids and adults as well.
