We just returned to the UK after a 9 night stay at the Kahala in Honolulu and it was 100% the perfect choice.Our trip was months in the planning and before we booked the Kahala we spent hours reading reviews hotels on Oahu, mainly in Waikiki. From the reviews it looked like the Waikiki hotels were really busy with queues for check-in and breakfast - as we prefer it a bit more relaxed and the Kahala being 20 minutes outside of Waikiki it seemed like the best choice.We got a great deal on a Dolphin Lanai room with the Kahala’s “4th Night Free and Breakfast Included” package. Staying 9 nights meant we only paid for 7 nights and with breakfast for two being worth $98 a day that’s a really substantial saving.The hotel and resort are hard to fault - the staff are great, the grounds superb and there are multiple dining options from the poolside bar/restaurant at one end to Hoku’s fine dining restaurant at the other.It’s not cheap but when you discover just how expensive Hawaii itself is you come to realise that for the standard of the hotel it’s terrific value for money

It is so true that you get what you pay for!We had the most wonderful experience - the service is stellar, the facilities first rate and the food unbelievable! Our guests were just blown away and still talking about it!!!Thank you to the staff at Kahala!!!

Very peaceful hotel, friendly staff, wonderful location, if you’re looking for a quiet and very relaxed time this is the place to be, the breakfast buffet is really amazing, and the sunsets are incredible
user_location: San Nicolas de los Garza, Mexico
user_name:
alfredomG7140FL
San Nicolas de los Garza, Mexico

review_body: We enjoyed our babygirl’s first vacation at the Kahala. Friendly staffs, totally breathtaking view and holiday decorated lobby made our stay unforgettable. The room was cozy, quiet and relaxing. Our baby had loved crib they offered, she slept almost through the night unlike at home.I knew it was a good hotel but the stay was beyond our expectation. We all fell in love and will definately come back to this place soon!We also had great moment with the Pacific Dream Photography. Photographer Macy was a really nice person, tried every way to make our baby smile. She took so beautiful shots that it was tough to choose. Jacob was so helpful picking up our favorite pictures, thanks for his pacience!They are totally nice and fun to work with, would recommend to everybody who wants to spend a memorable day.

If your looking to stay on Oahu the only place to stay is the Kahala Hotel and Resort. It's an off island experience just minutes away from the busy hustle and bustle of Waikiki, the property sits right on the beach with 3 outstanding restaurants a world-class spa and of course superb service to match it's timeless luxury.

I have used the Kahala Hotel for 46 years for myself, my guests, meetings, parties, luncheons, and dinners and everything has always been beyond expectations.This event, a Christmas Dinner Party at Kahala O Ke Kai in Plumeria Grove, was perfect!Arrangements by Anna and Jenny, Service by Winnie, Gerald and Jared. Cocktails and appetizers beachfront in the Grove and delicious dinner in the elegant oceanfront room.Three tables of six but could have easily accommodate three tables of 10 with space to table hop and visit in this elegant room. Highly recommended!!!

I have been going to the Kahala my whole life. The service is second to none. This visit I enjoyed the incredible Curry lunch buffet. I accidentally left my phone in the lobby. Once i noticed i promptly asked the staff at the signature and within minutes security had brought my phone to me! Great staff!

We just stayed 6 nights at the Kahala while my husband had a meeting there (lucky us). I found the setting lovely--especially the view toward the beach and south--and the service gracious and thorough. We were happy to be away from the urban intensity of Waikiki (you're in an upscale suburb) and felt a little like we'd gone back in time to a sophisticated resort of 20 years ago --in decor, style and service. Guests dress nicely, have tea or drinks in the lobby sitting area or read books on the porch overlooking the beach or listen to live music in the lobby bar. We liked the timeless atmosphere--the rooms weren't the latest decor, but they were large, airy and well-tended (big, double bathrooms). Very comfortable.The beach is nice, for all ages. No big waves in the bay and a raft for kids to swim to. Lovely views. Not a good destination for snorkeling, though. It could use a few more shade options (the lounges in the shade were taken early). Staff is very attentive and moved lounges to a shady spot for me.The spa and workout rooms are also first-rate. And it was really fun to see the dolphins work out with their trainers, who seem to keep them stimulated.My only complaints were relatively minor--I was disturbed by the terrible, bright lights atop the garage between the driveway and the beach. If you like to leave your window open at night (if we have a beach view, we want to wake up seeing it), the glow of those lights was awful. And there was noise at night from the front driveway below. You have to close your window and blackout curtains. The hotel graciously moved us to the other tower facing overlooking the dolphin pool (for an upcharge), which was much better. But what architect was allowed to build a beachfront garage (waste of prime real estate) with such terrible, bright lights on the roof? It mars the views and peacefulness of the place.I'd also like to see more healthy options on the menu, especially for breakfast at the Plumeria. How about one egg with greens (rather than a 3-egg omelet as the healthiest egg option?). The buffet is full of options but overkill for every day (and pricey). I was able to order a la carte, but was bored by the menu there and at the pool bar. Also, there were almost no vegetarian options. A little spa food would be nice. The more upscale Japanese-themed restaurant upstairs was very good, however, but not a breakfast option.Overall, though, a timeless hotel in a lovely spot away from the urban experience of Waikiki.

I read many of the reviews before booking and was a bit concerned over the ones who said the Kahala was old, tired and had bad service. Our experience was wonderful.We found the Mountain View room we booked to be spacious, the view of the gold course below and mountains across the Way was beautiful. We really appreciated the way the bathroom was set up with separate sinks and closets. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and eager to help. Most of all we liked how the Kahala is away from the crowds of Waikiki. We wouldn’t hesitate to book here again.

Our family celebrated Thanksgiving at the Kahala and had a truly wonderful time. Service was excellent and had a personal feeling. Our children were delighted watching the dolphins play everyday from our balcony. We decided try a free photo session with with Pacific Dream Photography (they have a desk in the lower lobby of the hotel). Macy, our photographer, took beautiful, natural photos, was very personable and sweet with our girls. And Jacob worked with us to find a photo package that met our needs and our budget (which wasn’t easy since we liked so many of the photos!!) Definitely recommend the Kahala and Pacific Dream Photography.

We stayed here for 3 days in December. The weather was not very nice. But we found staying at this hotel there was lots to do. The hotel itself is top notch with wonderful restaurants which cover a fabulous breakfast buffet, great lunch, afternoon tea, lots of options for dinners and drinks. The grounds are well thought out with a dolphin pool, a great beach area, a pool of exotic fish, and a regular swimming pool. The rooms were very well appointed. The ocean view rooms are really nice. Everything seems new and clean and well thought out. The bed and pillows were the most comfortable i've ever slept on. Service was fantastic from housekeeping, bellman, reception deskand everyone we came into contact with. While we were there the Honolulu marathon was on and the road to the hotel was closed down. We were really impressed with the arrangements the hotel made to get us out even though the road was closed. We also had a problem with noisy neighbors and were very impressed with the hotel's management of our problem. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and since we were celebrating our 40th anniversary, it was absolutely the perfect place to be.

When you think of top-tier hotels, you often think of brands like The Ritz or The Four Seasons. Without a doubt I have to consider The Kahala in that same top-tier category.This is a hotel which offers you an intimate experience. It is not a big, sprawling property like so common in Hawaii. Everything from the guest rooms to the grounds are impeccably maintained.The staff, as well, are very customer-centric.As for the on-site restaurants, they too are phenomenal. If you are there on a night when the seafood buffet is available you are in for a special treat. The cost is $60 per person but the available food is incomparable.The down side? Well, I'm not sure this is the best venue if you have small children. The pool is smallish and you won't find the water slides and outdoor amenities that cater to young children. This is a secluded, peaceful and elegant oasis and, although the hotel management may not agree, I didn't find it the kind of place where very small children fit in. While this may be a negative for travelers with small children, the rest of us appreciate this atmosphere.The only other thing you should know is that the property is located in a residential neighborhood. Don't plan to walk outside and visit countless shops like you would in Waikiki. But, if shopping is important to you, there is a shopping mall located just down the road a bit.

We returned last week to the Kahala for our 9th visit and were pleased as always. I actually stayed there in 1964 with my parents the year the "Kahala Hilton" opened and have never been disappointed. Our only gripe this time was over the lack of a shade option on the beach due to the removal of the cabanas, the bird problem at Plumeria Restaurant and the menus at Plumeria and the Seaside Grill aren't geared to the more senior guest. Overall "The Kahala is still a fantastic experience especially as retuning guests, the staff remembers us by name from the second we drive up. We are already planing our next visit.

We stayed at the Kahala Hotel and Resort for 5 nights this December. I have been visiting the Kahala since I was a 13 year old teenager; it is so beloved in our family that my sister even had her wedding here in 2009. I was eager to return to share the experience with my children (4 and 2) and we were not disappointed. We purchased our all-inclusive vacation (flights, rental car, hotel, and breakfast buffet for 2) through Costco Travel, and we will do it again. The service was amazing, and the amenities are top-notch. We stayed in the dolphin lagoon, which I thought my kids would go crazy over, but they were so taken with the ocean and the beach that they didn't really pay attention to the dolphins. The beach is absolutely stunning and the beach-side pool, baby pool, and hot tub were perfect for my kids. The only downside I can think of is that it is a little off the beaten path (meaning it's not like Waikiki), but if you prefer your resorts to be quiet and relaxing and don't mind driving to get to dinner and do some shopping, then this is the best place for you. While we were on the resort, we had a photo session with Pacific Dream Photography; I made the reservation a few days before we arrived, and the session itself is free (it was about 45 minutes long). The day of the shoot was windy and we had a cranky toddler (who had not napped) but our photographer was friendly, professional, and patient! She also took lots of "action" shots of the kids, which I think is the best way to capture small ones. I went in with zero expectations but came away pleasantly surprised -- we wound up purchasing the photographs because they were so nice. I highly recommend you try to the session out -- there's no obligation to purchase if you hate everything.

We left the mid Atlantic in parkas and arrived in paradise. This hotel is extraordinary . In all our travels we have never stayed at any place so beautiful. Just outstanding. Everything is special down to the little gorgeous white and gold ballpoint pens! The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed: wonderfully comfortable beds and linens. Everything in the room is first class.. The lanai overlooking the ocean is private and so very quiet here away from the throngs of tourists at Waikiki. I picked this place because I am a huge fan of the original Hawaii 50 and it’s star Jack Lord who lived in the Kahala area. This caused me to read on about this area and this Hotel . We are thrilled to be here and not looking forward to leaving at all. Dolphins playing in the ocean, 80 degreeF weather, and the friendliest people I have ever met , both at the hotel and the locals while walking around the area. Only thing I might do differently next time is a room with full ocean view rather than part ocean view, part parking lot view but no big deal. There is really nothing not to like here. Alll just fantastic and we can’t wait to return. A wonderful wonderful adventure. Mahalo all!

Hubby and I stayed here for a long overdue vacation. I was a little worried we may feel like we missed out since it's not on Waikiki, but it was heavenly! The hotel is unmatched in service, the amenities are great, and it is so close without being in the craziness. The perfect beachfront getaway!
user_name:
jmmm520
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: What a nice property! Sure, I read the reviews & history of this hotel. You just don’t know, until you experience it yourself. From the moment we arrived, we realized this hotel was special! The positive attitude of the staff and the beautiful grounds were impressive. Our room was spacious and comfortable! The balcony was large, extra wide and deep, with comfortable chairs & table. The large bathroom had a separate tub & shower. It included a high end, full service toilet! On a separate note, I was impressed with management. I had a small issue & the quick & proper response was impressive. This hotel’s priority is to manage a top notch hotel with superior “top notch” service. Every department is obviously properly staffed. The breakfast buffet provides a wide assortment of food for various appetites. The food was always delicious and fresh. The location and views from the restaurant were impressive. The lounge area had a very talented pianist/singer. The drinks were tasty & properly mixed. Would have been nice if they had a “Happy Hour”, which we grew accustomed to, in Maui. The location of this property is perfect! Tucked in a residential area, away from the zoo of Waikiki! It is quiet & serene. Bordered by the beach and a beautiful, private golf course. Never had an issue with availability of beach loungers, which they will set up for you, on sand or the grass area. When we return to Oahu, we will surely stay here again!

I stayed at the Kahala as a part of an event group and I couldn't have been happier with the resort. The people were friendly, helpful and very customer service focused. The Kahala resort is an upscale resort that makes a person feel relaxed and welcome from the moment you enter the property. The views are amazing and the ability to relax and absorb the true Hawaiian spirit is phenomenal. We ate at 3 of the restaurants on site and each was excellent with great service. The Plumeria is a perfect location for breakfast, lunch and/or dinner. My only negative comment is the number of birds that tend to gather around the tables at times tends to be a nuisance and could be unsanitary. The pool bar was a nice place for lunch as well. We also ate at the Italian restaurant on site and it is a true seafood Italian menu. The portions are small yet delicious. The rooms are luxurious and very comfortable. There were 2 sinks and closets in the room we had and had a very nice view of the ocean. The beds were extremely comfortable. I highly recommend this resort.The event room was set up perfectly and the temperature was just right. We had lunch catered by the resort on 2 days and it was very delicious. The menu was varied and the food was very good. Overall this is an excellent resort and I would highly recommend. It is close to Diamond Head and away from the business of Waikiki which is perfect. The hotel does offer a shuttle down into Waikiki if needed.

We had a great wedding ceremony and reception at the Kahala Hotel & Resort; our family and friends were blown away by the beautiful site. They also loved how delicious the food was. Our wedding was beyond perfect! The event manager was very responsible and extremely helpful during our wedding preparations and on the wedding day. She even helped have a hotel room available for us several hours before check in! We were able to get ready and relax in our room before the ceremony, which greatly eased our stress. We would definitely recommend the Kahala Hotel & Resort to anyone looking for the perfect wedding spot.

I once again had the very good fortune to stay at the Kahala Hotel & Resort this past weekend. As I drove up the tree-lined driveway, a spectacular border of vibrant red pointsetias tastefully reminded me that the festive season is upon us. As my car came to a halt, the warmth of the welcome and the personal recognition of being a valued return vistor set the tone for my stay. The Kahala is a very special place - a touch of the country with a beautiful horseshoe shaped bay, just 10 minutes from the bustle of Waikiki. The huge lavishly decorated Christmas tree filled the air with scent of real pine and continued a tradition begun 40 years ago when this elegant resort was born from the marshy foreshore of east Kahala.The warm welcome continued at check-in, which took less than a minute since I was a returning guest, and adorned with my welcome lei I was escorted to the elevator and was soon in seventh heaven in my ocean-front corner suite. These suites must be the largest on Oahu - at least 500 square feet of easy elegance. Nothing brash or intimidating here, just the hallmarks of 5-star elegance without a hint of bling! The view was magnificent along the coast in both directions, across the golf course to the east and then down onto the bay and the unique dolphin pools which make this one of the most magical resorts anywhere.Everything is as you would expect, beautiful bed linen, soft yellow drapes, elegant furnishings, art, rugs and spacious old-world bathrooms (2) . Share, or have a bathroom all to yourself. But most of all it is about the people. This is a hotel where genuine, Hawaiian hospitality and luxury resort service are in everyone team member's DNA .....it comes from their heart and that makes ALL the difference. Thank you to each and every one of you who I had the pleasure of speaking to. You are the Kahala, and you are very much appreciated. I'll be back!!!!

Our family arrived on Thanksgiving Day after a grueling flight. Check in was easy and friendly and our rooms were comfy, clean, and spacious. We especially enjoyed that there were two sink areas in the bathrooms, along with a separate tub and shower, and the toilet in its own area. The room fridge was also spacious and we could enjoy a first cup of coffee on the lanai each morning. The setting is quiet and peaceful, seemingly far from the hectic of Waikiki. A shuttle will take you there or to a nearby mall so there's no need to worry about paying for or finding parking if you want to shop nearby. We enjoyed breakfast each day at the Plumeria Beach House. The beach is sandy and there are plenty of lounge chairs to relax in. We enjoyed watching the dolphins and sea turtles. All in all we had a wonderful and relaxing vacation.

We visited the Kahala for a Thanksgiving getaway. This was our 12th stay at the hotel - obviously we like it!As always, the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We were in an Ocean Front Suite which is our favorite room category. You truly cannot beat the views from these rooms!As always, the spa treatments were awesome as was the daily breakfast.For the first time we tried Hoku's Sunday brunch and were not disappointed. It was delicious with many many options.I don't want to reiterate any of my prior reviews so will just say that we still love this resort and definitely will be back!

My husband and I got married at the Kahala in Dec 2011, and we return every year to celebrate our anniversary. The Kahala Resort holds a special place in our hearts, and every year on our return they treat us so well...like royalty!!! From the moment we arrive and pull up to the valet area, we are greeted by friendly staff that are eager to help us with our belongings. The front desk personnel are warm and welcoming...even the security staff greet you and smile at you!The Kahala is absolutely breathtaking. The lobby is absolutely stunning, and the views are simply magnificent from the lobby balcony, the rooms, and even on the shore! We’ve stayed in an ocean view room and the scenic view rooms, and both have spectacular views. We love both the ocean and mountain views we’ve had. I especially love the Kahala during Christmas, as it is so beautifully decorated. We love dining at the Plumeria Beach House for breakfast. The food is always so good. At night, since we have three kids, we opt to eat in the Veranda for some light pupus. Superb! You cannot go wrong with either places to eat. Next year, my husband wants to finally do a stay with just me and him. So maybe we’ll finally get to try the highly-touted Hoku’s and Arancino. I cannot wait!!!During two of our stays, we made an appointment with Pacific Dream Photography, located in the lower lobby, right at the bottom of their orchid staircase. I can’t tell you enough how happy I was the first time we took pictures with them in Dec 2015. The photographer we had then was so easy to work with. She took amazing shots of our family and even took some maternity shots of me. The photos turned out beyond my expectations!We just had our 2nd shoot with them, as we returned for our 7th anniversary. I wanted new photos for our family, and they are still as fantastic as I remembered them the first time...if not BETTER than the first time. Our photographer Maisie (or Macy...sorry...I’m not sure of the spelling) was so patient and so sweet. She really captured amazing photos of my family, and I have 3 young children. She kept right on shooting and really produced fantastic images!!!When the images were ready, I had to view and select the images I wanted to purchase. Jacob was so very patient with me, and there were so many amazing images from which to choose! He made the entire process so fun. I swear we both were laughing half the time. Jacob was really just awesome to work with, and I cannot day enough how I recommend Pacific Dream Photography. You won’t regret it!Staying at the Kahala is so relaxing! It’s far away from the hustle and bustle like other hotels in Waikiki but is still minutes from the city and malls. Kahala is just so calming and soothing...a private, luxurious resort that really captures the beauty of Hawaii!!!

Thank you Kahala ... what a vacation! We had such a wonderful epic time at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. We did it all, 10 nights, amazing breakfasts, swimming with dolphins, thanksgiving feast and an once and lifetime photo shoot with Pacific Dream Photography. We highly recommend the Kahala and hats off to all the staff and great service... Aloha service at it's best. We have stayed at many spots on all the islands Royal Hawaiian, Moana Surfrider, Four Seasons Big Island, Napili Kai... and this spot is just perfect. The right amount of 5 stars without being stuffy, fabulous service and overall fabulous experience. I also want to do hats off review for Pacific Dream Photography, we did a sunset photo shoot with Jacob and Macy and these two crushed it. It's hard enough to get photos with 2 year and 5 year grumpy crazy boys... and these two succeed with flying colors. We walked away with a series of photos and video that I know our family will treasure. Macy and Jacob worked all the tricks to get these kiddos (and husband) engaged and to smile for a full hour of epic shots! Thank you Pacific Dream Photography and Kahala Hotel. Mahalo the Glanders ~

This was a mixed bag for us. We planned a very special 5 night trip with our children and grandchildren for Thanksgiving. Seeing them is something that happens very rarely so it was a big deal for us. I will start with what works and get to what doesn’t.First off, the Hotel itself is very nice. I would recommend the location very highly. For any of you concerned it is too isolated, I would advise that getting to Waikiki or shopping or Diamond Head is very convenient. We did go down to Waikiki and I have to say it was crowded and dirty. There was trash on the beach which was really a small strip with wall to wall people. The small beach strip is lined with hotels and entertainment and very noisy and active and so far from Hawaii that I’m not sure I understand the appeal.We had ages 1, 3 and 7 years, 20’s, 30’s, 50’s and 60’s. My main concern was whether it would work for all of use. It absolutely did. The beach is gorgeous, CLEAN, well maintained and even booked to capacity, it never felt crowded. Gentle warm waves and plenty of lounge chairs and towels. Activities for everyone to do. Perhaps not the best snorkeling but that is available a short distance away.The pool was a surprise. I was worried about there only being the one, but plenty of chairs, never too full and great for both children and adults. They sell floats, rafts, balls, including small floatie for 1 year old at very reasonable price which was a pleasant surprise. I bought a great variety which made more fun for all the ages! We simply left it behind for others to enjoy. Prices for floaties, tubes and raft was from $4 to $11,I arranged for double umbrella stroller, car seats, pick up with concierge effortlessly before the trip. Our daughter requested double baby jogger for the early morning time change so she could run. For that, I went through a private service BabyQuip Quality Partner Ashlee Westmoreland (808) 868-5040. She was incredible. She actually delivered the jogger late in the day so our daughter would have it for the first morning. She is really a special person.Our four rooms were beautiful and nice size in the tower. We arranged for a suite for our daughter and son in law that have the 1 and 3 year old. The suites are definitely well appointed and perfect for families with small children. We had a regular king ocean view and loved it. Very updated and in great condition. Toto toilets (bidets) are in all categories of tower rooms – not sure about the other rooms. The other two rooms were same quality and consistency.Important note - I am a super light sleeper. I was a little concerned about the location of our room - beautiful view but by laundry and cleaning station. Once the door was shut - you can't hear a thing. No noise from above, below, sides or outside. I slept so well there.Views are very personal but I would definitely specify what you want. One of the room was a partial and it overlooked the parking lot. I think this is a communication responsibility. We checked in early so we were able to move our rooms with ease within the category. The front desk staff was super accommodating.Spa was out of this World. Super nice surprise. Excellent therapist – facials and massage. Wendy was my massage therapist. I can’t say enough about how wonderful she was – her warmth, professionalism and skill level was superb. I wanted deep tissue but desperately needed some relaxation and received it – I felt like I was in a trance when it was over.FOOD – Vertanda Afternoon Tea is amazing. A local friend suggested it and met us for Tea. My daughter and her friend joined. It was wonderful. We sat on the patio and had delicious delicate sandwiches, smoked salmon, chicken, cucumber. The pastries were ridiculously incredible. Tiny versions of the best of the best. We had a glass of champagne, enjoyed the overhand and breeze and could see the pool and the little ones having fun with their parents and grandpa!Hoku’s – food is on a different level. Impressive and well prepared. Absolutely no complaints. IT is expensive and the service is slow, but the servers are so pleasant, knowledgeable and attentive. We were impressed. Cons –Housekeeping is not an automatic. It is very well done and rooms are really cleaned well and lot of nice touches. My comment is when you leave for a few hours or down at the pool, just call housekeeping or let one of them know if they are outside the rooms that you would like your room done. We came back from long day to messy room the first day, but this was taken care of after we became proactive.Seaside Grill – super slow, super stressed and food is downright bad except for the fries. Really nice hostess and servers. They obviously don’t get the support they need. I don’t have enough information to know why the food is so bad.PLUMERIA RESTAURANT is really the weak link here. The food is so-so and the service is abysmal. Breakfast brunch isn’t great. It’s not thought out carefully. One day fish special and other vegetarian or poultry option, rest of time literally entire hot area was nothing but pork. Pork bun special and then down the line, two types of pork sausages, bacon, ham. A distrubtion would have been nice. Omelet station often had only one person and was over burdened with very long line. Most people would give up. When they had two people it was comparable to other luxury hotels – a wait but doable so you’re not eating alone if the rest of your party isn’t waiting with you. Stations get messy and run out of items often – really often.Ala carte orders during brunch – won’t get there until you are almost done – doesn’t work well with an already over taxed system. We had a meal with all the family and sole purpose of this trip was for us to spend together as a family. We were seated at 6PM and ended getting appetizers and then waited over an 1.5 hourswith no service whatsoever. No water refills, no drink replenishment and our dirty plates left stacked on the table. Every once in awhile, our server would breeze by and say our meal was coming out shortly. Needless to say, the children got very antsy and after 1.5 hours and several complaints, we ended up leaving. We had no choice. The 1 and 3 year old was done for the night and it was their bedtime. Explanation – there were several functions and the kitchen was over burdened. Why they didn’t close the restaurant is very odd and makes zero sense. In other words, it wasn’t there fault! There was a wedding reception and another party going on in the Hotel. Our observation was there was receptions almost daily and we received terrible service as a rule. Why is this okay? There are few things I dislike more than excuses when paying for service. This is an expensive venue, so ignoring our tables for 1.5 hours down to no water, no drinks, no clean up of messy appetizer dishes is up there with Plumeria being the worse dining experience we’ve head. We had to ask that the dinner would be delivered upstairs to the rooms. So, our last dinner together wasn’t together but stressful, messy, upsetting and everyone was in their respective rooms instead of enjoying time together. Our son and daughter were struggling with little children that needed to have baths and get to bed. Needless to say, dinner was cold and inedible. Management – dining manager was apologetic, hotel manager apologetic but that was about it. Horrible last experience. Really made us sad and so disappointed. It’ll be two years before we are together for the Holidays. Can’t really make that right. Didn't hear a word from the Resort - nothing!

We booked our package for Kahala through Costco and had breakfast and parking included. I think that if you are coming to Oahu that the Kahala is THE place to stay. You are removed from the craziness of Waikiki and have your own little private oasis. But you are just a short drive away from all the great restaurants in Honolulu and the activities (Arizona memorial, Bishop Museum, Iolani palace, etc). We did scuba diving at a nearby dive shop (Reef Pirates). We had an ocean view lanai room, which was nice but I would recommend trying to get on a higher floor. We were on the 3rd floor and got some noise from the lobby due to room location. We still slept like a pair of rocks though! The bathrooms have heated toilet seats which is pretty much the pinnacle of pampering. The beach is nice with warm, calm waters. You can get snacks and drinks right at the seaside grille. It is also amazing to have the dolphins right there. We did not buy any of the experiences, but you can still stand and watch them swim around and do their activities with the trainer. You are still way closer than you would get at an aquarium. We had an overall great time

The resort is easy to get to from the Hobalulu airport, 20 minutes by car. At the resort upon arrival greeted with beautiful flower garland with an easy check in. Check in is at 3pm and check out at 12 pm. The front desk is very efficient in processing your requests. Our room had beautiful ocean view. The rooms have same amenities but the configuration might be different. Our room was above average size with TV offering various channels, writing desk and a bed. The bath room had a tub, shower and his and her sinks and closets. Break was included. The buffet breakfast had oatmeal, omelette station, waffle, pancakes, potatoes, sausages , fruits etc. Delicious breakfast spread. At the resort there are 4 restaurants. They are all good but the Haoks is the best. Resort has its own private beach so not to worry about crowds. It is in so serene, quiet and has gorgeous views. There are dolphins on the property which are used for kids training.and education. It appears that the Resort is run very efficiently. Overall it is an excellent vacation spot.

My wife and I celebrated our wedding ceremony and reception at the Plumeria Grove and Waialae Ballroom, respectively. Anna Hinkley was our catering service manager. She was amazing for her efforts in supporting our special day prior, during and afterwards. Her attention to detail reassured us that every aspect would come out successfully. Although there were a few bumps in the road the recovery process to amend these issues were quick and efficient. Every staff member took excellent care of us. Thank you Anna and everyone else who was involved with our wedding day.

Peaceful, relaxing and pampering. I couldn't find better words to describe The Kahala Hotel & Resort. THE place to stay while on the Hawaiian island of O'ahu. Rooms are spacious with a stunning view of the Ocean and the dolphins lagoon and a huge double bathroom with both shower and bathtub.Several dining options are available inside the property as well as entertainment options like surf lessons, swimming with dolphins and relaxing at the pool or at the Kahala's splendid beach. A free shopping shuttle to Waikiki, Ala Moana Mall and Kahala Mall is available for all guests.Breakfast at Plumeria Beach House is delicious! A special mention to the staff, welcoming and gentle, definitely helps your stay to be at the top. We've been there to celebrate my birthday and they've been so kind and thoughtful to arrange a small birthday gift in the room with chocolate strawberries, a delicious cake and a bottle of sparkling wine. Our stay couldn't have been better than this, we only wish we've stayed more! For sure we will go back at The Kahala when returning to O'ahu in the future! Mahalo for the wonderful stay!

We've stayed here about 3 or 4 times now - and I've written a previous review. However, I really think they have even improved their service and value since our previous stays. This has got to be one of the best hotels on the island. Add to that the shuttle so you can make your Waikiki appearance and why would you stay anywhere else. We added a couples massage this time and will be doing that again in our future visits back to the Kahala.

I came to Honolulu for a large convention, but managed to spend 3 days of rest and relaxation at the Kahala beforehand. In past years I've gone to Kauai and the North Shore (Turtle Bay Resort) during convention visits, but this year decided not to rent a car and just chill closer to Waikiki. I've long known about the Kahala, but this was my first stay. Distance-wise, it's just a few miles east of Waikiki, but in terms of tranquility and solitude, it's light years away. The Kahala first opened in 1964 and was for many years a Hilton property. It was a Mandarin Oriental property for a shorter period, and is now Japanese owned. The hotel was designed by the Long Beach CA-based firm of Killingsworth, Brady and Smith, a highly regarded architectural firm known for their modernist mid-twentieth century structures. Edward Killingsworth is known for his post-and-beam construction, of which the Kahala is a shining iconic example. Nowhere on the property is the beauty of this type of design more noticeable than under the east tower where the hotel cantilevers over the open ground level space that houses the Dolphin Quest check-in area. The Killingsworth firm also designed Case Study House #25 in Long Beach CA. If you're interested, google the Case Study Houses-- they put mid-century residences in Los Angeles on the map, architecturally-speaking.The Kahala has a Walk of Fame nestled amidst its retail shops. Here photos and autographed notes from dignitaries and celebrities are found. Also, perhaps more importantly, are iconic black-and-white photographs taken by famed architectural photographer Julius Shulman in 1964. Shulman also famously photographed the Case Study Houses.The hotel's rooms are housed in the original 10-story main building and a 2-story triangular Dolphin wing. Half of the rooms/suites in the main tower have ocean views; the other rooms face inland (they're called "scenic" rooms). Every other room in the main tower has a lanai, the other rooms have a sliding door that fully opens, but no step-out lanai. The Dolphin wing rooms either face outwards towards the ocean or inland. Inward-facing rooms look onto the dolphin lagoons. I think all these rooms have lanais. The lobby is a soaring semi-open-air space that harkens back to the 1960's. There's a large lanai that looks over the pool. The Veranda restaurant is adjacent (afternoon tea, light meals, cocktails, evening music). The more formal Hoku's restaurant is a few step further. One level below is the Plumeria Beach House (buffet and a la carte breakfast, lunch and dinner) and the ballrooms. There's also a pool/beach cafe (Seaside Grill) and the Italian eatery Arancino. The area that connects the main tower with the Dolphin Wing houses the spa treatment rooms, which face a small semi-private relaxation patio. The fitness centre is adjacent to the Plumeria Beach House. There are unisex locker rooms, showers, hot tubs, saunas and steam rooms here. There is also a Hospitality Suite for guests to use before check-in or after check-out should the need arise. There's comfortable seating, some refreshments, even a shower.Check-in included a cool wet towel and a lei. My room was an Ocean View room in the west (Diamond Head) wing of the main tower which overlooked the lobby and motor court, with the ocean beyond. The Ocean Front rooms are in the east (Koko Head) wing of the main tower and overlook the pool with the ocean beyond. The room was pretty large and well-appointed. There was a ceiling fan, appropriately placed outlets, good (and quiet) A/C. The bathroom was split into 2 sides, each with a sink and closet, with a shower on one side and a tub on the other. In the middle was an enclosed Toto toilet--the Japanese kind with bidet features. There was an empty mini-fridge and coffee/tea machine, plus bottled water. Wifi was free. Note the Kahala does not have a resort fee! A true rarity these days. My time here was all about planning nothing and seeing where the day took me, if anywhere. Onsite, a main feature is Dolphin Quest experience, run by the same folks who do the experience at the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the Big Island. There are many packages to choose from, none of which are cheap. The pool is nice but small. There are ponds with fish and turtles, plus a Keiki pool and jacuzzi. There's a Keiki Club too. The beach here is pretty large and very calm both in and out of the water. The waves break far out in the distance. I think some beach chaises can be had for free. Others that are more cabana-like or have retractable awnings certainly have a fee. Some have an attached cooler. Chairside service is via a beeper. Worlds away from the chaos of Waikiki beach. Because the hotel is located in a residential area, doing activities off-site, including eating at non-hotel restaurants, requires transportation. The hotel has a great shuttle service that goes to the nearby Kahala Mall, Waikiki, the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, Bishop Museum and Iolani Palace. Although technically within walking distance, the roads to the Kahala Mall are heavily trafficked and do not have sidewalks. I took the shuttle there one afternoon and ended up having dinner at a decent ramen place. Had I known better, I would have made plans to eat at the Zippy's near the mall. I used Lyft for arrival and departure from the hotel. Taxis also always seemed to be waiting for fares. The Kaimuku area of Honolulu is nearby and has several eateries of note. I tried Koko Head Cafe for breakfast and used Lyft. I had 4 on-site dining experiences at the Kahala. I tried the famous Sunday Brunch at Hoku's (reviewed separately), the breakfast buffet at Plumeria's (reviewed separately), a pleasant lunch at the Seaside Grill and room-service club sandwich. Food quality ranged from very good to excellent. The atmosphere at Hoku's and Plumeria was a bit frenetic and thus service was not the most attentive. The Seaside Grill was also pretty busy but the waitress was quite good. Overall an excellent and relaxing stay in a classic, iconic hotel. My only regret was not eating at Zippy's.

We got married at the Kahala (and stayed two nights). The venue is gorgeous, we wanted somewhere close to Waikiki but didn’t want public traffic on the beach during our ceremony and Kahala is the best for this. All our guests loved the food, especially the crab cake & tiramisu. The different photo spots onsite is amazing, the lobby photo scene is stunning. Finally, Anna and her team is superb (very responsive + accomodating) and their vendor partners are amazing. Btw - Hoku’s brunch is the best brunch place I’ve ever been to - must go.

The property and amenities are AMAZING, but it’s the service that make The Kahala the ONLY staycation spot for us! Yes, we’re local. So we know what we’re talking about.If you’re looking for “paradise” - quiet, remote beach, exquisite, on-property dining - The Kahala is the place for you!

The staff and service was excellent. Gary our driver was so cool, and the retail shop manager Monjiwas great!! Love the room and the view, breakfast filled us for the day, can I buy room 1024?Thank you for the love and new friendships that we have created with the Kahala team, we will be back!!

the hotel is in a very quiet residential area 10 minutes from Waikiki. it is a beautiful, tranquil setting, next to a golf course with great oceanfront rooms and restaurants. Plus gorgeous dolphins to watch in shows and at play.

We came to the Kahala for our 20th wedding anniversary, and were thrilled with everything this hotel had to offer. It is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu and Waikiki, while still being a short shuttle away. This is vintage Hawaii. The resort is impeccable maintained. We had an oceanfront king Room with complimentary breakfast. The rooms are very large and roomy and the breakfast buffet never disappointed, we ate there every morning for 4 days and didn’t feel the need to eat again until the evening. Plumeria restaurant is open concept, breezy and beautiful. We enjoyed breakfast while watching children play, yoga class and the beautiful ocean. Dolphin encounter, fish ponds, gym area, evening entertainment, beautiful gardens (I could go on and on.) definitely look this one up- this resort pays attention to every detail.

Ended up here at the last minute as I didn't want to deal with the strike at the Royal Hawaiian. Location is not ideal if you want to be able to walk anywhere bit it is a quiet setting if you just want to unwind. Facilities are a bit dated but service and atmosphere were great.  Room was large and comfortable. Would definitely recommend if you dont want to be in the middle of Waikiki. Also, not having a resort fee is great, everyone should just build it into the price like the Kahala does. Hospitality lounge was great for a quick shower before heading to the aiport on my check out day.

We just came back from the Kahala. I think it is the best hotel on Oahu. Terrific service. Just the right size. A great beach. What more could you want? We love every single thing about this hotel. If you have an issue, go to the concierge and they will fix it.
user_name:
Daniel K
Phoenix, Arizona, United States

review_body: We just returned from an 8 days stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. We have stayed at this elegant 5 star hotel several times as we enjoy the peace and quiet away from Waikiki. The location of the hotel, the beautiful sandy beach, the calm ocean and comfortable beautifully decorated rooms are just a few to mention. All of the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.The hotel has four different restaurants with variety of local and international cuisine to meet all budgets.

The moment you step out of your car, you'll feel welcomed and well taken care of atThe Kahala Resort.The staff's warmth and professionalism resonates throughout the entire hotel, from the valets, to the front desk, to the pool attendants and restaurants.

My expectations were high and gratefully met. If you are able to reserve an oceanfront room with a balcony, do not hesitate. You will have incredible sunrises and sunset views, not to mention, glorious views of the ocean. Our room was very spacious, the housekeeping staff was very professional and accommodating. All staff went out of their way to ensure that we had a wonderful experience. There are also property perks, dolphins, turtles, waterfalls and plenty of room to sit by the pool or on the beach. We hope to return sometime in the near future.

Had a wonderful stay in October 2018. Hotel was comfortable, staff friendly, food good. Food and drink were expensive. Room comfort and clean. Is outside of the normal tourist area but easy to get to with an Uber or the free bus. Had an amazing spa treatment although not cheap.

This place is just absoslutely incredible. Stayed here with my brither for 3 nights. The front office staff is genuinely really nice. Warm, welcome and accommodating. We asked for a complimentary late check out and got it. Absolutely gorgeous looking resort! One of the best resorts I have stayed around the world. Brilliant food, rooms and beach! Waking up to the beach view was beautiful. Will definitely go back whenever I visit Honolulu and recommend for others as well. Aloha!

I can't say enough good things about The Kahala. Our large group was moved here last minute when our original hotel was apart of the Marriott strike. The Kahala scrambled and put together some amazing events, a Luau and a poolside dinner. Our room was huge and clean. The ocean view was awesome and we could look down and see the dolphins swimming in their lagoon. The turndown service each night was a nice touch with chocolates and flowers placed on the bed. Everyone from front desk, to restaurants, to pool workers were over the top friendly and helpful. Beaches in Hawaii are public even if they back up to a hotel, but the Kahala beach was never busy as it is in a quiet neighborhood. Definitely a plus compared to the hotels in Waikiki. We are already dreaming of a return trip!

This resort has everything other hotels no longer have.Its location is great. It is sufficiently far from the hubbub of the ever growing and crowded waikiki that is beautiful private beach offers relaxing tranquility. At the same time, it is only a few minutes drive from the heart of Waikiki so one can still enjoy the metropolitan city with its many attractions.Its rooms are spacious and comfy with excellent room service. The only other place in recent past, where we had a true turn-down service every night was the Savoy in the UK. The pool is small, but the hotel is small as well, so unlike places like Aulani where you have rush at 6 AM to reserve your chair, here, you can casually walk to the pool by 8 or 9 and probably even later and still get yourself a chair with great poolside service.Most importantly and unlike many other hotels, we made a complaint to the poolside manager re the functions that had been booked after 2PM at pool side which limited some of our pool time. The team was very gracious and kind in making arrangements for our party of 9 to have dinner at the Arancino Italian restaurant, which was a culinary experience in itself. Last year, when one of the valets at the Waldorf in Maui nearly ran over my son, the manager did not even apologize let alone make a gesture.Jenny Groudine the poolside manager had also left a box of chocolates in our room, which for a day I thought it was something my wife had bought. I can go on and on about this hotel, but I think it'll all be captured in the fact that, after 6 or 7 trips to Hawaii, I think we have finally found OUR hotel. The place where we will return every time and look forward to it impatiently from year to year.Thanks Kahala!

Our company had a conference scheduled at the Royal Hawaiian. Due to the strike by workers, our whole event was moved to The Kahala Hotel & Resort. The service, food, hotel room with ocean view was 5 star. Everyone in this hotel went out of their way to make you feel welcome. Gorgeous hotel and private beach. They have a lagoon with dolphins and several large turtles.

Just completed a five night stay at Kahala and all of the reviews are spot on - this place really is paradise and it absolutely exceeded my expectations. One disappointing factor which caused some annoyance the day prior to our departure was that management made the decision to close the only pool from 2pm for a private function. Yes, the ocean is right there but given you are paying top dollar to stay at this resort, not having access to the pool for half a day is very disappointing. We were only advised of this via a letter delivered to our room the evening prior. I would suggest they would have known about this when we checked in four days prior and I wish we had been advised then - we could have planned around this. Given the resort only has one pool I felt the decision to do to close this to guests for half the day, for a private party, to be unbelievable. However, overall this did not spoil my stay and I would highly recommend staying here. We came after spending time in NYC and it was the ideal place to recover and get some r&r.

The staff at the Kahala treat you like kings and queens. The view is spectacular, the ocean water is warm, and the food at Hoku's and Arancino is first class. We stayed in room 1013. The top floor corner suite above the dolphin quest. IT DOESN'T GET ANY BETTER THAN THIS!!!

Stayed two nights at dolphin lanai suite, so we could see dolphins from our terrace. Room condition was very clean and overall facility was still in excellent shape, considering it's been there for quite long. Private beach is just wonderful, so I recommend spending at least there(and reserve cabana if possible).

We wanted to come back to Oahu for a relaxing vacation. Did not need to do a lot of sightseeing. For this type of vacation, the Kahala was perfect. All the staff feels very welcoming. Always found chaise by the pool and when we would swim in the ocean doubt there were more than 12 people in the water. Nothing like getting in the ocean at Waikiki. The room was extremely comfortable. We had a balcony facing the mountain and golf course on the 6th floor. Large balcony perfect with a cup of coffee in the AM. We reserved shuttle several days to get into town and it was always convenient for us as we did not rent a car this trip. We loved sitting on the veranda watching the dolphins. The staff at Dolphin Quest were always very happy to answer all questions we had about the care, etc. of the dolphins and turtles.

History. Heritage. Private Beachfront Retreat. These are the words that embody the Kahala Hotel and Resort.One of the oldest landmark hotels in Oahu, the Kahala is ‘the’ place to stay if you wish to be away from the traffic and tourist traps that are Waikiki.20-25 minutes UBER (Uber or Lyft are allowed at HNL airport) or Taxi from the Airport, the Kahala is located right on the beach, adjacent to the Waimea private golf clubs and residences. And here is where one finds “Hawaii”. The noise of the ocean right on your balcony. Palm Trees. Quality restaurants. It is 15 minutes to Waikiki although the complementary shuttle takes 25 minutes.A complementary shuttle requires advanced reservation (preferably a day or two before - so plan ahead or call concierge in advance of arrival). Nearby is the Kahala Mall 1.1 miles away with a large whole food supermarket and light shopping. The next stop on the shuttle is Ala Moana which needs no introduction as the largest and busiest open air mall in the US. Following this, luxury row adjacent to the Ritz Carlton Residences near Waikiki main and then onto the stop next to DFS Galleria.The Kahala is owned by a Japanese consortium and is reflected by both staff, service and clientele. Rooms are dated, in keeping with the age of the hotel yet still clean and well appointed. We recommend being on the beachfront category which offers gorgeous views and the beach being a minute’s walk away. King sized bed was comfortable as were the feather pillows. Simple bath and shower. Brewed coffee, mini-fridge and the usual hotel room amenities. Power points are readily available. The beachfront rooms have a small “lanai” or balcony seating two chairs and a small table. The white sand beach calm, warm with the opportunity for paddle boarding although quality snorkeling is best found elsewhere.Being a busy, spread out hotel - room service, housekeeping and turndown can often be ‘late’ although a quick phone call rectifies things quickly. Breakfast at Plumeria is fine, with mostly continental and American breakfast buffet fare. If you book via various loyalty programs (e.g. Leading Hotels of the World, American Express FHR, Virtuoso) then it is complementary. Be aware there is a 5-10 minute wait time during peak hours after 8am. Hoku, it’s signature restaurant offers fresh Hawaiian seafood and although not quite “Michelin” quality was some of the freshest seafood we have had the pleasure of trying on three islands in Hawaii.Within the resort is the partner Dolphin Quest. Controversial for dolphins in captivity, many tourists were iPhone snapping away at the dolphins constantly during the day. They are literally swimming right there in the middle of the hotel. As is one green turtle and fish in the lagoon. Would we recommend the Kahala? Yes. It’s not Kapalua Bay on Maui but it’s probably one of the closest thing to a resort that one can find in the ‘miniature L.A” and hustle bustle that is Oahu.8/10

Want a quiet oasis away from Waikiki? This is your place. I hate the hustle and bustle in Waikiki. You could stay here for a couple of days and not even have to leave the resort.Dolphin Quest-we’ve done the dolphin experience a few times over the years, highly recommend if you’re into this kind of thing. Wednesday curry buffet (Thai, Indian, Japanese style) lunch is a great deal, highly recommend this as well! High Tea on the Veranda - so fancy and so fun. Great with girlfriends or just because. Kinda pricey for tea but take lots of pics (yolo!) and only do it once.Plumeria Beach Cafe - great brunch on weekend, awesome selection for other meals, the French fries are INSANELY good. SPA - oh man. This is lovely too.POOL - small pool for the size of the resort. Kiddie pool. POOL GRILL - surprisingly very good food here too. BEACH - way better than Waikiki.WEDDINGS - I’ve attended lots of weddings here, including my own many years ago. The room fits 220-250 comfortably and I’ve seen more squeezed into the ballroom, with overflow into the foyer.Why are you still reading this? Go book your reservation.

This hotel is beautiful, a true hawaii luxury experience. It's located away from the busy tourist areas. This is where dolphin quest is located. I recommend you have breakfast at the Pulmeria beach house. Great food with excellent views of the private beach.

My wife and I chose the Kahala Resort as the destination for our wedding anniversary and we couldn't have chosen a better place. Upon arrival we were greeted by Carlos and his team and our room was ready for an early check-in. Shortly after we arrived at our beautiful room (view to the golf course and partial ocean-view), we were surprised by the room service who brought us a bottle of complementary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a personal note by Carlos, congratulating us on our anniversary. He and his whole team made the trip a wonderful and unforgettable experience. We will definitely come back, soon! Thank you, Carlos and the whole team.

A 5 star hotel that deserves its stars. The service was perfect everywhere :room service, concierge, fitness, the restaurants , reception and pool. People were very friendly and helpful . The breakfast buffet is exceptional in its variety , quality and presentation. The best breakfast of the hotel we visit in Hawaii, The only thing that could be improved are the umbrellas at the pools.

Definitely deserves its five stars, from the moment you step into the reception you know it’s special. Staff are extremely helpful, nothing is too much trouble. Suite overlooking the dolphin lagoon was large, comfortable, and peaceful. Food very good. Free Shuttle bus into Waikiki etc great for those without transport.

Chefs Eric and Alan prepare a wonderful menu. Delicious artistry of food representing beautiful Hawaii from the mauntain (Mauka) to the ocean (Makai). It's presentation is just the beginning ... then follows nothing but a medley of the natural ingredients bursting with flavor, Veal, oxtail with freshly made pasta, freshly caught Moi, oxtail with fresh pasta to Veal. Waiters Tony and Ken were so attentive and brought us everything our appetites desired! Thank you Manager Eric and all the kitchen staff, it was truly a wonderful evening! We'll be back next month to try out the new menu - Cant Wait!

Kahala was one of the great Hawaiian hotels and the wall of famous photos proves just that. It is showing its age but service is friendly but slow. Our attempt to get a certain type of beer from the bar next door fell on deaf ears. Still it offer six dolphins which seem rather dated as they have never known the ocean in 25 years.

This was an absolutely fantastic hotel! We stayed for a week in the Dolphin Lanai room. I absolutely loved it! The grounds were very well kept, housekeeping came to your room twice a day, there are three restaurants on site and one where you can have what you might consider high tea. We had no problem with service, our concierge I believe her name was Joy she was an absolute marvel as we were there during hurricane Lane. The food was delicious at the Plumeria and simply amazing at Hoku’s! There were different activities that you could take pardon, like the spa, of course the pool and the beach, dolphin quest in the photo sessions. The photo sessions I was very Interested in but the packages start at $400. I really believe that they could get more people to buy if the package was lower. There was also some surfboard lessons that you could take, and also a workout room as well. This particular resort was not in the middle of tourism so you got a lot of the beach and the privacy and you’re not too far from Wakiki to be able to get to the tourism. It was very close to Diamondhead, and the Ala Mona Mall which is amazing if you are a shopper. We had an excellent time and I am so glad we went to this resort I can’t praise it enough for how beautiful it was, how great the service was it was just excellent all the way around we will definitely visit again should we come back to Hawaii!!!

What a wonderful greeting we were given upon arrival!! We were a little undecided about which room configuration to take and both Linda and Ryo took the time to go though all options at great length. This included walking us around the resort and viewing different rooms whilst being extremely kind and friendly to our very exhausted children. They were patient and accomodating, and got our holiday started on the right foot. Thank you Ryo and Linda. We are very impressed with the hotel and views of the ocean. Highly recommended. Dolphin swim is booked for Friday and the kids can’t wait.
Great room with sea view very large and confortableLuxurious hotel well maintainedGood breakfast pity they serve a cheap and bad orange juiceExcellent sea restaurant nearly on thebeachFriendly staff

Close enough to Honolulu, but far enough from all the "tourism". In my opinion, the onsite restaurants used to be better a few years ago, but are a good alternative from going into town for a nice meal. The private beach is one of its best assets. Service is second to none.

This hotel has it all - even apart from swimming with the dolphins. It is the most beautiful place we have stayed - facilities ,beautiful rooms , lovely staff , food etc. the beach was great as are the pools with staff very attentive & so peaceful & calm . A gem of a hotel to stay in

I surprised my wife with an impromptu staycation for our 24th anniversary. And while we go to this hotel every now and then, this time seemed even more special. Here are some highlights: The view; impeccable. The food; awesome. The service; ON POINT!!! The property; peaceful and rejuvenating. We had such an awesome time. The service, from the bell desk, valet, front desk, servers, housekeeping, I mean they are simply amazing. They made our stay so very special. A special shout out to Ken Morishige for taking care of my brand new truck at valet. Shannon Ladd for being amazing at checking in on us to assure all was going well. And the countless servers at the veranda and poolside who went out of their way to make sure we had all that we need. Oh, and I would be remiss if I didn't mention the Pool Attendant young man who went above and beyond to set up a special area for us to lounge at (I forget his name). The bottom line is that we had an awesome time. And eagerly look forward to going back.

Celebrated our 24 wedding anniversary here. It was beautiful. The staff and the rooms were nice.The Sunday brunch buffet was ok, was not overly impressed.We wanted to have dinner at the Italian restaurant but needed a reservation so we were turned away. Apparently the restaurant is not part of the hotel as I figured out by the way we were treated. Also they get busy so you need to book in advance.It may be a good idea for the hotel to let people know so they don’t get disappointed since it is a drive from everything.We ended up eating in the lobby area where there was entertainment. It was pretty nice and relaxing actually.

From the moment we arrived the service was fantastic. We only had one person at the front desk that did not get something done she promised she would make sure was taken care of. We should have called back later to check and see if it was done but we were out all day and didn't get back with the hotel to see if things were taken care of. The rest of the staff was Fabulous. The food at the Plumeria was so good. Ended up eating almost all of our meals there. Loved the privacy of the beach compared to other beaches on Oahu. And the relaxing atmosphere. Watching the dolphins and turtles just add to the relaxation. Everything was very clean and comfortable. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

The Kahala is rated as one of the best hotels in Honolulu. Tour drivers raved about it so either I have been spoiled in the past by staying at Double Island, Pullman Darling Harbour, Sofitel Barcelona and Shandrani in Mauritius to name a few 5 star hotels or the opinions of most guests are riding on the fact that many celebrities have stayed here in the past and it’s location. We arrived very tired after a long flight from Perth in Western Australia Around 1.00pm and were advised that our room would not be ready until 3.00pm. When we did check in it was a very ordinary experience and as they were upgrading their computer system it was explained that everything would have to be paid as we go eg dinners, drinks purchases etc could not be charged to the room. I chose a package which included Breakfast and the food was at best 3 Star, it normally costs $38 USD per person so was very disappointing. Dinner was okay but nothing to rave about. If you want access to a mini bar there is a charge to stock otherwise the fridge is empty. The dolphins in the resort are kept in a small pool and are touched by humans constantly. I believe they are a money making attraction with no consideration for their welfare and would like to see them released back into the ocean. Room service was good even though we only had pizza it was tasty. The staff were polite but not friendly and some hospitality employees, especially on the verandah, took a while to serve drinks and had to be summoned after waiting 15 minutes on more than one occasion. On a positive note the rooms were spacious and well appointed with beautiful views and the hotel itself was elegant. No matter where we go we aim to make it a good experience but I felt like I should have shopped around more before deciding on this hotel. Trip Advisor had mostly excellent reviews however this honestly wasn’t my experience and I definitely would not put it in the value for money category. It may be a 5 Star property but the service is definitely not.

Having grown up on Oahu, I had never been to the Kahala Hotel, but this gem provided me with one of the best hotel stays I have ever had. The hotel is a short 15 minute drive from Waikiki Beach, and the location is simple to find, yet hidden from the hustle of Waikiki. The beachfront property has a dolphin lagoon, with 6 dolphins swimming right next to the walkways. If you book one of the Dolphin Lanais, you can sit on your balcony and watch them play, or leave your balcony open and hear them all night! Magical! The cove that surrounds the beach permits the waves to be much gentler than outside of the cove, and sets up an ideal swim area for not only children, but anyone in general! Every single member of the staff that I encountered, from valet and check-in, to the cabana attendants; from housekeeping, to every food service worker, including the three restaurant outlets I visited and room service were extremely courteous, professional, and overall, WELCOMING! Although everyone was spectacular, I was not able to get everyone's name that deserve extra special kudos-I would, however, like to point out how amazing Mariah and Sean at Seaside Grill were. Mariah spent an extra few seconds to tell me how pretty my hair looked and made sure that my daughter especially enjoyed her chocolate shake. When I ordered a light and refreshing Acai Bowl for lunch, Sean was able to relate so accurately by my meal choice that he knew I had the same for breakfast! Deedee from the Concierge desk swung by my cabana while I was out on the beach, and knew exactly who I was, and offered to assist with any concierge services, including dinner reservations, dolphin encounter, shuttle service, and shopping information-this is an amazing service that reminds your guests of plans that they might have overlooked, or put off (such as ensuring you have some where to eat tonight!). Mary Jane in Hoku's was SUPERB! Not only was she extremely attentive to myself and my adult dinner companion, but she was able to incorporate my 10-year old daughter into the meal as well. Too many times have I seen children (my own included) spoken to, especially in restaurants that are on the fancier side of the spectrum. Mary Jane, though, made my daughter feel welcomed, explained the menu to her, and gave fantastic recommendations. When asked about a specific ingredient on the dessert menu, she gave a a description that was so detailed, and yet, so enticing, that it sold my daughter on THAT dessert over any other! Such a great hotel, with an amazing staff!

My family and I hadn't been back to Oahu for many years and took the advice of a friend to try the Kahala. My dad grew upon Oahu so we discussed at length where we should stay. We were a bit conflicted about the dolphins in the lagoon but wanted to stay somewhere quiet on the south side of the island. The hotel itself is a little dated but is set in a jewel of a neighborhood with a nice sandy beach where my kids played and jumped off the floating barge every day.Upon arrival, we were presented with orchid leis and my kids enjoyed the dolphin cookies that were brought to our room as we waited for our luggage. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was the spaciousness of the rooms as compared with other hotels. Our bathroom was outfitted with a Toto washlet bidet seat, separate shower and bathtub, and two sinks. My parents were also staying in a separate room so the hotel placed us on the same floor, which was thoughtful and convenient.On the first day, we ate at the Seaside Grill which seemed a bit pricey for what we received. However, we also dined at the Plumeria Beach House for a breakfast and dinner and really appreciated both the food and watching the sun set as we dined on the lanai. We wanted to try out Arancino because a friend thought it was the best Italian she had eaten in sometime but weren't able to due to lack of planning on our part.The concierges were excellent. Leimomi was a lifesaver and arranged a dinner reservation for 12 people at the last minute! Dee Dee steered us to Gone Surfing for a surfing lesson for my 9 year old that helped him have an fantastic first time experience. Dean and Cameron arranged our time on the Holokino (based at the Kahala), as well as excursions to Bishop Museum and a docent-led tour of Iolani Palace (which we had always wanted to do).My husband and I went to the gym on an off-time and were helped by a friendly and helpful gentleman as we tried out various equipment. When we decided to hike Diamond Head one morning, the valet handed us bottles of water and some towels as we got into our vehicle, which came in handy. All of the valets and housekeeping staff whom we encountered were friendly and professional.The only hiccup that we had during our stay was a bad odor in our room. We first complained about it but then thought that it was in our imagination. I bought a fragrant candle to deal with it but then said that we really should have moved as it wasn't going away. Housekeeping said that they had shampooed the carpet before our stay so something had happened in our room. They tried an ozone machine and a second shampoo before offering to move us to a different room. By that time, we only had a day or so left so we didn't think it was worth it. The hotel comp'ed our parking and gave us a dessert tray to make amends. Even afterward, I received a call (because I had been open to receiving a call) and was told that I should call back directly to make reservations and that they would take care of us. My parents' room didn't have any problems, and they were truly happy that we stayed at the Kahala versus somewhere in Waikiki. Since this was probably the last time that my parents would return to Hawaii, I was happy that they were happy and thought that everyone who worked at the Kahala truly has the aloha spirit. Mahalo!
user_name:
Stacey N
Palos Verdes Estates, California

review_body: From the time we arrived we knew this place was special. Our room was large 500sqf + well appointed . We decided on a room with a Lanai and is well worth the $$.Magnificent views of the mountains and partial ocean view which made our evenings quite enjoyable . The accessibility to the beach makes a whole world of difference quite and almost private ( beaches in Hawaii are public ) . Although we did not do the dolphin experience they where so nice to look at. The buffet breakfast was great , our travel agent suggested getting the room rate with breakfast he even included a 100.00 credit that made it even better. They have a shuttle that takes you to Waikiki which is nice . Looking forward to visiting next year.

Kahala is magical!❤️The beauty of Kahala lies in the location. You are about a 20 minute cab ride to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki for a fun day of shopping or you can relax poolside or on the beach tucked away at Kahala. The service at Kahala is incredible from the minute you arrive to the minute you have to leave. Our experiences at Kahala never disappoint... always excited to go back.

The Kahala Hotel and Resort is an old school smaller one. It is very peaceful, the staff work hard to remember your name, and are extremely kind and helpful. The food is all around very good, bedrooms are spacious, the beach front is beautiful, and it has most things you could want as a nice base on Oahu. From our visit, the people visiting include couples, families, and a good smattering of Asian weddings (or at least beautiful photo shoots). This is not a late night party / dj / people rocking out until all hours kind of hotel. It is also not a place to come and be overly budget conscious. That being said, it is a lovely splurge. If you go, be sure to walk down the hall of photos on the first floor and do try the Sunday brunch. It is sort of an event, so make your reservation early to get the best time for you. The salmon eggs Benedict is a religious experience. Note, this is not a brand new hotel or resort, it is more along the lines of not too shabby chic.

Just stayed at Kahala and we are looking forward to coming back. Gorgeous place, super kind, friendly staff, a serene private beach (not really private but it feels like it), great drinks...A few suggestions: the breakfast buffet could use more variety or daily changes, the pool bar and beach service need to stay open past 5:30/6pm, it would be great if the beach was lit at night.Calling out a few names for the amazing service: Kal and Gary at the valet, Sharon at the breakfast service and Jesse at the beach service. We will definitely come back!

My family stayed at the hotel for April vacation and got royal treatment all the way. The list of celebrities, politicians and athletes on their wall of fame goes from the Obamas to Snoop Dog.For one, they have a world class golf course attached to the hotel, and it has a private beach with the most amazing sunrises. It is a little further removed from the downtown Honolulu madness, but we enjoyed the peacefulness and great food. The kids definitely enjoyed the dolphin pond. They have about 4 dolphins, and kids can suit up and go play with them at feeding time with the purchase of pass. The trainers seemed all friendly.We thought about staying st one of the hotels at downtown Honolulu, but we didn’t want to deal with the crowd at Waikiki beach. It’s a little pricey, but totally worth it. There are daily free shuttle into town for guest who want to go shopping, dune out or just see downtown Honolulu. We too the shuttle several times to the zoo, aquarium, and to dine out a few times.

Firstly after such a terrible check in experience last year, this year thanks to Ellen in reservations everything was exceptional!We have stayed here several times, so obviously we love it. That said every year there are two notable things;1) Prices just keep going up and not in line with other places or expectations and more so whilst nothing changes.2) They don't value feedback as ghe breakfast buffet is still 3 star.No doubt the reply will be the feedback will be passss on..... Don't bother please as what's the point?The only other issue was at the pool.My 5yr old was getting the free water and he went back multiple times (5) as there were 4 of us and being 5yrs old he got one cup at a time. The guy told him that was enough and no more water! That is beyond ridiculous!The pool is small and on a busy day you can't get a seat.On a quiet day it is paradise.The beach is stunning and basically private.No point snorkelling here.They have update the pool food menu and it's all very good.Pool service is hit and miss however the servers are very friendly.The housekeeping staff are brilliant and in particular the turn down.Rooms are fantastic as are most of the facilities. It's always great to have the option to swim with the dolphins whilst staying here.All in all, still great, however the price and lack of improvements (after feedback is always passss on!) we may just stick with the Halekulani in coming years.

I've been coming to the Kahala since the mid-1980s when I was a kid, and began returning regularly five or six years ago with my own family. I'm not sure what changes they have made since our last visit in 2014 in terms of management, but we noticed an improvement over our last visit - which is saying a lot, because our last visit was fantastic!The staff, especially the food and beverage manager Joy, and the bartenders Anji and Greg were particularly attentive and friendly. After meeting my husband and I, Joy made a point to come and say hello throughout our stay and remembered our names, which is greatly appreciated and adds that extra touch of warmth and Aloha that we love about the Kahala. Yes, the pool is small, however, it's no secret from the pics, so it should not come as a surprise to any visitor. The beach is wonderful, with a great breakwater / reef to keep it nice and calm, so I prefer the ocean for swimming and relaxing anyhow. I mean, I can go to a water park anywhere - I come to Hawaii for the gorgeous ocean water and the Kahala's beach is uncrowded and calm. The pool chairs do fill up, but we never had an issue all week with finding chairs with an umbrella. The only "issue", if you can even call it that, with the pool area is that they have done away with the wristband system for getting towels and chairs. I understand that it is a bit of extra work for the pool staff, however, we did notice for the first time people who clearly were not guests using the pool. There were several days when we were at the pool and beach all day, and did notice people coming up from the beach and making their way furtively to the pool, and then avoiding the pool servers and paying their food/beverage tabs in cash.
