An improvement was noted in the quality and quantity of the food served at the pool - even the keiki portions were quite large. All in all, the Kahala remains our home away from home in the islands. We love the location away from Waikiki, but close enough to shuttle in or drive if you choose. I cannot wait to return!

First of all the location is spectacular close enough to Downtown and the action there yet in a peaceful section that you come to Hawaii for. Great view, pool, and beach. The service was 5 star even through all the hurricane warnings and closings. The staff was great and catered to our every need. The restaurants on the property gives you a wide selection of excellent dining. This is a five star experience from property to service anyone not having a great time probably would have complaints in heaven. We will be back.

A couple of friends and I check into the Kahala as an escape from the impending disaster news broadcasters were predicting. Thank goodness we were fine on Oahu and our little “staycation” was well worth it. Plumeria bar: excellent. Bathrooms: huge. Bath robes: honestly the best I’ve ever used at an hotel.

The hotel is outdated and the staff need more training to warrant five stars. At its price point, it should be a lot more luxurious. The rooms are nicely decorated but old fashioned like the rest of the hotel. The pool is very small and it was very crowded, it is a stretch to call this place a resort. The beach chairs are old and stained, and umbrellas are not available. A cabana needs to be rented for shade. The breakfast area is tired. All in all, a disappointing experience.

I have been staying at the Kahala Resort for over 35 years. I love the location of the hotel as it's quiet and away from the crowds on Waikiki Beach, yet only a few minutes away by car. Although the pool and hot tub area can be crowded, the excellent staff and service, accommodations, restaurants, private beach, and dolphin lagoon more than make up for it. Additionally, the bedding, pillows and towels are marvelous.

We stayed here on our honeymoon. It was a great stay! We had a room right next to the dolphin lagoon which was awesome. You could look out the window and see them swimming. Our room was very big with a 2 sink bathroom. We lounged on the beach often which was great. We spent a little time at the pool, we preferred the beach. We went for the spa for a couples massage which was great. The restaurant was fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel!

What a gem!! This is a great hotel if you're looking to get away from all the tourists. Its is a secluded beach and pool area. Staff was amazing and restaurants are great. The Dolphin cove was amazing. Best dolphin experience we have done. And the rooms are so comfy!!

We had previously stayed at the Disney Resort but wanted to try something different. Kahala was luxury at it's best. The dolphins were amazing, food was superb and the entire family had a blast. Cannot wait to go back!

I would definetly recommnd this hotel. The beach is almost private because of the area it is in, and that is the biggest advantage in my opinion. It is quiet and safe. If you want to go to waikiki the hotel provides a shuttle that leaves about every hour. It is a beautiful hotel with great helpful staff.

Our experience with this hotel was so amazing. Surely we will go back on our next family vacation. Everything was just great about this hotel, services, people, amenities, location and etc. Come and have the greatest experience in your life in this Hotel!

Beautiful resort! Staff is amazing. Food is very good. Its like being in old school Hawaii before everything got so built up. Its location is great if you want to leave the resort to explore the island. Only thing I think they should do is do a little updating to some of the rooms. Still I would go back!!!!

We loved every minute of our stay in this hotel whose reputation is well known. Excellent service, comfortable room and wonderful restaurant added to our enjoyment and much needed r&r. The lagoon with the beautiful dolphins soothed our soul and rested our spirit - their frolicking and performance brought smiles and delight to us as well as admiration for these smart and sweet mammals. The beach is very nice with calm waters for swimming and morning strolls. One down side: May is a month when clusters of jellyfish are in the water and that spoiled some of our swimming fun but it was not a big problem since this problem is transitory.The hotel itself saw a more exclusive and privileged era in the past and many photos of dignitaries and celebrities who visited it adorn the walls of this hotel. It is still a lovely place and location but some of the magic of its bygone prime is missing and replaced by sometimes noisy and plebeian tourists encroaching its halls and grounds.That is the reality of the tourism business - exclusivity is harder to find and costly to enjoy, even though it was by no means cheap to stay here as it is never cheap to vacation in Hawaii. Bottom line - we recommend the Kahala!

The entire staff of Kahala Hotel and Resort were extremely hospitable and made our stay very enjoyable. LInda from the back office made our stay extra special and memorable, her kind heart and beautiful smile and caring spirit really added a sweet touch.

Overall, we had a really nice time. Our room was spacious and clean. Nice bed sheets. Friendly staff. The only issue is that restaurants, city shuttle and pool area are all so overcrowded. It felt as if the resort could barely cope with the number of people it was hosting. Even having made reservations every single time we went out for breakfast and dinner, we always had to wait 10-15 minutes for our table. Plumeria was particularly crowded for breakfast, with lines forming to reception and food areas inside being surrounded, which it didn't make a very relaxing experience. Same can be said for the pool area (the beach area less so, but it's still pretty small) - SO MANY PEOPLE for such a small pool and so few chairs! The resort could benefit from expanding on its pool and restaurant offerings to accommodate for its huge numbers of guests. TV in the room didn't have Netflix access which we came to expect in hotels nowadays. The spa for us was one highlight (we had a couple's romantic package which was a treat, albeit a pricey one, but so worth it. The ladies at the spa are AMAZING. This is in our top two couple's spa treatments ever, sharing the first spot with Polynesian Spa in Rotorua New Zealand!). Hoku was another highlight: chef's menu was spectacular. I would definitely recommend this resort.

I had a fantastic stay! I loved the luxurious setting, the wall of fame and seeing photos of famous people standing in the same spots I was standing, the prettiest private beach, the little island, the two separate bathroom areas, the storage space, the huge, clean, elegant room, the chocolates for the turn down service, the spacious and beautiful common areas, and the branded carpet and cups

My husband and I stayed at the Kahala for 2 weeks for our honeymoon and were absolutely blown away. The staff, accommodations, and amenities were nothing short of amazing. We especially loved watching the dolphins in the lagoon from our hotel room. The room we had was very clean and supplied everything you could possibly need. The beds were very comfortable as well. They offered complimentary coffee in the morning which was a big plus. There was an onsite rental car which was convenient when we wanted to rent a car to take to the north shore. The beach was picture perfect. The staff would go as far as pulling out chairs and laying down towels for you which was much appreciated. We never felt that the beach was overcrowded either, which was what we were hoping for. The restaurants at the hotel were very nice and had pretty much everything you could want. We especially loved the breakfast at Plumeria. The hotel gym was very nice and had TONS of equipment. Would definitely recommend the Kahala to everyone. We loved our experience and will be staying at the Kahala during our next visit to Oahu!

Kahala Hotel is a very nice hotel in general. Will give them 5*.What you see in their image adverts on the web is what you get..please see images below.Members of staff are very friendly starting from the bellboys who helped us with our luggages to and from our room;the spa service is very good, my kids enjoyed the dolphins,the pool staff were all sensitive to our needs like towels, etc. Most of all, our room was very clean and well supplied with basic stuff like soap, shampoo, conditioners etc and our bed was very comfortable.I enjoyed the yoga sessions and the photography sessions from PACIFIC DREAM PHOTOGRAPHY with their professional photographer Macie and very accommodating Daniel. You both made our stay memorable with your video and photos..Thankyou both!Buffet food from Plumeria and Hoku were amazing and tasted very good.There were so many very good things about KAHALA HOTEL and I am very pleased with our stay with them.EVERYTHING IS ALMOST PERFECT!!!!Money well spent!The only thing I found a little bit disappointing was our afternoon tea in the Veranda. I personally think, their selection of sandwiches and sweets were too small and limited for the price that they were selling for. I am from England and quite familiar about afternoon tea celebrations, that's why..

Me and my husband stayed 4 nights. We loved everything about this hotel. It was very relaxing and had amazing service. The restaurants were great, best food we had on the trip was eating at the hotel, the veranda, arancino, and plumeria beach house. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and welcoming. The location for us was ideal being just outside of Waikiki, it was close enough to everything and had a laid back relaxed feeling. The views and beach were also amazing. I can’t say enough good things about this hotel/resort. If we ever go back to O’ahu we would definitely stay here again. I would recommend it to everyone, couples and families.

This was our third visit to the Kahala and at the price you pay you expect a lot. We did get a beautiful room, very kind housekeepers (although the towel they used to put down at night is gone as well as turn down service and emptying garbage at night ). They still bring chocolates and ask if you would like water though. The valet staff is still earning their tips and then some....mostly with a smile on their face. Breakfast at Plumeria is still top notch although the serving staff is definitely not as friendly or chatty as previous visits....overworked maybe? So what was wrong? Nothing except it just seemed like certain staff didn’t care as much...shuttle driver was not friendly, cabana rental staff was almost surly; we left mid afternoon for hour to eat and they re-rented our cabana even though we had booked for day. Most of concierge staff went out of their way except for one person who acted like we were annoying with our legitimate questions. I just hope this is isolated and not the beginning of becoming “just another hotel”. That would be a shame for staff to just not care anymore at this lovely hotel.

A delightful property with knowledgeable and friendly staff. The beauty the Kahala exudes is its like going home; from the moment you arrive, you can relax in the wonderful and inviting welcome area before checking in to your room. With something for all, the Kahala is a perfect retreat for those who want to relax and recharge or those with families who want to enjoy a family break. Close to all the action in Waikiki, the Kahala is perfectly located to do what you want across Oahu.The only area of criticism is the variety of the menu in the Veranda restaurant and Plumeria in the evening. Not a lot of choices and rather overpriced for what you get, an area of disappointment I feel.All that said, we thoroughly enjoyed our time in the Kahala and will return no doubt.Mahalo to all the staff at the Kahala!

Did the last three nights at the Kahala after visiting two other islands. The room we had here was by far the best and largest room compared. In fact it was one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed at on the Hawaiian islands. The service was outstanding, the pool and beach were spotless, and I lived the fact that unlike most of the big name resorts they don’t charge a resort fee. Upon entering our room there was a bottle of Champaign provided to us by Mr. Glennon the GM of the hotel to celebrate our honeymoon. We couldn’t have asked for a better stay and better end to our island hopping experience. When we come back to Oahu we will definitely be staying at the Kahala again. Thank you for the memorable experience!

This is a very nice hotel and resort in a very scenic spot away from the busy Waikiki beach area. Although you can take the very reliable and complimentary shuttle bus into Waikiki and nearby places.We had a comfortable and clean room with a balcony although after one nights lost sleep because the room was next to a noisy elevator shaft and had a noisy aircon system, we requested a move and this was done without problem or any real comment.We were fine after that and settled to enjoy this pleasant resort. The gym is fantastic and there is a good swimming pool with the dolphin lagoon onside and a lovely beach the other.A couple of nice bars with in the main friendly staff and a good quality restaurant. We did have one slight problem which maybe we should have said something, but hey, your on vacation, but one member of staff basically told us how much they expected to be tipped. An off day I'm sure and it did nothing to spoil the excellent meal.On departure we settled our final hotel bill in cash, so were dismayed to find upon our return home that our credit card had been charged. This was sorted out and the charges cancelled. I wouldn't allow our little misdemeanours to put you off as this really is a nice resort.

Spent 8 days here and loved every minute of it. Great rooms, great food, and wonderful help. When we arrived, greeted by front desk with lei's and they held onto luggage until our room was ready (flight got into Oahu at 12:00) Went to Seaside Grill for a great lunch overlooking the beach. The breakfast buffet was included with the room every morning, and it was incredible quality, freshness and diversity of food. Great relaxing time, will definitely be back!

As everyone knows this hotel is not located at the center of Waikiki. So if you want to avoid the all the energy and people at Waikiki, this is the perfect choice. I visit Hawaii once a year and usually mix Ohau and another island to enjoy both city hotel and beachfront resort. Not this time. Staying at Kahala made me rethink about going to another island. I strongly recommend mixing Kahala and other Waikiki hotels.

I attended their brunch with 30 friends which was quite nice. Outside seating was excellent with nice view with no bugs or flies to bother us while we ate and visited with friends. Food was delicious except for the thin pancakes which had no taste. Selection was good to choose from. The only odd thing was that had pastries in covered baskets which was okay but no signage and there were doves sitting the basket which was not good.

We celebrated my dad's 85th birthday at the Plumeria it was awesome & service was excellent. We definitely suggest everyone to experience the amazing food and sunset view!.The staff very friendly everytime we visit the Kahala!

The People on Hawaii are super friendly, Great food and superb weather.Highly recommended just a bit Pricy Rands to US Dollars.we done the Pearl Harbour tour and that was super interesting , we also visited some memorial sites as well as swam with the dolphins - awesome.there culture is very diverse and a lot of Chines and Japanese people visit the island.the Kahala Hotel was excellent and we received 5 star treatment. The local seafood evening was excellent.the one downfall is the travelling time to Hawaii from South Africa, it is sooooo far, so try flying in a better class with more leg room.Alohal

My Husband and i stayed here for our honeymoon from the second we arrived staff was helpful and attentive. The hotel itself is beautiful and our room was very nice with an amazing view of the ocean and mountains. For myself though, the real highlights of the property were the dolphin lagoon, turtle lagoon and the beach so close. The room service was twice a day and there was little chocolates left on our pillow for a bed time snack, they provided a bus which took you into Waikiki which was extremely convenient. I can not recommend this hotel enough. The one staff member in particular was the bus driving Gary, every trip he would tell us all about Honolulu the history, the different buildings, good places to eat and also the different activities happening in Waikiki. If it wasn't for Gary we would have missed out on alot of wonderful things happening. We will definitely be back for another stay.

A gorgeous piece of property that started as a Hilton in the 60's. Lots of charm, good restaurants and shops. Rooms are large with some updates. Location is east of Waikiki and Diamondhead, so you will need to cab or Uber to those activity zones.

The Kahala Hotel and Resort: is the best hotel in Oahu. 5 stars in all: food, services, location, staffs, activities, beach. Staffs help you set up the beach chair, you don’t have to do it. Cute and good cookie chocolate at turn down service (6-9pm). Room service and house keeping set up bed and snack for you. Signature Kahala gifts shop is affordable purchase, not overpriced.Breakfast in the morning is more than satisfy. Beach is extremely clean and extremely safe.Water in this area is warm. A nice and generous welcome guest from this hotel made our family sincerely surprised, so happy. This is a hotel with a diamond revolution, stunning and gorgeous customer services, location, food. No cons point. Guest Luu, D.Room 1208 (7/29-7/31and 8/3-8/7)Highly recommend.

The staff members were very friendly. For my parents' anniversary and my birthday, we received some delicious sweets and sparkling cider. That night, we went to PBH, and the food and service there were awesome.

Almost afraid to give an excellent review- we plan to return again and are fearful that when more people realize what an exceptional experience a visit to the Kahala is, we won't be able to find reservations! But even with that, it still bears reviewing.-Cameron was our first contact- a few days prior to arrival. I called to ask questions and book an excursion with Holokino. Cameron's insight and assistance left a lasting first impression.-Ying provided a welcome smile and a speedy check in to travel-weary guests. For us, flying to O'ahu from the east coast was a 15 hr venture, but with Ying's pleasant demeanor and two traditional plumeria leis, we were well on our way to relaxation.- While my husband made reservations with Nozumi at the concierge desk (wonderful seating for the Polynesian Center Luau) I stepped out on the lanai off of the lobby. Surprisingly, in one camera view, there were dolphins jumping and playing, two sea turtles gracefully lapping, the bluest swimming pool, and the most beautiful beach!- Cynthia consistently created a clean, welcoming environment for us to return to twice a day, with Kahala resort chocolates on our pillow and water on our nightstands.- The service at the Plumeria restaurant daily was magnificent, and I was especially touched by both Valerie each morning and Summer in the evening who remembered us by name and made us feel valued.- Raven ensured that our lounge chairs were perfect and was ever ready to provide additional assistance.- Pixie's restorative touch and the exquisite surroundings provided us with relaxing massages that will remain in our minds for a long time.At every turn, the staff was impeccable in their manners, service delivery, and creating memorable experiences.

We stayed for two nights and had most of our meals at the hotel's restaurants. The overall experience was awesome! Food was yummy and we enjoyed having our meal with a view of the ocean. Loved the calm environment and the relaxing atmosphere. Everyone was friendly and professional.

My wife and I decided to have our wedding reception at the Kahala hotel last year after attending the wedding showcase in June 2017 and trying the food. We got a good discount on our reception just by attending the showcase and also got to try a few select hors d'oeuvres/drinks/cake selections while there. We both think it's a definite must "to do" if you are considering having your wedding here. We also set up a menu tasting day to try out several dishes among their wide variety of items available...and this pretty much blew us away because we've been to several recent weddings and never tasted anything this good at any of them...even the dishes that we marked "average" were still very good.Anna Hinkley was our event coordinator and we both want to say if you work with her, you will be in great hands. She is so organized and on top of things....and really goes out of her way to help with anything and answer any questions you have. E.G. - The day before the wedding I had a car packed full of flowers/buckets/supplies and had an issue bringing it all up to the Hotel because I had a broken thumb. Anna directed me to the loading dock of the hotel, brought down a cart, and helped me make multiple trips to bring in everything to where it needed to go…one of the many times she went above and beyond to help us. She is fast in responding to emails, and is very detailed oriented.On the wedding day, we saw Anna at the reception and she worked with our coordinators to make sure everything started fine. The rest of the Kahala staff that evening were amazing…our guests had nothing but amazing things to say about the character of all the staff working the wedding. Almost every single guest we talked to said our wedding was probably the best they’ve ever attended and that the food was the best food they’ve had at a wedding. The one thing that may drive people away from even looking at this venue for weddings may be the price, but they are in fact very comparable to other hotels in the area. We looked at the Halekulani, the Hyatt, Royal Hawaiian, Hawaii Prince, Turtle Bay, and the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Believe it or not, The Kahala ended up cheaper than all those hotels mentioned, and the quality of the venue, food, service, is unmatched.Overall, if we had to do it again we’d choose the Kahala without a doubt…and ask for Anna Hinkley as our event coordinator - she’s the best!!

We came from the UK for our honeymoon in Hawaii - Stopping in a few places before this - the final destination. When we first walked in we felt like we were on the set of a movie. It is one of the most beautiful hotel receptions I have ever seen. We checked in late but were told we had been upgraded. What a treat ! All staff were so friendly and helpful. Dean was especially helpful and friendly and he managed to sort a situation for us with no fuss whatsoever.Pool is perfect size. Beach is just beautiful. We booked surfing through the hotel and really enjoyed that. The shuttle bus is driven by some lovely people. One driver had so much knowledge about the Island - We really enjoyed those trips. Room was spotless and beautiful. Fridge in room which was perfect for us and then the sea view ! We loved everything about this hotel and can't wait to return one day soon. The sea food buffet is well worth the money. Chefs are friendly too.Afternoon tea was lovely. And the Italian was incredible !

Our experience at the Kahala was extraordinary. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary along with our son’s 21st birthday and our daughter’s high school graduation. The location was awesome, away from all of the crowds. The highlight of our stay was the photo session. Our photographer was superb and took a lot of time with us. The photo shoot was right out front of the hotel which was great. The pics were phenomenal, so hard to pick. We will cherish the video forever, totally unexpected and affordable. I would highly recommend using this service. Top notch and I have had numerous professional pics done of my kids and family and I would give the folks here a 10 out 10. Great job!!!!

We chose the Kahala Resort for the last few days of our Hawaii trip because of it's location away from the crowded Waikiki area. It was absolutely lovely in many ways. The resort is quiet, beautiful, relaxing which was exactly what we were hoping. We took an Uber over to Waikiki just to experience it but it felt like we were in the middle of an ant hill. We adored the dolphin lagoon and even though we didn't buy the encounter experience we still were mesmerized just watching them as well as the turtles and other fish. Most of our time was spent lounging and playing at the pool. We thought our young son might get tired of the simple pool but he couldn't get enough, favoring it over the beautiful beach area. Fine by us as we were enjoying drinks and food from Seaside Grill. We also took advantage of the complimentary bikes- rode over to Diamond Head to hike. There is also a complimentary photography session with Pacific Dream Photography. This is a must. Our photographer was delightful and we were able to sit down with Daniel the next day to review. He surprised us with a video which actually had me a bit teary eyed. We LOVE our photos.I highly recommend Kahala. We hope to stay there again some day.

The Kahala Resort is a beautiful hotel with a much less crowded beach. Pacific Dream Photography within the resort, did an amazing job in creating a once in a lifetime photoshoot and video slideshow. You can relive your memories of Hawaii each time you watch it, and is definitely worth every pretty penny.
user_name:
rjwong
New York City, New York

review_body: Location, location, location. The Kahala hotel is in a secluded and quite location. We stayed in March 2018 after a few nights at the Trump Hotel as my family wanted to be in Waikiki for a few days. We were greeted with smiles upon arrival and were offered cold refreshment. The staffs took great care of our belongings. Had quite a long wait to check in but it was offset by the very quite beautiful lobby and view of the ponds. Finally got to our room and was a bit letdown by the size of the room. It was cramped and definitely show its age. We enjoyed the beautifully and well-maintained beach and various ponds throughout the resort. We made a habit of walking around the resort and the beach each day during our stay. Definitely one of a kind to be able to have ponds with swimming dolphins, giant sea turtles, and fishes. The semi-private/secluded beach was quite welcome by my toddler son. Very clean and clear water with literally no surf. Overall we really enjoy our stay at the Kahala and definitely can recommend this to anyone.

Went to the Kahala resort for our week long honeymoon and had such a great time, would love to go again! We were also offered a free photography session through Pacific Dreams, and thought it'd be something worth looking into. They were very friendly and easy to work with, our photography session was a lot of fun and we were able to sit down and look at our photos the next day, as well as choose any that we wanted. We love our photos and it'll be a part of our honeymoon that we'll get to keep forever!

If you are looking to just relax and not plan on going anywhere, then this resort is excellent. The resort itself is a little far from Honolulu. Hotel is older than what we are used to but the rooms are nice and resort is nice. Service is excellent.

I stayed at the resort for 1 week since I was attending a conference here. It's an incredibly posh resort with excellent staff all around. I have to say though that my family stayed here on a discounted conference rate. Everything at this luxury resort is, as expected--very expensive! From the onsite restaurants to even the pool side grill, expect to pay a hefty amount. There is a fridge and coffee maker in the room but no microwave. We ended up going out for tasty traditional Hawaiian plate meals most days to save money, though we did eat at Plumeria Restaurant (on site) for a buffet breakfast--it was wonderful. Everyone here is extremely helpful and polite. There is a dolphin pool in the resort with 4 dolphins. We did not partake in the dolphin swim program but saw many families in the water with the dolphins, which was very entertaining! If you've got the resources, I highly recommend going!

While at the Kahala we arranged for the Pacific Dream photography session and oh, what a dream it was! From start to finish, our experience was exceptional. We were able to easily schedule a time that worked best for us. Our photographer was professional, pleasant, and very willing to make every effort to capture beautiful memories for us. She knew just where to take our photos and just how to capture us in various poses with the majestic back drop of the ocean and island greenery. You should trust your photographer fully as they know precisely how to capture you in the most flattering of ways. Our review session was fun and helped us to select a package that included all the pictures we could have ever wanted. We were extremely pleased with our whole experience (start to finish) and know that we will cherish our photo collection for many years to come. This is a "must do" on your itinerary. You will want to capture the unique beauty of the Kahala and this photo session is an excellent way to accomplish this.

Great experience with the dolphin lagoon and Pacific Dream Photography. Hotel pool staff not so great - attentiveness could be improved; also food mediocre. It feels like you are always being nickeled and dimed rather than a full inclusive resort. It is beautiful there though and much quieter than Waikiki.

We recently had our daughter's first birthday party here and it was nothing short of amazing. We also had gotten married at the hotel a couple of years prior so it was extra special to have our daughters party there. Anna Hinkley was our catering manager for both our wedding and the birthday and she was incredible. She helped us find a suitable menu and made planning this event easy, even with all the crazy changes that happen weekly or even daily. The hotel staff itself is very accommodating and you cant beat the ambience or location. We love this place and are sure to return very soon.

Short version: Excellent! Better than great service at every level, including exemplary service and treatment from Hotel Mgr James Kepa, and beach service Mgr Tom O’Malley who treated us like royalty. Great beach, great food, great service, highly recommend.Long version:Honestly, I wasn’t very impressed when we arrived. Given that our favorite and regular vacation destination is Las Vegas, where everything is constantly being renovated or replaced with something brand new and shiny, the Kahala Hotel is an older hotel, reflecting the 1960’s/70s, and showing its age in some ways. We check in and everyone is super nice, using our names—Good Afternoon Mr. and Mrs. Tivis— which is always nice to hear, but we get to our 5th floor room and it’s not good.The room is large, like Vegas, with very nice furniture, desk, sitting area, beautiful bed with twin dressers on each side that double as bed-stands, Keurig, small refrigerator hidden inside a cabinet, French doors leading to a nice large bathroom with his and her vanities at each end, plenty of closet space, safe in closet, separate bath and shower, but the view!! Having booked this online myself I was sure I booked an ocean front room, not ocean view. After all, this is our 25th anniversary and we’ve spared no expense. We CAN see the ocean, over the rooftop of the lobby and restaurant, across the entrance drive to the hotel. And the roof’s not pretty. It’s a sun faded pale green, that needs re-painting and has several spots in desperate need of repair. I snap a pic and say “this is not going to work,” and we head back downstairs.James, one of the hotel managers, overheard my complaining as I showed the desk clerk the photo and immediately interceded. He was super nice and even though the reservation showed that I had indeed booked an ocean view room (which, of course, is possible. I have made mistakes before) he did not hesitate to upgrade us to an ocean front room with a spectacular view of the pool/dolphin lagoon and beach AT NO COST. He also said that nothing was noted on the reservation about it being our Silver Anniversary (uhmm, that would also be my fault). He congratulated us and asked if he could send up some champagne and an assortment of candied macadamia nuts, compliments of the Hotel!Now that’s what I call turning the situation around on a dime. This guy was fabulous, and very professional and courteous. We were sold.Once in our room, soaking in the view, drinking champagne and eating chocolate covered macadamia nuts and strawberries, I discovered the super-duper toilet!We have stayed in hotels with bidets, of course, but this was something like I’d never seen. The toilet was equipped with a Toto SW574 combination heated seat, self cleaning action and an expandable wand that came out on command of remote control that could serve as bidet for front or back. Look it up on YouTube. I mean this thing is awesome, I decided I had to get one when we went back home, until I discovered how much they cost, and EVERY toilet in the hotel was equipped with this device, even the public restrooms off the lobby! The Seaside Grill is excellent and provides upscale dinner seating right on the beach. All the outdoor furniture is high quality—all the pool/beach lounge chairs made of wood with thick comfy cushions. They put covers on them for you and bring you towels. They have two levels of Cabana rentals, with the high end being $165 per day (as opposed to $300 a day at the San Luis in Galveston). The beach, while by law technically not private, is secluded and feels private, with jettis at each end breaking the waves and preserving the beach. (It was very calm waters and perfect weather our entire stay). It’s all very clean and beautiful, with a variety of activities at our disposal, like stand up paddle boarding, going out on a catamaran, snorkeling, etc. The staff is all over the place taking care of your every want without crowding you or hovering over you. Everyone is super nice, conversational and very professional. Like in a nice restaurant, the outdoor manager, Tom, makes the rounds and personally talks with the guests and took time to visit with us on several occasions.There is a dolphin habitat with 4 dolphins you can see and watch all the time, and pay to swim with. There’s also a connecting pond with large sea turtles and beautiful bright colored fish. There are small bridge crossings which make it perfect for viewing and picture taking. The pool seemed heated and best of all is open 24/7, which is a giant plus for us as we are night owls. The whole area is great for star gazing. The golf course and all the plants, flowers and foliage are stunningly beautiful. And did I mention the CLEANEST AND NICEST outdoor poolside bathrooms in the world!!!!!I could go on and on about the restaurants, of which there are five, but suffice it to say they are all outstanding. Being our anniversary we splurged at Hokus, which was an incredible culinary experience. We discovered talking with our servers that most of the staff has worked there for decades, which says a lot.I began to take in the history of the Hotel, and the fine antique furnishings in the lobby, the beautiful chandeliers, the glass display cases with cultural relics of Hawaiian history encased inside. The very long hall of pictures celebrities, Presidents and politicians who’ve stayed there over the years. It’s really an historic place.There were a couple of little things that bugged me here and there, but to minute to mention. After all, you can’t please all of the people all of the time. But overall the experience was superior and upscale, with any shortcomings being far outweighed by the exemplary service by everyone we encountered.Five Stars!

The Kahala is a perfectly cut gem with a flawless attention to detail. The staff is friendly and professional. They always greet you with a smile and a chat which makes you feel welcome and part of the group. The Kahala offers so much... a beautiful beach, immaculately appointed guest rooms, fantastic food and hospitality. It is a place worth visiting again and again. It’s so true ...“The Kahala, the hotel that could only happen once".'

We stayed here for 9 days in February and it was a wonderful experience. We had a room directly on the beach and the views were magnificent. The location couldn't have been better either, just walk a few feet down some stairs and you are on the beach. The room itself was pretty outdated, but it is easy to overlook that when you have the views that we had. It is definitely ready for a remodel. For a beachfront room, it was pretty standard, not overly large, but it was sufficient. There is a nice breakfast bufffet each morning, which can get quite busy. Small gym, but enough equipment to make it suitable for a morning workout. Paddle board rentals right on the beach and it is excellent water for paddle boarding. That was our favorited past time each day. Dophins on the property in the dolphin pond, which I don't really agree with, because I think they need to be in the wild, but they were fun to watch. Overall, we loved the location, since we don't really care to stay in Waikiki and the water on the property was perfect for swimming, snorkeling and paddle boarding. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to get away from busy Waikiki.

This hotel is awesome and relaxing. If you want to get away from the busy Waikiki beach and relax in comfort while on vacation, then it's worthwhile to spend a little more to stay at the Kahala. The beach is not crowded and services are great at this hotel. Don't have to go anywhere to see dolphins and turtles as they are on the property.

Staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Nothing is too much trouble. Upgrade upon arrival, although I did wonder if scenic fire would have been better than sea view which is interspersed with car park. Rooms are traditionally fitted out but are roomy and separate shower and bath are a bonus. The toilet , yes, the toilet, self cleaning and warm! Amazing. We tried Arancinos restaurants and seaside grill. Both nice. Again staff excellent. Our guide showed us our room and all it’s extras and how to use them. Concierge were always helpful. Lastly the couple of times we used the Keiki Club - staff were fabulous - excursions and activities are good and they just get the kids and their needs. Maybe only one gripe and that’s the kids menu and it’s variety or lack of in each dining place. Free shuttle (check times) was great and goes to various places including Kahala Mall and Ala Moana Mall - Gary was very knowledgeable and a great driver. Busy hotel. But a lovely experience away from the maddening crowds of Waikiki.

Each time this hotel changes hands I worry that it will not be the special romantic escape that we've loved for years. But thus far, it is still just lovely. We had an ocean-front room that was beautiful. The staff was a warm and helpful group that we enjoyed and the breakfast buffet was the best. We decided to hire a personal trainer to take us out to explore the reef using snorkles and masks. What a special activity! We enjoyed three different restaurants on or near the property and each was lovely.

Words cannot convey the wonderful experience we had at this Hotel when visiting Hawaii. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed with the most wonderful staff I have ever encountered. The Bell Man took us to our room and took such pride in showing us around. When he opened the curtains to show us our panoramic view of mountains and water I couldn't believe it was real! We ate at every restaurant and loved them all. Our package included the breakfast buffet at Plumerias which was a wonderful way to start the day. The beach was quiet and enjoyable and the beach staff were wonderful too! They were so accommodating in every way. Housekeeping came twice a day and turned down the bed each night and left chocolate that was delicious! We stayed half of our time in Waikiki and half at the Kahala and it was a wonderful way to end our vacation away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki!

We visited a couple years back and it was so much better. This time Furniture damaged, foyer rugs old and worn, plumeria restaurant is AWFUL. Staff lovely. Helpful. Felt so sorry for the poor dolphins in a tiny pool all their lives meeting commands for food. Not right.

All staffs provided my wife and me with excellent service. I really enjoyed private beach and watching Dolphins. One day I want to play them. I came here only twice but I’m always impressed by buffet dinner whenever I came to. I will definitely come again in the near future.

I visited this hotel 6/27/2018-7/5/2018. I planned this trip for 4 other families and we all booked our vacation at the Kahala. First few days it was awesome. Service was great and it was all I expected from a 5 star hotel. However, after July 2nd, we had some issues. Morning of July 3rd we had kids ring our doorbell and knock on our door at 6am. I reported to the front desk. That evening, we went to the pool, as we always did the previous nights, to relax and let our kids take a dip in the pool. However, the pool was full of kids of all ages, seems like one group of families since they all knew each other, and they were throwing each other in the pool running around and screaming and diving/flipping all around the pool. Our kids were afraid to go into the pool. There were few other guest that came to the pool and walked away. The employs around the pool seemed afraid as well and did nothing. I reported this to the front desk and they did not even know about it. The girl at the front desk said that they will have the Front Desk manager contact me but no contact as promised. We, the 5 families, were very disappointed. The same guests were at the pool again. They were a little calmer but still intimidating and our families decided to skip the pool again. I was sad not to use the pool our last night in Hawaii. Our children were sad.

The Kahala Hotel & Resort was the perfect setting for our first Hawaiian family vacation. The staff was excellent and so welcoming. Our kids swam with the dolphins and we all enjoyed the serene beach setting. We booked a photo session with Pacific Dreams Photography and enjoyed our time with Macy, who was so fun and talented. We had a hard time choosing photos the following day, as we loved them all! What a wonderful experience!

Arrived at this hotel for 1 night before picking up my NCL cruise around the Hawaiian Islands. Upon arrival, we were greeted by very friendly porters and were shown into a very impressive Lounge area leading to the check-in desks. A short wait and a beautiful Lei presented whilst we wait made us feel very welcome. We arrived early around 11.30am so our room wasn't ready yet, but that was okay as they offered to look after our bags whilst we went for an early lunch until it was ready. We had given the front desk my mobile number and they said they would let us know when the room was ready, and sure enough a couple of hours later it was. We ventured up to find the room and the hotel was lovely, it had really wide corridors and felt sumptuous. I had already requested a high floor room and we had been given one on the 10th floor. It was only a standard room but upon entering the room, it was beautiful, lovely laid out, clean and very big and really nicely decorated. It was much bigger than I could imagine and this was only a standard room. I was extremely impressed, and as soon as you walked in, the view hit you through the big windows, absolutely breathtaking. It overlooked the beautiful mountains and golf course at the rear of the hotel, and low down I could see a lovely waterfall. There was even a small Birthday desert waiting as our Travel Agent had let them know it was my 50th. We decided to have a wander around the hotel and this is truly a beautiful hotel. To it's gorgeous lounge with amazing large chandeliers, beautifully decorated and extremely friendly staff. We ventured outside as I was so keen to see the dolphins in the lagoon of the hotel before anything else. I was not disappointed, WOW, these amazing and fantastic dolphins swimming around the lagoon, We stood for ages just admiring them. Where can you go and have four beautiful dolphins swimming in a lagoon of your hotel. Once we teared ourselves away we walked around a beautiful pool overlooking the ocean, the most fantastic views, we really were in Hawaii, a place I have wanted to visit since a child. Our night at this hotel was lovely and I was already looking forward to coming back for 3 nights at the end of my cruise. For this one night though, I had booked a meal in Hoku Restaurant as it was also my 50th Birthday I wanted a special meal. Before the meal we went to the Lounge, The Veranda for drinks, it was very busy and we saw a couple of tables free but they had reserved on them. We were greeted by the Hostess and she asked if we had booked, we hadn't we only wanted a couple of drinks pre dinner, we told her that, and she said not a problem and showed us to one of the reserved tables without question, whether that was as we were resident I don't know but nothing seemed any trouble. We went to Hoku for dinner, I will review this in another review, but memorable it wasn't. We finished dinner and went back to The Veranda for more drinks, it was now quiet, music playing from the piano and a cool breeze coming in through the large open doors, this was a lovely place to sit, talk and listen to the music. As I said we were coming back here after the cruise for 3 nights, and so far, I couldn't fault this hotel at all. We had spoken to Lynn on Reception when leaving the hotel for the cruise and had asked if she could get us the same room when we came back. She explained they were full but would see what she could do. Upon returning 7 nights later, there she was on the desk, she greeted us and explained she was able to get us the same room with the same spectacular views. For 3 nights we chilled out in this lovely hotel. We booked for our first full day a Cabana by the pool overlooking the Ocean. These Cabana's are $200 for the day so not cheap. For this you get a couple bottles of water, some sunscreen, and a electronic device for calling a waiter/waitress over for drinks or food. But we found out, everyone gets one of these around by the pool, so your not that special. Other than the view, we didn't feel these were worth the money, so day 2/3 we just got our own bed around by the pool. In the 3 days we spent here, we spent a lot of time watching the dolphins, and after speaking to the trainers here for them, who are happy to answer any question or worries you may have about these beautiful mammals, they assured me they were as happy as they believe they could be and if they didn't want to do something they wouldn't. They looked happy, they played together when no-one was in with them, but I still can't help feeling if the lagoon was big enough, I hope so as watching some dolphins swim along with our cruise ship, I can't help but wonder if that's where they should really be. Whilst here we ate in Hoku, Plumeria Beach, Arancino and in the Veranda Lounge, all of which I will review separate as each one deserves a separate review. Except the Veranda Lounge, we ate in there the night before leaving, a light bite meal, but lovely, beautiful food thoroughly enjoyed it, easily as much as the other restaurants. I love this hotel, and hope one day to return, but living in the UK, it is a long way. The hotel is beautifully appointed inside and out, with spectacular views extremely friendly staff who can't do enough for you and you are not to far from either Waikiki or downtown Honolulu both of which you can get to via a shuttle that runs from the hotel free of charge. I didn't want to leave this lovely hotel, or this beautiful Island of Hawaii, but all good things must come to an end. Hopefully one day I can return.

We had a four day visit and whilst it was relaxing and friendly this hotel needs some updating.The food was lovely but the restaurants are overpriced.We loved the dolphins and turtles but at the same time felt sorry they were in a contained environment.The beach is nice and the pool a little small but the service was solid.

What a perfect setting for our anniversary get away. The Kahala Hotel and Resort was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Outstanding hotel, outstanding staff, outstanding restaurants. We loved our room location. Each morning we'd sit on our balcony and watch the dolphins play. The section where we stayed was the Dolphin Lanai rooms. This hotel and resort exceeded our expectations.

Almost every luxury you can dream about - wonderful views from every angel - supercosy bedding - extremely attentive staff - you feel a warm welcome all over - very outspreaded areal with a golfcourt on side - just wonderful in every way

We had the time of our lives at The Kahala. Staff was always polite and understanding, trying to make our stay wonderful. Facilities are excellent and always clean. There's a shuttle to Waikiki so its postion is fantastic; not in the middle of chaos but near the city.I really appreciated the surf staff. Despite there were no good conditions, they were absolutely professional and kind.

We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon in Hawaii. We had a great welcome with champagne and chocolate strawberries complimentary. The hotel is quite old fashioned but is quaint, the pool area is too small for the size of the hotel and seems to have been sacrificed for the dolphin area. It is about 20mins from Waikiki and is a $50 round trip in a taxi. It is very quiet in the evening with not much atmosphere

We always make a point staying at the Kahala when traveling to Hawaii!It may be the 10th time we return, the Kahala has the best location in Oahu, close to Waikiki, but far enough that you feel away from the city.The beach is very safe and protected so the kids can run freely.The staff has pretty much been the same for ever.The Hotel could use a little bit of a makeover ... And it is sad that they no longer have cabanas on the beach due to some neighbors dispute...They only have umbrellas by the pool, so if you want shade by the beach, you’ve got to pay for it!We had a junior suite with a sofa bed for the kids, but the furniture is so tired, the kids couldn’t not sleep I. The sofa :/Regardless, the Kahala is a special place and we will keep returning.Kainoa at the pool made a real difference for us, Tom his manager as well.James at the front desk was amazing too.Mahalo Kahala

The hotel is located in a nice neighbourhood away from the noisiness of Waikiki. Rooms are well setup and presented, bathrooms are clean and full loaded with toiletries. The restaurants at the hotel are average, not to mention restaurants like the Plumeria are highly priced for the variety and quality of the food you receive during breakfast. This includes Aranciano a very expensive Italian restaurant with average quality. Be ready to share the hotel pool with a lot of children, there is no children’s pool and for the amount of rooms the hotel has the pool is very small. Cabanas by the beach are okay but extremely expensive to get the same sun beds you can find by the pool and two bottles of water. If you like to go dining at night be ready to pay $50 round trip for a taxi to go to Waikiki area where you can find the top quality restaurants. Also, there are zero activites taking place at the hotel during thd night. Nice place to relax but not great for family fun with teenagers.

Impeccable from the minute we arrived to the day of departure!Our suite had a stunning view of Golf course, huge balcony that we enjoyed every day. Large bathroom, his and her vanities, bidet, stocked with everything one may need, Comfortable beds, A/C, and luxury! Housekeeping went above and beyond all expectations! Clean rooms,Ice filled 2x a day, water bottles provided daily, evening turn down with chocolates! Fast elevators! Every onsite restaurant was fabulous! Every employee was friendly and helpful always smiling! Concierge amazing service! The Spa was amazing!Swimming pool, beachfront lounging, Dolphins, turtles, views, Staff all Excellent! We Love Kahala Resort...Oahu

My husband and I decided to spend our honeymoon at the Kahala Hotel and Resort and we were blown away! We were greeted with fresh flower leis and moist towels to freshen up from our long trip. Gina, at the front desk, was so friendly and welcoming. She asked if we were celebrating anything and we told her we were on our honeymoon and she kindly sent a bottle of champagne up to our room, along with a hand written card congratulating us. Our room was in the dolphin lagoon wing and we were blown away by the view of dolphins right outside our balcony. I highly recommend this resort if you wish to get the best out of your stay in Honolulu!

This was a top resort back in its heyday - there are some cool pictures on the wall from the 60s, 70s and 80s, and to a lesser extent early 2000s, but none from recent years. If you're looking to compare this property to other high end resorts like the Four Seasons, don't, it's nowhere near their level any more. I think the root cause is management, as no one seems to follow any sort of standard operating procedure here, and things are generally rough around the edges as a result. Examples: if you order the same dish from room service, you get something slightly different every day. Sometimes things aren't restocked when room service comes, sometimes they are. Kids club (which is $$$$) is glorified expensive babysitting - they watch movies for a good chunk of the day. You're better off going to care.com and bringing in your own babysitter. Things are generally not well taken care of - check out the banister across from the check-in desk- it's pretty beat up, and that's a symbol of what you should expect from the rest of the experience. Clearly there is some sort of staff issue since many of them have buttons saying "One job should be enough". The only reason to wear a button like that is because you're not happy with how you're being treated, and you want people to know. If you come here, go to the Italian restaurant - it seems to be somehow managed separately and the staff there is way better and food quality is way better. Drink prices were $12/drink vs $16 in the hotel. I've been coming here since I was a kid, but those days are over. This is now more of a "value play" since the room rates are slightly cheaper than other high end resorts, but you get what you pay for.

We have stayed at the Kahala several times over the last few years. It remains our favourite hotel on Oahu. Location is fabulous, quiet but still within a 15 minute shuttle to downtown Waikiki. The private beach is wonderful and the atmosphere of the resort is relaxing. Rooms are spacious and although we were upgraded, our particular room was feeling a little tired (carpets did not look particularly clean) and could do with a freshen up overall. Whilst it is nice to have water supplied in the room, the amount of plastic bottles used for this throughout the resort must be enormous. We were supplied with about 4 bottles a day. I’m fairly sure the tap water is drinkable and water is supplied freely everywhere else in the resort, including iced water by the pool. So, I’m unsure why it needs to be supplied in the rooms, but if it does, surely 1 or 2 glass bottles (that shouldn’t be taken from the room) would be the eco friendly way to provide this service. Also there seems to be no option for using towels more than once, so again whilst trying to be eco friendly, the hotel should consider reminding clients (and housekeeping) of this option. All in all a pleasant stay and we will continue to stay here when in Hawaii.

Beautiful resort and hotel. Couldn't ask for a more pleasant and helpful staff. We were well taken care of. This is a luxury hotel so we could only afford to stay in the scenic room without balcony, but it was just fine. The beach was so nice and not over crowded at all. The food prices at the Seaside grill were about what we expected, but we did have some sticker shock at the other resort restaurants so we decided to stock up on some lunch meat and cereal for the week which saved us a lot. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Oahu.

Had a few days of meetings and brought the family along. You can’t beat the Kahala. An outer island resort experience only 15 mins from Waikiki & downtown. The property is beautiful and the service is amazing. My wife sent me this unsolicited text while I was in a meeting:“I love this place. The service is awesome in an unpretentious and super friendly way.”That is reflective of the wonderful staff that make the Kahala over the top. If you’re in Honolulu, don’t miss the Kahala. Mahalo

The hotel was amazing, highly recommend booking a session with the photographers on staff! The kids loved seeing the dolphins and turtles and the buffet breakfast was great. We would certainly go back.

We stayed here with eleven people , age range of 23 to 88, spread over six different types of rooms. We were very well taken care of at every turn. The rooms are extremely comfortable, spacious with all the amenities you could want. The property itself is massive with all kinds of different room options. The large clean beach is perfect for sunbathing and swimming for all ages. There is a floating anchored raft which is fun to swim out to and jump off of. The snorkeling is very limited. There are plenty of well padded large beach lounge chairs with adjustable canopies up and down the beach and on the massive lawn. The lawn has plenty of room for play. There is a large pool which is slightly overwhelmed by children. The jacuzzi could be larger as it can’t fit enough people that want to use it. The on-site Spa is elegant and the employees, masseuses and masseurs are very professional. The Plumeria Beach House serves a fantastic breakfast buffet; we tended to load up here and have very light lunches. The dinners are okay and the menu is limited. Have someone go down and put your name in for a table at breakfast time, they don’t take reservations the wait can be 30 minutes or more, especially on weekends. Seaside Grill is your standard burgers,sandwiches, nachos and tropical cocktails and non alcoholic cocktails. Convenient but expensive and not memorable. Arancino is a good Italian restaurant. We liked it best for getting excellent pizzas to go, we would pick them up, and bringing them to the beach. Hoku was a disappointment, the food and service weren’t at all matched to the price. The Veranda was visited almost nightly by the 87 year old in our party for a cocktail and to listen to the beautiful live music. Yes the Kahala is very expensive. But you get more than you pay for, the price is justifiable. A very special Thank You to Ryo Morimoto for his patience and dedication to making sure our large group was well taken care of at every juncture.

This is an amazing resort located only 10-15 minutes away from Waikiki. The beach is spectacular and although there is no surf it is perfect for swimming, paddle boarding, snorkeling and just relaxing. The pool is small but there’s enough space for everyone. The food and service are exemplary and there is plenty of opportunity just to enjoy and indulge. We will be returning, hopefully soon ...

This is in a stunning location away from Waikiki beach, the other side of Diamond Head. The rooms are great - large, comfortable and some with good ocean views (although mine was over the hotel drive and entrance).

This hotel is a gem. Well cared for rooms and property. It's just beautiful. The restaurants on site don't let you down. I am a clean freak with hotels, and our suite was absolutely clean. The turn down service just spoiled me, in particular. I was very let down when we returned home that no one had turned down my bed and left me chocolates. LOL. The beach is beautiful and was not crowded, and the pool has enough chairs for all. This is such a peaceful place to be, and yet, so easy to go exploring all across the island from this hotel. We especially enjoyed our dolphin experience (plus we could see the dolphins from the balcony of our suite!) Another big plus to this location was our session with Pacific Dreams photography. Macy was our photographer and it was such a windy day. However, she managed to capture my family (including 2 young children) in such a beautiful and natural way. Plus, she was just a joy to work with. We had our session one morning, and the next morning, we reviewed our pictures and chose which ones we wanted. It was just such an easy and enjoyable process, and we ended up with absolute the BEST pictures to remember our trip by. I highly recommend that you book a session with Pacific Dreams Photography! Thank you to all who helped make this stay so enjoyable! We will be back!

I can not say enough good things about this hotel, staff, restaurants, and beach. I highly recommend this place I really have nothing negative to say. I stayed here on my Honeymoon and I went back for my 10th year anniversary. It’s truly an exceptional hotel. People will have there personal opinions about the Dolphins born into captivity on scene but I will tell you the turtles are released once age appropriate. A++

We stayed here at the end of May into June for 8 days. This was our third stay here and we couldn't be happier. The staff goes the extra mile with a smile, the rooms are great and the property & location are even better. The only thing negative was our room's (#717) bathroom tile needs replacing. Not a big thing, and we would gladly stay in the room again.

Chosen by our travel agent but absolutely fantastic! The room was superb. The staff were superb. The setting was brilliant. If you like beach/spa holidays this is the best. We don’t usually like this sort of place( beach/spa) but I will make an exception for the Kahala. I’m going to add photos of our room and views.

The Kahala Hotel and Resort is extraordinary and I am SO glad my husband and I stayed here rather than in Waikiki Beach. The ambience and service at the Kahala was the exceptional- from check-in to check-out, and including the front desk, housekeeping, beach attendants, Plumeria restaurant staff, valet and shuttle drivers. Our room (dolphin lagoon view) was very pretty, but also super comfortable, spacious and clean and the breakfast buffet at the Plumeria was the BEST we have ever had. The beach and the pool area was just beautiful as well. Even though we had rented a car, shuttle service to areas of Waikiki was a nice bonus and helped us avoid traffic and finding parking.Mahalo for making our stay at the Kahala . . . It was truly an exceptional experience. I would strongly recommend the Kahala to anyone visiting Oahu.

We just returned from three nights at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. Unfortunately my husband got quite ill while we were there and the staff was incredibly helpful. I especially appreciated the support from the reception and concierge staff and the wait staff and chefs at all the restaurants who went out of their way to make sure he was able to find something he could eat.Even had he not been ill, the staff including bell peoples and pool peoples were outstandingly friendly and helpful. The room and bed were very comfortable and we loved the bathroom configuration and the fancy toilets lol. This is a truly gracious establishment in every sense of the word. My only negative is that our room 329 was near the maintenance shed and around 8 am we kept hearing beeping trucks. But other than that - outstanding

My husband has always loved the city…our boys and I like 'not' city. We found everything we could want at the Kahala Hotel & Resort. It gives the boys and I laid back luxury but we can go take in hustle bustle and chaos — in addition to high end shopping — when we feel that need. We also enjoyed the onsite Dolphin Quest experience and capped off our family trip with a glorious photography session with Pacific Dream Photography. BEAUTIFUL photos that captured our environment and chemistry and a PHENOMENAL surprise when we came to pick our photos the next day! This is our go-to resort in Oahu!

I’m not going to go on and on about each thing at this resort, but it is absolutely an amazing place to stay. We finished our family holiday here on our way back to Australia, and it was unbelievable. ThAnkyou to all staff, as they simply couldn’t do enough for any of us, from the welcome when we arrived, to the check out when we had to leave.

My family and I had a great time here. It wasn’t overly crowded which was perfect for our family. The food was delicious and room service was great, quicker than other hotels. I would recommend vacationing here if you’re looking for much needed RnR.

We highly recommend Kahala Resort. Gorgeous Beach, excellent service and great on site professional photographers. We loved that the beach was nice but not overcrowded. If you like hustle and bustle, there is a free shuttle to nearby Waikiki Beach. One of the highlights was starting each day with the breath taking views from the on site Plumeria Restaurant.We highly recommend taking advantage of the on site photography from Pacific Dream Photography. It was a great way to document our babymoon. Macy was our photographer and she couldn't have been nicer! She was patient and put us at ease to capture some great photos. They even allowed an outfit change. The session was complimentary and after viewing the photos you decide if you want to purchase them. We're so happy we have stunning professional photos to document our vacation. We look forward to returning to the Kahala Resort in the future.

Our family of four had a wonderful time at The Kahala. The amenities were great. We loved the ‘free’ breakfasts every morning, lots of variety. We hired cabanas for several days and loved relaxing in these during the day. The kids loved swimming out to the pontoon and trying the paddle boards. I loved reading on the beach with a cocktail to keep me hydrated and my husband loved the drinks, the activities and the relaxation. Room services dinners and desserts were delicious. There were always taxis available, and the bus going into town was very handy. We also enjoyed going to the lilttle shopping Centre that had handy shops for us to pick up supplies.

Beautiful beach, the most peaceful place on the island. Dolphins, turtles and a lovely staff make the Kahala Resort the only place I want to stay on Oahu. Away from Waikiki, but everything still close by

Due to general condition of the hotel in certain areas, I just can't go 5 stars on this one. To be quite honest, there is room for improvement. I will say that in all the important categories except for physical plant, this hotel does rank 5 stars.What I love:The Location - Quiet area away from the crowds in a good neighborhood. Shopping is almost walkable.The Views - Diamondhead view and the view of the mountains in the opposite direction are equally spectacular.The Food - Breakfast buffet is fantastic. Get a room rate that includes it.What I Like:The Rooms - I like the rooms because they are large. Very spacious in fact. What I didn't Like:Arancini - Just not a great menu. Service was great. Food was just okay.Condition - The age and state of repair of the property is not up to standard. Needs investment.Overall, the staff is fantastic making for a wonderful stay. We will be back. I wish I could have gone 5 stars but just not quite there.

My favorite hotel in the Honolulu area. The tranquil surroundings yet access to civilization are unique, the staff is perfect, unobtrusive yet there if you need them. Access to beaches, golf and shopping, as well as a great spa,cool looking kids pool and resident dolphins assure the resort hotel is kind of perfect for everyone. Trust me, that's hard to pull off. Family friendly and romantic. The dining there also encompasses a few moods, brunchy family, or romantic for couples.

Overall, we had a very nice experience but I wouldn’t stay here again. On a return trip to Honolulu, I’d stay in Waikiki for more convenient access to restaurants and shopping and still a beautiful beach view. For a resort experience, go to another island! Pros:- Nice quiet location in upscale Kahala neighborhood, private beach -Entry level room had a beautiful mountain view and partial ocean view from side window (but no balcony or lanai)- Very friendly and accommodating service at check-in - Comfortable bedding, robes and complimentary coffee and water replenished twice daily- They sent a tray of chocolate covered strawberries on my birthday, which was the purpose of the trip. Cons:- No upgrade despite resort didn’t seem full. We were offered an ocean view room but told it was on a low floor primarily overlooking the porte-cochere and roof construction. No thanks!- Only 1 hot tub and pool. Worked fine for our stay (Monday-Wednesday during a slower season) but would be concerned during peak season.- Rude attendant in fitness area. I entered after a walk on the beach and had sand on my feet so grabbed a towel to wipe it off on the mat outside the door. She ran over and instructed me to brush the sand off away from the mat and then picked up the mat in front of me and shook it out. Really? Isn’t that what a mat is for? - Bathroom tile is chipped and scratched and needs to be replaced. There was paint sloppily splashed on the mini bar cabinetry and bathtub/shower combo caulking was molded. None of this particularly bothersome to me but odd for a luxury hotel room.

From the friendly greeting on arrival, the great food, the dolphins, pool, beach, ooh that beach!, through the room, comfy bed, great view, great facilities, and just the whole relaxed feel!We had trekked 2000 mikes down the Pacific Coast Highway and flew out for some RnR, and was this ever The place to do it!!Thank you all, it’s a long way from home but we will be backJon and Jean, England

The Kahala resort is a timeless classic and truly luxurious property. From the minute you walk into the lobby, you are overwhelmed with beauty of the resort and that beauty is supported by an overwhelmingly friendly staff. The Kahala is the perfect place to unwind. There is no other choice of equal on the island of Oahu or Hawaii in general.

Lek, who organizes Keiki Club at Kahala hotel and resort and takes care of kids, is one of the most wonderful women I've ever met. My son loves her so much, so we can say we visit Hawaii to join Keiki Club at Kahala hotel and resort to see her. Every time we visit Hawaii, my son spent 2-3 days at Keiki Club at Kahala hotel and resort.Their programs are amazing,too. Every day, they have special program like surfing lesson, catching crabs, excursion for Honolulu zoo and aquaium, and so on. Besides them, hula dance, watching movies, and shaved ice entertain my son as well.I can't thank you enough for Lek, no doubt to say experiences with her influence on my son in fantastic meanings a lot. We can't wait for back to Kahala hotel and resort to see her!毎回ハワイを訪れるたびに必ず行くのが、カハラホテル のケイキクラブ。というのも、オーガナイズし、子どもたちのケアをしてくださるレクに、息子も私も惚れ込んでいるから。今や、レクに会うためにハワイに行くと言っても過言ではありません笑ワイキキから便利な距離で落ち着いた環境の中で、すばらしい人々とともにすばらしい経験をすることは、息子の成長に大きな影響を与えています。また参加するのが、いまからまちきれないほど楽しみです！

Lovely outlook and delicious high tea. Very expensive but worth it for a special occasion. We ordered the royal tea which came with savouries, sweets, scones, herbal tea and bubbles. It was US$60 each. That’s almost NZ$100. There was plenty of food and we struggled to finish everything. I would go back again.

Kahala Resort never disappoints you with its gorgeous and beautiful picture taking background. When my family visited Kahala Resort, everywhere seems great spot for photo taking. My family of 14 had a great and wonderful moments in Kahala Resort. I love their breakfast buffet whenever I visit Hawaii. Kids love activities with dolphins. Best Resort in Hawaii!! No wonder Kahala Resort has Professional photo company, Pacific Dream Photography at resort site.

I had a small wedding at the Kahala Hotel and the catering service was excellent! From the catering manager to the staff helping out at our wedding, they are very professional and attentive to the details and to all the guests at the ceremony and reception. The food was phenomenal! The staff even packed boxes of food for me and my new husband to enjoy after the wedding! We got nothing but complements about the food and their 5-star service from our friends and families who attended our wedding. It was simply the best day ever!

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary and birthdays with a 12-night stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort April 13-25. Our special occasion was recognized by the management with sparkling wine and treats upon our arrival, a nice touch. Our stay was quite enjoyable; our tenth-floor room (Ocean View with Lanai) was spacious and well-appointed, with only the carpet showing signs of wear. The bed and linens were exceptionally comfortable. As mentioned in numerous reviews, the hotel staff is friendly and accommodating. We were especially impressed with the efficiency of the concierge staff. The sundry “store” (actually just a small portion of the boutique shop) stocks only a minimal number of items, so any needs must be met with a shuttle trip or bicycle ride or long walk to the Kahala Mall. The breakfast buffet is especially lavish, featuring a wide variety of items, both American and Japanese. We found it to be so ample that we usually only ate one other meal, a rather light mid-afternoon item or two at either the Seaside Grill or the Veranda. In fact, we found the two occasions we dined at the upscale Hoku and the Plumeria to be underwhelming, especially the latter, with rather amateurish wait staff and a number of diners’ noisy children playing on the grassy area by the tables. We watched the dolphins frequently, thoroughly enjoying their antics. A note: the tenth floor rooms have a lanai that has no cover, so the south-facing lanai is drenched in sunshine all day—not so suitable for reading or cool lounging. Since mainland US flights depart at night and checkout is noon, we used the very convenient hospitality suite through the afternoon of our departure: it is convenient and comfortable.

Best place we have EVER stayed hands down ! From the Aloha out of the taxi to the warm welcome flower lay at the check in . Exceeded our expectations in every way. I do have to say it was truly made special by Lorna in guest services . Once she found out it was a our anniversary she went over and above to make sure it was special . Even had a Bottle of champagne waiting for us apron arrival ! We fully intended to take the shuttle into waikiki. But once at the property we found it to offer everything we needed. So we just enjoyed every moment at the resort instead. Worth every penny! Mahalo

This peaceful and gorgeous resort is situated away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki; however, but this and many amenities, are easily accessible with the complementary hotel shuttle service. The breathtaking views from our lanai of sea, mountains, and palm trees were the perfect way to start and end the day. Their thoughtfully landscaped grounds complement the surrounding spectacular natural scenery and the vastness of the Pacific. The beach is wonderfully private. Indoors and outdoors, Kahala is kept in pristine condition. The resort however would not be able to achieve what they have achieved without their exemplary staff who work diligently and unobtrusively each day to create a "paradise" for their guests. Two of Kahala's employees, who serve at the front desk, deserve a special shout out for their warm and outstanding professionalism: Gina and Dean. Their wonderful insights and ready smiles made our stay just that much nicer.

So here I am back again at the Kahala Hotel! After a superb visit I didn't need to bother looking at any hotels in Honolulu as I knew I wanted to stay here again. The second time around the visit was still brilliant! We had the breakfast buffet option included in our room rate and this was one of the best breakfast's I've had, as an IHG platinum member I can tell you it really is! There is only two negative things I'd say about the hotel on this stay and that is the tiles in our bathroom were scratched and in some areas of the hotel the wallpaper appears to be peeling, this is very minor but something I noticed. Despite this,it is still a fantastic hotel! and I'm really hoping to come back for a 3rd time!

This is a very beautiful property with amazingly luxurious room and parking available, with the view of the Pacific, the hotel has restaurant, designer boutique, pool and Sea beach with lounging chairs, cabanas for rental and towel service. The lobby and the property as a whole is very beautiful ambiance, very friendly and helpful people. There was nothing to dislike except one reason, which is the reason I have given a 3 star they have 4 captive dolphins on the property, which is a total NO NO for me. In today's day and age where Trip advisor does not promote sea world tours anymore this property does not meet the standard for me. Knowing how cruelly these animals are captured at Taiji cove in Japan, I would expect better from such a beautiful property.

We were very fortunate to be part of my nieces wedding at this venue.Nothing short of paradise!!!!The whole place is just perfect for that tropical theme. The view was amazing!!! The customer service I thought was impeccable and was very worthy of a 5 star rated establishment. Kahala resort certainly delivered and I was happy to experience it all.

Our stay at the Kahala was magnificent. The staff at the restaurant was superb, and the Sunday brunch wonderful. The pool was perfectly heated, and the beach was lovely. Notably, we had our family's photos professionally taken by Lauryn of Pacific Dream Photography. She was wonderful with our 7 and 9-year-old girls! We did the sunrise shoot, and photos came out perfect!

Last year, I stayed at The Kahala Hotel & Resort for the first time, while traveling to Hawaii on business. My stay was so wonderful, that I decided to return again this year, and compare the two visits. I can honestly say that this stay was equal to and even better than last year's stay. It seems like the staff either remembered me, or they made me feel like they knew me. Just about everyone addressed me by name, and they always anticipated what I needed, whether it was bringing up my rental car, driving directions, boarding pass printing, or restaurant recommendations. My suite location, complete with balcony and ocean-view, was beautiful and convenient. The suite was comfortable, spacious, very clean, and filled with amenities to enhance my stay. Mr. Glennon, the General Manager, ensured that all of the details of my stay were arranged and communicated with his staff.
