The Kahala Hotels and resort is probably the best place i have ever stayed in , beautiful place with superb service , the rooms are top luxury , Beach and pool many restaurant a place that caters for everyone singles , couples on honey moon or families , very friendly staff , and in a quite affluent Kahala neighbourhood , rooms surrounding a lake of dolphins , mall nearby, ... do not forget to visit the hall of fame , pic of celebrities and world leaders all stayed in this hotel resort, high chance to bump into a celeb if you visit December or April

Top notch staff and service. We had a “scenic view room” which, in our case, was a view of the golf course. The room was large and spacious. The bathroom had double sinks, separate tub and bath, plenty of storage space.What stands out at this hotel is the friendliness of staff. Every time we passed by any staff member, they would greet us as if we were family members.

We absolutely loved the hotel. Everything from the room to the service to the private beach was outstanding. I really liked the location of the hotel because it was secluded but close enough to downtown if you wanted to venture out. The shuttle service to the malls was also very nice! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a five star relaxing vacation. We will definitely be coming back.

I have stayed at this hotel many times and i have to say it is so nice and relaxing. The place is great and pet and kid friendly with so many things to do and places to go. The people there are always smiling which is amazing and makes you feel better if you don’t feel great. The beach is so nice with a reef with fish you can look at. At the Kahala you can even go swimming with dolphins This place is awesome i strongly recommend staying here

The Kahala is a special place. It is paradise on earth, from the incredible breakfast (how will I survive without thin pancakes?) to the gorgeous beach, everyone who makes lunch and the day fun (Christina, Alicia, Sean and the team) before the tough decision of dinner. The rooms are gorgeous, like everything else - somehow being absolutely modern while feeling the same and like home over the last 40 years. The days passed so quickly and I can’t wait to return to our Kahala ohana. Mahalo.

Luxurious!!! Located on a beautiful secluded beach, away from the rat-race of Waikiki. The Kahala Hotel is a great get-away. Very peaceful!Rooms are generously sized. The staff of the hotel is amazing! Kerry Kuhl is the BEST !!!! She understands the needs of clientele. Many celebrities and VIP's stay here.We had the greatest time! Highly recommend!

I like the calm atmosphere of Kahala (comparing to waikiki) Their restaurants are very good, the beach is tranquil and the service is very good.The staff is very friendly and nice. It would be great if the hotel had toys to let the kids play on the beach instead of just selling.

This place is off the charts and is a great destination with a very nice quite beach, excellent service all around, nice pool and out door bar. It is expensive not sure if it's worth the price but over all it was a great experience. Just may not ever go back due to the cost....

The Kahala is a formerly grand and discreet hotel attracting all US Presidents since LBJ (not yet Trump), other world leaders and celebrities. There is a wall of photos of such guests which is fun to view. Apart from the Obamas, however, who do still put in appearances, this hotel has dropped off a bit, with the decor and maintenance showing as much, and yet the prices are still high.The staff at the front and bell desks, concierge, formal restaurants and bar tend to be very nice, with some standouts including Gary the bus driver who is a gentleman with a large amount of local knowledge. The pool and main restaurant staff are a little harder to deal with as they are busy - ask the wrong person for an item of cutlery and the response is a harried "I'll get your server". Regrettably, you'll be told that things can't be done (e.g. a table in the pool bar area), but $50 later they can be done. Guests then get competitive.The "beach front" rooms are that in name only. You'll face a six-deep throng of deck chairs to wade through to get to the sea. That would be fine if only there was adequate disclosure beforehand. To be fair to the hotel, we understand the State government has apparently changed the law regarding public access to the beach, and this has affected hotel layouts and planning in that area.The carpets in some of the bedrooms are in dire need of a steam clean, while others are fine. Paint is peeling in some areas of the hotel but not others. It needs a bit more work.We had a good time and the hotel is a nice place to stay. But given the above issues, the prices that they charge are too steep in the circumstances. There is more work to be done before the hotel is comparable with the Halekulani and Trump hotels.

Great hotel. Great service Luxurious but not pretentiousGreat beach. You still feel the Aloha spirit even though it’s a 5 star placeHighly recommended for anyone Close to waikiki if you want but also on right side towards Kailua etc

We returned for 2 weeks ( 11 of us , 6 adults , 5 kids ) for Xmas , new year , one beach front corner suite ( spectacular ).Two sets of beach view connections rooms. The accommodations is superb , staff is spectacular . The restaurents ( all three fabulous ) . Spa , massage / facial accomdating. . The pool (Jacob) staff is helpful , we rented a beachfront tent daily ( highly recommended ) The concierge is most helpful , Cameron , DeeDee. Dean , Susan ( on short notice they got me a private guide to KokoCrater sunrise hike ) .Chi the exercise area Look worn out , need upgrade . The steam room may be the best I have encountered , fast and furious . One evening , we smell someone smoking via the air vent . Security came immediately identified the source and handled the situation professional, we were offered the option to move to another room for the night but we don’t feel we need to . Xue the cleaning lady is meticulous and pleasant . In fact , we prefer the same floor and room partly because of her . I ran into the manager one evening , Mr Gerald Glennon a most pleasant and accomdating gentleman. . We plan to be back to Paradise again next year. .

Their attention to detail is spectacular. Everything is immaculate. The food was wonderful. The resort is peaceful and amazing customer service. I️ had a headache and the boutique to buy medicine was closed....they met me at the boutique in the middle of the night to open it so I️ could get some medicine. Wow. I️ would go back in a heartbeat!

We are from Los Angeles and somehow never knew that everyone from LA goes to this hotel. We knew 4 other families who were visiting this past holiday time. Apparently the hey-day for this property was back in the 80's, but the same folks keep coming back for 30-40 years! So there was a very congenial feel, where everyone sort of knew each other, or at least the regulars. The service is very good and the staff are very friendly (although that is typical for Hawaii and one of the reasons we love to visit). The hotel is located about 15 minutes from Waikiki Beach, in a residential area known as the "Beverly Hills" of Oahu. It was very quiet and away from the crowds of Waikiki. They offer a free shuttle to the main malls in Waikiki, including ala Moana, but they were not very convenient and we just took Ubers pretty much everywhere. Although the Kahala bumps right up against the Wailae Golf course, hotel guests do not have access to the private club and you cannot play there (but I heard that other hotels can get you on). The resort is very small and the pool is VERY small. But there were no issues getting a lounge chair at this very busy time of year. There is a reef that protects the beach, so the water is calm and you don't have to worry about huge waves. They have a little "Moana" style outrigger canoe that you can hire to take you out for a little tour, which was fun. The rooms are large and feel a bit old school. They definitely take care of the hotel (it's very clean) and have updated it, but have not done a complete gut renovation. The "Japanese" style self-cleaning toilet/bidets were a bit annoying. The concierge was amazing and helped us secure reservations at local restaurants and a tee time at Hawaii Kai before we arrived. Make sure you get a room package that includes breakfast--the breakfast buffet is very pricey (I think it was around $50 per person) and there isn't a grab and go option. Otherwise you can get room service. The on-site Dolphin Quest is also very pricey, but having never done it before, I was happy to be able to share that experience with my daughter. It was really special to walk the grounds and see the dolphins everyday.

This is a resort far from the center of the town. The rooms are spacious with lovely views. The hotel staff is very courteous and efficient. The best part is that the beach is a quiet one. There is a hotel shuttle that takes you into the city regularly, and you can take it back to the hotel, too. Breakfast at the hotel was very good but you have a limited choice of dining around the hotel.
user_name:
Touria G
New York City, New York

review_body: The Kalaha is gorgeous! The entire staff are quietly accommodating. Everything is spotless.The grounds are beautiful-especially the pool view of the ocean.Rooms are very nice and comfortable.If I had one comment to make it is that there were kids running all over during tea time. It was pouring down rain, but every few minutes kids/teens would be running back and forth in lobby. They would bump the chairs as we are having hot tea. A little discretion in running activities would be appreciated.

Our family had the best Christmas vacation here, at the Kahala. We have stayed at many 5-Star resorts for our family Christmas & New Years....this one stands out on so many levels. The rooms & views are amazing, no matter what side of the hotel you are on. The activities office was very accommodating for all our beach fun. The service at the pool is incredible & attentive - we loved our servers Mariah and Aiden, but the STAND OUT was Kelyn. She anticipated our needs & was always super friendly, happy & full of smiles. Thank you, Kahala Resort, for an amazing time.

For overall quality, safety, and a sense of being removed from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki or Honolulu, this is a good choice. Lovely touches like hammocks on the property, multiple high quality restaurant options, dolphins and other marine life to enjoy right on the grounds (yes, some certainly oppose this practice), and an overall calm, pleasant, elegant vibe keeps this as a high quality choice.FYI, the beachfront is not a swimming quality that is equivalent to Waikiki. Nonetheless, for enjoying a sense of serenity while strolling the grounds or rocking gently in a hammock, it does the trick.

Experienced an amazing week at the Kahala! So many highlights...From the moment we arrived we were treated like the most important people at the resort. The staff at the front were so welcoming to us and greeted our kids with Leis and stuffed dolphins. When we checked in we were told they were able to get us adjoining rooms with my brother and his family, which we weren't sure of since we had booked at separate times. Rooms were clean and comfortable. You could tell the housekeeping staff took great pride in taking care of the rooms throughout the week. Was so nice to have everything literally at our feet. The beach was beautiful with calm water for the kids, when they weren't in the ocean they were in the pool or looking at the dolphins in the lagoon. The beachside service was really good with drinks and food at the Seaside grill. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet and several dinners at the Plumeria and great Italian cuisine at Arancino. The concierge staff took great care of us, whether setting up activities and meals or providing us with towels on our way out the door for tours or trips to Waikiki. It seemed nothing was too great or too small for them. We weren't sure about booking at the Kahala with it being away from Waikiki but after experiencing the past week it was the perfect choice. We enjoyed our time spent on Waikiki but it was nice to get back to the peace and comfort of the Kahala. Already looking forward to our return!

This resort is without question a 5-Star resort. Everyone who works here seems genuinely welcoming and friendly. My husband and I booked a room with a lanai/balcony and had our wedding ceremony on the lanai. We cleared it with the hotel a week before and filled out a form so that we could have our photographer take photos of us on the property afterward. We requested for housekeeping to come in and make our bed that morning so that it wouldn't be messy during our ceremony (our parents and siblings would be our only guests). Not only did someone come in to make the bed, she changed the sheets, took out the trash, tidied up, and left us more bottles of water. After our wedding, the staff at the front desk addressed us by name and asked if everything went smoothly. The only thing we regret about our trip was that we didn't stay longer. Three nights just wasn't enough to explore and make use of all their activities and facilities. We already miss the wonderful staff, the breakfast buffet at Plumeria's and the heated toilet seats. We will definitely be back! Also, the pool, jacuzzi, fitness center, and steam rooms are open 24/7.

This employees at this hotel are among the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel that I have stayed at. Everyone we came into contact with from the valet, front desk, hostesses, wait staff, maidstaff, to pool staff were happy and always willing to help or get you help. The beach and pool are wonderful and relaxing. We also enjoyed the food and found the buffet breakfast excellent with many choices. Finally, we had a wonderful beachfront view room with an awesome lanai that was great to relax and look at the ocean. I would definitely return again to this wonderful hotel.

If I was able to live at a hotel, it would be the Kahala resort. Granted, I do have fond childhood memories of this hotel. It's absolutely an institution in the Honolulu area. It is that rare location that manages to feel impressive and cozy at the same time. Maybe it's the warm, fragrant, tropical breezes that waft throughout the open air architecture that manage to make the incredibly high ceilings feel warm.Even if you can't be a guest, go and visit. Eat at a restaurant, have tea, watch the dolphins frolic. Even if you drive up in a complete beater of a car (which I've done many times since I loved driving my grandfather's beater VW beetle when he had it), the staff will treat you well. The valets used to jostle good-naturedly over who got to park my grandpa's car.The restaurants I've eaten at are all fantastic, although The Veranda with its fantastic tea service and dinner-time fusion cuisine, is my favorite.I stayed in a room overlooking the dolphin lagoon which was nice, although the rooms that look out towards the beach have the luxury of having their own lounge chairs facing the ocean!The rooms in the original, low building are quite large. My bathroom had two sinks, two closets, and a separate tub/shower. Not sure what the rooms in the high tower look like.My favorite perk at the Kahala is that their pool is open 24 hours. I think every hotel pool should follow suit! There is nothing more decadent than a middle of the night swim.Wishing you love and romance,Aviva VaughnAuthor of slow burn women's fiction inspired by food, travel, and Jane Austen.

I first visited the Kahala when I was 6 years old, some 50 years ago. At that time, it was a Hilton International Hotel. I returned as a guest many (40-50) times over the years, through ownership and management changes (Hilton to Mandarin Oriental to Kahala Hotel).Even as the silk rugs and fine furniture in the lobby gave way to jute rugs and Crate and Barrel-esque case goods replacements, the Kahala remained a special place because of the quality of its personnel who went to heroic efforts to make new and returning guests alike feel at home.All good things come to an end and, painfully, nowhere is this more true than with the Kahala.The old guard has retired, the new staff conveys little more than a civil service work ethic, the carpet is worn, a number of terrace railings are rusted, the once charming dolphin pond has been converted to a crass “pay to play” commercial undertaking, the plantings are poorly maintained, etc.Plumeria Beach House has devolved into little more than a glorified fast food restaurant.Hoku’s is the one saving grace: its food and service remain first-rate.A number of reviewers continue to speak highly of the Kahala. Either they do not know the difference or they never had the good fortune to know the old Kahala. For those who know the difference, a visit to the Kahala is a sad experience.

We just returned from our Island hopping holiday in Hawaii. Our first stop was the Kahala and boy am I glad I chose this resort. Set away from the craziness of Waikiki this Hotel is like a private paradise. Everything from the grounds to the food, to every detail including all the employees, service, concierge, everything - perfection. Everything we experienced after the Kahala, hotel wise felt blah. They raised the bar so high! Thank you Kahala!

We last stayed here 40 rears ago when it was Kahala Hilton. It has been meticulously cared for and has not lost any of it's charm and elegance. One of their ground floor hallways has hundreds of celebrity photos of presidents, emperors, movie stars and famous personalities that have visited Kahala since it opened in 1964. Even if you do not stay at this hotel, it is well worth a visit for dinner and to explore the lush grounds.

Get the dolphin room...you can watch them swim right past your balcony!!! Love that this place is secluded...not noisy or crowded, plenty of room at the beach, great breakfast buffet, and very friendly staff!!!

I went as a part of a wedding party. It was very nice and luxurious. The restaurants are a bit pricey, but very convenient as they are right there. They did hit us with some charges we weren't aware of.

This hotel has the a spectacular view of the pacific Ocean. Very close to shopping centers, restaurants and business activities in Honolulu. easy access by transportation from airport or any points in Oahu.

We stayed at the Kahala for 5 nights after Thanksgiving. This is a great hotel outside the busy Waikiki and has a fantastic beach. The room was also amazing despite having a view of the front door of the hotel. We weren't in our room that much so the view didn't really matter to us. We could actually still see the ocean from the 1st floor. I thought the scenic view was sufficient. We didn't need a dolphin view or lanai. We used the shuttle once to go into town to do some souvenir shopping. We took an Uber to diamond head which was very close and it cost us $25 total. The food was great at the hotel and was expensive but that would be the same anywhere in Hawaii. We ate at all the restaurants and each was amazing. Hoku's and the Arancino(Italian) was our favorites. We never got the buffet's as it was so expensive, but felt like sharing two meals was sufficient for breakfast. The only negative's were that we could not get into the Plumeria restaurant thanksgiving night when we arrived as it was completely booked. I would have been helpful to know that we had to make reservations ahead of time. We had to make reservations each night and the restaurants were completely booked each night. We had an amazing experience and the staff were so helpful with questions we had throughout our stay. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for something outside of Waikiki.

The Kahala hotel is a gem on the island of Oahu.It has the perfect location outside the hustle bustle of Waikiki. You feel like you are on an island within an island. It is a tropical paradise.The service, rooms and views are outstanding.There are plenty of restaurant choices on property but they also provide a free shuttle to three other areas for their guests.Although all beaches in Hawaii are public, the beach here seems very private. It is a great stretch of beach and it has a nice sandy bottom as you walk into the ocean.It is my number one pick for Oahu

The Kahala. Situated outside of the Waikiki touristy bustle, the Kahala is truly an oasis.There's sometimes a stigma with "fancy" hotels, like if your name isn't Rockefeller you should probably avert your gaze because you must be lost. Cue the trepidation driving up in my dirty old Nissan... From the moment I pulled up at the valet, every single staff member that my friend and I encountered was so unbelievably friendly, gracious, and helpful. I don't know how, but by the time we left, we were on a first name basis with everyone! I have never been so well taken care of by a hotel and we were literally only there for brunch! I'm almost certain that if i ever had the chance to stay there, I would never leave. In fact, I'm going back again next week. Needless to say I'm beyond impressed!!

This hotel have all that the people wants to be with your couple! The rooms are a dream, the food was incredible and all the people understarstand what service means.We stayed in a room with golf field and sea view.The location is good to stay in and for use the hotel installations (are amazing). If you want to scape to the city and buy some souvenirs or eat out of the hotel you need to travel for that. I recommend car rental and everithing will be easier.Actually my trip was three yrs. ago but I'm writing some reviews and this one needs to be on my list.

We recently stayed at the Kahala in Oahu had the privilege of working with Loryn at Pacific Dream Photography. The hotel offered a complimentary photography session and since we wanted to capture our trip, we decided to take it on. I should note my husband really hates having his picture taken but He agreed to participate. We met with Loryn on a Tuesday morning, honestly so disappointed that we had awoken to rain. She was professional and courteous and asked us if we preferred to reschedule, but encouraged us to give it a shot. Let me say, from beginning to end, Loryn was amazing. We have a 5 year old and a 2 year old and I cannot BELIEVE the photos that she was able to capture with two little children and a dreary sky. She is extremely talented with working with kids and was somehow able to get both of our children captured with ease. I was probably near tears when we started because it meant to much to me to get some nice pictures on this once in a lifetime trip and I thought the weather had ruined it. Loryn clearly knows her stuff, posed us in natural poses so that we didn't feel awkward or uncomfortable and knocked them out of the park! I cannot express how talented she is. The packages are reasonably priced and Loryn was so patient as we painstakingly had to go through the process of picking which ones we wanted (they were all so good it was very hard to choose!). Once we selected, we had our gallery in hand within a couple of hours. I wouldn't hesitate in the slightest to use Loryn or Pacific Dream Photography on our next Hawaiian trip! Highly highly recommend. Kudos, Loryn! Thank you for capturing our wonderful vacation!

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights during our Honeymoon to Hawaii. The staff were exceptional and very respectful. We ate breakfast everyday there and they had a wonderful buffet. Our biggest mishap was that our call button didn't work when we rented the beach cabana and needed to go to the bar ourselves to get our drinks and food. We mentioned this at our checkout and the desk promptly alerted the manager. While we were there we took advantage of the Pacific Dream photography services. The booking was easy and the session provided some great photos. We look forward to printing several to hang in our home. The photoshoot is 'complementary' but you clearly pay for that service in the price of the digital files. Unfortunately, when we paid for the photos they failed to mention that there was a $16 CONVENIENCE charge for using a credit card.

Recently returned from a wonderful one week stay at the Kahala. The room was lovely and was always well tended by housekeeping. Service at both Plumeria for the breakfast buffet, and the Veranda for drinks and pupus was lovely. Special recognition to Gina at the front desk. She made check in simple and smooth, and she greeted me by name every time I passed by the desk from then on. Also, Pixie from the spa is a treasure. Met her as she provided complimentary foot massages on the beach (!!!) and she was so great I opted for a neck and shoulder massage in the poolside massage area. She was intuitive and compassionate. Finally, the gentleman (sorry I didn't get your name!) who was working the Hertz desk on Sunday 11/19 was full of helpful information. There is much to compliment at the Kahala, but it is truly the people who make it such a special place. Mahalo Nui Loa!

Fantastic holiday at the hotel, loved everything and will be returning whenever possible.The position was just right, away from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki but within a short car journey for when we wanted to go in.Staff great, my wife and I truly enjoyed our stay and were very sorry to leave.

I loved how romantic and peaceful the Kahala was when I came in my 20’s so I had to drag my husband here to see if it was how I remembered it 10 years ago. Things have changed a bit but the most important ways, have stayed the same. The friendliness, charm, and great staff still possess this hotel. The dolphins are still here but it seems like they expanded the dolphin pond, I don’t remember it being a small lake! The one important thing that’s changed is the busy-ness. This peaceful resort isn’t as peaceful around the holidays anymore. In fact, it is stressful and slammed. I think it is due to social media and ease of “word of mouth” through sites like TripAdvisor. There were too many weddings too, almost every day, meaning, brizedilla and crew descend upon the place and take over the hotel, restaurants, best views and quaint ocean spots. There’s also a tremendous amount of foreign visitors, which I don’t mind, but I overheard racist visitors from White America laughing with each other and complaining how this is an “Asian—-bleep—-Hotel.” Other than that, any issue we had was dealt with professionally and immediately by staff and management. We were so happy in our room that we barely went outside and didn’t leave the premises for 6 entire days! I’ve never been so luxuriously gluttonous. My only activity was to sleep and eat. I feel refreshed and happy, ready to take on my work and my life in a reinvigorated way. Thank you for such a peaceful stay.

Fabulous hotel, a Hawaiian treasure that incorporates wonderful architecture, incredible service and luxury, a touch of the old and a lot of the new blended in to this place. Nestled in its own bay we had a wonderful holiday, 20 minutes away from the vibrance of Waikiki and yet peaceful. Accept no substitute.

We recently had the opportunity to enjoy 9days at The Kahala Resort. The entire staff from the bellmen, front desk, housekeeping, concierge and wait staff all are trained to treat the customer with great respect and welcome. We had the opportunity to be at the resort for the lighting of the Christmas Tree Thanksgiving weekend and attend the party that they threw. Everything was first class and well attended. The resort is located a bit outside of busy Waikiki but close enough for meals and sightseeing. We also had the opportunity to work with their onsiteDream Photography and photographer Alexis. She really did a great job to capture our pictures on the beachfront on a beautiful Hawaii morning. The resort offers a shuttle service to several shopping centers which puts you right into Waikiki. They also helped us book several tours. Great 9days..I would definitely recommend The Kahala Resort.

Stayed here for 2 nights. Very clean, nice resort. Ocean is very calm and mello. Rooms were a good size. Nice bedding. Stayed in #227, ocean view. Also a view of the valet but there was no noise problem. The gym, sauna and steam room were nice also. Only ate at the pool restaurant which was okay.

Lovely resort with great rooms, beachside, and good food.Hotel was earlier a Hilton Resort and changed to THE Kahala. Not to compare with a Hilton Hotel, miles better and a great spot to try out.Thx to Manager Roy for solving the midnight emergency working in the right way.We will come back!

The Kahala is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. Staff is fabulous. Atmosphere is so restful and unhurried. 15 minuets away from the craziness of Waikiki with a lovely uncrowded beach, pool, dolphins and beautiful surroundings. Expansive buffet breakfast available every day. Hotel is very expensive but totally worth it. We loved every minute of our 5 day stay in a dolphin lanai room and were sad to leave. Packages with a free day or free breakfast are offered frequently so be sure to look for specials.

This hotel has it all...private location away from crowded Waikiki, great amenities,and a staff that is more than willing to please. We really enjoyed the bed and breakfast deal. Free breakfast every morning at Plumeria buffet.... and this buffet is loaded with any breakfast item you could want. After enjoying a lovely meal on the patio, you can either get very busy with any number of fun activities, or you can just laze around the pool or on Kahala beach. Even though it's a public beach, no one knows about it, so it's so chill! Dolphin pool is so fun to watch those guys! We just love it here, and anytime we come to Oahu, we make this our go-to hotel!

Just returned from a 10 day stay at the Kahala for our honeymoon. It was absolutely wonderful. I don't understand anyone that could ever say anything negative. The staff were kind, courteous, quick, caring and accommodating. The hotel was beautiful, food was delicious and we ate in every restaurant on site with no disappointments. Our room was spacious with a great view of mountains, golf course and partial ocean. The bed was super comfy and luxurious. Beach is beautiful and although a public beach it felt like a private beach just for our resort. Thoroughly enjoyed spending time watching the resident dolphins, turtles and fish. Shuttle to Waikiki was convenient and saved on cab fare. Resort is a little isolated from any other activities so it was nice to have the shuttle available.Mahalo to everyone at the Kahala. It was our first time there and hope that it is not our last. Would love to return.Jennifer D

We visited in September. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip. Everything about The Kahala is great - from the rooms, to the restaurants, to the grounds, to the great staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. And, at the front desk, Carlos was extremely helpful -- made our trip even better!! Thank you Carlos.
user_name:
DianeM669
New York City, New York

review_body: Kahala resorts were awesome. We stayed for a week and it really helped us relax. everything about it was a great experience. We only hoped there were more activites for us to do in the night and more vegetarian food. We used pacific dream photography services when we were in Oahu, Hawaii and I have all good things to say about it. It was easy to schedule, reschedule. It was raining at the time of schedule and Alexis waited patiently. They were all easy to work with and the price was affordable. The pictures were amazing and I fell in love with them. She cheered up the kid and even with a 20 min schedule she took awesome pictures and we were ready to view in 30 min. Thank you for amazing memories, pacific dream photography.

This trip has been so amazing. Our room, 825, has the most amazing tranquil view of palm trees and lulling waves and sand. The attendants here are so friendly and responsive. This hotel truly made us feel special and took care of our two year old daughter. They even gave her a dolphin toy at check in to start us off right foot. The bed is very comfy, the bath and shower feel great, the amenities impressive and the food delicious. We love eating at the plumeria for breakfast each day and then heading out to swim at the beach and in the pool. One of the highlights of our stay was the photo session with pacific dream photography. We were quite pleased with Loryn who took an already incredible landscape and combined it with a fantastic sunset and really creative poses in multiple settings. What was truly impressive is that we have a two year old who wasn't that cooperative for the shoot. I wasn't sure how that would translate until we went to the photo review appointment and had a decent amount of trouble chiseling down the photos because so many were incredible and keepers. We went with the 20 photo package and can't wait to have these memories on our walls at home and shared with our friends and family. Since the photo session was complimentary and appointment to review the photos was very comfortable with no sales pressure, the entire experience was enjoyable with no downside.
user_name:
JDBlums
New York City, New York

review_body: On 2 July The Kahala Resort turned on the most stunning day for the most memorable day of our lives! We cannot praise Anna, Cerise & the wider Kahala team enough for making our special day so perfect. If you're ever in Oahu you should make an effort to check out this fabulous property and the class and quality it oozes.@thetravellingroses

The Kahala is locally known as the Hollywood of Honolulu. There is a hall with pictures of the rich and famous "names" from around the world who stayed as guests of the Kahala, spanning several decades. The East-Facing beach is ideal for sunrise views or swimming, or weddings. Many, many weddings. The rooms are simply fabulous. All of them are quiet, beautifully decorated, and include advanced Toto Washlet automated bidet systems on the toilet. Generous windows have blackout drapes that fit perfectly. Maid service 2x per day that will spoil you for any other hotel. Four dining options span the gamut from internationally-recognized chefs to simple beachfront meals. The neighborhood is very quiet and safe, with homes (and some international embassy properties) that range in value from $1.7 million to about $34 million. Avid runners should get a jogging map from the reception desk to avoid certain streets that are too narrow for safe pedestrian use. A wide coral reef protects the hotel's beachfront from big waves, making it exceptionally safe and easy for all levels of swimmers. For surfers, the breaks are at least .3 miles out, but paddling in the area is easy. The pod of male Atlantic Bottlenose dolphins in the hotel's integrated dolphin lagoon live their entire lives there, meeting and playing with thousands of human visitors (including, now, me) along with their dedicated, respectful human trainers. The joy and playful intelligence of the dolphins is wonderful to experience up close. The hotel offers familiar luxury services, such as spa, gift shop, room service and so forth, but in each case with distinctive passion for excellence. All of this is only a 10-minute drive from the other Honolulu attractions.

Based on my prior reviews, this was our 11th stay at the Kahala (I must have skipped a review for September of 2016). We obviously keep coming back which is a good sign.This trip was a little different. We stayed the entire time at the resort for a total of eight nights. We did mix it up by spending the first 4 nights in a Dolphin Lagoon room and then 4 in an Ocean Front Suite in the Tower.We barely left the resort and spent most of the time on the beach in a cabana. I honestly don't know what I can say that would be new about the hotel, rooms etc. that isn't already in one of my prior reviews. So I will give a few tips.If you do book a Dolphin Lagoon room, push as hard as you can for an upper room. We were in a lower, which was fine, but having stayed in an upper previously, they are definitely better for watching the dolphins.We knew we wanted to use a beach cabana every day so we just talked to the beach/pool team on the first day and asked them to set it up for us every day. That way we always had the one we chose and it was set up really early.We found the food to be even better than on prior stays. We had a great meal at Hoku's, the breakfast buffet is amazing, the club sandwich at the Veranda was really yummy, I could go on and on! This is part of why we hardly left the resort.Comparing the two rooms, not surprisingly the service while in the suite was better - no missed turndowns, prompt room make up. Not a huge deal but I did note it. We were on the 7th floor while in the suitr and on this stay there was an issue with the hot water - at times it took a REALLY long time to make it to our room. Maybe not many guests in the tower thus no one pulling water, but we would literally have to start the shower and then wait 5-10 minutes before it was warm. If you do a suite, we recommend one at the end of the hall (the "13" rooms rather than the "1" rooms - we were in 713). These rooms have an extra window and are more quiet.I have to recognize Carlos the front desk supervisor. He went above and beyond in helping us transition between rooms and ensuring we got the room we wanted. Thanks so much Carlos!We will definitely be back again if they will have us!

Gorgeous hotel with the best service I've ever experienced at a hotel. Gorgeous rooms and amenities. The food was good, if the choices were a little limited, but there were a variety of restaurants to choose from. The beach was perfect, wonderful clean sand, and lovely area.

Everything is SUPERB at the Kahala resort and hotel! I'm a travel agent and my husband and I have traveled the world and stayed at very nice hotels and this is definitely at the top of our list of favorite hotels. Details like the fresh flower lei and cool towel upon check in to the turn down service with complimentary water bottles and slippers at bedside are appreciated. Had some local friends visit our suite and they can't wait to visit again for their own staycation :) We absolutely loved the view of the frolicking dolphins from our balcony. Equally impressed with the photo wall of past guests which included everyone from Princess Diana to former President Obama. Looking forward to staying here again next trip to Oahu!

In beautiful kahala. We stayed two nights. Service was what made the stay. Hotel is older but made the stay. The staff was outstanding in all regards. We stayed with our 16 month old. One of the most child friendly staffs we ever experienced. Everyone was very good to us from check in to valet to check out. The beach, the babysitting, the dolphin lagoon, and restaurant were all great. We highly recommend this property.

The very special atmosphere the Kahala promotes, so naturally, was much appreciated and makes all the difference. Accommodations are top notch and the staff is the best in hospitality... a very unique combination that definitely equals five stars! Do not miss the Kahala brunch on Sundays! A great place for locals as well as guests.

The Kahala is a wonderful Hotel and convenient location. The beach is beautiful. The staff is very friendly and welcoming and the restaurants are great! Our whole vacation was wonderful and we are looking forward to coming back!

The Kahala Hotel is an amazing hotel. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. They offered complimentary beach chairs and shuttle service. No extra resort fees. The dolphin lagoon, sea turtles and stingrays areas were nice. The restaurant were good. This is without a doubt my favorite place of all places I’ve stayed. I will for sure stay again.

This property has a large beach access where you can lay on the sand or dine by the ocean. They also have ponds with sea turtles, mantas and fish. They have trained dolphins that you can watch or swim with. Although this place is expensive, I felt it was worth it to have a relaxing beach experience. The food and drinks are excellent as well.

Myself, my husband and our five boys had a wonderful vacation at the Kahala Resort. We did the Dolphin adventure which was such an awesome experience for the kids and ourselves. We took advantage of the complimentary photo service on-site at the hotel by Pacific Dream Photography, we had the lovely Loryn shoot our session in the morning! Loryn was SO good capturing photos of our big family of 7! I highly highly recommend taking advantage of the on-site photography and capturing your vacation!!

This resort is fantastic. Every detail was excellent. From the moment we pulled up outside with the valets, to the extraordinary front desk service, assistance, suggestions and smiles from Deneen... check in was great. Our ocean front room in the tower is excellent. This is Hawaii! The Buffett breakfast was off the charts...This resort is outstanding!

A magical-High end experience! This hotel truly knows how to make you feel special in every aspect; from the professional courteous staff, to the attention to details. Our room had a mountain view-which was peaceful and relaxing! our updated room was compatible with all of our apple equipment! The housekeeping staff truly goes above and beyond when cleaning the room every morning and evening. During our stay we also, booked a photoshoot at the hotel, given that November has unpredictable weather, we had to reschedule because the photographer did agree with me that the sky was too dark and grey; and that is when I knew that Loryn-the photographer truly cared about the final product. In my eyes, she truly cares about capturing the memories plus the breathtaking views. During our shoot, we took my maternity photos of myself, family photos with my husband and daughter, and we even took Holiday photos for our Holiday card. The whole experience with Loryn was very unique and special because she cared about the details...she had all the angles covered making sure we had and the memories we wanted to capture for our photos! Even my 5 year old had fun during the shoot. I highly recommend Loryn-Pacific Dream Photography for your photo shoot, I had over 100 plus shots to choose from and it was heartbreaking to have to select our photos for our package because they were all AMAZING!

We returned to Hawaii for our yearly trip and decided to try out the Kahala Resort. As we prepared for our visit, we researched the hotel and was pleased to see they offered a complimentary photo shoot with your stay. Being a family with two young girls (one who is not fond of photo taking) we figured this would be the perfect place to hopefully get some tear free pictures.After a few days enjoying the pool, and the beautiful beach Kahala offers, we booked our sunrise photo shoot with Loryn as she was highly reccomended. Our photo shoot experience was more than I ever expected. Loryn was so patient with us and eager to get us a variety of photos. She made our 2 year old feel so special that she danced and laughed which resulted in the most beautiful pictures. The following day we met up for our viewing and were shocked to see a video that included photos as well as video clips Loryn he taken throughout the shoot.Needless to say we enjoyed the Kahala resort and it's beautiful beach but we loved our experience with Loryn and Pacific Dream Photography. Thank you for giving us so many memories of our trip.

We stayed at this hotel for our wedding and our anniversary and could not have asked for a better experience. The rooms are spacious, beautiful and well-maintained, the staff is attentive, professional, and friendly. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the ocean views are gorgeous! The kahala has plenty of open space and yet feels more intimate than the hotels down in Waikiki. It is the best place on island to get away from it all while still being close enough to the city to do all the things you might want to do. I can't wait to go back!!

Just amazing from start to finish. Special thanks to the concierge team and the bell hops. One of the top hotels in the world I reckon. Smallest of points to question is sometimes the call buttons did not work at the poolside for drinks or food. Other than that everyone was wonderful and fully deserved 5*

Our experience at the Kahala resort was simply amazing. It is a beautiful property set on a perfect beach. The staff was warm and attentive. I loved the dolphin pool. It was so relaxing watching the dolphins play. The rooms are large and the restaurants are amazing. There is a very nice mall right down the street, so additional shopping and more dining options are close by. The Kahala is a short drive to Hanauma Bay snorkeling and the amazing views at Diamond Head. They even run a shuttle into downtown Waikiki. The Kahala has it all. I will definitely be going back to stay with them again. It was a perfect vacation.

I have to start by saying this was our 3rd visit in 4 years so clearly The Kahala has many positives as we do keep coming back.The service is world class.It was disappointing on checking in that our room wasn't available even though we had been in touch with the hotel to request an early check in (12pm) due to have small children. We were told we would be able to get into the room before 2pm which in fact turned out to be 3:05pm.Due to year on year price rises on the suites we booked a dolphin room, however our room had no privacy and as soon as we opened the sliding door we were greeted with a group with the dolphins all looking over and in and no privacy at all with the rooms on either side. We changed rooms and again the service was exceptional and very understanding and did look after us with this change all be it we waited another hour.We had two beds instead of one king and the two beds are really a bit of a joke as they are like king singles. So even my wife and I sharing one bed each with a child 2/4 it was still way to small. *Roll away beds we were told were only available in the suites. We'd have to really weigh up other options for our October 2018 trip especially as prices just keep rises year on year above what seems reasonable.

We have never stayed at a more hospitable or gorgeous hotel. Every part of our stay, from checking in to checking out was superb. We were able to get an upgrade to our room which had a balcony, a beautiful view of the mountains at night, and a partial view of the ocean during the day (thanks Jacqui!). We loved how peaceful the whole resort was. We thought we would have spent the majority of our time at the pool but instead walked 5 more steps to the beach! There were always multiple people ready to help us with the set up of our lounge chairs and towels (but it was such an easy set up that we did it for ourselves most of the time). All of the food we ate at the different onsite restaurants was delicious and again served with such warm hospitality (we especially enjoyed our service from Randy at the Plumeria). My husband LOVED swimming with dolphins and wished he could have every day. We were so impressed with how many different things the Kahala had onsite that we only went down to Waikiki (on the free hotel shuttle, which saves you a $40 round trip taxi ride...) just once! The icing on the cake was our experience with Loryn and Pacific Dream Photography. We set up an appointment with ease and ended up having a sunrise session (which we HIGHLY recommend- the lighting was perfect and it wasn't even humid yet). Loryn did such a fabulous job on our pictures that we decided we had to buy all of them, and the video she made! Such a timeless keepsake. We hope to get our photos done with her next time we make it to Oahu. Thank you to everyone at the Kahala for such a five star experience!

This is a wonderful hotel with style and ambiance. The lobby area retains the grace of a grand hotel, the restaurants are all excellent, the beach is beautiful, the location is convenient without the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, the dolphin lagoon makes it all special, and the staff is generally very friendly and efficient. The concierge staff was especially helpful! My only complaint is that with one notable exception, the pool/beach staff aren't very helpful. They keep the portable beach lounges stacked up and good luck finding an attendant who will offer to unstack and arrange a few for you. We did manage to attract the attention of the attendants when we sat for a few minutes, after lunch, on one of the many empty cabana lounges, in the grassy area outside the dolphin wing. An attendant quickly and curtly informed us that we could not sit here unless we rented it for the rest of the day. Ok, we suspected these had to be rented but weren't sure, and there was nowhere else to sit there, with the portables all stacked up. Did the attendant offer to unstack a few of the portables or to retrieve towels? No. So I unstacked several until I found some without bird droppings. Not the service I expect at a hotel the quality and price of this one.

Loved it. Service impeccable. Staff were friendly and even when we had no cash to tip upon check in we were treated like royalty. Amenities and restaurants top class. This place is special. Get pampered at the day spa or get close and personal with the dolphins. There are also sting rays and sea turtles. Set right on the beach, the Kahala has set the bar to a very high standard. Can’t wait to visit again. On the pricey side but worth every penny.

This was my fourth visit to the Kahala, although the last visit was in 2004. Returning to this property was like putting on a favorite sweater - it envelops you with familiarity and a warm comfortable feeling. The sense of pride and Hawaiiana culture is everywhere. This hotel is truly a classic which ages very well.The staff are particularly amazing. They all displayed a genuine warmth and helpfulness.We had an ocean view room with a lanai on the top floor of the tower. I don't think there is a bad view room on the property. I've stayed previously in a room with the scenic view and found the view of the nearby hills very soothing, and a room with the dolphin lanai puts you close to the action of the loveable dolphins.The room was very clean and well designed with his and her sink areas and closets in the bathroom. The décor not only gives you a sense of place, but is reminiscent of Old Hawaii (without seeming out of date).The breakfast buffet is amazing. Loved the waffles with coconut syrup. We dined in two of the restaurants in the evening. Their casual restaurant, Plumeria, was a bit of a disappointment. The menu offerings were not particularly tempting to either my husband or me. We felt the food we ordered was large in portion size and uninspired.Hoku's, however, was a different story. The menu choices were more interesting and the food was delicious. Our server went out of her way to make sure my husband's prime rib was cooked to his liking. A wonderful dining experience. One evening we tried a local bistro, 12th Avenue Grill, recommended by the concierge. Also excellent.The resort location on this peaceful stretch of beach in an upscale residential area cannot be beat. You are away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but close enough to visit if you feel so inclined. The dolphins bring an added experiential dimension, whether you just watch their antics or participate in one of their hands on experiences with the dolphins.All in all a very relaxing stay. We are not going to wait another 13 years to revisit this lovely place.

the Kahala is truly a beautiful hotel right on the beach. Rooms are spacious and lovely. Staff is very helpful and friendly. The location is very good if you want to be on the south side of the island. Convenient to the highway but not too close so you don't hear any noise. Convenient shopping and good restaurants near by. Very close to Diamond Head and Waikiki in a lovely residential neighborhood.

We recently had family photos take with Loryn and her team and I couldn't recommend high enough. We travel to Hawaii yearly and decided this year we would have some family photos done. The communication in organising the photo shoot was fantasic. Loryn answered all my questions and booking in the session was so easy! Alexis our photographer was professional and fun! Alexis made us feel at ease and knew exactly what we were trying to achieve.

Every aspect about the Kahala makes you feel like FAMILY, or like you are vacationing at a friend's luxurious home. Our stay there was absolute perfection.Our extended family took a vacation together at the Kahala, taking advantage of their "stay 3 nights, get 4th free" and the fantastic packages at Costco which include 2 complimentary breakfast buffets (which is about $70 for one person.)When we went to the bar one day (the restaurant was closed), we asked if they could make us root beer floats. After a beat the bartender said, "I'm sure we can figure out a way." They sent someone to who-knows-where to find the ingredients, and our entire family indulged.We also had a wonderful time looking at jewelry at Hildgund. The sales-lady was hilarious and so unpretentious. I believe her name was Teruko. My father ended up purchasing a lovely ring for my mother and gave it to her in front of the entire family. What a wonderful memory.Everyone on the staff goes above and beyond. When I asked if the embroidered laundry bags were available for sale, a staff member gave me one for free. One of my favorite amenities included with being a guest is a FREE PHOTO SHOOT with Pacific Dream Photography. What a great idea! I would have a photo shoot from every hotel I ever went to if it was offered to me. You are allowed one per room so we did an afternoon shoot and a sunset shoot. It was fun to have the different lighting. The photographers (we had 2 of them) were so patient and suggested lots of different locations on the grounds (of course EVERYWHERE is stunning) and ideas for fun poses we could do as a family. It was wonderful to check off "Holiday card photo" from my "to do" list as an added bonus!I also love that the pool/jacuzzi area are open 24 hours a day. EVERY pool in the world should be open those hours. We went swimming at 8pm one day and had the entire area to ourselves.And the food is AMAZING. My favorite place to eat was at THE TERRACE. The wagyu sliders were perfect and the haupia lumpia were amazing. My daughter also had a blast having her first formal tea service.Although I haven't mentioned it yet, the hotel rooms are also amazing. Spacious and beautifully appointed.BTW, if you get the Costco package it also includes car rental and free onsite parking (at least the package we got included that!) Plus 2% back if you are executive costco member.My entire family can't wait to go back!

Where do I start? This resort exceeded my every expectation. My husband and I went to Hawaii for the first time to celebrate our 10th anniversary and my birthday and I’m so glad we chose this resort. The service from valet, front desk, concierge, room service, to housekeeping was outstanding. I wanted to be close enough to Waikiki beach but wanted to wanted the time I spent at the beach to be relaxing. The resort did that for us. The beach was beautiful and peaceful. I’ll certainly return.

Very good hotel, great service, excellent location away from chaos downtown but only short distance away, wonderful sunrise and sunset views. Would recommend to anyone and will return upon any stay on Ohau.

With most impressive appearance inside the hotel, gorgeous beach and the yummy food, we really have had a good time with my spouse to spend our twenty fifth marriage anniversary. The amicable manner of their staff and their professionalism have impressed us as well. It really deserves for being a five-stars hotel. The dolphin quest center has provided a very good opportunity for us to play around with the dolphins, which is not common in other hotels and we really had a happy and unforgettable moment . The availability to watch sunrise (within the walking distance at the beach) and sunset (a few minutes’ drive at the near-by area) is another free attraction. Meanwhile, there were several newly-wed couples taking pictures inside the hotel and the beach by photographers. This spells the romantic and cozy environment . Looking at some celebrities' pictures being posted on a corridor, who visited this hotel in the past decades continuously, I understand why they chose this hotel.We like this hotel very much and we would be back if we go to Honolulu again although we are not celebrities.

We stayed here for our honeymoon and it's simply amazing! The staff do everything they can to make it a wonderful stay. The hotel have thought of everything so you receive the best service possible! It was amazing that you would see it was busy at breakfast as the hotel is huge, but throughout the day, it didn't feel crowded as the hotel has so much space with various parts of the hotel available to relax. We hardly left the hotel in our 6 days there as there isn't any need to as a selection of restaurants are on site, spa, shops...everything! Thank you to all the staff that made our honeymoon perfect!

We stayed at the end of our Hawaiian tour at The Kahala resort for a couple of nights. The hotel is situated at the end of a private road outside Honolulu in a quiet residential area so we recommend that you rent a car if you plan on going sight-seeing (I think you can even rent a car at the hotel). We were welcomed by a smiling team with flower leis. As well as previous stays in other hotels, we were left to find our hotel room ourselves which seems to be common in Hawaii. Our room was modern and vast with the garden facing the dolphins lagoon (no ocean view). We spent hours in the patio watching them play and loved it! The hotel is the house of other aquatic animals: one manta ray and two turtles, which made the happiness of young and old. The resort is family-friendly: there were a lot of family with young children when we stayed. The hotel has a lot of rooms and the common areas can become very busy so be prepared to share your space, but our room was in another building and was very quiet. Good to know: we were able to use the hospitality suite to refresh ourselves before our flight. Overall it was a lovely place to stay outside the bustle of Waikiki beach, with a great staff and nice amenities.

Great Hotel...Definitely coming back again. We stayed on the 9th floor and had a great view of the ocean and the pool. Everyone around the area confirmed that we were staying in the best hotel in Oahu. Make sure you use the concierge service they are the best at getting you activities booked to keep you entertained.

Let’s start with the location: right behind Diamond head... the breeze is an added bonus to this enchanting resort. You fell like you are in our own private beach and the amenities make you forget the premium price you pay for the room. One highlight to note from a tech guy as me. Love the beach cabanas with a wireless al remote that allows to call specifically for extra towels or food and drinks service. Speaking of service look for Kelyn: not only she is very prompt and attentive, she also sports one of the best smiles of the island! Thank you Kahala for making this even a more unforgettable time in our Hawaiian paradise.

From the Ohana greeting at check in, to the attention to every little detail - our stay was like something from a romance novel. This is not a flashy, phony, over the top opulent show off style hotel. This is authentic Ohana charm at every turn, every touch. The high count linens and soft tropical tones in the carpets and decor are the first clue that a stay here is special. All the staff offer genuine greetings and learn your favorites so quickly. The things that will bring us back again and again are the ways this resort's staff made us 'feel'.

My Family and I do an annual trip to Hawaii and as part of the trip we do a family photo session. We have been using Pacific Dream Photography for our photo's for the last two years. Always a great experience with the staff and photographs. Alexis's was our photographer this time and she did and excellent job we love our family photos. Thanks!

Oh My Goodness this Resort is PERFECT EVERYTHING about it the staff are incredible, The service attentive, the resort simply stunning. The only sad thing was we were just one night having spent 3 (in a terrible hotel in Hilo) before hand then joining a cruise. I WILL BE back for an extended stay to totally enjoy everything this hotel has to offer.I cannot say enough about how helpful and friendly the staff were. We were allowed to check in early AND were upgraded to an ocean view room the entireplace was WOW WOW WOW

We love the Kahala Resort and have stayed here many times. I had not known about Pacific Dream Photography until our last visit in September. I booked a complimentry session with Loryn a month prior to our visit. The weather was a little overcast but she assured us it is better for photos. She took family photos and then senior photos for my daughter. Loryn was so awesome to work with, she is very kind and caring and the resort has the perfect scenary with the palm trees and ocean for a backdrop. We loved the photos so much that we bought a package. She made a video of our photo shoot that is so touching and sweet I tear up everytime I watch it. I highly recommend Pacific Dream Photography and Loryn.

We stayed at The Kahala Hotel for our 10th wedding anniversary. It was the perfect place to celebrate! It was one of the best places we have ever stayed at (we have traveled extensively and stayed at many luxury hotels) and we would love to go back when we visit Hawaii again. We also booked a photography session with Pacific Dreams Photography a week before leaving for Hawaii which is highly recommended and an absolute must! We chose to take the pictures around sunset and every single picture came out so gorgeous it was definitely hard to pick the favorites. The staff at Pacific Dreams was so accommodating and worked with our tight schedule with viewing the pictures (only time we could view our pictures was 8am since we were flying out that morning). Our photographer stayed late in the night to edit our photos so we could see them early in the morning before hopping on a plane; we are thankful to have chosen such a great company to take our anniversary photos!
user_name:
maryyu2017
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my second visit to the fabulous Kahala. The rooms are spacious with large bathrooms. We enjoyed the complimentary buffet breakfast each morning, the Seaside Grill for lunch and Arancinis for dinner. It's so peaceful and we requested beach lounges at the end of the beach under the tree for shade so they set us up there. This is my go to hotel on Oahu. They have a complimentary shuttle to Waikiki which we didn't use as we weren't there to shop, but it's good to know you can. All the staff are so friendly. I can't wait for my next visit!

We have been staying at the Kahala for over thirty five years. It is still a wonderful hotel, and a welcome break away from the crowds of Waikiki. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. The grounds are lovely. We always stay in the wing that overlooks the driveway and ocean - you can see the car park - but this really doesn't matter as it is low level. The 'pay for three nights stay for four' is a good deal, especially as the most wonderful breakfast in included in the rate. Join their rewards club (its free) and you receive $50 resort credit per room per day.

Booked this for our honeymoon for a week in Hawaii (travelled USA rest of time). We wanted somewhere quiet & peaceful but this was anything but. It was absolutely full of Japanese families. There were screaming babies & children all around the pool, beach, in the hotel and parents yelling at them, which was quite stressful. We ended up cutting our 1 week stay down to 2 nights & left for another hotel.The service at the hotel was brilliant however & the manager was very understanding about our issue.It is also a lovely setting.I’m not so sure about the dolphins & tortoises in the pools there though, I feel that they needed more space than they have.

This was our third say at the Kahala Resort. As before it was pleasant, relaxing, pristinely clean/. We were in Oahu for a convention which was held at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Aware of the lackluster room conditions at the HHV we chose to stay at Kahala. Good decision!. Away from the hustle bustle of Waikiki but close enough to be an easy drive to convention activities. I highly recommend this property anyone staying on Oahu.

I recently stayed at The Kahala for the first part of my Honeymoon and it was a DREAM. The hotel itself it about 20 minutes outside of the busy downtown area of Waikiki so if you want a peaceful trip and a gorgeous beach than this is your hotel! The room was very nice with a super comfy bed and a HUGE jack and jill bathroom which was a major plus. The separate room with a headed toilet seat was a nice touch in addition to the huge bath tub and shower. We had an ocean facing room in the "Diamond Head" wing but I would recommend asking for a room in the "Koko Crater" wing because the sunrise views over Koko Crater are AMAZING. Our room had an ocean view but was over the main parking area of the hotel so it wasn't directly on the beach. We didn't have a car but the parking fee is an additional cost. The staff was super friendly and we received a lay and cool towel upon check in. Every morning we received an "aloha" from maids in the hallway. This hotel caters to a more Japanese clientele and there was a wedding almost everyday we stayed there. The hotel is situated on the most perfect white sand beach with calm aqua waters which we swam in everyday. Unfortunately it was very windy when we stayed but that didn't stop us from sitting on the beach! We were almost the only ones sitting out there everyday. The pool is small so we didn't spend much time there but there were always an open chairs. It was so much fun walking past the dolphin lagoon every day and seeing them playing and swimming around, although I do feel bad that they are trapped in there. The breakfast buffet was expensive and left much to be desired so if you have a car grab food at Whole Foods nearby if you can. Their Italian restaurant on site was amazing though and highly recommend. The best part about this hotel is you are away from the crazy downtown area but can be there in about 20 minutes via Uber or their free shuttle which we used a couple of times to explore restaurants and nightlife. The only downside to staying here was that we didn't receive anything special for our honeymoon, no treats, chocolate or champagne. I think a little hospitality would have gone a long way but either way I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Our family just returned from an amazing time at the Kahala .. We had 3 of our young grandkids with us .. and my kids. My husband and I had come 17 years ago and loved it so we wanted our family to experience it too. When we checked in they had leis for all of us cold towels and turtle stuffed animals for the kids. Their welcome was the best we have ever experienced .. We had a dolphin lagoon room and an ocean view room. It was wonderful sitting on our patio and watching the dolphins. Our grandkids were mesmerized, they came so close to our patio as they were swimming around the lagoon. The kids felt the dolphins were watching them and talking to them.There were so many family things to do .. We loved beach, for the kids the mild waves was just wonderful and they loved the kiddie pool with the tiled turtles. The grounds are beautiful and in the evening they are even more spectacular. We loved the breakfast included with our room ,, the Hawaiian french toast with the coconut syrup was divine. Our server was so cheerful and really nice to the kids. We always appreciate. The Buffet breakfast has so many choices and the bacon was some of the best I've ever had. All of the food was great ... I also want to comment on the staff. The entire staff was amazing from Lynn who checked us in, to the guy helping us with lounge chairs and a small table for our stuff. They were just there with smiles and greeting us with Aloha. I can't wait until we can come again and maybe stay a little longer. One more thing to add about the value of our reservation. We booked a signature rate which included buffet breakfast daily and 100.00 resort credit... so that was a major extra value to counter act the price .. The kids were free. The rooms were very spacious as well as beautiful and the bathrooms were very large.

The Kahala is located at the end of a quiet, neighborhood street. It is a more secluded resort which made it really quiet and serene. This was the perfect location for our honeymoon. We were wow'd from the moment we checked in. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The pool, dolphin experience, restaurants, lobby, rooms, and shops are all beautifully maintained and staffed with friendly faces. There are plenty of amenities that this resort offers and it has plenty of techy options without interrupting your desire to disconnect from the world. The beach is fantastic and well maintained. It was not crowded at all and for being a "public" beach, I was worried that it would have too many children running around being disturbing but it was not. We had a fantastic, relaxing time here and will be returning because 1 week was just not enough time!

This was my first hotel stay in Hawaii and I was amazed when I entered. The Kahala is very clean, up to date, and quiet. The staff was attentive and very helpful. We had a bottle of cold champagne waiting for us when we entered the room, CLASSY! The air condition was nice and cold. We had a great view of the ocean. This hotel has turndown service and they leave slippers by the bed and chocolate. The bathroom was big and the best part was the toilet which is also a washlet. The location of the hotel is great for watching sunrises and is very quiet in the mornings. I will definitely come back to this hotel!
user_name:
NYCtraveler0072010
New York City, New York

review_body: If you want serious glamour, privacy and an escape from the masses of Waikiki then you only have one choice – The Kahala Resort and Spa. Located 5km southwest of Diamond Head on the coast of the posh Kahala neighbourhood. The hotel boasts a stretch of white sand beach, so you won’t have to worry about fighting crowds for a spot on the shore. The rooms are one of the largest in Hawaii with his and hers bathroom and wardrobes, and deep soaking tubs. Sleep with your balcony doors open to the sounds of the sea.The Kahala grounds are beautiful from the Orchid stairway through to the cascading waterfall. They even encompass a lagoon where guests can swim with bottlenose dolphins, or just admire the sea turtles swimming past.

Every single staff person that we came in contact with from the welcome to the send-off was exceptional. We received orchid leis on arrival and champagne in our room. (Could be because we were celebrating our anniversary) The rooms were spotless, comfortable and views breathtaking. Valet service was prompt and the guys were so friendly. Food at Arancino was amazing. I wish our grandchildren were with us as the dophins were so much fun to watch. It was sad to leave such a place where one is treated like royalty. Never fear, we will be back! Much aloha to the staff and management of Kahala.

The Kahala manages to be a classic old-school hotel in the best way while providing the amenities of a resort. The atmosphere is soothing and relaxing. The food is outstanding and the service is excellent. The rooms are updated and clean but again, still classic. Coming here is a beautiful escape.

It was my husband and I's first stay at the Kahala and we will definitely be back. After staying at hotels on Waikiki for many years, we really appreciate how uncrowded and secluded the Kahala is. The hotel grounds is beautiful and we just love the nice and quiet (almost private) beach right in front of the hotel. Check-in was smooth. Was given an upgrade to a Scene Lanai room since we booked through Virtuoso. The room itself is a bit outdated and starting to show wear and tear but clean and functional. Shuttle service to town is very convenient. The beach! Oh I can just lay on the beach lounger for days.Dining was a hit and miss. Room service on our 1st night was mediocre at best. However, we really enjoyed the daily buffet breakfast at the Plumeria Beach House. We also dined at the Italian restaurant on the property one night and had an awesome dinner.The only thing I feel lacking from this place is the service. Service was okay but nothing exceptional. Bell staff was almost non-existent. We were never asked if we needed help with our luggage or transportation arrangement. Front desk staff was polite but almost robotic. We just expected more from a gorgeous, classy place like this but unfortunately we weren’t completely satisfied with the service that we have received here. Nevertheless, we would still go back for the breakfast and awesome beach.

Our fifth visit to the Kahala Hotel and it remains our favourite in Honolulu. Situated just 15 mins from down town Waikiki, it is so much more peaceful, with its 'own' beautiful beach, than the hotels along Waikiki beach. The complimentary shuttle service to the local mall and Waikiki is fabulous, and allows you to get to Waikiki for serious shopping etc. it is heaven to return to the resort each time though! Service remains excellent, from bell hop, front desk, housekeeping and the delightful Steve and Gene in the bar, nothing is ever too much trouble. Although understanding of their long association with Dolphin Quest, it is really no longer 'enjoyable' seeing dolphins used for tourist attractions and this should be something that the hotel considers in this day and age. Overall though, this hotel remains our firm choice when visiting Hawaii each year.

The Kahala is perhaps the classiest hotel we've ever stayed at. Everything was first rate, from the staff to the room to the quality of the food in the restaurants. My only quibble was with the iHome clock/radio in the room, difficult to set (there was no manual) and inefficient once set, overly technical and virtually useless. The beach there was also delightful, uncrowded and with a nice sandy bottom. All-in-all, a wonderful experience.

The Kahala is a bit hard to describe given the stunning decor, service, staff, restaurants, location, cleanliness, view, beach, dolphins, etc. What a stunning facility that would be hard to top ANYWHERE. We had a stunning view of the ocean, ate multiple meals at the hotel, enjoyed breakfast on the first floor sitting outside on the edge of the beach, watching a Japanese wedding that was about to occur on the beach almost in front of us. If you do decide to try this exquisite hotel, please make sure you try at least one of their in house restaurants and also spend time with the dolphins at the hotel's pond: truly memorable. Also I believe that for an extra charge you can "swim and play with the dolphins".One more thing: the location of the Kahala is on the "other side" of Diamond Point and this is a stunning advantage. It is located in a private high end neighborhood, the ONLY hotel in the area, next to a private golf course and NOT on Waikiki. But hey, a rental car or cab gets you to Waikiki in less than 15 minutes. Perfect.For that special occasion, this is a sure bet to use for your visit. You won't be disappointed.

From the moment we checked in to the moment we left this beautiful hotel, we felt like royalty. The staff from the desk agents, to maids, to bellmen, to valet were all so very kind and made our stay here absolutely wonderful. Our day started out horrible until we got to the hotel and then because of the staff, they made all our worries go away. We ate at all of the restaurants on the hotel grounds and ALL of them were absolutely fabulous!. We definitely want to come back again. Our basic room looked like a suite, we were truly blessed. I can just imagine what their suites look like. The dolphins in the pools were beautiful! All of it is just so wonderful and welcoming. We didn't want to leave.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Kahala Hotel & Resort. It is ideally located with its own superb beach-front some twenty minutes away from downtown Honolulu. That isn't a problem by-the-way as the hotel provides a shuttle service into various points in town. Right from the start of our stay we experienced outstanding customer service from all the members of staff we encountered. It was obvious from the onset that all staff are trained to a high level in dealing with their guests, this has to be applauded.Our room was spacious and well equipped. Sleep quality was excellent. Amenities and facilities were top notch. Dining options were good and menu options were interesting and varied. The private beach was splendid. All-in-all we enjoyed our stay immensely. My only personal reservation about the place was the dolphin lagoon. I found it hard to see these beautiful creatures used as a money-making attraction for the hotel. They should be allowed to roam the oceans free, as nature intended.

Stressful check-in....we had booked a King Lanai Lagoon Room but upon arrival they only had two doubles and that was not ok with us. Long story short we met Rainui a Front Desk Manager who came and showed us several options with his colleague and we were beyond satisfied with views of my dolphins and ocean. He exceeded expectations...they were both soft spoken and refined gentlemen who knew how to please and welcome. I would like to also thank him for the amazing cheese platter that had beautiful soft cheeses and crackers and the grapes were so sweet. We wrapped it up and had again the following day. The champagne was so welcoming.You outdid yourself! We appreciate your handling with such grace and what you did came from sincerity and professionalism.Hotel, food and beach is all one needs.The Kahala has it all right here.

Exceptional service, attention to details, impeccable grounds and beach with island flair is what the Kahala is all about. Did not get off to a good start but staff quickly made a room change and the vacation was a huge success. Great food, amazing beach, and a song playing on the TV when you turn it on that will be etched in my memory for ever. Mahalo nui loa and Aloha Kahala until next time.

Aloha nui,Last night, a portion of our family dined at The Kahala Hotel & Resort at the Plumeria Beach House. We celebrated the 18th Birthday of our second daughter. It was Kama'āina Thursday last night. Wow! What a special treat. It comes with a choice of a main dish, the salad bar and the dessert bar. We appreciate the kind service given by the staff. Mahalo for making our daughter's birthday dinner a special one. We dine at the hotel every once in a while as it has delicious 'ono food, great service and one of the best views in all of O'ahu. If you have a chance to visit, please do. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do. Aloha!Kama Hopkins
