Stayed 2 nights..not long enough. Spacious rooms with comfy beds. Bath had a separate tub and walk-in shower. High-tech toilets similar to those found in Japan. Hotel is located on a beautiful stretch of beach. Cordial hotel staff were outstanding. Everyone went the extra mile!The hotel is just a short drive from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The hotel operates a shuttle if you want to explore the city and then come back to the tranquil beauty of The Kahala.Their "wall of fame" has pictures of famous people who have stayed at The Kahala.. every President since Nixon, Princess Diana, well known entertainers, sports figures and many others. When I saw that Tom Selleck stayed there, I knew I was in the right hotel.Will definitely return to The Kahala on my next trip to Honolulu!

The hotel grounds were beautiful, restaurants were all very good, and beach was amazing. Also, the large lagoon and ponds with dolphins, turtles, fish and other animals make even a walk across the hotel memorable. The service was top notch and there were a host of options for food, evening drinks and music as well as dolphin activities, or just relaxing beach / pool time. The location is great, as it's a close enough cab ride to Waikiki to go for a meal or shopping, but far enough were it feels secluded. My only gripe is the room condition, it's very nice but could use a bit of an upgrade - i'm being picky now as there is no reason to spend more time than is necessary to sleep in the rooms when the beach and hotel are so amazing.
user_name:
juanqixote
New York City, New York

review_body: Enjoyed the facility and found the staff to be responsive. Dining experiences were a disappointment tho and the location, in the middle of an upscale but still a generic suburban neighborhood didn't lend it a true resort vibe.

We would just like to say that "The Kahala Hotel and Resort"is a beautiful place to stay. Not only of its elegance of what you see, but also of the people that work there. You are welcomed with warm smiles and friendly individuals, they make u feel right at home. We just had our wedding there and we're very happy we did! Thanks to all the staff there, that made our special day one to remember. John & Nizza)

Always a great hotel with top service. Efficient.Roomy rooms. Quiet so never hear anything in hallway.You leave room and it is straightened so always clean.Food very good.Had a wheelchair for me when I had problems walking.

This hotel is an amazing place to have your wedding. It's very private compared to Waikiki, the staff is very professional and helpful, the food is amazing, and there is nothing more to be desired. You are taken care of by everyone from start to finish.

We enjoyed one night post-cruise at the Kahala before our return home. I wish we could have stayed longer. We arrived early, so our room wasn't ready. The hotel offered my mom, who was suffering from an illness, rest in a complimentary relaxation room until the room was available. Upon arrival, we received a warm welcome with leis and a refreshing towel as well as a free upgrade to a room with a balcony. The grounds and beach were impeccable with a lagoon filled with dolphins, green sea turtles and rays to enjoy watching. We had a wonderful lunch at the cafe with a beautiful view of the ocean. The room was very clean and had all of the amenities we needed. The staff, the food, the grounds and the room were all memorable and leave you looking forward to a return trip.

We had my son's wedding at the Kahala in July, there were 90 guests from all over the world. The staff was very helpful in all the planning, the room accomodations and banquets. We were very happy with the arrangements and everyone had an enjoyable time. This was not my first time to the Kahala, I have stayed many time over the last 30 years and have not been disappointed with the service and the surroundings. A very memorable time!

Me and my fiance were in love with this hotel. The beach is just couple steps away from the hotel. There are 6 dolphins in the lagoon along with sea turtles and Stingray, if you are lucky, you may see them right at your room's balcony. The services were given was excellent and staffs are really friendly. I was there early before the check in time, however they still check me in and their front desk staff - Ms Linda was very kind that put me on waiting list for the first available room that is ready and she even gave me a call when the room was ready. Breakfast was good, there are both indoor and outdoor seating, which i think outdoor is better as you could enjoy the ocean at the same time while having the yummy breakfast, just that there might be a possibility of a wait around 10 - 15 mins while busy timing (around 8-9 something), however, there's a door that connecting to the lagoon which you could just walk out and say hello to the dolphins while waiting for table. :)My experience at The Kahala hotel was just really enjoyable and definitely will come back again soon!

Loved this Hotel old world charm. Choice of beach or pool. Food was great. Drinks where great. Loved fact that they had the dolphin program can swim with them In a respectable manner. Great place a little out of Waikiki but felt like the real Hawaii notTouristy. Thoroughly recommend.

Loved this hotel. Not overly crowded. Fantastic service. Has a dolphin program and you can watch the dolphins during the day. There are also two separate ponds with a sting ray and two green turtles. Smaller private beach made this a perfect spot for those who want to get away from crowds. We loved our room on the beach side where we literally were steps from the ocean. Pricey but worth it.

Recently went with friends to celebrate a birthday. The staff was friendly and provided excellent service.It is great to have Ginny Tiu, pianist back at the Veranda! Listening to her music is so relaxing and the backdrop of the moon reflecting off of the pool and ocean reminds you that you are in paradise at The Kahala.Come to experience the beauty and graciousness of the staff. It was like a mini vacation.

We decided to stay at The Kahala as a compromise between those in the family who wanted Waikiki for the shopping and bars and me who was paying and wanted some relaxation! This is a great compromise - a few miles out the hustle but close enough to go in to shop and dine. The hotel itself is great - large rooms, great service and no feeling of being busy, even during US public holidays. The beech and pool areas have plenty of space to grab a deck chair and relax and the food at the restaurants on site is fantastic.

Reception was understaffed and I had to wait over 15 minutes to check in. Only one person at the desk. Hotel rooms and public areas have seen better days. Furniture scratched and chipped in my room. Tiles in bathroom stained. Comfortable bed. Old carpet. Hotel probably had its high light back inthe 1970s. I paid about USD 450 per night for my room Juliette Linai. I do not see much correlation between room rate and room and service. The pool is definitely too small for the hotel. Lots of children, very noisy. The beach is public. Hotel provides towel and lounge chair but no umbrella for shade. A cabana or anything that provides shade starts at US$68 per day, even if you only want to stay at the beach for only two hours. Beach was okay. Nothing special at all. Hokus was good but tasting menu was not exceptional. Lamb was overcooked and had to send back! Fish was iver cooked, fry as well. Appetizers were very good. Staff is used to guests who have not travelled extensively and/or dined around the world in 2 and 3 Michelin star restaurants or Relais Chateaux. Breakfast is busy and noisy. Buffet only and no a la carte. Stand in line and wait. Bring headphones. Seaside grill is good. Service friendly but lacking in etikette. Although my reservation was made and confirmed with my title as Mrs. Everypiece of paper, even the welcome note in my room as an unlimited Leaders Club Member was addressed to Mr. The General Manager Gerald Glennon blamed it on my travel agent or Leading Hotels although written confirmation contradicts this. Gym without air conditioning! I have visited over 20 leading hotels and this hotel is just not up to par. I will never return nor can I recommend this hotel to any one I know who understands quality and service. My stay at the Okura Hotel in Bangkok, 2 weeks prior to my stay at Khala was such a contrast! I loved it there albeit a very short layover stay of two nights.

I returned this past weekend to stay at the beautiful Kahala Hotel and Resort for the first time in many months, and instantly felt the warmth of the welcome from the valets and reception personnel for a returning guest. It was genuine and sincere. I also immediately noted they had been very busy making the hotel even more elegant and worthy of its global reputation. The new reception and boutiques area has been beautifully upgraded.For more than half a century, this bijou has been the retreat of visiting European and Middle Eastern Royals, Presidents, Prime Ministers and global music and screen stars. I love walking past their lobby level photo gallery of famous guests who have graced the Kahala over the years. I now understand why the Kahala has also been a firm favorite with the local community who have always been embraced by the hotel owners and management and have contributed to the unique and friendly culture that permeates all areas of the resort. They can now add me to that community list. This beautiful ocean-front hotel, nestled in tropical gardens with it's unique dolphin ponds, is a place that visiting guests and the local residents alike truly treasure. To think the resort's very secure and tranquil environment, just 12 minutes from the bustle of Waikiki and 20 minutes from the Ala Moana Mall and downtown Honolulu, is what I imagine the hotel VIP guests perhaps value above all else - I certainly do.While the food at the ocean-front Plumeria Restaurant or at the sophisticated Hoku's is as good as it gets, my favorite place is the comfortable and welcoming Veranda at sunset.... until late at night. The live music; friendly and attentive service and the comfort and beauty of the decor ( the Venetian glass chandeliers are spectaular) make this a very special gathering place. I love it !Being a resort, and not just a luxury hotel, means there are a wealth of activities including surfing and stand-up paddle board classes; a luxury spa; a very well-appointed fitness center with the latest equipment;, coastal sailing and of course the very, very special activity of swimming with the dolphins. On this trip I used the gym, the spa and just soaked up the calm and sunshine from the lanai and lawn of my beach-front suite. The suite itself had those signature grand old decor , furnishing and fixtures and very much reminded me of the 'old' Raffles in Singapore, the Oriental in Delhi or the Penninsular in Hong Kong. Like all truly great hotels, I had a wonderful feeling of wellbeing and indulgence throughout my weekend stay. In my opinion, the Kahala Hotel and Resort is my all-time favorite place to stay on Oahu.

Myself and family have been going to the Kahala Hilton since the 1070's. It is a wonderful place to relax and to be pampered. It is not centered around children, although activities are offered. One can arrange for outside activities around the island, so there is plenty to do.The Kahala is a consistently fine hotel with wonderful amenities and food. All rooms or suites that we have had offer excellent, expansive views whether ocean or mountainside. Service is generally excellent, and the beds are comfortable. Food is expensive but excellent. Taxis can be slow, but I don't know if the hotel has control over this matter. The hotel offers activities for children, and there is dolphin feeding to watch.

We just got back from vacationing in Hawaii where we spent four glorious nights at The Kahala. We are a family of 5 and we all agree that our stay was one of the best. The hotel and grounds are well kept and gorgeous. The staff was readily available at all times. Location is perfect. Also, cannot forget to mention Pacific Dream Photography. We had thought about getting some family pictures taken as our children are young adults and thought it may be one of our last chances to get us all together. We almost skipped it due to time and so much to see and do. In the end, we decided to squeeze it in and we are so grateful that we did. Possibly one of the best photo sessions that we have ever had (and we have had our share). Such a fun experience and the best souvenir we could come home with.

Having just returned from the Kahala (3rd trip in 4 years and my Family & I have been coming to the Kahala since 1985), I felt I must write a review. The Kahala is a haven on Oahu. A peaceful, spiritual dreamy resort that transports you back in time to the way Hawaii used to be......serene and far from the madding crowd. The service is impeccable and we are always made so welcome, the dolphins even welcome us back. We particularly love the double rainbowed views towards Koko Head and the calm ocean. If you are contemplating Hawaii, the Kahala is a must. And all run superbly by the charming Steve Tabiolo, who is literally turning the Kahala into an even more splendid place! He has a great team. The shuttle is so handy and Stephanie a wonderful driver. Chef Chea personalises fantastic food and makes the best sushi, Sheila bakes stunning white cakes, Heidi is a super housekeeper and keep the rooms beautifully, Jacob and Lloyd look after you at the pool, Miriam and her girls take care of you at the Plumeria, Cameron and team suggest where to go, Deann and Ying cover the front so well, Jasmine and Kelly take care of you with your bookings at the front. Everybody at the Kahala is lovely and kind.Go to the Kahala, release your mind, free your spirit, aloha nui loa....

Gorgeous hotel and beach. Professional staff. Food fine. Hotel catered very much for Japanese and Chinese customers/ even down to toilets!! Hotel messed up taxi pickup from airport and we had a fight fir them to admit responsibility!! Great location, courtesy bus was great.

I've stayed at many wonderful hotels and had some fantastic experiences however, I was caught by surprise when I pulled into the driveway and I was greeted with a warm aloha and addressed by name. How did you know who I was? I was there to meet a client and no one knew what kind of car I drive and the staff have never met me before. Once I arrived at the restaurant, I was addressed by name again. I was brought a glass of ice water and I asked if I may have water with no ice and was told, 'certainly,' with a smile. Often times, the servers seemed troubled when I give this request but not this server. Wonderful recommendations were made for lunch and the restaurant manager was approaching several tables asking how their food was and asked us, too. I was blown away again when I reached the lobby entrance to retrieve my car as it had already been brought around and the front was quite busy with people checking out. Something wonderful has happened to this property and I am thrilled. I will be return!

We won a trip to this hotel at a fundraiser so we didn't get to choose our room (and as a disclaimer we are not typically 5 star hotel types). We had a scenic room, no balcony. The room itself was quite large and the view of the golf course was nice enough. Wish we had a balcony. The bathroom was very large but stained tiles on the floor. Small refrigerator was a nice touch but to use a microwave it was $25. Everything here is extra. Pool cabanas are $160/day but we would go out at 5:00 after our day of sightseeing and they were empty and we had lovely sunset cocktails by the ocean. The ocean and beach is beautiful though the beach is small. So much better than staying in Waikiki! Maid services were very nice and turn down service with water and chocolates a nice touch but I hate having to ask the valet every time we wanted to take out the car. Parking was $32/day!!! We had a two bed (full sized) room and my son slept on a air mattress and daughter on the chaise. It was perfect since the beds were too small for two people. Upon checkout we were told it would be $175/night extra for the two kids!!! Why say the room can sleep 4 if they charge extra for the 2 kids?!? We complained and spoke with the manager and they removed the charge. Service throughout the hotel was lovely except for the Seaside Grill where the servers were quite inattentive. All in all it was quite a nice stay but everything quite pricy.

Would rate it higher if it wasn't relatively expensive and thus more expected. On the great side, this is the place if you are looking for a nice beach away from the hustle and bustle of other Hawaiian resorts. Not too crowded and not trying to be chic. Just laid back Hawaii with a touch of understated class. Staff is pleasant and helpful. On the not good side, it needs to have better pool situation. They are small and they need a decent adults only pool. The big drawback for us is no ice! No icemakers that guests can access. We needed ice for injury and other reasons. Had a difficult time getting it. Would never have assumed that at a first class resort. Asking staff is ok, but takes too long and obviously not a priority. Also, with the exception of Hoku's F&B needs to upgraded throughout, especially plummeria and in room service.

I was disappointed with my experience in this hotel. I found cleanliness to be an issue. It smelled very mildewy in the hallways and in our room. Rugs needed cleaning. Service was professional but not always available for how quiet the hotel felt. Huka's was a nice dining experience but pretty empty the night we went. Pool service was weak. There is one fairly small pool that was filled with kids. Gym was just okay. Equipment was dated, as is most of the hotel. The spa is very awkwardly located but the actual treatment rooms may be the best thing about the hotel. The beach offered very limited service.. It is located in a luxury neighborhood about 20 min from Waikiki. It may have been the time of year or a special holiday but the majority of guests in the hotel were visiting from Japan. The beach is very pretty. Overall I would choose another hotel next visit to the area.

Friend referred me at this hotel and everything was great experience with Kahala hotel. Easy to communicate with staff members and I felt so welcoming staying at this hotel for my honeymoon. Thank you Kahala!

We've been staying at this resort at least twice a year for the past six years. The customer service has been superb until our visit last week. Sooooo disappointing! Going from having a beyond outstanding experience to mediocre was not what we were expecting. This hotel always stood out because of its prestige and unique clientele, who catered to presidents, royalty, movie stars, etc. The service was exceptional and was nice because it was away from the busy Waikiki crowd. I'm not sure what's happening with management, but then we were there last week it was nothing like what we've experienced in the past. There were all elements of people (not to be discriminating), ton of kids, and the break point was when we were in the water, in front of the hotel, and a nice piece of human poop went floating by. Thank god the wind was blowing and it kept going towards the condo beach next door. Someone needs to get a hold of what the "Kahala Resort" used to be......the quality has really taken a turn for the worst. I believe it definitely has to do with management. The front desk was accommodating, the Valet were awesome, the service at the Plumeria was great, it was just the overall feeling of being on the property that left a bad taste in out mouths....no pun intended But when that piece of poop went floating by, that kinda told us that things have definitely changed. Don't think we'll be back anytime soon....unfortunately. Sadly, this was our "go to" place to unwind.....not anymore. Time to move on. Disappointing.

This is the most beautiful resort on the island! The rooms, the hotel, spa, the service, restaurant, food, everything was fabulous! All of the staff were fantastic! They provided excellent service and went above and beyond! The rooms were super clean and housekeeping did an amazing job! The service at the restaurants were top notch! Our son loved the dolphin experience! We had a great time on the sailboat ride! The spa and massage was perfect! The pool is a little smaller than most resorts this size, but we enjoyed the sandy beach and comfortable lounge chairs. The overall experience was absolutely amazing! We hope to go back again soon!
user_name:
Elizabeth B
New Smyrna Beach, Florida

review_body: After only being here for one day I can report that I made the right choice in this hotel. There are so many choices in this area and I researched them all. This hotel has met all my requirements for the perfect family vacation spot:Beyond beautiful beach and scenery throughout hotel and grounds.Swimmable beach just steps away from our room, calm enough for blow ups for kids and it even has a floating platform for the older kids to venture out to. Really large beautiful rooms with enormous bathrooms (his and her side each with a closet, stand alone shower, separate tub, and potty room). Large deck off room with comfy chairs for watching the dolphins (we had 2 dolphin lanai rooms for our family with 2 adults and 4 kids).Calm and peaceful oasis. It does not feel crowded at all. It is everything you dream about when you think of Hawaii. Excellent concierge team. Communicated easily and often before arrival. They secured an all day ocean cabana ($165/day) and a private tour of Pearl Harbor for my son and husband. And of course all the activities we planned: shark cage diving for my teenagers (snorkel gear used and less expensive and easier than you would think, THANKS A LOT SHARK WEEK), dolphin swimming, Pearl Harbor tour, etc. how are we going to fit in Hanauma Bay snorkeling, hiking Diamond Head (both near Hotel), shopping in Waikiki, Chinatown food tour, haunted Honolulu tour my teen wanted, spa, Dole plantation, etc?Clearly, I should have planned much more time at this oasis in this really fun island. All my kids are asking why we have to leave after 2 days to go to Maui!Not sure about why there would be negative reviews. It is not sparkling new, but very classic and well maintained. And those fancy toilets were the cause of hours of giggling by my 7 year old daughter who is now the expert at all the functions. Only regret is not staying for a week or at the very least 5 days here. Final tip: booked our stay through Costco travel website. Better prices than any web deal or travel agent I spoke with, and it included a free car as well as free hotel valet parking. Think I saved about $800 at this hotel and about $1500 at our hotel in Maui.

The last leg of our 2 week Hawaiian Island trip was staying at the Kahala. We wanted to get away from the Waikiki buzz and selected this hotel to be at the beach and not too far away from Honololu. The architecture is beautiful, with an open air lobby, stylish and well decorated, indeed it has 2 big buildings with 10 levels and some lower level rooms around the dolphin laguna or at the beach front. The reception was efficient but not overly friendly. We were staying at an Ocean Front Lanai room (8th fl), spacious, nicely decorated but with wall to wall carpet that should not be there in a tropical environment (why not wooden floors for a 5 star hotel: healthier and more style). Must admit the bathroom, however not the latest design, was big and efficient for 2 people. The room had a great view on the ocean with a nicely spaced balcony. The breakfast area had an inside an luckilly also an outside terrace which was the area for evening dinners (Plumeria) aswell. The hotel was at full capacity so you had to wait for breakfast, but the way the breakfast buffet was organized did remember me of some 3 star level hotels where masses of people where looking for food, absolutely not the level of a top hotel (the teams however did their very best to serve you well !). The absolute disaster and reason for rating this hotel only with 3 stars was the beach service or rather the lack of organizing a clean well kept beach: in the early morning you would find beach chairs all over the place with sand and old towels still on from the day before. If you want some shade at the beach you will have to pay which is unforgivable at this resort price level, I would suggest for management to take a trip to Asia or beach clubs in Europe and copy the beach service. So all in all what a shame as the hotel has really potential, the staff are trying their upmost, it has maybe the best location in Oahu but is falling short on a number of important elements justifying its 5 star rating.

This resort is perfect for a peaceful and restoring holiday.It is located 20 minutes outside the crowded Waikiki Beach, but it is easily reachable by free shuttle, the shuttle can also connect with main malls and shopping areas.The hotel is beautiful, mixing lux, Hawaiian tradition and comfort,Rooms are spacious, smart, comfortable, cleaned twice a day with add of ice, water , chocolate every time.Swimming pool and beaches are into the resort, very clean and peaceful, there are also dolphins, fishes and tortues all around.Wifi is working perfectly everywhere , there is a fitness room and yoga class in front of the beach.Three restaurants, Plumeria on the beach, Arancino very good italian and a third very high level one.All people working there show you the real aloha spirit, they are very helpful, kind, full of courtesy for customers.Ok, it is quite expensive but it completely worthy and I suppose in line with Honolulu prices.

Fifteen-plus years ago, Honolulu was our home and the birthplace of our children. We visit the isles (now as tourists) every couple of years. For most of our trips, we have stayed at the Kahala Resort. The hotel is an oasis of calm amidst the growingly hectic nature of Oahu. Over the years, some resort features have thankfully remained the same: elegant and quiet lobby, complimentary morning coffee (in addition to free coffee in the rooms), impeccable service, and long-time, friendly workers at Plumeria Beach café, not to mention the breathtaking beach with gentle waves. A wonderful feature new to us:Pacific Dream Photography offers complimentary photo sessions for guests. We didn't want a "cheesy" photo shoot and certainly didn't want to be pressured into buying anything. So, it took us a few days to think about booking a session. I am so glad we did. Loryn, the Creative Director, was immediately responsive to our inquiries and flexible when we experienced a little rain during our scheduled time. The photo shoot was fun and easy and the images were available for viewing the next day. There was no obligation to purchase anything, but after viewing the frames, we WANTED to do so. Loryn was able to capture our children so beautifully -- every, single frame was a masterpiece. Some frames were better with a touch of editing and Loryn was easily able to take care of it to my liking. This is the first time we have professional images from our Hawaii vacay and they are tasteful and artsy. Really added to our overall Kahala experience!

We went to The Kahala Resort for the dolphin experience for my 6-year old son and came across Pacific Dream Photography. We booked the photo shoot on a whim with Loryn and she was very friendly, knowledgable and accommodating. Loryn knew exactly where the perfect locations are for the shoot. She took awesome pictures of our family! I would definitely recommend Pacific Dream Photography to families who want professional photos taken!

I waited three weeks to write this review so I could sufficiently remove myself from the emotions of an amazing vacation by returning to my home State of New Jersey, and for me to further reflect upon my holiday at the Kahala. I will address each item separately: Lobby- Upon our arrival, we were very impressed on how nice the lobby was. It was clean, and it became quickly apparent that this truly was a 5 star hotel. Front Desk Staff- After an 11 hour flight from New Jersey, it was great to have courteous and friendly staff to greet us upon our arrival. Breakfast- The buffet breakfast in the morning had plenty of options and it was delicious. Upon our arrival, we were advised that the busiest times in the breakfast room are between 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m., so it would be ideal to arrive for breakfast prior to those hours. But being that our body-clocks were still on New Jersey time, arriving early for breakfast was not a problem. Beach- The beach at the Kahala was amazing and very calm, and because it is secluded it lacked the crowds. We were concerned of high waves because we went with two young children, but there were practically no waves at the Kahala. I was informed that due to the reef in the ocean where the Kahala is located, it prevents the waves from getting to be too high, thus the beach is perfectly safe for young children. Cabanas- Also while at the beach, we had reserved a cabana every day for a fee of $65 per day. It was well worth it so we could get a slight break from the hot sun when we wanted to rest for a bit. Lunch- We had lunch everyday at the Seaside Grill, which is right on the beach. The hamburgers and sandwiches were nice and tasty portions, and the coconut smoothies were spot-on.Dolphins- We were especially excited to have a session with the dolphins at Dolphin Quest, which is in the vicinity of pool at the Kahala. It cost $225 per person for a 30 minute session, and we will have great memories, photos, and videos of playing with the dolphins. Dinners- Most of our dinners were outside of the resort area, but we did have some dinners at the Kahala. We had dined at Arancino’s for nice Italian cuisine. We had also dined once at the Veranda, and the most memorable part of the meal was a non-alcoholic drink called a Kahala Fruit Crush; it was an all-natural mix of various fruits into one drink. So even if you do not dine at the Veranda, I recommend that you at least order the Kahala Fruit Crush. Pacific Photography- We had used the services of the photographers who are stationed inside the Kahala. They did a fantastic job, and they knew all of the best spots on the beach to take photos, along with having us properly pose for the camera. Day Tour thru concierge- We took a break from the beach for one day based on the recommendation from the concierge to do a one day tour around Oahu. The stops on the tour included a coffee farm (where we bought various flavored coffees), the Dole Plantation, a macademia nut farm, the North Shore, and the Polynesian Cultural Center. This tour was fun, and the kids mostly enjoyed it due to the plentiful gift shops that we patronized. Room- The room was clean, and it was on the larger side compared to other hotels in which we had accomodations in the past. This was especially important here because we had brought more luggage for Hawaii than we had brought for other destinations because this vacation was for more days than our usual annual vacation. So even though we had four check-in luggage, four carry-ons, and multiple personal items, we still had plenty space to comfortably walk around our room.The bathroom was especially large, as it had two sinks (each at the opposite side of the bathroom), a large bath tub, and a separate shower. The toilet had its own separate room within the bathroom itself. The toilet was quite unique as it had a heated seat. Wall of Fame- On the ground floor near the lobby, there is the Wall of Fame which has photos of past and present celebrities and dignitaries who had visited the Kahala. Location- The Kahala is far enough from the crowds that it is quiet and secluded, yet it is only a 20 minute cab ride or shuttle ride away from the big-city feel of the Waikiki beach area. We especially enjoyed the coziness of Kahala, yet we did plenty of shopping and browsing at the stores of Waikiki.

This was our 5th stay at Kahala (mandarin oriental after Kahala Hilton) in the past 10 years. We have stayed at the scenic lanai with and without balcony, and the ocean front views. The Hotel is well maintained despite its age. The bathrooms probably need to be re-done soon. Although other areas are updated, bathrooms have essentially stayed the same foe 10 years now. Overall, good stay with excellent service. Recently it has become very popular with Koreans (always popular with the Japanese) and it can be crowded at breakfast. I think it needs a second restaurant open for breakfast.Early morning at the beach area is very calming and relaxing, as it can get very crowded with kids mid-day.

Best part of this hotel was how peaceful and quiet it was. Had a lanai room facing the golf course and mountains. Wonderful private and uncrowded beach.Hospitality was top notch. Chocolate covered (dark, milk & white) macadamia nuts delivered on day of check in. Turn down service also included chocolates. Bottled water provided every day.Totally worth it!

Most visitors (70k a day) who come to Oahu Hawaii stay on Waikiki beach...for the experienced or luxury traveler, this a big mistake. The smart move is to stay at the iconic Kahala. Removed for the mass of humanity on Waikiki is this iconic gem of a property....Diamond Head is 5 minute drive and Waikiki is a 15 min drive away. This gorgeous hotel sits on it's own bay and is on the grounds of the word famous Waialae CC, home of the PGA's tour's first full player field tour stop each January; the Sony Open.My suite was beautiful.. facing the ocean and looking out at Diamond Head on one side and the golf course on the other. Underneath was a lagoon with dolphin swimming. The room appointments were historic Hawaiian and just gorgeous!! The bed was excellent, as was the service loaded with the Aloha spirit which is why I love Hawaii so much! This is a busy hotel but the friendly staff was just fantastic. When I first arrived, I was greeted in the driveway by Craig, who has been greeting guests at The Kahala for the past 40 years!! He then called me by name (it's a tough one to remember) for the next few days I was there.Lastly... if I was not impressed enough by how great this hotel looked and it's killer location...I had a surprise at check-out that I was most impressed with (I am an experienced luxury travel and not easily impressed) When I checked out last Sunday, the hotel's manager came out to greet me!! He thanked me for staying and asked what could be done to improve his property. I was floored when he took out a pad and made notes of my suggestions!!! I strongly recommend you stay in this hotel...

Everyone was so nice. Service was top notch. Rooms were spacious with a full bathroom. Nice touch was free bottled water everyday. Far enough away from crowds but close enough to get to Waikiki area in 20 minutes. Customer service was very helpful. Would stay there again.

We spent three nights for a wedding held in this hotel. It is not convenient for going to town and main beach; had to rely on infrequent shuttle, especially in the evening, or taxi. The hotel is huge, has big modern rooms, private beach and there is a pond where one can play and swim with dolphins. To us the dolphins was the highlight. The service is average and the rooms were pricy. I think this hotel is good for those who are willing to pay, enjoy large rooms, extensive hotel ground and dolphins; and do not mind taking a medium long taxi ride to go out for dinner.

How wonderful to return to this lovely property! The Aloha spirit is alive and well here. Even with construction in the lobby, check in was a breeze! The facilities are iconic, elegant, and relaxing. We loved the easy access to the beach!During our short (but lovely) stay at the Kahala Resort, we had photos taken by Pacific Dream. The photographer was relaxed and friendly with us and took so many great photos! It was almost too hard to choose the ones to keep! Customer service follow through was also wonderful even after we were home! Thank you to the team there!

We stayed at the Kahala Resort a few weeks ago and thoroughly enjoyed our vacation there. We liked how the property was far from the crowds in Waikiki, yet only 15 minutes away when we wanted to go there to eat. They have a shuttle service into the Waikiki area which was a great benefit. The property has good sized rooms with beautiful views and huge bathrooms. The front staff was friendly and welcoming. The dolphins, pool and beach access were a nice feature, as well as their fantastic onsite restaurants. Our Kahala Resort stay was further enhanced by the complimentary photo shoot they include with Pacific Dream Photography. The photo shoot was a very positive experience. Loryn, our photographer, made the session fun for our 3 kids, as evidenced by the smiley and natural looking pictures we took. She was very patient and knowledgeable as to where and when to take our beach photos. After our session, Loryn was helpful in sending us our photo gallery through email so we could review them at home and she even customized a nice package for us to purchase. We had such a wonderful experience with the Kahala and are so happy we chose that property to stay at. A major plus was the photo session with Pacific Dream Photography. We will definitely cherish our Hawaiian vacation memories with the beautiful pictures we purchased.

I have not visited this hotel for some years, and we were hoping that the new owners would keep the hotel just as it was. When we last stayed there we thought it was the most beautiful hotel we had ever visited. The restaurants, were wonderful, not only for the food, which was excellent, but also for the décor. The bedrooms and bathrooms were very luxurious. The fact that the hotel was away from the town with its own private beach were an added bonus. Looking at photos of the Hotel as it is now, we were pleased to see many of the features that were in place when we stayed there, especially the dolphin lake. The new owners have expanded the restaurant and the beach area now has loungers and umbrellas which weren't there before, which is a great addition. We would definitely want to stay there again.

I was so happy to be back! Felt like home! Everything is perfect! I stayed in the suite this time and my family stayed in a room with amazing view! Friendly and professional staff are very impressed . Grace Chan and Yoshimi Nakano are very efficient and caring, helped us a lot of planning event and made all my family members very satisfied and had a very happy memory in Kahala.

This was our first trip to Hawaii with our 2 girls so we definitely wanted some good mementos. Loryn was the answer as she was able to take some beautiful shots of the kids against the amazing backgrounds at Kahala. Look forward to displaying the photos back at home!

We made an appointment through the concierge for a photo session during our stay at the Kahala. When we arrived for the session, we were told that our appointment (the evening before checkout) was too late for reviewing the photos the following day. We almost cancelled but our photographer Loryn was very helpful and flexible and we decided to go for it after all. In the end, Loryn took fabulous shots on the beach, and we were very happy that we didn't cancel. Highly recommend the excellent service to capture your memories through beautiful photos!
user_name:
oatiepotie
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed here for a week at the end of March. The room was nice, although I believe it was under a laundry or machinery room as there was some noise at night. The staff were reasonably helpful and the food was nice without being exceptional. Overall the stay was nice enough, but I don't think I would return if I travel again to Hawaii

We talked about visiting Hawaii for many years, but this year made it a reality. Once we decided to visit Oahu and the Big Island, we then had to decide on accommodations. We were looking for a place in a more peaceful setting than busy Waikiki (although we visited and enjoyed Waikiki). The Kahala was the perfect fit. The minute we arrived, we knew our stay would be special. The staff is so friendly and accommodating, and customer service excellence is apparent everywhere. The lobby area is beautiful and airy.We had a Dolphin Lanai room, which overlooks, as it sounds - the dolphin lagoon. The beautiful beach was just steps away from our room. Other reviewers have discussed the room amenities, which were very nice. Our hotel stay included the breakfast for two each day. The buffet was very nice with many choices and the best part was being able to start the day on the edge of the beach, watching the ocean and feeling the breezes. Again, wait staff was very attentive. I will definitely recommend The Kahala to friends and family looking for a more laid back Oahu experience. Simply beautiful and a special experience we won't forget. P.S. We never found the complimentary coffee bar.

Private beach. Well away from Waikiki hustle and bustle, yet easily accessed via shuttle or uber. Most of the pool area is surrounded by a lagoon with resident dolphins, stingrays, turtles... Be sure to check out the Magnum P.I. plaque

My stay at the Kahala Hotel was alright. There are several things going for them, for sure. It is in one of the fanciest neighborhood, Kahala. The ground sits on a very nice property with a beautiful private beach. They have the "dolphin quest" where you can play with six dolphins (on the other hand, the six dolphins cohabit in rather small lake... it looks pretty big in the pictures, but they are rather small). The pools are fun. You would see a ray (or two) and other tropical fish in their pond, the water fall is impressive. The hotel is certainly prestigious in terms of the kind of guests who've stayed at the hotel (you can see the pictures hung on hallway -- pictures of kings, queens, former presidents, emperors, hollywood stars, grammy awards winners, etc etc). And, the price of the hotel certainly will convince you that it is a luxury hotel. The hotel staff is very courteous and friendly. At the check-in, they give all the female guests orchid leis and male guests Kukui nut leis. That certainly made my father happy, and the cool orchid lei was very refreshing against my skin after the 7-hour flight!! Since we checked in a little early, she told me that we can use the hospitality suite where we can shower, take a quick nap, have tea/coffee, or just relax. Right before 3pm (the check-in time), I received a call from one of the receptionist and was informed that the room was ready.So, we got the keys, get to the room, and as soon as we walked in, we were hit with the old urinal smell. Yes... the whole room smells like an old bathroom. Not sure what that was about. I went to the bathroom, and I couldn't really locate the smell. The bathroom is huge, with two vanity, two closets, which was nice... except that one of the sinks doesn't drain the water... Maybe they have some pipe/drain issue? Anyways, we had to open the windows for a couple of hours to get the smell out of the room (but bathroom just stank). Since we were only staying one night, we didn't even bother telling the house keeping to fix the sink. But, the whole entire bathroom has a dated look. Most of the tiles in the bathrooms have cracks in them. Maybe they are going for an antique look? Not sure. Didn't really give off a pristine feel, unfortunately.As some of the perks of staying at the hotel, there are a lot of activities going on the resort, and you can probably spend a whole entire week on the resort (though they don't have that enough restaurants to keep my interest). One of the perks was getting a 45-minute photo shoot on site for free, and that was a lot of fun. Anyways, I felt like the hotel was overpriced for the amenities and quality of the room, and I don't think I will be staying there again. On the other hand, Hoku's has the best Sunday brunch in Honolulu, and that was one of the major reasons we stayed over Saturday night... so I am giving it a 3 star.

A wonderful resort that affords tranquility and quality away from the honky tonk of Waikiki beach. This resort has a beautiful little beach that feels private (all beachfront in Hawaii is public by law), and it has first class service and employees. The restaurants are of high quality with very very good food and service. Location is great -- close to the city but not in the city itself so a quick jaunt to shopping and other sites is easy.What is the problem? Well... The pool for the hotel consists of a small kids pool and a regular pool and hottub. In practice all three were one big kiddy pool -- there is no separation of adults and kids, so you can be in the hottub and a parent brings their baby in diapers and plops them down next to you. Gross. The main pool was overrun with small kids as well. If you have kids with you -- great, you will love the access. If you are like me and my wife, there for a romantic getaway we retreated to the beach and avoided the pool deck which also meant no beachside food service either. This is a problem that the Four Seasons has sorted out by building separate calm adult pool decks at their resorts and I must say was the one thing that irked us at an otherwise wonderful stay.Overall this is a great hotel with many unique features -- location, quality, service, dolphin attraction, great beach, and friendly staff, but there is one downside in their design. We do plan to come back and stay with them again.
user_name:
Michael F
New York City, New York

review_body: Sadly, I agree with nyctuna! We were so excited about this stay and it's really upsetting to write this review. Almost everything about the resort - beach, service, restaurants, common areas, gardens - is absolutely impeccable, seriously amazing and more than met our expectations.What didn't though, was the rooms. Honestly, I was shocked at the state of our Dolphin Lanai room, which was one of the more expensive options in terms of rooms. It was a big room, with 2 of the smallest beds I've ever seen. It's the first time in any of our travels that my husband and I couldn't sleep in the same bed - we had to share with a child each! They were TINY, and really uncomfortable. So much so that none of us really slept for the week. I should have complained but didn't because really, what were the options? I'm assuming all the beds are the same throughout the hotel. So instead of coming home rested and relaxed, we were all completely exhausted and cranky.We'd previously had a week at the Moana Surfrider with twin beds which was beautifully comfortable and honestly I was expecting at least the same at The Kahala.Aside from the terrible beds, the room was really rundown. Very old carpet, furniture and paint. The bathroom was awful - so old and tired, dodgy patchy paint, crumbling cabinetry, tiny little old drawers. Tiny old shower with a crusty shower head and mildew in the grout.We had to unplug the toto toilet, as the seat was burning hot and every time someone walked into the bathroom it turned itself on even when not in use. Annoying, and not very environmentally friendly!Honestly, I was pretty devastated. This hotel has just so much potential but the rooms are really in desperate need of complete renovation. Not just a refresh - I mean a complete gutting and re-doing.The room with taxes etc was around $850USD a night - well over $1,000 AUD a night which is an enormous amount of money. For that, there is an expectation that the entire experience is luxurious and amazing. The resort itself hits this mark but the rooms absolutely do not, and so because of that i don't feel that the experience is able to be recommended.If they fixed it, I'd be back in a heartbeat. Until they do though, I couldn't recommend staying here.

We recently spent four very pleasant nights at the Kahala. Great hotel. I'd never stayed before, but remember the place from a visit I made when my aunt and uncle were guests around 1970. It was the Kahala Hilton then, and considered top notch, as it is today. The dolphins are still there and you can meet them up close. I've heard it's the oldest such habitat in the country. Check me on that. We had parking and breakfast included in our package, no small sum. Plus a room upgrade to full ocean view from a very spacious balcony. You may not get all these throw-ins (my gf is a regular) but you will likely love your stay.It's right on the beach. Yes, palm trees, trade winds, sounds of crashing waves all await. It's also near the Kahala mall, so if you like to shop or simply forgot something, things are easy. Try the little gastropub Puka's in the Whole Foods. Great beers and food. Really liked that place.The structure of the hotel itself goes back to something like 1964, but they've been sprucing things up and keeping modern. The reception area and lounge are very open, spacious, and inviting. The new finishes are quality and elegant. This does not look like a "faded glory" hotel as I have seen elsewhere many times. We didn't have a suite, but the room too was spacious. Bathroom serves a traveling couple well. Dual sinks and storage areas. Shower and bath were separate, facilitating his-and-hers getting ready for an evening out or at the on-property Hoku's restaurant (I'll review separately). The closet areas in the bathroom space seemed a bit odd to me, but ultimately served our needs. There weren't accessible outlets near the bed, so, horrors, we had to charge up our E gadgets from batteries which we recharged in the bathroom the next day. The bathroom included a Toto "Washlet", a halfhearted bolt-on attempt at mimicking the company's high end bottom-cleansing toilets. The heated seat was absurd in Hawaii and the built in "deodorizing" fan merely filled the little room around the toilet with a vague sewer smell. With the hoses and wires coming out the side it looked more Soviet than Japanese.The bed and linens are great, super soft and comfortable. The service in our room was good, but getting ice took longer than I'd have liked. I wish they just had an ice machine like a motel 6. The bell and valet staff were great. Very friendly and fast. The desk folks were also very good. Look for Pete out by the pool / beach, a cool and capable guy. Very nice fellow. He'll teach you SUP, or in our case outrigger canoe paddling / surf riding. Look for the turtles, we saw several. Actually caught a few waves! They also do little catamaran trips. Don't forget to meet the dolphins. An adjoining pond has cool looking fish and a very social stingray. Pool is not huge, and populated with kids, but is nice. Ditto jacuzzi.We had breakfast in Plumeria (main casual restaurant) each morning. Omelet bar was very good. Smoked salmon and the trimmings also very good. Fruit was pretty tasteless, but looked good. Coffee and juices were decent. All the usual buffet stuff. The service was quite good, and friendly. We sat at the bar, a great way to avoid the big line, giving us a nice view of the pool and beach environs. Also had a lunch there. The poke crostini was especially good. The evening bar menu out on the veranda was also very tasty. All in all this is a very nice hotel and you should definitely give it a try.

Considering that I've stayed here since the very early 80s (always in the very expensive rooms, with my family frequently staying in the best suites), it was very disappointing to see how far things have slid downhill. I booked an oceanfront room...and expected to be on the beach, as has ALWAYS been the case, and yet I was put on the 2nd floor. Instead of improving the infrastructure of the hotel, there are exposed wires everywhere...tv...lamps...etc. Furniture is beaten up and the general condition of the room is pretty pathetic...and this is an $1,100 per night room. I've loved this hotel for almost 40 years, but this experience is pathetic and sad. Even the general cleanliness and attention to detail has gone downhill. At 8:00 pm, housekeeping is nowhere to be found to conduct turn down service. The restaurants are difficult to book, and yet on this visit we have MULTIPLE rooms and numerous people. This used to be an excellent, service oriented hotel, but that has clearly changed. I'm actually just really sad and disappointed.
user_name:
nyctuna
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a very pleasurable stay. The room was big enough for two kids to each have a roll away bed and the bathroom was spacious as well. The hotel is an older hotel but it is clean and well kept and it has a charm not present in newer hotels. The pool is fairly small but it was easy to secure chairs and get waiter service. Having the dolphin swimming around made for a unique experience that my kids really enjoyed. The beach is calm and beautiful; one can wade far into the water without strong currents. The hotel is pretty far away from the action so it is not very convenient for shopping or going downtown but that's not what we were looking for so it was perfect for us. The restaurants were pretty good and it was nice to have the breakfast buffet included for adults. Kahala was great for our family; if I were just with my wife then I might have chosen to be closer to Waikiki.

This was our third trip to the Kahala and we'll keep coming back. Excellent service, fantastic facilities. Only let down were the beds, which were soft and lumpy. To the point we had to get a rollaway for my husband to sleep on. The toiletries were also not as nice as our previous stays and were quite harsh.The staff are so helpful. From the concierge who assisted with some queries before our arrival, through to housekeeping. Even though we were there during peak season, we never struggled to get a dinner reservation or a chair by the pool. Enough room for every one

Waited a long time to go to Hawaii and it was worth the wait. This was the first stop of a few as we travelled around the other islands.The hotel and staff made us feel welcome from the word goWe had a ground floor room overlooking the golf course which was a nice escape from the pool and beach when we needed it.The dining in the hotel is not cheap but well served and well presented, but who wants cheap when going to Hawaii.All the staff chatted to you, welcomed you, made sure you were attended to, all were polite and helpfulIf ever we came back to Oahu, then we would not hesitate in going back to the Kahala Hotel and Resort

Wonderful services and location. Far enough away from downtown Honolulu but close enough to visit if you wanted to. I loved the restaurants but be sure you make reservations. The beach was relaxing. My son loved the Dolphin Quest which was available on site.

フォトツアーを利用しました。海辺で、すごく綺麗に撮ってくれます。滞在中にはぜひ参加することをお勧めします。Julia is the best photographer we've ever met. It was the second time we went to the photo tour in Kahara hotel. I strongly recommend this photo session.

This is truly a great place. A little out of the way but very convenient to Waikiki and the rest of the island. I picked this because it was not on the crowded Waikiki beach area. And big was it a winner. Not a massive resort but it gives you everything you could want along with privacy. The concierge was incredibly helpful with restaurants, snorkeling, and sailing. DeeDee gave us great insight as to the Arizona memorial and Big "Mo". If it weren't for her we would not have been able to see both on the same day. The on property restaurant, the Plumira, had excellent ocean front dining and the breakfasts had so many selections. You can sit inside our out. It was only 20 minutes by cab to Waikiki but once on property you seemed a million miles because it was so private.

we where here for a wedding of our best friend and what a experience this was.From dolphins swimming under your room balcony to perfect food private beach and exceptional service! the view is incredible, one downside, its far from everything so you will need a car!uber works also ; )

Absolutely beautiful resort! Free shuttle service to Ala Moana Center and other select places. The resort is located away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The staff's hospitality was immaculate from the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out. This would be a place we'd stay once again while visiting Oahu, and would definitely recommend to anyone seeking rest and relaxation on this beautiful island.

My family and I really enjoyed staying at The Kahala. Overall stay was relaxing, welcoming and pampered. The staff were wonderful providing great service. Love the beach as it felt private and peaceful.

The Kahala Hotel & Resort is a nice hotel with an excellent staff of people working there.The service in the restaurants, valet and concierge is really great.Breakfast is excellent and the lunch and dinner options are quite good.The beach is nice and the views of the ocean and hillside are spectacular.Our stay got off to a rocky start when we arrived and found out that our suite was not connected, or even near, the extra room that we booked for 2 of our kids.On our reservation, they were clearly connected.I have to say that the front desk did not handle this well, and they were quite blunt and unapologetic about it. Especially a front desk staff member named James.I think that the hotel overbooked on that floor and hedged their bet that it would work out.I could see this location getting a major overhaul by a top hotel chain to update it's tired 1960's feel. I love the retro architecture and feel, but it's a bit rundown.

Just an absolute gem of a hotel in a very busy Oahu hotel market. If you want to feel special and taken care of, then there is no other place to stay. I will not stay anywhere else on Oahu. Don't be fooled by the imitators. This is the best luxury hotel in Oahu.

When i made the reservation thru an agent I wasn't sure what to expect. It was everything plus more than i had imagined. The bedroom was beautiful and relaxing. The beach and food were excellent. I would highly recommend it to my friends.

The Kahala Hotel is an ideal place for families visiting Oahu. It has many advantages over the throngs of hotels located on Wikiki Beach in Honolulu, crowds and the hustle and bustle being the chief among them. The Kahala is located in a residential area, about 20 minutes drive from downtown Honolulu. However, it's not isolated by any means, and plentiful shopping and dining options are only minutes away.The main reason I couldn't give this resort full 5 stars is that it's showing its age and is in need of some remodeling, particularly in the guest rooms.Pros:- Located right on a smallish but very nice beach away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu Waikiki Beach; feels much less like a tourist trap than parts of Honolulu- Adjacent to a nice golf course- Dolphin lagoon with several dolphins, turtles, fish, and other sea creatures (kids can participate in Dolphin Quest at additional charge)- Accommodating, attentive, and friendly service- Very kid friendly- Timely and reliable housekeeping with turndown service (with complimentary water and chocolates)- Very large rooms with all of the amenities- Clean and well maintained facilities- Friendly and helpful staff (everyone, from valets to front desk to housekeeping to maintenance)Cons:- Very odd room layout. Difficult to describe, but if you've been to Kahala, you know what I'm talking about. The bathroom is large, but it's almost as if they took two small bathrooms (one with a tub and one with a shower) and mashed them together. So even though the bathroom is actually quite large, it feels cramped. Also, the TV is mounted on a side wall next to the bathroom, so that if the bathroom door is open, the TV is obstructed from view. This very weird room design will have you scratching your head, literally -- my son actually hit his head on the TV!- Rooms and facilities are clean but definitely showing their age; it's overdue for a refresh and remodel (particularly the guest rooms)- Tiny pool (but not a huge issue considering its location RIGHT on the beach)- Somewhat loud A/C unit may bother some at nightOverall, the Kahala Hotel is a nice resort with excellent staff, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it or to make a return stay the next time we visit Oahu. Our family had a great time! Aloha and Mahalo!

Our entire experience of accommodation at the hotel was really excellent. It is a great and beautiful old hotel very well maintained and modernized. All the hotel staff are very helpful and attentive. Having the lagoon with dolphins and the private beach are a hard plus to match. The hotel is worth every penny you pay.The experience of snorkeling or a canoe ride in its quiet bay, is truly amazing.The only problem is that The Plumeria the restaurant for the breakfast is always full of people and you have to wait more than half an hour to be able to eat. Also the quality of the food is good but not the level of excellence that should be for a hotel of this level. The scrambled eggs are really bad and on the contrary the omelette station is very good.

The Kahala experience was superb. The staff attention to detail was excellent and the hotel itself was a relaxing environment. I stayed here for a week and can recommend it to anyone. It's very popular as a wedding/ honeymoon destination but for me it was a business conference! The location is removed from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but it's a short trip using the free hotel shuttle to find yourself in central Waikiki for dinner or nightlife. Of course, you can't rate Kahala without mentioning its main attraction- dolphins!The hotels central lagoon is home to four trained dolphins that visitors and guests see every day. In fact we had a dolphin come up to our room every morning and play while we drank our coffee! They were amazing animals , treated with great care and love by the trainers from Dolphin Quest, an organisation dedicated to marine conservation.So, Kahala is thoroughly recommended for those people seeking a more secluded Hawaiian holiday with its own beach and of course friendly staff and dolphins!!

After originally debating booking the Moana Surfrider or the Sheraton both in Waikiki beach I couldn't be happier that we decided to go with the Kahala Hotel for our honeymoon. Our dolphin lagoon room is very clean, a good size and with a patio where we can sit and read or just watch the dolphins playing.The gym looking over the beach has free weights, cardio and weight machines, all up to date. The buffet breakfast is full of variety and very pleasant sitting outside by the sea. The hotel is stunning, the dolphins and tropical fish and turtles so calming to watch. Having your own secluded oasis down the road from crazy Waikiki is heaven. The free hotel shuttle works well. After visiting our two first options for drinks we are so so over the moon with the Kahala Hotel.

We loved Kahala - far enough out of the mayhem of Waikiki to relax, close enough to head in for dinner and shopping whenever the need arose! The concierge, Cameron, was great and so helpful. Hoku's and Arancini are both great for dinner too.

Had not been back in the Islands in over 22 years. It was good to know that despite thechanges and the now unfamiliar faces, the Grand Dame at Kahala still stands regal and proud despite the vagaries of time and space. Members of the hotel staff greet you by name, with warm welcome smiles in the spirit that is uniquely Aloha. The views of the beach and the reef beyond from the lanai of your oceanfront room beguile and mesmerize, so that one never wants to leave. Swim with the dolphin in their own lagoon and learn why it is so important to save our seas and all marine life that dwell in them. Do not miss the excellent Sunday brunch at Hokus nor the authentic Italian fare at Arancino's. Leave space for the latter's superb creme catalán. It is comforting to know that the more things change, the more they stay the same...but when it comes to the Kahala hotel, even better through time.

We spent several wonderful days at The Kahala Hotel & Resort. When we arrived, not only were we greeted by the friendly valet, front desk staff, the General Manager Mr. Gerald Glennon greeted us warmly and presented us with a beautiful Leis. We were upgraded to a full-ocean view and could see the dolphins playing. We had wonderful dinner at Hokua restaurant and a nice seafood buffet at the Plumeria restaurant on the beach, the service was impeccable. I highly recommend staying at this hotel and experiencing and being treated like "Royalty".

Despite being touted as a 5 star hotel, the Kahala is just a dated hotel in a beautiful location. My husband and I chose the hotel for its proximity to Waikiki without actually being in Waikiki and on that front, the Kahala delivered. It is quieter and much less crowded than the Waikiki resort scene. The beach is very sandy and the water is beautiful and clear. In many other ways, however, the hotel came up short:1) Room quality: the hotel calls itself a 5 star hotel, but the rooms look more like a 3 star hotel--this was clearly a very nice hotel...25 years ago! The bathroom was dated, with a tiny shower stall, old fixtures, musty closet/cabinets, and mildew on the tiles. The layout was funky, with the bar set up in the bathroom (psychologically, I really did not feel that making coffee in the bathroom was at all appealing). The main update that seems to have occurred in the last 20 years is the installation of the Toto washlet in every room, which I will admit, was quite nice. While spacious, the room itself has dated furniture and the carpet is old. There was no bed skirt or sheet on the box spring of the bed. On the bright side, the housekeeping team does a great job keeping the rooms and common spaces looking mostly clean. Turndown service was very good. Overall, pretty underwhelming, considering we paid over $500/night for our (non-ocean view) room. We did face the golf course, which was actually very pleasant. 2) Restaurants: Given that we were hoping to be beach bums at the resort, we spent a lot of time at the hotel restaurants. A couple frustrations--a) the Plumeria Beach House restaurant, which is the main casual dining restaurant on the property, was always full, causing us to wait on three occasions. The recommendation of the hostess staff? Call to make a reservation. Sorry, but at a "5 star hotel", I feel that I shouldn't have to plan in advance to eat at the breakfast buffet. Also, after charging almost $40/pp, the hotel should consider adding another server at omelet station--that line is ridiculous. Again, service was friendly (and the omelets are good!), but all the waiting drove us nuts. b) Hoku's--we made a reservation for dinner at the "fancy" restaurant at the resort and ordered the degustation menu. We should have known it was going to be a bit lacking, but wow, that was a terrible value ($500 for weirdly huge portions, weird wine pairings, and frankly food that wasn't great). Yikes. Service was very kind, however. We had the Sunday brunch at Hoku's and enjoyed that much more. Arancino's, the Italian restaurant, was...fine. Cocktails at the pool were lacking and food was average (but I had a smoothie one day that was really good). I know we were at a resort, but given how hard it is to get off property, it would have been nice if the food was a couple notches better (I know it can be done! Even at a resort!)3) Pool/Beach: There is a small but very nice beach area and 4/5 days we were there, the pool staff could not put up umbrellas due to high winds. We were told that they were going to upgrade their umbrella system, but we ended up paying $115/day (+ tax and tip) for a cabana. There was a cheaper option for shade (a $60 beach shade for two chairs), but man, to pay for shade every day at the beach was a real bummer. We could have cowered under a tree, but any shady areas were very crowded. The vibe at the pool was your usual kids-shrieking-loudly situation. And the kids pool is tiny (and therefore, unused by children), so if you are looking for a relaxing pool environment, head elsewhere!4) Other odds and ends: The tv screens on the gym cardio equipment are nice, but the headphones didn't work half the time. There weren't enough outlets in the room to charge our phones. The sundry store didn't have basic necessities. Bottom line, the service was very good, but this hotel needs quite a bit of work to justify its high prices.

My girlfriend and I decided to spend a few nights at the Kahala. Best decision of my year so far! As gorgeous as this hotel is, and it is BEAUTIFUL, the most amazing thing about this place was the staff. Every interaction we had with an employee was wonderful. A perfect example; I was walking in the hall of my hotel looking to see if there was an ice machine, when an executive from the staff in suit and tie who happened to be on the floor noticed me looking. He approached and asked how he could assist me! I mentioned the ice, and in a few minutes a staff member knocked on the door with ice for us. Little things like that make you realize how well earned their rating is. The grounds are gorgeous, the dolphins are amazing to watch, the food at the hotel restaurants was great, and to top it off, President Obama and family were staying on our floor! Perfection.

Fantastic location!! Not too far from all the action of Waikiki. Strongly recommended! Literally on the beach front. Not crowded and very clean. Staff was amazing as well. Over all service was top notch!

Great resort. The hotel was clean and modern with all the amenities you need. Julie, Anji, Steve, Gene, and Cathy, were fantastic. They were pleasant and gave amazing service. The staff is very tenured, and it was obvious they have stayed for a good reason. The beach is right outside and is kept clean. The staff was great to work with when looking to get a lounge chair of cabana. When/if I go back to Oahu, the Kahala is my hotel of choice.

The Kahala is the best! The location is excellent, the beach fabulous, staff wonderful - my husband and I love it there! The hotel is in a lovely neighborhood and next door to a country club where my husband was able to play tennis. We can't wait to return!

My partner and I visited the resort almost everyday we were in HI. The food is amazing and the servers and kitchens (at the seaside grill, plumeria and the veranda) were great with my severe allergy.Resort staff were kind and helpful. Mildred one of the shop workers helped me find everything I needed even if she didn't have it in her store and told me what to do to get snorkel equipment that works with bad eyesight. The pool staff was also amazing when renting cabanas.

If you are visiting Oahu and want to get out of the madness that is Waikiki but would like to be close enough to visit, this is a great spot. The hotel is just outside in Kahala, a very nice area. Everything about the hotel was great. The rooms are large and very well appointed, the staff is amazing - from housekeeping to front desk to the restaurants - everyone was genuinely pleasant and welcoming. The beach area is nice and quiet and offers a range of activities. Swimming with the dolphins was a highlight for my kids and the staff that oversees that operation are a very professional, knowledgeable, and caring group of marine biologists and animal specialists. If you enjoy luxury delivered in a low key manner, this could be your spot. Great hopping off point for a stay on Oahu. Kailua and Lanikai are not too far for great beach days and you can get to Honolulu and all the sights easily enough. Don't miss Arancino if you do go -- the best Italian meal I have had outside of Italy. Amazing.

This hotel far exceeded our expectations. We stayed here for three nights on an anniversary trip, and it was just perfect. The service is impeccable, truly five-star quality. The location is breathtaking, away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but close enough if you want to visit. The hotel booked a trip to Pearl Harbor for us which was seamless. They have many activities right on the resort making your stay as relaxing and exciting as possible. The restaurants are all excellent. We tried them all and they all offered great options and quality. This hotel is truly five star, and I would recommend it to anyone staying in Oahu. I will definitely be back! Mahalo!

It was Great to be recognized at the main front entrance by the doorman and valet. Dining service provided by Taryn and Kent was gracious and exceptional. The location of the hotel is outstanding because it is the only one in Kahala, wonderful private beach. Such a beautiful, superb setting!

I booked an oceanview room on BookIt and a few days before the vacation was to start I went on Kahala's website to find out about the activities and accomodations. During my research I realized the oceanview room I had booked didn't have a balcony. What a waste of an oceanview room! It was my mistake but every hotel I've been to so far in Hawaii has a balcony when the room is oceanview. I called the hotel to get a different room but they said I needed to check with the company I booked with. I called BookIt and they didn't have any rooms with a balcony or "lanai" so I thought I would just ask for it during check-in. Luckily they had a room for me and were able to upgrade me for a fee. I stayed at the Grand Wilea in Maui just a few months ago so needless to say this hotel just doesn't compare. There isn't that "wow" factor when you first walk in. The pool is small. The rooms are nice but you can tell some things are getting old and dingy. I didn't rent a car because I expected to mostly stay at the hotel and they do have a free shuttle which is a plus but take the shuttle at your own risk. I actually called to confirm the location of pickup only to be completely ditched. And when I called to find out where the shuttle was they said it had already left. They told me to call a cab and they would reimburse me. I asked them if I could take Lyft because I've never rode a cab and already had the Lyft app on my phone. They said no because they needed a receipt to reimburse me. They even went so far as to ask me why I didn't flag down the shuttle when I saw it. The shuttle drop off is on the opposite side of where they told me to wait so they were basically asking me why I didn't run across three lanes of traffic to flag down the shuttle? This isn't the kind of service you'd expect for the prices you pay. I wouldn't say I would never come back here because the location can't be beat and most of the people here are wonderful but I wouldn't recommend this hotel based on my experiences so far.

The hotel is top notch in service, cleanliness, amenities and beauty. Perfectly located in quiet location near but not in Waikiki. View while having breakfast and lunch is amazing. Property has several coves with turtles, fish, sting rays and dolphins.

My initial visit to the then Kahala Hilton was in May of 1967 when my wife and I took a delayed honeymoon. We returned often in the ensuing years, particularly in the 70s with our young children in tow. My now adult son and I just returned from a 5-day visit that will likely be my last (I turn 86 on my next birthday). The hotel remains a gorgeous property and has aged well. For my money, the setting and ambience put it apart from other resort hotels in Honolulu. This grand dame, though not without minor flaws, still delights where it counts. Absolutely superb! H.W.H. Denver, CO

After spending one short stay in Honolulu central I swore I would not return until I was introduced to the Kahala at Diamond Head. This was our third time spent at this hotel. It was USA school vacation time and I expected it to be crowded and it was but the holiday makers consisting mainly of families and honeymoon couples... a strange combination which worked really well as most guests were very polite and the children well behaved unlike our previous weeks visit to Maui 4 Seasons. The staff are very accomodating, the rooms well appointed and the house keeper Ping very meticulous and generous with bottled water and lovely products. The beach is perfect for toddlers , children and me as there are no waves due to a protective reef. The beach staff were the biggest let down at this hotel. We asked a passing server if he could bring us some water and we were told to get it ourselves which was no problem but could have been handled with more care. No umbrellas were available and covered chairs are available for over$ 100 + . No food or drink service offered to us the entire 7 days spent on the beach. The pools are very popular and fairly noisy probably due to the season but fine if you are with children. Not for adults wanting a peaceful time. The beach is a perfect alternative with lots of seating available . Breakfast buffet is fabulous with a great selection all labelled for food allergies and GF available for me . Chris the server was very efficient, friendly and helpful at all times. It can be very busy as outside visitors are welcome on the weekend but they do try seat hotel guests as priority. We ate at the Italian restaurant which has amazing food, beautifully presented. There is a very efficient shuttle service to the various shopping malls and the concierge staff Damien and DeeDee gave us some great suggestions regarding restaurants and amazing sushi at Sushi ii . There are weddings most days but they are very unobtrusive. We did have issues with some rather badly behaved and inconsiderate guests but it was dealt with after a few complaints. This is a beautiful hotel and a great place to relax

Incredible spot. Not cheap by any standard but worth it for a really special experience. Friendly fantastic service. Beautiful beach (get a beach view room to walk out right toi the beach). Rooms are exquisite. WOW!

First stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. Pleasant surprise, it was just far enough away from Waikiki to avoid the crowd, but easy access. Room and bathroom were spacious, food at all venues sampled were excellent. Can walk to Diamond Head. Only problem, tried reaching the concierge by phone and by email prior to our visit to arrange tours, but no response.

My wife and I returned to Kahala and it was, as expected, wonderful from start to finish. I write a review after each trip there--I think this was our fourth trip--and to be honest I am beginning to run out of new ways to describe how much I love this place. Beautiful rooms. Great views. Good food (but see below). Impeccable service. Luxury.We had a rental car as part of our Costco package and one day drove to Waikiki Beach, just to see what we were NOT choosing, and all I can say is that we have no desire to stay at any of the 5 star hotels downtown. It was like one giant concrete high-rise after another, hot and crowded.The only real criticism we have for Kahala revolve around the food options. Veranda has gotten too fancy; you don't even see a Kahala burger or regular dinner items on the menu. Their jumbo shrimp cocktail consists of exactly two shrimp. Really. Just two shrimp. I am sorry, but you should not call two shrimp a cocktail. They were superbly fresh and delicious, but for $16 it was almost funny.Also, the regular Plumeria dinner menu needs more options for non-fish eaters.
