I recognize that with so many Asian customers it is probably tough to come up with a menu that pleases everybody, but there were times when I really just wanted a big steak and my wife wanted a Kahala burger. More pasta dishes would be appreciated, too, by people like my wife who want neither fish nor a steak.I will say that their seafood buffet has really improved since I tried it a couple years ago. At $60 it wasn't cheap, but I thought it was worth it if you like that kind of thing on a Saturday night. But I also have to mention that the next night we went to the Father's Day buffet. The buffet was virtually identical to the seafood buffet with three exceptions: 1) it was 15 bucks more per person, 2) there was a guy playing guitar and singing, and 3) there was a whole cooked pig. The buffet was not described to us as a seafood buffet when we reserved seating, so that was a big disappointment for my wife, who does not eat seafood. By the way, the pig made virtually no sense: it was cold and served in bite-sized portions rather than in piles of pulled pork, which is what you expect when you are in Hawaii and somebody cooked a whole pig. I wonder what they did with all that leftover pork, too, since diners seemed to be turned off by, well, a cooked pig head in the middle of a buffet. Anyway, it was hard not to feel a bit taken advantage of when we realized we were basically looking at the same seafood buffet.But all of these are small points. We love the Kahala and I am already thinking of our next trip there.

We spent four nights at this beautiful hotel our children five and seven swam with the dolphins which was an amazing lifetime experience. Swimming in the sea, cocktails watching the sunsets - great food at Arancino's. great memories, thank you Kahala!

Exceptional in every way. From the food to the beach and the amazing service. The Kahala was top notch across the board. We booked through Costco and the deal was truly special. Kudos to the staff for superior service.

The Kahala has been one of my favorite hotels since I can remember. The entire hotel is fabulous: from the ocean views, floral decor, perfect cross breeze, rooms, and hotel grounds (including the dolphins, golf course, and beach). What I love most about the Kahala is the location-- while not far from the "city" and touristy things to do, it never feels crowded, stiff, or stuffy-- it's picturesque: always kept clean and up-to-date, is welcoming, and has attentive service. Simply a fine resort, and love this place for all occasions: solo, family, friends, romantic.. 5 stars.

We just came back from a 5 night stay and could not be happier with our experience. Pros:-Front desk service is excellent - so friendly and on point-Carlos, our check in representative, even sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries to celebrate my husbands birthday! This was not expected and we have never received this type unprompted generosity anywhere!-Valet staff were extremely professional, speedy, and friendly-Beautiful beach on the property-Beach rentals and cabanas were convenient and reasonably priced-Housekeeping staff were very detailed -Spacious rooms with LED TVs, strong A/C, and fast stable internet-No resort fee -Parking reasonably priced-Room service was on time and convenient -Onsite dolphin quest -Quiet area with convenient mall nearbyNeutral:-Beachside service was kind of slow-Mattresses and pillows were really soft (may be a Pro for some)Cons:-Seriously no water pressure at all in showers---slow drip at best The self parking lot is kind of small with the top two floors closed off for valet so it sort of forces you into using valet. Valet costs the same as self parking and was very professional except that there isn't an ATM that dispenses small bills or a change machine onsite. We found ourselves having to get cash back offsite in order to tip for the various excellent service around the resort. Just be prepared in this respect beforehand. The property is very private and quiet despite having a lot going on. We were never disturbed by room noise. There were several weddings and construction that took place onsite during our stay as well, and it didn't impact our stay. We were between Aulani, Four Seasons, and the Kahala and at so glad we chose to stay here. The service at this resort is what sets it apart and makes for all the difference.

I found this resort by accident. We visited their beachfront lounges with bar and food service to your lounge with a buzzer. Of course they are a private beach and the daily hire is fair. Protected waters to swim in from a natural rock shelf in the distance. We will visit here again for a quiet day of good drink, food and relaxation. The valet parking is complimentary for guests, at least it was when we hired a lounge. I never would have known if it wasn't for the valet taking a few minutes to show us what was on offer. The valet must be well trained in hospitality, it shows.

This hotel and location are simply beyond dreamy and fabulous! This is the second time we've stayed at The Kahala and it was perfect, again! We never left the room or balcony! It's situated between Diamond and Koko Head volcanos with the most pristine and beautiful beach in front of you. Totally private and steps away. There are lots of children however, with all the activities the staff has for them, it was wonderful to watch the kids explore the dolphins, fish and ocean. I was very surprised at how quite and serene it was during the day. The food in any of the restaurants is excellent and they were extremely accommodating with my health issues. It's like being with family from the moment you check in. Don't even think about it; just go!!!!!!

We've been visiting this property for the past decade. This is our first time with our newborn. Because of the "private beach" and tranquility, the property is perfect for the baby to experience Hawaii and the ocean. The room is dated. It's time for them to update them. I also feel that the service level has dropped over the years. The bell persons and the valet are great but the restaurant staff aren't as friendly comparatively.

My husband, two-year-old daughter, and I stayed at the Kahala for the first time a few weeks ago, and had a wonderful experience. The service was excellent and the property is beautiful. Our stay was only two nights, but luckily, we were able to squeeze in a photography session on our departure day at 6am, which turned out to be perfect for sunrise photos.Julia Jump was our photographer, and she was incredibly patient, friendly, and professional. She made our two-year-old daughter smile and laugh despite it being so early in the morning. She captured such gorgeous photos that we will forever cherish. She is truly talented! I would highly recommend setting up a photo session with Pacific Dream Photography during a stay at the Kahala.

This place is what dreams are made of. I used to live in Hawaii and the Kahala treats everyone like they're kama aina. You are close to everything you need without he hustle and bustle of downtown. The facilities and staff were second to none. I started this post mainly because I wanted to review the photographer, Julia, we worked with from Pacific Dream Photography at the resort. Our son just turned 6 months old during this trip and I have always wanted professional photos taken of him. I never really went through with it because it seems that anyone with a camera and photoshop can call themselves a photographer these days. Well we bit the bullet and booked a session with Julia just to see (the Kahala offered the session in our room package). Sunrise session with a grumpy baby, I thought/hoped maybe we got a couple good ones but my hopes weren't too high. Man, was I wrong. I was moved to tears how Julia was able to capture our family in posed and candid shots. She is a professional in all senses of the word and is amazing at what she does. She has captured my family and the love forever. I cannot express how grateful I am to Julia and the Kahala for my amazing trip back. Mahalo

We stayed at The Kahala after visiting two other islands as part of an incentive trip. The staff is professional and attentive. The food is very good especially Hoku's. After traveling with a large group we just wanted to chill and the beach area was perfect. The location is close enough to Waikiki for shopping and a bit of night life.

We happened to stay at The Kahala recently on our first trip to Oahu, and boy was I blown away! The very moment you step in, you are treated like Family! So much love and warmth! Hotel:The lobby of the hotel is beautiful with pretty chandeliers. When we checked in, we were given the traditional welcome of the lei and a cold towel to refresh. The checkin process was very smooth. We had a Scenic Ocean View Suite which had two bathrooms! The rooms were spotless and aesthetically decorated. The view from the Lanai(porch) was breathtaking. The bathrooms had luxury bath products. They had a shower and a soak tub and a vanity area as well. The evening turndown service was really cute, where they would leave chocolates every night. We were celebrating our 10th anniversary and so it was a very special one. The hotel had a surprise for us with a very personal touch.The beach is almost like a private beach with very few people not like Waikiki with a lot of people. If you want quality time and actually feel like a vacation, please consider this place. This resort will be like heaven for you. The hotel also had 6 playful dolphins who are the cutest. Restaurants:The hotel has few of the best food places in Oahu. Plumeria is amazing for breakfast and dinner. The view of the beach right in front of you is beautiful! The Seaside Grill is good for drinks on the beach or by the pool. Arancino is phenomenal! So much creativity and so good food. Not to be missed! Valet & Parking:There is a $32 charge for Valet or self parking. The Valet people are super sweet and always very very responsive. There was no other resort charges and you always had water, towels, umbrella etc at your disposal from the Bell desk.They even have a shuttle which drops you at the most popular places like the Kahala mall, T Galleria, Ala Moana etc. Overall:Everyone was so nice and welcoming. 7 nights were not sufficient for me. I wanted to stay more. If you seriously want to enjoy the beach side and have a relaxed stay, this is the place you should consider. It is away from the Waikiki crowds and pretty accessible by Shuttle. We had a rental but we din't drive to this crowd . The best part of the hotel I would say are the people. Everyone is so caring and treat you like family! I had such a phenomenal time here and can't wait to return back.

This was our first visit to Hawaii and we were treated like royalty. Everyone was so kind and respectful. The beach and the pool were beautiful and the food was fantastic. Dolphin Quest was a once in a lifetime experience for our daughter.

This place was great incredible. We had an amazing stay. The stag was out of this world. Everything was very clean. I'm definitely coming back. We had our honeymoon here and it was perfect. They were very accommodating and helped plan activities.

I am in love with small hotels and The Kahala Hotel is it! Excellent location, uncrowded beach, and a local feel nestled within Kahala town itself. Easy access to many things including shopping, jogging, swimming, the freeway if need. BUT once you're there you don't want to leave. Friendly staff, historic rooms which I can't get enough of. Quiet and the relaxation we were looking for. A reminder of days gone by. And let me say the BEST part about it, dolphins were swimming literally 15' from our front lanai all day everyday. I didn't want to go home and I never day that about visiting Oahu from Kauai. We will be back.

This hotel is excellent. The service is very good and the people are very helpful. The room was top rate and very clean and nice appointed. The resort has its own private beach. I would definitely stay here again.

If I could give it 10 stars I would! My husband and I stayed 5 nights and 6 days. My husband went to celebrate his 40th and I went for my Honeymoon! The parking attendants, bell boys, reception, servers at the Plumeria Beach House, attendants at the pool area or the beach area, and the sales attendants at the shops were so friendly, nice, and polite! Complimentary water ALL DAY! The Hotel is luxury, not crowed at all, clean, rooms are beautiful, housekeeping did a great job! The Plumeria Beach House, delicious food, excellent service, friendly atmosphere, great views!Enjoyed live music and wine at The Veranda Restaurant with beautiful views!Julia from Pacific Dream Photography was so nice, friendly, and professional...and her pictures came out AMAZING!!! They have a hospitality suite where you can rest, shower, watch TV, drink refreshments if you get there before you can check in or when you check out. Like we had 4 hours before our flight left so we went to the beach and then cleaned up before we left. :)I can go on and on.....I have ZERO complaints :)Thank you Kahala team for such a WONDERFUL STAY <3

Not a single complaint! :)My family visited this resort last week and it was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The service, amenities, restaurant and the pool are second to none. Most of sfaffs are very kind and they never say 'No' regarding my request.They give us turndown service throughout our stay and when I came back to home, I realized I left my wedding band in the room. I called the hotel and they kindly answered and found my rings! Food was great at Plumeria Beach House and surprisingly espectacular Seafood buffet(a must). You can enjoy the meal with gorgeous ocean front view.On that day we saw two beachside weddings taking place at this hotel and it makes us much romantic!Also We loved the pool and dolphins! we went there with 24months baby girl and she loved to play at the baby pool watching dolphins and the main pool which is not that deep so the parents (even under 5feet tall) can easily holding the baby and play in the water.Thank you Kahala for making our stay wonderful!I will not hesitate to stay at the kahala in the future. We can't wait to go back!

This was our second visit to this hotel. It is on a beautiful beach. The pool is as warm as a bath. The sea almost as warm. The sand golden and soft. There are dolphins, fish and turtles at this hotel.These are looked after by very attentive sealife experts and are well cared for. We had a room in the tower overlooking the golf course. We had a large veranda with lovely views. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was terrific!!!

This was an amazing hotel. The bedrooms were clean. The service was top on. The person that gave me our baggage was very polite and gave me a tour of the room. The breakfast was great. Their was a very kind lady at the concierge desk that made all our bookings. The beach was very peaceful (much quieter than waikiki beach).There was a dolphin lagoon also, which you can go inside. I highly recommended this place in honolulu.

Most trips to Honolulu include a lunch stop at Kahala's Plumeria Beach House, with its gorgeous ocean views, great service and excellent food - and this last trip was no exception. For a change, we sat inside as the wait for outside seating was longer and they were able to put us right next one of the outside passages so we had a splendid view. After lunch we wandered around to watch the dolphin feeding and people swimming with the dolphins. Also enjoyed staff interacting a bit with a stingray. We saw two beachside weddings taking place at this romantic resort. Kahala is just a magical place.

Everyone, from the receptionist to the bell boys, everyone one in this hotel was friendly, welcoming and polite. We paid for a standard room and were up-graded to a suite with a balcony on a high floor and we couldn't understand why. My husband joked that maybe we looked so old and tired they just wanted to be kind. Whatever it was, it was a very restful stay, with the most comfortable bed. The room was tastefully furnished and spacious. The breakfast was very well prepared and pleasant. It was an altogether good experience. We would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Kahala is everything a Hawaiian Resort should be. It will surprise you to realize how much fuss and activity is going on a few miles away on Waikiki beach. Kahala is calm and magical. It's been on my bucket list to stay here, and it more than exceeded my expectations.

We loved the beach here. You can really enjoy swimming, paddleboard, kayaking and just relaxing at this beach. It was not very crowded. It has very nice view. You can enjoy the breakfast right at the beach outside. They have nice breakfast buffet. Rooms are very clean and large. I suggest top floors to have better view.

The Kahala is GORGEOUS, and their staff is so, so wonderful. My husband and I spend 5 nights / 6 days with our 10 month old daughter, and the staff were amazingly helpful - even gave our daughter a little dolphin stuffed animal that she still loves to play with! The concierge desk - ESPECIALLY Dean in particular - was great, and helped us arrange for a snorkeling trip to Haunuma Bay, as well as a babysitter to watch our daughter when we were out snorkeling and one night for a "grown up night out." Dean was on top of everything, and made sure that we were taken care of no matter what we decided to do. We had breakfast included every morning with our stay, which was yummy and convenient. The beach was great, too. We had dinner one night at Arancino (I think that's the name?) which was really great, too -- but be sure to get reservations! We were there when there was a little construction going on, but it wasn't too much of an inconvenience at all. Wifi was free for basic service, and $25 a day for more power if you wanted to stream videos etc. We will surely return!

We had an absolutely splendid staycation at the Kahala Hotel with my husband and our twin toddlers. I am not exaggerating when I say that every single staff person with whom we interacted on our visit - the valets, the front desk, the restaurant and pool staff, the cleaning people - was wonderful, kind, welcoming, helpful, and full of aloha spirit. We had a huge room with plenty of room for the kids to run around, a gigantic bathroom with a tub and a shower, and a mini fridge that was blessedly empty so we could fill it with our milk and leftovers. We asked for a kama'aina rate and were told that we'd have a golf course view, but in fact, we had a great view of the ocean. We also told the staff we're celebrating our anniversary, and they had a bottle of champagne waiting for us - classy!Best of all, we LOVE THE POOL AND BEACH. It is kid heaven!!! The pool is heated to a very comfortably warm temperature. My toddlers loved the mini kiddie pool, just their size and just right for them. The beach has no waves and is ideal for children. My kids also loved watching the dolphins, turtles, and sting ray swim around, and visiting the waterfall.We had several great poolside meals - my only complaint being the portions were rather small for the high price tag. We also loved the breakfast buffet, which is right on the grass so the kids could run around while the grown-ups had an actual conversation.We will definitely be back. This is a very elegant but not snobby, fun and fabulous hotel!

My husband and I just spent 5 nights here for our honeymoon after a couple of nights at Turtle Bay. We couldn't recommend it highly enough. 5 star service the entire time. Enough restaurants to eat at, a buffet breakfast, shuttle service into Waikiki, a gorgeous dolphin lagoon and much more. Staff were considerate and obliging. Nice to be away from the busyness of Waikiki. We will definitely be back! Thanks Kahala Resort.

I researched the hotel prior to booking this trip through a travel agent and ended up with a golf course view. I wanted a luxury hotel that was quiet, not crowded since I would be traveling with a toddler. The room and bathroom were spacious and very comfortable and the style of desk, size/location was perfect. The first two days were problematic. My luggage was delayed upon arrival but delivered to the hotel around midnight. However, neither the front desk nor the bellman called to inform me of such. While trapped in my room, I was surprised to hear the sound of construction above me (somehow I missed that the hotel is under renovation). As a result of the lack of communication from the staff, my luggage went undelivered until after 12pm. On day two, I ordered lunch (pepperoni pizza) for my daughter and received a pizza with a bread tie under the cheese and pepperoni. Definitely a quality control issue. However, the trip did improve greatly. The beach is beautiful, the waves are calm and perfect for little ones. Breakfast was consistently delicious. Room service was great (even at midnight). And the housekeeping staff of Jasmine and Belle provided impeccable service. My daughter enjoyed the large pool even in the rain. As well as, her wee dolphin encounter. However, while in the pool I noticed some unsafe tiles along the edges. Although, the resort has a small pool for little ones, the food menus only have children's meals for 6-12 yr olds. It would be nice to have a menu with smaller portions for those parents who are teaching our children not to be wasteful.Overall, I would definitely consider staying here again but only after the renovation is complete.

We stayed at the Kahala resort for two weeks in a Dolphin Lanai room which overlooked the dolphin lagoon.The Kahala resort is about 8kms from Waikiki and provides a free shuttle bus departing the hotel at 9.30am through to 9.10pm stopping at Ala Moana shopping centre, Luxury Row and T Galleria in Waikiki and Kahala Mall.The hotel has direct access to a small, uncrowded beach with an average water temperature of 26 degrees.There is also a 26000 sq ft lagoon that is home to five dolphins that are very well cared for. While we were there a team from the University of Michigan conducted a program of scientific research on the dolphins which would be difficult to perform in the wild and adds to our knowledge about dolphins, however captive dolphins are becoming increasingly controversial. If dolphins could talk I think they would askto stay in the lagoon.The room we were in was quite large with a spacious balcony overlooking the dolphin lagoon, there were two wash basins and a separate toilet. The large screen TV had execellent reception and the free wifi was reliable and of adequate speed.We relied on the shuttle, The Bus, and walking, to visit the Arizona Memorial at Pearl Harbour, climbing to the top of Diamond Head, hiking to Makapu'u Lighthouse, snorkelling at Hanauma Bay, circumnavigating the island by bus (for $2.50 each) and shopping in Waikiki and Honolulu also managed a swim at the crowded Waikiki Beach.The Kahala is in an upmarket area surrounded by beautiful homes and shares a boundary with the Waialae Country Club, a private golf club that hosts the Sony Open each year.A buffet breakfast was included in our hotel package and was served in the Plumeria Beach House with an uninterrupted view of the ocean.The breakfast staff were a delight and imparted much helpful local knowledge. Thanks Barbara, Lynne and Carol.There are several shops and five restaurants within the resort .We also enjoyed the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and Honolulu however it was good to return to the Kahala's tranquillity and uncrowded beach. A well-run resort which we highly recommend.Mahalo, Kahala

I had an amazing time at this hotel and would definitely come back. The staff were very friendly and the room we had was very clean. As this hotel has a private beach it's always very quiet and calm which I loved. I am looking forward to coming back to this hotel next year!

We stayed at this resort for two nights (booked Standard View, Mountain View - King bed). Location is great (near Kahala Mall) away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. A short walk to the beach -- feels very private given the location of the hotel (not overcrowded like Waikiki). We received a cold towel and a lei upon at check-in, and there were complimentary snacks (cookies) in the room. The room itself was fairly spacious. There are a number of onsite dining options. We did not eat on the property, but Hoku's is excellent (based on prior experience). Hotel had some ongoing construction during our stay, which is not perfect. Didn't cause any issues, but you can certainly hear the construction noise as you walk around the property. Overall, it is a very nice hotel in a tranquil setting, with a beautiful beach. We would recommend to other and would definitely stay here again!

We had the pleasure of being a guest of the Kahala Hotel and Resort during the 75th Anniversary of Pearl Harbor and this legendary Hawaiian Landmark. This is, without a doubt in every way the ultimate, from its peaceful location away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki to its impeccable service and attention to every detail. Gerald Glennon, the General Manager, is one of the great old school hoteliers and his thoughtful and elegant hand is obviously there and that makes all the difference in the Kahala Hotel. Thank you Kahala Hotel for providing us with the best experience and stay!

I just fell in love with this hotel, amazing staff and stunning location.The hotel is located on the Beach front of Kahala with stunning, uninterrupted views of the Ocean.Kahala for those unfamiliar with Oahu is about 5 to 10 minute taxi drive to Waikiki but without the shops and crowds.We originally booked three nights here and planned to move to Waikiki for the last week of our vacation. We fell in love with the hotel and decided to extend our stay and cancel the hotel in Waikiki. You are close enough to the shops and restaurants of Waikiki if that is what you are after. But if you are after a quite, relaxed holiday and one where you feel that you are on a tropical island rather that a Disney resort then I highly recommend this hotel. The hotels in Waikiki are perfectly fine, but few have direct beach access and none have the views or ambience of the Kahala.On the downside rooms particularly those on the Beachfront are not cheap and if I am completely honest are a little overpriced for the size and comfort. Prices are not that far behind the Four Seasons, what you pay for is location.Hotel restaurants are good with the Italian restaurant of particular note (exceptional wine list too)Highly recommend it.

This was a great place to stay. The food was delicious and the the service was excellent. We loved the breakfast buffet and enjoyed the views of the beach and ocean. Our room was comfortable and clean. We had a patio that looked out to a waterfall and cove with dolphins. Lino took great care of our room and was so helpful! We were impressed with the friendliness of the staff.

We have gone there for their Wine Tasting Dinners, cocktails after work, Brunches, etc. but unfortunately, they keep cutting while raising prices. It doesn't help that the hotel is undergoing renovations.

I been in this hotel before when Is Hilton after mandarin original now is very nice hotel always best in Honolulu This is photo in 1996 in Kahala mandarin oriental very good staff and good service .... second photo is Kahala Hilton in 1990

My Mother's Day gift was staying here for two nights. Truly grateful for experiencing this magical place. Even though I rated a different luxury resort kind of low for being "man-made" and "canned", this resort can get away with it because of its pure elegance and charm. The spirit of Aloha is here.Loved everything we had at their onsite restaurants:Seaside Grill - great pokePlumeria Beach House - had their amazing buffet breakfast twice (outdoor seating)Arancino - try their signature dish "Spaghetti ai Ricci di Mare" (would go back just for this)Our room had a dolphin lagoon view, so it was great to wake up to the sounds of splashing, playing dolphins! We felt sorry for them for working all day and living in a lagoon. But glad we saw them happy in the morning. One day, they should definitely let them free. They also have other fish, turtles, and a stingray at the shallow end of the lagoon.Service was excellent everywhere we went. Everyone was genuinely kind and pleasant. This is a big plus for me - no snobby behavior, thank you very much.Hopefully after reading these positive reviews, you immediately book your stay here! It's well worth it, even if it breaks the bank!

Recently spent my first Mother's Day at the beautiful and charming Kahala Resort. Our entire experience was absolutely wonderful. The staff was incredibly courteous and friendly. My family lives in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, so it was nice to escape only a few miles to the serene setting of the Kahala. The resort is elegant and the decor is absolutely lovely. Our room was amazing and it was so nice having the extra space in our enormous suite. Our lanai overlooked the golf course and the lagoon where we watched dolphins playing below. The dining was exceptional and all of the amenities were wonderful. The perfect place to spend a Hawaiian vacation.

Spent several days at the Kahala Resort recently helping to accompany and babysit two grandchildren, ages 3 1/2 and 1 1/2. Excellent stay for our family group.Pluses:*long gentle beach was ideal for small children. The offshore reed eliminated large waves. Not great for surfers but wonderful for toddlers.*the breakfast buffet (included in my Amex rate) was excellent. The large numbers of Asian tourists have influenced a wonderful Asian food accent to hotel's offerings. In my group, we created a daily donburi option at breakfast from the rice, egg and proteins available each day. Delicious and fun.* the smallish pool (way overheated) was also perfect for kids. They alternated seamlessly between beach and pool.* beach walks in the early morning were outstanding for early risers, young and not so young.*international clientele (especially guests from Japan, China and Australia) lent a fun and sophisticated atmosphere to this destination resort.Minuses:* though great for kids, the pool was way too small, hot and crowded for adults. The resort badly needs a quiet, more luxurious pool option for adults.* the dolphin pond, though popular, is anachronistic. Caged dolphins performing for paying adults and families seems way out of step in today's world. I'd close that part of the pond in favor of a large adult pool mentioned above.* the food options are variable. The seafood buffet offered on Friday was disappointing. It had a catering, institutional feel and taste vs a fresh seafood option.* cabana facilities and services were minimal. At $115 per day, we expected a server to stop by once in awhile. Never happened during our 9-5 rental. Also, the cabana has a canvas cover and two lounges...only. Miss Vegas-like cabana offerings found in other luxurious hotels.This hotel is ideal for families with young children. Would stay there again. With adults only, however, I would look elsewhere

I have been to The Kahala Hotel & Resort many times, but this was my first opportunity to stay there as a guest. The hotel location is only a 10-minute ride from Waikiki, but it feels like you are on an outer island - no congestion, noise, or heavy traffic - just tranquility and beauty at The Kahala. My one-bedroom suite accommodations were very comfortable with a panoramic, unbelievable view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The lanais are large, so I enjoyed reading, having a glass of wine, and munching delicious appetizers there, refreshed by the balmy breeze. The lobby is elegant and provides the feeling of Hawaii with its decor and architecture. The staff is extremely courteous, friendly, and helpful. They treat each person as if they are special, and there is no request which they can't accommodate. For families, they have dolphins to swim with, which is fun and educational. I had a wonderful massage in the spa - totally relaxing and therapeutic. The Veranda Restaurant served a variety of hors d'oeuvres, but the Ahi Poke Musubi was the absolute best! In one word, my stay there was "awesome," and I can't wait to return!Vivian H.

The best place for breakfast with the most pleasant view as Hawaii should be. Most people dont know that there is a cold and hot menu, so if you just want to eat healthily, then you can do the cold with fruits and cereal, yogurt and raw Hawaiian honey dripping from the honeycombs.

The Kahala is one of the best hotel complexes anywhere in the world and as a result attracts the rich and famous. It exudes old world charm and elegance and the Dolphins provide a wonderful spectacle. It's hard to imagine a better place to stay in Honolulu.

this is a yelp review that i wrote back in 2015 and i'm kicking myself in the butt for not doing a review for Trip Advisor. The stay back then was so great that my wife and I are going back this June 2017 (less than a month away), with the kids this time. i have no doubt that the service will be any less than perfect, like the last time we stayed. This time, I'm sure I'll be inspired to write a second visit review, but this time i'll do the trip advisor review 1st.Very sorry that I haven't posted this review sooner, it's been a couple of weeks since we got back and I've been catching up with all the work that I left behind, so this is my review for the Kahala Hotel and Resort. We stayed at the Kahala for three of the most relaxing days that I can remember. I wanted to surprise my wife for her birthday (milestone one), so I was looking for something that was close enough to be able to jet off too and fly back in a short amount of time and far enough to seem like a mini honeymoon without breaking the bank. So, I ask a friend of mine, who goes to Hawaii more than anyone I know, what was a fine Hotel with some style, great service, and some history (the wife likes older classy hotels), on Oahu? His response, "The Kahala, its 10mins from downtown Waikiki, has its own private CLEAN beach, but's so nice you probably won't leave the resort". Man was he right. From the moment, we arrived until the moment we left we witnessed and received the most attentive and hospitable service. I contacted the hotel through their website because I had a request, nothing big; I just wanted to surprise my wife with a handwritten card from me in the room before we arrived. I tried this the year before, for our anniversary at a really nice hotel (5star rating) and they dropped the ball. I won't mention the name of the place because they felt really bad and I know that sometimes things happen but I wanted to make sure I didn't have a repeat. The automated email I got was that someone would get back to me with-in 24 hours, lo and behold; someone responded 4 hours later, that someone was Chef Concierge Susan Koki. She told me that she would be more than happy to help with making this surprise trip one to remember, so she proceeded to ask about my wife, have favorite flowers, color, food, etc., she told me to send the card to the hotel and she would make sure that it would be in the room before we checked in, if anything came up to shoot her an email or text her. Now check in is at 3pm, which I didn't know, and we would be there at 1pm. This makes this even more special. So, Friday is upon us, wife has the day off and I took the day off, she has no idea what we are doing or where we are going. I take the kids to school, come home and tell her that she has 15 minutes to pack. Now this could all go bad fellas, you know how women can get, they'll pack 3 big suit cases for a weekend, the only clue I gave was to bring ID and the place has a pool. She thought we were going to Napa, imagine the surprise when we pulled up to the Airport then walk up to the Hawaiian airline gate and then pulling up to the Kahala. Now it's time for the icing on the cake. The valet/bellman greeted us, grabbed our "two carry-ons" and then let us know that our bags would be right up shortly and walked us to Linda at the front desk who checked us in, she then called Bart, who I believe was one of the hotel managers, who personally showed us to our room. Now remember those questions that Susan asked in the email? Well she paid attention. The HUGE room had Purple Orchids flowers throughout the room, on the dressers, tables, bathroom etc., chilled champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with the Kahala written in gold leaf, nice presentation, and on the bed surrounded by my wife's favorite flowers, my card... Touchdown!! I know that Mrs. Koki didn't just throw that room together in 20 minutes. Now guys this is where you get to see your better half cry the good crying, not the bad kind. "The devil is in the details" imagine getting to the room and your card wasn't there, my wife wouldn't have known but I would have and that would have killed it for me. Fortunately, I was lucky enough to find the Kahala and all of the wonderful people there, everyone we interacted with, working there, made every effort to make our short stay, dare I say perfect? The hotel is gorgeous and gets 5 stars itself but the service is on a whole other level. We will be bringing our children back here to vacation as there is plenty to do but I'll always remember our 1st experience here. If you don't want to leave anything to chance, I would recommend calling the Kahala. P.S. I never even spoke to Mrs. Koki over the phone or face to face (just email and text), it's almost like I had a guardian angel pulling strings for me.

We stayed at the Kahala for a week in August and it was incredible. Excellent service, huge room and great facilities. Private beach with a man made spit you can walk down, plenty of sunbeds serviced by sufficient staff levels. Nice big pool right next to the dolphin enclosure where we enjoyed a reasonably priced swim with dolphins experience. Good food by the poolside and in each of the restaurants (we tried all but the seafood one) although the Italian wasn't really up to much. Regular buses in to the local Mall or Waikiki which is a great night out for shopping, eating at Hard Rock Cafe (don't forget your ID as my 26 year old wife instinctively didn't think to take hers as we don't need it in the UK and she then couldn't get served alcohol). Of treat yourself at the Cheesecake Factory or enjoy the fireworks at the Hilton centre. Relaxing in the main bar with a drink and listening to the pianist was 1 of our favourite experiences at the hotel. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful, recommending the chiefs luahau which was amazing. All I would say is make sure you take enough spending money, we took £1500 for a week thinking we would be ok but it's around £7 for half a beer by the pool and £11 for a burger & chips for lunch. That gives you and idea of the prices you will pay throughout your stay in the hotel, admittedly it's cheaper if you venture out in to Waikiki but why pay for a 5 star hotel and not experience the catering there right?Overall the best holiday we've ever had and we will be back at some point in our lives.

My husband and I just wanted to relax on our last day in Honolulu and booked at the Kahala. This property exudes understated (old world) elegance, is well maintained, is secluded and sits on its own private beach. The ocean views are breathtaking! We were given welcome leis upon arrival, were told our room wasn't ready (since we arrived before check-in time) but were given access to a hospitality suite where we could change and start enjoying the hotel's amenities.Enjoyed the day on the beach... so peaceful and relaxing!Luxurious accomodations with turndown service, very spacious room and bathroom with modern fixtures (heated toilet seat!) and amenities.It was truly a treat... would definitely return!!!

The Kahala was the perfect resort for our family with two daughters 15, 17. The service is exemplary, and the private beach beautiful with all of the amenities you would ever need. We stayed for 8 nights and found the resort to be great value for money.The food options on site offer great meals but more high end. However, there are many options fairly local and Waikiki is only 20 mins away too. When we come back to Oahu we would definitely return to the Kahala.

We stayed a week at the Kahala in a scenic room which provided beautiful lights at night. The pool is a warm salt water pool and relaxing to swim in. Many thanks to all the staff of the Kahala who greeted us warmly, (even remembered our names!) and provided excellent customer service. Dean recommended the 12 Avenue Grill and made all the arrangements for us; very professional service. I made lei's with three ladies on May 1 and they were welcoming, and taught me how to sew leis; I made two of them. Dallas in the rental car area gave us quick, efficient service and provided several sites to stop at as we drove around the North Shore. Our rooms were wonderfully clean and top of the line. We will definitely return to this beautiful oasis.

As a single male traveler who had been surfing in Honolulu for a week, I came to the Kahala for some rest and relaxation out of the chaos of Waikiki. It was such a pleasure to enjoy the beautiful resort location and the absolutely gorgeous room they assigned me. The luxury and peace were just what I needed before heading back to California and my busy life. Truly a memorable stay and much appreciate .I could tell they really strive to accommodate all their many and diverse guests.I will be back!

I recently hosted a dinner for 30+ guests at the Plumeria Beach House. The seafood buffet was excellent; the service by the staff was great; the restaurant was very accommodating to everybody's requests; and the ocean-side view was amazing. Several of the guests who arrived earlier enjoyed viewing the marine life in the ponds adjacent to the restaurant, dolphins that were swimming nearby, and the grassy area next to the ocean. Everyone had a great time; I definitely recommend any locals or visitors to consider this restaurant.

The seafood buffet was excellent. The staff is fantastic. Great value and great ocean view. This place is outstanding for visitors or locals. Great atmosphere for dinner . if you have not been here lately you should go

I have been going to the Kahala Hotel for years and I have never had a bad experience at any of its restaurants. Two weeks ago, I attended my friend's annual dinner party and had the most amazing experience. While the food was superb - presentation and taste, the service was outstanding. I was especially impressed by the entire dining team. I did not learn all the staff's names; Grace and Gerry distinquished themselves with their knowledge of the wines that accompanied all the dishes and made great recommendations. Grace did numerous call backs to make sure we were enjoying our dinner. Gerry was also attentive and worked tirelessly to exceed every guest's expectation. Many thanks to the Kahala staff for a memorable evening.

We recently held a company party at The Kahala Hotel & Resort for 125 of our honored employees and their guests. This was our first event at The Kahala as previous parties have always been held at other properties throughout Waikiki and Honolulu. The level of service, atmosphere, and food is unparalleled to any other experience we have received. If you are looking for a unique place to impress your guests and give them an experience like no other, The Kahala should be your choice. We had numerous compliments from our guests and "ZERO" complaints. The overall response and feedback was, "We want to do this again next year at The Kahala". ROOMS: Multiple people from our group including myself stayed overnight for the party. The luxurious rooms are some of the best you are going to find in Hawaii. The amenities are awesome and the service is on spot. From the moment you arrive it is like you have stepped back in time and are experiencing the quintessential luxury Hawaiian lifestyle. RESTAURANTS: All I have to say is experience all the restaurants on property. From a great Italian meal at Arancino's to a superb Seafood brunch at Hoku's you can't go wrong. You will have a great meal and leave thinking about how you want to come back and share the experience with more friends and family.I could write for hours about how great this place is. Experience it for yourself. You will not be disappointed.

After a ho hum stay at the Westin villas on Maui we were greatly anticipating an enhanced experience at The Kahala. And that's just what we got. It is located about 10-15 minutes away from Waikiki in a more quiet, residential area in its own enclave. We found that appealing to be away from the hustle and bustle. From the moment we arrived, the staff was the epitome of welcoming & friendly. They projected a genuine happiness of not only having us there but ensuring that we had an exceptional time. The front desk clerk who checked us in was extremely sincere in her efforts to upgrade our room in honor of our 10 year wedding anniversary. They were even gracious enough to send up a bottle of champagne on ice. -- classy move. We were greeted with beautiful leis and an adorable stuffed dolphin for our son. We booked this part of our trip through Costco who informed us regularly about ongoing construction throughout the property. Although this didn't sound too great at the outset, hotel management did an amazing job of containing any noise and related mess. In fact, it did not disrupt our stay in the least. We actually received 2 phone calls from of all people, the hotel operator who simply wanted to make sure that we were enjoying our stay and asked if there was anything they could do for us. Our room was on the 8th floor with a glorious sweeping head on ocean view. Very large lanai. Equally spacious bathroom with his & hers sides and finally a comfortably sized stall shower with good water pressure. (Separate large tub). I must mention that we have never encountered a hotel with bath towels as soft and plush as the Kahala's. There was also a keurig coffee maker with complimentary coffee pods provided daily. There were some issues though. The room itself needs work. The carpets are frayed and stained and the walls need a fresh coat of paint. There was a musty smell that we asked housekeeping to remedy. They tried to no avail. Also, the sheets almost felt damp. While it was humid, we certainly did not encounter that in Maui. But kudos to housekeeping who offered to change out the mattress. To be clear, notwithstanding these deficiencies, The Kahala is no dump. In fact, we believe they are far outweighed by the staff's exceptional service & care. We started each day with their incredible breakfast buffet. It exceeded our expectations. Lots of choices for kids and adults in a beautiful setting, overlooking the ocean. The saltwater pool was on the small side but never a challenge getting loungers with umbrellas. It was only steps to their self-contained beach where seating was equally easy. We enjoyed their towel policy, which was as simple as being asked, "how many do you need?" A welcome change from the hassle-filled and rigid policy at the Westin Maui. Kahala pool staff even insisted on escorting us to our choice of loungers and set them up with chair covers. The dolphin lagoon was a wonderful feature and we enjoyed seeing them. They offer a personal hands on experience in the water with them but we found it too pricey. We would be remiss by not mentioning the wonderful, highly skilled concierge staff. Special shout out to DeeDee, who was so friendly and knowledgeable and treated our 5 year old son like a prince. The Kahala is lucky to have her. Finally, it cost a lot to stay at The Kahala but it was worth every penny. But on that note, if you do book through Costco: it literally pays to check for pricing changes between your time of booking and departure. In our case, not only did the package price decrease by $357, they actually added comp breakfast buffet and parking. Costco refunded that difference immediately. If you happen to read my review of the Westin villas in Maui (same trip), you'll notice we wondered where their self-proclaimed aloha spirit was. We found it. It was here at The Kahala.

We are big fans of the Kahala Hotel and love it for its beautiful surrounding, impeccable service and delicious food. Most recently, we hosted a dinner party at the Maile Ballroom for our friends and it was truly a very memorable experience for everyone. A successful dinner party is one of the greatest achievements a host can claim and here, we would like to share this wonderful achievement to the Kahala Hotel team for partnering with us in hosting this special gathering for our friends .Some background on what made it special, once we set the date, we worked very closely with Grace Chan, Chef Wayne on the preparation & ideas. Special mention also to Sonja and Michael for the amazing dessert and rosemary bread. The Kahala team is absolutely top notch on the island. Preparing food for many guests is never easy but the team did it in style. The feedback from my guests included “Ribeye cap was tasty and lobster prepared to perfection. SeaBass was also excellent. Foie gras crunchy on the outside and juicy inside. Salad, scallops and fantastic appetizer plate and dessert selection. Even rosemary bread served hot!”, just to share a few comments. We are delighted with Gerald Glennon, General Manager for leading this wonderful group of people. The team deserves the real praise on what truly goes on behind the success of the party. Thank you Kahala Hotel and look forward to our next event soon!

You only do it once and it better be good. We picked Kahala Hotel because of its reputation as being the best hotel in Honolulu. We were so glad that we did. The service was amazing and for a 200 people banquet, the food were delicious too!With 9 months of planning and working with Grace Chan from the Kahala hotel very closely, she made sure everything was done to perfection. From the cocktail on the lawn to the main event, the banquet was extremely successful, memorable and we can't ask for anything more.The hotel rooms were amazing, all the guests had a great time, dancing into the night and after party at the hotel. A night to remember, and thank you Kahala Hotel for the wonderful memories.

Recently I was invited to a dinner party at the Kahala Ballroom. I was so impressed with the cuisine and service that I just had to compliment Executive Chef Wayne, Manager Grace and their staff for the top notch dinning experience. Our appetizer was cooked to perfection foie gras with vanilla roasted pineapple.hearts of palm salad was fresh, crisp and with just the right amount of dressing. The enticing aroma of the freshly baked rosemary bread permeated the entire dinning room. Then the Chilean seabass/ribeye, both cooked to perfection and literally melted in our mouth, For dessert, matcha crepes with French vanilla ice cream - WOW was all I could say!

Nice and clean hotel. Location is beautiful but far from waikiki beach and shops. It quiet and private beach is beautiful but very windy. Hotel itself need an upgrade/remodeling. Things look a little dated like the pool and room furniture. But service and staff were awesome.

We had a MARVELOUS time at the Kahala for Spring break. The hotel is in a secluded area and you feel like you're in your own paradise. The hotel staff was amazing. Special thanks to James Kepa who gave us so many perfect recommendations for restaurants and places to go on the island. This stay was just what our family needed!

We had deliberated for weeks on where to stay while visiting Oahu and we could not be happier with our choice. If you are looking for a hotel that will pamper you and is away from the noise and busy touristy areas, then you should seriously consider The Kahala. The shuttle is available to take you into Waikiki on a regular basis. We stopped into other hotels that were on our list while visiting Waikiki and although there are some that are very beautiful - they were very busy and the public has access to these pool/beach areas. Waikiki felt a little like the Vegas strip, but a beach strip. At the Kahala - you will have peace and serenity with the added bonus of getting into the "livelier area" when you feel like it.An absolute must for anyone who likes sushi - you have got to go to The Verenda or Hoku's for their "AHI POKE MUSUBI". We would consider flying back just for this! We had it 3 times during our week long stay.The level of service at The Kahala - from the restaurant staff to the pool staff and housekeeping - all extremely friendly and attentive. I must point out that during our stay, the Kahala were undergoing some renovations which did not impact our stay one little bit. They made every attempt possible to circumvent any and all inconvenience.Even our taxi driver one evening said to us, as we pulled into the resort, "I just love bringing people to this location, it's so beautiful and peaceful here". We couldn't agree more!

The Kahala Hotel has long been our go-to spot for dining, but last weekend we decided to take a "staycation" and get away for a few days. To say that we were not disappointed is an understatement. From the moment of check in our visit was greeted with gracious hospitality that followed us through the weekend. The quiet elegance, beauty, and serenity of the property captures your imagination to transport you away from the hustle and bustle of daily life. Mahalo to the staff and management for living and sharing the spirit of aloha. We look forward to returning soon.

We used the Kieki club for a couple of days during our stay. I cannot say enough good things about it! Lek was amazing with our son! He wants to go back! He went on the excursion day to the Zoo and the aquarium and then he did the camp day with the canoe/surf lessons. The added touch of sending us photos of his adventures was a HUGE plus. IF you are going to this hotel and have children look into the kids club - not just so you have some time to yourself but for them! Its awesome!

One of the most elegant resorts i believe on the island . You don't have to travel if you want a picture with a dolphin the hotel has dolphins but you would have to set up reservations and it's a fee of course . The view is awesome the service was hands down polite. They Have free bike rental if you want to go for ride around the island which I think is a great idea . The hotel provides free shuttle to Waikiki mall. Which is great because the taxi is pricy . The hotel staff gave a upgrade since it was our anniversary .

We were here 6 months ago to celebrate our anniversary and had such a great time returned with our teenage son for Spring Break. This time was great, too. We rented a paddle board and attempted that for the first time. It challenged us in the wind, but provided a fun couple of hours nonetheless. I did a SUP yoga class. It was a humbling experience but not impossible. The service was once again exemplary. The man from housekeeping who kept our room immaculate provided such wonderful service and when our paths crossed was professional and accommodating. We are already talking about coming back once the renovations are complete.

We had the most wonderful, relaxing stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. The staff was amazing and wonderful, the beaches perfect and relaxing, and the food and amenities top notch. You are in paradise but you don't want to leave the comfort of this hotel because it has everything there, including swimming with dolphins. Truly a once in a lifetime experience that I can't wait to have again!

If you're going to Honolulu, your best bet is to stay at The Kahala Resort. The rooms are spacious, gorgeous and magnificently comfortable. The service is top notch and so is every dish on all their menus. Best vacation yet!
user_name:
berijane
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is one of the greatest properties I have ever had the pleasure to stay at. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and beautifully appointed. The staff, especially Kerry Kuhl were absolutely wonderful! I needed to secure a meeting space for my group, at the last minute and only for a few hours and Kerry graciously let us book one of their spaces at a discounted rate since we did not need it for the entire day. This level of understanding and appreciation is almost unheard of in most of the hotels I have stayed in. Great work Kerry and the rest of you at the Kahala! Keep it up!

Our family stayed in 2 adjoining rooms that created a suite. We faced the gold course. The resort was nice with a full complimentary breakfast buffet. It was nice and remote so it felt much more quaint and relaxing. The most amazing part was the wondering photography session we did at the resort through Pacific Dream Photography. We will have these memories for a lifetime. The photographer and manager, Julia was SO wonderful during the shoot. She tried her best to get our kids to smile and laugh and made us all feel so comfortable and right at home. She was also an expert photographer in general. After the shoot she was SUPER accommodating when I misplaced my jump drive and there was a mix up with images. I appreciate her amazing service and artist touch to make our memories truly last a lifetime.

13 of us had the use of a beautifully appointed day room until our rooms were ready. Luggage was stored but we did grab our swimwear and headed to the gorgeous beach. 2 in our group rented double lounges with shade and we all enjoyed that. There's even a button to call for food and drinks! Most of us had lunch at the Seaside Grill, nicely shaded, casual and tasty offerings. I had an enormous plate of Hawaiian salted edamame and was going to taste what the rest of the group had that was vegetarian but it disappeared! They loved it. The virgin pineapple, coconut, smoothly in a frozen pineapple was so refreshing and fun to drink. The water is beautiful at the Kahala and going in and out of the water isn't a challenge because there is a protective reef where the waves break. The dolphin program and other animal programs looked great, I was especially impressed with a boxfish that had been trained! I was super delighted by the size of our stunning ocean view room. It was large enough with a balcony for all 13 of us to have a pizza party dinner catered by Arancino the Italian restaurant at the Kahala. The pizzas were delicious and a platter of fresh fruit for dessert was perfect. I had such a good sleep in the plush bed, the tub and shower are great. Staff are all warm and friendly and anticipated certain needs.Seriously cannot wait to return to this paradise. Until then Aloha and mahalo.

We took a risk planning our wedding as a destination wedding and having never been to Hawaii before, and worked with Grace and her team to setup our wedding. Had all our guests stay at the Kahala, and had an amazing time.Every guest told us that every staff encounter was amazing, facilities were unparalleled, and the dolphins oh my. Grace went out of her way to give us (and everyone else) the most memorable wedding ever. We even stayed at the Four Seasons but for us, the location, facilities and staff is what makes a hotel. We had the dolphin experience which was amazing, the trainer was fantastic. Having our wedding ceremony outside with the lovely views as the background was stunning. Having the reception at the Walia room, with the waterfall outside for the guests to mingle was a fantastic touch. The rooms and suites are amazing, the concierge service was always there for us, and the saunas and private beach means you can have your wedding and honeymoon in the same location. Our only regret was we didn't stay an extra week there.Thank you Grace

This hotel is fantastic! It was literally the best service I have experienced anywhere, hotel/restaurant/website, you name it- I have never had better. From the front desk to catering to group events, amazing. The location is unrivaled. 20 mins from Honolulu, close enough to get to easily but far enough away to feel secluded and quiet. This hotel is well worth the money if you are traveling to Oahu and Waikiki.

Beautiful hotel & surrounding area is gorgeous. We just returned from a Spring Break holiday, when we left the hotel began renovations in gift shop area but it was not disruptive. My teenage daughter loved to check out the dolphins in the mornings, the beach is beautiful, we rented a car to enjoy daily excursions and had the best vacation ever. The property was very pretty, rooms are very spacious. The restaurant with the beach views was also closed during the week for refurbishment, I'm sure it will be beautiful when done. We also took a ride to see the Disney Aluani hotel, and thank God did not stay there, it was also beautiful but packed with screaming kids and the location was not as good. The Kahala dolphin rooms were cute but they were in the shady side, and if the wind was not blowing it smelled slightly like a fish tank. We also did not take the breakfast package, we enjoyed the buffet only one morning, it was super expensive but delicious - because the restaurant is so busy it slows you down if have plans to leave in the mornings on excursions so I was glad we did not include it in our package for everyday.

We were staying at The Royal Hawaiian for our entire vacation in Hawaii, 10 days. We decided to have lunch at The Kahala, which was a surprise. It's beautiful and the staff, friendly. Very friendly. My husband and I sat inside, ordered the Lemonade Ice tea, and he ordered the Island Catch and I ordered the Lunch Special, Naan Steak Sandwich. It was delicious! I had to share it with my husband. The yogurt spicy sauce, not sure how it was made, but it had enough spiciness to thickness, fresh mint, and the steak was perfectly cooked and tender. He loved the garlic rice and the vegetables with the sweet sauce of the fish dish he ordered. Great flavoring on both dish. We will be staying at the Kahala, next year. The property is beautiful and the steak sandwich, I will try to make at home back in California. ;)

Arrived late afternoon to a beautiful, large room with heated toilet seats, plus other features. Amazing! There is a dolphin quest and turtle pond on the property, one swimming pool, but a wonderful beach with water toys. Although it was fun to see the dolphins up close, I did wonder why they're in captivity, whereas the turtles are kept only for a couple of years and then let loose in the wild. Every restaurant we ate in had exception food. The breakfast buffet at Hoku was popular, but I ordered from the menu each morning, and I was glad I did, the line for omelets took forever. Note: the Hoku restaurant at dinner requires pants, no shorts. But the Veranda restaurant has smaller plates and luscious breezes with live music to entertain one and all. We remarked each morning how quiet this hotel was and how comfortable the bed was. This is a wonderful resort and one my husband I would come back to enjoy!

Stayed at the Kahala in April for a 4 night stay. 4th night was free. Reservation came with free breakfast buffet at Plumeria. Plumeria is being renovated so ate at Hoku's (free) during the week. Plumeria was open on the weekends. We had a second floor ocean view room with a Lanai. The second floor would be the third floor at other hotels. Nice view of ocean/beach from room 211. Stayed at Kahala in 2007 and 2012. I did notice that a bath tub shelf that was available in 2007 is no longer available.(see photo). Carpets do show a little wear from when they were first installed in 2007. I had a new room in 2007 when everything appeared to be new. very spacious room, with two bathroom areas, one with a shower one with a tub. I noticed that maybe to save energy, the corridors of hotel were not air conditioned. Air conditioning does shut off if balcony door is kept open. A new energy saving feature. Enjoyed cabana lounge and cabana tent rental for two days on beach. The grill near the beach serves a limited menu but still has the drink served inside a real pineapple. The front desk and housekeeping are very responsive. Valet service is quick and efficient. I have stayed at the Kahala 3 times and it was our honeymoon hotel in 2012 when we were given a free upgrade to a suite (which made our honeymoon even better). Hotel is near a residential area. It is a secluded hotel if you value quiet. Restaurants are in the hotel or within driving distance of the hotel. We used the spa which was very enjoyable. I used the fitness center several times. Modern equipment and open 24 hours. I did have problems using the room key several times to both get access to fitness center and room. It's one of those card keys where you touch the door to enter. Room has fridge, coffee maker and you also get free water and turn down service each night. Pricey of course at about $900 a night. but for our stay the 4th night was free again with the free buffet breakfast. A great place to stay for rest and relaxation and a romantic stay.

If there is one group of customers that are hard to please, it's restaurant owners and managers. Probably the most critical of every detail and service flaw. With that said, all I have heard since the event were "EXCELLENT" compliments of our recent Awards Luncheon at the Kahala Hotel & Resort's Maile Ballroom. The food was delivered hot and quick, the room was set just as requested and the staff were very friendly and attentive to every need. I am still getting emails which is why I'm writing this review three weeks after the event. I highly recommend the Kahala.Gregg Fraser, Executive Director, Hawaii Restaurant Association

My wife and I booked a last minute trip to Hawaii in March 2017. We are extremely happy that we stayed at Kahala Hotel and Resort! Highly recommend! I personally wanted something more resort/relaxing/quiet yet not to compromise my wife's opportunity to shop in Waikiki. Kahala is the place! It's less than 15 minutes away from Waikiki and Kahala provides a shuttle just about every hour. Other than the resort itself is beautiful with dolphins and it's semi-private beach, the food there is pretty amazing. My wife and I especially like the Italian restaurant Arancino inside the hotel. Try their uni pasta! Lastly, we wanted to maximize our day in Hawaii (who wouldn't) so I booked a 9:40pm flight back to LA. Through AMEX, we already have a late check out (4pm), so I thought I'll just ask to leave the bags with the hotel front desk like we normally do. However, Carlos, the front receptionist went above and beyond to better service us. He kept the room for us till 7:30pm instead so that we can enjoy our stay longer and be stress free with our luggage. That was Aloha-ly Awesome! Because of the extended hours given to us, we got to jump in the ocean and soak in some more Aloha sun!!! It totally made this trip that much better! Mahalo Kahala, we'll be back very soon on my wife's orders!

The resort is beautiful, service is amazing and is great for any occasion (family trip, business, romantic get away). Concierge staff was very helpful and Lance from valet parking, as well.Can't wait to come back !

We just returned from a six night stay at the Kahala. It was beautiful and relaxing. At the Kahala, you can be low-key or step it up a notch if you prefer. The staff is very helpful, welcoming and kind. Our boys 17 and 15 enjoyed the water, the beach and the gym. This is a great location as it is away from Waikiki, but just a 10 or 15 minutes drive away. We went to dinner three times in Waikiki and took Uber. We did have a rental car, but unless you are planning to drive to other parts of Oahu, I would recommend not having a rental car and taking Uber, much more relaxing and you don't have to deal with parking! We were advised that during the time we were staying at the Kahala, the Plumeria Restaurant would be under renovation. I did worry about this because that is where they normally serve breakfast. I need not have worried: Breakfast was switched to Hoku restaurant and worked very well. We did not hear any noise and were not inconvenienced at all. Would definitely come back to the Kahala again. Loved the genuine Aloha Spirit, the beautiful rooms and bathrooms, the dolphins and the tranquility you will find at this resort!

This was our second stay at The Kahala. Out of ALL of our hotel stays during vacations, The Kahala is still our favorite. We love that it is tucked in a beautiful neighborhood, away from the hustle and bustle of the island. With two active boys, we opted for the oceanfront suite. It did not disappoint. There were so many great amenities, both in the room and throughout the resort. It was nice to come back to the room after busy days either sightseeing or lounging by the beach or pool and feel relaxed. My kids loved looking at the massive wall of celebrities who have stayed at the hotel. It made them feel "fancy," as my nine year old put it...haha! I told him during our first stay, we saw the then Governor Schwarzenegger in 2008 at the front entrance. Chef Wayne and the entire food service staff was incredible--I contacted him a few weeks to our arrival and spoke with him about a week before we checked in. Our sons have a few food allergies, and we were never concerned or worried for their well-being, as Chef Wayne assured me they would be fine. At Plumeria for breakfast, items were labeled if they contained an allergen. While we dined at the various restaurants on site, they were already aware of the allergies and took extra care in ensuring that the boys would dine safely. Never did they feel short changed on food they were eating, as they were able to eat pretty much everything...except those items containing nuts. I cannot say enough about the on site photography that is offered at the hotel!!! This was not offered our last time at the hotel, which was about 9 years ago. So happy they have added this, as it's always nice to remember a vacation. Talk about quality photos using a GREAT camera-we took sunrise pictures and they turned out beautifully-some of my favorites-and we take professional pictures yearly. I purchased a package and we have all of the digital rights to them. Christmas pictures are DONE! Everyone there, from housekeeping, to the front desk, to the wait staff, to the bellmen--were so friendly and so helpful. The Kahala remains our favorite hotel, hands down. We will return again one day soon!!!

My wife had the most amazing wedding at Kahala in December 2011 and recently returned to a lukewarm reception for our 5 year anniversary. Despite letting the restaurants know in advance of our anniversary and telling check-in staff, we ended up in a room with two separate beds at the back at the property. We then spent the next few days overhearing "Ferguson Rewards" guests commenting on their free room upgrades. Kahala is in a beautiful setting and is simply wonderful, but it seems that their new owners have strategically decided to focus on larger group bookings. For those looking at heading back to Hawaii for an anniversary perhaps consider staying at the Royal Hawaiian, where we headed afterwards and were greeted with champagne in the room and various nice touches throughout our stay.

I stayed at the Kahala in March with my husband who is handicapped and my best friend and her husband. When we checked in we realized that we needed a few items to accommodate my husband. Tyler at the front desk went out of his way to improvise and accommodate. It was much appreciated and worked well. Thank you. Everyone at the Kahala was ready, willing and aiming to please all of the guests. I've never seen so many ambitious and energetic employees. Nick at the pool was also amazing. Every day he would help my husband at the pool, never acting like it was a bother. The first few days of our trip the lift for the pool wasn't working to get my husband in the pool. We didn't say anything about it. A manager, Julie, came right over and took care of the situation. She reserved a cabana on the beach for us, champagne, and macadamia nuts to the room! We are not complainers, she just did this as a good faith gesture. I have nothing but good things to say about all of the employees at the Kahala. The view from our 9th floor ocean view lanai was breathtaking! It was wonderful to sit out there in the morning having coffee and again in the afternoon with a glass of wine. The room and the hotel were immaculate. Yes, the rooms are a little dated, but still very fresh and clean as were the linens. Room service was also great.The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. My friend picked the hotel and the location was perfect. It is set on a cove perfect for swimming. We never had a problem getting chairs at the pool or at the beach. Staff members even came onto the beach and to the pool to ask if you would like lunch or drinks. We did order quite a few times and never had a problem with long waits. The lunch from Seaside Grill was very good. We also ate at the other two restaurants, Plumeria House and Hokus which were very good also.We also loved looking at the dolphins, sea turtles, and fish. The employees took very good care of them. It was by far the best vacation we have been on, and I truly wish I were back there. Thank you Kahala for the wonderful experience and the exquisite service.

Yet dated. We were surprised that this 5 star hotel needed a facelift. The furniture was worn, some of the wall paper peeling, the grout in bathroom dirty, etc. but if you are looking for a relaxing resort, this is it. It is located about 20 minutes away from Waikiki and therefore about $20 taxi ride. Service however was great and food was very good. So we think it's a very good place to stay if you do not want action around you.

Wonderful setting with friendly staff and spacious clean rooms. Directly on the beach. Spectacular scenery. Great restaurant opportunities. This is truly the place to stay while in Honolulu. Closet I all the major attraction Hawaii has to offer.

My husband and I traveled to the Kahala last July for a post-deployment/anniversary vacation. I cannot begin to describe the level of luxury and personalized attention that made this experience so unforgettable. We booked through Costco travel, so our flight, transfer to/from airport, and hotel were included in our pricing. We also had daily breakfast buffet, a spa credit, and a complimentary photo session. Altogether, this was an incredible value. I seriously cannot emphasize enough how lucky we felt to be at this resort. We had never been to Hawaii, so we were a little hesitant to be so far from Waikiki without transportation. There was no need to worry, because the complimentary shuttle from the Kahala to Waikiki stopped in several different areas and was very prompt and helpful. We also were able to easily schedule a few tours that picked us up at the Kahala.Honestly, though, I would be happy to not even leave the resort. The breakfast buffet was varied each day but always included fresh fruit, a personalized omelet station, and several baked goods. While the restaurant could be busy during peak times, we had no trouble finding seating, even the more desirable ocean-view tables. The grounds were immaculate, including the beach and pool areas. While we did not swim with the dolphins in the Lagoon, it was still a pretty cool sight to see. Our room was impeccable. It was a huge suite, with a king-sized bed, sitting area, flat-screen TV on a swivel, a HUGE lanai, and a bathroom with two separate sinks, a large soaking tub, and a walk-in shower. But overall, the most memorable part of the Kahala was the service. Anywhere we went, we were greeted with the warm Hawaiian hospitality that permeates the island. No request was too big and nothing was overlooked. We felt like royalty and were treated as such.I wholeheartedly recommend the Kahala and would definitely return.

The basics are all here: the rooms are reasonable, the views are good, the food is good, the beach and pool are reasonable, the service is good. There are some downsides: the place feels a little 'older' than you might expect and it is a little more isolated than many locations. Overall I enjoyed my stay, but probably wouldn't stay there again

Kahala is fantastic! The staff goes out of their way. Restaurants are nice with good options. The beach is different, more like a cove. The rooms are spacious and relaxing. There's a fine dining restaurant, casual open air cocktail place for snacks and beach bar which is nice. Must try the poke balls. Really good runs from the hotel. It's a nice option to stay outside of Waikiki madness.
user_name:
nicole h
New York City, New York

review_body: I highly recommend this resort to families and those traveling with toddler aged children. My family and I didn't want to leave!!!We traveled to Oahu in Nov 2016. Myself along with my husband and 4 year old son. We had never traveled to Hawaii with children before and were worried about our trip being too commercial and not "Hawaii" enough. We drove right to the Kahala from the airport and all the worries were gone. We are bit of hotel snobs and we paid a fair price for our stay but it is SO WORTH it. The Kahala is STUNNING!! It is quiet, away from Waikiki and on the other side of Diamond Head. It is a little bit of a drive to get to places, but the tranquility and peacefulness of the resort makes it incredible. They treated my son like a VIP and us as well. We had a Dolphin Lagoon room with an ocean view and it was sheer perfection. Every morning & evening we watched the dolphins and finally towards the end of the trip we did the Dolphin Encounter (via Dolphin Quest) and it was a very special moment for us. We are for animal preservation and the entire program is so incredibly respectful. The breakfast buffet the Kahala offers at Plumeria is so very delicious and a highlight for us daily. We bought the breakfast as part of our package and that saved us about $20 a day. The beach is lovely and was a must for us to book the resort. It completely met our needs and we were able to enjoy the beach daily. The food at the beach was also very, very good. Towels and loungers are always available. Be mindful- there are no umbrellas. Arancini for dinner was divine. We had a 3 hour dinner there with our son and they completely took care of us. Yes-it's pricey but we felt we had solid, delicious food. A few things that set this resort apart from others. The staff listens and tries to accommodate you. Several times, our room needed to be made earlier or later- no problems. Need anything like water or extra blankets or soap- it is delivered immediately. They really care to take care of you. We needed a late check out and were granted a 6PM checkout due to our flight schedule. If they can accommodate you- they will. Book The Kahala..... you won't regret it.

When most people hear you're going to Oahu they think Waikiki with its crowds and traffic. The Kahala which is on the other side of Diamond Head is another case altogether. What a paradise. Built in 1964 and painstakingly maintained and updated since, the Kahala is an island of tranquility and luxury.
