A beautiful private beach, dolphin lagoons, spacious rooms, fantastic restaurants, and superlative service sets this place apart. We very uncharacteristically made an effort to not leave the resort the entire time we were there and we're glad we did. It's that kind of place. I'm almost hesitant to recommend the Kahala because I want it all to myself!

I had won a two night stay, and we chose to stay there to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. They upgraded us to an oceanfront room, and gave us a bottle of champagne. Everything about the hotel was terrific! The room, the staff, the breakfast buffet at the Plumeria Beach House, were all awesome. The hotel is way out on the other side of Diamond Head, but they have free shuttles to Waikiki and the Kahala Mall, or you can rent a car from Hertz right on the property. There is a Dolphin Quest on the property, as well as a wonderful spa. My husband got a massage in the spa, and he said it was the best one he's ever had! If you're up for a splurge, this hotel is the place to go.
user_name:
Cheryl D
Port Chester, NY, United States

review_body: Where to begin. This resort is top notch. I have NEVER slept so well as I slept here. The bed is to die for. The views are to die for. Have I mentioned the breakfast buffet? Out of this world. The beach is secluded and gorgeous. A little disappointing that you have to pay so much to enjoy it. Especially since the only pool has tons of kids. The cabanas on the beach are not cheap. The pool is free but not very relaxing. My suggestion would be an adults only pool. The staff is to top notch. I MUST mention our all time favorite, Dean the Concierge. Dean was born to do his job. My husband and I absolutely loved him. In fact, maybe went too far by asking if he would come home and live with us??!! He is the most kind man and is so willing to help you with anything and everything. Always with a smile on his face. I would go so far to say that HE made us feel so welcomed and comfortable. And if his boss is reading this, HE DESERVES A RAISE!!! A couple of very small changes. Don't get me wrong. This place is near perfection. However, if they want to reach perfection it would be nice if the bathroom's had a ceiling fan. It gets quite warm in there doing hair, applying makeup, etc for the ladies. Also, the vanity has no drawers for makeup, etc And, last but not least, a small step in the shower for the gals to shave their legs.Now, my husband's MINOR complaints. He went to the workout room early every morning. He also loved the steam room. He said it would have been nice to have decent razors down there along with some more toiletries for the guys. Such as, after shave, etc. As I said, all MINOR things. We absolutely loved our trip. We went to recharge and have our trip of a lifetime and that was accomplished. We were treated so well by the lovely staff. Kudos to all of you on a job well done (especially our beloved Dean! We will miss you!)David and Julie Gill

The Kohala is an unbelievably calm oasis on a very busy island. We stayed here for almost a week and found it hard to leave. I never found that the hotel or grounds felt crowded and some days I would be one of only a few people on the beach or in the water. The fitness centre is excellent and I can strongly recommend the yoga classes offered through the resort. We ate at the Plumeria every morning and the food was good and the staff was WONDERFUL. My husband and I look forward to returning...

We traveled to the Kahala, our first visit to Hawaii, with four adults, once of which was handicapped and in a wheelchair. Our flight, on United Airlines, was a nightmare and we arrived 8 hours later than scheduled. Check-in went extremely smooth even though it was late at night.The hotel is spectacularly beautiful and clean. The hotel staff was more than accommodating and happy to help with any need that we had. Traveling with a handicapped individual is not an easy task. The hotel went far and beyond to make his stay as comfortable as possible.We had booked our activities through Cameron Frithsen, the concierge at the Kahala. I put this poor fellow through the ringer with e-mails and correspondence for months before our trip trying to plan every detail. He was professional, courteous and straight out extremely patient with me. He is a shining star, of which there are many, at the Kahala. I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. They are helpful, they are friendly and they are over the top accommodating.The location of this hotel is off the beaten path of Waikiki, which was perfect for us, since we sought rest and relaxation. The beach, the hotel and the setting was truly paradise. The Dolphin Cove was an interesting addition that we kept visiting again and again. We ate in all of the restaurants. The food was delicious and the service was fantastic.I would travel back to the Kahala again and again. This was truly a trip of a lifetime that did not disappoint.

My husband and I stayed last September and whilst the property was very handsome and well-maintained, we had some initial issues with our room and parking. The service manager swiftly addressed these issues and rectified those that he could.Although outside of Waikiki, there is a free shuttle and the property is nice and quiet. The pool could have done with being bigger given the number of rooms, and I stick by my original comment about preferring to see dolphins in the wild.Overall I would definitely stay there again.

From beginning to end everything was great with our stay. Front desk and concierge serice was very accomadating. The rooms were fantastic, heated toilet seats were a huge excitement for my wife and I. The best part of the Hotel was definately the dolphins for us as well as the other lagoons with assorted fish and sea turtles. The Free breakfast in the morning was top notch. The gym had everything i needed and the mens and womens locker room had a hot tub, sauna, and a steam room. The beach was wonderful, just a short walk from the hotel and not overcrowded, and the pool was very warm which my wife and I love, you can just walk right in (It was also a salt water pool!) they had a couple of restaurants on premise, we ate at one (cant remember the name, not the Italian one) and it was great, although pricey. Finally, it was just an 18 min drive to Down town Wakiki, which we frequented a lot afor dinner and shopping.

We liked this hotel because it was a little away from downtown or Waikiki beach where most of actions happens. While being at the resort we could enjoy the quiet private beach but when we wanted some action we were able to take the shuttle to downtown. This is the place which hooked me into "relax-on-the-beach" vacations.

ITS your home away from home staycation .... You away from the hustle and bustleof the city and just a 10 minute drive away if you feel the need to go to Waikiki.The hotel grounds are beautiful, Theres a pool, a hot tub, a private beach. And DOLPHINS......The rooms are spacious and clean. There's valet parking, restaurants and bars on the the hotel grounds. The Staffs were very helpful and accommodating.From the time I pulled up in front the hotel to my check out, everyone was super nice.
user_name:
saleeshab
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife, two daughters and my parents just returned home from visiting this beautiful resort. One of the highlights for us was the photography experience we had with Julie from Pacific Dream studios. Pacific Dreams is on property at Kahala so it was very easy to book and we definitely wanted professional pictures with the extended family there. Julie took us to several beautiful areas on the property and the pictures we selected were so much better than we could have taken ourselves. I highly recommend Pacific Dream when you visit Kahala!

Such a great time. Love the dolphin quest, the food and atmosphere at Plumeria was excellent. We had just a few days but the resort and staff made us feel like we were here for weeks and as if we were special. Feeling rested and relaxed!! We will be recommending it to our friends and family.

Concierge did a marvelous job working out our itineraries with the whole crew of 7 kids/3 adults-with turtle snorkels, dolphin quests, and the submarine ride (PS-latter activity, not really recommended-dull if you are a diver, but I wanted to take my 7 year old daughter who liked it).At beachside, Peter at Hans Surfing School was our amazing guide. He helped us craft fun things to do with ages 7-14 year olds (surfing, paddle boarding, out rigging to see turtles). The guys in the cabana hut were terrific to blow up our tubes and things.The cabanas were lovely-really fantastic-nice with the fabric sides to adjust for wind and to be able to easily go between surf and pool. Loved the push buttons, and the waiters were generally awesome and came right away. I would DEFINITELY come back here.Tip-Go to breakfast early, as it gets a bit crowded (10 min wait) if held in the smaller dining room.Tip-$28 cab ride to get into Honolulu, so very good choice if don't plan much touring around--in/out of hotel propertyTip-Next door Arancino resto is top of eater.com and had spectacular food (foccacia bread shaped like cubes...pizza shaped like a bunny). So no want for good eats.

We stayed only for a few nights but loved it. We drove in (had a car) and loved the semi residential location away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu's main hotel area. Although not loads to do in the area in terms of nightlife, we loved what the hotel had to offer. Luxurious finishes, amenities and excellent food and drinks. The pool was small (and very crowded with children) but the beach goes forever. The only thing that was difficult for us was that they have dolphins in a very small area for people to "swim" with. We could not believe how many people were doing it and how small the area for these beautiful mammals was. This needs to go!

What to say...lovely rooms fantastic pool and dolphin pool lovely staff with the strong exception of the night house keeping staff who with one exception were surely and unhelpful. The bell desk staff were exceptional as were the shuttle bus staff. The big thing that lets the hotel down is the food. The room service food was meh at best no better than what a motel would serve. The buffet breakfast was expensive and passable at best. The Arancini restaurant was amazing food and great service and is the highlight of the food. The views from the rooms are amazing

The staff at the Kahala was amazing... The word "no" is not in their vocabulary... Every request was either answered or we were escorted to the destination we were looking... the food service staff were very attentive and all he meals were Delicious... We will defiantly be back to the Kahaha very soon...

This was our second visit to the Kahala and once again it was a outstanding visit. The employees are excellent we spent a week and never had a bad day because of poor service. From the front desk staff to the room cleaning staff just excellent.
user_name:
chaz4021
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The nicest plush hotel we have ever stayed. The dolphin lagoon, the lobby with beautiful royal cloak from King Kamehameha on display, fabulous resturants especially Hoku's where we had a delicious meal. So glad I shared with a friend! So delicious and I wouldn't been able to eat it all alone!Was definitely the best HOTEL of our 3 island tour! AMAZING ROOMS AND BATHROOMS!

Staying at Kahala Hotel & Resort was the best lodging experience I've ever had. The moment I arrived at the hotel, the lei and oshibori greeting was such a welcome gesture. Front office agents were friendly and personal. The room was super clean and spacious, given its 50-years' history of the hotel. The bathroom was equipped with a smart toilet and two sinks. Housekeepers took care of daily turn-down service and offered Kahala brand chocolate and orchard. Exquisite! The Chi spa and fitness center became my morning sanctuary. Meandering along the Dolphin Lagoon, not only could I spot 6 dolphins swimming, but also turtles, stingray, and fishes. Sipping a cup of Kona coffee, the morning unfolded beautifully in the breathtaking sunrise above the ocean... The next item in my Sunday's schedule was to run to Diamond Head and hike its Summit Trail...

Beautiful resort, older and very well maintained. Beach is amazing!!! Restaurants are wonderful, although a bit expensive. We almost never left the resort, we had such a good time. The rooms are spacious, clean and bedding is perfect. A truly enjoyable experience.

We spent 2 nights here checking out on March 4th. We had a ground level Dolphin Lanai room and it was awesome. It was a quick walk to the pool and beach. The room was spacious and the bathroom was nice. The service from the staff was always spectacular. Saturday morning we were able to have room service on our Lanai and watch the dolphins with various groups.We spent a little time at the pool and on the beach and also rented a 2 person kayak for an hour. All of the equipment seemed in great shape and the beach area was never crowded. The location of the hotel is great because you get to avoid the overcrowded streets in the Waikiki area which making getting in and out of the resort much easier. This was definitely one of the more relaxing stays I have had in a hotel.

The room was amazing and extraordinarily large. You got necklaces upon arrival, and they looked like the pure incarnation of wonderful. I recommend everyone to come to this almost unreal paradise of Hawaii.

Had my daughters wedding a the Kahala, everything about the wedding was fantastic. Thanks to Anna for assisting us with the planning of the event, getting a make up/hair lady, photographer and florist. Could not have asked for better service.. Hotel is nice, not often we get heated toilet seats in our hotel rooms! Hotel staff was attentive and friendly. Only time we had poor service was at the pool trying to get food. They have call buttons that we pressed repeatedly with no response, asked a waiter(who said he would send someone), waved our menu.. finally after 20 minutes of no service we went to be seated... dolphins were very entertaining.. we had 3 rooms at the hotel and all in all we would all say the stay was very nice.. again the staff help with the wedding/reception was great.. thanks kahala

Stayed here 4 nights at the end of February before joining up with family in Kona. We enjoyed our first stay so much we came back for another couple nights before our return home. Amazing place with a very friendly and welcoming staff. Beautiful beach, pool, rooms, and great food at the Plumeria, Veranda and Seaside Grill. (Did not make it to the Hoku or Arancina restaurants). The breakfast buffet had so much selection!! Well worth getting up for in the morning. Sit outside and catch the sunrise as you eat breakfast. The dolphins, sting ray, turtles and fish in the lagoons were always entertaining and the staff was always happy to answer questions. We learned a lot from the very well informed staff about all the sea life living there. Did not do a dolphin encounter but it was fun watching others. Maybe next trip!Our room faced the golf course and was very quiet. The bed was perfect and we loved the huge bathroom with separate shower and tub. There was a tv but we only watched it once to see the weather. Did not miss the crowds of Waikiki. Took time to sightsee along the north coast, and of course Pearl Harbor and hiking Diamond Head. We will definitely go back and highly recommend the Kahala.

We only stayed 2 nights here at the beginning of our 2 weeks in Hawaii but I wished we had stayed a bit longer. The room rate is on the high side for us, but I decided a splurge was in order after a long non stop flight.I loved that it was away from the crowds in Waikiki but still just a short drive away. The space is beautiful, spacious and modern. The luxury sneaks up on you rather than hitting you over the head. It feels good being there and the staff backs that up with great service that's not overbearing.Our room was perfect and large. They have Toto Bidet toilets, which are great, and a fun surprise to those of us not used to this kind of after wash.The beach area was not at all crowded. ( we checked the Waikiki beaches later and some of them are so small and noisy. Not a pleasant experience ) and just a few more steps past the pool area. There is a pond with amazing fish and sea life and while some don't approve of the dolphins in another area, it is still wonderful to see them jumping out of the water.I enjoyed the long hallway with photos from the past and appreciated the decor more and more as time went on.It was a perfect relaxing environment. Now the one one bad note was that the food was expensive no matter what. We did manage a small dinner at the Italian restaurant but I didn't like that if you wanted to eat it was a big bite out of the budget. We went over to the Whole Foods, for breakfast, a mile away and had a simple coffee and oatmeal for $8.00 rather than $16.00 just for a bowl of cereal. While I'm critical of this I didn't take off a star because I think most people that stay here expect the food to be pricey.All in all it was a wonderful beginning to our Hawaiian Holiday.

This was a quick business trip .  I had been to Four Season Big Island two months ago and Halekulani 6 months ago . Four seasons a solid 5 star hotel . Halekulani a distant 2nd place four star hotel and Kahala a big drop to third place and three star hotel .  I upgraded to full ocean view which was beautiful view . Carpets in room were strangely sticky, toilet was broken,and furniture was dated and worn. Food was expensive and really mediocre.  If need to go to Oahu and want to avoid crowds of Waikiki would search for another hotel.  Also, would have never even made reservation if knew had dolphins in captivity

The Kahala is a superb blend of classic luxury with modern amenities all wrapped up by outstanding service. Away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, the location is perfect for relaxation and serenity. Upon arrival we were met by Todd, he quickly whisked us away to check in. A wonderful Aloha greeting by Carlos and James at the front desk was met with bonus upgrade! Our ocean view room, on a low floor was perfect. The views of the ocean, pool and especially the dolphins habitat was superb.The property is intimate, and pristine. The pool area is a little tight, but there is ample space on the beach. Service at the pool/beach lacked at times (could be a bit more attentive). Shining stars were Aaron at the Seaside Grill, and Julie O' they personify the Best of the BEST. Susan took awesome care of us during the week at the fantastic buffet breakfast. The buffet changes daily, one day chicken dumplings, the next day the famous thin pancakes! Can't go wrong. The SPA is a must do experience during your visit. We had the most amazing service from our hosts Kumi and Angeli, and the BEST massages we ever had from Saori & Wendy. I highly recommend asking for one of these therapists, it will change your life :) Onsite restaurants Arancino's & Hoku's are both fantastic! Special thank you's to Jonah at Arancinos, and Mr. Mikio and his fabulous team at Hoku's Taryn & Chris et al. Hoku's is world class (see my other review), and I highly recommend both of these restaurants.Dolphin Quest was a fantastic experience. To get up close and personal with these amazing mammals was simply amazing. We felt honored and blessed to share the time we did with them. Sooooo beautiful, intelligent, and loving. We learned a lot about the dolphins, and truly felt the overwhelming love and attention that the DQ caretakers show them. One big happy family. There's a reason why there is a block long "wall of fame" adorned with "A" listers as well as the common joe in the lobby of the Kahala. This Five Star hotel embraces one and all. As the Honolulu Police Department motto says "One Heart - One Nation".
user_name:
Vinceonthemove
New York City, New York

review_body: Our family had an amazing stay at the Kahala Hotel. The room was fantastic and the staff incredibly helpful. It is a very beautiful and unique property. We had a family outing on the stand up paddle boards and had a great time.

First off, if you live in Hawaii - your expectations of being "blown away" by a hotel are limited because we tend to see a lot of pretty amazing things here. Second, if you live in Hawaii and plan corporate events for work; it's even a little harder to get the "wow factor."I am impressed and just really blown away by not just the service, but the care and thought that Ms. Anna Hinkley and her team at the Catering & Conference Center at the Kahala Hotel & Resort provided our group at a recent event. I had the pleasure of working with Anna directly to ensure that this weekend destination event went smoothly and that all the guests were treated to a true Hawaiian experience. Her follow through and expertise on even the smallest detail made it so this 200+ person, multi-tiered event had the host couple and all the guests NOT wanting it to end. I'm not sure- but Anna may have had some influence on the parting of clouds and rain for an 90 minute outside cocktail party with fire dancing on the beach! Thanks to Anna, and alternate plan was already in place if the rains came - which really helped alleviate any stress.The Kahala Hotel and Resort staff is top notch and EVERYONE from the valet to the people that helped us with in the Maile Ballroom were just exceptional with their attitude and willingness to help.The rooms provided to the guests were clean, very comfortable and gave everyone a luxurious weekend experience.From an event planning standpoint, we had an amazing experience preparing for this celebration and I would highly recommend to anyone near and far that they consider the Kahala Hotel and Resort for their personal or corporate event needs. You won't find a better team of people that will be by your side to make sure your vision is realized.

This property is top notch!!! The amenities are vast, the staff we extremely friendly and professional!!! We loved that it wasnt the touristy filled, high volume property. Fantastic location, the beach is fabulous, and lots to do here!! We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We loved the beautiful and gracious Kahala and especially enjoyed our dolphin lanai room. Watching the five dolphins play for our four day stay was a highlight of our stay on two islands. The room is tastefully decorated with dark wood furniture. The balcony (lanai) was spacious, and we could see the ocean beyond the dolphin pools. The bathroom was one of the best ever with separate sink areas, shower, bath tub, and double closets. The staff are uniformly polite and competent. The hotel has a long portion of lovely beach. Breakfasts in the Plumeria were very good. The location of the hotel to the east of Diamond Head is super when compared to the madness of Waikiki. The hotel does not have a resort fee, but parking is $32 a day.

Wonderful, peaceful property with great restaurants and beach away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Home of the Dolphin Encounter. Easy access to tours, nature, water sports and Waikiki and other areas via uber or Hertz rental car (on site)

We stayed at the Kahala Resort a couple of months ago and found the property, hotel amenities and especially the staff fantastic. The hotel has all of the creature comforts one would expect for a resort in Hawaii with the added advantage of being located away from the high density of Waikiki, but within minutes if you choose to travel from the hotel to experience all that Waikiki offers. What makes this hotel special is the understated elegance of the decor, spacious and well appointed rooms immaculate grounds, and a staff that is well trained and focused on providing service with real Hawaiian hospitality. We have stayed at other high end hotels on Oahu and can honestly say that this is by far our top pick for enjoying all the best that Oahu offers. We will be back.

Last week, I called The Kahala to get some information about the Hotel. The hotel operator, Gina promptly answered the phone. She was so pleasant and professional. She made such a great first impression! If she is an indication of the staff and level of service at The Kahala, I can't wait to experience the resort.Karen J.

Went to Hoku's for dinner on 2/18. Both the food and service were excellent! The valet was very polite and opened the car door for my date and helped her out. Our waiter was extremely professional and addressed me by name throughout the evening. The food was fantastic! I had Mahi Mahi and it melted in my mouth. Never did either of us feel rushed to finish our meal or pay the bill quickly. I would highly recommend Hoku"s to anyone.

The private beach is perfect. Not full of people and very clean. Dolphin pool is impressive. Food in that Italian restaurant was good! Their staff are very friendly and professional. They also have free shuttle to ala moana mall, Waikiki area and Kahala mall!

The best place I have stayed in a long time. Extremely friendly staff, Great food, Cold Beer, lots of Sun, Super cool Dolphins & other sea creatures, easy shuttle rides to Waikiki Beach and malls, quick taxi rides any where on the island and a way to get away for all the tourist on Oahu.

Earlier this week we decided to take a mini staycation for my daughter's second birthday and visit the Kahala. We had an amazing time and I was blown away by the service and amenities, plus the hotel property was just spectacular! On check in, they noticed my daughter had a birthday crown and welcomed her warmly with a dolphin gift for the occasion, but the feel of the hotel was upscale and while family friendly it was not overly kid-centric. We really enjoyed the view of the pool and ocean, and spent some time in the afternoon chatting with the dolphin trainers between dips in the pool. The dolphins, turtles, sting rays, and fish are wonderful to see up close! We had dinner at Arancinos on property and enjoyed a delicious meal with very hospitable service. The room was a perfect sanctuary from our every day and after less than 24 hours we felt as if we'd been on a full vacation! Can't wait to do this again for our next special occasion.

From the time we arrived till we left I felt I was a welcome guest. The staff from the door to the concierge and maid service were al. Very friendly and eager to help. The room was spacious and I loved the turndown service. I am now addicted to the "thin pancakes". I had them everyday of the seven days we stayed. The breakfast buffet was excellent. I am not a fan of gourmet restaurants as I find them large on style and not much else. The concierge recommended several restaurants in town that were excellent and had Hawaiian food. Ninety percent of the wait staff was excellent but there was a ten percent that seemed to have a smile but that was the only quick movement they had.

The staff was the best. Everyone was fantastic and we give big props to Julia Jump with Pacific Dream photography. We did a little photo shoot to remember the trip and she was so much fun to work with. She made us feel very comfortable and her knowledge of taking our pictures goes beyond a skill set and goes further to an art form. The hotel grounds were always kept clean - it was very kid friendly. We got lessons how to paddle board from Peter and we also recommend that experience. This hotel has a great little protected cove that made learning the sport much easier. The balcony view of the ocean was to die for. But the other side of the hotel has a view of a high end golf course and the city. So both sides are awesome.

I recently visited the Kahala Hotel and immediately felt the staff warm Hawaiian hospitality and they all seem so happy !The valets rushed to my car door (not like other hotels where the valets just stand waiting for you to get out ) , they welcomed me to the Kahala Hotel by name and instantly I knew I arrived to a very special place .Hoku 's Restaurant is special , service from Frank and Kent were amazing and flawless .Our meal was delicious .The Hoku's staff are so warm , 5 star which compliments your dining experience .Mikio (!!!) General Manager of Hoku's needs to be recognized .He came to our table to inquire if all was to our liking as noticed he did this to all the patrons dining in the room .His warm ,caring and 1st class disposition also added to an enjoyable wonderful meal .I will be back and will be telling all my contacts here in los Angeles , when visiting Oahu they must stay at the Kahala Hotel for it's authentic staff hospitality personalized attention .I will be back for sure !

I went to the Kahala for a lunch meeting. The valet, Darryl, greeted me by my name! He also walked me into the lobby to meet my friend. We went to the Plumeria restaurant for lunch. Again, I was greeted by my name by the restaurant manager, Won. Had a great dining experience there. When I was leaving, the valet brought out my car without me asking. That was a nice surprise.

Had a mommy-daughter breakfast date on Saturday morning at the Plumeria Beach House on the Kahala Resort property. Everything was amazing......the food selection, taste of the food, the service from hostess to waiters & manager and my coffee was excellent. My daughter ordered an Acai bowl from the menu and she loved it! The kitchen staff was constantly replenishing the foods on the buffet line and the omelette bar was fantastic. We will definitely be back to visit the breakfast buffet again, with the rest of the family. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

From the moment you arrive you just know this is somewhere special. The welcome from the bell hop team and reception (Noel) was just lovely and seemed so genuine. The room (we had a scenic lanai king room) was beautiful- lots of space and very comfortable. The scenic rooms are looking over the Wailea golf course and the mountains with all the houses - it was lovely to sit & watch the world go by while relaxing on the balcony. If you have time get a spa treatment- best ever and the treatment rooms are beautiful. The beach is an oasis of calm - great for an early morning swim and so easy to stroll there from the hotel. The breakfast was nice - eggs cooked to order & plenty of fruit / breads & hot food to choose from. We ate in Plumeira, seaside bar, the veranda and Hokus. All were nice although we expected Hokus to be just a bit more special than it was. Overall though we wanted a relaxing & really special holiday that felt like a treat and the Kahala didn't disappoint. We are already planning our return there!

Dolphins in captivity is wrong.No, I mean NO beach service: food or beach boys. They are available, they just don't do anything.The building is an iconic architectural masterpiece from the early 60's.Magnificent lobby. Tall ceilings, bright and airy rooms. Certainly pay extra for ocean front/views room...that's why you came to Hawaii.Quiet and peaceful away from the noxious noise and crazy crowds of waikiki.No surf here as beach is in a very calm lagoon.Water sports rentals available-- sups, etc.Negatives:1. No Beach boys never-ever were found on the sand. We had to find them huddling together at their stand. They only left the stand to set umbrellas or gather chairs at end of day--watched it for 4 days.2. $30 for an umbrella-- then a beach boy would leave the stand, drill the hole, place umbrella and disappear back only to be scene again as they gathered up chairs at end of day.3. No food service on the sand-- we had to go up each day and place orders. Eventually they would deliver. Never found them on the sand (4 days)4. Overpriced breakfast buffet was nothing special.5. Needless to say, the dolphin cage/petting pond is so wrong as to be almost criminal. Even seaworld is ending that type of horrible captivity. Free the dolphins and end that exhibit.We never took the trolley into town---we always ubered in for foodie dining ( see my reviews). Hoku restaurant looked uptight and too formal.Peaceful and serene and on the sand-- there's a only couple of choices for hotels like this (lotus).Glad we came and tried it, but probably won't return.

From the moment you set foot on property you are in for an amazing pampering. The staff of The Kahala really make you feel like royalty. Located off the beaten path of Waikiki The Kahala is a hidden gem on the island of Oahu. The rooms are spacious and elegantly clean. Every attention to detail has been considered for an optimal relaxation experience. Linens are soft and comforting. The soft comfortable beds embrace you for the best sleep that I've had on any vacation and the rooms are quiet as the Hotel is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I personally appreciate that in the evening, you can lightly hear the ocean waves washing up on the sand. The view of the Pacific Ocean is breath taking, and if you are lucky and are there at the right season you can see whales all the way out to the horizon. The white sand and beach is so fine to walk on barefoot. The water sparkles every morning and we were able to get amazing sunrises every morning of our stay. But what really made this experience over the top was the dining options. Though the breakfast buffet in the Plumeria Beach House is amazing with a large spread and made to order omelets, our real treat was Hoku's the fine dining restaurant. As you walk in staff greet you by name and you are seated at a table with a sunset view of the ocean. It was recommended by a friend that we try the 7 course Tasting Menu and I'm glad I did. If you like seafood Chef Wayne created a wonderful spread. I especially like the Petite Hamachi Poke Don, the Poached Half Lobster and Chef’s Signature “Kahala Wrap”. All flavors are fresh and well designed. The seafood is perfectly cooked and special care is taken to assure an optimal flavor and savory experience. Overall 5 stars is not enough to express the amazing weekend we had. Thank you Kahala. We'll be back soon.

Had the Seafood dinner buffet at the Plumeria House on Friday evening. Very happy with the fresh seafood selection and prime rib carving station. Definitely satisfied my craving for seafood! The buffet was well stocked and wait staff was very attentive. Will be back! Mahalo!

This beautiful resort in paradise deserves mention...Luxury, pampering, excellent staff. All areas, beach bar, the many restaurants, spa were outstanding. We were there when they had "dinner by moonlight" and since it was our anniversary, we were seated right on the beach! I recommend this resort for a lovely, romantic stay.

I have been going to the Hawaiian Islands for almost 40 years and stayed in many of the top resorts on all of the islands, Four Seasons, Mauna Kea, Halekulani, etc. but had never been to the Kahala Hotel. It is a hidden gem. You really go through a time warp leaving the major city and congestion of the freeway from the airport to this magnificent oasis. It really transports you to a very relaxing self contained island in a residential neighborhood beyond Diamond Head. While this is an older property early 60's it is well kept and maintained. We use to go to the Mauna Kea a lot but that property of relatively the same vintage aside from its one of a kind beach is no longer well maintained, lacks the service, amenities, friendly and helpful staff and higher quality food and beverage offerings throughout the property. We also considered the Four Seasons Ko'Olina for this trip but have seen numerous poor reviews...its location and setting is nothing like the Kahala.Here is a list of the pro's (many) and con's (not many) Pro'slocationstaff-gets to know you quickly and your food choices, drink choices, your name, they go out of their way to be courteous and helpful and it is genuine (Mauna Kea staff could learn a lot from this group training and execution)cleanliness-rooms, public areas, restrooms...again even though this is an old hotel is is very well maintained...beautifully manicured groundsbeach-beautiful site with great places to sit, shade, umbrellas, nice lawn if you prefer that is well maintained, gorgeous views, good quality comfortable chaise lounges, with friendly helpful beach staff...you don't have to get up at 5:30 am to get a seat.fitness center-well equipped for this size property with a steam bathfood and beverage-Hoku, Beach front restaurant (lunch) and Arancino Restaurant on property were great variety, service, wine/beverage selections (though typical for many hotels wine is way overpriced...need to add more value choices in all categories on wine lists), the 3 meal restaurant (Plumeria) not so much...food was not great or the service, waitress provided indifferent poor service so in fairness we only visited it once. i.e. decided not to go back after a bad dinner but did not try lunch or breakfast while we were there. Veranda lobby lounge great for the evening with great live music, small plates and drinks/wine for before or after dinnerrooms-we stayed in an ocean view lanai room...great view, thoughtfully laid out with all you need and updated with 2 sinks, closets, great shower, etc. not all rooms here have lanai's or ocean views but its worth it.Pool scene-not a lot of screaming kids but perhaps we went at a quiet time and also fortunately not the hot shot look at me crowd that gets drunk and disorderly and unchecked these days at Four Seasons Hotel pools that we have experience first hand at several properties. There is a nice calm about the place.Con's things that could be improvedThough it would a major capital project it would be good to eliminate the dolphin pools and activity in the main courtyard of the hotel overlooking the beach...needs a bigger pool area and beachfront bars to take advantage of the incredible views...the one bar faces away from the ocean, you look at the bartenders from half a dozen stools versus out at the ocean. There is another bar across the way with a couple of outdoor sofas outside the 3 meal restaurant Plumeria that is a nice place to sit and sip with a view but the property could to a lot more to take advantage of their location with their bars.In summary, a great high quality experience from the reservation team that helped us a lot, every staff person we came in contact with..we have already booked again in November. Once you are there we just did not want to leave, i.e. no need to go downtown or even have a car...they have a shuttle service if you need it to downtown Honolulu. Thanks so much to everyone at the Kahala that provided us with great hospitality!

this is a 5 star plus resort with Dolphin Encounters on premises. Have coffee or breakfast in their beach restaurant area and watch the dolphins play and interact with visitors. Staff is very helpful and friendly

It was great stay for my family. Especially my two sons loved this hotel.And every staffs and housekeeping, room service were adorable.Hope to stay again here.진짜 좋았습니다. 오래됐지만 최선으로 최고를 만드는듯한 호텔이었습니다. 다시 하와이를 와도 여기 머무를 생각입니다.

I was very pleasantly surprised when I went to the Kahala Hotel & Resort recently. The valet service was exceptional. The valets greeted me by name and were very prompt in getting my car. It made me feel like a VIP. Keep up the great service!

For my honeymoon, I scoured all the hotels in Honolulu in search of the best deal yet luxurious feel of a room since if there was a time to splurge, it would be for my honeymoon. I kept seeing many awesome reviews for the Kahala, but for the price and distance from Waikiki, I wasn't completely sold. Yet, when I found the Costco package (which I highly recommend!), I was more OK with booking. Since my week at the Kahala, I cannot recommend it more. It is such a beautiful hotel. The service was the most wonderful I have ever experienced. Everyone is so helpful, attentive, and nice! I loved the room's cleanliness and luxurious feel (I felt so spoiled! Chocolates and a plumeria nightly). It was so quiet and felt very safe. The breakfast at Plumeria House was phenomenal! The bed was so comfortable. And the distance to Waikiki wasn't an issue since they have a complimentary shuttle. I did a combo of driving and shuttling, but I like the shuttle because parking in Waikiki can be a bit of a struggle. I even liked being away from the hubbub of Waikiki (as many people will say). Overall, for what Kahala offers, I can't recommend it enough. I had a blast even without an ocean view room (views of Diamond Head and Koko Head were still awesome). Though just leaving a few days ago, my husband and I have thoughts of booking our anniversary trips in the future back here at the Kahala.

My wife and I stayed for three nights at the Kahala before moving on to Maui. We've made several trips to Hawaii but have not spent any nights on Oahu for several years. The Kahala is a great hotel that gives you the benefits of being in Honolulu (great shopping, restaurants and sightseeing) with the privacy of a self-contained resort setting.The Kahala was built in 1964 and is a strking mix of "midcentury modern" architecture and old-school room decor. (Very large and well-maintained rooms, by the way...) The hotel was nice enough to upgrade us to an oceanview lanai room upon arrival -- a beautiful view overlooking the pool and beach, but very quiet. I recommend everything about the Kahala -- the very friendly staff, the restaurants, the pool area, the dolphins (!) and so forth. Not the most "hip and trendy" hotel out there, but a well-run classic.

From check-in to check-out trip was perfection! Upon arrival at this gorgeous hotel (our family of four, kids 14 & 11) we were greeted with leis and upgraded to a magnificent oceanfront suite. The view was stunning and I had my morning coffee on the huge balcony every morning while the rest of the family slept. Breakfast on the terrace at Plumeria Beach House was delicious. Also ate at The Seaside Grill twice, food is nothing special but very convenient if you are at the beach and was something close and quick. Highly recommend dining on the patio of Arancino, there is a casual vibe but the food and service is upscale. The beach is beautiful! Kahala does a great job of putting plenty of lounge chairs out on the sand, so unless you want the shade there is really no reason to hire a cabana (I am a big fan of cabanas and we do rent them at most resorts we go to- not necessary here). There are servers that walk around constantly if you'd like to order food and drink on the beach. Kids enjoyed swimming with the dolphins, and ordering smoothies at the pool bar. The Kahala is graceful, elegant, historic, and feels like true Hawaii...as authentic in my opinion as you can get on Oahu and I have been visiting Hawaii for decades. I am so happy we finally made our way to The Kahala and can't wait to return!

What a fantastic find. Such a great hidden gem. This is a perfect resort to come to if you want to enjoy a bit more peace & quiet from the busier Waikiki. A luxury resort feel with great ammenities and activities and beautiful beach which is private and quiet. It is only a 20 minute drive from downtown Waikiki. The rooms are so large and well appointed. We had a stunning view of the Ocean, golf course and mountains. The food we ate at the resort was 5 star and service was also amazing. We would definitely come again and recommend to others.

I recently had dinner at Hoku's in the Kahala Hotel. It's my favorite place to dine, however I am not writing about the usual great dinner and service at Hoku's, I am writing about the nice surprise I experienced with the valet service! After dinner we were greeted by all the valets by our name (both guests) asking us how our dinner was and they thanked us for visiting The Kahala. The kicker was that our car was at the valet waiting for us! Those of you that visit The Kahala know that this is NOT the norm. Usually you have to wait for your car and sometimes I mean WAIT. Kudos to The Kahala and it's Valet Service! Awesome touch of personal class!!! What a great way to end your dining experience at The Kahala!

I dined at Plumeria Beach House at the Kahala Resort and had a top shelf experience. Even though I was not staying at the resort, the staff provided exceptional service throughout. Upon arrival, Craig at valet greeted me by name and other valets also welcomed me by name. When I arrived at Plumeria House, the hostess was extremely pleasant, Eric the waiter was very efficient and courteous, and the Food an Beverage Director stopped by the table with a warm aloha. All of them used my name as well and the food was delicious. This was such a great experience, I did not want to leave and I highly recommend this resort to anyone.

is this lovely property which refreshes the soul. Everything is done perfectly, check in professional, unhurried, considerate and informative. we upgraded our room to a balcony and so glad we did, had an ocean view from a very high floor, I am usually not one to stay in "high rises", but we wanted to stay in Honolulu several nights and this sounded the best for us, especially being somewhat away from things. There was an abundance of beach chairs and places to sit, often lacking in many beach properties, there is a nice breakfast area and a fabulous restaurant attached to the hotel. Rooms were done beautifully, bedding, bath towels, amenities..all top notch. We could find no fault. My only reservation was , as I said, it being a high rise, and the fact that they had dolphins in the pool area, this is not something I care for at all...but that is a personal opinion. Also, they could provide more tables at the bar which opens after the beach bar is closed, there was only one table...and the large couches are not comfortable....but those are certainly extremely minor insignificant complaints! We totally appreciated the Kahala and enjoyed our time there very much.

We are never disappointed when we stay here. Best beach scene on Oahu. All beached are public but this beach seems private. Great for kids and adults, easy access to the beach. Small put great pool. Rooms are fantastic. Get the golf course view for privacy. Great restaurants

Hotel has a beautiful setting and the buffet breakfast is delicious. Although there were some glitches on check-in and a problem with the second assigned room (beware a room on the 10th, which is a smoking floor) Bart, the front desk manager on duty, resolved all problems swiftly and then personally delivered a generous fruit and cheese plate. He showed excellent guest service.

The 1960s Kahala is located on the south-eastern side of Oahu about 20 minutes drive from Waikiki just around Diamond Head. 20 minutes drive from Waikiki but a world away. For all of Waikiki's noise, shops, intensity and crowds the Kahala offers the complete opposite.The iconic 60s style modernist Kahala hotel is set on the most beautiful palm tree lined golden sand beach, with protected calm water surrounded by an outer reef. The beautiful hotel pool area is located next to the beach and there are free sun lounges for hotel guests in addition to enclosed luxury cabanas (for an additional hire fee). The beach waiter service is attentive, and there are activities offered such as stand up paddle boarding, kayaking, fishing and a dolphin experience (the Kahala features a natural looking large lagoon which accommodates approximately 4 dolphins). The overall mood is one of calm and privacy. The privacy obviously has appeal as this hotel has the reputation of being a celebrity favourite and there was a NYC celebrity with their entourage staying while we were there but they along with everyone around them were very discreet and low key. It's very easy to relax here.The hotel lobby and hotel interiors are impressive and grand and yet have still captured the charm of 'Hawaiian Island cool'. Our room which was a basic landside room without lanai overlooked the famous neighbouring golf course and the mountain, and was a generous size and luxuriously appointed. My husband and I were travelling with our teenage daughter and the room comfortably accommodated the 3 of us.This was our second visit to Oahu and our second stay at the Kahala. Previously we hadn't stayed in Waikiki, on this trip we spent 5 nights in Waikiki first followed by 8 nights at the Kahala. For me the Kahala is the ultimate Oahu holiday, whereas Waikiki was simply too noisy, too crowded and not at all relaxing. If you are looking for a bit of both experiences the Kahala offers a free shuttle bus to take guests to the local shopping centre Kahala Mall, the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and to central Waikiki though you need to book your seats in advance as it's popular.The only (small) negatives are the cost of hiring a cabana or covered sun-lounger is pretty pricy and should be greatly reduced for hotel guests (a few 'outsiders' appeared to be hiring them on the weekend yet it's the same hire price for non hotel guests), and there is quite a hefty additional fee for a rollaway bed and having a third person in the room which wasn't quoted initially in the room rate. We ate in the Plumeria restaurant and in the Arancini restaurant and both experiences were excellent. It would be nice if the beach bar could be opened a little later than 530pm as a glass of wine in the evening on the beach would have been an attractive option.This is an impressively run and excellent hotel set on a gorgeous beach. If you're after a relaxing yet luxurious resort style holiday then the Kahala would be a great choice.

Julie O., Breann and Zi made our dining experience so special. We love to celebrate special occasions at the Plumeria, and love to bring our dearest friends. The food was totally delicious, the setting perfect and romantic. We had the best time and can't wait to return! Thank you so much!

The Kahala has it all. It's a terrific location - right on the beach. If you decide to get up and watch the sunrise -- it's right there every day! The rooms are large, the food is terrific and the staff are there to help. And you're away from all the noise of Waikiki. You'll be happy with your stay at the Kahala.

We had a wonderful time at The Kahala Hotel. The location is perfect right outside of Waikiki but secluded enough to truly relax. The spa was serene and a perfect start to our vacation. Our ocean front room made the stay even more special. The service from everyone was top notch. Sean at the beach and pool went above and beyond to make sure we had a relaxing day at the beach. Thank you!

All staff we encountered at the hotel were friendly and helpful- often going out of their way to get information or things that we requested.The breakfast buffet is a favorite- great food and a spectacular view of the bay. On our last visit our waiter, Randy, gave us especially good service- including friendly and helpful tips on where to go for hikes or other places of interest. His gracious smile and quick laugh were the icing on the cake to his attentive service.

Friendly service however on 2 out of 3 visits, uninformed wait person. On one visit, however the wait person went & checked, which was helpful tho clearly was wrongly advised by the chef. On first visit the chicken salad was dreadful, on the following 2 visits the tuna was of such questionable quality, one fillet could not be cut due to the amount of sinew in the fillet. Why did I order twice? I lived in hope

Hi, for starters - I don't ever endorse or generally have ever written a review - - - buy - - - going to Hawaii is always a spiritual experience for myself, my wife and kids. This time we came upon The Kahala Hotel and Resort, and the journey was nothing less than amazing. Admittedly, I'm picky when it comes to hotels, air conditioning has to be cold and vents clean. I cherish the time passed tradition where it seems everybody from the bell desk to the managers seem to know you and go out of their way to make sure the traveling experience is nothing short of Mr. Rourke's character in "Fantasy Island" - let me tell you from Carlos the desk manager to Bob and team at the restaurant I know as Rick's Bar from Magnum P.I. (who turned me on to another tv idol of mine - - Jack Lor'ds bronze not too far from the hotel) made this experience and trip as close to Heaven On Earth as I can remember. The Kahala offered unparalleled personal service -- beautiful rooms with beach and ocean views, top notch room "ambassadors" and one of the greatest surprises of all - - the talents of a singer I met with a smooth soulful styling not unlike the finest in the music industry I've worked with - - his name is David Swanson and he tore up Lionel Richie's "Easy Lover" and simply, lives in a house of soul of his own making. Add-in the beach hut, and we made it Paradise yet again. Thank you to the staff and management of The Kahala - - I'm your biggest fan and look forward to seeing you on our return journey....(TJ Lubinsky).

We spent the last 3 nights of a 7 day trip here, and it was a very luxurious hotel. The amenities were excellent, and staff was very attentive. We used concierge for dinner and show reservations. We did not try the dolphin quest, but they offer it right there on site. The lei greeting was fun, and a nice touch. The hotel is away from the hub of activity in Honolulu, but that worked fine for us as we left they area each day for sightseeing. Very clean hotel, with top notch finishes everywhere.

Unlike the many times previous, Kahala has lost its Yes / can do attitude.50% of the staff continues to remind us why we rebooked here, 50% make us wonder if we will ever rebook again. Far too many instances to elaborate in this review. I have though,sent a hand written letter off to the general manager with our specific praises and disappointments.

We turned the planning of our 15 day Hawaiian vacation over to a delightful young woman at AAA and she booked our first stay at The Kahala. The bar was set very high! The Kahala is extraordinary and I would stay there again.The facility itself is stunning from the first view of the lobby to the huge lanai off our very large room. We were almost overwhelmed at first, but sitting at a table on the beach to each our lunch the first day there soon lulled any doubts we might have had about "belonging" here and we reveled in our week-long experience every moment.Our room was beautifully appointed with an incredibly comfortable king bed, separate sitting area, desk and massive sliding doors to the lanai. Every day our three rooms (bedroom, large dressing room and large bath) were tidied and we would find lovely bottles of water along with chocolates and orchids when the bed was readied for night.There was more than adequate information in our room about the resort and area, all very helpful. Also helpful was being able to text the concierge with any questions.We had a rental car but never had the opportunity to park in the garage ourselves. This was somewhat odd to us and valet service, even at a few dollars each time for retrieving and returning the car, became a bit of an exasperation. While convenient and easy, we could see that the open air garage was not full, even when the discretely placed sign said it was. However, the valets were all extremely accommodating and always made sure we had a Kahala shopping bag and cold bottles of water when sending us on our way.Being only minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki was a huge plus. And yes, the shops, restaurant and famous beach were only a few minutes drive away. We ate not only at the beachside restaurant, but also on the veranda. A lovely glass of wine, excellent light meals and very good service await. There are restaurants on the premises for larger meals and also afternoon tea in the lobby, but we did not partake. I took issue with the dolphin lagoon. While lovely, it was very hard to see these gorgeous creatures in captivity, even though they appeared to be well cared for under excellent supervision. I wish the hotel management would reconsider and allow the dolphins the life they deserve....one of freedom.The views are amazing, the staff professional, friendly and courteous, but the resort is expensive; not just for the room, but the shops, full of enticing items, are also quite pricey. However, this is what one would expect while staying at such a beautiful hotel.We would definitely stay at The Kahala again, but would be better prepared for the luxurious surrounding with expensive meals and extra items. This is no fault of the resort that we did not adequately prepare ourselves for such a stay.

We just spent 8 days at the Kahala. The pool & beach are both immaculate & stunning. The kids had a blast on their private beach-so much better than the bustle of Waikiki! They swam with the dolphins and loved the sea life living on the premises!Even with all that, I have to say the customer service was top notch! My husband was sick for the first part of the trip and the concierge sent someone to Long's for medicine. Carlos at the front desk arranged everything we asked for our arrival. I forgot my phone after checking out and he sent someone from the hotel to bring it to me at the airport. Seriously, who does that? Also had the best meal at Hoku and the best waiter in Bob! Tipped us off to the Jack Lord statue at the Kahala Mall.Thanks to the Kahala for a fabulous & memorable vacation!

Stay at Kahala for RCI Winter Workshop. Beautiful resort, staff very friendly and helpful.Our first day we experienced the Spa. My husband and I both had the Jetsetter Massage. It was fabulous. I had Leslie and she was absolutely terrific. One of the best massages I have ever had. We have had the breakfast here 2 days now ordered from the menu the Lobster Benedict was yummy and the Turkey Tostada was also yummy.I never usually enjoy the food at hotel restaurants but thus far I have been pleasantly surprised at the quality and service. The only drawback staying at the Kahala is that it is a remote location from Honolulu. The hotel does provide a shuttle service but it does put you on a schedule which for many of us on vacation we are trying to get away from schedules. We have stayed at the Marriott in Waikiki before and the nice part was able to walk to many destinations. So in regards to Kahala you do feel a little captive at their location however it is very peaceful and quiet and given that it does allow you to relax.

The Kahala resort has everything, including heated toilets. The rooms are very elegant. There's a spa, fitness center with yoga (including SUP yoga), several restaurants. The best feature is the beach access. It provides a wonderful escape from the bustle of Waikiki but they provide a shuttle to the Ala Moana mall and Waikiki area for the times that you actually want to leave the beach. While the dolphin area is popular with children, I found it sad to have all those dolphins confined to such a small pool.

We did not realise when booking our holiday that the Sony Golf Open would be played at the Waialae Golf Club, which is just a three minute walk from the Kahala. It was a fantastic privilege to be staying in the same hotel as some of the best golfers in the world. My wife and I are also golfers and our room overlooked the 10th and 18th fairways and greens which was so exciting.The hotel was in a beautiful spot alongside the beach with various restaurants to choose from to eat. The decor in the main reception was beautifully designed and a very enjoyable place to sit. The hotel offered everything for the perfect relaxation, great weather, great beach, hotel shops, spa treatments and good food.

nestled on the end of the road that circles Diamond head, is a Hotel that offers the finest in all things hospitality. beachfront and calm waters are what makes this hotel great. smiling and friendly staff, beautiful gardens and did I mention the beach !?

We are a family of five, with a 17, 13 and 10 year old. We were at the Kahala for three nights over Christmas, after spending a week on the Big Island at the Mauna Kea. In this review, I will provide some thoughts not only about the Kahala, but also that contrast the Kahala with the Mauna Kea to provide some comparison between two of Hawaii’s classic resorts. The Kahala, as most know, is well situated in an upscale residential neighborhood about a 10-15 minute drive from the hustle and bustle of downtown Honolulu. The hotel is tall and built in 1960s style. Clearly the Kahala is very popular with Japanese travelers, as compared with the Mauna Kea which has a guest base that appears more drawn from the US mainland. The lobby area is really beautiful, and the hotel has some nice upscale shops on the main floor. The rooms are very spacious and are gorgeous. We had two rooms – the kids’ room faced the mountains. Ours had a spectacular full-on ocean view with a lanai. Both rooms were very large, with a sitting area and flat screen TVs. The bathrooms are huge, with two separate vanities, an enclosed toilet (heated seat) area, and a separate bath and shower area. The ceilings are high. The rooms are generally really beautiful and updated. In short, the physical space – both the main floor and rooms – was terrific. The physical space of the hotel structure is more upscale than the Mauna Kea, although less spread out. The beach is located within a cove and has no waves due to a coral reef that shelters the beach area. This makes for good swimming and paddle boarding, but no ability to boogey board or body surf. The beach itself is fairly long, although not very deep. The sand was fairly compacted (as compared with the Mauna Kea beach), and almost gives the appearance of a man-made beach. All in all, the beach area was fine, although as noted we were spoiled from having spent 5 nights at the Mauna Kea, where the beach is about as good as it gets. Perhaps the beach scene did not seem as active as one would imagine due to the weather. On the days we were there, the wind was strong in the afternoons, and at times brought moisture (drizzle) from the mountain behind the resort. In general, the weather in late December was much spottier at the Kahala than it was at the Mauna Kea, and the beach/pool area is not nearly as sheltered from the wind as we would have liked. The pool area felt pretty cramped. There is one kidney/oval pool and a Jacuzzi. As with the Mauna Kea, the pool and Jacuzzi are 1960s in design, certainly not the monster pools that newer resorts are building. At the Mauna Kea, it seemed to work better because the pool area was removed from the beach, and there was more physical space available so it felt less cramped. At the Kahala, the pool/beach area was pretty hectic (it was the high season). Much less tranquil than the Mauna Kea, which somehow manages to get through the high season without the resort feeling too full. There is a dolphin lagoon winding through the pool area. It was nice to see the dolphins, although we were of mixed feelings about the whole captive dolphin idea.We ate at the nice restaurant (Arancino), which was very good, and expensive. We also ate at the Plumeria Beach House, on the beach level, which was fine (other than a ridiculously overpriced buffet on Christmas eve, which might have been okay except for the loud children and babies that were packed into the restaurant.) The breakfast scene at Plumeria was largely hectic – one generally had to wait (although not too long) for a table, and the atmosphere was pretty loud. By contrast, the breakfast experience at the Mauna Kea (Manta restaurant), was more laid back. The staff were all lovely – we enjoyed all our interactions. My only gripe was that the concierge was not terribly helpful in helping us plan out our Pearl Harbor visit – did not seem to have a grasp on when we should leave, given our reservation time, how long the various attractions would take, and how to piece together the various aspects of Pearl Harbor (the Arizona memorial, the Missouri, the Bowfin, etc). I felt they should have the Pearl Harbor thing down, since many guests (like us) are there largely to visit Pearl Harbor. We did take a great trip to the north shore where we watched the surfers at the banzai pipeline (spectacular!) and stopped by one of the killer garlic shrimp stands, which we enjoyed more than the $85/person Christmas eve buffet! In closing, don’t get me wrong – we enjoyed our visit to the Kahala. It is a lovely hotel, and we would come again if visiting Oahu. It’s just that the Mauna Kea was a really difficult act to follow. While the Kahala is a very good hotel, it cannot compete, in my view, with some of the more tranquil, spread out resorts elsewhere on the various islands, but maybe it is unfair comparing a Honolulu resort to a resort on a different island. Certainly the Kahala compares well to other Honolulu resorts, most of which are on Waikiki and are probably even more hectic in feel.

This was our first visit to The Kahala, the last time we visited we stayed at the Halekalani however this time we wanted to be away from Waikiki Beach. We booked dolphin rooms - a two storey wing of the hotel. We loved our rooms. With large balconies each morning and evening we would watch the dolphins being fed and exercised and the beach was just 2 minutes from our rooms. There is a nice pool with a jacuzzi - good and hot but to be fair we spent most of the time on the beach going for walks and swimming in the sea. There is a breakwater so the waves aren't massive and fine for swimming. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as being over Christmas they were charging $50 per person + + and with 4 of us it would have been very expensive especially because of the terrible rate us Brits are now getting. However, there was a Wholefoods and Longs in the nearby Mall (approx 10 mins walk) and we were able to buy cereals, milk, yogurts and pastries which we put in the fridge provided. We will definitely return to the hotel one day.

This was our third stay at the Kahala and it never disappoints. We got married there four years ago and were amazed by the staff work ethic and how they made our day so memorable. They have maintained this level of service throughout our stays and it is always lovely to catch up with Grace who did and amazing job with our wedding. Also appreciate Carlos's help on the front desk during two of our three stays. We were heading out very early the day we left and he was able to organise us room service for breakfast as the buffet would not have been open in time.The buffet breakfast and dinners were always amazing with a large variety of options that covered whatever you may have felt like. Also find their free shuttle service very helpful as you are about 20 minutes away from Waikiki. They make regular drop offs and pick ups at Waikiki, Ala Moana and the Kahala mall which has a really good Whole Foods.Cleaning was impeccable and there was a morning service as well as an evening turn down service. The rooms themselves were a good size to fit two big open cases and still move around with ease. The beds are one of the comfiest we've slept in and the the room in general is beautifully decorated. Bathrooms are very nice with the addition of the heated bidet seat. Did notice that there might need to be a little bit of work done to the paint work in there as it was not up to the Kahala's usual standards. We stayed in a dolphin lanai room for the first time this stay and absolutely loved it. Can quite easily waste a day watching the dolphins pop out of the water to say hi to you or watch the trainers do their work with them.Loved relaxing in the grand lobby and if you are ever going to the Kahala around Christmas time you are in for a treat - their Christmas tree is amazing! Am wondering if Evan who did the floral arrangements for our wedding dressed the tree. Where they find a real tree that perfect and beautiful I've got no idea!Had a nice massage at the Kahala Spa however do feel the pricing is too expensive for what they are offering. Used the fitness centre most mornings which is well set up but could do with much better yoga mats.The beach is beautiful at the Kahala, great for swimming and cooling off but not sure why there weren't umbrellas available for the loungers as we didn't want to get a cabana or covered seat which was offered instead.

Recently had a 2 day stay at the Kahala as a treat to myself for my 60th and I really loved it. The foyer area was grand and open with a beautifully decorated Christmas tree standing tall and proud in the lobby as you entered. Also other beautiful Christmas decorations adorned the hotel as well with more Christmas decorations and trees downstairs. Our room was huge and overlooked the golf course. The bathroom was also big with 2 basins which worked well - 1 for each of us. Our room was spotless and well appointed. Had breakfast each morning down in the Plumeria Beach House restaurant and it was a lovely spot, with sea views and a very good selection of foods for a buffet breakfast. The staff were very efficient and pleasant and you could not fault the service. If it wasn't so pricey I would stay there again. So I'm really glad I ticked it off the bucket list and to top it off we arrived in a stretch limo (just happened to be in the taxi rank when we arrived at airport). I couldn't fault it. Unfortunately the weather for those 2 days wasn't beach weather, however, we managed to fill in our time with a pedicure at the spa and some shopping over at the Kahala Mall. It was also really nice to get some peace and quiet before heading down to Waikiki for some action and serious shopping. Thank you again for a most memorable stay.

Traveling from Australia to New Orleans for the holidays with a almost 2 year old toddler is no easy task, but we always look forward to our Kahala break on the way back home. From housekeeping staff who seem to always know when exactly to clean our room (the early turn downs are much apreciated) to exceptional Bell and Valet staff (our car was always out front before we could walk up - we never had to wait) - the Kahala makes the stay experience so easy. I also wanted to give a special thank you to James at the front desk. Our little guy loved him from the moment he handed over the stuffed dolphin. Every time we would pass the front desk he would be looking for James and run up and give him a high five.  I traveled to the Kahala back when it was a Mandarin Oriental, and remember the turn down housekeeper bringing my little brother golden books to read for bedtime. It is is no nice to see that this same level of service continues years later. Kudos to the entire team for an exceptional stay with service that is orchestrated to perfection. We look forward to staying again when next we transit to and from the US!

We go every year to the Kahala for Christmas and New Years and love it. The hotel is a classic and the staff are great. We plan to go back as it takes time to become part of the place. After 5 years we are now seeing the same people against and our daughter has friends she meets every year. We love the hotel but there are things needing improvement given how expensive it has become...The good:1. The staff - they all care and are good people. If you have an issue just talk to the staff and they will try to sort2. Location - not Waikiki and not the north shore. A bit of class and style and not in the middle of no where3. Consistent - Rooms are big, food is god and things change slowly. If you want a modern slick place go elsewhere. If you want classical style stay here.Needs improvement:1. Trouble handling volumes - when it is packed and the staff is stretched you feel it. Over the last couple over years we would eat at the Veranda a few nights as it ways always a good place to relax. This year it was over run, used as an overflow Hoku's. The change in the menu this year was a disaster! Time to rethink2. Bathrooms- large and the two sinks are great. They just need a refresh. The tiles on the floor are worn.3. Toiletries - the change to the Kahala branded, cheap, Alibaba ordered toiletries was disappointing. Stop trying to squeeze pennies and lose the dollars!As I said we will be back and care about the place. We recommend the hotel to anyone. At the same time the owners need to ensure the quality does not fade...

We arrived late and tired. We were taken to a room on the first floor overlooking the parking lot. If that weren't bad enough, the bed was three quarters the length of a normal bed. Not sure how that happens. Needless to say we were not happy and reminded them that we had booked in May and had made some requests. After a few hours, we were in another room (although we were told there were no other rooms...?? After this fiasco, we were moved to the 9th floor overlooking the golf course which was beautiful. The room was great and the hotel itself is magnificent. They do detail very well. The turtles, rays and fish are amazing. The Dolphin Encounter was an amazing experience as well. Breakfast at The Plumeria was beautiful with its amazing views. We stayed over New Years and watched the awesome fireworks. Well done!

It was my first trip to Hawaii and The Kahala Resort gives you best of both worlds - Luxury in its own secluded area but complimentary transport provided to Waikiki Beach, Ala Moana and Kahala Malls. The staff go above and beyond to ensure you have a great time. Cameron the Concierge arranged so much for us like Island Tours and Chief Luau. Pearl Harbour was a must and I learnt so much there. We were in Dolphin Lagoon Wing and would spend hours on our lanai watching Dolphin Interactions through their Dolphin Quest programme. We participated on our last day which was awesome. The food was gorgeous and Lava Flow cocktails were delicious. The countdown party on NYE was brilliant and had the best firework display I've ever seen. The rooms were large and bathrooms had vanity basins and hanging space on both sides of bathroom - great with 2 friends travelling with plenty clothes lol. They also had smart toilets with heated seats and bidet which I now want at home. We didn't want to leave and I hope to return very soon.

My husband and I came to Kahala Resort for our babymoon. Everything about Kahala is pure luxury! From the moment you leave the taxi, you are greeted warmly by the bell staff. We were thoroughly impressed by the opulent lobby which seamlessly integrates ancient Hawaiian artifacts and modern Hawaiian styling. The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and allowed us to check in early. Our mountain facing hotel room was massive complete with a sitting area, two closets, two sinks and hot tub. We couldn't believe our room was not considered a suite because it was so luxurious and spacious. Sheets were soft, bed was comfortable and pillows were plentiful. The property is relatively small but the real gem of this resort is their amazing beach, which is private, clean, and has plenty of beach chairs. This is a far cry from nearby Waikiki beach. There is also diverse wildlife on the property with dolphins, sea turtles, and other marine life. We also enjoyed a wonderful afternoon tea service and a delicious meal at their Italian restaurant. At the end of our four day trip, we did not want to leave. We hope we can stay at Kahala every time we come to Oahu! We have been to Oahu six times and this is the easily the best resort we stayed at!

Situated in a very beautiful bay, it has a fantastic view and the restaurants and beachside bar and restaurant will make you feel like you have come to paradise. However, the bathroom is a bit run down and if you look at the details, you see that it needs some deep cleaning. The dust on the doors or in the corners of the floor were not so pleasant to see. Also, the closet is situated in the bathroom which is not so nice for the clothes. They also did not have a full size mirror to see how you look. We also did not have any slippers.Their restaurants had wonderful vegetarian dishes! This was a big plus. Especially the Hoku's and the beachside/poolside bar restaurant outside.They do not have much places with shades to lie down outside. What I did not like was that the tents and the beachbeds were very expensive. The price of the Hotel is very expensive so it should be complimentary. It is a big minus that you have to pay for the tents and the beds. You don't feel pampered enough for the price you pay.The reception was not to our liking. The man talked like a robot but in a fast pace that we felt like he just wanted to throw us all the information he learned at his training. He had no sensitivity to imagine that we just got there and we were dead tired after a night flight and we are not happy to listen to how much a macadamian chocolate would cost at this place in the hotel with a coupon we get or not.... It was really insensitive. It just made us feel like "Never are we going to buy anything here and the least macadamian nut chocolates!"

I can't express how amazing this hotel resort is. The staff were extremely friendly and so helpful and really took care of us. The room was spacious and included complimentary coffee (Kona blend...yum!) and the turn-down service was a very nice surprise. And waking up to the beautiful sunrises just made every morning special. I even turned one of sunrise photos into a metal 11x14 print so I can continue to wake up to sunrise at the Kahala. Thank you to the Kahala staff -- James (front desk); Craig, Derek, and Alex (bell/valet); and room attendants -- for going above and beyond to make our vacation peaceful and relaxing. I will definitely be coming back!

Very nice Resort Hotel. Definitely the fanciest place our family has stayed..price wise. Beach was very nice. Clean as well as beautiful. They have paddle board rental and canoe rentals as well. Food was pricey. We only ate on site once other than the wedding reception.

We are experienced visitors to Hawaii all five islands ( my first trip 1970). Our first stay at Kahala is fabulous for all three generations of our family ( age range from 2 to 67) The bell desk ( Alex). , front desk ( Lynn, Noell ) , concierge ( Dean ) , housekeeping ( Yeung) , restaurant ( Marian ) , pool,( Jacob) ,and many others , all only goal is to priovide the best service with a big ALOHA smile . THis resort is secluded , yet only minutes to Waikiki . Three restaurants , from high end (alba truffle pasta) to family seafood buffet . The Xmas Santa arrived in an Eaxcilbar on the beachfront, together a very entertaining program for all . The dolphin experience on the premises is a must , we had fun and learn a lot about the animal . We stayed there for 10 days , just moved to Waikiki for new year .We plan to stay for both Xmas and new year at Kahala next year . All the ocean view rooms has spectacular view , Maui can be seen with sunrise . I met a gentleman who has spend every Xmas Kahala since 1964 (first open). Dsepite there mananagemt changes and the property a bit older , he feels the hotel maintains the highest standard , we agree with him . This place is expensive , as we are coming all the way from the East Coast , such expenses is well worth it. , we want Paradise at its best.

The Kahala is a magical wonderful place to stay whether it's with friends or family with young children. The beach is not crowded at all where you can snap the sunrise and sunset with practically an empty beach! The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and extremely comfortable.
