They have awesome warming toilet seats with a built in washer. The service is excellent. You really get what you pay for. There's complimentary coffee and tea every morning.Some special friendly Aloha from:James Kepa, Front Desk AgentCraig Shimizu, Door Attendant (Bell and Velet)Derek Clemente, Front Service Attendant (Bell and Valet)Alex Sarun, Front Service Attendant (Bell and Valet)Housekeepers who cleaned the roomKwong Wong, Room Service Waithelp who brought the ice for our achy bodies after the marathon.Thank you Kahala for an unforgettable experience!

This is the second visit to the Kahala. The hotel is beautiful, but it is getting around that time for a little refresh. From what we understand it has recently changed hands so i'm sure that is on the list. The rooms are a great size and the amenities are nice. The beach is the best part about this property (the dolphins quest was a great hit with the many children). The views on the ocean side are spectacular. The employees are incredible and treat everyone equally. The food in the restaurants on the other hand is just not that good and way overpriced. Best to eat out if at all possible. Overall, the seclusion of this hotel makes it a must.

Very nice hotel and beach. Set off from the noise and traffic of Whakiki. Several great restaurants. Nice beach.We were there for the Honolulu Marathon, our daughter was running it in. Great access from the Hotel to miles 11 and 22 on the Marathon path.

This is a gorgeous hotel with a lot of neat history. Room was roomy and very clean. Bedding was so cozy and soft, it almost felt like home. The grounds were beautiful, private beach was awesome and pool area was perfect. This location is secluded away from all the crazy downtown area, which makes it perfect for those who truly want to relax in luxury.

We visited the Kahala for our honeymoon and chose it due to great reviews from family. We were booked in an upgraded golf course view room on the 9th floor with a lanai. We had a wonderful stay in the Kahala and the service was impeccable. Here are some highlights:- We arrived at 6am and were able to check into our room straight away at no extra cost. This was extremely appreciated as we had a long flight and it was nice to access showers and the room right away. Lei on arrival is a nice touch.- We used the free Kahala shuttle bus to travel to the Kahala Mall and Ala Moana shopping centres, this was very handy and some of the drivers pointed out the sights to see on the trip.- The bathrooms are very well laid out with separate closet space and drawers for each person and included handy items like an iron- We had booked a Romantic Package and prior to our stay had communicated a number of requests e.g. for dietary requirements. We were really impressed that the staff remembered all these requests which made the meals go very smoothly- The buffet breakfast has amazing views and delicious food, the omelette making chefs were great. The thanksgiving buffet was divine with live music and great atmosphere. The staff really get into the holidays and the lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas.- The rooms in the Kahala Spa were beautifully intimate and relaxing - love the infinity baths- The turn down service is a nice touch - the staff left small chocolates on our pillows each night.- Coffee pod machine in the room is a nice touchThere were no major downsides, but the buffet breakfast does get busy (which they tell you), and so some mornings we waited 10-15 minutes to be seated. Given it is probably the best views on the island, this is no surprise though! We didn't mind the wait.Thank you to the Kahala community for making our honeymoon so special. We hope to return again someday.

The Kahala hotel seems to be stuck between its history, which shows itself for example on the picture wall of visiting celebrities and an uncertain future, as shown by maybe not so animal friendly dolphin pond. But if you love old style service, the staff excels, if you need more of a refreshed look, look elsewhere

We had our first photo shoot sessions with Pacific Dream Photography when we stayed at Andaz Maui when our first son was 2 years old. We initially thought we'd just check out and take advantage of the complimentary photo sessions and keep a couple of good photos or so, but oh boy, we were only amazed by the quality of photographs that came out of it. During the review session, we were also pleasantly surprised by the movie clip which they put together for us, which included some of the best photos as well as short video clips here and there. We ended up getting the gold package which included 40 or so photos and the movie. We were very happy with the purchase as our son watched the movie over and over again. 1.5 years later, we went back to Hawaii, this time to Oahu. This time we also had our second son who was only 7 months old, and as I found out that Pacific Dream Photography does the photo session at the Kahala hotel which was where my husband I got married, we decided we'd definitely like to do our family photos with our kids there. Yet again, we were very happy with the product they created for us, and we purchased the same gold package for our photos and the movie. It is really the best way for us to keep our memory of the family vacation. So worth it. They are also very professional, friendly, and fun to work with, which makes it super easy to go to them. We know when we go back to Hawaii again (and they seem to have an office in each island), we'd definitely like to contact them again!

We recently stayed at the beautiful Kahala and it was even better than I remember from our past stay. The room is very spacious and the bed is very comfortable.The beach is pristine with calm gentle waves which allow for great stand up paddle boarding and swimming. The staff provides excellent unobtrusive service.I have yet to stay in a Hotel in Oahu that makes us feel as comfortable as the Kahala.We will Definitely return!

Our family really enjoyed our stay as a guest at the hotel. On a previous occasion, one of our children swam with the dolphins for her birthday. We also had awesome dining experiences there. My personal favorite is listening to piano/lounge music and having some pupu and drinks with friends. We go there at least once a month for dinner and music. I recommend it to everyone. Mahalo to The Kahala Hotel for an amazing experience!

The location is away from the crowds in Waikiki. A gorgeous secluded property, but with nearby shopping and a complimentary shuttle to various locations within the area. The staff is wonderful! They were extremely attentive to our attendees needs in the meeting space areas and made the planning process very easy throughout the event. My guestroom had a beautiful view of the lagoons and beach. You can't ask for a better setting.

Recently stayed here for five nights. Pros/Cons in my mind:Pros:1. Far from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki2. Luxury hotel with friendly staff3. Rooms that are large and clean for the most partCons:1. Small beach. 2. Small pool3. Will probably need a car. Parking is $30+ a day. 4. Golf course is part of the hotel. My rental car was hit by a golf ball and resulted in a small dent.
user_name:
derkman
New York City, New York

review_body: The Kahala is a lovely ocean-front property which sits on a small private-feeling beach away from the crowds of Waikiki. While upscale, it is also very welcoming - beautifully decorated yet not stuffy. The staff is gracious and attentive. From the moment we stepped onto the property, the bellman, wait staff, and everyone else remembered us and called us by name. Our room was beautifully appointed with a comfortable sitting area and "real wood" furniture, complete with luxury high-end toilets!! It was fun and relaxing just to be there!My purpose for staying over was to oversee my company's Holiday party, an event for approximately 300 people, which we held in the Maile Ballroom. Kari, the catering manager was a joy to work with, and each and every detail of the event went perfectly! I received numerous comments from the party attendees raving about the food and the service, and I agree! I've eaten at a number of hotel buffets (including high end) and The Kahala nailed the difficult task of making buffet food taste fresh and interesting, and like it was made to order for me personally. I look forward to holding future events at The Kahala!

Beautiful hotel on beach, view from room overlooking golf course.Lovely room, even lovelier staff. Had a wonderful relaxing pedicure at their spa, a special thank you to Miki.Stunning lobby so lovely just to sit and admire their beautiul xmas decorations.Thanks to super friendly staff at breakfast, always smiling and helpful.Thanks to the lovely staff at The Verandah had lovely high tea.Will be back and highly recommend for a peacful location just 15 to 20 mins into bustling Waikiki, the hotel provides free shuttle service.

One Word....ELEGANT.......Spent a few hours at the Kahala whilst celebrating an anniversary/birthday.. we were from a cruise ship with stopover at HNL... and spent a very amiable few hours enjoyingan HAWAII HIGH TEA in very salubrious surroundings.A definite comeback stop.

I had indescribable relaxing days here. A beautiful area. All in all, simply top notch. Well maintained and spacious rooms with nice interieur. A first class service. Delicious food and cocktails at the pool and beach. Arrived in Hotel Heaven!

Great hotel! Not much else to say that others haven't already said. - Free Wifi- Dolphins, Stingrays, Tropical Fish, Sea Turtles within the hotel lagoons - Super soft sandy beach- Sunset views- SOFT bed- Lei'd upon arrival!!
user_name:
nyczleanie
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband & I stayed at the Kahala Hotel & Resort last week for 4 days/nights to celebrate my birthday. We had stayed at the property 13 years ago & loved it then, read the reviews & decided to return. We were not dissapointed. The Kahala is located in a quiet area (not the hustle-bustle of Waikiki Beach, no thank you!). It is elegant & the rooms are beautifully appointed. We upgraded to an oceanfront room so we could listen to the waves & take in the fresh Hawaiian air... It was worth the splurge! The restaurants are varied and offer fine dining at Hoku's where we enjoyed a 7 course Tasting Menu one evening (superb!) to the casual beach dining to the Veranda where we enjoyed live music nightly before dinner. The service staff is phenomenal. Professional and poised. This is a perfect place for a romantic getaway. We will be back!
user_name:
TRstravels
San Jose del Cabo, Mexico

review_body: We've planned 2 Christmas Holiday parties at the Kahala. From planning with the catering office to the day of the event, the service was exceptional. All details were taken cared, down to the small details e.g. decorations to give our room a festive holiday decor. I highly recommend the Kahala Oke Kai Room with its spectacular view of the ocean and the beautiful Diamond Head Lawn fronting the Kahala Oke Kai Room is beyond words. A great venue for a wedding, shower, birthday or any memorable event.

Vacations come and go too fast, but we discovered a great way to keep the feeling of that experience alive. After checking in to The Kahala Hotel in Honolulu, we were offered a professional photography session that was reasonably priced especially for that type of service. We took advantage of this and were even able to choose the settings ourselves. We had shots taken on the beach, in the hotel, and the Kahala Hotel grounds. Loryn from Pacific Dream Photography did an amazing job capturing photos of us that really conveyed the Spirit of Aloha that we were feeling. The prints we purchased turned out to be our most treasured memento from our Hawaii vacation. There is nothing like the professional & personal touch that Loryn provided to keep the Aloha Spirit alive long after our vacation was over.

Hotel was excellent. Very friendly and helpful. Private beach and view . Good for honeymoon lover. Also gd for children who love to play or watch dolphin show. Italian restaurant and the japanese food was very good too.

For those searching for a quiet intimate spot away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu The Kahala is it. The property is beautiful and well maintained. Check in was seamless until we went to verify the type of package we had purchased. It took two trips to the front desk, us calling Delta and then Delta having to call us back to rectify the situation. When the hotel called back we found it odd that they just blamed Delta. . . Same thing happened when we asked for a new hair dryer. . . They had to show my husband how I was using it wrong. We regularly stay at Ritz Carlton properties and can attest neither incident would have happened there. On to the good . . .the staff at the beach bar, Plumeria (especially Eric) was efficient, kind and friendly. Dinner at the Italian restaurant was outstanding as was the service. My husband had the best massage of his life at the spa and being able to have a couples experience was fantastic. On to the next oddity . . . Dinner at Hokus. The food was outstanding, but India (waitress) could have cared less if we were there or not. Her fearless side kick was fantastic or the experience would have left a very bad taste in our mouth.Spring gave us a private personal training session which we both loved. The yoga class was great as well. Overall a good experience with some inconsistencies.

My wife, daughter and I attended the Kahala Tree Lighting Event the day after Thanksgiving. It was a great way to start off the holiday season and by far the best holiday event in Hawaii. It was very festive with holiday treats, music and a beautiful tree lighting ceremony in their luxurious lobby. My daughter really enjoyed seeing Santa. Highly recommended if you are on Oahu during the holiday season.

The service was impeccable and the room was very comfortable. We enjoyed the smaller, more private feel of this resort to some of the more crowded places in Waikiki. Of course, the dolphins are a major draw for our family. Sitting on the veranda and watching them is so relaxing. Swimming with them is an incredible experience. We also loved the cabana loungers with food & beverage service on the beach. My daughter enjoyed some time in the kids' club, even though she was the only kid in there one day! We had one bad dining experience, but otherwise we were pleased with the restaurants. We will definitely return to this lovely hotel.

I didn't stay at the hotel on this visit but I did get a chance to attend their awesome, new Moonlight Wellness Series - Mindful Breathing Through Movement. Spring, our instructor, was fabulous! I was unfortunately the only attendee of the class that evening and I wasn't cancelled on(!) (which has happened on many occasions at other places due to even low attendance). Mats are provided if you need them, I had brought my own, not knowing what to expect. The class is done in a hale (i would imagine so that you don't have to battle blowing sand) right next to a restaurant but, that was just fine because that's why you are in a meditation class - to learn to "hear" but not "listen" to the sounds around you. I loved that simple point that hadn't particularly been brought to my attention in any other led-meditation experiences prior to this one. Each week there is a new focus and I look forward to this Tuesday's class, guests should definitely be trying this out! You've come to Hawaii and the beautiful Kahala Hotel for relaxation, right? Meditation will take you there, even if it's your first experience with it, Spring is an amazing guide. Calm, soothing voice. Patient and offers assistance with postures if the person is open to it. Then namaste. (Please, please do not clap at the end. That's what the 'namaste' takes the place of, Spring knows you appreciate her :-))

The Kahala Hotel and Resort is a quiet lovely smaller facility. Smaller how? Not as many rooms as several of those just around Diamond Head in Waikiki. But small in size is the only "small" part of the place. It is huge on service. From the moment I arrived, and was quickly greeted by Heidi covering me with an umbrella to protect me from the rain to Carolyn at the front desk. I sincerely felt like I was truly welcome, just because. My room was lovely and the view was spectacular. I could even see down into the Dolphin pool as well as far into the ocean as big freighters moved along. I could see the back side of Diamond Head. Everyone at this facility is happy to help you. The Dolphin Quest program is a must. All ages can totally enjoy this activity. Not only will you have the joy of being with a Dolphin the staff is quite helpful in teaching you about a Dolphin. The places to eat here are exceptional. The Plumeria has an amazing breakfast, lunch and dinner. Then of course there is Hoku's. Be adventurous and try the tasting menu it is exceptional. Then while you are in your cabana enjoying the ocean there is the Seaside Grill for great food. And you are a quick drive into Honolulu to the airport when you have to go home, which after being here you won't want to do.

First of, I should admit up front that I'm not a fan of the crowdedness of Honolulu, but was in town doing research for a book I'm writing, part of which involves the Kahala. Thanks goodness, because the crowds of Waikiki would have been terrible! The Kahala is elegant but not stuffy, and most of the employees seem genuinely happy (not just "I'm being friendly because it's my job" happy). In particular, the woman in the gift shop, Jimmy, the bartender at Arancino, and the person who checked us in--perhaps also named James?--were exceptional. Oh, and Lloyd at the pool might seem a bit crusty at first, but once you engage him he has great stories because he's worked there since 1968! Definitely talk to him.The room are quiet, big, plenty of room to put away you belongings. The decor is Colonial Hawaiian. Very comfortable. The only odd part is the goose down duvet, which is too toasty for the tropics. It pretty much requires that you run the AC to sleep.The pool is small, but every two long chairs have umbrellas, which is nice. The beach is great--quiet, relaxing, and the calmest, most shallow water I've ever experienced in Hawai'i. You can wade really far out.The only problem we had was with valet parking. Although, *technically* there's an option to self-park for the same price, the garage was always full, with a sign telling you to go to valet. It's a little inconvenient if you're a spontaneous person and just want to get in your car to go somewhere, but I guess I could live with that if they were at least organized. One time it took them half an hour because 1) they forgot about us, then 2) after about 15-20 minutes I asked about our car, they realized no one had ever gone to get it, then 3) they brought us a Jeep Cherokee, and we were driving a Nissan Sedan. When I said, "That's not our car," the valet said "Yes, it is." I said, "No, it's not, we have a Nissan," and he said "this is your car," and showed me the keys with our room number on it, like that made it true. We finally got him to believe it wasn't our car, so that took a while to sort out while they found our *actual* car. This was at 2:30 on a Thursday afternoon, by the way--not at peak hours (one time during peak hours they just forgot to get our car after we'd called down, but that resolved in much less time)The "peak hours" issue has a lot to do with how this hotel operates. It's GREAT when they're not busy--personal attention, efficient, friendly, relaxed. But when their occupancy goes up (as it did on our last day there), they can't keep up. This was esp. true with the restaurants, reception, and the aforementioned valet. You have to wait in a lot of lines, can't get reservation, etc. But maybe that's just par for the course for Honolulu.

It wasn't until I arrived in my room that I realized I was smiling from ear to ear with a sense of total well-being, having been treated so specially from the time I pulled up in front of this Hawaiian hotel icon. I have learned that The Kahala Resort has been loved by the local Hawaiian community, and its many famous guests,since the days it was known as the Kahala Hilton, back in the 70s. Some locals still refer to it that way all these years on, and with the same affection they reserve for a much beloved Tutu (grandmother) or elderly aunt. The Kahala has always stood apart in the elegant seaside suburb of Kahala, just 15 minutes drive from the bustle of Waikiki, embraced on one side by the crystal clear waters of the Pacific, and soothed on the other by the lush greenery and cool mountnain breezes of the Waialae Countrry Club . When calmness, serenity, privacy, security and intimacy are atop your wishlist, the Kahala Resort is the ONLY choice on the South Shores of Oahu. The Kahala is as authentic as Audrey Hepburn, apple pie, and its elegant new General Manager.This Grande Dame of Hotels has always seen itself as an honored and respectful member of the Hawaiian Ohana (family) where discerning locals and their families come to decorate the enormous Christmas Tree that adorns the lobby just after Thanksgiving each year, or to indulge in the long-famous, sumptuous seafood buffets - where this very special hotel knows that it truly merits its place in their hearts. The Kahala really is very special - humble, respectful and confident that it will charm and delight. Here, in the quiet 'countryside' just 15 minutes from Waikiki, you are more likely to share the elegant Verandah Lounge for cocktails with a visiting President or Prime Minister, a seasoned veteran of the arts, a 10-goal international polo player or just another very discerning world traveler, than many of the crowded and predictable lodgings to be found jostling for a patch of sand on Waikiki Beach. This is an hotel where you are the center of everything,and where this elegant 53 year old Grande Dame will steal a piece of your heart ......time and time again.

If you have been a frequent visitor to Honolulu and stayed in Waikiki, I would recommend staying at the Kahala Hotel and Resort for your next visit to Honolulu as it provided pure relaxation in a resort atmosphere and at the same time a short commute to Waikiki if shopping and more typical visitor related activities are desired. Our three night stay was just spectacular with well appointed and spacious rooms, courteous and professional service by a core of long term employees and a very large and pristine beach for sunbathing or long relaxing walks along the shoreline. Dining experiences provided different opportunities to enjoy creative and tasty cuisine without having to leave the property. We found all of the dining options very enjoyable and reasonable for the quality of food and service provided. Would recommend Hoku's for a great dining experience and the Plumeria cafe for more casual all day dining. Either way you will not be disappointed. If you have not stayed here it is worth a try and know that you will not be disappointed.

Hawaii always impresses, but Kahala was a true gem. With a private beach, fabulous food and cocktails, outstanding service, and Dolphins onside. Any room view here is great. The heated toilet seats might impress you too :). My teenage daughter loved swimming from the shore to the little island or simply sun bathing on the floating deck in the middle of the ocean. WOW.

I attended a family wedding at this resort and I reserved here with some trepidation based on the reviews especially in 2014 and earlier. The later reviews were better. I did happen to talk to one member of the ownership group and discovered the resort changed owners in 2014 - which explained the improvement. Hotel is first class. my room was great and service in all areas was top notch. The hotel is on the other side of Diamond head from Waikiki which in my view is excellent. The area is less congested and the resort has a beach which is more or less private which makes it a wonderful place to relax. This will be my go to place for my next stay on Oahu. I must add one comment regarding the weddings, the have two outdoor venues set up and to be honest I wasn't impressed with either one. I've been to other outdoor weddings and this didn't feel right - seemed more thrown together. The reception was not up to 5 star quality but that may have been more of a comment on what the bridal party selected rather than the resort's capability. That not withstanding - this is a great place to stay. They also have dolphins in a large mini lake which were fascinating to watch.

This was our second stay at The Kahala. We went to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and were absolutely spoiled. We even received a lovely card and champagne from the hotel. Their restaurants are amazing and all the staff treats you like royalty. We will definitely be back.

The Kahala - wow whats not to love!From the moment we arrived to the moment in the grand lobby with its amazing chandeliers, until we left we were treated as though we were really cared for. It is in a quieter area east of Waikiki and Diamond Head which is what we were looking for.A fantastic welcome with a lei and really friendly happy staff. In fact we were given a number to text for anything we wanted. How great is that?The room was beautiful, well appointed and clean. We were celebrating my husbands 50th Birthday and were treated to a bottle of Champagne in the room and some chocolates.The bathroom has a double sink with a full sized bath and a large shower, large closets, slippers and dressing gowns.There is a turn down service and the bed has to be the most comfortable bed I have slept in on my travels. A great nights sleep.Food and beverage service is amazing - we found it a little pricey but the exchange rate isn't in our favour at the moment.The beach is clean, so are the sun beds and they are really comfortable with great cushions, and there is plenty to do if you can pull yourself away from watching the turtles, rays and dolphins in the lagoon.All in all a lovely place to stay and relax.

A luxurious lobby greets you on arrival and those chandeliers are grand and create a feel of grandeur. Attentive valets do not waste any time to assist you unload your luggage and our guest service staff member was delightful and welcoming. We were given cool towels and a joyful welcome with lays. Unfortunately the joy ended after a long haul flight when we were given a room that obviously had a mouldy air conditioning unit We are asthmatics so that was a disaster but the lengths the Receptionist went to to talk us out of moving were unprecedented. Offers included a purifier, wait until tomorrow, other rooms are noisy, we may not have another room. We were also given a supposedly quiet room in the middle of a large wedding party that had all of their doors open, so it was chaotic. Do not accept this rhetoric that is full of contempt. It didn’t matter that it was our second stay and the staff member was awful. They should do better given their luxury rating. We eventually got a room lower down that overlooks the golf course and it was quiet with a lovely view of the golf course anyway they didn’t notify us and we had to chase it up after 4pm. We had a base room and they are fine unless you need an ocean view. They are large and the best asset for a family is the two separate sinks, a separate bath and toilet resulting in an ease in getting organised for the day. The toilet is one of those Asian ones that do all their fancy work and I personally don’t like a heated seat in the tropical weather though as we couldnt turn that off. The beds are small. More like a Large King single in Australia and not really a double, but they have luxurious bedding, really clean and crisp linens and a very comfortable bed. It did accommodate two people in the bed though. All of the amenities were quality and the cleaning impeccable. I loved those turndown chocolates and wished I had bought a large stock before leaving.Kids will like the fish and stingray in the lagoon and we liked looking at the dolphins until we saw a guest hassle them late at night by taking photos with a flash. We were not happy about this and let security know.The staff in this hotel are generally very warm, engaging, patient, professional and assist you with your every request. We organised our car hire from Australia so we got all of the appropriate insurances with Hertz as they were onsite. We got a great deal but the service was much better than other car hire companies that we dealt with in Hawaii . So was the return of the car to the airport, hassle free. It does cost $32 US to park, so we arranged it on the last day of our stay. The valets are outstanding and always quick, polite and friendly.Breakfast was a great fare with the usual omelette station, a friendly knowledgeable cook, hot foods in abundance, plenty of fresh fruit, pastries, some Asian foods ie. Miso and salmon. The foods were top quality and the staff were really attentive. It was particularly busy on Sunday, so book a table. Just watch the cheeky birds or they will be eating your breakfast when you turn your back. This buffet had superior items when compared to other 5 star hotels in Hawaii and the restaurant has a lovely relaxing outlook to the beach. It is expensive at $38 US, I am fairly sure there is a continental component that is less expensive. You can use the chairs on the beach which are in abundance but the cabanas were an extra cost. We still got service on the beach, but you had to look for it and it was a long while. We like this beach because it is protected but there are no waves to play on as such which will suits smaller children. The surfcraft staff were really friendly and knowledgable too but the hire costs were expensive. We bought some lilos to float around the ocean. The pool isn’t huge but the service is good and there are always good quality chair covers and fluffy towels available. The restaurants were pricey and the Italian restaurant was probably the best value but still pricey. We only discovered at the end of our stay that they do take aways. We utilised the shuttle and went to the Kahala Mall to eat at a good restaurant and get supplies at Wholefoods. The shuttle also went to Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping centre. There wasn’t a great deal of times but more than enough to eat and return on the last shuttle if you chose to. We do love this hotel and its relaxing atmosphere.

The hotel was nice. Friendly staff. Not a large beach to walk on if you like to walk. The rooms were nice and quite enough area that we slept with our balcony door open. Wasn't impressed with breakfast at all. The buffet was lacking in choice and because of that $38 a person was a bit high. Go to Whole Foods or something on your way in and pick up a few thing and use the mini fridge. Breakfast should not cost $80+ for two people. I know it isn't Mexico but come on. If you have kids the would enjoy the dolphins, and the sea turtle and stingray lagoons. The gym was adequate.

The Kahala enjoys a sweet spot - within striking distance of Waikiki, but sufficiently far from the madding crowd to lay claim to "resort of choice" in Oahu.Dear reader, let us be candid with each other. 16 hours flying time in each direction for some pasty Brits to spend less than a week on vacation sounds a little silly.It probably is. But falling out of bed from a Dolphin Lagoon room to hotfoot across pristine sand into 80.2 degree water in October is an easy sell. A very easy sell. And what a sales team. Whilst the atmosphere is far from regimented, it is made all the more special by its staff. If the new GM is within earshot, Sam, Lloyd, Charlotte, Moonie and Tyler all deserve hearty plaudits. The Kahala gets all the small stuff right - from the complimentary Kona coffee served from 5.30am to the scrumptious chocs never too far from the pillow. You don't snag every President since Lyndon B. Johnson by not knowing how to run your unit.Breakfast at the Plumeria Beach House is a comprehensive spread, and the afternoon tea at The Veranda is very civilised without being overly formal. But Hoku's is the dream ticket - a wonderful ambience, delightful cuisine and a team at the top of its game. Outgoing President Obama was fully justified in taking 4 and a half hours over that dinner. Hillary, your photo is already on the wall.

We attended a wedding at this hotel and it was perfect. The hotel has everything you need and the private beach is your own oasis. There are even dolphins on property that are fun to watch and turtles too. The rooms are what you would expect from a 5 star property and have "smart" toilets that are an added bonus. The views are amazing and hotel staff very friendly. We ate in all the restaurants and there is a good variety and prices are not out of hand. Close by is a large shopping center with more restaurants and a whole foods market. The rooms also have mini fridges so you can store some fresh papayas and drinks. Getting to the downtown and airport are super easy just a short uber or taxi ride away but you will love the peace and quiet of this private retreat where celebrities have stayed since the 1960s. If you are looking for a luxury hotel on the island of Oahu this one is hard to beat.

We stayed just 1 night but we loved the hotel, the pool area has a big natural pound for fishes/turtles and dolphins , with some staff feeding and training them.The beach in front is also lovely. Room is very complete, with japanese toilets (shower/drier), tub, and confortable bedding. You can also use suite 101 after your check-out to shower/nap for a later flight/amenities/water, amazing! The only downside is parking which is 32 USD

The Kahala was low key and chill and yet provided great service with a smile every time. At every request with every turn, I was made comfortable and accommodated. The concierge service was great (shout out to Cameron), they booked an entire island hop day that went off without a hitch. Every person I interacted with there had a positive attitude. I would go back on a minute. Mahalo!

We were in Hawaii for our nephews wedding on Oahu. There was no hotel located near the wedding location..so we opted to stay at the Kahala because it is outside of Waikiki (10 minutes by car/shuttle). This is a breath of fresh air - near Waikiki but with the peace and "Aloha" spirit you find on other islands. This property provides a relaxed casual but elegant feel that is "heaven on earth." We are not "resortists" but would go back to this property to do just that. The locals will come and dine on property - celebrate their special occasions and walk on the beach on occasion, their spa is fabulous...and worth every penny. If you have kids they have a marine biologist team/educators on staff...and its a great place to relax.If you want a an escape regardless of your feeling of Waikiki (this property offers the best of all that the Hawaiian islands have to offer)! We booked through our travel advisor and got the security and benefits of that as well as additional perks too. I highly recommend this property...even if it is only for 4 days like our stay!

Service, location, food, and rest is best on Island, but you will pay for it! Crazy expensive overall, but then so is the rest of Oahu facilities and food. If you go, get a package through Costco! About Half the price and generally includes things such as free breakfast (otherwise, $38 each), $100 resort credit per room, parking, and some have $200 spa credit; depends on timing and length of stay. All considered, you will love it and live rich!

This was a splurge for us - we don't normally stay at such nice hotels, so my review is that of someone who was a little out of her element. It turns out nice hotels are really nice, right down to the shmancy toilet seats. But, in another obvious statement, it ain't just the room that's expensive. Everything is, from parking (although, nice that valet is the same as self-park, so, heck yeah, valet) to cocktails ($16 for mai tai, but, then, you can order it from your lounge chair at the private beach, which makes up for a lot). So, to my fellow splugers: don't forget you'll want to splurge on the rest of the stuff too. It's worth it. A note about the dolphins: I'm really not in to captive dolphins. All the literature said they would be there, so I can't say it was hidden. But, man, they are *right there.* Like, you can watch them from the pool. I got used to it, but this is a warning for those whose convictions are more solid than mine. This hotel really fits a niche because there aren't any other private resort type experiences this close to Honolulu. If you need to be near Honolulu, but still want that vacation-in-remote-paradise feeling, you can't do better.

My wife and I spent a week at Kahala. This was our fourth trip there. Overall, it was, as expected, wonderful. But.....we once again experienced some of the restaurant service issues that I have noticed in the past.We will start with the good news: Our room was magnificent, with a great view of the mountains. We pretty much left our door to the lanai open at all times and enjoyed the fresh air. The king bed was super comfortable and the hotel has replaced its older, seemingly first generation flat screens with modern televisions. The maid service was, as usual, first rate, as was the hotel staff generally.We loved waking up early each morning--we were on west coast time--and going to Plumeria for breakfast. Watching every sunrise from the patio there was magnificent. As I have written in the past, I think the breakfast buffet is excellent and a good value, especially if you can make it last until dinner (but hard to do on west coast time when you are eating before 7 am.) After breakfast each morning we took a walk down the beach and imagined that we had enough money to buy one of the empty beach front mansions. Try it at least once: when you walk back the view of the hotel against the mountains is worth it. We loved hanging out at the pool and swimming in the ocean. One really positive development is that service around the pool and beach has totally improved. For the first time ever on our trips they seemed to be fully staffed. And, they wisely put nachos back on the menu outside, which now seems to have something for everyone.This brings us to the bad news: service at the Veranda was, inexplicably, inconsistent at best and terrible at worst. Every time we went there it took way too long to get drinks. In fact, there were times when we would be seated and not see staff for more than fifteen minutes. It was strange because they seemed to be sufficiently staffed. At times it appeared that the staff did not have specific area assignments. We could never figure out their system. In fairness, it must be said that the staff there was friendly and seemed to be trying (especially the obviously new staff). I also loved their marinated mushroom salad and the shrimp cocktail was a surprisingly good value. Not incidentally, the Veranda has new tables and chairs and seems to be upscaled a bit since our last trip. I suggest--if anyone in management is listening--that the Veranda go back to, and stick with, the Mad Men cocktail bar theme. Sometimes what the adults want is a stiff Martini and a big plate of food.Also on the negative side were the menu options at Plumeria. Even on normal nights it isn't a particularly expansive menu. But what we really objected to was the nearly non-existent menu on Saturday and Sunday, when Plumeria offered their seafood buffet. It just doesn't make sense; their room service menu was operational, so why should you not be able to get the very excellent Kahala burger for dinner on the weekend? A cynic might say they are trying to get people to spend the $60+ on the buffet....I will try to write an official review for Arancino, the Italian restaurant at the hotel, but suffice say that the drinks and service there are excellent but as far as the food goes stick with their excellent pizza.The shuttle to Hanauma bay, which includes gear, was quite reasonable at $29. But understand that you are just paying for a taxi ride and the gear, not any kind of expertise or guidance at the beach. But go there for sure, as the snorkeling is incredible.Also, if you like to fish you can sign up for a fun canoe trip straight out into the surf from the Kahala beach. Every year I go and always catch some really strange fish. Thumbs up to their guide Peter, whom you will see around the pool running their surfing and paddle boarding services.I am being generous giving Kahala a five on this trip; probably a four or four and a half is more accurate. But despite our criticisms we always love the style and class of the Kahala. As I have said before, if you think this place needs an update go stay at the Hilton at Waikiki. I hope that we will be able to go back to Kahala next year!

Around 11 on 10/17 the nice lady bartending at the pool grill made me the most wonderful drink I had during our 13 day stay. It was named South of the Border. Lunch was fabulous. The resort & grounds were stunning, relaxing, & peaceful.

We stayed at the Kahala Resort for our wedding anniversary celebration and it was such a wonderful experience. The staff are amazing, especially Jacqui at the front desk who helped us out with our early morning arrival. The hotel rooms are spacious and lovely. The restaurants were great. We enjoyed a special anniversary dinner at Arancino and were totally spoilt. It was a very relaxing stay and we would love to stay there again on our next visit to Hawaii.

Considering how expensive the rooms are at $400+ a night, you would expect that the management would put effort into making the flagship restaurant as good as it could be, but the evening we went both the food and service were a disappointment.The Japanese cook was more interested in flashy design than content, and the quantity hardly qualified as a meal. In the dessert he used a stale Unagi pie, instead of baking it himself. The waitress was out of her depth, even though there were only five covers at that time that evening. We sat outside on the veranda and when the candle blew out we couldn't see our food to eat it! We asked various people to relight it, but it took nearly fifteen minutes to get it relight. The waitress brought a glass of water first, then the silver, then menus and bread as an after-thought after the meal was over! Inattentive, easily distracted and unprofessional, we really didn't want to leave a tip.Conversely the room was excellent and we loved the bed so much that we photographed the manufacturer's label, and the pillow, so that we can order them for our home too.Meal with 2 beers $140 - worth $60?

The Kahala is just east of Diamondhead which means it's a little quieter than Waikiki. We were greeted with an orchid lei, and it just got better from there. Had a room facing the hills/mountains with a lanai. The rooms are beautifully appointed, with a large bathroom. I felt like royalty as we strolled through the lobby and around the grounds. Everyone was professional and so friendly. If we get the opportunity to return to Hawaii, we will definitely be staying at the Kahala.

We stayed at the Kahala Resort Hotel for a Business get away and boy was it! We were treated like royalty. The food was amazing and the music was fantastic! Thank you for such a lovely time. Love, Love, Loved it!!

Loved the view over the ocean off to Kokohead with the clouds reflecting the sunset. We sat at the Veranda for dinner - great food and lovely view. Service throughout the hotel was superior. Cute benches oceanside to drink morning coffee and read the paper.

We had a wonderful stay at the Kahala. We were married here on the Diamond Head Lawn with lunch after in the Kahala O Ke Kai room on Saturday and we found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Timely requests were answered and everything went smoothly. Our event coordinator was amazing. She is such a sweet and genuine person and was always professional and responsive to email, calls, and questions. Her kind demeanor was very calming and we were never stressed on our wedding day!We felt the wedding packages were a good value. They have an excellent list of preferred vendors. Our vendors knew the hotel staff, property, and each other well. Helped to make our celebration go smoothly and as though we were part of a big family!Catering staff were impressive! They were helpful with our special requests with my grandma and were always checking in with us without feeling overbearing. Food and cake were fantastic. I was surprised that the catering staff was able to exactly replicate a photo of a wedding cake I admired!Housekeeping did a wonderful job with turndown and left our orchid Lei in hearts on our bed and even folded our clothes! So many sweet attentive touches did not go unnoticed!Room service staff were friendly and timely. Room was very spacious with lovely decor. We utilized our lanai - enjoyed having snacks and a breakfast with our view. We had a scenic view room but I could still see Koko Head and the ocean from the lanai. We had two meals at Hoku's and enjoyed both immensely! The night before our wedding my mom and I had tea at the Veranda and very much enjoyed their live music.Although our wedding was very small, everyone made us feel as though we were VIP. We are truly touched and grateful to the Kahala for helping to create such s special weekend for us.

My third stay at The Kahala and once again it was lovely. All the staff members, from the restaurants to housekeeping, continue to impress and couldn't be more friendly or helpful. The large rooms (especially with a lanai) make it feel more like an apartment than a hotel and the double bathroom amenities are wonderful. I particularly love the "old world" feel of the place but a bit more maintenance wouldn't go astray especially as our balcony railings were showing a fair bit of rust. We did the canoeing this time which was great fun - especially seeing numerous turtles popping their heads out of the water near the reef. The only downside of this resort is the captive dolphins forced to perform tricks for tourists. I was especially distressed when one was forced to beach itself on a pontoon for the enjoyment of a paying customer. I thought we were past this sort of stuff in this day and age............

One of the leading hotels of the world.. Not so sure it really is. Great location and beach yes. Rooms aged but ok - 50pc have no outside space just Juliet balconies. Breakfast is barely any different to the whole world's 4 star restaurants - when my wife said she would only take a pancake for breakfast and grab a sausage off my buffet menu the waiter said in all serious 'no i couldnt let you do that maam, i'd have to charge' very odd and money grabbing attitude. Main pool and seating is quite dull with non stop painful music and of course additional charge should anyone be as extravagant as to want a parasol on the beach. Golf course attached but private members only and no guests can play. Sorry but comparing with other leading hotelsI dont get it - non stop weddings being held there due to location though

Recent stay at the Kahala, our fourth stay. Rooms are lovely and spacious as is the bathroom with twin vanities. The hotel remains our favourite due to this and importantly the location, away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, yet with a shuttle service to take you into town when desired. Food at Kahala could really be improved. Poolside burgers were excellent as always, yet Asian chicken salad was just lettuce leaves with some poached chicken. Tasteless. Same with club sandwich, unfortunately the toasted bread simply tasted like cold toast and the filling was dull. Other than that, and the fact that the pool area could do with an upgrade, we again question why Kahala continues to be associated with Dolphin Quest. This is a real downside to staying at the property. Staff are extremely helpful and courteous, checkout with Tyler and Carlos was seamless. Housekeeping staff similarly wonderful to deal with. Excellent hotel overall.

We ate lunch overlooking the ocean at the Plumeria Beach House restaurant. The experience was one of excellent service and good food. I have eaten there many times before and will go back. Hoku's, upstairs is excellent for dinner and a more formal dining.

We spent a week at the Kahala, our first time as we normally stay in downtown Honolulu. What a delightful place--tranquil, beautiful and wonderful beach activities. It's a great beach to learn to paddle-board and play in the water. The dolphins are an added plus. We will stay again.

Spent 3 nights after Ironman in Kona. Staff, setting was spectacular. Didn't fully appreciate until we went to Pearl Harbor and then drove through Waikiki. Thrilled we chose it. Dolphin lagoon outside our room was unforgettable. Dining was very nice, both breakfast and dinner. While we are not fans of resorts and hotels, this never felt like either. Highly recommend.

Chose the Kahala from other reviews having never been to Hawaii before and glad we did! Lovely hotel in a beautiful setting and little away from the bustling Waikiki area making it peaceful and tranquil, but only a short drive into Waikiki if you want to visit. Hotel rooms spacious and well appointed and service very good from attentive staff. We had the scenic room which although doesn't have a sea view was lovely and gives great views towards hills and mountains behind. The selection of restaurants in the hotel offer a good choice - the breakfast buffet is worth having - sitting right in front of the beach at breakfast is a real wow!

Would we stay there again...YES, without a doubt. Although there was a minor misstep at check-in, put in a room that was meant for someone else who hadn't arrived yet, the service was always warm and professional. As we were celebrating our anniversary we were gifted a nice bottle of sparkling wine to add to our celebrations. The location was fantastic. Waikiki is almost certainly my least favorite area to stay in Hawaii. Because so many hotels are situated there, we have stayed overnight a few times as we transited to another island. Kahala, although only about 6 miles away from Waikiki, feels as if one is worlds away. The hotel and surrounding area are peaceful and beautiful and the hotel at 10 stories is the tallest structure in the area. If you want to endure the crowds and chaos in Waikiki, a complimentary shuttle is offered to hotel guests.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to another "weekend away" in 2017

We enjoyed every aspect of our stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort! This is a great place to stay if you don't necessarily like the big crowds near Waikiki Beach. The view was epic! And the staff made every effort to make our stay enjoyable!!

We recently had the perfect week here! It is such a beautiful resort! Our son and daughter-in-law had an amazing wedding here as well. The location is wonderful, and family and friends who came for wedding, loved it as well. Such a relaxing atmosphere, and the staff so attentive and friendly, with a 'can do' attitude. If we could go back right now and relive our experience, we would!! The beach and restaurants were excellent, each day more special than the last. I would highly recommend this resort for a wedding, vacation or event. There's something for everyone. We all find ourselves longing for more.

I stayed at the Kahala hotel over 4 nights. Our room was in the dolphin wing, main floor with a view onto the golf course. The view from the window was therefore, "OK". It is a very beautiful hotel, with a very scenic beach. I didn't quite get the VIP experience that other people were experiencing as our room was inconsistently managed. Some days we would get our toiletries, other days we had to ask. The last day I would received the daily newspaper---but not other 3 days? One evening around 6pm we came back to the hotel after a long day out to find that our room wasn't even touched (I ensured no 'do not disturb' sign was displayed that morning), and no clean towels available to shower. I was also sent a defective blow dryer and had to call in another. I haved called the front desk for a lot of things over the course of my stay, and I felt uncomfortable about appearing needy and annoying. At least they were mostly nice about it. On the plus side, the in-house Pacific Dream Photography gave us a fun complimentary photo session, and the director Julia really accommodated us to make us happy with their services. The concierge, business centre and the bell desk were extremely pleasant and helpful as well. All in all, this hotel is good. It is beautiful and comfortable. We were eventually provided with what we needed once we asked for it. The rating reflects the mild disappointment that our experience did not meet our expectation of what a famous five star hotel should be.

The hotel has everything you may need, whether it be families, couples, friends and families. You want require it, the hotel provides it The location is far ether than Waikiki It is set right on the coast with fabulous views out across the ocean Wonderful rooms, super food and great customer service.I could go on and on Overall an excellent we'll run hotel I would highly recommend it Well worth the cost

We had an excellent experience here. The hotel is older (built in the 70s?) but the upkeep and the amenities are amazing. Our reception was warm and welcoming, and everything was done with excellence. Pool, beach, adventures, dolphins, great food, and great staff and service. It was the highlight of our stay in Hawaii... I only wish we could have stayed longer. We definitely plan to return!

The Kahala Resort is amazing. It was such a wonderful escape. The property is beautifully landscaped, the room was well appointed, beds were very comfortable, and we really enjoyed the beautiful ocean view. The staff was consistently friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The lagoon with the dolphins, rays and sea turtles was quite a treat, and the private beach is also a nice perk. The one and only drawback of the hotel is that it can be a little inconvenient to get around if you don't have a car and need to rely on shuttle services. The hotel does offer a shuttle service to several shopping areas which is nice, but if you want to go on any tours, etc. you have to take a taxi or pay extra for the tour company to pick you up at the Kahala. Even thought this was a bit of an inconvenience, I would definitely stay at the Kahala again if I return to Honolulu.

This Hotel has everything a family wants, it has a big pool, small one and a whirpool. Beachfront. Has a good service and staff is very nice.The only thing I did not like its food, its expensive and its not good at all.

This hotel is fantastic. The service, location and cleanliness could not be beat. You felt welcome from the moment you pulled up. However, the rooms, although clean, were a bit dated and the some floors are smoking for foreign guests. The grounds are really beautiful and the private beach is quite safe and protected from the rough ocean. There are fantastic restaurant options for all meals!

My husband asked me to join him on a business trip to Hawaii and, I know it sounds ungrateful, but I wasn't very interested in going after a summer of travel and a good deal of time in Tulum, Mexico. What could Hawaii offer that might dazzle me after that?Hawaii has... well you know, the breezes, the beaches, the people and the poke! But just as important, it has The Kahala Hotel & Resort.From the moment we stepped out of the car to the extra attention from Jordan and James at the front desk (Our reservations were wrong ~ no fault of The Kahala ~ and Jordan & James not only fixed it, but went above and beyond), the staff treated us with genuine kindness. The room, right on the beach, the walk there with its riveting dolphins to the classic retro decor. I was undone at every turn.Don't stay at The Kahala unless you want to feel spoiled. Don't stay there if you don't love luxury at its best. If you're not into friendly and gracious staff, you don't want to have everything you need at hand or if you are looking to find fault. This is not the place for you.But if you want a resort that makes you feel like home is a luxurious, opportunity filled delight, please, oh please choose The Kahala.Hawaii is a magical place and The Kahala Hotel & Resort is the cherry on top.
user_name:
Michelle P
San Miguel de Allende, Mexico

review_body: Excellent hotel, lobby area blows you away and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice but worn, it needed some touch ups and clean the curtains. The 4th night we were there, we came back to the room to find the bed covered in ants. Staff changed the linens and sprayed bug spray outside the room. But by the morning of the 6th day, the chairs were covered in ants. We were on the ground floor so that can happen and again the staff was quick to apologize for the issue. We still really enjoyed our stay and had an amazing breakfast overlooking the ocean. Definitely recommend having the buffet at Plumeria.

The Kahala is the Luxury Resort that leaves all other Hawaiian upscale properties in the dust. Located in a lush green compound south of Diamond Head on a large beautiful private beach, this resort has a real Hawaiian vibe throughout, and defines true luxury in a elegant and understated way. Service is excellent. Rooms large and well appointed with gorgeous bathrooms. Great stay.

My husband and I stayed at The Kahala Resort to celebrate our first anniversary. It surpassed all of our expectations. The staff is exceptional, the grounds are stunning, the food is amazing, the drinks are even better and the services available are world class. (P.s. try a cocojito, you wont regret it) One of the services we took advantage of was the photo session with Pacific Dream Photography. As our plans changed we almost missed our chance and I am SO happy that Julia was able to fit us in at the last minute before leaving for the airport. My husband and I had very few pictures together on this trip and being able to capture such an amazing memory ended up being my favorite part of this trip. The images Julia captured for us are simply stunning. She was fun to work with too!

We arrived with a very warm welcome from the valet service to the front desk. We stayed at the dolphin lanai room and it is fantastic. It's very roomy, well-appointed room, a large bathroom (separate tub and shower and a hi-tech toilet 8)) with a view of the lagoon. The hotel has a 70s vibe and I can understand some reviewers' comments that it's dated. Food and beverages are very pricey, but if you have a car, it's a short drive to the mall where you'll get plenty of choices to eat. The resort also offers a free shuttle to the mall and to Waikiki. The beach is wonderful with plenty of chairs. If you want to indulge, there are cabanas available for rent.We will stay here again next time we are in Oahu. It's relaxing, it's close enough to Waikiki if we are inclined to experience its noise and energy, and most importantly, the service is impeccable.

The people who choose this place will not be disappointed. The view is spectacular and the quiet serenity of the place will not be forgotten.Away from the noise of the city, this place is a morning delight. The ocean breeze and the sounds of the waves at night will delight you.The parking is a bit stiff, but if you parked in Waikiki it would be the same rate. It is not a trick, the fees are posted.Take in the beauty and enjoy the island air. It is Oahu on the leeward side.

The Kahala Hotel and Resort offers the best service, food and rooms on Oahu. The secluded location offers privacy and is a luxurious haven away from busy Waikiki.The beach is immaculate and beautifully maintained by the fantastic pool staff. Lloyd at the pool has been there for over 40 years and will help set you up by the pool or on the sand or in a private cabana.The food offerings are terrific. Sit by the beach at Plumeria and enjoy the best breakfast buffet ever!Ask for Barbara or Susan for superb service.Hoku's Restaurant is simply beautiful for a truly special evening and a must try is the whole fish baked for two or the crusted rack of lamb is always a treat, but save room for the dessert as all of the choices are delicious. Say hello to India and Danielle, who have wonderful Aloha spirit!Finish the night at Veanda, which offers live music nightly and great drinks and desserts. Brittney and Julie will take great care if you. Sit outside on the veranda on a comfy couch and enjoy tropical breezes.The rooms and bathrooms are large and well appointed and very quiet with excellent maid service and terrific turn down service in the evening.Dolphins in the lagoon are fun to watch and you can swim with them if you want. Great photo opp.This is truly a memorable property.

We spent 6 spectacular nights at the Kahala resort. The Ocean Front room with a view of the pool, dolphins, Diamond Head, Kona Head and the beach is probably the best hotel room view we've ever experienced. After good meals at 3 of the 4 on-site restaurants (we skipped Hoku), we'd relax on the lanai and enjoy the blissful sounds of the ocean. Everyone at the resort was very friendly. The room was spacious and had an initial wow factor, only some slight imperfections. The breakfast buffet at Plumeria Beach house is fantastic. Skipped Hoku which is supposedly the best but the other 3 were better than average. Was skeptical of using the shuttle to Honolulu but it was efficient and the driver provided excellent info as he drove. Research the resort costs so you know what you're in for. There are no "bargains" here. Being removed from the city, the gift shop could use some less expensive food and drink options. We would return in a heartbeat. It will be difficult to return to the madness that is Waikiki after the calm relaxation of Kahala.

This is a review based on just first impressions of the resort, having arrived here earlier today. The good:1) Our room is spacious despite being a standard 'deluxe', with the bathroom in particular being a great size2) We were 'upgraded' to a room with a balcony. The view is of the golf course behind the hotel though.3) It is away from the chaos of Wakiki and the resort offers a shuttle service there (or I guess it's a cheap Uber ride away)The disappointing:1) Upon check in we noticed on the back of the key wallet that parking is $32 per night whether we use the valet or self park. I can't really see any other option either given the immediate surroundings. This is going to really add up as we are here for 5 nights. There were no warnings in advance, and when I questioned it I was told by the receptionist that it was cheap because we were not paying a resort fee!2) Most of the outside space is taken up by a lagoon which is home to some dolphins, turtles and other sea life who really belong in the sea. It is not only really sad to see, but it also takes away valuable recreational space as the pool area is tiny given the size of the hotel. It seems really overcrowded, including the stretch of beach. The children's pool is the size of a hot tub.3) We waited for a good 10 minutes to get our car back out of the valet tonight. When we had arrived this afternoon the self park lot was full so that wasn't even an option for us. It's so frustrating waiting to just get your car to leave the hotel.We will see how the remainder of the stay works out. In conclusion I am disappointed at the initial impressions, and hope that the level of service somehow out-weighs the negatives going forward.

We stayed at the Kahala for our family's first trip to Hawaii. We were treated like royalty during the entire 5-day stay. As we were touring the hotel, we came across Pacific Dream Photography, who let us reserve a photo session at no charge. The employees we spoke with, including our photographer, were the nicest, most helpful and professional people we have ever encountered while preparing to take family photos. Everything from scheduling our session to taking the photos/choosing our photo package was made extremely easy because of their genuine kindness, professionalism and the astonishing quality of the photos. Our first trip to Hawaii will be forever memorialized in the most beautiful pictures only because of Pacific Dream Photography. We are beyond satisfied and forever grateful!

My wife and I selected this resort to celebrate our 5 yr anniversary. Don't think we could have made a better choice and we will be back. Did not like the 32/day garage fee, but traveling in/out daily, I made use of valet. There is also a shuttle that runs regularly to popular local destinations which is very good.We had a package rate / otherwise the $38/pp buffet breakfast (15% grat incl) was a little overpriced.The resort was outstanding, large rooms, comfortable pillows and excellent temperature controls, very attentive staff, and very good food. The location in proximity to Waikiki, but in the quiet and upscale Kahala district made this stay a hit. I will be back.

Beautiful charming hotel with attentive staff. From the moment my husband & I pulled up to the lobby we were treated like royalty. Our room overlooked the dolphin lagoon & was clean, large, peaceful & we especially liked the his & hers closets & vanities. The massages & facials at the spa were amazing, as were the private treatment rooms & estheticians. We celebrated our 25th anniversary at Hokus & had a delicious & memorable dinner! I can't say enough about the hotel beach & the beautiful grounds. The Kahala Hotel & Resort is by far our favorite hotel! We will definitely be back again very soon!

The staff at this hotel are fantastic! So I had to wonder, why did my room look so tired and sad. The king bed was comfy, linens crisp and towels fluffy. So why was the furniture upholstery frayed, tables chipped and mold in the shower and on the bathroom walls. The beach was lovely, clean and private. The food was excellent. Enjoyed the stay but wish the room matched the quality of the staff.

My husband and I stayed here for two nights: the night before our wedding, and the night of our wedding. As a soon-to-be bride, I was completely stressed out, but as soon as we entered our room, all my stresses melted away. The view was stunning. Perfect ocean view. Even the view from the hallway right outside the elevators was stunning, perfect view of the lush green mountains. I grew up in Hawaii (but now live in NYC), and places like The Kahala make me so proud to be Hawaiian. Since we were celebrating a special occasion, the hotel brought us champagne and chocolate strawberries. It was a little awkward that they brought it to us while we had settled into our room, and my husband was on the toilet at the time! The quality of everything was beautiful, from the bedding to the bidet, to the gorgeous lobby. In fact, the lobby is probably the most beautiful lobby I've ever seen -- even if you're not a guest, come to the Kahala just to see it! I love the chic island vibes throughout the hotel. It's so nice not to be in a sterile chain hotel. Very good service, although for such a high price it would have been nice if more services were complimentary, such as paddle boarding and cabana rentals.I would recommend this to anyone celebrating a special occasion. The location is perfect -- just a quick drive from Waikiki (and who needs Waikiki when you're staying in Kahala?) with a somewhat private beach.

We stayed at the Kahala for a week and every detail and need was attended to. Friendly staff and beautiful setting. Could not have been more pleased with our choice. The food was a bit expensive and did not match the quality of the resort so we did venture out to find some meals.

My wife & I have just spent 2 weeks with our friends at The Kahala Hotel. We are regular visitors now (from Scotland) & have yet again had the most fantastic time here. We return here as you are treated like royalty, the facilities are second to none & the location is absolutely perfect. We met the new General Manager - Gerald, who took time each day to speak to the guests. Through our visits, we have got to know a lot of the staff & they work so well as a team to provide a service which I can only say exceeds 5 stars. We love the shopping in Waikiki but would not choose to stay there as it is very busy & the beaches are so crowded. The Kahala Hotel is approx 10 minutes by car from Waikiki & has a beautiful quiet beach. There is the Kahala Mall 5 minutes away which also has excellent shops, dining & cinema. The hotel has a free courtesy bus which runs all day to 3 close-by shopping centres - The Hawaiian Village, Ala Moana & The Kahala Mall - all fabulous, but there are also superb shops & top class restaurants within the hotel itself which we use regularly. See you guys in September 2017.

The Kahala Hotel & Resort is located East side of Diamond Head and middle of the luxury residence area. You are able to feel like at other island of Hawaii, more slower pace and relaxing on the beach, take a surfboard yoga class, experience dolphin encounter. There are seven restaurants on site. The hotel run complimentary shuttle for its guests between Waikiki area and this resort.

Excellent service the moment you step in the resort. Everything is excellent, the location, security, amenities, people, room, and restaurant. This is our first time in Hawaii, and we're very happy we chose the right Hotel and Resort. Love the dolphin, sea turtle ang stingray lagoon (Dolphin Quest). Very unique. Love the "exclusivity" feeling in the resort especially the beach. All 5 star.....if we can give more than 5, we sure will :) .......Fantastic and Fabulous !!! You will never go wrong when choosing this resort.

I've stayed at the Halekulani a few years ago and this place is definitely better. It also compares very well to the Royal Hawaiian. It has a much more private relaxing feel of a resort. It has a real beach, gym and spa, and you don't see crowds all over the place or walk right into Waikiki. The eating options are also better. Our kid got up at 4am from jetlag the first day and my wife and him took a nice walk out on the beach; someone from the breakfast buffet gave him a croissant to hold him over till meal time. We had two connecting rooms at the end of a hall overlooking the golf course; they were beautiful large rooms, one with a terrace, and there was no need to have something overlooking the ocean or the dolphins -- I'm not at all sure we would have liked one of the lanai suites at ground level which would not have been private. The bathroom amenities were very good. The hotel's gym is great and open 24 hours; I really liked the sauna area which was also very private. The hotel is fairly compact and it is easy to get around it, and this also made us feel comfortable to have our 9 year old son run around on his own and not worry so much. Peter, the pool manager, was really nice to us; he gave our kids surfing lessons and swam out with them to this little island they wanted to go to and outfitted them with special shoes to avoid getting hurt from the rocks; he charged us for one hour and was out with them for two. He was also a really good instructor. My massage at the spa was in the top 20%. They also have a treatment for sunburn which is useful. Despite using lots of sunscreen, I got real red. The surf in summer was beautiful and swimming in the ocean was a real delight. The breakfast buffet is excellent; dinner at the hotel's signature restaurant was also excellent with a particularly good tuna. I was upset at the corn soup being something like 5 spoonfuls in a plate for about $15; i mentioned it but they didn't bring me any more. They have a buffet in their restaurant on weekends but it didn't include a single cooked vegetable, which is a problem for people who want vegetables without meat or shellfish. I didn't see any of the beautiful mangoes or avocados at the hotel like I saw in the nearby farmer's market. Basically, the hotel doesn't showcase the local produce. The weakest area of food in the hotel is the pool area, which could use a more expansive menu. We enjoyed the lobby entertainment on the weekend, particularly the piano bar. The hotel's kid camp evening program was better than most hotels, with interesting arts and crafts and a crabbing night adventure. Our son brought his crab back to our room to spend the night and mistakenly let it loose at the breakfast buffet; an alert waiter caught it just before a riot broke out after a diner noticed. The hotel is conveniently located to Diamond Head; we were able to do an early morning hike using a taxi from the hotel entrance. The business center was also good and the hotel worked well with us when our flight to Tokyo was delayed 24 hours and we had to deal with it. My mistake was not consulting with the hotel concierge before booking a private tour of Pearl Harbor through another company over the internet. We paid a lot of money for what we got and it might have paid to do it through the hotel. We didn't do the dolphin adventure; we've done that elsewhere. The pool itself is a bit small but overall we were happy that the pool area was calm and the beach was a place you could certainly find a lounge anytime on this private beach. Compared to the hullabaloo we saw on Waikiki this was not comparable.The rates and prices here were good value for money with room rates in summer being quite reasonable especially with Amex Fine Hotel & Resort benefits thrown in.

My daughter and I stayed at The Kahala Resort July 2-July 5th after staying at Aulani on the other side of the island. The Kahala is a very nice place to stay. It is quiet and remote away from the crowds of Waikiki. We had a room on the bottom floor facing the golf course. This area was very quiet and the room was quite spacious. Our stay came with the breakfast buffet that was very good to start our day with. The staff at the resort were very friendly and professional. The parking attendants were awesome. The beach was very nice and we got chairs with no problem. The beach was never crowded when we went. We took the complementary shuttle to downtown which was great so we didn't have to drive and deal with parking. The only complaint that I had was that when I booked the room I reserved a 2 bed room which they said they didn't have any available. They did provide a roll away bed which was ok but I was disappointed. Other than that everything was wonderful and I would recommend staying at The Kahala Resort and I would stay there again.

Without a doubt, the Kahala is the standard by which all others may hope to achieve. The rooms are sensational, very spacious with great amenities. The staff are exceptional. They all go out of their way to be caring and prompt. For my money, this is best hotel on Oahu. No crowds, no resort fees, superior service. Can't beat it.

My family of four stayed here and had the most wonderful time. The room was fantastic, the beach was spectacular, the pools were lovely, the dolphin experience was amazing, the restaurants, Hoku, Pulmeria Cafe and the Veranda all were excellent.

Absolutely loved this hotel. Location was perfect. Sunsets were out of this world. Service was impeccable. Rooms were large and very clean. Dolphin quest is located at this hotel so your family can enjoy watching the Dolphins play. Offered great gym that was accessible 24 hours a day. Every aspect of this hotel was perfect from the valet parking,concierge, buffet breakfasts to the free photography session. Would absolutely recommend and stay at this hotel again.

World class hotel in a tropical setting. We truly enjoyed our stay. Very relaxing. First class staff. Beach was great. Expensive but worth it. However, we would recommend renting a car in order to experience the rest of the island and to check out other restaurants. Restaurants on site are mediocre but expensive.

My wedding was held at this resort. Grace Chan helped me plan the most amazing event, and was beyond helpful, our experience was absolutely PERFECT! The hotel is beautiful, everything is very clean, and the customer service was outstanding. Our suit was the most beautiful hotel room I have ever stayed in. I would highly recommend this resort for weddings, events, and vacations. You will have an incredible experience!

Really nice resort, high level of service. Very engaged. Excellent restaurants in resort. Loved the dolphins .... I found the pool and the beach quite small for the number of guests. Prices are very high which you expect in a 5 star resort, however charging umbrellas on the beach on top as well as a cappuccino at breakfast (instead of the regular coffee) felt too much ....we had a nice room with a view to the golf course, keeping the lawn in shape involves a lot of noisy work starting at 6am in the morning ... this is a bit annoying when you are on vacation. The location is relatively far from waikiki, you need a car or always take a taxi.

This is a marvelous Hotel that really and truly checked all the boxes. Facility, front desk, concierge, valet, cuisine & restaurants, politeness and efficiency. Out all the high end Hotels we have visited, The KAHALA RESORT ranks as THE BEST. It has made celebrating our Anniversary the high light of our vacation time every year since 2012. I would recommend this Hotel for couples or families that want anything and everything.

Tea was dainty and serene. We watched the dolphins in a near by dolphin pond. Sandwiches were okay. Desserts were the stand out. The China was beautiful and tea choices by Harney & Sons were great. I really enjoyed the Caribe tea. If your with a little one order them a specialty iced tea, they are all delicious.

This is my third time back....................I was considering trying the newly opened five star in Honolulu, but had to return to this place..........Been there in the Seventies, the nineties and now..........it is still an elegant and superb respite with perfect location. Every bit of our service was top notch and i did not have to think about anything at ALL.............Which, is the point of a vaca and of a Five star place. The pool is a bit small compared to the gargantuan behemoth kinds at other resorts, but there is a separate kiddie pool and we never set foot anywhere but the beach anyway!!!!!! why swim in a pool when the beach is right there and gorgeous and perfect for toddlers anyway?? And five other beaches within ten minutes drive? It's HAWAII..........I have never stayed in Waikiki.................shoot me if i ever said I would(LOL). This place has withstood the test of time and is understated and elegant. Local businessmen and dignitaries do their "business lunches" in the Veranda and make deals there................and the other restaurants are popular with the locals which is why you have to make reservations............. but we always found a place to eat...................and the room service is impeccable too.........just ask for a different room or a different seat at a restaurant and you will be made comfortable. The key to this place is that they are totally focused on anticipating your every need and then.... getting out of the way.
