Room was very large and clean, great linens / beds, fabulous view from the top floor bellmen and waitstaff all were excellent.............and the dolphin encounter staff all wonderful, as were the Pacific Dream photography staff. The ease of the place is what sets it apart..........I have stayed repeatedly at other top properties like the Peninsula and the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong, and this place still is in that category, except with the Hawaii vibe to it!!!!!!!!!!Kudos to the staff there once again.......... I first landed at the property at the age of 12 when I went on a Mommy /Daughter vacation..........This year i took my13 year old daughter to renew this family tradition with her !!!.Liza Chianelli Bove' & Family..............PS...we shall be back WITHIN the year this time around...........

I had visited this resort to swim with the dolphins there and vowed to stay here if ever back in Honolulu. I was not disappointed! This resort is absolutely wonderful and is situated on a fantastic beach that is never too crowded. Our meals here were wonderful and the spa services were particularly excellent. You will feel spoiled the whole time.

Reading all the reviews, I was expecting to stay in a wonderful hotel, which definitely was not the case. It is a good hotel, but nothing else. 1- Location That is perfect. The private beach is awesome, once you are away from the crowds on Waikiki. It is a truly beautiful beach. BUT - be prepared - if you want a nice place at the beach, you will have to pay for your cabana. 2 - RestaurantOn our first day at the hotel we had to wait about 30 minutes to get into the restaurant to have our breakfast. It was really annoying as people (not only guests) were agglomerated in the tiny hall in front of the restaurant , many of the sat at the stairs. Besides that long wait line, breakfast was ok. Nothing espectacular - you cannot compare to the ones at Four Seasons or other international hotels. We also had the opportunity to have the dinner buffet and once again, it was ok. I was expecting much more. 3 - Swimming pool Disappointing. A very small swimming pool considering the number of the guests. Kids were playing loudly and there was no much space left for the adults. Also, it was super hard to find a chair - there are a few of them and once again you will have to pay for the best ones. 4 - Dolphin So sad to see those dolphins swimming in such a small lagoon. Believe me, I do not have any picture of the them because i felt really sad. My last experience with dolphins was at Atlantis Hotel in Dubai and, sincerely, there is no way to compare both experiences. 5 - Rooms Spacious and clean. Bed super comfortable. My opinion is that Kahala is still a choice for those who lived in the 70's and had opportunity to enjoy its glamour on that time. But if you are a younger couple, Kahala is still an option because of its beach and location, but be aware that it is outdated and you will have to share your lift rides and lobby time with some very arrogant people (i'm not talking about the staff, but the guests)

Lovely property, large rooms, ours opened out onto the golf course, which was lovely and green. breakfast was lovely and plenty of fruit!the beach is wonderful and calm, and the pool area was great with the kids. I personally take issue with animals in captivity - but its all been said before. overall this is a lovely place away from the noise and human traffic of waikiki. kahala mall is just down the road and is good to grab a quick bite if you're children never stop eating and you don't fancy paying resort prices every 15 minutes - because they never. stop. eating....would return.

I have stayed and eaten at this establishment over the years. I like this "quiet side" of Honolulu. In the 70's I visited the restaurant / bar. Staying here is "relief" from the hustle bustle of Waikiki. There has been a turn over of owners. The hotel is need of updating - carpet, furnishing, etc. The major updating/renovation at the Sheraton/Waikiki some 8-10 years ago attests to what thoughtful changes can be made with benefits. I was happy to receive an unsolicited "upgrade" to a upper floor ocean view room. I do like the mauka side though - cooler and views of the city lights on the ridges.Convenient location to Kaimuki, Kahala mall, my relatives and the H1(major freeway).

We stayed at the Kahala for three magical nights. It just doesn't get any better. Everyone is so friendly and eager to please. Everything is so peaceful and beautiful. The location is beyond fantastic. You have all the advantages of being close to Waikiki beach but none of the noise and congestion. If you're coming to be part of the noise, Kahala is not for you. We came as a couple, but it is also very family oriented as well. Some places that are family oriented tend to lose the quiet romantic feel but Kahala definitely does not. Our mountain lanai room was roomy and spectacular in every way. I enclosed a picture from our balcony. I don't usually notice bedding. I'll sleep on anything, but even I could tell it was exceptional. The beach is quiet and secluded and oh so beautiful. We had never been to Hawaii, so this visit was on our bucket list, and coming here only made us want to add it to the "bucket list" a dozen more times! Walking to diamond head, doing yoga on surfboards, swimming with dolphins. All on premises. It's like out of a fantasy. I would give a million stars if I could. If I were nitpicking I would point out that they strangely nickel and dime you for some strange things like printing out a few pages or taking a class, but even in that department, they are very generous with bottled water all over the property and free wifi and a free shuttle to the Waikiki area and free bicycle rentals so they exceed all expectations in that department as well. Mahalo Kahala! We will dream of you many times until we see you again :)

Very Beautiful Place To Stay In Hawaii. First class all the way. The décor is beautiful you have lots of things to do in this hotel, including swimming with dolphins right from the back side of your room. Very friendly staff and vip treatment all the way.

Even if we don't stay at the hotel, it is a very nice quiet beach to hang out on and have lunch at the restaurant. Dolphin Quest is located on the property to experience $$$$ or just observe. Removed from the hoards in Honolulu. A relaxing refuge.

Lots of fun for the kiddies in the dolphin pool but had nothing but bad luck in the restaurants. The Seaside Grill sat us but never took our order...twice. The Plumeria took our order fine but the food was a bit tasteless. The Veranda "tea" in the afternoon was unknown to the one employee we could find. The room was really nicely decorated and it did have a balcony and sea view. Unfortunately, most of the view was of the parking garage, dumpster area and the hotel entrance so we spent a lot of time watching cars drive around. We also go to hear the trucks picking up glass from the recycling bins several (early) mornings. When we left they did make a very nice complimentary breakfast to go (way before restaurants opened) and had a cab ready for us at 4:50am. I probably will try some of the other high end resorts...this was just too uneven and the view embarrassing for the price.

I have been coming for over a dozen years. The staff remembers you and there is always a warm Aloha making you feel right at home. They always try to give us the same room over the years and the staff from the valet, front desk or the restaurants try to make your stay special and memorable. The rooms I prefer are on the Koko head side and if you happen to be there on a full moon night there are not many places in the world with a more spectacular ocean view. The beach and pool are very comfortable and is great for kids and families but a bit too busy for couples. I wish it had an adult only pool! Still I return every year. It is a perfect getaway from theWaikiki crowds and reminds you of a time when the islands were a bit less developed.

What a well run hotel! The staff seemed to have been long time employees with great attitudes. The location is perfect. Near enough to Waikiki for restaurants and shopping, while feeling splendidly apart from the maddening crowds. The beach is very lovely with all the amenities you would expect from a top tier resort. A true luxury experience!

We've gotten married here 18 years ago, and still return occasionally. Even when we don't always stay at this hotel, we at least always visit their restaurants every time we visit Hawaii. Back then, it was Mandarine Oriental Hotel. Since the management change years ago, nothing seems different. The level of service, facility and every little detail is just as exquisite and just so effortlessly elegant.

We stayed at The Kahala Resort recently for 5 days and enjoyed it thoroughly. A beautiful hotel with a touch of old world glamour and class. A beautiful location right on the beach, it was amazing the water was beautiful, warm and tranquil , the staff were helpful, restaurants were of a high standard, the Dolphins were amazing!

Our family just return from staying at the Kahala Resort for 7 nights and had a fantastic time. If you’re looking for an area just outside of Waikiki but with convenient access, this is the ideal location. The Kahala offers shuttle service to and from Waikiki daily, or you can easily make the 15 minute drive---although parking in Waikiki can be difficult.The rooms are beautiful, quiet and roomy! My only tip would be to make sure you check your room set-up in advance. We had a total of four (two adults and two teens) and the room we had was set up with two twin beds…we were obviously expecting two queens or kings.Restaurants on the premises are good with a nice selection of offerings, albeit a bit pricey even for this category of Hawaiian hotel standards. We ventured out to eat a few days and found some excellent places like ‘Town’ on Waialae Ave….insane food and fairly priced!The service at the Kahala is truly excellent, from each and every employee! In addition, there was also a sincere, caring attitude from everyone which is a rare find these days.The grounds are beautiful! They have a great pool and beach access along with plenty of chairs/lounges/cabanas for both areas.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back next time we visit Oahu.

It has been just over a year since we stayed here, while we were in town for my 50th reunion at Punahou School. I have stayed here perhaps 10 times or more in the past. I was born and raised in Honolulu. I will NOT stay in Waikiki. This is the only hotel I would consider in Honolulu. Period.The rooms, the location, the service, the ambience. It is not Waikiki, that is for sure. The beach is beautiful and you will not have trouble getting a lounge chair at the pool. You cannot say that anywhere else.

While staying at the Kahala Resort for our Anniversary, my husband and I booked an appointment with Pacific Dreams Photography. They are located on site at The Kahala Resort and the session is free. We absolutely LOVED working with Julia! She is so sweet and easy to work with. She made it one of the highlights of our trip! Our pictures turned out fantastic! I highly recommend using Pacific Dreams Photography during your stay at The Kahala Resort. Thanks again Julia for the wonderful memories!

We booked an event at Hoku's awhile back. Because were impressed with how Chef Wayne and the Hoku staff worked with our family's food allergies, we decided to stay at The Kahala during our stay on Oahu. If you are looking for a hotel that can accommodate food allergies, this is the place! Our son is highly allergic to wheat and my daughter and I have other less severe food allergies. All menu items and buffet items are marked with codes to let you know what to watch out for. The hotel went over and beyond to ensure my son had wheat free food. He was able to customize his meals and the Plumeria Manager sent out for gluten free pancake mix and other items so he could have a variety of breakfast options. His allergy was flagged on our file so all restaurants knew to take special precautions preparing and handling his food. When we ate at Hoku's for brunch, they introduced my son to the chefs to let them know if he asked for anything special it was okay. How special is that! As for the rest of the hotel staff, they made us feel like part of their family. We did a couple some small issues with our room, but the staff took care of it right away. We would definitely stay here again!!!

We are family from Poland, we spent there 9 days, beautiful beach, beautiful rooms - suites with sea view, very good service, restaurants not so ngood but it does not matter, because there are many others in Honolulu

First let me say that if I was coming back to Honolulu I would stay here again. The rooms are enormous which is great it's just the quality and finishes that are a little tired now. The beach is fantastic and away from the craziness of Waikiki beach. The waiters on the beach only start at 11 which is a bit of an irritation and the pool is too small for the number of guests so makes the whole thing a little crowded. Personally I think they should do away with the Dolphins and let them free. The pond they keep them in is too small. Breakfast is ok, could be better, could be worse. The queuing to get and get a table drove me mad originally but then I realised you could book. Not something I am used to. Overall - it is a solid 4 star. Lacks "cool" factor. One word o. Waikiki as well - this is a city with a beach as opposed to a beach which has a town. It's busy this place.

I agree with everyone else about the superb service, luxurious accommodations, and excellent food in 2 of the 3 restaurants we tried. The spa is amazing and well worth the splurge for a truly remarkable experience for the senses. My only complaint was the silly drinks prices. I like to relax with a few cocktails at the bar in the evenings, but the prices of the drinks sent me to Longs drug for a bottle of vodka and mixers. Sixteen dollars for a glass of Chardonnay! Nine dollars for a beer, and $16-22 for specialty cocktails. I wouldn't mind paying the money if they were strong drinks, but the bartenders barely fill the one shot tumbler and the drinks taste like kiddy drinks. The sad thing is, the beautiful beachside bar was mostly devoid of customers around the clock , and my guess is it's because of the ridiculous prices. Nobody wants a bar full of rowdy drinkers, but my guess is the hotel would make more money if they changed tactics and made the drinks either stronger or cheaper, and in doing so tempted more people to hang out and socialize at the bar.

An outstanding establishment whether travelling for a family holiday, as a couple or in a small group or equally alone. The tranquility allows one to relax whilst there's plenty to do for the more active. The restaurants offer tremendous value for money and are well staffed. The shuttle service to Ala Moana and Waikiki is outstanding and allows you to step in and step out of the action!

Stayed there for several days and had a great time. Rooms and grounds are very clean. The food was good but service at the veranda was awful. They do have dolphins and stingrays which kids love, I Strongly recommend this hotel.

It's is not surprising that this hotel is a refuge from the popular tourist area of Waikiki. It is the only hotel in the beautiful private neighborhood of Kahala and is definitely off the main track. In contrast the property boasts Dophin Quest which is so popular with the families who visit from all over the world. The restaurants Arancino and Hoku offer excellent dining experiences and anywhere else food is offered in the hotel is specially prepared and served by the most pleasant staff. There is a shuttle from the hotel to the Kahlal mall and farther away to Ala Moana. There is a real Hawaiian ambiance here.

YES it is 60's chic…very impressive even in 2016, if you don’t look too closely. Here’s an official review by someone not paid or given gratis. Just your basic vacationer and lover of all things beautiful in good repair.WALL OF CELEBRITIES The wall with signed and framed photos of celebrities that have visited the Kahala in the past is, well a thing of the past. The photos have been moved to a wall near the lower level public restroom. And for good reason, no one of serious consequence has visited the resort, or had their photo taken, since Michael Jackson in 1987. But no biggie since cool and chic is a matter of conversation and social media. You could be sitting in a pool of rubber cement and if the general consensus was YEA MAN, then everyone would conquer and jump in. I get it.INSIDE TRACK Serious renovation needed. Walls, and hardware throughout especially in the lagoon wing, rusted; window seals, dirty and dead bug invested. Mirrored accent pieces: Moisture damage. Art: Three gorgeous framed island originals: matting either not wet-sanded or moisture has permeated and caused edges to lift. Very Tacky. Original chandeliers still impressive, and would be stunning if they were cleaned so that they could regain their glory as prisms of light. LAGOON WING If you are wondering where base meets oxidized painted wall and dated stone slate flooring, yes there is visible moisture damage. If you are considering a stay, seriously contemplate if there is any concern for the impact mold may have on you or your loved one's health. The visible markers on stairs, walkways and dirty carpet are staggering. Minimum renovations needed: Flooring, paint, window seals, rails, casings, and air-conditioning.UNRESPONSIVE Let’s talk Hotel staff for a moment. After searching your face for any sign of celebrity, which results in a no-go, you are demoted to your average guest with just enough money to maybe book a room. “You may wait for your reservation over there and no you may not use the basic free internet on the property. It is for our guests only.” Define guest. One who eats? Or one who sleeps? Either way it doesn’t mitigate the fact. Hotel Condition: Dilapidated

Everything you read about this hotel is true. It is a gorgeous, luxurious property, that will meet or exceed every expectation. What truly makes it five star is the service. Everybody was so incredibly helpful and welcoming. Not to mention the special treatment we got as part of our Honeymoon! The beach alone is worth the extra price (which was not much more Waikiki hotels, might I add). We ate at both the Seaside Grill for a quick bite and Plumeria Beach House for breakfast and the curry buffet on Wednesday. All amazing meals. Be sure to take advantage of the shuttle- it makes Waikiki or Ala Moana a short, free shuttle ride away.Words cannot express what an amazing property this was. You will be in the lap of luxury in the Kahala, and you will enjoy every minute of your stay here. Thank you for making the start to our Honeymoon so memorable.

Having lived in Hawaii for over 30 years, we have attended many events at hotels in Hawaii. On July 30th, 2016, we attended a vow renewal celebration at this hotel. Ms. Hinkley was the Catering and Event Manager. She did a fantastic job! Everything was top notch from the ceremony itself to the follow on reception and dinner. The food was by far the best we have had at any hotel In Hawaii. This event was well organized and the staff was wonderful. I would highly recommend contacting Ms. Hinkley if you are contemplating where to have a memorable event.

The property is very nice. Buildings are on the older style, but nice. Great location off Waikiki, but close enough to have access, and good local restaurants within quick driving distance. Honolulu is nice, but doesn't feel as relaxing as Maui or the other islands.Good pool and beach for kids. Good for families, and everyone loves the Dolphins. Not really a trendy disco hotel for the hip set, but very appropriate for families.Just a few complaints. Operations need to get their act together. They made two fairly big mistakes on our visit, one which they fixed and one where they just left me with a bad taste in our mouths. First, they sent us a promotional email with offer to upgrade. Good offer as the email read, but the email offer ended up being confusing and misstating the offer. They did fix it by honoring the upgrade. That's good.On the second issue, we checked out. Three weeks later I find out they charge us $300 more because they forgot to add one dining charge on the receipt. The charge is,legitimate, and we paid the bill of course; but when I settle a bill, I expect the bill to be accurate. Don't find mistakes (that you made) 3 weeks later and charge me without contacting me. Boo. Ultra bad. They need to get their accounting group better.They might have received a 4* star (out of 5) review from me naturally, but with errors, I offer 3. (Maybe less).

Wow, the hotel is situated at the best part of the island towards the tailend of waikiki beach. The hotel suites are of a good size, definately aim at getting one overlooking either the dolohin pool or even better the ocean in the main building. We saw whales breaching everyday at dusk which made this stay even better.Rooms are clean, well equipped.

We left Kahala this morning after one week's fabulous stay and I truly had tears in my eyes I was so sorry to leave! We were in a mixed family group with two teenagers. Rooms were beautifully furnished with very high and very comfortable beds and excellent air conditioning. The resort is a comfortable size and I never worried about where other family members were. The private beach is calm and beautiful and there are plenty of opportunities to find ahade particularly under the trees. The breakfast buffet is delicious and as well as the restaurants on site we also ventured further afield on the recommendations of the very helpful concierges, who also helped us organise a number of trips. I loved getting up early and having a few hours at the pool. We also made good use of the gym. All the staff are fabulous very welcoming and helpful, I get the sense that they enjoy working at the Kahala. If you get an opportunity to go I can't recommend it highly enough.

When thinking of where I wanted to propose to my girlfriend (now fiance), I wanted somewhere personal and private. So immediately I was drawn into the Kahala Hotel as it is a luxury hotel that is secluded. Staying in Waikiki would definitely have been noisier and crowded... not ideal for this type of thing. Long story short our experience at this hotel was amazing and the staff went the extra mile to make sure the proposal went perfect.Room - The Ocean View Suite was amazing. Our room was located right above the dolphin pool with a view straight at the ocean. It almost felt too big! Awesome view, beautiful room, no noise, check.Service - We were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived. The valet boys gave us a warm welcome and were extremely polite, the front desk greeted us with leis, the masseuses we had did an amazing job, and our waitress at Hoku's restaurant was funny and very attentive. I had also made many requests for the big night and was in constant contact with Shannon Ladd from HR. She went out of her way and made sure everything was taken care of. I can thanks everyone enough for making us feel so special that day.Proposal - For my proposal, I wanted to incorporate a Japanese holiday called "Tanabata". For this holiday, people would write their wishes on a piece of paper and hang it on a bamboo plant in order for it to come true. So prior to our stay, I dropped off a bamboo plant and asked if they could set that up before we arrived. Sure enough, the plant was set up when we got into our rooms and we wrote our wishes and hung it. We then went to eat dinner, during which some of my friends snuck into the room to set up hidden cameras and decorate it with rose petals and candles (LED, of course). The hotel was also accommodating with this request and even allowed my friends to enter the hotel through the basement to lower the risk of any accidental encounter. After everything was set up we returned to the room and she immediately thought we entered the wrong room. I laughed and reassured her this was the room and she finally caught on and teared up. Behind our wish was another piece of paper with the big question and I kneeled down and showed her the ring. It was a very emotional experience for both of us, and she nodded with her eyes flowing in tears. A few minutes later my friends showed up with a cart full of champagne (thanks to the Kahala for allowing us to use this) and a final reveal that I had also secretly brought her friend to Hawaii for this night. In the end, I don't think there was a dry eye and it couldn't have been possible anywhere else. I am glad we chose this hotel, met such great staff, and do plan on staying here again.Highly recommended.

Spent a 4 day long weekend at Kahala with my husband. Checked in and room was not ready however we were upgraded to beautiful room with patio and ocean views. Daily buffet breakfast was very good and beach service during the day was good, too. We did not go to pool - too small and too crowded with little kids and families. Used the gym and attended a couple of fitness classes that were basically private, which was a nice surprise...of course you have to pay extra for any group class. Rented kayaks and SUP and enjoyed using those. Beach never felt overly crowded although we did notice that non-hotel guests were using the chairs and beach area and I guess there's nothing to be done about that. We once had to ask a group of 20-somethings to turn down their metal music but the manager handled it graciously. (This group was acting like they were on Daytona Beach which was unexpected.)Overall a very good value for our quick vacation but probably a much better venue for families rather than for a couple. Not particularly romantic. We would come back with the kids!!

Overall, we loved the stay. We liked the room, particularly the bath room with walkin closet. However, the requested kettle never delivered, though I called 3 times. We do not cre such matters usually but everything was so expensive so that we expected better service. Again, we liked the stay overall, and we may come back to see Dolphins again.

So many great memories from check in to check out and everything in between! Definitely get breakfast! Beach - awesome; Service - awesome; Staff - best! Photographer - outstanding, favorite pictures and video every! I would book again and again!

This is a great property to stay at . Beautiful hotel , the beach and everything was amazing. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Great service with a smile always . Had requested a two beds room which they did not have but they did give us a rollaway which worked out fine for us . The beach area was great and worked out great for us as the waters were calm and beach area clean.Beach chairs and loungers were laid out for your use free ofcourse. The staff would even help you carry the stuff set it up for you . Though you have to pay for parking , but the valets were always eager to help and please. They would even ask us if we needed waters on our way which were provided to you at no charge. Overall they made us feel very comfortable and appreciated.Thank you once again for a lovely time .

The resort is a vacation unto itself. This was our first time in Hawaii and we were celebrating a few milestones as a couple, so we wanted something relaxing and a little beyond the ordinary. We are also budget conscious travelers, so we booked this and airfare combo from Seattle through a well-known travel site.The hotel is grand. It is located 15 minutes east from the Waikiki area, 20 minutes from the airport, and is bordered by a high-end residential area. Access to Highway 1 is 5 minutes. We rented a car to take day trips to different parts of the island, but there is a free shuttle that runs several times a day and picks up/drops off from multiple points in the Kahala/Waikiki beach area. Parking was a premium at $32/night, but when you calculate Ubers, taxis, shuttles, tips, and convenience, we figured this would work best for us. The resort has multiple areas including a high-rise portion, as well as rooms that circled the dolphin pools and "private" beach (accessible to the public, but bordered by two small peninsulas at either end of the hotel). There is a public beach that can be accessed through the outlet or just walking Kahala road, but we never made it that far. We stayed on the main floor and although they placed us in a room next to the maids' work room and elevators, a quick call to the front desk ended with a duplicate room in a more quiet area within 2 minutes. They didn't just move us- they wanted us to check the alternate room out first before we committed. Since we were also celebrating a belated anniversary, they provided complimentary sparkling wine on our second day. We also needed to print out a travel item and the front desk did it free of charge (it was one page), even though we could use an office area for a charge. It was superb service!I was amazed at the access points within the hotel- we had to explore the hotel first, but even though resorts can be so massive that it feels like a short hike anytime you want to go to the pool, the Kahala's entry points were all thoughtfully distributed so you could walk to the pool/beach area within a few minutes. The rooms we had access to were similar- a bed/desk area in cream/yellow/gold/baby blue tones. The bathroom was a highlight of the trip- it had two closets, two separate facing vanity areas, a tub with a gorgeous hose, and a separate, enclosed shower that had a retractable clothes line. The bathroom also had a Keurig and a compact fridge- perfect for housing some beers we brought from Don Q grocery! The star of the bathroom was the Toto toilet, which had an internal seat warmer. Our room faced the golf course, and it was a perfect, quiet spot for us. The room was air conditioned, but the air conditioning system automatically shuts off when you open the large windows to let the sea breezes in. There are rooms that also overlook the grand entrace/parking lot, high-rise rooms that overlook the local region, and rooms with direct access to the beach and pool areas, so there is a lot of variety! My husband was obsessed with visiting the dolphins. An encounter with the dolphins in the water is pricey- about $200+ for some quality time, but they are really close to you near the gates that line their pools, so we lived vicariously through the many kids that visited. We also visited the dolphins during the evening and they would make snapping noises with their teeth and sleep on the side of their pools- this was a really special and unique feature of the resort! Adjacent to the dolphin pools was a manta ray pool which housed two very large rays, and the regular people pool and hot tub. Surrounding all these pools was a cabana poolside lounge area and the hotel's main sit-down restaurant (I believe the buffet breakfasts, etc. were served here).The food on the premises was very expensive, we didn't partake, but it seemed like high quality. There were also two high-end restaurants on the property- Arancini's, which was italian, and a restaurant with high-end Hawaiian that opened up to the veranda in the front of the hotel, served drinks, and hosted a tea time.The resort has a wall on the main floor with pictures of special visitors (politicos and well-known entertainers of all types), a few clothing stores, and a spa area with private massage rooms. We also took a tour through the fitness area, and I was impressed- this was a complete gym with barbells, all kinds of new cardio machines, towels, etc. adjoining a separate women's and men's spa rooms, each with its own hot tub, steam and sauna rooms, showering areas, and lockers. This area was a bit off to the side of the resort, but it was probably the nicest and most complete fitness area I've ever seen in a hotel.There was nightly turn-down service with two sea salt chocolates, luxury bath and body products, and small touches like personal slippers and a light blue Kahala bag to tote your stuff to the beach. This was one of the best hotel/resorts I have ever been to, and although we didn't budget for personal massages and high-end eating, the resort was close to everything (even a Whole Foods in the Kahala mall!) that we always felt like we had access to it all! Although we visited Waikiki for the action, I would prefer to stay at this hotel instead.

Aloha. We booked a family package with breakfast for 4 night. We were upgraded to ocean front view just steps from the beach for celebrating our anniversary. The staff were friendly, and the ocean view was amazing. I ❤️ this hotel!!. The only recommendation is to provide more varieties in the buffe breakfast, but over all I highly recommend this hotel if you want to relax and enjoy a wounderful beach. Thank you for making our trip as a wonderful experience.

The staff is what makes the Kahala top notch- service was exceptional from the moment we arrived to the day we sadly departed. Everyone, at all times, made us feel welcome and taken care of. While most hotels offer good service, the Kahala staff seemed to genuinely care, a perfect example being this- while riding in the elevator, we were chatting with a staff member who said, with complete honestly, 'thank you so much for staying with us, we appreciate it" and it came from the heart. They really did seem to know we had a choice of where to stay, and they took care of us so we'd return. And we will- we've already booked a return visit in January.The rooms are quite large, complete with a mini fridge which is helpful. The grounds are beautiful, and the beach is great- calm, warm waters, away from the bustle that is Waikiki. There are several small touches that were welcome, such as complementary coffee and tea downstairs starting at 5:30 am, bottled waters when we arrived and at varying times through the visit, music on the veranda, the list goes on.The Kahala was perfect for our holiday, and while the property is outstanding, the people were even more so.

The resort is beautiful. The valet and front desk folks spot on. The room was very nice. Housekeeping and room service top notch. Stunning beach, nice pool. The pool boys were very good, especially the older gentleman! The only downside to everything was the service around the pool and the cabanas. We paid to have the tented cabana for whole day, $115. The wait staff came on duty at 11am and we were the only cabana being used at the time. We watched as 3 wait staff just stood around until 11:30am... as they still did not come over to help us we went to the window and got a menu and ordered our own stuff

We stayed at Kahala resort from July 9 to 13 with our family of 5. We arrived at night and check in did not go well as the rooms we booked were not available and we had to split between several floors and get roll away beds. Tyler did not do a good job dealing with the situation at all. However, management response to my complaint was outstanding and we were eventually moved and even upgraded two days later. The rooms were large and the bath room outstanding (heated toilet cover). We had great views and one room had a nice balcony to enjoy. The beach was great and we enjoyed the amazing views a lot. Also a lot of fun to eat outside at Plumeria and enjoy the surroundings/ view. I did not like the price of the restaurants though... Really a rip off for what is being offered. Breakfast buffet at 35$ per person! Good quality but nothing exceptional for that price either. I recommend to go outside to places in Waikiki for dinner that are much better value. For breakfast I recommend Koko head cafe and for lunch Diamond Head Market and Grill. If you have a rental car, parking costs almost as much as your daily rental costs and I thought that was over the top. 32$/ day and tip for valet as self pArking was not an option most days as fully occupied. I enjoyed the fact that the hotel was close to Waikiki and attractions like Diamond Head / Pearl Harbor/ Honolulu city and it offers a relaxing stay. It has a lot of pluses and potential but management needs to work on cost/ service level. I dont want to pay extra for everything if I book such an expensive stay. Just remember that if you wanted a beach chair with cover you were charged 65$ and for cabana 110$. The concierge service was outstanding though and specifically want to mention Cameron who provided us with some great tips. If you want to attend a Luau though book a few weeks in advance! Overall good stay and nice hotel/ calm alternative to Waikiki but high cost for services offered.

BEFORE WE GET TO MY REVIEW. I just wanna say, that if you're traveling with more than two people and plan on eating at the hotel. the prices are insane. and not the good insane. If you're trying to save a bit of money on your Hawaii Vacation, you should probably stay away from this hotel. Now Staying at the Kahala Hotel and Resort was amazing! I loved every bit of it!! When we arrived it was about midnight, and I'd say that's the best time to check in because Wilson at the front desk is so kind, friendly, and helpful! He really knew how to start this trip off! We first had an issue with our room not being the right one, we originally booked a room with double beds, but got one bed instead, and Wilson quickly solved the problem! He had helped us out by giving us a nice roll away bed! Not the fold up kind, but the kind that is an actual mattress! Free of charge because our room was incorrectly booked, and we had papers to prove it. Not only that but Kyle who helped at Valet was so kind and genuinely a nice person, he showed us our room and all of the great things that it comes with! And Lance, whom, I'm not sure what his title is, but he helped with setting up our roll away bed, was one of my favorite staff members the whole trip. Now we stayed for a week and the entire week, I only looked forward to seeing or being helped by Kyle, Wilson, and Lance. And that tells you something considering I was at the pool and beach majority of the stay and NONE of them work at the pool or beach. Now with every great reviews come complaints. The first thing I didn't enjoy was the parking cost and valet cost. Now I don't mind the valet too much, but parking is $32. PER DAY. I'm already staying at your hotel, which is costing me an arm and a leg, plus I'm paying for a whole week with a rental car. I eventually paid the same amount as I ate at restaurants. Not only that but if you choose to valet it's $32+Tip. so it all adds up. The next thing that bothered me was the fact that all of the restaurants' costs were not the greatest! It was a lot, we had breakfast at the Plumeria Beach House and 3 adults & 1 child's buffet ended up costing a little more than parking. and that was only ONE morning. could you imagine what the price for all of this would be if it was the whole week!?! It's ridiculous! I get I'm on vacation, but it felt like I was constantly watching what was being spent. And the last complaint I have with this hotel would be the Dolphin Quest. I wish there was a price or a deal with in-house guests, because we are staying at the hotel and all the prices are not meant for in-house guests. They're really all for anyone, and I understand that Dolphin Quest is a separate business, but come on, if you're having a room with a view of dolphins how could you not get a price meant for in-house guests? I just didn't understand it.I also didn't understand the cabana rentals by the beach and pool area. you would rent it for $65 a whole day, but after 5:30 it becomes free....doesn't make much sense to me since it's barely dark out at 5:30. BUT I did enjoy the private beach we had as well as the pool! You could be at the pool for half a day and then walk down a few steps to be at the beach! It was amazing, the privacy, the amount of people that were there, the view! It was all great! I did not want to leave at the end of my trip.Overall, great hotel and great staff! My only concern is the prices, if you're staying for a week with kids, things add up. e

For 4 years now my husband and two daughters have travelled from NZ to Hawaii during the NZ school holidays. We have always stayed in Waikiki or near Ala Moana. Last year we visited the Kahala for lunch and at the time decided we would return to stay for our next Hawaiian visit. The Kahala is PERFECT in every way! Pool staff were so helpful getting us loungers and towels set up every day. We loved having the option of the beach so close to the pool. Unlike Waikiki the beach was not crowded at all and perfect for swimming and paddle boarding. The rooms are generous in size and beautifully appointed. We were on the 9th floor overlooking the golf course which whilst it wasn't sea view it was still a spectacular view. There was an empty fridge in our room which we filled with snacks and drinks (important when travelling with kids) which we purchased from the fabulous Wholefoods at the nearby Kahala Mall - 5 mins in the free hotel shuttle! We used this free service most days as the shuttle also takes you to Ala Moana shopping Centre.We had heard that the Sunday brunch at Hoku's was a must so we booked (you do need to book) and had the most unbelievable, stand out food I have ever eaten from a brunch buffet. My daughters loved the dessert table along with the chocolate fountain - my husband and I feasted on some of the best sushi and sashimi before moving onto the amazing array of cooked food (the beef and lamb were cooked to perfection) washed down with glasses of mimosa.For our daughters the highlight was being able to swim with the Dolphins. I was so impressed with the Dolphin Quest staff who were just lovely, super professional and I loved that they also educated my daughters about these beautiful creatures. Quite pricey but WELL worth it!We have stayed at many top end, fabulous hotels in Honolulu over the last 4 years but I have to say there is something special about the Kahala...We will be returning next year

My family and I recently spent time at the Kahala. It was an extremely positive experience from the moment we stepped out of the car. The property itself is hidden in a residential area right on the beach. The grounds are beautiful and immaculate. Every member of the staff is warm, helpful and engaging. The rooms are spacious, nicley decorated and very comfortable. The restaurants are quite good. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the people who make it so special. One of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying. We look forward to returning in the future. Mahalo.

My husband and I took a trip to the Kahala for our one-year anniversary. As usual, everyone there was wonderfully helpful, the scenery was unbelievable, and the dolphins were a source of endless entertainment. This time, we decided to schedule a beach shoot with Julia at Pacific Dream Photography--to document our anniversary. She's completely lovely--very nice, very articulate, great at giving directions, and she has a great eye. We asked for action shots that featured the beautiful landscape and surroundings, and she absolutely nailed the setups and poses. She also took some beautiful portraits. The setting is stunning and the pictures all turned out beautifully. I'd definitely recommend Julia and her company to anyone who's interested in documenting a special occasion or just capturing some moments in the stunning scenery at the Kahala!

If you have read my reviews, you know that we frequent the islands a couple times per year, have stayed at most of the premiere hotels over the years and that I'm somewhat discerning when it comes to where I choose to stay during my Hawaii visits. In a nutshell, I'm picky and I like five star properties. The Kahala not only delivered on my expectations, but went above and beyond and we will choose to stay at the Kahala whenever we find ourselves on Oahu. I wouldn't say Kahala is five star, but it gets 4.5 in my rating book.We like the shopping and energy of Waikiki, but after staying two nights in the area, I wanted to end our trip with more peaceful surroundings, so fortunately, the Kahala had last minute availability and we spent our last 36 hours at the resort and I'm so glad we did!The reception at check-in was warm, we were given an upgraded room (Amex Platinum Card) and the bellman were very helpful as we settled into our gorgeous room with an amazing ocean view. There was limited hotel availability, so my family of four had to stay in one room and roll away beds were quickly set up. A bit tight and had we stayed longer, we would have reserved a suite or two rooms to be more comfortable. But, I was very impressed with how generous in size the standard rooms are and for one night, it was fine bunking up with the family.This hotel reminds me of the old Kapalua Bay Hotel on Maui which in my opinion, was a hidden gem, classic 60's Hawaiian hotel, but it unfortunately succumbed to condos. The Kahala has a similar vibe. It retains some of that old Hollywood Hawaiian glamour. And, this was accented by a view star sightings we had while on property which is always fun. I hope they do not try to change the core soul of this property. Please don't mistake the old-school nostalgia with dated and tacky...It's not. The Kahala is very well maintained, the ground are gorgeous and the service was nearly on par with what we experience at the Four Seasons properties in Hawaii.One of our gripes with Waikiki is the noise and the crowded beaches...If you want a public beach and are ok with that, Waikiki is a terrific option. All beaches in Hawaii are public, btw, but the beach at the Kahala feels very very private and is edged next to a reef protected lagoon. Not only is the setting gorgeous, but it is very relaxing and feels exclusive. We never struggled to find beach chairs and the beach service is amazingly attentive. Not something you will EVER find in Waikiki. So,we loved this and cooked in the sun a bit longer than we should have.If there is one trite complaint, it is that the pool is smallish for a hotel of this caliber. And, I could see where the hotel might want to add another pool option, but it was not an issue and pool chairs were also plentiful, as was the pool service.We dined every meal at the hotel and I think visited all restaurants except the steakhouse which was not available. Our favorite spot was the Italian restaurant, absolutely delicious! Modestly priced (for Hawaii) and the wine list was amazing (also well priced). The open cafe was terrific for lunch and breakfast and we indulged in the seafood buffet one night which was terrific and in my opinion, well priced for Hawaii.We did not use the fitness room, but did use the steam and jacuzzi amenities...Hmm, I would actually complain a bit about these areas...They were fully functional, but could use some TLC and updating.Due to the gorgeous setting against the ocean, the Kahala is a very popular wedding spot. It seemed like there was a wedding ceremony every ten minutes with wedding attendees circulating throughout the property. This was not an issue for us, but it did add to the hotel congestion and some guests might not enjoy the 24/7 nupitals being exchanged.For us, the Kahala was an escape from the frenetic craziness of Waikiki and delivered on our desire to end our vacation in peaceful surroundings with great food, terrific beach and great service. I believe this trip was the start of a family tradition and we look forward to our next visit. The hotel fits like a glove and we will be back.Many of you might be looking for hotel comparisons and most likely looking to compare Kahala to the new Four Seasons Ko'Olina because of price and rating. We would like to visit the new FS property, but we have not stayed there yet and cannot compare, so take this review with a grain of salt. I can share that if proximity to Waikiki is a goal, Kahala is likely a much better option. However, I don't think the two hotels really should be compared. The FS KO is a newer property located at least 30 minutes from Honolulu. I hear it is adjacent to the Disney resort and shares a lagoon with Disney, so I'd expect the beach is crowded, full of kids and maybe not quite as exclusive feeling as the beach at Kahala? For those considering the Halekulani vs Kahala...One, the Halekulani has a limited, very public beach, but is a gorgeous property in the heart of Waikiki....If you want five star in the middle of the craziness, go Halekulani...If you want to be one step removed, yet retain easy access to Waikiki shopping, my guidance would be Kahala.I hope you find this helpful...Happy Traveling and Aloha.

This resort is not perfect by any means, but it has a sense of place and pride that you just cannot simply put into words. The staff at the Kahala has that sense of pride. From the valet, bell staff, front desk, beach activities and managers all want to make sure you are welcome in this place of refuge. I even witnessed a manager park a car when the valets were backed up. You really feel welcomed and get a sense of pride in this lovely place.The rooms we received facing the Dolphin Lagoon were large and the bathrooms equally as large. There are updates that need to be done, but you know that this is not a new resort, but they have managed to keep her presentable and their respect for this resort shows. The Toto bidet was just fantastic to complete the room amenities.Ate at the breakfast buffet, and that was a good way to start the morning. Good combination of Japanese, Hawaiian and Continental fare. The shuttles to Waikiki and Ala Moana was just fantastic. You are just 15 minutes from all the activities.I would definitely go back to the Kahala. This is truly a special place.

I was slightly intimidated by how nice the property was. Absolutely everything was impeccable and luxurious, and I only brought relaxing clothes for this vacation. The staff made the entire family feel like rock stars though, and were always smiling and had good vibes. I can't say that enough.The property is a little secluded away from the hustle and bustle, which we really enjoyed. It is still close enough to shopping and food though, and we took advantage of that. I wish the parking structure accommodated more vehicles because it was full often times. The valet parking worked well though when it was full.The dolphin lagoon really added something special to the property. It was kind of magical passing by dolphins on our way to and from the beach and pool. It also has a very relaxing artificial waterfall near the lagoon. The beach was amazing-super clean and uncrowded with plenty of area to do whatever you wanted. There's even a reef where you can do some snorkeling. I do wish the pool was larger and deeper, but it certainly did the job and my kids never wanted to leave it. There's food and drinks by the pool-the food was great and the adult mixed drinks had very little alcohol in them.The toilet had a bidet on it, which made for funny first experience with one. I really wouldn't mind having one at home now. The rooms and the views also didn't disappoint. Huge king size bed and very large bathroom, that had a bath tub and shower. Our fridge was not very cold, but the room did come with free coffee via a Keurig.I'd give this resort a 10/10. I tried to mention everything that wasn't perfect in this review, but the resort and staff easily made up for it. If I can get the same deal I'll definitely return to Kahala. Mahalo!

First class in every sense of the word - accommodations, facilities, private beach and pool and excellent service and hospitality. Close to all the great sites on Oahu...be sure to have breakfast at the beachfront Plumeria and drinks and snacks at the seaside grill. Swim with the Dolphins located in the private lagoon on the property. Paddle board and kayak right from the beach. My kids had a blast and didn't want to go home. We will definitely return!Rooms are spacious - we had three kids and still had plenty of space. Get a roll-away bed.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Kahala while attending a wedding on Oahu and cannot say enough about the outstanding service and accommodations. I chose the Kahala to avoid the busy Waikiki area and take advantage of the seclude beach and pool. My stay was exactly what this New Yorker needed to rest and relax in full luxury. Upon arrival, after my 12-hour flight, I was greeted with smiles, a cool towel, a lei and a speedy check in process. Surprisingly I was upgraded to a king room with an ocean view but what impressed me the most was my HUGE bathroom. The room was well appointed with an outstanding AC and circular fan, furnished balcony and a bed to die for. The entire resort was posh luxury at its finest. While staying I ate in the restaurant, drank at the bar, ordered lunch beachside, rented a cabana, ordered room service and even utilized the fitness center for an after check out/ post beach day shower. Waikiki was easily reached via taxi but what a joy it was to be on the calm side of Diamond Head surrounded by rainbows both day and evening. All the staff from the valets to the pool attendants were helpful, fast, and always greeted me with a warm smile. Special thanks to my beach server Jen for tending to my needs so diligently, to the wonderful gentleman who manages the valets and front entrance who so generously accompanied me to the fitness center and to my spectacular housekeeping staff who discovered my little travel mascot (a small token from my boyfriend) and placed it atop my turned down sheets at bedtime.
user_name:
gaill3
New York City, New York

review_body: While visiting the beautiful hotel on vacation we used Pacific Dream photography. This was an amazing experience, being able to capture my family's time at the luxurious resort. The pictures were excellent, as well as our stay there. Highly reccomend.

We stayed here for 3 days and loved, loved this hotel. The staff was wonderful and the location is perfect. The breakfast is a little pricey, but amazing selections and wonderful food. Special shout out to Aaron, who works in the beach and pool area, for being so kind to us and giving us advice about hiking. Would definitely stay here again!!!

I chose The Kahala for 2 nights for the start of my honeymoon in Honolulu and it was by far the best hotel I stayed at on the trip (in terms of service, amenities, and value) and it was not not even the most expensive on our honeymoon. The property was beautiful, the rooms were nicely appointed, and when we got up to our room after an 11-hour flight, we found a full bottle of champagne from concierge, which was very lovely. You could tell they pay a lot of attention to making their guests happy. We booked a standard room with breakfast included in the package, and I thought the breakfast buffet was delicious each morning - we ate on their outdoor patio area overlooking the beach. There is a Dolphin excursion on their property, and there were plenty of fish and sting rays swimming in other pools of water on their property. The service of the staff was also wonderful. All in all, I would stay at the Kahala again in a heartbeat.
user_name:
nycrunner2011
New York City, New York

review_body: We just returned from a trip to Oahu. We spent 3 nights at The Kahala in a dolphin lagoon room. Great choice as we had our 5 year old daughter with us. Our room - 1123 - was on the ground floor and had a nice patio area right on the dolphin lagoon. The dolphin swam right by our patio throughout the day to our daughter's delight. We did check out the view from the tower rooms - and those views are exceptional. If we had been traveling as a couple (no kids) I would have preferred the tower rooms (higher the floor the better). The pool, though small, was really nice. The beach is so calm - perfect for little ones. This is the hotel you visit to totally relax and get away from it all while being a short distance from the action of waikiki. You can take a Lyft or Uber to the Kahala Mall which has a Whole Foods and other shops - about a $5 Lyft fee. There is a free shuttle to Waikiki but we found it more efficient to take a Lyft - about $12. We will return to The Kahala.

The staff service in the rooms, lobby and valet was nothing short of outstanding. I'm not sure what other staff worked on our room, but it seemed like one person was assigned to us (Lino?) and greeted us by name the first morning. Brought plenty of water to us every day. I believe cleaning happens twice daily by default. One feels like royalty staying there, at least what I imagine about royalty.  Valet service was impeccable as well. Anything you need relating to transportation, they will try to accommodate. Excellent restaurants and service staff as well. If I had to find anything to complain about on the trip, it would be the strong winds during our visit (no fault of the hotel), no microwave oven in room, and the salt water pool seemed not particularly clean towards the end of our stay. However, very good by the pool drink bar and grill though, and the beach was really something.  That beach seems to be well isolated from the open ocean by shallow coral and rock formations surrounding the beach (see googlemaps), with the nearest inlet a good distance away on another beach. It seems like but a dream now that we're back in reality. Thank you Kahala management and staff.

We chose this resort solely because of the Dolphin Experience. It was a really amazing place to stay. We wished that we had more time to stay here but our plans had us moving to Maui. The grounds are well taken care of and beautifully landscaped. Our kids loved the little pools filled with turtles, fish and of course the amazing dolphin pools. The beach area was a great place for our kids to enjoy swimming. We were greeted with flower leis upon arrival. Our rooms were upgraded to ocean/dolphin pool view rooms because we booked the dolphin experience. We also received dolphin shaped cookies in our room upon arrival, which of course thrilled our kids. We dined by the pool for lunch one day. The service was not great and the food was so so. We did enjoy the morning breakfast buffet which was amazing and the service there was excellent.We also used the services of the concierge to procure tickets to Pearl Harbor. We had tried to get tickets online at home before we left but all tickets were sold out. We received superior service from the concierge. They were able to get our tickets for the day and times that we needed.We look forward to staying here again in the future.

My husband and I have stayed at the Kahala several times over the last several years. The last times were in December 2015 and January 2016. Each time we are never disappointed with the service, the restaurants, the view, the relaxing nature, and the friendliness of all. I lived in Hawaii for 10 years and miss it greatly. I look forward to each return visit to enjoy all that Hawaii has to offer to include the Aloha spirit which the Kahala is excellent in providing!!
user_name:
njdchilo
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Paradise is the best word to describe this place. Where to start.They treat you like royalty as soon as you arrive.The hotel is in a great area of housing all valued between 1m and 35m or so im told, it feels safe and sophisticated. It's not in Waikiki, it's in a quieter area and that's what appealed to us. They provide shuttle bus pretty frequently to certain areas including Waikiki and a taxi return is about 25dollars including tip so you don't feel isolated. Upon check in we were told that we had been upgraded to a room with a balcony which we were really pleased about as we love spending early evening with a glass of wine on the balcony.We went to the room and straight to the private beach. This was around 2pm and plenty of beds around the pool and on the beach. Standard beach beds are free and extremely comfortable. you can pay extra for bigger cabana beds if you wish. As you would expect the beach is beautiful and private not to busy or noisy just relaxing. The pool is heated and also have a outdoor jacuzzi this isn't a huge area but perfect for the size of the hotel. Upon returning to the room we had been left a bottle of Champagne and two glasses to wish us a happy honeymoon and they followed this up with a call to check we liked the Champaign and to ask if they could do anymore for us, class touch from a classy hotel and something we really appreciated. The room is very spacious, we had the mountain view which can be windy but still a beautiful view with a waterfall just below us.They provide a empty fridge that you can stock which is another classy touch instead of raiding you for evey penny with a mini bar like most hotels. Tea and coffee facilities also provided and replenished every day.The toilet well, it seemed to do more than my computer. I'll let you figure this one, reminded me of the ballagio fountains in Vegas.Maids are excellent and also provide a turn down service leaving chocolates and water in the evenings.We only visited one of the restaurants in the hotel but will review that separately as don't want anything to take away from what is a brilliant hotel.We did use the snack bar which was very good, a shame it wasn't open in the evening as it would have been lovely with the surroundings. Also you know your staying somewhere good when Pierce Brosnon is in the suite next door.They had weddings every day but they did not intrude on your stay and were not loud. In fact it was nice to see.This place just has class written all over it, is the only place we could imagine staying on the island. We are already saving for a return visit. It isn't cheap but is worth every penny and you pay for luxury. Thanks you for the perfect honeymoon.

We stopped in for lunch, this is a beautiful hotel, we were in the Plumeria Beach House dining at the bar. Our server / bar keep was GregWe just had the Ahi Poke and garlic chicken wings with drinks. The food dishes around us looked great as well. After we walked around outside looked at the waterfall and the Dolphins swimming with hotel guest. A lovely place to stop for dining and drinks!

Don't get me wrong. This hotel is very expensive but I wanted to surprise my wife on our honeymoon and we are very pleased with it as I type this. You can swim in the ocean or walk 20 meters and take a dip in the warm pool. Self-parking and valet parking are $32 per day so you might as well just use valet parking everyday. The staff is very friendly and helpful and they must have known we were on our honeymoon since we got chocolate and fruit the next day. The rooms are fully equipped with everything you need (hair dryer, iron, safe, bathtub, shower, robes, towels, two bottles of water, coffee, iPhone charger, etc.) You can also swim with dolphins (extra charge) or just enjoy their own aquarium near the pool and hot tub.

Our stay at the Kahala Hotel was great! The service was great and everyone was very nice. We loved dining at all the restaurants here! Lastly, the Kahala provides a free shuttle to go to Kahala Mall, Ala Moana and T Galleria, which was great because we all loved to shop. We will definitely come back here!P.S. The view from our room was amazing! Highly suggest one of the ocean view lanai rooms.

Two weeks is plenty of time to get to know a place well - good and bad. My wife, 5-month-old daughter and I had the pleasure of staying at the Kahala for 15 nights, and got to see it all. Final verdict: this hotel is amazing, and we feel very fortunate to have stayed at such a place for some much needed relaxation and luxury. Here are some recommendations:1. Room. The scenic view rooms are a fantastic deal, and the 'view' of Waialae Golf Course is perhaps even more special than that of the ocean (which is prominently featured in all the common areas/lobbies). My wife remarked on how the 'smallest' room here was quite huge in comparison to many other hotels; it was more than adequate for our entire stay. It was also quiet and well-insulated for sound, which was critical when trying to keep a baby asleep. I might also add that our room was immaculately maintained by the housekeeping staff who are as friendly as they are detail-oriented. 2. Food. The food in the restaurants is good, but if you're here for awhile and want some variety, nearby Kahala Mall (< 5 minute drive) offers a Whole Foods for groceries and several terrific takeout restaurants (e.g. GRYLT). Don't miss Sunday brunch at Hoku's though. My family (who lives here) said it was the best they've had on the island. 3. Beach. The water at the beach is very warm, thanks to the shallow reef offshore that both protects it from waves (making it very safe for swimming) and warms the ocean water naturally by the time it gets to shore. If you swim out to walk on the reef, be careful not to cut your feet. 4. Photos. Take advantage of the services by Pacific Dream Photography. They do a great job. It is a good way to capture memories of the trip that don't always exclude the camera person. The result can be pricey (the photo session is complementary, and you only pay for the photos you like) but worth it. 5. Parking. The self-parking often got full in the afternoon, and the only option was to valet park (mornings and evenings are more clear). Valet parking staff were very quick and professional. 6. Grounds. The lagoons filled with fish, stingrays and Dolphins offer a great place to spend early mornings for those with jet lag. And the free coffee in the lower lobby from 5:30-8:30 was great company on early morning strolls. As I observed each morning, the hotel staff work diligently to ensure that everything is perfect for hotel guests by the time they wake up (even taking care to rake up extra plumeria flowers that have fallen onto the lawn) and succeed every time. 7. Patrons. The guests at the Kahala were diverse - of all ages and from all over the world - but all very classy. Our friends who were staying in Waikiki remarked at how good looking all the people were at the Kahala. It's quite a crowd to be around. Big thanks to the Kahala team for making our much-needed holiday truly exceptional, and for being so warm. My mom mentioned that she liked that all the staff were such normal, local people that were just behaving naturally (she has lived here for all of her 70 years). We felt very welcome and comfortable here. Staying at your hotel could easily become a decadent habit that we hope to adopt.

The staff were the best, the accommodations were superb, food was delicious, atmosphere is Very Hawaiian luxury. This resort has it all, wildlife, flowers, tropical beauty, the works. The price is high but worth it if you are looking for attention to detail and pampering. We had an ocean view, enjoyed scuba, loved being away from downtown - yet close enough too.

Visited with family for a short work conference. The Kahala is in a lovely location east of Diamond Head and away from the Waikiki madness. The rooms were quite spacious and nicely appointed. Not super fancy, but that was just fine. The staff was consistently friendly and very helpful. I would definitely return to the Kahala (the dolphins are an added bonus).

My family and i first stayed at the Kahala when it was a mandarin oriental and had a wonderful time. It was a different oahu experience away from the busy Waikiki and rely enjoyed the excellent service. We came back this time and was very at things have not changed and they have done an excellent job in keeping this property in the same condition with some improvements. The service and staff is efficient and friendly and the restaurants n bars provide excellent food n drink at good prices for a luxury hotel. They are not cheap but they don't stick it to you just because they can. We had afternoon tea, light dinner and room service, and breakfast buffet and they all were of excellent quality.The beach attendants were very helpful and kept the place very clean. The only down side is the traffic on oahu makes it a bit of a challenge to see the rest of the island. But the resort is so good that you have little desire to leave once you check in.

What a beautiful property! Secluded, but close to everything! Away from the frantic, crowds of Waikiki! Private beach! Beautiful, calm water!Great service, and luxurious accodations! (Softest sheets in the world)Everything you need for a relaxing experience!
user_name:
Tl L
Houston, Texas, United States

review_body: From housekeeping to the pool staff and food and beverage managers....all of them were incredible and made our stay at this Heaven on Earth...just more perfect.Pool staff-Nick Cabebe, Nick Cockette, Lloyd Barclay and Jacob de la TorreFood and Beverage Manager-Joy Garzon...welcoming and warm and accommodating!Joshua Hamm-resturant manager who filled in at pool when they needed helpAlena-Chi fitness centerGillermo-Manager at the Italian Restaurant on the property...incredible!Thank you ALL!

One of the nicest Hotels in Hawaii. The Kahala is about a 15 minute ride from all the hustle in Waikiki. This resort is top Notch,Beyond beautiful. Staff is friendly & courteous ,rooms are spacious & elegant and private beach is divine! For those who like a Full Service Resort this is a must on your list!
user_name:
susangB5279CJ
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed there for almost a week: meeting and relaxing. It's one of a kind place to relax and chill out. They have service going to Waikiki and other places in Hawaii. The Kahala Hotel & Resort offers experiences to help you unwind and relax in the most tranquil of surroundings. Whether you want to explore the island of Oahu, pamper yourself in the sumptuous spa, or take part in aquatic activities, there’s something for everyone to enjoy. Only one downside: "No Clinic" in house i mean.

This hotel is charming and updated, with a great beach, attentive staff, and enough removed from Waikiki to enjoy some peace and quiet when you want to leave the tourists and retailers. Michael in the dining and wait staff was wonderful with our kids and family during breakfasts with our conference. We tend not to visit Oahu but will come back for the Kahala.

From the moment we arrived at the resort I knew we were on vacation. Greeted by friendly valet staff who promptly took our luggage . Then at the check in desk it was the same Aloha spirit. Warm towels and fresh lei's for my husband and I. The room was large , clean and comfortable. Nice large bathroom as well. Views from our balcony were wonderful in the morning as we enjoy our coffee . Quiet room. We had the breakfast buffet every morning and it was awesome. The Dolphins , private beach , music at night and wonderful service!!! We will be returning!!!

Very nice hotel to stay with kids. Great pools, beach front almost private, dolphins are amazing. The Best hideaway from the craziness of Waikiki.Just hate the offer for upgrading to a higher rank room for 300 dollars at the check in counter.

Wonderful hotel that is about 20 miles away from downtown honolulu in a residential area...so away from the crowds.Things to note:1/ friendly and responsive service2/ breakfast was delicious...rare for hotels3/ room was comfortable and spacious4/ the dolphin sanctuary is on the hotel grounds but run by a different group...with that said, it is awesome! you can see the dolphins at all times. the activities were pricey but well worth the experience.5/ they run a shuttle to 3 different locations. one stop is to central waikiki which was a great starting point for the area...runs about every 80 min. another shuttle stop is about 1 mile away (which is also walkable) at a shopping center that has a whole foods and convenience store.6/ pool was small but very warm--the shallow end was 3 feet, great for toddlers7/ the beach was just ok but i think represents this side of oahu8/ the bath products were nice9/....so the one exception is...they need updated bathrooms.
user_name:
manageout1
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for 7 nights and the room is beautiful, comfortable, clean and very roomy. The bed was so comfortable. I have trouble sleeping, but not when i stayed here. The grounds, lagoon, pool area, dolphin area were beautiful and very clean. We had the mountain & golf course view which was goregous. Staff is very friendly and ready to accomodate what ever one might need. Room service is awesome, but a bit pricey. But when you're gone all day and return late at night, room service was nice to have. The bathroom is very spacious have 2 sinks/counters in the bathroom. When we checked in and went to the room, the bed had slippers by the bed, chocolate candy pieces and remote sitting on the bed. This was a nice welcome. The resturants are very pricey in the hotel.House keeping were very frienly and helpful. They made sure you were stocked with whatever you needed. Over all I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We visited the Kahala to experience Dolphin Quest, which is located in the resort! We were given access to the grounds and beach after our dolphin visit and we all were very impressed: gorgeous grounds, white sandy beaches, beautiful lagoons full of fish and sting rays! Then we enjoyed a yummy lunch on the beach! They even brought my granddaughter a birthday dessert after lunch! Fantastic service! Would love to stay here on a future visit!

Having stayed exclusively at several Four Seasons over the past years, I would say my experience at the Kahala met or exceeded the service I received there which I thought was the pinnacle of hospitality. It was far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, and the nice sandy beaches, which were only a walk away, felt at times as secluded as a beach could get on busy Oahu. The Four Seasons on Oahu unfortunately is right next to the crowded Aulani Disney and shares a beach with them and diminished the feeling of seclusion and exclusivity that the Kahala exudes. The onsite Plumeria Lounge offered great ocean views while dining. There were plenty of amenities that also catered to families with children and my girls had a great time swimming with and feeding the Dolphins at the hotel through Dolphin Quest. Definitely the best hotel on the island I've had the opportunity to stay at!

Just got back from a 6 night stay at the Kahala Hotel & Resort. I grew up in the area and so it's like coming home for me. I remember the hotel being built back in 1964 by Hilton. Love the architecture - open and spacious.We had a Dolphin room which also had a view of the breakers. Watching the dolphins every day was so much fun and interesting. The dolphin trainers are very friendly and spend a lot of time answering questions you might have about dolphins. I came away knowing much more about dolphins.The staff at the hotel were all so friendly and helpful. Lino, our housekeeper, was the best. The location of the hotel being in Kahala makes it so nice. It's is quiet and peaceful, especially compared to the craziness of Waikiki. I highly recommend the Kahala Resort for anyone coming to O'ahu.

We spent 5 days at Kahala during our Hawaiian trip. Hotel is really nice and in a good location in Oahu to relax. It is 5min drive from Waikiki beach, with private beach, pool and a lagoon in the middle of the hotel with 4 dolphins. It was nice, but I have to confess that I was kind of disturbed to see those animals trapped in a small lagoon...At the beach area it is possible to rent a SUP, kayak... Only negative point is that they have some cabanas available on the beach, but you have to pay an extra to use it... Didn't understand the reason.Rooms are really comfortable and well decorated. All hotel is very well maintained.Breakfast is very good, with a plenty of options and a breathtaking view.Hotel has many options of restaurants and we tried Arancino, which was really good!In the end, hotel it is a nice choice in Oahu.

Everything was terrific. The staff catered to every need we had--even helping us fill a cooler with ice (for a chartered fishing trip) and delivering it to our car at 5 am!!! (Thank you James). The hotel was so clean. The restaurants were terrific. Breakfast (waffles with coconut syrup) was AMAZING!!! The private beach was a great, safe place to swim and play! The scenery was amazing! The waterfall, the dolphin lagoon, the sting ray pond...the list goes on and on! The resort was about 5-13 minutes away from everything we wanted to see/do (Waikiki, Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay snorkeling, Ala Moana shopping). We loved the resort because it was so close to everything, however, it was secluded enough to let us slow down and relax. Thank you Kahala Hotel & Resort!!! We highly recommend you!

We usually stay at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua in Maui when we go to Hawaii, but for our babymoon, we decided to go to a different island. We chose Oahu due to the abundant dining options. At the same time, we did not want to be in a super touristy area so we chose the Kahala Resort & Hotel and we were so glad we did!The resort is secluded in a posh suburban neighborhood and away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The resort is located 10 minutes from Waikiki which makes it very convenient. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle, but we used Uber to get around since RT cost was under $25. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a lei and since our room was not yet ready, we changed in the hospitality room and hit the beach right away - very accommodating. We upgraded our room to an ocean front view and it was definitely worth it. We spent a lot of our time on the lanai enjoying the view from our room. You can tell the property is older, but overall, the property is 4.5 stars. Rooms were spacious as were the bathrooms. Maid service was on point.Food options on property were great as well. Great quality and reasonable cost. Haku is a must dine experience - amazing food and unbeatable views. Daily breakfast buffet was great. Loved the afternoon tea at the Veranda. I did wish there were more asian/hawaiian options available on property though.Service is spectacular. Every staff member we interacted with was pleasant and accommodating. Overall, great experience!

My wife and I enjoyed a little weekend getaway. The staff was over the top great. Our room was beautiful( we did not have ocean view) but no need. You feel like you are not on Oahu. Only 10 mins from town. We enjoyed room service and there restaurant, the pool and beach. Highly recommend this hotel if you want service, and not to be in town. Mahalo Kahala Hotel for taking such care of us!!

This hotel was amazing! The staff were so helpful, even though I'm sure we had a very discounted rate from our travel agent. They were very accommodating at the desk and in the room. The bell hops even insisted on giving me an extra water bottle when I went out to hike Diamondhead (and I needed it!). Everyone was amazing, and it was especially convenient for me to have the Dolphin Quest lagoon there since I was going to do a dolphin swim. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The bathrooms were amazing and spacious. But most of all, the staff made this experience wonderful. Great location away from the city and right on the beach. Highly recommended!
