Very nice hotel. Great non crowded beach. Large rooms. We booked a room for 4 people but they put me in a king bed and then tried to charge me for two roll always. They did take the charge off. Just remember if you are booking for more than 2 people in a room they don't guarantee a second bed. I probably wouldn't have booked there if I had known that. The room was still plenty big with two roll a way beds and the King. The food at the resort is crazy expensive. Like 60 dollars per adult expensive. Stop on your way and get food especially if you have small children.

We've just stayed at Kahala Hotel for a fabulous 11 nights - a truly relaxing holiday. We choose Kahala because of the size of the rooms - a massive 51sqm. My husband has a very bad back and I was having medical treatment in Hawaii so we knew we might spend longer than average in our hotel room. It was important to have more space than you get in many Waikiki hotel rooms. We were in a Scenic View Lanai room on the 9th floor with a great view of the golf course and mountain. From the balcony we could look to our right and see the water.Service was great. The rooms were serviced twice a day and were spotless. The hotel has some nice food options - however you could end up spending a bit on meals here because you're not in easy distance of other (cheaper) dining options. We used the free shuttle to go to Kahala Mall (Wholefoods) to buy some breakfast supplies, snacks & paper plates (plus some free plastic cutlery) on our first day and it probably saved us $300 or more. There is a minibar size in the room that is empty - so plenty of space for your own supplies. Kahala Hotel also provides a shuttle to Waikiki several times a day. It's a set timetable with set drop off/collection points at Ala Moana and T Galleria (near the Royal Hawaiian) - I don't think I'd figured that out from my research before we got there. A cab ride back to the hotel from Waikiki is about $25.The swimming pool is very kid friendly and heated (which was weird), at it's deepest it was just over 4' deep. The beach is nice, but again it's very shallow for a long way out, like Waikiki. I thought Waikiki beach was nicer, to be honest, but Kahala is so much quieter. It was easy for us to find a couple of free beach loungers anytime we wandered down.I went to the hotel spa once and had a fabulous massage (thank you Raina!), but it is really expensive - undoubtedly the most expensive massage I have ever had.I was also pretty impressed with the gym. There was a good range of equipment and machines for a hotel.They even supply headsets, oranges and towels! There is a jacuzzi, steam room and sauna next to the gym but they are attached to the male and female changerooms. The hotels has daily displays of the dolphins doing tricks and it didn't get tired. At any time of day you can see them swimming around in the lagoon.So even though this was not a cheap resort and the pool/dolphins etc are more kid friendly than a typical couples-style holiday, the size and cleanliness of the room and the welcome we received from the Kahala staff left us with a strong warm impression - we would definitely return to this hotel.

Stayed here for a business award trip with my husband. This is an older hotel that is impeccably maintained with beautiful grounds including the dolphin lagoon. Pool area is very simple and could be updated but the beach area is wonderful. Our ocean view room did overlook the arrival area and over the parking area but was still very nice. The room was very large and nicely appointed with a huge bathroom with separate shower and tub. Lots of closet space. Housekeeping staff did a great job and we enjoyed the flower and chocolates each night with a turndown. On arrival we were greeted with a lei and refreshing towels. We took a yoga class overlooking the beach which was well done. Breakfast in the Plumeria was delicious each morning and had outdoor seating to enjoy the view. Shuttle transportation available. Paddle boards available to rent. Awards evening in banquet hall was lovely and would be nice for a wedding although ceiling height in that area was lower. A wonderful stay.

This resort is extra special in all ways. From the service, beautiful rooms, pool, dolphin lagoon, to the beautiful (practically)private beach. We are a single couple who typically enjoy adult only resorts but this is upscale all the way. We ate at all restaurants at the resort, visiting Arancino three times!! We did take the shuttle into Waikiki a couple times and took Uber home. It is so quiet away from all the crowds of Waikiki. You have the best of both worlds. On one of our last days, we took the offer to sit for a free photo shoot. Although I had to twist my hubbies arm a little, we are so glad we did it! These ladies were amazing and work their tails off, getting all the beautiful property in all our shots. We did buy a package, but now our Christmas cards are done!!! I would suggest doing this for sure! Over all we loved everything about The Kahala, and can't wait to go back!

Ok first off the staff does an amazing job from check in to servers to housekeeping..The problems areAccommodations: The rooms are in need of some serious renovations we stayed in a dolphin lagoon room and it had the smallest shower i have ever seen (think cruise ship size ) They need to do something about the carpet in the rooms like clean them or better yet bring back the wood floors and they need some new mattresses & a screen on the sliding glass door would be great to keep the lizards out . The watercloset (toilet) is super small there is not even a trash can in there however they have put in those toilet seats that warm up ( im pretty sure thats where all the hot water is routed too ) its motion activated and i swear its more accurate the the motion detectors on some alarms..Food & Beverageok so the food is outrageously overpriced even for hawaii standards.. The alcoholic beverages you cant even taste the alcohol in them for 16.00 at least let me taste the booze also there is no Happy Hour at this hotel which i found very odd..plus they dont let the servers try the food so they really cant recommend a whole lot!! Plumeria RestaurantTHE WORSE COFFEE I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE ..THEY DO NOT EVEN SERVE KONA COFFEE ITS SOME HORRIBLE BLEND..There 7.00 expresso was a joke as well.This is where the breakfast buffet is served and lunch & dinner ..Please be aware this is the least expensive restaurant on the property and it is closed 2 nights a week !! i have never stayed anywhere that they shut down a restaurant like that ..Service was great until it got busy and there just wasn't enough servers.The verandaThe servers were great the food was so-so the drinks i sent mine back and asked if they could put more alcohol into it.. When we asked the servers a question about something on the menu they couldnt tell us how it was because they are not allowed to try the food ..occasional they will let them try something on the menu but if youre not working that day youre out of luck.. Thats just crazyHokuThis is the hotels high end dining experience didn't even bother to try. Im really not into paying 160.00 for a ribeye steak plus you would think since its named after one of there dolphins they would at least give part of the bill (like 10% ) to the dolphinsArancinoThe Italian restaurant was great ..the food the service the drinks and they served illy coffee ..Came to find out it isnt part of the hotel its concessioned out and that explained everythingsea side grillThis is the pool restaurant and bar ..nothing special there was a good burger there and the edamame they have with the chilis (not on the menu )is the best..also this closes at 5pm so if you wnt to get a drink and watch the sunset you need to go upstairs wait 20 minutes to get youre cocktail then go back down ...Room ServiceNever did it im not okay with paying over 10.00 for a delivery fee and 18% tip on top off a 20.00 burger  the poolThe smallest HEATED pool i have ever seen in my life ...The Beach is much better and the towel guys are great they get you all set up so there really isnt any saving of lounge chairs like at some resorts which i loved..Dolphin QuestThis was an amazing experience very educational and you can tell the dolphins are loved by there trainers however i would have liked to see them in a bigger lagoon or less dolphins sharing that space .we did the private session and it was worth it ask for courtney she is great .you do not need to be a guest to do this and dolphin quest is not associated with the hotel its a separate entityAll in all this property is secluded about 15 minutes from waikiki (20 or 25 dollar cab ride) will i stay here again no ill stay in the craziness that is waikiki for the great food options, people watching and mixed drinks that i can feel..

This was a beautiful hotel that made us fee like royalty. Great pool (although small, but heated) and great access to one of the prettiest beaches! If back in Honolulu, I don't think we would stay anywhere else. The service was outstanding.

I suppose the views and beach help this rating some, but the amenities and staff are first class and most epic. Came here for years with my P's and now we have started our own memory lane at the Kahala. The lobby is awesome. Listen to the stained glass chandeliers tinkling in the tradewinds from a big comfy chair and people watch. Your experience starts there. Don't miss the breakfast buffet at Plumeria--yummy on the beach. (Don't forget the waffles with coconut syrup or macadamia nut pancakes ;) Lunch by the pool or be served on the beach. After surfing the north shore, we come back to our suite and enjoy our afternoon pupus on the lanai. Then its off to Hoku's--one of the best restaurants in the islands. Ask for the fish aoili for your home-made bread (it's a secret now--but they will get it for you and its awesome amazing). Sunday brunch at Hoku's anyone? Best of all, you are on the other side of Diamond Head, so it's quiet. The Kahala is nestled between the Pacific and the Waialea Country Club at the end of Kahala Avenue. If you want hip happening night life, go downtown. Stay on Waikiki. But if you want a real vacation--away from it all--this is your spot. They know service and they know how to do it right.

The Kahala was a pleasure to stay at. The service and people are top notch all over the resort. If you are looking for a polished resort where they call you by name and want a seamless experience, then the Kahala is a great option. As with all top resorts, it is expensive, but the value is there.

Wonderful stay! Carlos went above and beyond with his customer service skills. He made us feel so welcomed and pampered.Thank you for the champagne Carlos and Carmine. The live music was very nice to listen and dance to in the evenings. We will be looking forward to staying soon. Aloha.

Recommend this hotel for your stay in Honolulu. It is in a quiet neighborhood, away from the hustle/bustle of the madhouse of Waikiki. Pleased with the service & location/ property. One disadvantage is that you are limited to their dining choices. We were happy to find some reasonably priced tours from the concierge. Transportation, like everything in HI is very expensive...it's a good way to see the island.

Hawaii is Amazing & Gorgeous! However, I strongly believe the Kahala was a great factor in making Hawaii so incredible! This is a hotel that should not be missed, as it really makes your trip to Hawaii incredibly special & magical. The Kahala, has the most accommodating staff, each & every restaurant & lounge was fantastic. What an outstanding property that is so well manicured in each & every way! It's very private and a great place to relax. We are Looking Forward to many upcoming stays at the Kahala.
user_name:
Bangkokbabay
New York City, New York

review_body: We went to Oahu to both elope and to enjoy our week long honeymoon at The Kahala. This place is five stars on all fronts. I have stayed at a lot of nice hotels and resorts and The Kahala tops them all. You are greeted by name during your entire stay, shown genuine hospitality, and treated like you're the only guest at the property. We were fortunate enough to have a Jeep during our stay, so we explored the entire island, in closing Waikiki. Every time we ventured to another hotel for a meal or drinks, we were so thankful to have chosen to stay at The Kahala. We had a beautiful room that overlooked the golf course and had ocean views...stunning. You basically get to enjoy a private beach, even though all beaches in Hawaii are public. The food was almost all top notch. We had a breakfast buffet included and let me tell you, it is some of the best food we had our entire trip. We also had lunch and dinner at Plumeria and pool side, both great. We did eat at Hoku's which is their fine dining restaurant, and it was just ok. Some of the most fun was sitting in the lobby area at night and listening to the live music and eating heavy appetizers and having drinks. The staff is what makes this resort stand out. You meet employees that have worked here for decades and you can tell that they love what they do. There are nice touches throughout the hotel...coffee each morning, flavored water poolside, etc... If you leave for the day, the valet always offers towels and water to go. We considered Trump, Halekulani, and Turtle Bay. Turtle Bay is in a neat area (north shore), but was dirty and looked like a Holiday Inn. Trump is not on the beach, and Halekulani was nice for drinks but too crowded. You can get to Waikiki in 15 minutes from Kahala and believe me, you'll be glad that you can escape to Kahala.

The Kahala truly sets the benchmark for all others to follow with regards to service. Many hotel chains such as Four Seasons talk about their service, but The Kahala actually delivers! In my opinion "Actions speak louder than words" and that was the case here.  Starting from our initial contact with the reservations department and continuing through out the stay, the staff provided unmatched warm personalized service that I have never experienced in a hotel.  Understated elegance is a term I would use to describe my dining experiences at the hotel. Starting with roomservice which was very prompt in providing a much needed late lunch of sashimi and a clubhouse sandwhich to a mouth watering breakfast buffet in the Plumeria room we enjoyed all of our dining experiences here. If you desire a relaxed unhurried vacation experience in the Hawaiian Islands you should stay here!

We have stayed at this resort twice over the past few years. The service and location are outstanding. You can't go wrong staying here. The only challenges we encountered on our recent trip was lack of pool attendant service, way too many insects to enjoy the beach, and our bed pillows needed exchanging. In fairness to the resort, the response to our complaint regarding the pillows was addressed immediately, and we did not complain about the pool attendants nor the beach insect issues. The attentiveness of the staff at the front desk, in housekeeping, plumeria restaurant, parking attendants, and bell staff by far out weighed any minor issues we encountered. Also the common areas and grounds are beautiful. The Dolphins and their trainers on site are amazing. The entertainment at night is great. Your choice of restaurants are top notch. Stay here now and you will thank me later :)

They didn't miss even the smallest of detail. Absolutely stunning views. The meals were amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly and so helpful. Our room was huge and every single day we came back to our room there was a tray of delicious treats waiting for us (I am now in love with apple bananas). It was a paradise within paradise.

We've been to Maui and Kauai several times, and love those islands. This was our first trip to Oahu, and I did quite a bit of research before deciding on the Kahala. I was curious to see Waikiki, but I didn't think I wanted to be right in the hustle and bustle. I'm not a city person (although I live in LA), and when I go to Hawaii it's not because I want to be around fancy shopping, high rises and crowds. So I chose the Kahala to be in a quieter area, and I'm so glad I did. It's a beautiful resort with excellent service, and an understated elegance.The day we went to Waikiki we visited the Moana Surfrider, Royal Hawaiian, Halekulani, and Sheraton. I was so glad not to be staying at any of those hotels. If you're not into noise and crowds, and a Vegas-like atmosphere, definitely check out the Kahala.One day we drove up to the North Shore, which I loved, but the Turtle Bay Resort was a disappointment to me. I was surprised that it lacked elegance. Seeing it made me very glad again that we had chosen the Kahala.Before we arrived, I read on TA that the ocean view rooms looked out over the parking structure, so I requested a high-level floor. They accommodated that request, and also let us take a look at the ocean front rooms, which are on the other side of the property, away from the parking structure. There was a significant increase in price for the ocean front side, so we decided to stay with the ocean view lanai room. We were on the 9th floor, which definitely helped provide a nicer view, but the driveway and parking structure was definitely in sight. I still loved the lanai and the view, though. I've attached pictures to show what it looks like.

The Kahala is a beautiful resort that exceeded our expectations. We stayed here for a wedding and found that all staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. On my friend's wedding day, the front desk were especially helpful and went above and beyond (especially Carolyn!). The resort is absolutely beautiful and relaxing and we would recommend to anyone.

From the time we arrived all the way through to checkout we received impeccable service and were nothing less than delighted with everything the Kahala had to offer. We booked two rooms, both scenic lanai and both were in the Diamond Head Tower. One was on the second floor and the other, the ninth. Both had simply stunning golf course and mountain views, especially when looking east to see the early morning sunrise. The rooms were spacious and luxurious with comfortable beds, more than ample closet space and huge bathrooms. Room service twice daily along with turn down service in the evenings. Bedside slippers along with complimentary bottles of water and dark chocolate square was a nice touch. Resort amenities were simply outstanding. The pool area was not overcrowded during our stay and we never had to wait for a chaise lounge either there or on their private beach. We rented a full size cabana tent two of the days and loved it. The Dolphins on property were a special treat and two of our group participated in the Dolphin Quest program there. It was simply fantastic. The staff there cares deeply for these beautiful animals and it shows. They also house live sea turtles there but there were none during our stay... they were recently released into the sea after growing to the appropriate size on site. They will be replaced soon... We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet at the Plumeria Beach House every morning. The buffet selection was enormous and of very high quality. Those thin pancakes are to die for... Randy tended our table most days and he was exceptional. He gave us a lot of local information and we got to know him quite well during our stay. Other staff members that were VERY helpful during our stay and deserve special mention include Cameron and Leimomi at the concierge desk, Betel who greeted us upon arrival and gave us an introduction to the Kahala and the entire valet team in front who had our car waiting for us each and every time when requested. Mahalo to the entire team at the Kahala... you do it right and made our stay with you one we will remember for many years to come. We can't wait to visit with you again!

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Kahala for a few nights, and it was our first time in Hawaii. Everything was even better than we could have imagined. It is like a dream, staying at this resort. I asked her to be my wife while staying at the Kahala, and she said yes! Maybe we will come back for our wedding. What an amazing place where dreams come true.
user_name:
Jay J
Toms River, New Jersey

review_body: We had the pleasure of a recent stay here at the Kahala Resort, and it is the ONLY resort I would recommend in Honolulu.. It is nestled at the end of a peaceful residential road, that opens up to paradise... The reception desk staff are EXCEPTIONAL... Very friendly and professional, looking to meet your needs.. The concierge desk is unsurpassed... Our very spacious room, had a beautiful mountain and golf course view... VERY quiet and serene.. Our bed extremely comfortable with Frette bed linens, soft and luxurious...The bathroom was HUGE, double closets, separate vanities, and a spacious walk shower, along with a soaking tub.. Twice daily housekeeping service made it a pleasure to come back to after a night out.. We enjoyed the private ample beach with plenty of chairs to accommodate guests, the water was sublime and refreshing.. The pool was large with a poolside bar.. Breakfast at The Plumeria restaurant, on site, served an ample buffet or ala carte.. The corned beef hash was delicious... The only drawback was the live music offered for having an evening cocktail... We were hoping for some local Hawaiian or jazz, and didn't get that...Overall in relation to the rest our stay, EXCELLENT RESORT and SEVICE

We stayed at the Resort about five years ago in a "Scenic View" room, the lowest price category. The room was large and the view was pleasant, overlooking the golf course looking toward the mountains. This time, traveling with our college student daughter and my mother, we booked a Scenic View room AND a dolphin lagoon room. My mother and daughter gor a room on the second floor of the dolphin lagoon wing with killer views of both the dolphin habitat AND the ocean beyond. The Resort kindly gave us a room only a few doors down the hall; it was apparently still in the Scenic View category but we had a beautiful golf course view and, stepping out onto our micro-balcony (not really a lanai but just big enough to stand outside), you could make out an ocean view in the distance. See the photos below to get a sense of the views we had in each room.Both rooms were quite large and very comfortable, with extra chairs, a desk, separate tub and shower, dual sinks, dual closets, fridge and coffee maker. The dolphin lagoon room proved to be a huge hit with both my daughter and mother. They spent hours sitting on the large lanai and watching the dolphins. They could see the dolphins, trainers and guests sometimes participating in one of the "dolphin encounters." But they also just watched the dolphins swim lazily around, be fed and groomed, etc. Literally, hours of amusement.The staff was amazing as always. Every one of them had a cheerful and helpful attitude. We pre-purchased full breakfasts at Plumeria every morning, as this was a highlight of our last stay at the Resort. I consider the breakfast buffet there to be one of the best such buffets I've ever eaten at, with full American-style and Japanese-style offerings, including omelette station, wonderful tropical fruit selections, island specialties such as macadamia nut pancakes, Okinawan taro/tapioca soup, etc. And virtually every table has the most beautiful and relaxing ocean view.The Kahala is definitely pricey but get on their email list for the regular specials they offer. If you are able to plan ahead, they offer packages with percentage-off discounts and breakfast included. We also took advantage of the senior discount since my mother was one of the guests this time.Final bonus tip: when we checked in, we were handed a card that mentioned a professional photography company called Pacific Dream was offering a beach portrait session with no sitting fee. Even though we were not prepared for formal portraits (our outfits did not match color-wise), we went ahead and scheduled an appointment for the next day at sunset. Our photographer Julia was such a delight to work with, really putting all of us at ease. She took us to a few different spots within an easy walk from the main building and patiently shot a couple hundred images in every combination of the four of us. She even snuck in some videos and candid shots without our awareness. The next morning, we had our viewing appointment. No hard sell at all, but after seeing the absolutely gorgeous images she captured of us, we ended up buying a package. We will treasure these photos as a wonderful keepsake of our Hawaiian vacation. We can't say enough good things about Pacific Dream and Julia. You should really take advantage of the free session offered and consider packing some color-coordinated outfits. But even if you were not expecting to sit for formal portraits, the stunning ocean and tropical backdrops, together with professional photography, can make anyone look good.

Luxurious opulence, private stunning beach, unparalleled customer service, exemplary food. The rooms are spacious and we loved saying hello to the Dolphins every morning. Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff. This is our third visit to this hotel and we will be back again next year.

Returning after 2 years one thing that hasn't change is the exceptional service and greeting at check in.You really are made to feel welcome including the children.The resort is very expensive especially for the suites, however the quality is exceptional.There are many many positives about The Kahala including the location as you feel you could be anywhere with the convenience of being only 15 mins out of Waikiki. Two years ago what we found disappointing was the buffet breakfast ie the lack of options and variety, and two years on it's just as disappointing but we were smart enough this time to not bother adding it.Having been lucky enough to have warm beautiful weather for our 5 days it was odd to find the pool is heated and pumping hot water in al day, so it is like getting in a warm bath and far from refreshing.The service through out the resort is exceptional other than the pool area. We would be asked if we wanted a menu to order food or drinks, then most times no one would come back and after 30 mins we'd simply go to the pool bar and place our order, which was a little disappointing.It's also a shame 5 star resorts still allow people to come to the pool at 8am, place towels on half the chairs and then turn back up around 11am.The rooms and immaculate and the cleaning team are wonderful.The views from the ocean view suite are amazing as you would expect however we were towards the end of the building above the entrance to the hotel so constantly and into the evening you hear the loud beeping of the shuttle/bus reversing into it's parking spot which was annoying.The Plumeria restaurant does a "wonder of the 7 seas" buffet on Friday and Saturday nights, as advertised in their lifts and online it's called the "the best of Kahala buffet. I was somewhat disappointing and certainly not worth the money. As I said there are many positives and it's a great places for families, however it's a shame The Kahala isn't as good as the price tag demands it to be.I think in 2017 we'll go elsewhere.

Wonderful staff that was cheerful and well-trained. The Italian restaurant Arancino is amazing--unique and creative approach from drinks through appetizers, entrees, and desserts. One of the best hotel restaurants we have ever enjoyed. Breakfast buffet made everyone in the family happy. Luxurious rooms. Short drive to Waikiki.

If you are looking for a quiet oasis far from the crowds of Waikiki, this top flight hotel is for you! From the lei greeting to the chocolates and turn down service, the staff say this world renowned hotel know how to make you feel extra special. Worth every penny!

We chose The Kahala because we knew we didn't want a crowded noisy Waikiki hotel. This was our first time to Oahu and first time to The Kahala. We stayed 7 nights. The beach is amazing, beautiful, calm, clear, and super easy to swim in. The hotel grounds are well kept and have a relaxed feel, not pretentious. We had a Dolphin Lagoon room on upper level, room 1231. Fun to watch the dolphins up close but best of all a small flight of stairs down to the beach (no elevator to deal with and lobby to walk thru). We had breakfast buffet every morning and the food good with excellent service. For eating outside the hotel The Kahala Mall is very close with good options. We would stay again.

In 2005, I had the pleasure of staying the Kahala Hotel when it was a Mandarin Oriental hotel chain for my first trip to the Hawaiian Islands and I had been dying to get back there since. I have visited Hawaii (Big Island, Maui, Kauai, Oahu) annually since my first trip, so easily 9 times and I finally got back to the Kahala last April (I know this review is late). I have stayed at many great hotels in Hawaii (many I have reviewed) and several on Oahu, the Kahala just beats them all. As I mentioned, I first stayed here in 2005 and when we checked in, they still had my profile on record which surprised me. Because of this, we were upgraded to a partial-ocean view room on the 9th floor when we booked a mountain view room. We were given fresh leis, juice and my daughter a nice stuffed turtle animal with the Kahala Hotel insignia. We were booked for 4 nights, and after spending 4 nights prior at the Andaz Maui which was nice but the decor was in stark contrast to the Kahala. While nice, Andaz Maui is very modern and there is something to be said for a large 500+ square foot room with plush carpet and a deep soaking tub. In general, even though the Kahala is an older hotel, it was just more comfortable for us as a family.The only negative aspect of the hotel is the pool. After staying at the Andaz with their multi-level of pools, the Kahala needs to redo the pool area. While many love the Dolphins, it is also a point of contention for animal rights activist. My daughter loved them, but if they got rid of the dolphins, the pool area could be expanded. Although not a deal breaker by any means, it's just not a relaxing area as all the guest from kids to adults are forced to use this little pool area. At the very least, the beach is close and it's perfect for kids.The Kahala is the perfect hotel on Oahu - it's close to Waikiki but far enough from all the hustle and bustle. And you might see a celeb or two!

Fantastic hotel, excellent service, wonderful staff. The hotel is away from the madness of Waikiki on its own sandy beach with rolling surf and swaying palms. Food standard is excellent, not a cheap place to eat though, you get what you pay for.Loved it and would re ecommend it as a fantasy holiday destination.

I have mixed feelings for The Kahala.... we spent five nights there last July to unwind after an amazing but exhausting road trip around California, Arizona & Nevada and wanted a luxurious hotel to chill in before our return to the UK.Upon arrival, our room wasn't as expected, so the hotel kindly moved us to a much better one which became available from our second night. We had an issue with the beds in our family room and despite many assurances from reception, this was finally resolved on the third night when I complained to the hotel manager which resulted in him physically bringing another bed to our room himself! Not really the service you'd expect from a 5* hotel.Most of the staff were friendly and attentive although as highlighted above, not always terribly efficient. The hotel itself is well known for its impressive past guests, including monarchy, presidents and A List celebrities which I found a little surprising - it just didn't seem plush enough.The restaurants were nice but expensive and breakfast in the Plumeria was lovely - the only disappointment was the awful bar area in the hotel. Staying in Hawaii, we expected to be sitting outside listening to the ocean as we had a last drink before bed, but the only bar open after dinner was a massive brightly lit room with high ceilings and a few large tables and uncomfortable chairs dotted around - we couldn't believe there was nowhere cosy or romantic to go to after dinner.Our daughter loved the dolphin experience and the secluded and private beach was simply beautiful. I definitely wouldn't go back to the Kahala, it was very expensive and didn't quite live up to our expectations but we did have a nice stay.
user_name:
Jane H
West Sussex, United Kingdom

review_body: Felt pampered and relaxed. Loved the four star treatment. Had a fabulous room over the Dolphin Lagoon. Spent hours sitting on our private balcony watching the trainers and guests playing with the dolphins. Enjoyed our buffet breakfast every morning and the 'almost' private beach. Perfect location away from the hustle of Wikiki but yet very close to everything. Excellent staff, especially Charlie Bingo, the best bell hop ever. Be sure to ask for him when you are there visiting. And Gene at the bar makes one of the best Long Island Ice Teas and Pina Coladas. Great memories from our week long stay. Only down side is that this kind of service doesn't come cheap. We spent a pretty penny, but since I don't travel often, I really felt it was worth it. Highly recommend.

The hotel is in a unique location. Close enough to visit but a world away from Waikiki. We loved it, met some great people, and had a blast. The bathrooms are 5star for sure. They are HUGE, the hotel has everything you need, so you don't have to go anywhere else. If you do, then don't rent a car on site. The car service is a generous 3 stars. But Uber Black worked well for us. I'd definately stay there again. And if you do, make sure you dine at Michel's on night. The hotel restaurant was good but pricey. Also make sure you rent the outrigger canoe adventure to the turtle viewing area that was AWESOME!!! Good luck and have fun!

We wanted to stay away from downtown Honolulu and this was the perfect place for us for a romantic getaway. We had an oceanfront suite which was gorgeous and the hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The food was also very good. The hotel has a wall of fame with photos of celebrities who have either stayed at or visited the hotel. Ranging from actors to singers to heads of state. The resort is in the exclusive area of Kahala and they also have a dolphin lagoon for swimming with the dolphins. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a more remote, quiet destination.

We used to dine at this resort when we lived in Hawaii, but we never stayed overnight. in a guest room. This was our first time staying at the hotel and we were concerned about customer service since it is no longer associated with Mandarin Oriental. In general, the location is wonderful, i.e. quiet, away from Waikiki, with a great beach and close to shopping, dining, etc. The ocean side and mountain side views are both very nice. We had a room on the 8th floor with a beautiful ocean view. The pool is small, but nice and did not seem crowded. You can tell that the property needs some touching-up with missing tiles in the pool, an underwater light fixture hanging out of its fixture, worn hallway carpeting, etc., but that is pretty nit-picky. On the positive side, the rooms are nice and quiet and the beds are very comfy. The customer service overall was adequate, not overly friendly or attentive compared to other hotels we stayed at in the same category. The pool menu is very limited, especially for children, but the food itself is good. The main reason we stayed at this hotel was the Dolphin Quest program for our daughter, which was fantastic. The nice thing about the hotel is that it is close to the Kahala Mall, which has plenty of shopping and dining options, so you don't have to eat at the hotel if you don't want to. We had a weird incident with in-room dining. We ordered our daughter the Keiki (kids) portion of pancakes. The food arrived and an adult order of pancakes was delivered. When we pointed this out to the delivery person, they had to actually remove 2 of the 4 pancakes so that they could physically prove to the chef that we only consumed 2 pancakes!!! We were surprised that they didn't just say, our mistake, go ahead and keep the full order. We mentioned this to management, but never heard back.

The Kahala Resort Hotel was on our bucket list, knowing how expensive it is we unfortunately can't return year after year. We chose this hotel to celebrate our 12 yr. anniversary. We've been dining inside the hotel at The Plumeria Beach House for years before and during our marriage. We love the food, ambiance and professional staff. We were nothing less than impressed by the hotel staff as well. Loved every minute of our short 2 night stay-cation. We felt like movie stars, pampered in every way! Mahalo nui loa!

What's great about this hotel is that it feels secluded. Away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, you really feel like you are away on an island. It doesn't have the city feel although the have shuttle buses to take you out the Waikiki area to do your touristy shopping and crowded dining. I hate to admit, it'seems a major draw to be in the area of excitement. Kahala Hotel has Dolphin Quest which in my humble opinion is one of the must do'so in amyone's lifetime. The beaches here at the hotel is really picturesque and not crowded at all, giving you much personal privacy. The pool and jacuzzi area is just ok, seems a bit dated but still very nice and inviting. Hoku's is their fancy smancy dinner restaurant which also has a fabulous Sunday brunch buffet. The Plumeria cafe is the place to be for your casu as long meals and their bartenders really aim to please their guests with outstanding cocktails! Overall a great hotel to get away from the crowds. You decide whether you want tranquility or the excitement, if you know what I mean:-) Happy wife happy life so let the wise one choose and you'll be renewing your vows again.

Stayed at the Kahala for a few nights before a cruise around the Hawaiian Islands. There is just to much to praise about this place. Our oversized room, with a very nice balcony, was ocean front overlooking the little island and peninsula where we were married 10 years earlier.The bath room was wonderful with excellent water pressure and instant hot water. Great shower and separate soaking tub.The towels were super sized and very luxurious.We ate breakfast every morning at Plumeria, overlooking the beach. Wonderful buffet with made to order everything and a choice what of seemed like over a hundred other entertaining dishes, wonderful pastries, choice of cheeses, spectacular local and exotic fruits and juices. Dinner on Friday was the Seafood Buffet in Plumeria House. So much high quality food can't even mention it all. Just perfect!!! We did have drinks and sandwiches at the Seaside Grill next to the pool and dolphin lagoon. Bartenders were classic Hawaiian making fantastic drinks. One was even made inside a whole pineapple, which we watched them cut, core and fill with their delicious concoction. The food there was excellent as well. Every place we ate was some of the best food ever. (We did not eat at Hoku's but will next time.)The Atlantic Bottlenose Dolphin shows were excellent. The staff is highly trained and knew their dolphins. It was magical! The adults loved it as much as the kids. And , of course, you could swim with the dolphins. There is an excellent golf course and you can walk around there and the grounds and beach until your Misfit says you have reached your 10,000 steps goal.There are many specials you can take advantage of with your room: A dolphin experience room, breakfast included with room, a senior rate, an early reservation discount and a resort credit rate. Check with the hotel to see which may be best for you. The Kahala is one of the Leading Hotels. A five star resort.

So wanted to celebrate a friends birthday and was looking up best Sunday brunches in Honolulu. This was definitely a good find. The crowd was well dressed- they will snuff and huff at you for wearing crocs. The food and service is unparalleled. The servers were very attentive to everything we needed.

My wife and 6 year old boy recently stayed only 1 night to Celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary. And it was definitely a treat. We had a couple 60 minutes Swedish massage and it was amazing. Olivia my therapist was excellent in finding the right pressure points. Really relaxing experience. Wilson at the Front Desk was seamless during the check-in process and really friendly. We had a wonderful Ocean view room overlooking the Dolphin lagoon and the pool. Can't beat the view. We then headed for dinner to Hoku's restaurant my wife and I for dinner and the food was excellent and we really enjoyed the balance on every dish that was accompanied with the right vegetables. All the ingredients were fresh and not overdone yet very tasty. Top notch fine dining. They even gave us a complimentary Lilikoi, Strawberry mousse cake. Very nice touch! Susan the Chef Concierge was outstanding in anticipating our needs and thought of everything before we could think of it. From the stuffed animal Dolphin to sending us a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine for our special occasion. It made us feel special.Overall very good family friendly resort and very relaxing and timeless. Check-out the wall of fame next to the lobby that shows all the important personalities/celebrities to understand the rich legacy of this Resort. I would highly recommend for families or couples looking for a gateway on Oahu that is still close from the main attractions and famous Waikiki beach.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Kahala, the hotel is beautiful and the staff is super friendly and helpful. The beach is gorgeous and the kids loved the dolphin lagoon. The breakfast buffet is also great, we would look forward to it every day. We'll definitely come back!

Excellent hotel with first class service. We just returned from 5 days there. The hotel is located a few minutes from downtown but provides shuttles on request. Easy to access the hotel from the airport/return. We had a room on the second floor with a balcony overlooking the golf course. Great views, spacious room. Every amenity one needs for the entire stay. Several restaurants on property from which to choose. Loved breakfast every morning in Plumeria overlooking the beach and ocean. Fabulous breakfast buffet. Seaside Grill is a lovely spot for lunch. Enjoyed visiting Dolphin Quest twice. Staff is very knowledgeable and enjoy sharing information and stories about the "family". Would absolutely recommend this resort property and will return on our next vacation in Honolulu.

The Kahala provides top flight service, facility, and a location that is convenient to all the major attractions in Honolulu. I cannot say enough about the staff and their desire to meet every expectation. The Dolphin Quest Facility located in the center of the hotel facility provides a unique opportunity to meet these mammals in their own habitat. Simply a great place to stay.

The Kahala was a nice hotel--the room and especially the bathroom were downright elegant. A couple of caveats: EVERY night reservations were required for dining. You can eat at the bar, but if you want to be seated, make reservations and make them early. Also, there are sea turtles and dolphins at the resort. Frankly the circular swimming of these penned animals was just horrifying. I would NOT subject children to the sight. NOTE: Avoid booking during the Honolulu Marathon. Our car was inaccessible to us because of the event. You can swim off the beach here but there is no sea life/snorkeling merit.

After spending a lot of time reviewing which island to visit for our first trip to Hawaii and settling on Oahu, the next step was to find a great resort. We could not be happier that we decided on the Kahala. It is clear to see why it is ranked as one of the top 10 resorts in the state of Hawaii.The elegance and care the staff has is tremendous. You feel like royalty each time you interact with them.Everything in Hawaii is expensive, and my only minor complaint about the Kahala is the price of food on site. There are many, many dining options on site, but none are what I would consider budget friendly.The resort itself is at the end of a private lane - very secluded. Private beach, dolphin lagoon on site, spacious rooms, great views. Nothing about the property is out of place. Care is taken to each need. Twice a day housekeeping - bottled water in your room each day, as well as at valet. Beach towels, umbrellas, sunscreen, all available to you as you need, whether you're staying on property or not.If you're into the constant traffic of people, automobiles, and long lines for restaurants, stay near Waikiki. If you want a private, secluded, quiet time away, there is no better place than the Kahala.

The hotel is beautiful . We stayed in the Dolphin Lanai rooms, this overlooks the 6 amazing Dolphins. The dolphin trainers are brilliant , they take time to explain anything you wish to know about the Dolphins. You can also book to be a Dolphin trainer, my son and daughter done this along with there partners it lasted about 5 hours they loved it. The hotel has a golf course and is on the beach. I found the staff very helpful and pleasant . Cameron who works on the concierge desk was great . The hotel is not all inclusive all food and drink must be paid for. You wIll be asked for ID if you do not look 21. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the shops and restaurants in Waikiki the cost of the cab is about 27 dollars. The outside pool at the hotel is not very big, but very warm. If you are looking for a relaxing holiday then this is a wonderful hotel . We had a lovely time here. One word sums it up Paradise.

Not many hotels have dolphins by the pool! Certainly was something new. Great beach and breakfast by the ocean. Rooms and service are traditional but ideal. Would certainly go back and is ideal for families.

A Promise Fulfilled 39 years later-  The beautiful Kahala is unlike any other Hotel/Resort on the island of Oahu- The location is approximately 20 minutes away from the traffic noise and crowds of people in the area surrounding Waikiki .  The grounds are spectacular, with exotic plants, beautiful flowers andwaterways teeming with aquatic life. This includes performances of jumping dolphins, turtles and many types of exotic fish. The Kahala has one of the most lovely, serene and quiet beaches in all of Oahu adjacent to a magnificent blue ocean. The ambiance is quiet elegance throughout the hotel, especially in the lobby. The restaurants have excellent food and the staff are engaging, friendly and ready to serve. The rooms are charming with beautiful views of the ocean. On the opposite side of the hotel are views of the mountains and the adjoining golf course. Our favorite time of the day was our morning breakfast/brunch buffet with a wide variety of delightful food. You have the choice of being served inside or outside by the ocean. Our plans for this trip, October 21-28 began in 1976 on our honeymoon. During our honeymoon stay (76) in the Waikiki area, we had plans for dinner at the Kahala Hotel. We sat down for dinner and the waiter brought menus. My husband took one look at the prices and immediately left me by myself at the table. I too got up and left with apologies to the waiter.This was our first big disagreement. It was the beginning of a Promise made by my husband to return to the Kahala. It only took 39 years. On our honeymoon in 1976, we had lost all our pictures due to a camera malfunction. While celebrating our 39th anniversary in 2015, we met Julia Jump, Creative Director of Pacific Dream Photography. The hotel offers her services from her photo studio in the lower level of the hotel. We spent part of an afternoon and evening with Julia moving throughout the Resort, taking pictures. Surprising to us, without our knowledge, Julia was also creating an amazing video. The entire photo/video package was then put to music and the result was a great joy to us. These photos reduced much of our disappointment from the loss of our honeymoon pictures. However, a Promise 39 years ago was fulfilled.  We would love to return to the Kahala. But, if we can't, we will always have our pictures-

The location is wonderful and the beach is perfect. The pool is small but it is not an issue. We stayed in a cheaper room without ocean view but the outlook over the golf course is still magnificent. The room was enormous and very well appointed with an enormous lanai. You feel far outside of Honolulu but it is just a short trip away. I rate this hotel a three because I did not think the service was good for this level of hotel. Reception, concierge and pool staff were unhelpful and bordered on rude. Service in the restaurants was slow and also not so friendly. These points would stop me staying here again

From the moment you step into the grand lobby of this hotel, you realize that you're seeing a bit of history and that you're going to receive the highest level of service. Every employee greeted us with a smile and a desire to help in any way. The rooms are lovely with high quality fabrics and bathroom amenities. The famous dolphins are still in residence and we saw many families taking part in the dolphin experience. The beach is gorgeous and perfect for lounging and easy swimming, as it's more protected than other beaches we've visited in Hawaii. We dined at the Plumeria Beach House and found the food to be very good. For the ultimate experience, try Hoku's. Arancino's is excellent for Italian. Near the hotel shops, don't neglect to look at the many pictures of celebrities who've stayed at the Kahala over the years. It's amazing! IF there's a drawback at this hotel, it's the size of the pool. It's rather small and children may be disappointed to find that there are no slides to entertain them. Overall, I'd go back to this hotel in a heartbeat!

Everything about the Kahala is just right. The staff are attentive when you arrive - the rooms are very spacious and comfortable - and the dolphin lagoon is incredible. The food was outstanding - we did the evening buffet and the quality of food was spectacular - and I am picky! It is great to go to an upscale property that maintains a laid back feel. This is a great property for a couple vacation - to a family vacation - to apparently weddings (as we saw 4 of them in one day!) We really were impressed by the quality of the food and ate at the restaurant for every breakfast and a couple dinners.

I stayed here years ago when it was part of the Mandarin Hotel chain...the visit then was exceptional..and this visit was also perfect! Beautiful property off the beaten path..lovely rooms..restaurants.. beach and most of all the people. Did not encounter ONE person who was not friendly..remembered you and wanted to help make your stay all that it could be..Thank you all..I will return to relax and enjoy the surroundings.

Myself and my wife stayed here recently for our belated honeymoon. The hotel has a great history and retains all of the grandeur of times gone by, whilst still ticking all of the boxes as far as modern facilities are concerned. The service from all staff is perfect, the food in all of the outlets excellent, especially at Arrancino and Hokus. Location is also great for those wishing to feel like they are in a secluded resort, but still be within a stones throw of the city and all of the major landmarks. I would definitely recommend this for those looking for a great, luxurious and relaxing stay with zero pretence and 100% attention.

What a hotel. From the moment we landed we were treated like Royalty. The staff were super accommodating. Car rental at the Hotel was a bonus when the weather wasn't great. We loved our room overlooking the Dolphin lagoon, pool and the beach. The 4 of us enjoyed grabbing a bicycle each morning and going for a family bike ride. We hope to be back. Mahalo

We like this hotel. Perfect for couple or family with kids. My daughter loves to watch dolphin feeding. The hotel is a bit tired but still providing sufficient facilities and good services. We also enjoy the afternoon tea at the Veranda.

Hotel is tired. No closet, hang clothes in the bathroom. Furniture is scuffed, pool and beach service was not up to par. All food was excellent, beach was nice, but pool was missing tiles, drinks were ridiculously expensive. Time for a renovation. I would rate this 3 1/2 stars.

We visited for before and after a cruise. We selected a dolphin lanai room for our stay. We were situated on the second floor overlooking the lagoon. The room was perfect and the view of the lagoon was interesting. The public areas were perfectly maintained. The staff were all helpful as well. We were able to rent a car on site as well. I recommend renting one of the bicycles on site and taking the short trip to diamond head crater and taking the hike to the top. I suggest doing this only if you are in decent physical shape. The mahal a bikes are very good. We ate in the pulmeria restaurant and sat outside beachfront. Highly recommend. Enjoy. One of the nicest properties we have ever stayed. Kudos to The Kahala! Mahalo.

After countless trips to Hawaii, I still feel that The Kahala is the best place to be. In this recent trip, I arrived from an international flight so it was great not have to use the inter-island terminal. The resort is a very brisk 15-20 min away from the airport, but it is in such an excluded area.It is a short and scenic drive to Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, but also very close to Hanauma Bay and Hawaii Kai. The service is impeccable and they make you feel so welcome and everything is truly a can-do attitude.The front office manager provides a special touch by remembering your visits.

This beautiful hotel sits just east of Diamond Head. It's location makes its beach nicely secluded, even though it is not far from Waikiki and downtown Honolulu. Our room is perfect, quiet and comfortable, and is directly above the dolphin pool. Watching the dolphins from our balcony was a treat, whether they were performing, swimming with guests, or just relaxing in their pool. Onsite restaurants and lounges are delightful. Service here is impeccable.

This hotel is situated well away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. In fact you really need a car to get out here, although I think that there is a shuttle into Waikiki. The day we arrived, there were two weddings and a funeral, so it was absolute chaos, but once we'd got through the front entrance and up to the reception desk all was calm. I was worried that we'd have a lot of noise but our room was very quiet as it was right on the beach at the end of the hotel. The long walk to our room was so worth it. It was a fabulous room, the only problem being the very noisy air conditioning unit. In the end, the only way to resolve the noise was to leave in on "on" rather than automatic and turn it slightly up so that it didn't cut in and out all night long. Hoku's Brunch on a Sunday is a must, with a huge selection of foods to try and for an extra few dollars you can get a glass of champagne with two complimentary top ups! Yum. The hotel has a pool, but with a beautiful beach just a few steps away from it there's really no need to use it. The Seaside Grill serves light meals and snacks and amazing cocktails right there on the beach as well. I loved staying at the Kahala Hotel for the peace and quiet so if you're wanting to be amongst all the shops and nightlife then this hotel is probably not for you.

Must go best accommodations amazing beach beautiful hotel superior dolphin program all around amazing fun staff great drinks super location extremely clean facility just go go go go go go go go to the Kahala Resort you won't be sorry

We traveled to Hawaii for Spring Break with our 7 and 14-year-old children. We spent the first half of our trip at Disney Aulani and the second half on Maui. We returned to Oahu for one night before leaving Hawaii solely so my 7-year-old daughter could swim with the dolphins at Dolphin Quest, which is located at the Kahala Resort. We had booked a one bedroom with an ocean view lanai several months prior to our trip. However, when we arrived, there were no such rooms available. While they offered to upgrade us to another room, we would have had to pay the difference in room rates. We ended up downgrading to an ocean view without a lanai which was fine for one night, but honestly I think they should have offered us the upgraded room at no charge since the room we had booked was not available.The resort is nice but slightly dated. Our room was spacious, but the beds are fulls rather than queens so they were a bit small. The beds, however, were very comfortable and the bedding was upscale. The bathroom was very spacious with a walk-in shower, large spa bath and 2 sinks. The toilet had a heated seat and bidet functions (don't ask) which my kids got endless amusement from. We greatly appreciated the traditional nighttime turn-down service and replenishment of fresh towels.The breakfast buffet was included in the room price and had a lot of options. The restaurant is located right on the beach with a beautiful view. We ate lunch at another small restaurant located on the beach by the pool which had a limited menu.There is one very small swimming pool, a sting ray pool, a sea turtle pool and then a large dolphin pool operated by Dolphin Quest. There are beach cabanas and beach/pool chairs with nice cushions. The hotel is 5 minutes from Diamond Head and 20 minutes from Waikiki Beach. It was very peaceful and the dolphin experience was excellent, but I probably wouldn't want to stay here for more than one night given all the hotel options in Hawaii.

The Kahala is set in a quiet residential neighbourhood on the South coast of the island which was a great location for us as first timers to Oahu.Porters, door and valet staff were all very efficient. Check in was quick although we would have appreciated being escorted to our room as it was quite a trek along several corridors and down stairs. We were given a map but got lost half way and ended up asking a member of housekeeping in one of the corridors who gave us more directions. Lovely welcoming gifts for the kids and pre-requested items waiting for us in the room.All staff were friendly, welcoming and remembered our preferences after the first meeting. This was especially true of the lounge bar staff. We stayed in a ground floor dolphin lagoon room which was fabulous for meeting the dolphins. Each morning they would be swimming immediately outside our room and on several occasions stopped by to allow our kids a short pat on the head. We got some great photos. Whilst generally a very positive experience, the hotel looks tired in parts - sunbeds that have seen better days, furniture that needs replacing, a fresh coat of paint required here and there, old wallpaper peeling off in some places. It gave the impression that it had been left to deteriorate over time and was a bit 'lost in time'. I hope the new owners are ready to invest money in the hotel and return it to the grandeur I'm sure it once was. We would very likely stay there again but would also want to stay on the stunning and less inhabited north coast.
user_name:
Plane_Talking_Travel
Lytham St Anne's, United Kingdom

review_body: A lovely hotel with a rich history and phenomenal service. It seems like instead of a multi-million dollar renovation, they decided to provide world class service. The vibe is so zen (unlike the craziness of Waikiki). And maybe it feels that way because every morning you get to visit the Dolphins that live here. And turtles and rays. The crowd is mostly Japanese. We saw did not see a single loud drunk tourist...a chic and sedate crowd.

Stayed here twice while visiting Honolulu. The hotel is not in Waikiki, but the offer hourly shuttle service to different highlights (Mall, Waikiki, etc...) The rooms are okey, they could use some remodeling, but they have all the necessary utilities. Their beach front is nice! Shame that they charge for the water sports, unlike other hotels. They also have a lagoon with dolphins which is very fun to see, and another one with stingrays, turtles and fish.The breakfast is the best! A lot of variety and the restaurant Honu is amazing! The best poke I have ever had!!!! Kudos!!!I would definitely come back to this hotel.

I had been planning a special anniversary and dreaming of staying at this hotel for five years! I am extremely happy to say that the wait was worth it! Before I had even started my trip, I was contacted by Leimomi Consylman (one of the hotel's concierge) who helped me plan our activities to make this trip memorable. The Kahala Resort is located in a secluded, upscale area that is close to Diamondhead and Waikiki. Upon our arrival, we were instantly struck by the beautiful property - exterior & lobby were grand. The staff instantly greeted us and genuinely made our entire stay pleasant by meeting our every need. Our room was gorgeous and the views were amazing! Also, there is so much to do on the property that you can find something for everyone - swimming with the dolphins in the private lagoon, enjoying the beautiful outdoor pool/hot tub, relaxing at the spa or lounging on the private beach are some of the activities available. This was the highlight of our 2016 and we HIGHLY RECOMMEND this property to anyone coming to Oahu!

Kahala Hotel is now under a new management. However, the level of service remains very high. Hoku's restaurant was once again the highlight of our vacation. Note to the chef: please keep musubi on the menu. We will definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Ann V
New York City, New York

review_body: The location, the food, the staff, the rooms, facilities and pool (there are dolphins-you can swim with them at additional costs, stingrays and turtles in a special lagoon at the hotel premises!) everything was simply wonderful! We loved our stay! The friendly staff contributed to an amazing stay

We stayed here for a week and we loved it! So many things to do and see and the rooms were gorgeous! The view was amazing and we enjoyed having breakfast and dinner downstairs. An awesome place to go for a romantic getaway. We will return very soon!

I stayed in the Presidential Suite during spring break 2016 and it was nothing short of depressing:- they listed a bunch of amenities at check in (free massage, daily cabana by the beach, preferential seating at Plumeria, $100 laundry credit, etc.)- on check in, no welcoming by anyone (fine)- day one, all the cabanas were taken (so that afternoon, we chose the one we want for the rest of the week)- day two, cabana was there- day three, I went and dropped my stuff at the cabana, then had breakfast. On return, someone else was sitting there, and my stuff was gone! My friend went over to the little kiosk and some attendant say "hmmm, your name was crossed out" (probably someone took a tip and decided it was easy to just remove a name from the list). When I went to the kiosk to ask for my lost bad, the guy said "oh, we have it here" - so they removed my bag, then gave the cabana I reserved to someone else. When I ask the guy to fix it, he gave me royal face like I WAS THE ONE AT FAULT.- about the "preferred seating at Plumeria" - forget it! I called down to get a table, and 3 out of 4 days they weren't even ready.Get ready for the worst part - when I went to check out, my massage was on the invoice, the laundry was on the list, etc. You have ask for them to remove it. This is NOT a mistake, because my friend HAD THE SAME ISSUE! So please don't respond and say this was an isolated incidence. It's not.No thanks. I can spend $3,500 a night and get much better service.BUYERS BE WARE. CHECK YOUR BILL!!!!

Our travel agent recommended the Kahala Hotel. It is a lovely hotel. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Wakiki but close enough to get there. It has a relaxed atmosphere with superb service. The dolphins were so much fun. Ask for an oceanfront room. I would highly recommend this gem.

The wait staff, and other people like them around hotel, are sweet and helpful, but the upper management has an attitude. They had a plumbing problem with some rooms when we checked in, and although we had a year old reservation, they had to move someone else to our reserved room. Another room 1142 had a lock that didn't lock and our safe in room had to be fixed.The ONE pool is filled to the gills with the cutest little swimmers, unfortunately with bikini bottoms and no diapers. It's not hard to figure where they went to the bathroom. Have been going for years, but it has changed dramatically. Your reservation of a specific room can be changed by them, don't expect much, and then you won't be disappointed. The views are great, such a shame it is going down hill.

This resort was absolutely beautiful, from the decor in the lobby to the suites, and the grounds it was all top notch. Our suite was enormous, in fact we arrived late on February 13th and had 8 family members eat dinner in our livingroom area (too tired to go out so we ordered room service and the food was very good). There is a dolphin swim area (if you want to pay extra) or you can just enjoy the pretty (although a little small) pool area or the beach. We ate lunch at the Sea side grill and enjoyed it very much. We were only here for two nights before heading to Maui and it was a perfect place for a short stay in Hawaii. Since the resort did not have a ton of amenities for the kids I would not have wanted to stay for more than a couple of days. However, our short stay was perfect in every way! We did a tour of Pearl Harbor one day and did the Diamond Crater Hike another day for activities then took a short flight to Maui to continue our Hawaii family vacation.

Our family stayed at The Kahala over spring break this year. We were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived. The entire staff was friendly and efficient and spoiled us for the duration of our stay. We most definitely would recommend the Kahala to all of our family and friends.

A young woman staff's service at the Herz was terrible.I've never got that kind of poor sevice in my life.Also, I tried to find Korean speaker to get some help,but there was none.(Even though it was written in the brochure.)It was my honeymoon, and I expected wonderful moment.However, the overall service was not worth enough.

The Kahala Hotel is worth every penny. The entire staff was extremely friendly and the concierge suggested only the most entertaining activities for my whole family. It was an absolute week in paradise, from the phenomenal morningly breakfast buffet to the soft white sand beach. I would 100% recommend this hotel for you and your entire family. My kids had an amazing time playing at the Kid's Club. My kids and I also enjoyed playing on the beach and playing games on the water raft. My family loved the Dolphin Quest experience, where we had the chance to swim with dolphins. At this amazing tropical oasis, you and your whole family will make memories to last a lifetime.

Beach front hotel away from noise of Honolulu. Parking is free. Heavily packed during holidays. Pool, delphinarium and a couple of restaurants onsite. Might get expensive during holiday season. Service is way above average.

I would consider us luxury, but family friendly travelers and The Kahala met our style perfectly. We were here for 3 nights during Spring Break, with our kids ages 9 and 11. Both a friend who has been to Hawaii many times, and my cousin who works in travel and use to live on Oahu, said this is the only place they would ever recommend staying. Below is a list of what we loved (both adults and kids voted):1. Location: a few miles away from the craziness of Waikiki and at the end of a nice neighborhood, isolated on it's own. Easy taxi or drive in to town if you were looking for other dinner options and shopping.2. Smaller resort, not your big luxury chain hotel. I like both, but what made The Kahala special was you got to meet other guests, and you got to know the staff. The pool is small, but we never had an issue getting a chair at the pool or on the beach. There was always someone to assist you with a chair covers and towels.3. The Service!! Everyone from the activities staff, poolside assistance, bellmen, bartenders, were just great. Special Shout Out to Anji our poolside bartender. Not only was she genuinely friendly but also gave helpful tips on getting around the island. Super great with my kids too. 4. We are suckers for a breakfast buffet....with a view. Get a package that includes it (which we did). A beautiful way to start the day.5. Prior to my trip, I worked with the concierge service to book tours and make dinner reservations. At work, it's often difficult to take personal calls, so I dealt with them mostly via email. I got quick responses, all questions answered, and ended up loving what they booked for us. 6. My family loved the TOTO toilets in our bathrooms. Seriously, they talked for days about getting them at home. Heated seats, self cleaning, multiple spray options.....what's not to love.The only thing I didn't like is that the rooms show their age a bit. You can tell it's an older building that's been renovated. That said, we had a suite and both rooms were of great size with two full bathrooms with showers, tubs, TOTO toilets per above, closets, etc. Our kids are getting a bit older and next time I might consider two connecting rooms or a larger suite. The pull-out sofa bed was really just a full-size, not a queen. Honestly, we were never in our room because we enjoyed hanging out at the pool so much. Thank you to everyone at The Kahala for such a great experience.

We were up graded to an ocean side room because of our standing with our agency. The room was very spacious as was the bathroom. The service was excellent throughout and quite friendly. It was nice being tucked away from all of the hustle and bustle of the city but still within easy driving distance.

The dophin quest program was awesome and our kids loved it !! The beach was quiet and nice. Luxurious hotel and more like Maui experinece. You can have a relaxed vacation just like in Maui in busy honolulu.

Off the beaten path of busy Waikiki, is this quiet and wonderful hotel. Lagoons of native fish, dining with views that are spectacular. A real gem hideaway in such a busy city. Impeccable service, food and rooms, this hotel has the " Aloha Spirit !"

Accolades to Lynn at the front desk and Cathy, Executive Secretary! They really turned things around for this stay. Unaware that I was traveling at one of the busiest times of the year, they did not have the category of room I had reserved and paid for far in advance available at check-in. they provided me with a very lovely ocean view room but it also overlooked the parking garage and the entrance to the hotel which proved to be very noisy. They also said they would charge me $200.00 more per night for this room. I felt it very unfair that I was being charged more for a room that I did not wish to have or had reserved. I spoke with Lynn who found a room in my category that I had reserved for, a scenic view Koko Head room, very serene and quiet. I spoke with Cathy who gave the general manager my message about the additional charges. Both Lynn and Cathy went out of their ways to help me. not only was I not charged the additional charges but I was given a late check out on my final day. Theses two ladies did an excellent job of turning my situation from me being an unhappy guest to me being a very happy guest. the rooms are lovely, the maid service is excellent, the linens and amenities are wonderful. the staff at the restaurants are wonderful. I enjoyed my stay very much and wish to return!!

My wife and I stayed in a Dolphin Lanai room and it was a lovely experience. The rooms are huge and decorated well. The staff and service was amazing. And having the Dolphins outside of our room was very special. My wife described this as a 'fairy tale hotel'...and looking back I'd agree. It's a beautiful place to go and stay...

Was upgrade from regular to Balcony view by friendly front desk manager. Basically stayed for $395 per day for the price of $1200. This place is like a Maui resorts. Disconnected from the rest of Honolulu. Good relaxed vibe.

Favorite hotel on the island Nice rooms, great service and food.Warm pool and great beach that is easy to swim inSpa is nice albeit too expensiveHealth club niceNo need to ever leave place but close to everything if you wantAnd of course the dolphins are always a highlight

They say that you can never go back, but coming back to the Kahala was very special. Would it live up to the two times we visited in 1979 and 1982?I must say that it didn't disappoint. Not much has changed in all those years. The rooms may have been redecorated, but the still have the same warm feeling. The restaurants are different but are still top quality. We ate at Hoku and the beach grill. But that will be another review. The dolphins are still there swimming, jumping and amusing children and adults alike. The grounds are still manicured and well cared for as is the entire property. It was a pleasure returning to where I met my husband.

I am currently a few days into a stay here during a short trip for my wife's birthday. Arrival was great, nice lobby, welcoming staff. The expedia silver status upgrade got us a room with a balcony (i booked the scenic view rooms, assuming all the rooms at a 5 star hotel would be ok). Room decor was tired, scenic view was of a golf course and noisy freeway, very much like an Indian casino in the central valley). after much discussion with staff, they segued (not an upgrade as same price range) us into a dolphin lagoon room. sounds great but the nicer dolphin lagoon rooms are "out of commission" for remodelling and my room is overshadowed by the supports & service area of the main tower. the room is damp and the bathroom smells like skunk (are there even skunks in Hawaii?). I spoke to management again (a Belgian chap) and again, the nicer rooms, although unoccupied, are available for a less than modest fee. I truly wanted to love this hotel but all the issues (no one told me there was a gym, there's coffee in the mornings, yoga, beach bar wait staff just ignore you being a few)are being compounded into an overall unsatisfying experience. I have a couple of days left to make my wife's birthday a happy one and i sadly feel the Kahala is not going to be able to make that happy. Carlos at reception is exceptional though, Clinton the shuttle driver and Todd the bellman is as well. In summary, not the 5 star experience i have had before in Hyatt, Sheratons, Shangri-La (US, ME, Europe, Mexico, Australia), very tired room, limited room choices & lack of will on the part of management to exceed expectations & win over guests

3 stars says "Average". I wanted to rate higher because of all the wonderful times we've had here, but its hard to do with what's happening. This truly was a great hotel in setting and service for many many years. Now its going to seed.We've been coming here for many winters. We have never seen it look so ill maintained. The new owners may have a plan for the hotel, but need to spend more attention to the grounds. The motorized beach dozer does a good job of removing coral and stones from the beach, but tears up the grass along the paths and has destroyed much of the rubberized guides. It looks so bad. The grass also looks like they've stopped using fertilizer; it's brown in many places and pale green at best. There's leaves and other organic debris under the plantings that should be removed. I could go on.Part of the story of the sale was that they would develop time-shares. It will be tough to sell a share to someone the way the grounds look now. I'm not sure we'll be back.The service people are still great. The food is good. Do something about the grounds maintenance.

Having visited Hawaii 10 years ago and stayed in Waikiki, I knew I wanted something quieter and so pleased with our choice as Waikiki is even more of a tourist trap now. This resort is located within a wealthy residential area and is quiet. It has its own private beach which beats the crowds in Waikiki. It can be expensive to hire cabanas for the day but sun loungers are free to use. Breakfast buffet has lots of options and the fresh pineapple and papaya were delicious!Rooms are very spacious and comfortable. There is a free hotel shuttle bus which goes to Waikiki which is handy if you want to leave to go for dinner etc but the hotel restaurants were also good - esp Arancinos. All in all a nice and relaxing stay which I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to people

I have stayed at the Kahala hotel and resort several times. I started staying there when it was still the Mandarin Oriental Kahala Hotel. Service is excellent, rooms are excellent and most importantly the bed is SUPER comfortable. I would recommend staying in the ocean front Coco Head side (not the Diamond Head side). Get a suite room at the end of the hallway so you overlook the ocean.

I stayed at Kahala for a group event and everything was top notch from beginning to end. Highly recommend for business or vacation travel. Room was excellent, food was very high quality and the location could not be better.

This hotel is very nice, and the private beach is brilliant to have to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The minibus into the centre of Honolulu was useful and the staff were friendly. The restaurants are lovely. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have the money however it is a little on the expensive side and you need to get a bus or a taxi to go anywhere other than the hotel.

We have held an annual business event at the Kahala for two years. The staff is second to none with Grace Chan at the helm. The entire staff is always pleasant and engaged with the guests. The food in each of the restaurants is superb. The Dolphin Quest is an experience everyone should have in their lifetime. David Swanson in the lounge is an accomplished pianist and musician. Our guests thoroughly enjoy this hotel.

Our room was right on the dolphin lagoon, we were able to enjoy the dolphins whenever we wanted as they were right next to us. Our room was large and comfortable. Each employee we encountered was extremely nice and gave us outstanding service. The Kahala Beach Resort is on the other side of Diamond Head from downtown Honolulu and perfect for your privacy. We were only steps away from the secluded beach area. We enjoyed our five night stay to the fullest.
user_name:
Philip R
Sun City West, Arizona

review_body: Service here is the best. Everyone is so nice and seem like they really care about this hotel and about making a good impression. We had an excellent stay. We will come back again. The Italian restaurant here is exceptionally good.

My wife and I go to Hawaii every couple of years. I used to live in Honolulu so it is very familiar to me. Of course living in a place offers a very different experience than being a tourist.
