Yet in Hawaii it can be difficult to not cross paths quite often. The Kahala is truly a very special place, and not only because of its very special location. It is situated in such a way that there are no other hotels anywhere around. The Kahala area of Honolulu has long been one of the most exclusive parts of Honolulu. The hotel is directly on its own beach. It is surrounded by the most impressive Waialae Country Club & Golf Course so all the surrounding area is really beautiful. If you don't happen to get an ocean view the golf course and mountains are are a nice vista as well. From the many times we have stayed there I can honestly say I have never had a bad experience. But then I tend to be kind and empathetic when requesting service.Another exclusive to my knowledge that the resort offers is the resident dolphins. They have several in their lagoon and you and get in the water and have your picture taken with them. This is a really big hit with the kids believe me. It is always busy.This property is not new, but it is maintained in pristine condition, and I tend to be on the picky side. I even walk around outside the perimeter of the hotel where guests don't venture and just look to see how those places are kept. Even the service dock is clean and organized. If you don't want a rental car they offer a very convenient shuttle service to the local shopping mall and the tourist ghetto of Waikiki, if you wish to go. The mall is highly recommended, and I think you know my opinion of Waikiki. In summary this is the place for you if you have the means. I might mention that many famous celebrities choose to stay here, and we have seen several in previous trips. One wall in the shopping arcade has many of their pictures taken while staying here. From Bob Hope and Frank Sinatra to more recent musicians, movie stars, and politicians including former US Presidents.
user_name:
Pyotr S
Cabo San Lucas, Mexico

review_body: Nice hotel in a great location. Enjoyed our stay. Just a couple of issues:1. Through to night we'd often be woken by rather noisy water pipe noise in the walls. Most times the noise ran for 10 to 30 minutes. It's clear this is an old hotel that's been refurbished with likely most focus on aesthetics. 2. We weren't that close to the hotel deliveries area but we could hear delivery trucks readily. This was frequent and at all times of the day. The particular kind of noise is those was refrigerated trucks which park to unload but keep their engine running all the time they are there. Sometimes lasting more than 1/2 hour. Early morning times were not appreciated. There's no way we could sit on our balcony and just enjoy the view at those times with a Diesel engine rattling away. We had 9 instances of this in our 5 day stay.

As a five-star resort, we expected beauty, good food, and good service from The Kahala. We were not disappointed. This is a very classy place. Though it doesn't have a dress code, the clientele seem to know to dress well, and to expect old-fashioned service. The concierges began by helping us with arrangements well before our arrival. Our room (dolphin lanai) was large, with a huge bathroom and double sinks, plus a fancy Japanese toilet. The toilet made us laugh, as it felt a bit like having a pet. There was true turndown service, beautiful views, and even a sort of mini-zoo on the property (rays, turtles, fish in addition to dolphins). We loved watching the dolphins from our balcony! All of the on-site restaurants are quite good. Expensive, but that's to be expected in Hawaii. But what really made the difference for us was the outstanding level of service. Without exception, everyone we encountered at The Kahala was extraordinarily friendly, helpful, and competent. Couldn't be happier with our experience. Tips: there is a sheltered, uncrowded beach. If you watch carefully during whale season, you may see whales breach from here. The neighborhood is a bit outside of Waikiki, so if you want to wander the streets and shop, this is not the place. It is in an upscale residential neighborhood ("The Beverly Hills of Honolulu"). There is onsite parking. The hotel seemed to be a popular wedding destination for Chinese guests, which was beautiful to watch. On weekends, locals flock to the hotel's restaurants and bars, but it is still very quiet by 10 p.m.

The perfect location for a visit to Honolulu. The hotel is right on its own quiet beach which is not too busy. Good beach/poolside restaurant with helpful friendly staff.The room we had was beautiful with great housekeeping service. All the hotel restaurants are excellent which makes it hard to venture out!

Recently I had the opportunity to stay at the Kahala Resort. At check in the front desk and guest relations personnel were wonderful. Our room over looked the ocean and every day we could lookout and see whales breaching off the coast. The room was spacious and beautiful, but needed some updates. The atmosphere at the hotel seemed very homey and the employees made you feel like family coming home. After check in we met with the concierge Cameron. Cameron was unbelievably helpful. He made all our dreams come true from dinners to excursions on the island and providing a knowledgable insight with ideas and suggestions for our stay. I want to thank the Kahala Resort for a wonderful stay and having wonderful helpful, friendly and smiling staff. I felt that the employees looked out for each other and looked at each other as family. A real family atmosphere.

We visited Honolulu in February 2016 for a conference and decided to take a few extra days away from busy Waikiki. We booked the celebration package which included breakfast buffet. The rooms are large and spacious, we had a king bed and there was plenty of room for a cot for my daughter. The bathrrom was wonderful with 2 sinks, a tub and a separate shower. Food on the breakfast buffet was plentiful and delicious, especially the pineapple and papaya! There is a lagoon on site with dolphins ( run by Dolphin Quest) which provides education and opportunities to swim with the dolphins. Our room also had a large balcony.

The service is outstanding. Everyone working for the resort went out of their way to be helpful. The food service was great and the food was excellent in all the different restaurants we used from breakfast to dinner.
user_name:
chaz4021
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This resort has the advantage of being close to everything Honolulu has to offer while being far enough away to offer a tranquility that most the local resorts can't provide. The beach is beautiful, with beautiful water views. There is a dolphin lagoon, with a wing of rooms facing it, for those who might prefer to dolphin watch. I have mixed feelings about this. The lagoon they are in is beautiful. There are even toys for them to play with, so there are things to keep them stimulated. They are obviously well taken care of. I just have reservations about the concept. There are several restaurants on the grounds, and there are activities to entertain all ages. The lobby area is beautiful. The pool is in need of an update. There is noticeable need of tile repair around the edges. Our room was a nice size, and attractively decorated. Staff was efficient and pleasant.

From the moment we stepped on the property until the moment we left, the Kahala was an amazing experience. Even though we arrived after midnight after a horrible airline experience, we were immediately put at ease by the front desk clerk, who made us feel welcome! He also apologized that the restaurants were closed, but immediately offered room service if we were hungry. Our room was large, comfortable, and very clean.The restaurants were amazing, and the waitstaff very attentive. The pool area and beach were wonderful. And although the hotel was full with families on vacation, it didn't feel crowded, and we were able to relax and unwind at the beach. It is away from all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The staff is superb, and almost everyone calls you by your name.There is also a mall that is only a 15 minute walk from the property, if you feel the need.We will definitely be back!
user_name:
G. Berkley B
Hampton, United States

review_body: from start to finish this resort is on point. the staff was always accommodating ~ generous and personable. we hanged hotel two days into our trip and were quite pleased we did. dollar for dollar this best value on the island. if you want to really treat yourself spend time here.of course its a resort so its full of people however somehow they all manage to stay out of your way and create the illusion of being alone on the island. close enough to town for the best shopping and far enough away to experience the best side of the island the north shore.

We decided in a week in Honolulu and chose the Kahala as it offered a good beach, great restaurants and elegant rooms with great views of the Ocean. We were not disappointed!Our days started with an amazing breakfast with great views and then peaceful relaxing by the pool and on the beach, followed by lunch by the beach. We went off to dinner at Roy's and other wonderful restaurants close by, although a couple of nights we ate in Hoku's which was lovely. All in all, we keep coming back because it's just consistently good.

I stayed this hotel for my wedding in Hawaii.Two nights in the ocean view lanai and three nights in the mountain view lanai.Ocean view lanai, we could wake up with sunshine, beautiful shiny ocean, it was really great.I could prepare for being bride with viewing beautiful ocean and the bedroom and bathroom are large enough for 5 people (groom, bride, makeup artist, photographer and coordinator).We took many pictures in the hotel, beach and golf course next to. So much photogenic place in the hotel.The atmosphere was really elegant, and almost all staffs were so kind to us. Although it locates a bit far from center of Waikiki, it worth stay.I like mountain lanai room too. Not brilliant as ocean view, we could enjoy the lanai. Actually staying lanai of ocean view was too hot. The silence was so nice.I want to get back to Kahala anytime I could.

We have stayed at the Kahala Hotel before and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Honolulu. Its just 20 mins away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The hotel is beautiful and has its own private beach to swim and snorkle. The rooms are large and elegant and the beds are very comfortable. Even though the Kahala was built in the sixties it has great atmosphere and fantastic service. The staff are very professional and helpful. There is a complimentary shuttle service to the shopping centres in Waikiki for your retail therapy! The buffet breakfast is delicious! Lots of choices. The seaside grill is great to dine at while looking at the ocean plus nice food. The Plumeria Beach House for dinner is excellent! The veranda is nice for a after dinner cocktail and live Hawaiian music. There is a dolphin sanctuary on the premises where you can swim with a dolphin and have your photo taken. We enjoyed being with the dolphins on our last trip. So if you are looking for a relaxing holiday in Honolulu The Kahala Hotel & Resort is the place to stay.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and the staff and facilities at the Kahala were amazing! Great people great rooms and the Dolphin Quest Experience was amazing. When we come back to Hawaii, we will be staying at the Kahala and no where else!

GOODS:We came here with our 2 kids, 8 & 11, and they loved it! When we arrived, I felt like we were treated as if we were royalty.........it felt nice. Valet staff were my fav's including the ones that stand behind the counter when you pull up. If you need anything ask them! Every day they gave us towels if we were going to another beach & bottled water. They asked how our day was and when we'd leave they gave us great suggestions if we didn't have plans. All of the staff was GREAT! Check-in went so fast. And shocker, we got a free upgrade to ocean view and WOW what a big room. 2 mornings in a row we saw whales jumping from our hotel window. We had a refrigerator. We got bottled water everyday & chocolates. Loved the bathroom. Check-out we learned something new, they have a hospitality room for those of us with late flights. We could stay at the resort all day and go in there to shower, lay down on a couch that was in a room and nap, 2 desktop computers, or just lounge in a comfy chair and watch tv. I've never had this offer at any hotel.The Dolphins to visit every day was very enjoyable.Our kids went to the Keiki Club 2 times and they LOVED it! They made lots of crafts and got a t-shirt each time. And the staff made sure to reapply sunblock on the kids.Pool area, yeah it needs upgraded but I'd prefer to have the heated pool to enjoy instead of it being closed........just saying. The beach is nice and quiet, not high tide. BADS:Restaurants.........Too Pricey........we ate here 1 time during our 8 night stay $125 by the pool and not worth it. Yes the resort is high priced, but I am not gonna spend $200 per meal for my family of 4. And yes even for breakfast which I thought was unheard of. I will say what I saw at the buffet for sushi lovers was well worth the $ but our girl can't stand any fish & there was no substitute foods for her. This is my only reason I would not stay here again. I'm just the type that can find better use with that amount of money. Be careful about parking your car rental........the cost is to be $30 something a day and we looked at a receipt and it was $206 for 1 day. The hotel took it off our bill and then told us what to do with our parking ticket. I wish we were told that ahead of time. Pillows looked elegant just not my type on comfort. And I knew they were full size beds but I wish more resorts would offer queen beds. Summary:It's an elegant place to stay away from the hustle. Be prepared to spend a lot of money on food.

Well, it took me 13 years to return to the Kahala, and not for lack of desire. When I was there 13 years ago, it was the Mandarin Oriental. I was surprised the hotel has not changed much at all in terms of appearance and renovations. I love the traditional Hawaiian theme and there is something very Don Draper/Mad Men about this hotel. It is like stepping back in time a little bit. It could definitely use some polishing up, though. The pool tiles are worn and there are signs of wear and tear here and there, but all in all, nothing major. The service has gone down a notch since my last visit, although overall it we were pretty well taken care of. We reserved a Dolphin Lanai room and were pleasantly surprised at the size and comfort of the room...until it was time to go to sleep. There was a repetitive noise coming from the water pipes that kept us up all night long. When we first called the desk they sent an engineer to take care of it who made it clear he was not there to listen to our complaints of sleep deprivation and told us to talk to the front desk about that. We inquired at the front desk about changing rooms, because, well at $600 a night, you should get a good night's sleep. We were told we would have to change rooms twice if they relocated us. With a little nudging from me, my husband contacted the night manager who was able to put us into a suite. The new room was very nice and we were very comfortable for the remainder of our stay, however we missed having a lanai. The breakfast buffet at the Plumeria was great. The room package we chose had it included, so we did eat there every morning. We also ate at the Veranda and at the poolside restaurant. The service at the pool was surprisingly good. We reserved a lounge chair with the shade and they were quick to come around when we raised the umbrella. We also sat at one of their tables once and had a great chat with our server while we sipped on mai tais and enjoyed a small snack. The Veranda was fun. There were some cute couples dancing and we enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere there. On Valentine's day we had reservations at Hoku. I had seen the menu ahead of time and noticed there was only red meat options for an entrée and requested a seafood substitution for myself. They noted it and had it available. The reservation was hard to get and they made it sound like it was going to be an unforgettable dining experience. However, I was SUPER disappointed that it was the exact same dish I had the previous night at the Veranda, their casual dining spot. Not only that, but the fish tasted like it had been sitting in a buffet dish for a while. It was dry and tasted like it had been cooked in mass quantities. I wasn't surprised to see the same fish show up the next morning at the buffet. The overall Valentine's dinner experience was disappointing, even aside from the seafood dish. Especially for the price they charged for the holiday meal, it simply was not worth it. The best feature of this hotel by far is it's location and pristine beach. It's away from the Waikiki scene, but not to far that you can't run to Duke's for a sunset cocktail. One of the best things we did while at the Kahala was to schedule a photography session with Pacific Dream Photography. They are located on site and the session is free. We thought we would have one or two photos that we would like but we ended up with over a hundred that we fell in love with. Loryn was so great to work with and she is an extremely talented photographer. Overall, everything was overpriced at the hotel, but we had a great time spoiling ourselves. I would have given five stars in my rating but for the Hoku dining experience.

The Kahala is like no other resort on Oahu. Private beach, manicured grounds, Dolphins swimming under hotel, turtles being hand fed along with sting rays in separate pools. Food is excellent. Private golf course. Free shuttle to town. Friendly employees. Excellent security. Not inexpensive, but worth the price. Lorna in reservations is a long time employee and did her best to get 5 adjacent rooms for our family.

The Kahala is one of the most luxurious hotels we've ever stayed in. The rooms are very well appointed, the grounds are beautiful and the 6 dolphins that live on site are delightful. We were treated like royalty while staying, which is the ultimate treat while on vacation. We loved reading the wall of fame showing all the famous people who have stayed here. The hotel is beachfront which adds to the charm

We loved this hotel! It sits on a beautiful, serene location, far from the madness of Waikiki but close enough to visit the great restaurants and sights of the island. The service is impeccable, friendly and warm, all the employees were eager to help at any time. There are plenty of ways to relax: pool, beautiful beach, bar, several oceanfront restaurants, spa, outdoor yoga classes, soothing ocean views featuring sunrises and sunsets!We highly recommend staying in the Dolphin Lagoon Wing - we had a beautiful view which included the ocean and we really enjoyed watching the dolphins and their caregivers work their magic all day long. This included shows and popular tourist "encounters" but also vet services and general training. Our room was lovely, clean, and had plenty of storage space. There is a waterfall nearby and we enjoyed its calming sound.The hotel's Hoku restaurant (named for the youngest dolphin, born here) is fantastic, with a great Pris Fixe option. We hit the best restaurants around and this was high on the list. After dinners, we'd relax in the Veranda where an excellent pianist entertained nightly. We also recommend getting the breakfast-included package - a great buffet with many choices (including breakfast for Japanese and European guests) that will save your having to leave the hotel. There are no nearby options. Ask for availability of other packages which will save you money.All around, a wonderful place to stay - the perfect place to experience Oahu. We can't wait to go back!Tips: we rented a car for getting around the island but took cabs to and from dinners in Waikiki (average $25 plus tip each way). We loved our dinner at Roy's in Hawaii Kai (15-20 minutes east), a much better choice than the Roy's in Waikiki.

You should come visit this delightful hotel. You can park for up to four hours if you get validation. Get some food or drinks out near the pool.The Dolphins, Manta Rays and Sea Turtles are worth the visit alone.

First the bad:They don't have firm pillows, I would kind of expect that this caliber hotel would have firm pillows.That's all the bad.Now the good:Great shower, i'd be fined here in California for that kind of water pressure, quite a luxury!Rooms were very big and clean.Bed was about perfect.The gym has the best view of any hotel I've stayed at. I got to watch the sunrise from the treadmill everyday. Very cool.The bathroom was also great, definitely designed for 2 people to get ready. The sinks were opposite each other and the side with he stool had a magnifying mirror.The location is great if you want to be close to all the Honolulu stuff but be away from the zoo that is Honolulu. Diamond Head is a very quick 10 minute or so ride.I can probably keep going on the good, we had a very restful stay.I can't wait to go back!

We had such a lovely holiday at this beautiful, majestic, landmark hotel.The feel of " the good ol' days" lingers there, transporting you back to bygone a era, the 60's. The service is excellent and the atmosphere relaxed. We chose this hotel for the Dolphin Encounter for my daughter, the staff were terrific and we learned a great deal about marine life and the Dolphins that reside. We will return some day, I hope.

This old grand dame is not what she once was. In a state of disrepair all around the property. Towels and chair covers at pool should be tossed. Pool tiles in sad shape. Place mats in Plumeria were also in bad shape. The only plus was a very helpful valet staff. They seemed to be the only ones on staff who knows what is going on. Gave better advice on where to go, what to eat than the Concierge. This was my third visit here over the years. Would never return. Sadly, this trip was in celebration of my 60th birthday...and this is what I will remember.

Upon arrival, we were placed into a large corner suite on the third floor. The variety of views were special. Out of our bedroom, we could see mountains and the Waialae golf course.Out on the substantial sized balcony we overlooked the lagoon with the dolphins and a great ocean view. Oddly, the living room which had one wall facing the lagoon and ocean only had a very small window facing the ocean. Not sure why the view was not captured by a larger window. The suite had two large bathrooms each complete with stall showers, bathtubs and large closet space. The décor was nice and the suite was quite spacious. The suite contained heated toilets which hissed like snakes every time you approached them. The hot water took quite a long time to heat up in both showers so that was annoying. The cable tv reception in both rooms had little synapses which was also quite annoying. The grounds are really beautiful with a lovely beach and protected shore line so you can swim or walk along the beach without the huge pacific waves. The breakfast buffet was quite good in a lovely setting and was included with our rate except for expresso drinks which were over $7 with tax. We are always annoyed and mystified by the extra expresso charge. Similarly, there was free wifi which had a very weak signal. They offered high speed internet for an absurd cost of $20 a day. Again, when you are playing huge daily room rates, the nickel and diming for expresso drinks and high speed internet are totally annoying. One other annoying thing is the hotel's relationship with the private Waialae Country Club which literally adjoins the property. You can play tennis at the Waialae for the significant sum of $62 for one hour of court time but the hotel has no access to the Waialae's Championship golf course ( home of the Sony Open).The hotel has dolphins ( including a dolphin quest), sea turtles and sting rays which are very special, beautiful and exciting. They have a fascinating photo gallery off the lobby including photos of many famous guests that have stayed there and it is well worth looking at. The hotel is in the beautiful Kahala neighborhood which is worth walking around. It is close to Diamondhead and to the Doris Duke home in Kahala which is absolutely spectacular. Unfortunately, you have to go to the Honolulu Museum of Art to take a shuttle bus to the Duke home but it is well worth doing. The staff was excellent. We would definitely return. Importantly it is not too near the tacky and incredibly busy Wakiki beach area. Overall, we had a wonderful 7 day stay.

The rooms are big and comfortable, we had views of the golf course and had a balcony which was great, the beds are very comfy and we always have the best nights sleep at the Kahala. The breakfast is very good with lots of choice and the service as always is great, there is a free shuttle that runs you back to Waikiki among other destinations and is a great way to sightsee. We will return

If you are looking for a relaxing, pampered experience away from the crowds of Waikiki, then make a reservation at the Kahala. The staff are welcoming without being overbearing; the restaurants are very good, and the facilities are first rate--the beach is simply one of the best in the islands. The Kahala is small enough to feel intimate and not impersonal. Truly a world class resort.

Kahala was one of the first hotel I've ever stayed at in Oahu. I recently went back to dine at Hoku's but since it was closed for lunch got a bite to eat at Plumeria Beach House instead. Brought back some good memories.The location of the resort is completely different than anything in Waikiki. Deep in high end residential area of Kahala, it's a good 20 minutes away by car to Waikiki. The oceanfront space is superior than Royal Hawaiian due to there being less crowds. If you enjoy lounging on the sand for hours on your vacation, this is the space for you. Of course being from LA I still prefer Manhattan Beach for that.The decor and rooms itself is what really gives the hotel 4 instead of 5 stars. The decor is nice but there are areas that are simply too dated. The black aluminum framed window in the lobby, the furniture looking like it could use an updating, the toilet in the restaurant was unfit for a high end resort. I looked at several rooms in the hotel before settling on one. The front desk staff was wonderful as they accommodated my request for a room change without any hint of resistance. The rooms were all fairly mediocre to be perfectly honestly. The layouts were a little strange as well like a remodel gone a smidgen wrong. However when night time comes staying at this property is wonderful. They have live music in the lobby piano bar, great seafood tower at Hoku's, and calm & peaceful waterfront to just sit at and listen to the waves. It is a complete 180 versus the drunken shenanigans of Waikiki. Sleep is also great as it's perfectly quiet here nestled in between a golf course, the ocean, and the high end Kahala neighborhood.Great place to be and I hope the owners improve upon their gem of a hotel in the coming years. Hire a great GM, really nail down the nitty gritties, and turn this hotel into the 5-star hotel I know that it can be.

Went here with the whole family- 2 kids under 7yrs - loved this place! The heated pool is small but perfect for us and wasn't busy when we were there. Pool staff helpful and there are pool toys for the kids. Fun seeing the puffer fish being trained and watching the manta rays in shallow pool. Dolphins are always entertaining. The breakfast buffet is much better than what we had at Four Seasons Maui and as an added bonus was included with our room rate booked through Costco online.

It's been ten years since my last stay and (scathing) review of The Kahala here on tripadvisor and I'm happy to report the hotel is wonderful again. I've stayed at this property many times over the years, ever since it was The Kahala Hilton. I recently stayed two nights, out of nostalgia mainly, and was delighted. The property looks absolutely terrific and the people were, without exception during my visit, were the most friendly and welcoming I've ever had. (It was great to see Bob again at Hoku's!)I booked a mountainside room with lanai for old times sake, since that is the type of room I used to get years ago before graduating to ocean views and suites. The mountainside view is beautiful, and the Sony Open golf tournament was going on just below my balcony at the country club that adjoins the back of the hotel.The grand hotel lobby is stunning and peaceful, the hotel grounds and rooms updated, rooms clean with every amenity.The only surprising downside - and I didn't expect this at all- is that I didn't sleep well. I didn't find the bed or pillows as comfortable as I would have liked. I first thought that maybe I was just having an off couple of nights, but when I switched over to Halekulani for 6 more nights to join friends I slept incredibly well and peacefully. The super comfy bedding at Halekulani (also a wonderful hotel but in need of some refurbishment soon - see my recent review) was the only area The Kahala disappointed. One quibble about the room: They place a small, heavy, round black table in the middle of the room. After tripping over it in the dark twice (ouch!) I placed it against a wall. You can see it in the room photo I have attached to this review. I recommend they remove them or place them elsewhere.Plumeria Beach House has an absolutely amazing buffet on some evenings of the week. My friends and I tried it during our stay at Halekulani and we were all greatly impressed. In fact, looking back we all named it the highlight of our trip.

The Kahala hotel is located in a residential area of Kahala on the island of Oahu. I thought it was really expensive and lacked excitement. The experience here is different then all the other hotels I have stayed at in Hawaii. My favorite thing about this hotel is the chandelier in the lobby. Or maybe it was in the dining room. Sadly, it's the only thing I remember about liking this hotel.The location is not in an area that offers much off property. I would say this is definitely more for tourist not wanting a local flair. I felt it could have been anywhere in the world not feeling Hawaii and definitely not the spirit of Aloha.

We recently completed a stay at the Kahala Hotel and were blown away by its beauty and the genuine service of its incredible staff. From the moment we checked in, we felt privileged to experience such a wonderful place. From the front desk associate sending up a beautiful cake for our son's first birthday to Delia from housekeeping making up our son's pack and play like it was meant for a King - the service at the Kahala was truly genuine and beyond outstanding. On the Room front, we found our room to be beautiful with wonderful views and spotless. The lagoon with Dolphin Quest was a hit - and we really appreciated Coleen's thoughtful responses to everyone's questions. It was clear she really loves her job and the animals. Overall, the Kahala was the best part of our holiday in Hawaii - a top notch hotel that makes you feel special, even if you are ordinary.

I enjoyed this resort very much. It is a peaceful and refreshing alternative to the busy hotels of Waikiki. We stayed in a room facing the dolphin lagoon. There are six dolphins that live at the resort and interact with guests throughout the day. If you are considering a dolphin lagoon room, be sure to ask for one centrally located on the lagoon. The beach is calm and pristine and the pool is very clean and well staffed. I would definitely stay here again.

We have stayed at the Kahala (right after the New Year) at the same time of year for the past 5 years and have always found it to be a relaxing, enjoyable experience. We love the isolation of the hotel and that it is apart from the busy-ness of Waikiki--if you want to be in the heart of the action in Waikiki there is plenty to choose from there. We love the beach at the Kahala and although the pool is nice, we gravitate to the quieter peaceful beach area.We have never been disappointed in the location of our room, and choices range from several hi-rise rooms with/without lanais to our favorite beach-front rooms. Sometimes it has taken some juggling at check-in, but Carlos the Assistant Manager has come to know us, and always seems to get us into the perfect room. The rooms we have inhabited have always been nicely appointed, comfortable, with spacious bathrooms and comfortable beds. I have read comments that the hotel is in need of updating, but I have noted that the Halekulani in downtown Honolulu (which would be a comparable hotel) has similar criticisms in its reviews. Maybe its the service, the warmth of the employees, and the overall "Aloha" spirit" of the Kahala, but I never notice the imperfections since the positives outweigh them. Breakfast is delicious and we also enjoy Hoku as well as having a pre-dinner cocktail in the verandah. Housekeeping employees, the valet staff (always addressing us by name), desk staff stand out in my mind as always being friendly and accommodating. We check-out right before the start of the Sony Open, which I know can be a busy time at the Kahala--but I have no complaints about attention to our needs during our time of stay. Can't wait to return next year!

Our family of four stayed at the Kahala Hotel in a one bedroom partial ocean view scenic suite for three nights on our way from Australia to the US/Canada and then again for one night on our routine route home. We chose the Kahala because it was set in a quieter area than the rest of Honolulu and it was about half an hour by taxi from the airport. We loved:The grounds and general ambience are lovely and relaxing and well cared forThe christmas decorations were beautifulPlumeria breakfasts - excellent food, beautiful location and exceptional staffDolphins and marine animalsView from our room over the mountains and seeing a breathtaking rainbow or twoPersonalised welcome and treats for the kidsStaff who went out of their way to make our trip specialOur kids commented on how nice everyone was (generally in Hawaii) - out of the 12 or so places we visited and stayed at across the US and Canada Hawaii was the standout for service and friendliness!Not so keen on:A lot of the balcony and outdoor furniture is quite rusted and several pool tiles missing. A few stains on lounge/sofa bedComparatively very expensive

Don't let the cost weigh you down. Call it a splurge. It's the only hotel that is away from the business of Waikiki.  I never valet parked in my entire life, yet this was one of the best parts of the hotel. The cost difference between valet and self park is not much at all. Aside from this being a fabulous architectural structure, the rooms are fabulous.They have those high tech toilets that you'd probably find in Japan. The service here went above and beyond! Thank you to the management and housekeeping for making my stay here fabulous. I left the day before my birthday but they still left this fabulous red velvet birthday cake for me :) The valet parking helped as well by lending us towels to go to the beach. There is a wall of famous people who have stayed at this hotel, so if it was good enough for Princess Diana, pretty sure it's going to be good enough for you!Dining:Not that you need to but you can make an open table reservation for Plumeria. The beach cafe is a little more casual than Plumeria, but both provide great menus! Please note that they do not have the chip card technology for payments with a credit card, so don't panic when they take the card away to get processed. Beach:I am not a huge fan of crowds and Kahala beach is perfect for that reason. Pools:There aren't huge pools here, but one main one, a hot tub and a kiddie pool. *note that for the beach and pool you can order food from the sea side cafe! Please don't be overwhelmed by the grand stature of the hotel, the staff are so friendly, not pretentious, and very helpful.EntertainmentIn the evening there is live music at The Verandah, open air near the lobby. I was here several years ago and the set up of The Verandah was different, I preferred it back then, it seemed more lounge like, now there are tables and chairs and seems to be a different configuration of the band. (Then again, it could be because at the time I was there, a giant Christmas tree was in the lobby). Near the pool there are resident dolphins, manta ray and turtle. If you want to do the Dolphin quest, this is the only place that you can swim and interact with the dolphins. If you want to watch you can do that too. The wifi connection is excellent! If you preferred a wired connection, check the business centre.

Wow an amazing hotel in an amazing location. We stayed in an ocean view lanai that was the biggest deluxe room I have ever stayed in, huge bathroom! You pay for for the privacy and quality but ifs worth the spoil. This was a 25th anniversary gift to each other and the hotel recognised this with bubbles and dessert.Kahala is a 5 star hotel and deserves this rating. If I can afford it in the future I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Luxury.

Checked In this afternoon to the Kahala hotel. This is our 4th visit in 4 years..we come every January for 8 days with our 2 sons. We are return visitors and always stay in the Ocean front interconnecting rooms. We visit the Hilton HawaiianVillage Ali'I tower Waikiki in interconnecting ocean front rooms the week prior to the Kahala. We are always treated like return guests should be and personally remembered by the Hilton hotel staff. Unfortunately last year at the Kahala our rooms were not as we had booked and we were told that was all they could offer. This year we have arrived to a very similar situation whereby we were not given the rooms we had booked ie interconnecting rooms for our children and had to unfortunately argue our way into the rooms we had originally booked way back in February only to be put on level 3! We are not treated like return guests should be nor do they ever acknowledge that we stay for over a week in the full ocean front room with our children. We will travel to Hawaii as usual next January but unfortunately will never stay at the Kahala Hotel again.Disappointing!!

We have enjoyed staying at the Kahala Resort many times over the past few years. We have no reason to go elsewhere. The service is top notch from the front desk to housekeeping to the beach cabanas. We love so many things about the Kahala. We love the buffet breakfast as you sit beachside and enjoy the peace. There is no Waikiki hustle and bustle. The Plumeria Beach House provides excellent beachside food and drinks. The kids can snorkel and paddle board or kayak. The restaurants on site are delicious. Waikiki is accessible by their complimentary shuttle service. The on site spa is heaven on earth. I really have nothing negative to say. the Kahala provides the peace of Hawaii with accessibility to the frenetic pace of Waikiki. I wish to keep coming back and continue the tradition. A special shout out to Carlos who is always a pleasure to talk to at the front desk.

Loved this place - 1920's style glamour with updated amenities! The staff and service was top notch! an amazing number of famous faces have visited the hotel over the years - the wall hangings of famous movies stars is astonishing. I really enjoyed my morning stroll observing the fish & sea turtles in the lagoons.

The Kahala Hotel was a wonderful experience, right from the moment that you walk in the door. Rooms are great, beds are great, views are great, eateries are fantastic and the service is top notch.The gallery of people who have stayed is also worth a look. The hotel is far enough out of the Waikiki area, but close enough to go if you wish and there is a shuttle service - good value for money.

I began staying at this hotel in the late 70's when on a business trip to Honolulu for Vogue Magazine. The company had me staying at a hotel down on the Waikiki Beach but it was wildly noisy, so I moved to this oasis of calm and returned too many times to remember. Each time I came here the warm staff was welcoming, helpful and so service-oriented. The hotel itself runs like clock work and everything here is beautifully done and reliable. The restaurant, the room service, you name it: the Kahala has the art of service down to a science as well as running a first rate hotel. I even stopped here on route to Australia and booked a room for half a day for dinner, a shower, and some time at the beach to break up the long trip. It's that wonderful.
user_name:
acbas
New York City, New York

review_body: After coming to the island for the first time since 1977...we wanted a place to stay that was away from the downtown area. We were on our honeymoon and wanted the peace and tranquility that the Kahala had to offer. After reading so many positive reviews and searching the island for a hotel we decided on the Kahala. And we were not disappointed. When we first arrived late into the evening, we were not thrilled with how indifferent the 2 male staff were that greeted us after we found the odd location for the front desk. It's not what you'd expect for such a fine resort. Kind of tucked away from the big lobby area. The 2 young men were in no hurry to help us as one of them was busy on his cell phone chatting with a friend. The other man really didn't seem to care we had asked for a room (several weeks in advance) that was from any elevators, pop machines, or maid service stations. We asked for a room that was on an upper floor away from any noise and my husband wanted to see the room before we checked in. So we went and looked at the room he offered (which I think was on the 6th floor) and we looked at it, it was not what we expected. Pretty much a basic room with a view towards the golf course and the truck loading/unloading area. It was also too close to the elevators so not what we asked for when we made our reservation. We had also called before we left home to make sure we got what we had asked for. Since these 2 men at the front desk were not too helpful and didn't really seem to care what we wanted, they seemed to just want us checked in so we would not disrupt their phone calls and their own visiting time with one another. When we went back down to the front desk and asked to view another room that was more to our liking, they acted like we were making trouble for them and just wanted us out of their hair. Since they said the hotel was full they only had one other room to show us (I think it was on the 9th floor) so we went and looked at that and decided to just take it. Even though it was pretty much the same room as the one on the 6th, we took it as it was after 9:00 then and we were very tired after all our travels from the mainland. But during the night, the toilet kept running, there were the sounds of the elevator that kept going, and the trucks made a lot of noise the next morning. Since we were staying a week, we decided we weren't going to stay at the Kahala. That is...until we met with a manager in the morning that was the most incredibly helpful woman we had ever met! She went out of her way to help us move to a room that was more to our liking. She was amazing and we ended up having the honeymoon we dreamed of because of her! What a view we had from their 2 story building that's right on the beach! Thanks to her...we will never forget our special time in Oahu and will definitely return to the Kahala!

We stayed at the Kahala for 6 nights during our honeymoon in December 2015. We chose this hotel after researching a few others in the centre of Waikiki and are so glad we did.We checked in at 2pm and were greeted with a fresh lei. Our room was ready and our bags were taken up for us. The bellhop was a lovely man and gave us info on the hotel, pointing out our restaurant options etc. He explained where everything was in the room and double checked we were OK with it all before leaving us.The room was so nice and airy, we had a view of the golf club in the country club next door out of a long window which stretched nearly the whole length of the room. There is also another little window above the bed which helped make the room seem so airy and open. The bathroom was a great size as was the main room and it was spotlessly clean and well maintained. There was a fridge for personal use in the bathroom and enough glassware if needed and a coffee machine.We both had a 4 drawer dresser so there was more then enough room for all of our clothes and the closest was also big enough to take our 2 suitcases. The safe was big enough to hold our phones, iPad and 13" MacBook and our passports etc. It also had enough hanging space as well and lots of spare towels, dressing gowns and slippers.The bed was really comfortable and the turn down service of an evening was a nice touch. The staff were all so friendly and welcoming. The pool area was also clean and the poolside bar/restaurant had a good drinks list. The beach was lovely too and there were enough beds everywhere. We loved the hot tub the most as the water temperature was like a very warm bath so it was hard to get of sometimes! We only ate at the poolside bar during our stay, it was nice food and not too unreasonably priced considering we were so far out of Waikiki. The free shuttle to Waikiki is a great amenity, the last one is at 9:45pm and the schedule is on their website. On our first visit there we were so pleased we had chosen to stay outside of Waikiki as it is just like a big city. It was nice to get back to the peace and calm of the Kahala. If you want to visit other places, you will need a car. Parking is $32 a day for self park or valet. We picked up our reserved car from the Hertz office in the hotel - the guy was really rude and pushy so I would not do this again, I would pick our car up at Honolulu airport. It was also busy with a queue outside his office which I think he was getting a bit stressed with, hence him being rude. On our last day the Honolulu marathon was on and the Kahala was great at informing us all what our options were if had to get to the airport or another part of Oahu - a info sheet was left on the bed with our turn down service. Overall we loved loved loved our stay here and did not want to leave, even though we had another week in another hotel on Oahu. We will definitely stay at this hotel again next time we are in Oahu, it was just pure paradise. Aloha!

Truly amazing in every way shape and form! Everyone bent over backward make my stay OVER THE TOP! From the front desk to the Chi fitness complex ..it was a 10! I did not expect the level of service, kindness and perfection!

This is the single most overpriced hotel I have ever been to. And we frequent Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton and other high end hotels so this is really saying something. To call it a five star resort is a laugh. It is not only frayed at the edges and stuck in -at best 1985-the staff is rude, unhelpful with an attitude and seemingly overwhelmed. The location is pretty but the pool is inadequate for the number of guests and occupied 24/7 by screaming children. We couldn't use it or the jacuzzis in 7 days.The beach staff is surly ( especially the manager) and comes around very infrequently. You are supposed to raise a flag if you want service but you could still wait over a hour and have to get up and get your drink yourself anywayThe restaurant staff is overwhelmed and could use the help of some bus staff. Even in an empty restaurant it takes twice as long as it should to eat. And the menu is unimaginative and offers no healthy choices. Hokus and Arancino are both good it cost $700 for dinner for 6.The bars are the worst- drinks are super expensive and taste watered down. Have to order a double, which makes it a $26 vodka and soda.The concierge staff, Cameron especially, was the only bright spot. They were wonderful and helped arrange some fun off property activities.Showers had mold. The hangers looked used. Furniture mismatched and stained. Time for a renovation or a downgrade in stars.Had a nice time because I was with my family but will never return to this resort. If I could have gotten my money back and changed hotels I would have in a minute but over Christmas they wouldn't allow that:(

My husband and I spent the first few days of our honeymoon at the Kahala Hotel & Resort in May of 2015. We are now ruined for all other hotels, because nothing can live up to the Kahala! Every morning we were greeted by the friendliest front desk staff, and the valet was incredible. There was a slight delay in getting our car one morning (somebody had double-parked behind us) and they went above and beyond apologizing, asking if they could call us a taxi, etc. We were not in a rush to go anywhere, we were on vacation! But that just goes to show what an absolutely amazing staff the Kahala has. I can't say enough good things about the Kahala... We can NOT wait to come back! I need more of the waffles with coconut syrup & fresh guava juice for breakfast!

The staff was excellent at the hotel and at the restaurant. It rained pretty much the whole time we were there and it was still an amazing experience. If you are looking for an upscale hotel with a comfortable feel this is the place for you. The room was clean and comfortable. The only issue I had was that there was a palm tree directly in the view of the dolphin lagoon slightly obstructing my view of the dolphins playing. The visit was pretty much perfect. We are still talking about it.
user_name:
Rachel D
Brooklyn, New York, United States

review_body: We arrived at Honolulu at around 6am expecting a car to be there to pick our group of 8 up as booked but to our surprise there was no car. Not the end of the world we thought but not the best start. Luckily, the rooms and breakfast buffet were fantastic for the whole trip. Unfortunately, the concierge was not great as on a few occasions he really stuffed us around. We had booked a boat charter for our group of 8 through the hotel, they knew we had a group of 8 yet booked us onto the boat of 6 as that was the biggest yet failed to tell us until we got an into ready slip under our door. Wasn't exactly fun to decide who would sit out the boat charter for the day. One thing that was great was the free bus shuttle to and from the hotel into waikiki, Stephanie the driver was fantastic and had great tips. If you are wanting some couple time around Christmas I would not recommend this hotel as it is full of families and children, we didn't use the pool once as it was too packed with children, the beach however is divine. If you want a private umbrella on the beach expect to pay up- it isn't cheap. Overall, we did have a great time but there are a few things that need to be fixed, the biggest is management during a bust time of the year. There's no excuse to mess around a large group of 8.

I have been to the Kahala Resort many times in the past 30 years. Despite several ownership changes, the staff never fails to make guests feel at home. Rooms are comfortable, breakfast is great (especially sitting outside the Plumeria Room and looking at the beach). My grandchildren (ages 4-1) were always made to feel comfortable, as long as their parents. The Resort makes families feel welcome and they go out of their way to make sure that children are always comfortable. Each time I have to leave, I would love to extend my stay. Everyone that I know (there were 29 of us on this trip), friends and family feel the same way. The rooms are large, the pool/beach area is great and what can be more relaxing than watching dolphins at play!

We stayed at the ocean view room. I am reviewing this after staying at the Trump Waikiki.Pros:- private beach- dolphins, manta rays, turtles lagoon which was fun for the kidsCons:- staff was not very friendly- hotel is old and room and bathroom look old and feels dirty, especially the carpet- not much amenities offered. Only bathrobe and slippers- location is very far from everywhere, a taxi to Waikiki will cost about 20usd one way- breakfast area was too crowded, had to wait for a good 20 minutes before getting a tableNot worth the price and would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

We booked The Kahala 11 months ago for our Family Christmas Vacation, together with my Parents & my sisters Family we reserved 5 rooms. 2 x 2 interconnecting Ocean view rooms, and an Ocean Front Suite for my parents. ( these are located on the 6th, 7th & 8th floors) The view from all 5 rooms was beautiful, although very exposed to the elements. This will be however the only time we will stay at The Kahala, we found it impossible to secure a dinner reservation at one of the hotels 3 dining establishments during our 12 night stay, & therefore were forced to frequent the local shopping mall and Waikiki for dining options, not good when you have elderly parents. The staff were unwilling to even take our rooms numbers should a cancellation come up during our stay, & even after offering to split our party into a 6 & a 4 their response was " we just can't help you" The resort literally shuts up and goes to sleep by 10.30pm. The overall condition of the hotel is also in desperate need if maintenance, especially their extremely small pool area that has tiles missing everywhere. The hotel has no guest laundry, which I think in this day and age, with families travelling for extended periods of time is essential. If you search the peacefulness of being away from Waikiki, allow me to suggest you fly to one of the outer islands, as we have done for past Christmas's and what we will be doing again after this stay at The Kahala. To finish on a positive note, the Housekeeping staff greet you every morning and evening with such warmth & friendliness, nothing is ever a problem & no request to great, something your Reception & Restaurant staff could learn from them. Not a good option for a Family Vacation!!

As a family of five with three children we spent our fall vacation on Oahu and chose the Kahala Hotel & Resort as our accommodation for 14 days. This is not one of the hotels at Waikiki-Beach where one hotel was placed next to the other and the beaches are quite crowded. The Kahala was built in a pleasant residential neighborhood beyond Diamond Head and thus away from Honolulu. The Kahala has a nice private beach and is surrounded by a wonderful park. The hotel site comprises a lagoon with dolphins the guests can swim with. The staff is mainly Japanese, very polite, attentive, friendly and extremely service-oriented. The hotel stay starts with a warmhearted reception at the front desk. The hotel rooms are quite spacious, well-furnished, but not over styled. We had two interconnecting mountain view rooms with a sunrise experience every morning and breath-taking views of the Oahu mountain range near Kahala. The breakfast can be enjoyed right at the fringes of the Pacific underneath wonderful palm trees, listening to the pleasant sound of the ocean waves. The breakfast buffet is just perfect and comprises offer for each and every customer and each and every taste - a remarkable experience. The swimming pool at the Kahala is quite small, however, we never used it as it was far more thrilling to swim in the ocean and do canoeing or stand-up paddling (offered by the hotel). Whenever you want to be at the pulse of Honolulu, after a 15 min drive you are there. Quite near to the hotel, there is the Kahala Mall, a smaller, but nice shopping center with a selected number of restaurants incl. Pizza Hut and Panda Express for a quick lunch. The Kahala is very close to Hanauma Bay and Oahus east coast with Chinaman's Hat and the Polynesian Cultural Center. All the sites of the island a perfectly accessible from the Kahala (Dole Plantation, North Shore, Pearl Harbor etc.). In some areas the hotel needs some renovation; however, it is nevertheless a perfect place to stay when exploring the beauties of Oahu. It is a smaller hotel with a nice atmosphere and a limited number of guests. You will never have the feeling to be at a crowded, noisy place where you might have to stand in line or to queue up for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Being in the Kahala neighborhood offers you a vacation in a tranquil place right at the shore of the Pacific Ocean with a decent Japanese hotel management and concept. Enjoy the Sushi as well as a perfect French Onion Soup! Whenever we get back to Oahu, we will definitely choose the Kahala Hotel & Resport. It is a second-to-none experience!

WE have ben coming to this property since 1985. We have seen all the management changes with the ups and downs and now find the current inn keepers are doing an outstanding job of running this elegant property. The staff in the various dinning establishments are well directed and the food is well above average. The all important beach and pool are well looked after and for the most part the staff looks after things rather nicely. The only weakness is a below expected parking Valet service. A strong hand is needed to to put this service in proper order.

I was terribly disappointed in every way by this resort- the rooms, the pool area, the cabanas, the shopping arcade, and the weather! Apparently the wind often blows at speeds up to 45 mph plus during December. We are in the middle of our week's stay and I have wanted to go home every day. If you really want a luxury Hawaiian experience, try the Four Seasons resorts on Maui or the Big Islanc.

Kalaha Hotel is my favorite hotel on Oahu. It's close enough to Waikiki and Ala Moana where you don't need to deal with all the headache with foot traffic. Their pools are not as crowded and the beach is def not as crowded. If you want just relax and enjoy Honolulu, I highly suggest this resort. There are dolphins there too. Make sure to order their alcoholic beverage that's served in a real pineapple. It's the best!

The Kahala is the best! We loved our stay. We went on a mini vacation in March of 2015. We loved it so much that we came back in December for a longer stay. The Kahala is a luxury. The staff is super freindly. The accommodations are well portioned and the bed is confortable. The recent addition of toto toilet seats was also a nice touch. The beach is perfect for a lazy relaxing day or a nice swim. We love seeing the dolphins. Overall, the Kahala is a great little piece of relaxation away from the big city atmosphere of Waikiki. We love it and will be back next year.

What an amazing property. The highlight for our family was swimming with the Dolphins. We didn't stay at the hotel, but spent most of the day here when we came to swim with the Dolphins. We enjoyed two meals, shopping and exploring the grounds, but the highlight was dolphin quest experience. Now that we are familiar with the hotel, we would definitely stay here in the future. Watching the dolphins and other sea life in the lagoons was fantastic and I loved that the hotel was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was immaculate. I loved the history of seeing all of the heads of state and celebrities (pictures in halls) who have stayed there.

service is great. staff is authentic. problems are dealt with with honesty. the only problem I have is as more people discover the hotel the price may rise!!Rooms are large. Breakfast is wonderful. Ability to book tennis and golf next store is fantastic (tennis courts were well run and we were treated like members). The only time we see staff get up set is when they are not treated with respect (which is 100% the right time to get upset)

We had wanted to really like this hotel as an alternative to our usual hotel in Waikiki. Unfortunately we discovered there’s almost no shade around the pool or elsewhere on the grounds. The hotel is located in a residential area and is not convenient to city bus routes, and turned out to be too far away from the alternative activities (restaurants, shopping, nightlife, museums) we like to do when not reading in the shade next to the beach. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to Waikiki and to the nearby Kahala Mall, but fixed departure and pickup times are limited. The shuttle will not drop you off at the popular Diamond Head State Monument (picnic grounds, historic hiking trail) located between Kahala and Waikiki. The beach in front of The Kahala is average and suitable for families with small children because of the protected lagoon. The quality of the sand is not as soft as Kaanapali on Maui. If you are on a tour staying here you’ll probably be satisfied since your package likely includes off-site activities each day. If you are an independent traveler, you’ll have to rent a car. Other than watching the dolphins in the hotel lagoon, there’s little to do here. We had planned to relax and read in the shade of trees or umbrellas, but that turned out nearly impossible. On our second day we were not allowed to raise the umbrella shading our poolside lounge chairs because the wind was too strong, and yet the previous day was windier and all the umbrellas were raised. The first room we were given was not what we had reserved, but the hotel did relocate us quickly. Since we’ve had many ocean view rooms during previous Hawaii visits, the “scenic view” room was fine and less expensive. It looked out over the golf course, with beautiful early morning mountain and sky views. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. Placement of the extendable wall TV was odd, partially blocking the bathroom door. Separate “his & her” sink areas were convenient, with good storage/closet space and ample hangars. There was a large soaking tub and nice walk-in shower. The tile floor of the shower was somewhat slippery, but no non-skid mat was provided. Another small but noticeable omission: no soap was provided for the shower; just one bar at each sink. The patio furniture was rusting, with faded and torn fabric. Be careful with your room selection: a section of lower-level “partial ocean view” rooms are located above the noisy hotel entrance and parking garage. We ate at most of the hotel restaurants and enjoyed the Plumeria Room (ground level downstairs, indoor and outdoor seating) for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Off the main lobby The Veranda serves cocktails, appetizers and light dinner items. Both the Veranda and Plumeria Room provided good food and service. If you like a full breakfast your best value is to add the breakfast buffet package to your room rate since it includes taxes and gratuities and all you can eat! We enjoyed The Veranda several times, and one evening our server was especially personable --- can’t spell her long first name and she is originally from the Philippines. The Seaside Grill is located between the pool and beach and serves lunch and dinner. Unfortunately for lunch it has little shade over the tables and when it rains everyone scrambles to find cover. There is a bar next to the pool but during our weekend visit there was no poolside beverage service. Guests walked up to the bar to get their beverages. The pool looked old and is small for the number of chairs surrounding it. Chair cushions are covered in fabric which means the insides get wet from rain. You discover this after sitting down and getting wet shorts. The lobby of the hotel is pretty in an older-Hawaiian way, with interesting displays of Hawaiian cultural artifacts. Guests are greeted with orchid leis upon arrival. The Kahala Hotel seems popular with business groups (ample space for meetings and functions of all sizes), tour groups from overseas, and wedding events. Children and adults can participate in the in-water educational dolphin programs, which range from $125 for 15 minutes to $700 for 5-hour 30- minutes. The 1-hour $310 Dolphin Adventure was a unique experience. There is also a five-day “Trainer for a Week” program for $3,250.Overall the Kahala Hotel was disappointing. There is little to do, especially when there is no reliable shade to relax poolside or near the beach. Shade trees should be added on the Koko Head side of the lawn area next to the beach. Remove some of the lagoon area and oldest low-rise rooms and replace them with a beachside waterpark with slides and swim-up islands, like a smaller version of the Grand Hyatt Poipu. Make the Kahala more of a destination property since it is far away from alternative activities.

We absolutely LOVED working with Julia! She was animated, full of life, and willing to do anything to get the toddlers to smile! They were long overdue for naps and yet somehow between tears and meltdowns, she got those kiddos to smile for more than a few photos. Julia came onsite to our beach house rental which made it so easy for us as a large family. Everyone from the infant to the 66-year old grandpa loved her vivacious personality. We so appreciated the moments she captured during our family vacation and will cherish the photos for years to come.

Stayed here for anniversary with husband and newborn. Staff was very attentive and helpful with setting us up with crib and kama'aina specials/rates. We didn't do much, but it was nice to chill and do nothing at a nice resort!!!

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Oahu for the first time. When we arrived at the hotel we were blown away with how beautiful the grounds are! The staff couldn't have been more friendly, accommodating and helpful. Our room was on the 4th floor facing the golf course. We didn't have any ocean view but that was okay with us. The room was quite large and the bathroom was gigantic! Everything was spotlessly clean and had a super comfy bed. The beach area is great - the sand is really soft and there isn't a strong current. I love that this hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood and not in a busy part of town. We went to Waikiki Beach one night for dinner/drinks and it only confirmed that we made the right decision by not staying there. We were very pleased with everything and would likely stay here again if we return to Oahu.

I had only a short stay and this was the first time that time didn't fly when I was having fun - truly a delightful and must visit resort!The views, the relaxed location but an easy shuttle to Waikiki, the food, the amazing dolphins - The Kahala is truly a gem!

They advertise beachside service but they never come by. If you go to the outside bar they're bartenders ask you how to make the drink. They only know how to pour premixed sour drinks with very little alcohol. Jeez for these prices I expect knowledgeable and attentive staff. Gets two stars only for being on the beach in Hawaii.

I have traveled a number of time to the Kahala over the past 10 years and on my last visit, the signs of and aging hotel and concept is glaringly apparent. The setting though is beautiful, and set away from the hustle of Waikiki. We first checked into an ocean view room with a balcony. We looked out over the front entry and parking lot...and then the ocean. The bathroom was tiny, dated and with one sink so we moved to and ocean front room in the KOko head tower that was better. The spa suites were unique years ago, but the check in area now feels dated and uncomfortable. There is no common relaxation area. Our two deep tissue messages were $525 for 60 minutes and were just ok. They gave us a little snack when we pad the bill-- plastic cup like the kind you get take out condiments in with stale trail mix. I would expect way more for these prices. Our lunch of two salads and water at Plumeria was $98. The breakfast buffet is good (the price is higher on weekends) but it's exactly the same as 2006 right down to the maple glazed pancakes. Hoku's dinner was delicious but the waiters are stressed, literally running at times and leaving dirty dishes stashed on tables throughout the Resturant. Again, I would expect a higher level of refinement and meticulous attention to detail for the prices. I am suprised the hotel hasn't adapted to the latest food changes on the island- farm to table etc. In fact, they have adapted at all in the past 10 years. We enjoyed our stay despite the feeling of over paying and looking past the peeling paint and dated server uniforms.

Beautiful hotel. The rooms are spacious, and the bathrooms are wonderful, with a deep soaker tub,shower, individual sinks, closets and a high tech water closet.Bed very comfortable. We ordered room service and the meal wa delicious and delivered promptly. Love the location. .. near everything, but away from the bustle of Waikiki. We will define try stay here again.

We had a perfect 4 days of rest and relaxation at this resort. All of the services we used were top-notch. The Dolphins were really special too and our daughter really enjoyed that experience. The weekend buffet was OUTSTANDING and every meal we had - from the beach dining to restaurant dining - were great. Staff was perfectly attentive without being on top of you. Highly recommend and we will be back!

I travelled with my husband who had business in Oahu for several days. We had a room overlooking the dolphin pools. I enjoyed watching the shows/programs and even seeing the dolphins in the less busy hours. The beach at the hotel is small, but clean and well kept. This hotel is removed from the bustle of Waikiki which I like. It is almost the antithesis of an all inclusive resort. It will appeal more to an experienced traveller. I went into town to shop and we ate at some nice restaurants in the area, but mostly just enjoyed relaxing there. We inquired why so many Japanese choose to stay there and were told by a local that this is one of the few hotels with bathtubs, a preferred feature for that clientele. There were times that we felt like we were in a foreign country which we actually enjoyed as well, because it makes for good people watching! Because this is a family friendly hotel, the pool can be crowded with children at times so if you are trying to escape, you may need to go further away. This is definitely NOT a hotel for the party crowd, but more for those who want a quiet, family friendly environment.

Brother in-law and I brought my sister who's dying of cancer for a last visit to the islands. Mr. Azuma & Flora & team made this a very "beautiful and special trip"... Forever grateful for their love!

We spent a week at the Kahala. The room was a Dolphin Lanai first floor room. Absolutely gorgeous to watch the dolphins splashing about. It was quite spacious, clean and Island style furnished. They did a great parade for the kids at helloween. Beach is great for kids with just a tiny bit of break and sand all along. Pool is very nice, clean, with umbrellas for some sun protection. Service is lovely, attentative, and efficent. We did some SUP paddling which I can recommend for beginners. Breakfast is quite nice with a view of the sea.

This Resort is amazing! If you like peace and quiet with a private beach this the place.It is very classy. No selfie sticks here no people taking pictures of their food. No tacky people at all! I love this place. Well from their hall of fame what kind of people stays here from the Royalties Prince Charles to famous celeb like George Clooney. Need I say more? I didn't want to give a review cause I want this resort for myself only. But I loved it so much that I want to shout it out to the world. My heaven on earth paradise.The staff is so warm and so friendly. Thanks Heron! thanks Linda. You guys are the best!

We were there during an "off' time. Not reflected in room rates. Check in was a bit wiggy - no offer to show us to our room - even though it was the furthest from Check In. Strange. No 'welcome' back from the front desk - after staying there many times. Oh well. Our beach front (sand) room was as we left it a year ago, TV has been updated. Two small bottles of water offered at turn down. No towels offered for the lounges - had to pick them up. For these rates - they should have fresh towels as standard every day. Morning Buffet breakfast is quite good. Valet parking has a charge - even though the garage says full - valet only. There's not a better beach choice on the Island - imo. I'll be back.

My husband and 3 kids vacationed at the beautiful and gorgeous Kahala Hotel and Resort. We had the best time ever! From the moment we stepped out onto the front steps of The Kahala from our taxi to the moment where we left the front steps to hop back into our taxi, I can honestly say that The Kahala has exceeded our expectations. The staff who work there are very warm and friendly and very, very accommodating. The Kahala is a very elegant hotel and we were always greeted with kindness and smiles all the way. The level of service is absolutely outstanding! We have been returning to this hotel year after year and cannot imagine staying anywhere else but The Kahala Hotel and Resort. This is our Hawaiian home, our home away from home.

We don't usually stay at resorts of this caliber, but my husband's conference here led us to stay at the resort for 5 nights and it was absolutely wonderful. The service was great from all the staff we encountered. The grounds and beach area were beautiful and I visited the Dolphins every day. I appreciated being a little removed from the craziness of Waikiki-from what I saw its not an area where I would want to spend a lot of time. If this is within your budget, or even slightly out of your budget, I would encourage you to stay here.
user_name:
avalonbride36
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I am disappointed with the hotel's service and the attitude of the staff. Twice, the hotel closed restaurants at times different from their published times; the staff was unapologetic. The pool bar seems poorly staffed and there's is no clear signage to indicate when it is closed and when it is not. I had to wander to find someone to give me a towel. I sat in one chair and was told to move because another guest had reserved that row or chairs. I moved to another chair and was told I needed to pay to use those chairs under an umbrella. Again, NO SIGNAGE! The staff member was incredulous at my suggested fix. "A sign on every chair?!" she retorted. Yes! It's a simple pre-printed sign that says "reserved". Everywhere else in the world has them! Also, I was told there were no tables at the restaurant but the pool bar opens at 10:30an. While that statement is factual, it's completely misleading: the pool bar opens at 10:30 but doesn't start serving food until 11am.This isn't the worst hotel, it's just nowhere near five stars. I'd stay somewhere else.

My wife and I stayed in a suite for three nights in mid-November, 2015. The room itself was gorgeous with stunning views of the ocean, beach and the back of Diamond Head. We had a coffee maker, and espresso maker and a full bar set up in the room too. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom huge (and even had heated toilet seats) and lots of closet and dresser space. Room service was excellent: probably the best I have ever experienced in a luxury hotel. Not only was the food delivered hot, it came so fast I thought they must be reading my mind! One night we ate at the Verandah and it featured many tasty small plates in a quiet setting off the main lobby. Finally, the Spa also was very nice. Everyone we ran into treated us like we were royalty too.

Not impressed with the overall quality of this resort. Beach was ok, but there were no beach attendants who regularly checked in on us. Spa was awful; I paid over $300 for a mediocre warm stone massage. Sorry, at these prices I expect perfection.
user_name:
Paul D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was by far the best and most relaxing vacation I have ever taken. Everyone at the hotel was very welcoming and helpful. The food and other services were all exceptional. I can't wait to make this trip again!

Recently, I had the pleasure of staying at the exclusive Kahala Hotel and Resort on the island of Oahu. It was both delightful and memorable. The rooms at the Kahala are exceptionally large compared to most on the island. Ours was oceanfront and a minimum of 500 square feet. The view of the ocean, pool and beach was exceptional. The bathroom had two vanities, sinks, closets, a large modern shower and deep soaking tub. Service, including friendliness and efficiency, was impeccable from valet to housekeeping. The Dolphin Quest pools, along with the fish, turtle and ray pools were fascinating and exciting. My review is based on a comparison of the hundreds of hotels I've stayed in. It's plain to see why this one is one of the Leading Hotels of the World. It is certainly deserving of that designation, along with it's 5-star rating. I highly recommend this property to families, couples, and business travelers. There isn't enough room here to list all the positives this hotel offers. Staying at the Kahala was certainly a delightful experience and one I would like to repeat.

Stayed at the Kahala 4 nights. It was a wonderful stay. Overall I received impeccable service from the staff. Mostly dined at the Plumeria and the food was really quite good.The only thing I would point out is that even though the hotel was very well taken care of and the service is spot on, the hotel does have a dated look and fell to it which for me was a negative.In order for the hotel to truly be considered a luxury resort it needs at the very least to be updated (if not completely remodeled).

From the time you are met at the door when you enter the facility you are treated so special by everyone. Charles brought our bags to our room and every time we saw him he always asked if there was something he could help us with. He even remembered our names! How special is this? Our maid who kept our room so neat was Ling Ling, what a special person was she. She always went out of her way to make sure we had what we needed. God Bless her! All I can say is that the folks at the Kahala are special and are the main reason why we are returning in six months. If you are looking for a place to relax, to feel special, to enjoy what God has created then this is the place to come.

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel on a few occasions. Unfortunately we were disappointed and will never stay again. This hotel is at best 3 1/2 star rating. Patio tables are rusty, pool is cold, etc. We expressed our concerns about the pool only to be told use the jacuzzi or it's a matter of personal preference. I expressed my concerns at the time of checkout, but there was no real concern. Our anniversary and my husband's birthday experience at this hotel did not meet expectations. I do not recommend.

The staff at the Kahala resort exemplify the Aloha that we all hope to experience when visiting Hawaii. Each person we encountered, whether from housekeeping, front desk, concierge, room service, pool, or food and beverage areas, had a smile and greeting for us and were truly exceptional. The concierge staff member was especially kind and helpful to us; also the staff members working with the Dolphin Experience. We enjoyed all of our dining experiences at the Kahala, especially the Veranda; also tried Arancino for dinner and the Plumeria Beach House for breakfast.
