We stayed 4 nights and didn't want to leave - We got a room by the lagoon and my daughter wanted to spend as much time as possible near the Dolphins - Rooms and large and well appointed - It has the best restaurant in town and the lobby bar is brilliant - Love this place!

I had a great experience that a professional photographer from Pacific Dream took my family's picture at Kahara. We were satisfied with the photos very much because they were just so beautiful. Julia, the photographer was very kind and she knew the places where she could take the best photos in Kahara. Good thing was that her work was complemantary and we could decide to purcahse the photos or not later (I purchased). I truely recommend it.

Hadn't been to the hotel in 15 years. It was still a great experience, now with two teenagers. Very helpful concierge. Casual dining food prices a bit over the top, but otherwise it was a fabulous experience

The experience at the Kahala was great overall. Everything was, in my point of view, very expensive but the quality you would get met what you paid. Since we arrived at there rather late, all the shops was already closed but one of the staff was very kind to reopen a shop for us.
user_location: Rossio ao Sul do Tejo, Portugal
user_name:
aoffh
Rossio ao Sul do Tejo, Portugal

review_body: Haven't been back to the Kahala in over 20 years but it's still a special place. Check-in is smooth an easy. Resort is elegant Hawaiian charm without all the glitz. Staff is fantastic across the board. You have your own quiet oasis in Oahu but are only a 15 minute cab or free shuttle ride into Waikiki. The rooms are well kept and appointed. The breakfast buffet is excellent. There is really nothing negative to say about the hotel at all. For me it's the perfect choice if you must stay in Oahu.

The Kahala has everything you can ask for. The location is perfect, the staff is outstanding. The hotel itself, the beach & restaurants are top notch! I love it here and plan to stay here when we return.

This hotel is a great place for either business or pleasure. I spent five nights there in late July and couldn't have been happier. Everything is top-notch, from the oversized rooms, to the delicious and varied food, to the genuine, friendly service from everyone working at this gem. It's by no means an inexpensive place to stay, but then again, you get what you pay for, as always. I wouldn't hesitate to return.

The Kahala resort and hotel exceeded our expectations in so many ways. Having stayed previously in Waikiki, on a number of occasions, we thought that we try a different experience. We stayed in June of this year and we had the most wonderful time. We arrived late in the evening after a long flight and we were greeted with such hospitality.The room request that we made through the lovely lady,Lorna, in reservations was granted and from the beginning we felt really excited with our choice.When we got to our room there was a problem. Upon reporting this, the staff were so helpful and gracious. They told us that another room would be organised for us. We went for something to eat and when we returned, the manager came to speak to us. He apologized for the inconvenience, which for us it was no problem at all. We were just happy to be there! He generously upgraded our room, this was so unexpected and amazing. It got our stay off to an incredible start.Our room was spotless and the decor was beautiful, from the gorgeous wooden floors to the muslin curtains blowing in the breeze. Everything you would dream of in a tropical setting.Our room had a partial ocean view and looked out onto the mountains and golf course. We normally pay for ocean view and were therefore uncertain about the scenic rooms but I have to say they were beautiful. There is a waterfall at the back of the hotel and it sounds so lovely at night. i wouldn't hesitate. to book this room category again. my only recommendation is to book the Koko Head wing.We enjoyed our breakfast in the Plumeria on several occasions, we choose to eat from the a la-cart menu as opposed to the buffet. we thought the buffet was very expensive but perhaps would be good as a brunch option. I highly recommend their waffles, so light and delicious.Overall, dining is expensive but the food is good. You are well looked after and the standard of dining service is excellent. Our only complaint was that we found some of the younger servers less friendly and lacking in attention but that may be down to experience.What made our stay so wonderful, were all the staff that greeted us with such warmth and attention. In particular, Gloria and Leimomi at the concierge desk. These two ladies made us feel so welcome and they looked after us so well. We would return to the Kahala just to see them! Everyday we were greeted with a warm smile from so many staff and we felt the service was exceptional, especially housekeeping. We have stayed in many 5 star resorts but this was definitely the nicest overall experience we have had. It was amazing how many staff addressed us by name.After we had checked out, we realized that we had left some items in our room. We were very grateful to Anastasia, from housekeeping, who made sure that our belongings were safe until we could pick them up.There are many positives to say about this hotel. From the pool, which is lovely at night and so warm, to the beach. The photos don't do it justice. There are some drawbacks to staying here. if you don't have a car, you are restricted. to on site dining, which is very expensive.if staying here make use of the free shuttle into Waikiki. Use the bicycles at the resort to explore the locality, its really beautiful. Consider hiring a car, it gives you more freedom.Overall, we really recommend a stay here. There may be some areas of refurbishment required but there are no significant issues. Anything pales into the background when taken in the context of the whole experience.We have stayed in many of the top hotels in Honolulu and the Kahala beats them all. This is where we will return.

This was our first visit to Hawaii. This resort was everything we could have hoped for. The location is great if you are looking to get away from the craziness of Waikiki, although it's not too far away and the resort provides a shuttle. The beach is beautiful and it was never over-crowded. We always got chairs, and a lot of the time we felt like we had our own private beach. We didn't spend much time at the pool, but that was nice as well. I read some reviews that said the pool was small, but I did not think it was. Plus the beach is steps away so why worry about the pool! One of my favorite parts of the resort was the dolphin and sea turtle lagoons. It was just awesome to be able to walk by that every day and see the dolphins frolicking around, what a unique experience!I also liked the fact that the servers didn't walk around all day peddling drinks on the beach. They were around if you wanted something, but they weren't bothersome at all. The Veranda was a great place to go at night to relax and enjoy the view. The breakfast buffet at Plumeria was delicious! We ate at the Seaside grill every day for lunch and everything we had there was very good, and at reasonable prices. The service was great at Arancino, but the food was just so-so. We did take the shuttle to Waikiki to eat dinner a couple times, because there were not a ton of options at the resort. But again, they provided a shuttle do it was no big deal. We rented a car to explore the rest of the island one day, and I couldn't wait to get back to the Kahala. They have a rental car agency on site that the Concierge pushed for, but we saved over $100 by going to Enterprise a couple miles away. I loved every staff member there, with the exception of the one concierge - I do feel he was pushing us towards certain things, maybe they had deals with the hotel. That was no big deal, I would just suggest you do your research as well. Fantastic time at a fantastic resort!

Stayed for the Xmas season 2014. Yea it's the classic Kahala. Nothing much will beat it. It's the Iconic Hawaii hotel. Needs a pool redo. Only reason for not giving 5 stars. Otherwise the staff is " the best in the business". Location is what makes it super special. 12 mins to Waikiki with all the restaurants yet in a quiet area with amazing beach. Beach and pool like 30 yards from each other which is where mega resorts fail.

This hotel is amazing. We had a view that was to die for! Private beach access, dolphin swimming and a spa, I am surprised we ever left the hotel. Great hospitality and a very accomidating staff. I will always stay here if possible while in Honolulu.

My friend and I went for a mommy's date and got a 90minute massage. What a treat! It's on the pricey side but well worth it! The masseuses are professional and polite. The treatment rooms are so nicely decorated in the island decor and was so relaxing! I did t want to leave!

My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Kahala this past July. When we visit Hawaii, we normally stay on the Big Island, with an occasional stay on Maui or Kauai. That said, this time work took me to Oahu, so we decided to make a long weekend of it there. We were seeking a “resort” experience away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach. The Kahala delivered on this front. However, if your looking for the peace and quiet and refined service of the Four Seasons Hualalai, this is not “quite “ it. The service, while good (as it should be for the prices they charge), is not exceptional. Don’t get me wrong. Most of the staff we met were wonderful, friendly and forthcoming. It’s just that the processes behind them were missing that certain “something” one expects at a 5 star hotel. A few examples: Our arrival to the hotel: Doors were opened of our taxi, our bags placed on the curb, and then…nothing. We were unsure of what to do. So we inquired of one of the busy bell staff. After throwing leis around our necks – literally - she assured us someone would be by to greet us immediately. After few minutes…we were still standing there next to our bags. Strange. We took our bags to the front desk ourselves. Not the biggest issue one can think of and likely makes the reader think us a couple of prigs, which we really are not – but I use this an example of how the “system” at this hotel fell apart.  A second example of this: We made a reservation at the on-premise Italian Restaurant (Arancino) over 1 week in advance. When we arrived for our 7:30pm reservation we were escorted to a table inside, waaay in the back of the restaurant (at the rear entrance) - (who wants to sit inside in Hawaii? – and who wants to sit next to the door?) When we inquired about sitting at of one of 5 or 6 empty tables that where available on the veranda, we were told they were needed for later reservations!?! Again, this makes us sound like pretty high maintenance people. We really are not. That said, when we spend 5 star prices ($500+) on a hotel room, and are prepared to spend $300 - $400 on dinner, we do expect something beyond the Hilton or Applebees. We ended up at the other restaurant at the Kahala – Hoku’s where the food and service (and place they sat us) where all outstanding. One of the best in Hawaii. Again, let me reiterate, most of the staff at this resort is wonderful. They are as good as some of the people we have met at The Four Seasons and Aman resorts. It’s the system that needs a tune up. The rooms at the Kahala are quite large, beds comfortable, views out of most rooms very nice. Unfortunately, they are just a slight bit on the dated side and baths have a single vanity. (Again, not the end of the world, but they are charging real money for this place). Be sure to book or request a room with a veranda (if that is your thing, as only every other room has one). Finally, the most distributing thing, and something that should give all pause who are considering a stay here are the captive Atlantic Bottlenose dolphins they keep at this resort. When I arrived, I did not have a strong opinion on the keeping of ocean mammals one way or another. My wife however, was quite distributed – from the moment we arrived. My thought was of all things man does to animals, this is probably the most benign. I spent some time researching this subject while at the resort. While one can find pros and cons on both sides of the issue, after a good deal of reading and looking at these amazing animals, my feeling on this issue was revised. I no longer find it acceptable to keep animals such as these for our entertainment. Swimming with them in captivity is just not OK. Its actually quite sad to walk by these dolphins on your way to and from the beach and restaurants. That said; please do your own research on the topic. For us, and for this reason alone, we will never again return to the Kahala.

I was very shocked at this hotel. I was visiting Oahu with my family and I'm from Maui. The rooms were nice and the whole facility was good. Coming from Hawaii we wanted to just relax, stay at the beach, and let the kids play for the weekend.Seaside grill had pretty good food, Kainoa at the bar gave us awesome service and was always happy. I was truly impressed by the manager at Seaside Grill. She was wearing a wrist brace and I swear she was working harder than her workers! Overall they gave good service! The pool staff is probably the hardest working guys in the whole hotel! They are running around in the sun, moving heavy furniture, and giving out great service! Kainoa, Jacob, Rand, Nick, and Brent treated my family like ohana. They really gave off that local vibe and took care of my kids! One worker that does not belong there is another Nick (he didn't have a mustache), but that guy looks extremely mad and unapproachable ALL THE TIME and I even saw him get mad at the oldest co-worker and let the co-worker set up the beach by himself. He just didn't fit in with the group of having positive vibes.The reason why we chose this hotel was we heard they had great service, and I feel overall the hotel did a good job. People come to hawaii for the beach and I feel that the equipment at the beach area can be improved. Even the pool is outdated and not to mention the huge puddle of water by the drain. When visiting Oahu again, I will come back to The Kahala. I can see why others may want to visit Aulani or Halekulani...

I love this hotel! The location is what makes it so great, it is secluded from busy Waikiki but yet not too far from town… The workers are great at this hotel everyone is friendly and they give the "aloha" spirit. One group of workers that stood out the most to me were the pool staff in the white shirts! Those guys work very hard and all the furniture that they move day in and day out, I give them a lot of credit! Of all the workers one gentlemen came off was very lazy, he was the eldest of the group. it seemed as though he avoided guest service. Another thing that stood out to me was how the pool was kept. For a hotel of such high status, there was a huge puddle of gross water at the bottom of the shower. Overall I will definitely return to this hotel. Great experience!

As a Staycation, This is a very relaxed and soothing vacation. While there, you don't feel like your on the same island. No outside noise, like street noise. And the best part is the Dolphines. It's like they know your taking their picture and they will look at you and smile. The staff is great when it comes to the small children, as I watched a young man with three little girls, he called them by name, and he made them feel safe. he was so fun to watch.

My family has stayed at the Kahala 4 of the last 5 years. We return because we feel the combination of location, service and amenities are hard to beat. We appreciate the wonderful beach which is perfect for kids. The location is centrally located - yet free from the crowds of Waikiki. The staff are truly lovely people and always go the extra mile from valet to housekeeping. We have always found our rooms clean, comfortable and spacious. If you are "pool people" (no disrespect intended) you may find the pool a bit small, but we are "beach people" and find the beach one of the best. We do visit other islands/resorts and always return to the Kahala. We booked our stay at Kahala through Donna Bender at Maui Calls. She is exceptionally knowledgeable about all of the Hawaiian Islands and a true professional. Donna will see to all of your needs, including providing her exclusive "Local Girl's Guide to Oahu" which covers local gems you would not find in other guide books.

We were in Hawaii celebrating my sister in law's 50th birthday and I thought it would be a wonderful memory to have family pictures taken while enjoying our vacationi. We booked with Pacific Dream Photography which is located at the Kahala Hotel & Resort. First of all, wow! What a resort, between the lovely, traditional lobby to the restaurant where we dined after our photo shoot. This place is beautiful & top notch. The photos were taken on the beach and surrounding area at the resort, and they couldn't be more beautiful. Our photographer made the shoot fun and relaxing. All of which is reflected in our photos. Our group consisted of 7 people and all of the shots are beautiful, which is quite a feat! Don't hesitate to book with this company. They are extremely accommodating and will work with you and ensure you get what you want/need. The service they provided was exceptional. Our time slot was for 45 minutes, and we took well over an hour. That's dedication to getting the perfect shot! We had so many beautiful group shots, we had to purchase more than we had originally anticipated, with no regrets. When/if we're back in the area, I would definitely book with these folks again.

I really enjoyed my latest stay at the Kahala! I have stayed a few times over the years- the hotel and grounds are beautiful and the outdoor restaurant (the Plumeria) is a favorite!I like to stay at the Kahala because it is close to downtown Waikiki but away from the bustle.One new thing I did on this trip was to get professional photos done by Pacific Dream Photography ( by Julia Jump.) My photos are amazing- Julia did such a great job!! My friends and family just love these pictures (which are taken right on the beach at the hotel.) I hope to visit the hotel again in the future with my family and will definitely do more pictures with Pacific Dream!

the customer service is outstanding. From the moment of arrival to departure you are treated like royalty. Any need is quickly met. The beach is impeccable and there are many activities available. The food is incredible from the morning buffet to the late night dinner. It is conveniently located on the East side of the island. Please come and be pampered because you will not be sorry.

I had a brief but enjoyable stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. Bottom line for me – wonderful resort setting and luxury service, but it could really use some fresh, upscale interiors. It’s the only true resort near Waikiki, complete with a peaceful relaxed atmosphere, long stretch of picturesque beachfront and lots of well-manicured outdoor space. The 10 minute drive from the crowded Waikiki scene was a welcomed escape – it felt like Hawaii should. I had a great morning jog around Diamond Head through the upscale neighborhood along Kahala Avenue with the scent of plumeria in the air. Upon my return, I really appreciated the hotel staff’s spirit of aloha when a bellman handed me a water and the front desk clerk offered me a wet mint cloth. That gracious service will bring me back. Good (but expectedly expensive) buffet. I didn’t swim with the dolphins but there were plenty of families who did. The ponds with tropical fish and turtles were cool. The hotel was clean throughout. My standard king room was huge and the bathroom was majestic – his and hers sinks on opposite ends, more mirrors than Versailles, separate tub and Niagara Falls-like shower. Although I only had a peekaboo ocean view, my garden view room overlooked the Waialae Country Club which was lush and green.My one real complaint is that while I paid an exorbitant amount for a last minute reservation in order to be close to business associates, I was disappointed that the hotel was physically fairly outdated. I wouldn’t have a problem paying more if the lobby, public areas and guest rooms were freshened up. My bathroom had plastic towel rods, old sink fixtures and a plastic chrome ceiling grid fluorescent light. The main pool area was particularly mediocre. Many other 1960’s era Hawaiian hotels have been updated to meet guest expectations; the Kahala feels like it needs a similar facelift. Otherwise, a very nice stay.

Stayed there twice and each time for a week. We stayed at the Dolphin lagoon the first time and the room was huge. I don't think anyone would have anything to complain about the service at Kahala. It's the best I have experienced. Loved the private beach and we have tried a few restaurants at the resort and all of them were delicious. Have to admit the pool is small and noisy with the kids running around. But why stay by the pool when there is a gorgeous, quiet beach just around the corner.

This resort has a quality reputation that it no longer meets. Be careful of ocean view rooms. Half of these rooms have a view of the front of the resort and parking garage before you see the ocean. These rooms do not have the sound of the ocean but have the sound of backing up tour buses all day and night. No point in getting a Lanai room because you won't be sitting outside in this environment. You pay top $$s and they don't even provide high speed internet without a $20/day fee. The pool has not been maintained and needs work. The food is generally pretty good. Most of the staff works hard but not more than what you would expect. The surroundings are beautiful and the Dolphin pools are exceptional. Concierge service is spotty. Several of our tours were expensive but fabulous but several were expensive but not what we wanted. Location is why people come to this resort. The beaches are not crowded but I would only recommend this resort if someone could get a deal on the rooms.

This hotel is in severe need of a cosmetic upgrade. The lobby and rooms are old and outdated. This certainly is not anything close to a luxury hotel. However, the beach is beautiful here and the food is better than most resorts. If it weren't for these two things I would have checked out in search of a real 5 star experience. The pool is laughable.

We celebrated our anniversary and were welcomed by a bottle of chilled champagne in our room! By far the Kahala is the best place we have ever stayed at. The boutique style resort was beautiful. The staff was wonderful and treated us like we were the only guests. We most enjoyed that it was close to all attractions, but nestled away from all of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We stayed 5 nights on Oahu and five nights on Hawaii Island. Each island was unique, but by far the Kahala on Oahu was the most enjoyable. We hope to return soon for another stay at this amazing resort!

The resort was gorgeous. The rooms are huge and clean. The staff is amazing...great customer service. Loved the dolphins in the pool area. The beach is wonderful. The location is central to everything plus it's nice and peaceful. Nearby to the mall.

This was the best hotel experience me and my fiancé have had thus far. The STAFF was very welcoming and helped made this trip smooth. I don't know which part of the hotel was best, from the beautiful views of the ocean, to the FANTASTIC SUITES, or being able to look out of our room and see dolphins, sea turtles, and sting rays. WE had a blast on this breath taking island. Definitely didn't want to leave but trust me we will be going back.

I was upgraded to a junior suite with a view of the ocean and the grounds. Exceptionally comfortable. I had a late dining experience on the terrace overlooking the pool with piano music in the background. Enjoyed a swim in the lovely pool early morning and a fantastic brunch. Walking the private beach and grounds with dolphins playing in the pool was a delight. Great for families with very small children. I was solo and could. Not have been treated with more courtesy. Beautiful lounge area with antiques

My fiancé and I spent a week at the Kahala and exploring the island and absolutely loved our experience. Halfway through the trip, we extended our stay an extra two days simply because we were not ready to leave!! The room, food, service, and staff with The Kahala was exceptional. After the wedding and kids, it will definitely be a spot for many family vacations to come!

this was a few years back 4-5 hot towels and a real flower lei when when stepped out of the car greeted by 3-4 people. had to wait about 15 minutes as our room was not ready but got a free upgrade to ocean view roomhad everything in the room you would want that seamed to be replaced (coffee, tea soaps etc) everytime we left the roomthe staff was the best we ever hadjust saving my money to go back again

It was my first time ever to go to the US and what a perfect place to be. The resort is fabulous. The rooms are comfortable and cleaned every day. The breakfast restaurant had many variety and so delicious. Swimming with the dolphins was a dream come true, was a real highlight to experience that. They have regular shuttles to all local malls. The shopping is endless. They also have some high end shops at the resort and a beautiful spa. Unfortunately I didn't get to go to the spa as time was limited but I would highly recommend it. The Resort was very accommodating. I would love to go back one day.
user_name:
Pani T
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: We travel extensively and experience many 4-5 star properties around the globe. The amenities and, most of all, the finest of customer service was appreciated here at the Kahala during the second week of July. I've only been home two days and am missing it so much already! We look forward to our return. Mahalo!

I have been travelling to Honolulu for years and staying at The Kahala is something that I always look forward to. Away from the bustle of Waikiki, but still close enough for when you want to shop. A relaxing holiday for families with a safe swimming beach for kids and fabulous staff. I love this hotel and am always so relaxed after staying here

Another amazing stay at the Kahala. Amazing welcome for us and our dog Coco. We all received leis on arrival, including coco. In the room coco had her own bed, dog bowl, and dog biscuits with her name on it. This is the place to relax and unwind whenever we need to recharge. Thank you again Kahala!

If you are traveling to Oahu this is the place to stay. Rooms are spacious and very clean. The beds are some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The bathroom had two sinks and lots of room to store your cloths and other items in. The maids were always on the floor, so you could always have a clean room. Don't worry if you have a late flight, because they have an amazing hospitality room with drinks, a shower, and changing rooms. It's an added bonus. We had a great time at the Kahala and highly recommend it.

With a most wonderful welcome, this grand hotel has the staff who understands the needs of its guests. The welcome included a bottle of cold water, a lei and a washing towel. Our room was on the 7th floor and quite large and very well laid out! Plenty of drawer space and hanging space too. Lovely shower and bath and double vanities! Plush robes and slippers are a plus too! The elevators have antique hula dolls that shake as the elevator goes up and down. Bike are free to rent (thru the concierge) for 3 hours at a time, plus helmets and a bike lock as well. They even have a kids bike! Also, plenty of umbrellas for the asking at the bell desk! Dolphins on site are a plus too! Not free to engage with them but free to watch in the dolphin lagoon on the property! Also arranging or getting a taxi is so easy to do, but to get to Waikiki, it will set you back about $25-$30+...this is why I wrote it is off the beaten path. It is in a quiet part of Honolulu, not in the ruckus of Waikiki. Aside from that and our liking to be in the city, it is a most fantastic hotel in every way!

My wife and I stayed there in a simple garden view room on the 8th floor. Very hospitable staff, typical 5-star or 5-diamond service. They really treat you well. Dolphin lagoon is a treat any time of day. The private beach is nice, and never really crowded. Not an ocean person? You can swim the pool! The restaurants are excellent, and the Plumeria is not to be missed for breakfast. only 10 minutes from the nightlife of Waikiki, yet feels another world away. The staff appreciates good tippers and your experience will be that much more pleasant.

We recently stayed at the Kahala for six nights and had a wonderful experience. The room was very clean and the staff was great! They really seem to enjoy working at the Kahala which was reflected on how they treated the guests and the property. My family would definitely stay at the property again. It had a tropical feel and we avoided the crowds and chaos of other areas of the island.

Had an opportunity to stay at this legendary resort recently. There were many excellent elements to the hotel (wonderful sense of arrive, gorgeous public rooms and restaurants overlooks the resort and water, warm attentive staff") ......the entire report feels very "compact" and crammed into s small space . The pool area is very disappointing and overflowing with guests. The hotel looks it's best in the early morning when the chairs are lined up...otherwise the small outdoor area quickly becomes sloppy and messy and very un-luxury. The guest rooms are oversized and well appointed- bathrooms felt felt like and apartment with many shelves and drawers and "pockets". LOVED the rooms

We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Kahala Hotel & Resort. We at first were hesitate to book, as several people stated it needs a face lift. And in some aspects, this is true. However, we loved our stay and will return again! It is a little tricky to find. Review your directions before venturing out. We made that mistake and ended up at the Koko Marina and needed to turn around. Once you make your way to the end of the road (it is literally at the end of the road!), you will be welcomed by the aloha of the islands -- an open door resort, friendly staff and a tropical breeze. The grounds are well maintained and very lush. A waterfall along the north wall leads to several streams and lagoons housing dolphins, sea turtles, sting rays and numerous fish varieties. There is a nice pool area that expands into a well groomed beach area. The beach is beautiful and they have chairs set up there for use. The resort also has a relatively large fitness center with a wide variety of updated equipment. We used it daily! The staff are true professionals and will go out of their way to assist you. This hotel truly pampers you. It is a great place for couples and families alike.

Enormous though slightly outdated rooms. We stayed in both the garden and tower rooms. The tower room with a partial ocean view was so beautiful we didn't want to leave (esp at the price we were paying). It's a nice resort that is inconveniently 15-20 mins from waikiki. Choose to stay here if you want to be away from the hustle of waikiki.

Didn't stay in the hotel however we had breakfast in their restaurant and it was great. Good food and plenty of it.Wasn't to expensive and just a great place away from Waikiki to have a nice breakfast.Free valet parking if your eating there, which is handy because finding a park could be problematic. We got chased out by a car park womble in a golf cart at the nearby golf club when we pulled up for a minute.The hotel has a great outlook and I would consider staying there on our next visit. We had a hire car but I'm sure transport into Waikiki or Ala Moana for shopping is something they could arrange. Its only 10 min in a car from Waikiki.The had dolphins in a pool as well as some turtles. The dolphins were doing tricks and playing with handlers. I didn't like to see the sea turtles confined in a small pool.Will go again next time

The classic charm, excellent service, peace and quiet is why we keep coming back to the Kahala. The rooms are clean with very comfortable beds! Best sleep ever! The staff went above and beyond to make us feel at home. This is our fifth time staying here and its equally as enjoyable as the first. If you're looking to change the pace from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but only be a quick ride to the action. Look no further you've found the perfect place. Tips: They have Dolphins, Sting Rays, and a Sea Turlte There's a beautiful waterfall Private Beach The Thin Rolled Pancakes with Maple Butter Sauce

We stayed here for a business conference. The meeting rooms and dining areas are top notch. The pools, beach access and views are superb. The dining options are high quality but limited. If you like to be tucked away from the hectic bustle of Waikiki, this is the place for you. No nightlife to speak of except for the cocktail area. But quiet and very, very nice.

We've traveled the world and always say the Kahala is our favorite place on earth. We finished our 30th anniversary celebration on the north shore and checked in to the Kahala for a 3 night stay to really relax. We love their attention to detail and they fulfilled our every request. The Kahala is paradise at its best. Can’t wait to come back.

This resort was amazing. We stayed in a scenic ocean view suite. The room was great with lots of space, comfortable beds and beautiful views of the mountains and ocean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Their breakfast buffet was very delicious. We would recommend this hotel to everyone for a relaxing and great vacation. We would love to return in the future.

Just returned from a three-night stay at the Kahala to attend a wedding, and everything was perfect. Expensive (and this is Oahu, so that was to be expected), but perfect. Although we had booked a standard room, we were upgraded to a room with a lanai upon arrival - comfortable bed, large bathroom, and beautiful view of the golf course, with the beach directly around the corner. Full service waitstaff at the gorgeous beach and pool, and the dolphins, sea turtles, and stingrays in the lagoon next to the pool were fun to watch. The restaurants were expensive but again, service was excellent and the food and drinks were very good. We took advantage of dry cleaning service (24 hour turnaround time), the free shuttle to Waikiki (the driver was great and pointed out sites along the way), and the onsite Hertz car rental office. My favorite part of the resort is the location - close to enough to Waikiki and Honolulu that it is a quick drive to the action, but far enough that we were able to relax on the peaceful, clean private beach. I never wanted to leave!

I recently stayed at the Kahala for one night as a staycation. Highlights: spa, spacious lanai with seating/overall décor, friendly staff.I have been to high end spas before and usually like the treatments but slightly resent the high price tag. The Kahala spa was amazing! I received incredible multi-hour treatments both days of my stay. The treatment rooms are gorgeous; the treatments were well-executed; the staff were friendly and unpretentious. Totally worth it!The décor of the hotel seems Hawaii meets Southern charm. This is not a huge sprawling resort and feels intimate. I loved the large lanai with rocking chairs overlooking the ocean- perfect for a book. I would love to return for afternoon tea service in the dining room. I didn't do the Dophin Quest experience (swimming with dolphins) but I enjoyed watching the dolphins, stingrays, and turtles in their respective ponds.The beach is private (unlike Waikiki), although small. Like all of the Waikiki area, the beach quality is OK but underwhelming; the best beaches on Oahu don't have hotels. The water is rather shallow which might be nice for kids or weak swimmers. Also, there are only a few rocks in the water which is a blessing.Location: The Kahala is private and not located exactly in Waikiki, but it's quite close. There might be a shuttle available (I'm not sure). It is close to Hanauma Bay (a favorite place for snorkeling-get there early if you need parking); also, try climbing Koko Head- it's a great workout and ends with amazing views.Food: There are several restaurants including an Asian inspired venue, Italian, and a more American focused (surf and turf) restaurant. I only ate at Plumeria House (surf/turf); the service and food were great. The prices were as expected at a resort.My room was lovely, clean and comfortable with good space and storage.The pool looked enjoyable although a bit small.I really enjoyed my stay.

Not impressed. Top resort in Hawaii. Please. Dirty. Elevator broken. Retro chic is one thing. I would call dilapidatedThe only thing top of the line is the price.This will absolutely be my one and only stay.Can i leave early?

We booked a Dolphin Lagoon suite and were absolutely blown away. The resort is classy, staff unbelievable and the facilities are amazing. A total spoiling worth every single centSwimming with the Dolphins was a beautiful moment.. But even just watching them swim under and around your balcony is an event that will melt your heart.Nearby Kahala Mall is a great little shopping and dining opportunity.

We just recently completed our family vacation to Honolulu where we stayed at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. This was hands- down the best hotel stay I have had in any city, country and continent in my over 35 years of travel experience. The Kahala is a gorgeously beautiful hotel with excellent service and an exceptionally friendly and attentive staff. I have to single out both James and Noel at the front desk for their amazing guest service. They were both extremely helpful, attentive and knowledgeable. James even helped us take some family pictures in the hotel's beautiful lobby. The hotel staff was always very friendly and attentive with ever-ready smiles. I would rate the Plumeria's breakfast brunch as the best we have ever enjoyed at any hotel by a long, long distance. I would definitely recommend getting the breakfast package to all guests. The views from the Plumeria of the beach and the ocean only attended to the very enjoyable brunch there. The complimentary hotel shuttle to Waikiki and the Kahala Mall was always very helpful and ran on schedule. I would also recommend the outrigger canoeing experience with the hotel's excellent lifeguard Gabriel. It was a very enjoyable experience. The dolphin lagoon with the six dolphins was brilliant fun! We had a room on the 10th floor with a lanai and partial views of the ocean and overlooked the beautiful golf club. We aloso had a view of the mountains. We had a good visit to Honolulu BUT an excellent visit to the Kahala Resort! What a breathtakingly beautiful stay and experience. Thank you to all the staff at the Kahala Hotel and Resort for making our stay so much fun and enjoyable! It was both our privilege and pleasure to stay at your amazing hotel! It was worth every dollar!!!!

Beautiful spot, with excellent facilities. Both pools and beach wonderful - and great fun to have the extra pools with fish, turtles, and dolphins. But it's far from most other activities one wants to do in Honolulu and a good taxi drive from them all. Rooms quite spacious.

The Kahala is an institution in Honolulu, set on a beautiful beach away from the bustle of the chain hotels or Waikiki. While it is a large hotel, you feel at home thanks to the personalized Hawaiian hospitality. It's 100% worth the splurge. My favorites: - breakfast buffet is outstanding. Fresh and beautiful offerings facing the beach -- to satisfy all your senses.-- spacious rooms you will want to lounge in - get one with a lanai - Morning run on the beach or the nearby residential neighborhood (and I'm not a runner)-- veteran staff are ready to help you and anticipate your needs with genuine friendliness. I've heard this hotel is under new management and I urge them to keep the current staff who make this place so special-- easy days spent wandering between the pool, beach, dolphin pool, café, kayaking or paddle boarding with great instructor if you like -- no planning needed-- beautiful views of the coast and Kokohead crater - will relax you in a heartbeat-- Hoku's has terrific food and ambiance, especially if celebrating a special occasion-- spa treatments are delightful, expert staff and in beautiful settings (spacious and airy spa rooms that feel like a villa) -- a short distance from Diamondhead which is a great moderate hike with a fantastic view at the topI have skimped before and chosen other cheaper hotels - never again after staying at the Kahala.

Where to start, from the moment we arrived at this beautiful resort we felt special. Nothing was too much effort for the staff here. The room was out of this world, it came with personal Starbucks coffee making facilities, slippers, bath robes, water, fresh fruit and a beautiful view of the neighbouring golf course and mountains. The hotel has its own private spa, shops, dolphin lagoon, turtle and ray lagoons, private beach and is well known for having many high profile celebrity guests. They have a hall of fame with photos of all celeb & royal visitors......its safe to say we felt out of place haha. But we were treated no different. Our room included breakfast, which was the best buffet breakfast i think we have ever had anywhere. They also have valet parking and free shuttle services & pick ups to certain places in and around Waikiki. Every evening when we came to our room our bed was freshly turned down, with chocolates on the pillow and fresh water. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. One day I hope we can visit again soon, I really miss this place, the people were so friendly and it was pure heaven. Always greated with a warm and friendly Aloha and Mahalo.

My husband and I were looking for a stress free, relaxing resort to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and we found that at The Kahala. This is a fabulous resort with outstanding service and amenities! We had a ocean front room with a lanai. The room and bathroom were large; the bed was very comfortable. The private beach is wonderful with cabanas and plenty of room to enjoy water activities or just soak up the sun and ocean breezes. The dolphin lagoon is really neat too! Others have mention that the pool is small; I travel to Hawaii for the beaches not for the pools. The restaurants have wonderful food not to mention glorious views of the beach and ocean. We will definitely return to the Kahala on our next trip to Hawaii!

This hotel is the perfect place to stay . It was recently taken over by a Japanese company and the service is top notch. The hotel is quite clean and it has a few restaurants on site. The beach is fantastic and not crowded like Waikiki beaches. If you want to swim wth Dolphins you can do so right at the hotel.One of the finest golf courses in the world is next door to the hotel , it is private but I was told that it is possible to play there. I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Oahu . It isn't far from the busy Waikiki area, but secluded if you just want to relax. They have a wall of photos of famous people who have stayed here, fun to see everyone from elizabeth Taylor to bill Clinton to Paul McCartney .
user_name:
lastresortname
New York City, New York

review_body: Upon arrival we were greeted with prettiest smiles and everyone really made you feel welcome. Even though this hotel is dated it is still beautiful. The rooms were large, airy, and serene. The color schemes were relaxing and comforting to the eyes. I still want to know what shade of blue the uniforms were. I have to get it!

I was looking for a quick getaway to Hawaii and while I normally go to Kauai, I needed to be able to get a direct flight back to SF in order to make it home for another trip. So Honolulu it was...I was SO pleasantly surprised to find the Kahala Resort it really is a hidden gem. About 15 minutes out of Waikiki, it's located at the end of an affluent neighborhood on a golf course with a small near private beach. So you feel relatively secluded, was the perfect place to relax in peace without the chaos normally associated with hotels in Honolulu. They had a dolphin pond, a fantastic spa which I took advantage of twice (ask for Papa, he's amazing) and even a shuttle that takes you into Waikiki. Was very convenient to get some shopping down and get off the resort for a bit.My only complaint would be that while there are several restaurants onsite with lots of choices, it's VERY expensive. Breakfast was $40 per person which was just crazy. Dinner at any of the restaurants was even more than that. If you can try to balance by getting off the resort and trying some of the local restaurants or there's a mall nearby with lots of choices.

I suspect many have had a great experience here. But our experience left a lot to be desired. My wife and I prefer to head to the Big Island where resorts such as Mauna Lani and the Hapuna Beach Prince Hotel are among our favorites. We have generally avoided Oahu...and I wish we would have continued to do this. Our stay was marked by poor service (1.5 hours for room service on one occasion), promises never kept by the hotel manager (I will send you a bottle of champagne...this never happened although he consistently asked us if we had received it until the day we departed), inability to locate hotel staff when needed (particularly problematic at the fitness center). The one shining point was the excellent Italian restaurant Arancino...We cannot say enough about the excellent service and food choices here...very unusual finding in Oahu, which is not known for this.The beach was okay...if you are expected something like the Hapuna beach, you will be disappointed.As others have pointed out, the pool was crowded.It appears that others had better experiences here, so hopefully my review simply represents an anomaly...but we will definitely not be back.

We have been visiting this hotel for about 20 years. This is the third owner we have experienced. Yes the hotel is showing some bumps and bruises (marks on the walls, stains on the rugs and chairs here and there) but it is still a great hotel. Excellent staff, very good food, comfortable/quiet/clean rooms, shuttle into Waikiki. My only comment would be that as a return guest at other hotels, we usually receive some time of welcome amenity, but we didn't receive one here (we did when we stayed at the Halekulani earlier in our trip). If you want a quiet/elegant hotel without being amid the hustle and bustle of Waikiki full-time, this is it.

Quiet, private and great location , not too far from the airport. Feels more like another island than Oahu.50+ year old resort but has been remodeled a few times, retains a some of the old Hawaii resort charm . A lot VIPs seem to stay here as its private and secure..The dolphins were great and very close to watch. The beach was nice . It was quieter than most. A plus. Staff us super friendly and helpful

The Kahala Hotel is a nice hotel that is away from the craziness of Waikiki. The rooms are very comfortable and the hotel is fairly well kept up. It has a secluded feel to it given the proximity to Honolulu. The beach is rarely crowded but the small pool is very crowded. The only complaints we have are in regards to the timelines of their housekeeping. We had our room cleaned while we were at the pool with the "Do No Disturb" sign up.. A few days later, we had the reverse problem when we scheduled the room cleaning later in the day and they never came. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

After spending three nights at the Hawaii Prince Hotel Waikiki (please avoid it!), we were thrilled to spend three nights at the Kahala. This place is wonderful. We traveled in May 2015 with our 22 month old daughter.ROOM: We had a second floor room overlooking the dolphin lagoon and it was excellent. A little crowded with the crib, but still plenty big. We were able to escape onto the patio with food and drinks after putting our daughter to bed at night. Other reviewers have complained about the rooms being dated, but we did not have any similar complaints. Our room was modern and clean. The crib was nice and clean, with a soft blanket for our daughter - and a sweet little stuffed turtle for her to keep.BEACH: Excellent. Quiet, private, small waves for the little ones, plenty big, not crowded. We also spent a lot of time at the pool, the baby pool, looking at the sea turtles and the fish, and watching the dolphins. There is also a lot of green space near the beach for a little one to run free.FOOD: Excellent. We had several meals at Plumeria and they were all excellent. The host routinely sat us outside on the patio closest to the garden/beach so our daughter could wander a bit. The brunch, though expensive, is worth every penny. We also had several meals at the Seaside Grill. This was a little disappointing for the money, but still fine. In every restaurant though -- the service was excellent and SUPER accommodating of our toddler. If you venture off property, check out Diamondhead Market. Don't be frightened by the ordering/eating in the parking lot -- the food is amazing! We also enjoyed the shaved ice at Waiola.SERVICE: Not much to add here as other travelers have said it well. The service is outstanding - from the housekeepers, to the restaurant staff, to the check-in desk, to the pool/beach crew, to the valet (who stocked us up with waters and towels before we headed to the north shore with some friends).

We stayed at the Kahala Resort for our honeymoon. This place, the service and accommodations are exquisite. We saw the Dolphin Lagoon, swimming in the pool and walked to the beach within steps of our lounge chair. Afternoon Tea is a MUST do at Veranda. Treat yourself and find your stay at Kahala Resort!

You probably won't want to leave once you get here, so take a transfer service from the airport and save the valet parking fees. We were greeted with beautiful fresh leis on arrival and a gaggle of bellmen surrounded our car and unloaded it as one of them escorted us to the front desk, where the clerk asked if we were celebrating anything special. He offered to send up a cake for my son's birthday when he learned that's why we were there. We got an upgraded room that was literally on the golf course -- a nice patio with two padded chaise lounges to relax and enjoy the beauty. I'm sure there are balconies/lanais with views of Diamond Head crater or the ocean on request.Our luggage actually arrived at our room before we did -- our bellman gave us the grand tour and offered to set up our luggage to unpack.Beds: My notorious bed snobbery, that can usually be satisfied only by Marriott beds was taken to a new level. I literally considered never leaving that bed... not even after my credit card was maxed out and the police summoned. It was that awesome. I finally decided against my sleep in because I want to come back. The linens were equally top notch. For that reason Beds: 6/5Cleanliness: I am also a freak about clean and this gets my rare OMG clean award. In fact, while I'm at it, let me tell you that the number one thing that impressed me most about this resort was the maid service. It was spectacular. They all get a raise. I know you can afford it. For example, I had dumped my makeup bag looking for tweezers or something that had gotten lost right before we headed out to eat (we got in sort of late) without thinking about the evening turn down service.... only to return to all my items neatly organized on a towel. They were meticulous about replacing amenities every visit, I just can't say enough wonderful things about the housekeeping staff. Cleanliness 6/5Amenities: Here's a hotel that gets those little touches that make you feel better about shelling out a wad for a hotel room -- slippers, robes, Starbucks coffee (that they keep stocked!), an up-to-date coffeemaker, water, there were bath salts, lotions, any toiletry item you might night right at your disposal -- including a dental kit if your luggage got lost or you forgot to pack ye ole toothbrush. The bathroom was stunning -- his and her sinks, a tub that I could lay down in that also had a spray arm for rinsing off or washing your hair... An amazing shower, a water closet a magnifying mirror... if you're older and blinder you know how important this is but now I need a LIGHTED ONE folks... even magnified isn't enough anymore! But one at all is definitely awesome. The amenities don't stop with the room... there's dolphins... that's right DOLPHINS swimming around in the pool (their own, not the main pool) sea turtles, a sting ray and other sea life. While there is a charge to get in the water with them (at least if it's a planned excursion and not a drunken dare) you can certainly enjoy them from the deck at no cost. Then there's paddle board and surfing lessons... they offer an intro less of about 15 minutes at no cost -- the instructor was so nice to my son and spent extra time with him just because he was the only one. No microwave, though... maybe some rooms do have them.Amenities: 6/5Food: 24 hour room service. Need I say more? The prices weren't that much more than what the restaurants offered. There is also a bar and grill on the beach (my only real negative is that it didn't stay open very late which was disappointing as I enjoy hanging out late afternoon with a cocktail and snacks on the beach.) We had breakfast outside at Plumeria. They offer a buffet but we dined from the menu -- French toast with coconut syrup was quite excellent as was the corned beef hash. It was surprising though that the servers didn't clear the tables right away and that cleared dishes were left out on stands that attracted birds -- some of the patrons seemed to be unhappy with that.Room comfort: The AC worked and you could crank it down if you wanted to be cool and it actually gets cool. The flatscreen TV had good reception and you could angle it if you wanted to watch from the bed. There was a nice settee to watch TV, or just chill on. The desk and chair was a bit of a mismatch -- I found the desk uncomfortable for typing from the chair height and it wasn't adjustable. On the plus side, the wifi worked great here, so that helped with business. They also have a nice business center -- it's located in a suite. Noise was an occasional factor, but it's the doorbells that causes the problem. The adjoining room people arrived late and I got woken up by their door bell, knocking, bellmen deliver luggage, food, etc. over a period of about an hour. Maybe after a certain time, one could avoid the doorbell. Also it would be a good idea to check in latecomers next to an empty room, but of course that might not be possible if the hotel is at capacity. Comfort 4.9/5Spa: I got a discount spa coupon on check-in so I expected that it should be easy enough to get a same day appointment and it was. Looking at the prices might dissuade some people from trying the spa (I'm guess the coupon was incentive to make the leap) but without a doubt, that was the best facial I ever had in my life. Weeks later my skin is still glowing. Facials are sometimes uncomfortable because of the skill level of the esthetician -- but not once was anything less than perfect -- she even worked on my eyelids. The treatment rooms are huge, not the typical little closets that most therapy sessions take place in. I am definitely coming back and treating myself to a spa day in the near future. Spa 6/5

The most attentive concierge services I've experienced. Amazing room and very quiet. We ate at Hoku (excellent fish) Arancino (unbelievable pasta). Live jazz in the evening from the Honolulu Jazz Quartet on the Veranda. I'm from Chicago--- this some of the best I've heard ever. The buffet breakfast every morning was delicious. Only disappointment was the pool area. The chaises were a bit worn out and the beach area just isn't of the same elegant quality as the rest of the hotel.

This vacation was an absolute dream come true! Usually I like to go "beyond the resort" while I'm on vacation, but it was really hard to leave the Kahala... everything is right on the property...the beach, great food and such a relaxing atmosphere. It was a family vacation (all adults) and we enjoyed every moment...from the delicious breakfast buffet at the Plumeria Cafe...with spectacular ocean views, to the dolphins, turtles & tropical fish right on site...this was Aloha at it's finest...Mahalo and we hope to be back again!

We came to spend our honeymoon, we arrived on Saturday, having been married in Palm Springs , CA on Friday. The Kahala went above any expectations to make our stay memorable. We will comeback very soon.

First time traveling with our 20-month granddaughter and her parents, and we were all treated like royalty. The staff was very attentive to all of our needs, even before we were aware we needed anything. The staff responsible for the dolphins always took the time to answer our many questions. The pool attendants were always quick to recommend a location for our cabana, to make everyone comfortable.The front desk staff and concierge made many suggestions - everything for a family with a baby. It makes a positive statement for an organization when employees have been with the company for many years. We will return.

It is the loveliest hotel I have stayed in and as the US uses it for Pan Pacific conferences that speaks volumes alone.We had a room which was the pinnacle of luxury and the double bathroom suite is as large as a small house. To gild the lily there was a large pool outside our apartment with 2 dolphins (under the care of the Hawaiian Zoological Society) swimming within a yard of our patio !Everything was fantastic and as we were on a world tour and stayed in many 5* hotels this one was top of the list

Absolutely loved The Kahala! Just spent a week here for my honeymoon. This hotel is first class. The staff are pleasant and attentive. We stayed in a mountain view roomand still enjoyed the view. If you are on the fence about getting mountain view vs. ocean, you can't go wrong with either choice. The beach at Kahala is absolutely breathtaking. We loved that it wasn't crowded at all. Also enjoyed watching the dolphins in the lagoon and sitting on the patio on the veranda. For those that are on a budget, definitely splurge and get the breakfast buffet at Plumeria Beachhouse at least once. It is SO good!!! The only downside for us was the food being outrageously priced for what we are used to. I also noted there was some dirt or oil on the curtains in our room, but everything else seemed clean. We really enjoyed our stay though, and hope to come back soon. Wish it wasn't so far away from home!

Best hotel and resort in Honolulu. Super friendly staff and the concierge service was very helpful. Our family (4 of us) joined the Scuba diving and Snorkeling tour as suggested by the concierge and it was an awesome experiences.

My family spent 2 night at this resort. We wanted to spend a couple of quite days on the beach without leaving the resort to recover from jag leg , before starting explore the islands . The hotel facilities and beach where fantastic. . The beach is protected by a reef so it is perfect for kids and people that enjoy calm waters. The room is very spacious and updated. We ate all our meals at the hotel during our 2 day stay, and the meals at the different restaurants were constantly very good . In the lagoons there are dolphins and you can book interaction time with them. Even if I am not crazy by the idea of animals in captivity, I must say the the keepers were knowledgeable, caring and prepared to share all information and details. The Dolphins were well kept and not overworked. So All was great but what made it fantastic is the service! All the people we interacted with where gracious, friendly and incredibly helpful. Made us feel valued guest all the time! That made this stay even more unforgettable ! Thanks

Hotel staff were curious and helpful. Grounds were well maintained and beautiful. Would recommend to couples or friends traveling together. Food was good, a bit pricy but to be expected. Easy travel to Waikiki and Haleiwa and North Shore. Highly recommend getting a rental car.

The Kahala is awesome. I don't understand how anyone can give this place a negative review. What I especially love about this place is that it feels like you're on a remote island that happens to be 10 minutes away from Waikiki. I went over the Memorial Day weekend and it was busy, but somehow they make you feel like you're the only guest they have. Everyone knows your name by the 2nd day. They really feel like a family. And everyone I spoke with that worked there acted like they were a family. The hotel was bought recently and everyone there is excited about the new ownership, hoping they can be even better. I do wish they did more Hawaiian stuff, like other hotels do. Maybe have a band playing local music with some hula dancers out by the ocean. Other than that I'm not sure what else they can do. I stayed on the 10th floor with a full ocean view. I think next time I go, I will request a partial ocean view. The scenery over the mountains is very cool and the weather changes - or looks like it's changing constantly. I got a facial in the spa and it was very nice. All the people that work there are so welcoming and it's so relaxing. They have rocking chairs everywhere at the resort, which I love. Only one hammock, which is my one nit pick, I wish there were a few more. Had dinner at Hoku's which was great. The breakfast buffet was included in my plan and it's consistently good. The waitresses always knew my name and would sometimes recommend something they liked and even bring it over to me! Most nights I would take the free shuttle into town. (Make a reservation and don't forget to tip your driver) I never really made the free shuttle back so I would take Uber. It averaged around $14 from town. The slight problem I had with those drivers is they heavily relied on the GPS and didn't really know where to go without it. One time I was at the Royal Hawaiian and it took the driver awhile to find me. You could do Uber taxi which costs the same as a taxi (although no tip is necessary.) They're just taxis that are now with Uber and these guys know where they're going. Now back to the Kahala, I don't really know what else to say about this place except I really can't wait to come back!
user_name:
Bryan F
New York City, New York

review_body: My family of four stayed here after our 7 day cruise. Highly suggested if u cruise to relax especially if you are from the East coast. My 2 sons ages 6, 10 loved this place. My 10 year old learned to spear fish while my 6 year old loved exploring the beach. Rooms were very clean and well maintained. Food was great and the people and service were accommodating and very friendly. We did a private dolphin experience, not sure if it was worth it could have had same experience with a small group for 700.00 less! Great beach and relaxing views.

We just returned from what was I believe our 9th stay at the Kahala - obviously we love it and return whenever we can and will again notwithstanding some misses on the hotel's part. My profile picture was taken from one of the beach cabanas years ago.The high points:The hotel's location away from the hustle and bustle is really key. You can get into Waikiki easily if you want but the resort itself is peaceful and relaxing.We stayed in an Ocean Front Suite which was amazing. (You can check out my prior reviews if you want more room detail. Or message me.)We ate at all the restaurants. Hoku's is good but we haven't been wowed by it. However, the short ribs and Ahi Musubi off the appetizer menu are a must try. As an FYI, you can order off of the menu for Hoku's in the Veranda. Drink and appetizers are perfect.We love the breakfast buffet at Plumeria - the pecan buns, Kahalasadas and thin pancakes are the best. We ate at the Italian restaurant (Arancino) twice. The Waygu Bolognese was excellent.We had massages and I think this is my favorite spa ever (we have tried a lot of them). The staff at the spa is hands down (no pun intended) the best. They remember us year after year which is impressive. Extremely relaxing massages. The tables are super comfortable - the whole experience is wonderful. The IT team was extremely helpful. We brought our Apple TV and Cameron in IT got us connected immediately. He was incredibly nice and helpful. Areas for improvement:Again, we love this place, but even we have to admit that their general customer service is not what it could be which is frustrating given how much we love the hotel!I think prior reviews have commented that there is a charge for everything. On this trip we did feel like if we didn't pay for something, we didn't get it. And even if we did pay, some things might not have been worth it.During prior stays, all suites included the suite amenity program. They seem to have changed it such that unless you stay in a signature suite, the program is an add on. Because we do want the breakfast and cabana use, we booked the add on. But other aspects of it are a bit spotty. They don't walk you through it and you are left to figure it out on your own. If you book the add on, make sure you call room service at the start of your visit to set up your afternoon drinks and your morning coffee. Reception did not facilitate that process at all. We also found that the appetizers that came with the add-on program were rather underwhelming as compared to prior stays. We didn't even bother with the morning coffee and just went to the coffee station that they set up each day in the lower lobby.This trip was for our 20th anniversary, a fact which was highlighted to the hotel prior to our stay. At this caliber (and price) of hotel, I do expect some sort of gesture of acknowledgement and, quite frankly, the Kahala is the only hotel that has now repeatedly failed at this aspect. No upgrade, no champagne, not even a "Congratulations" from the hotel (the restaurants were good at this). Really? Again, if you didn't pay for it, you don't get it.Bear in mind that we stayed here immediately after the Halekulani which has some of the best customer service we have ever experienced worldwide. That is hard to measure up to, but I think the Kahala could and should do better.Enough of the negative! This really is a great property and we will go back for another laid back stay. Definitely give it a try if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

From the second we stepped out of our taxi at the front door to the time we were picked up to leave after 4 days, all the hotel staff made us feel like royalty! We stayed on the 7th floor in an Ocean front Lanai room which was absolutely breathtaking inside and out especially being directly over the beach, pool and dolphin area. We arrived in our room to find a complimentary basket of fruit and chocolate macadamia nuts with a happy birthday message from the hotel. This was such an emothional thing to happen because we stayed in 3 hotels before this on our trip and the Kahala were the only ones who went out of their way to make such a big deal about my wife's 30th which is why we came on this trip in the first place. It is an amazing hotel and we ate in the Italian restaurant which was reasonably priced and true luxury eating. All the staff were very helpful in getting us all the answers to any questions we asked them.There's one thing that I felt so bad about was that we left the hotel early to catch our flight and I forgot to leave our tip for the maids and for this I am truely apologetic at they were fabulous and made the room look spectacular every single day. Thank you very much for all your generous gestures and kindness during our visit, I'd highly recommend this hotel and if u can book early u can get an amazing deal on an amazing room, go for a Lanai room, it really makes a big difference.

Started our first ever Hawaii trip in Kauai. Awesome, that was for pleasure. The second part of the trip was for business at The Kahala! AMAZING! I loved the first part of our trip, but I also enjoyed the "business' part equally. We had a celebration/ sales meeting at The Kahala. We met up w/ our Japanese colleagues. They were VERY happy with accommodations and meeting space. We were upgraded to Dolphin suites, AMAZING! We adored the sea turtles and are looking forward to returning with our children in the future. Staff was super polite, kind and always willing to help. It was not cheap, but worth every penny. This is the place to splurge. Save your pennies and spend them here. Do the Dolphin Quest, have some drinks, eat the AMAZING breakfast buffet (don't miss the coconut syrup!) Concierge service was impeccable! We enjoyed a trip into Waikiki, but so glad we didn't stay there. It was crazy busy. The Kahala was the polar opposite. Relaxing, quiet, secluded, but just minutes from Waikiki. It was "perfectly perfect in every way!"

My husband and I came here on our honeymoon and it was amazing! Everything about the trip was great. There were no complaints with any aspect of our stay! Beautiful rooms and grounds. We especially liked the Dolphins and turtles that were around! If you are looking to stay somewhere away from the crowds this place is excellent!

Traveled here after 5 days on Maui. Nice to be near the city with a great beach and views without the crowds. Very nice breakfast buffet in the open air restaurant. Get the shuttle schedule right away to plan free trips to downtown Honolulu. Good sandwiches at the pool bar for lunch. We had a lower priced hillside view which was fine since we spent most time on the beach. Beach snorkeling was ok and best done at low tide. Only one surprise, a $17 bellman tip on the bill.

Our second visit to the Kahala was just as good as our first. This hotel gets the details right without being ostentatious or obnoxious. Relaxing and beautiful! Stay and you won't be disappointed with your decision.

First, the good...Spacious rooms with balconies to take in either a view of the ocean or the hillside. We had a hillside view and enjoyed sitting outside while the sun went down and we listened to the cascading waterfall below us. Our room was very clean and the bedding was of excellent quality with plenty of pillows. Our housekeeper was very nice and gladly left us extra coffee upon request. The alarm clock with latest IPhone connection was convenient for listening to music and charging my phone. In general, the staff is friendly, smiling and very helpful...must say thanks again to Taylor in The Veranda for her excellent recommendations and great attitude.This a a great place to stay overall but here are a few things that need improvement.My partner arrived a day earlier than I did and he was greeted with a welcome and a lei. I showed up the next day and got neither. Maybe I just missed "Lei day" but for consistency, it would have been nice to get the same greeting.At the pool, service was spotty and it was difficult to find someone to give you a towel. I'd have preferred they just place a pile of them in one location for everyone to grab as needed. This item may be just my own personal issue but the dolphins on the premises make me feel sad. They live in a pretty small space compared to the ocean that they could be living in just several yards away. I know the kids and families love these amazing animals and get to experience them up close but I'd rather travel to see them in the wild where they came from.

The Kahala offers great service and wonderful dining options. The beach is not huge but kept groomed and the service on the beach is spot on. The pool is not as large as we would have thought but again the service is outstanding It's possible to swim with dolphins without leaving the pool area and great for kidsWe would go back anytime!

This resort was amazing! We loved most every minute! The weekends are exceptionally busy with weddings everywhere. But, don't let that deter you, it's a magical place. The rooms are beautiful and the service is top notch. The beach area was a little on the small side, but a gorgeous view. We ate only breakfast in the hotel, but I have Celiac Disease and can only have gluten free. They accommodate! Housekeeping was wonderful and the rooms very clean, the entire property was clean. We had one issue with the parking garage, but that will be taken care of. We are planning a trip back to stay the entire time there. You won't be disappointed!

We just returned from the Kahala. Must be our 15th time! Had a "partial ocean view Lanai" which was everything we could hope for. At check in, we were first offered a mountain view, but my wife really wanted to see ocean, and of course, they accomodated her with this great room. Breakfast at Plumeria was excellent as usual. Had drinks at small bar in Hoku's which was fun and relaxing. New Italian restaurant was a problem, as we could not get in. We were there a week and could not get a reservation. I think hotel guests should always be accomodated, but apparently this restaurant is not owned by the hotel and it shows. The staff are what really makes your stay here exceptional and they came through once again. My only issue is that their needs to be more shade options at the beach. No one sits in the sun anymore, and it gets competitive for the shade under the tree. Can't wait for our next trip in the fall!

Having decided on The Kahala for this trip as somewhere new to try based on family recommendations we had high expectations.I reached out to the reservations staff prior to our arrival on a few items for our stay and the level of service (by Sherrilyn) was simply exceptional and world class.We had a family group (under two surnames) and for my family we had an ocean front suite which was truly stunning and being right above the dolphins was a life long memory just alone to see our 2yr old son's reaction each day and night calling out and talking to all the dolphins.We had one major issue that we book a king bed suite and when we arrived we found two basically over sized single beds in our suite.We had requested this set up for my sister in laws room ,but not our suite, and after two attempts speaking with the front desk we were told "the G.M will call you to resolve" and that never happened, which was disappointing. We had an issue with our bill which also took multiple conversations to resolve.These, I guess are admin issues but the bedding was a major one and very disappointing we never were called to resolve for us during our 3 night stay.The resort itself is truly beautiful and the location is what really sets it apart from other leading resorts such as The Halekulani.Having the dolphin lagoon is amazing and offers a real unique aspect to your stay here.Having swam with many sea turtles in Hawaii I did find it a little sad to see sea turtles in a very small pond, but perhaps they are happy, although it seems almost cruel to me.The buffet breakfast here is below world class and well below expectations and has no soul.The omelet and egg station is great but the rest is very poor indeed.Perhaps most people have breakfast as their rate so the Kahala doesn't see the need to be world class in this area which is a shame, as something like this will make people stay elsewhere in the future.We had read many people in their reviews saying how small the pool is, and sure it's not huge but it was more than ok - although we were there in off peak season, so I could see it being painful to get a seat in summer for example.The beach and bay is simply stunning.The free wifi was the worst I have uncounted in any resort on the planet as it drops out constantly and you are not aware it has dropped out, and then you have to re log in, which we had to do approx 10 times a day over just a few hours in the room - simply useless.*We all had this issue regardless of device etc.I can be hard to please (as my wife tells me often) but having been lucky enough to travel across the world there are certain expectations you come to expect when staying AND paying for a resort such as The Kahala and although it truly is beautiful it is expensive and does need some more love and attention.

We drove up and were promptly greeted with beautiful Leis as the car was whisked away and our luggage promptly gathered. The experience took a dramatic turn when the person at the front desk told us we would not have a King size bed because we did not "request" one upon booking. It was not so much WHAT she said, but the WAY she said it. Somewhat condescending and leaving the distinct impression that the satisfaction of other customers was more important than ours. NOT good news when you are on your anniversary. The room was nice but when I turned on the light it flickered like a strobe light in a disco. My wife was very unhappy. I called to talk to the Manager but he was "busy" with others. After a while he called me and we were given a significant upgrade to a beachfront room with lanai; but had to pay an additional $250. At first I was a bit put out but came to find that the room they gave me was quite a bit more expensive than our original booking and the $250 was a fantastic bargain. Perhaps the complimentary bottle of Champagne helped too!We ate at Hoku's and the food was good but the service was incredible. The lady who served us helped so much with the pairing of the wines with our meal and great options for going through the menu. She made the experience so much better and even gave us a complimentary dessert with candles for our anniversary.We also invited friends for the seafood buffet at the Plumeria, it was simply outstanding! We all enjoyed the great selection of food and wine list was great too. It was a wonderful and memorable evening for us all.The beautiful and SECURE beach was relaxing beyond compare and unlike the rest of the island where you get a ticket for drinking at the beach, they have a wonderful beach/poolside bar.We will definitely visit again and if it had not been for that one person at Check In it would have easily been a five star experience.

We had excellent experiences at every level during our six-day stay (my husband and I traveled with our 9 y old daughter). However there are two things to mention that unfortunately are on not on the good side: although our "scenic ocean view" one bedroom suite was in a very good shape, the state of the hotel in general is showing visible signs of degradation.Perhaps the hotel will go through a renovation before things get (much) worse.But one very short dialogue that I had with a young pool staff member was really unbelievable, and, I think, absolutely not excusable:"Excuse me, where is the restroom?""Right there (he gave me indications)." and he added smiling "Or you can jump into the pool and pee in there."I would like to count this incident on the "weird travel experiences" category yet WOW!!! I was stupefied. What kind of training (if any) the pool staff receives? To feel free to give these kind of "pee in the pool" suggestions?
