When I was researching resorts on Oahu to celebrate our 45th Wedding Anniversary, all recommendations kept pointing to "The Kahala." . and, BOY, did I make the right choice! From the time I first communicated with Ellen in Reservations to our luxurious suite to our checkout with Noel at the Front Desk everything was perfect. The food at the onsite restaurants was exceptional as was the service. We celebrated our anniversary with dinner at Hoku's and it was one to remember. Our server, Lisa, was wonderful . . .the meal was outstanding. They even brought us a special anniversary dessert! I could go on and on about all of the amenities. . . .some that aren't listed on their website. The worst part of our stay was checking out and flying home. If. uh. .when. . . we return to Hawaii, the only place we will stay is at the Kahala.(P.S. If I could select more than 5 stars for an overall rating. . . .I would!)

Very beautiful spot, traditional hotel resort charm. Should rent a car if you stay here so you can explore the island and visit the bustle of Waikiki. The restaurants are ok, and the staff is very friendly and helpful.ngo outside the hotel for more interesting, and less pricey, food!

This resort was the perfect place to start our Hawaiian vacation. It was a beautiful, peaceful, elegant resort - isolated from the chaos that is Honolulu. Like an elegant empress, the Kahala stands regal and calm to welcome all. While she may show her age at times, she ensures you are at peace, surrounded by beauty, and pampering.While this resort can be pricey, they do not nickel and dime you. Free Kona coffee in the morning, amazing salted dark chocolate at turn down, almost-private beach, a variety of amazing Macadamia nuts as a welcome gift, and friendly people. Similarly, the food is amazing, but pricey.I still dream of the Kahala.

Charming grand dame hotel, good service, small but very nice territory, small pool, excellent pretty shallow beach, safe for kids. Arancino was a great restaurant, the rest reasonable but quite unexciting.

Aloha! We stayed 5 nights at this hotel with our little kids(4 year and <2 year old). Very comfortable stay! We wanted to stay close enough to Waikiki but away from the crowd and the noise.Please look no further and book your stay here if this is important to you. We felt the rooms are priced high for its size but they are very clean. I would recommend including the breakfast package at the time of booking your room. Our package included daily buffet breakfast at the ocean front Plumeria Beach House. The beach is very good but the pool is very small.The hotel is the home for some amazing dolphins. My daughter and wife did the dolphin encounter program ("Wee Family, Fins and Fun"), which was memorable! The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to the mall and the Kahala mall. Use it if you need to! Our peeves-1. We felt that the parking at the hotel expensive.2. We had requested for a room upgrade to the partial ocean view several days prior to arrival upon availability. Although the rooms were available, the request was turned down. 3. Lots of black ants in the pool. I talked to the pool staff and they are not able to do much to control it.Overall we enjoyed our stay!Mahalo

This hotel is very elegant, the service and the staff are exceptional. This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still close enough to town if you would like to shop or have dinner.The beach and the views are out of this world If you want to relax this is the place to go.

Relaxing, peaceful, beautiful luxurious. Away from all the noise and crowds, but convenient cab ride to activities and night life. Loved the rooms and delicious food. Great beach, too! We would stay again in a heartbeat!

This was our honeymoon and from the moment our shuttle bus pulled up to the estate, we were met with high quality service, friendly smiles and a feeling of joy that we were staying at the hotel. The room was amazing, beautifully laid out, furniture of the highest standard and a view to die for. The bottle of champagne was just another wow factor. We ate in the Plumeria, the Italian restaurant (whose name i cant remember) and the Veranda. The service was some of the best received, the food was excellent although they did undercook my wife's burger this was quickly rectified. The beach and pool area is so clean, so tidy and they have friendly helpful staff. The dolphin and other wildlife just gives you the feeling of remoteness and relaxation even though you are not far from Waikiki. We loved our stay here and it was better than our best hopes. Amazing hotel with amazing staff and a feeling of luxury that gives you everything you want

The staff was wonderful, the rooms were very large and well decorated with a spacious balcony. The beach and pool area was very comfortable (not a crowded mess like other resorts). The dolphins swimming through the hotel grounds was awesome.

I've stayed at many hotels in Honolulu, but have always sort of forgot about the Kahala. The chaos of the hotels in Waikiki, even "serene" ones like The Modern are very chaotic with too many people, slow elevators, crowds in the foyer, slow valet parking, loud bars & screaming outside, etc. At the Kahala, everything was PERFECT. It's a bit of a farther drive past Diamond Head, but it's through a lovely peaceful high-end neighborhood so you can see a little bit of the local living in Honolulu.Breakfast was fantastics; we never had a bad seat and it was never too crowded. We ran outside but also used the gym once, which was perfectly equipped. It's a bit on the higher end when it comes to cost and the pool is indeed small (we unfortunately picked a seat next to the restaurant/bar, which was noisy with the smoothie machine. But it's like that everywhere at all hotels, so it was our own fault), but with guaranteed relaxation we will stay here again!

This was by far a GREAT experience, from the moment we arrived we were welcomed and treated like Royality. The staff were very accommodating and pleasant, receptive and friendly. It is a beautiful resort off the beaten path but only a short drive or shuttle ride to downtown Wakikii. From the Valet to the desk clerk to the wait staff to the room attendants to the concierge were all very helpful and catered to our every whem. If you take the opportunity to make it there you will not regret it. The Concierge, Gloria Robinson made you feel like you are the only one that matters, she is very knowledgeable and provides guidance when you want to dine, tour or find interesting things to do in Hawaii. This is a 5 Star Resort but we received 10 STAR service!!!

Wow sums this resort up. The rooms are comfortable with beautiful linens and pretty bathrooms with large tubs for relaxing. The hotel has a dolphin habitat and the beach is breathtaking. The rooms are loaded with little amenities that just make your stay there perfect, setting the tone for a Hawaiian paradise.

The Kahala Beach Resort was everything we hoped it would be. It was the best run hotel and resort that we have ever visited. Service was superb from the moment we drove up. any need we had was taken care of quickly and efficiently. We upgraded to an ocean view room and it was worth the extra money. The vistas of the lagoon, pool and ocean were magnificent. Both restaurants that we ate at, Hoku's and Arancino's were excellent. Afternoon Tea was also served and we heartily recommend it if you have time. The Kahala was convenient to Honolulu and all of the sites around the area but is far enough away from the city to feel a sense of relaxation. I would recommend considering the Kahala if you will be in the Honolulu area

I've stayed at many hotels in Honolulu around this price point. This is the only one relaxing and not feeling like a zoo; other hotels had too many people, busy lobby, long time for valet parking, messy buffets and breakfast, small rooms. This hotel is PERFECT.

Good location, away from Waikiki but near enough to travel into via shuttle or taxi or even walk like we did most of the times, lovely grounds, Diamond Head in the background as you sit on the semi-private beach. Very relaxed atmosphere, with available water activities, which is great, but…The hotel is aging and it shows everywhere. There is not a single thing in a room that is stain free, also very outdated furniture, very 1970’s feel, NO adult pool. Staff were a bit slow, and seemed to be too busy with all the weddings that were happening all day long. The food also nothing to write home about, really average at best and quite pricey. Would not come back.

My family and I have visited the Kahala over the past 30 years. We return for the beautiful semi private beach, views, the nostalgia and the aloha spirit that we've come to enjoy from all of the staff. However, nostalgia does not make us blind to the rooms, which are in dire need of a good scrubbing. I echo other reviewers when I say that that the carpets have stains, the chairs do too. Most offensive is the non slip rubber strips in the bathtub which are almost black. One look and we knew that we would not be using the bathtub. A simple use of R.O.G. with its special sponge on a daily basis will eradicate that soap scum. For the hotel rates offered, I expect more. We always rent a car to drive over to the hotel, and parking is not cheap everyday. Their is a hotel shuttle offered to Kahala Mall and Ala Moana as well.In any case, I still love the hotel for all the memories that it has given my family. The views are beautiful, and I love how it feels like you have your own private beach. The Kahala staff makes a huge difference too-- for so many years the service has remained consistently great: the bell desk with their friendly attitudes, the front desk (especially Lorna) with their aloha spirit and of course the Plumeria cafe staff. Love the buffet breakfast with all their delicious macadamia pancakes, fruit bowls, malasadas and more. Not to be missed is the Italian restaurant as well, with its delectable uni pasta. We enjoyed paddle boarding and there are other water activities to be enjoyed as well. These activities are not cheap, so keep that in mind. All in all, I wish I could give the hotel five stars but the state of the rooms just do not justify it anymore.

I truly enjoyed my stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort. The Hotel personnel were friendly and welcoming. The attention to details made all of the difference. I especially appreciated the concierge service; Gloria was exceptional! I look forward to staying at the at the Kahala Hotel and Resort on my next visit to Honolulu.

From the time we pulled up with the TOTALLY RUDE security guard, to the snooty workers, to the poorly run valet, to the overrated food, to the deteriorating hotel, to the unusually small area they hold their Dolphins... This place is a NO go for us. We are SO glad we made a visit to this place before booking our next Hawaiian vacation. We are currently staying at The Trump for about the same price as we would have paid here. I would not have lasted 11 days in this place. Wow, and did I mention how RUDE the staff is here?!?! 5 stars? No way...Stay somewhere else. This place is overrated.

If you don't like the busy Waikiki area then this is the resort for you. Its only about a 15 to 20 minute drive if you need to reach Waikiki. The level of service provided is outstanding and it truly is a 5 star resort. All staff members call you by name and are very courteous and helpful. The rooms themselves are very nice. I stayed in a regular room with a king bed and veranda. I had a partial view of the ocean but I saw several awesome sunrise from the veranda. The bathroom area is very spacious with double vanities and a separate shower and tub. There are very nice restaurants on site or you can choose to use the room service option. There wasn't a meal I didn't enjoy. As a whole I'd say the staff makes you feel very welcome while you are here.

We stayed at a The Kahala for four nights on our honeymoon and we were not disappointed. The hotel itself is beautiful and the service is beyond compare. Our every need was anticipated. From the front desk to the valet the customer service never wavered. We had the breakfast buffet every morning at the Plumeria Beach House and dinner a couple times and found the food to be fresh and very good. The beach/pool area is small but in a comfortable way and we found the service was great out there as well. The dolphins, sea turtles, sting rays, and other sea life on the property were definitely an added bonus. We would definitely stay again.

My husband and I took our 4 kids, between ages 8-15, and had one of the most memorable, special, and fun vacations! The Kahala sets up so well for families, and we were impressed with everything from start to finish. The food was fantastic at all of the restaurants (which is generally not the case at resorts in our experience), the service is outstanding in all aspects, and the rooms are great. We had connecting rooms which were spacious and so nicely appointed. The beds were super comfortable, and the rooms spotless. The beach is beautiful and the ocean is safe for the kids to swim around. They paddle-boarded and enjoyed swimming out to the raft. The kids also had so much fun with the dolphin experience - truly incredible. The Kahala is in a great location, too. It is close enough to Waikiki and to the highway so that we could venture out to do other things around the island, but it was really nice to be off the beaten path. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone! We can't wait to go back!

My Friend and I took a room each here for 5 Nights and we were sure not disappointedFrom the initial phone call to make the reservation to our greeting on arrival and the 5 star service throughout.Great Rooms, fabulous breakfast, good restaurants, nice bar, amazing dolphins, turtles and fish in the outdoor pools and the wonderful beach.We had an 11 day Hawaii Cruise ahead of us , but the hell did we want to leave, could have easily spent another 11 nights hereHighly recommended , I certainly hope to return

I have stayed at the Kahala repeatedly over the past 25 years. It's still the top proprerty on Oahu - setting, beach and service exceeds even the Halekulani. The staff is the real key - consistency, friendliness and excellence are their hallmarks. They embody Aloha, and make the Kahala truly memorable.My only complaint is with the rooms. The guest room renovations over the past few years were not successful. While the public areas look great, the rooms lost their Hawaii feel and overall impact. The new look is more Santa Monica than Hawaii, and the furnishings, walls and carpets don't wear well. I will never understand why the iconic parquet flors were covered-up with wall-to-wall carpeting. The carpets just get stained, smell musty and make the rooms feel less grand. Despite the generous room size, there is insufficient (and cheap) furniture and nowhere comfortable to sit - other than the bed. Finally, the bathrooms, which were very nicely redone in the mid-90's for the Mandarin Oriental, are showing age and do not match the decor of the rooms. With some surface renovations in the bathrooms, new furniture and exposing the old floors (which hopefully are still under the carpets), the rooms again could rival the best anywhere.

Love it, love it, love it! But then I've loved it for 30+ years. My daughter, son and I were there recently and remarked on how well it has stood the test of time and changing management. The lobby continues to be one of the most beautiful anywhere. Some of the staff have been there longer than I have which speaks well for the hotel--and we love those familiar faces! Everyone, old and new is friendly and helpful. Lots of Aloha at this property!
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Cathrine S
New York, New York, United States

review_body: I stood at the Kahala Hotel for a Romantic get away, rooms are amazing, dolphins out the window, hear the ocean and most important away from all the Waikiki noise but a few minutes ride to all the action, Restaurants are fantastic, great service and food, a must do, go for the Sunday Brunch or just sit in the lounge for drinks and PUPU

We enjoyed the days we stayed during our honeymoon. Had a great room , quiet, clean and with good views. People working in the hotel were very professional . We were very happy with this hotel. The turtles and rays were impresionates

We just spent a week at the Kahala, and had a great experience overall. We had a very nice room with connecting room for our kids overlooking the dolphin lagoon, and it was a blast watching them frolic at all hours of the day. Positives- Rooms were decent sized and very comfortable- Staff was very helpful and friendly- Beach and pool were generally uncrowded and we could get chaises when we wanted- Breakfast buffet was excellent (though if not in our package I wouldn't have paid that much)- Light plates at the Veranda restaurant were great - nice food and ambiance- Parking is easy (though $28/day!)- The nightly mineral water and salted dark chocolates as part of turn-down!Negatives- On-site restaurants are expensive. Typically $60-$75 per person with my kids as part of the party. Not a huge number of cheaper options right nearby (except Olive Tree).- A $142 charge to guarantee that we'd have connecting rooms (!)- No night-time activity on the beach - there's a restaurant with lights, but never open and no lights on the beach. My guess is that the goal is to keep things quiet near the rooms at night.Summary- A great place to come on Oahu for a luxurious getaway - just be prepared to pay luxury prices for food and amenities.

A nice place to stay but felt like I was profiled, being treated not as a customer but as if I was just someone off the street. Some of the wait staff and the front desk was very helpful and courteous, others were not.

The Kahala Hotel and Resort retains the elegance and traditional warm Aloha spirit that it had over 50 years ago. This hotel was initially owned by Hilton, then by the Mandarin group, and now is under new management but they have retained most of the original staff and the elegance and warm Aloha spirit has not been lost. I grew up visiting the hotel while in high school and returned in 1983 to run in the Honolulu Marathon. This recent visit was for my 50th high school reunion. I can't praise the hotel staff enough. The warm welcome and genuine care and Aloha were remarkable. Lynn at the front desk placed us in a wonderful room overlooking the porpoises and the hotel beach. The hotel has been maintained well over the past 50+ years and is not showing its age at all. The bell and valet service was excellent and warm. The housekeepers were all very gracious.

Wonderful resort hidden in a residential area beyond Diamond Head and away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki; a place for peace and quiet. Magnificent lobby. Spacious guest rooms are well appointed and the bathrooms have his and her areas at opposite ends of the room from each other, a very nice feature. Bed was very comfortable, and the balcony wall is covered in drape adding to the feel of spaciousness and luxury. Your kids can even swim with the dolphins and there are tropical fish, turtles and sting rays all for viewing in the decorative pools outside the hotel door. There are several dining options. You really could spend your entire time here and not leave the property.

We spent 3 nights at the Kohala and we did our research before we left home. Tripadvisor, Jetsetter and even Andrew Harper ranked this property very high, so we went on the advice of all that research and with high expectations. We were also travelling with another couple and they too saw the high ratings of this hotel. Sadly, none of us will be returning to the Kohala as we were disappointed. When we booked, we reserved a partial ocean view room. When we entered the room it was clearly a mountain view room, and we asked to change rooms. Granted, if you stood on the balcony on a stool and leaned way over and looked far right you might have seen a sliver of ocean in the distance. This room however did not match the picture printout we had with us of a partial ocean view from the hotel website. They changed our room to an ocean front room. The room was very nice, roomy and bright. But, there was a huge parking garage in front of this ocean view.We were ok until the second morning of our stay. We had booked the bed and breakfast package which included daily breakfast at Plumeria restaurant and this was confirmed at check-in. They even handed me a printout about this breakfast package and it all looked nice. When we arrived for breakfast on the second morning, we were told by a man with a snotty attitude that we needed a reservation for breakfast and he would not seat us. He repeated this several times and told us to try our luck getting a seat at the bar to eat. We ate here yesterday--no problems. Now, if a reservation was necessary why wasn't I told I needed a reservation? It wasn't stated on that printout I was given at check-in. Or why didn't they offer to make a reservation for me since the breakfast package was included in my reservation? The Kohala is in a residential neighborhood, so there are no other nearby restaurants or even a Starbucks to go to if your hotel refuses to seat you. But, we were able to grab 4 seats at the bar after a brief wait and ordered breakfast. Danny and Freddy took good care of us there, and they were so helpful and kind--thank you to you both. The valet and bell staff were also superb here. We have stayed at other properties in Honolulu and this is not a bad hotel (especially if this is your first visit to Oahu), but it is not close to being the best either. It was built in the 1950s, has a small pool area and is far away from everything. And for us .... It just felt like there was always something a little bit wrong here all the time!

Ok, let's get it out of the way: yes the hotel is 10 minutes away from Waikiki and upscale shopping and famous restaurants, but it doesn't matter, you are never going to leave the property. It is expensive, but worth every penny. Get the best room your budget will allow, you won't regret it. The service is spot on, attentive,and prompt, without being intrusive. At check-in, I discovered that I had not reserved a room with a lanai. I asked if I could pay to upgrade, none were available. They offered me an upgrade to a suite at a reasonable up charge. We took it, it was worth every penny.Regardless, the rooms are great, large bathrooms, double sinks, separate bath and shower, large closets, great beds and pillows. Turn down service and 2 bottles of water per day and free internet. We had the breakfast buffet included with our room, I would Reccomend doing that, but if you don't, have the breakfast buffet at least 1 day. It is one of the few hotel breakfast buffets that is worth it from a quality and variety offering. Everything from American style to European style, to Japanese style cuisine. Fresh fruits and baked goods, etc etc.All of the restaurants on premises are excellent from casual light fare to fine dining with a dress code at Hoku. We never left the premises for 5 days, except to visit Pearl Harbor and the Arizona memorial.If you reported something needed fixing they didn't just note it, they fixed or replaced it immediately. We had a cappuccino machine in our suite( surprisingly). We love coffee so we used it quite a bit. The 3rd day it broke. I told the front desk, they reacted like it was really important. I didn't expect anything to happen. We came back from the beach, it was replaced and ready to go!Speaking of the beach and pool areas, they are quiet, relaxing and well kept. Plenty of space and chairs, and food and drink service. And believe it or not, for Oahu and a luxury resort, the prices were fair. Much more so than Maui.I don't know what more I can say other than we will come back, and you should not hesitate to stay here.

Overall the Kahala is very nice, but it's bones are old... and showing.Lobby and restaurants are great. Bars close a little early though.Service is on par with any major American resort... very good, but not exceptional.Rooms are large but old. Everything about them feels very 1960's. Televisions are big screen, but wall mounted and have to be folded out of the way in order to enter the bathroom. Cabling for power, internet and TV are all in visible, but tidy, cable channels. Bathrooms have his and her sinks, but a tiling job that reminds you of Grandma's vacation home. Gym/Spa and locker rooms are almost an afterthought addition. Overall architecture of the whole hotel looks 1960's.It is a luxury hotel, it does have modern amenities, but if feels really old. It's time for a makeover.ALSO... LOVE THE SEA SALT DARK CHOCOLATES!!!!

spa: GREAT service! very secluded and private. Arancino's: neatHoku's: servers and staff very charming, food was terrificDolphins: a fun, once in a lifetime experienceluxurious way to spend the weekend

Within minutes drive to all the restaurants and shopping of Waikiki . This hotel is located at a peaceful, beautiful spot away from the crowds and noise. The hotel itself is beautiful. The staff were all friendly and helpful. It is worth the price to stay here! We will be back!

I enjoyed my stay at Kahala 2 years ago and I chose this hotel again. Overall I was satisfied with my stay, especially I like a dolphin lagoon room. Only my disappointment was that I could not relax at the poolside because of a lot of noisy kids. Although my purpose of this trip was to relax at the poolside, I gave up and left there...I understand that Hawaii is a resort place good for family with kids but some of the kids or their parents did not care about other guests...I wrote about my experience at the Kahala in my blog.http://shamrockblog.com/2015/04/21/the-kahala-hotel/

This location was off the beaten path which was lovely. The service and hospitality were excellent. People learned our names. They followed up with me via email on a request. This was a very high quality experience

We booked a suite and they took great care of us. I'll just stick to the main points that can help visitors-- The Suite package included a RT transfer and the Chauffeur picked us at the gate and drove us to the baggage claim area and then to our hotel-- We were early so they guest director gave us a temporary room until our suite was ready--Good lunch and breakfast at their restaurants. The Japanese restaurant has a good brunch buffet. There is a dress code so please check when you book (boys -- no shorts)-Good but small Spa--The area is away from the buzz of Waikiki and that is what we like. It is a short drive away from downtown. --We did not do any of the dolphin activities -- We just don't believe in it but if you do more power to you. -Nice beach and great for a walk along the water. -- If we go back, we will be happy to stay there again.--Seems to have VVIP (not us) Presidents, PMs Kings, etc all the time.

The Kahala is a lovely upscale resort a short distance away from the madness of Waikiki. The beach was very nice. The staff was friendly. The rooms were extremely spacious. Two vanities, his and her closets, separate tub and shower. This was wonderful given we shared the room among three of us (my husband, me and my teenage daughter). We had a large room with two double beds, a chaise lounge and a desk/ chair and separate table and chair. The hotel was a smaller resort than say, The Grand Wailea and Hilton Waikoloa, where we've stayed before. But it didn't mean it was less elegant. It was very elegant and was not crowded at all, even though we were there on Spring Break. And it's perfectly located. Diamond Head was very close. As was Hanauma Bay, Koko Crater, the Original Roy's, Chief's luau, the Pali Highway, and Pearl Harbor. From the Kahala it was so easy to get on the highway and head to the more remote side of the island and many gorgeous beaches and stunning vistas. If you have small children who like swimming, the pool wasn't large. But the beach was right there and very nice and there are kayaks, paddle boards and surfboards for rent. I would highly recommend this hotel. We had a lovely stay.

My husband and I had a great couple of days at the Kahala. From the moment you arrive you are greeted by friendly staff who go out of their way to please. The parking valets, the bell men and ladies, reception and the always smiling and cheerful housekeeping staff. We did not have an ocean view but we had chosen a room within our price range. Our room was plush and ticked all the boxes. The mattress was just wonderful with high quality linen sheets. The bathroom is stunning with each of us having our own basin and cupboards and thick white towels. We included paying for breakfast, there was a short waiting time to be seated given that it was the holiday season, but this was never more than a few minutes. Breakfast spread was enormous enough to keep you going till dinner. Situated a little out of town and away from the very busy Waikiki strip, we preferred the quiet life of Kahala. Surrounded by beautiful homes, close to a big shopping mall and lovely undeveloped beaches we loved it. I feel one does have to hire a car to stay here but as we travelled around the island we made great use of our car hire. Every trip we were given water and swimming towels to take with us. If you don't exercise out in the fresh air - the gym is well equipped. The pool is a little small but not a problem with the ocean right there. We loved watching the dolphins play, an ideal place for families and couples like ourselves for a few days of rest and relaxation surrounded by luxury and happiness.

Understated, laid back, but classy all the way. We stayed in several places during our multi-island Hawaiian trip and this was my favorite by far! Upscale without being stuffy. Staff was super friendly and very pleasant. Expensive but so worth it!

After having a terrible stay at another resort on the island, we picked up and moved to the kahala. Best move ever! From the warm welcome and tbrief tour of the resort, to the small touches...to ordered poolside lunch, but my son pulled me into the pool...so they graciously waited and brought it as soon as we stepped out of the pool over an hour later. For my sons birthday, he was brought sparkling cider in champagne glasses with chocolate. Food is great, rooms are spacious and clean..service is impeccable. This is the way it is supposed to be!

Upon arrival at the hotel - the bellman stand and valets are attentive and friendly - unfortunately it ends there. With a difficult check in process and arrival at a room that we were not happy with - we called the front desk were a very short tempered man told us to come back down to switch rooms - if not for the great bellman we may have left the hotel - as it was the bellman that reasoned with the front desk to keep us from going back downstairs.The situation did not really improve and when we went to breakfast in the morning we were asked if we had a reservation and where then turned away to the bar for first come first serve even though there were open tables. 2 people in our party of the 4 were on a breakfast included plan ! I don't mind making a reservation but one should be told at check-in. The only excuse giving whenever we asked for things was that it was spring break and the hotel was extremely busy?? The beach is narrow and the pool fairly small but it is very close to the ocean so not necessary. The dolphins are very fun - the hotel also seemed to be having multiple weddings on the property it was always tough to get thru the lobby. The rooms are well appointed and after we moved to a room with a lanai it was fine. The double sinks and double closets was a very nice bonus! upon check-out we were told that we could see a final bill or what credit card was used because the computer system was down! I did speak to the manager who very graciously listened to our complaints. It would just seem that the Kahala has some work to do to get from average to great!!

Great hotel and a must stay. Get a room or suite with Ocean view on top floors Nice staff and the rooms are extra nice.Great food and spa. Expensive but worth the price. Pool is fantastic and you have the sand beach if you need the ocean.

I organized an event and stayed at the Kahala for several days. Don't get sticker shock when you first start working with them - you get more than you think. The staff operated like an extension of our team and ensured our event was successful. They did everything they could to accomodate us. The quiet, small beach and pool area was perfect for when we were off the clock. The restaurants were great options for our varied tastes. If you're considering an event at the Kahala, I highly recommend. The only bad thing was that it was windy the whole time we were there in March and some of the rooms whistled and rattled with gusts.

Oahu gets a bad rap, at least among the people I know. “It’s too built up, too congested,” they say. “Not if you stay at the Kahala,” I say. It is the perfect location – sheltered in a beautiful bay in a quiet neighborhood, very tranquil and beautiful. Yet, a short drive, not even on highways, to Honolulu, should you want a taste of shopping, restaurants, and other “action.” The staff could not be friendlier. The amenities are gracious, with several good restaurants on the grounds, and the scenery is spectacular. There’s a reason that it is chosen as the location for wedding photo shoots every weekend. Having dolphins, turtles and other sea life on the premises adds another dimension of interest. The guests embody the fact that the Hawaiian Islands are almost equidistant from the East and the U.S. mainland. The feel is very international. At the same time, there were many guests with young children. It is very family friendly. I have given our room less than 5 stars because it was a little dark. (We had a room on the ground floor by the dolphin pools.) On the other hand, it was spacious and very convenient.We enjoyed our stay immensely and hope to return soon.

Our first experience with The Kahala was on a all-expense paid business trip for my husband in January 2014. He and I went solo and LOVED everything! We loved it so much (and felt guilty for not taking the kids the first time) we returned a year later to celebrate his 50th birthday with our two teenage children. Although it was a different experience with the kids the second time, The Kahala still fit our needs perfectly. PROSThe buffet breakfast is ridiculous. I seriously gained 5 pounds during our recent spring break stay. The beach is super quiet. If there were non-hotel guests there, we didn't know it. All beaches in Hawaii are public beaches, but The Kahala is very quiet compared to the ones in Waikiki. It is a quick 10 minute drive to Waikiki which is great for shopping and people watching. We rented a car for the week as part of our travel package and it was totally worth it. There is a hotel shuttle which my daughter and I used as well. It was very convenient. The service is top-notch! Everyone is very accommodating and just a phone call away. The fish, dolphins, and turtles were fun to watch as well. CONS$20 upgrade fee (daily) for premium wireless, optional of course. My daughter said the free version was slow. I did use one day of the premium on our last day to download movies on my iPad for our plane ride back home. $75 fee (daily) for a roll-a-way bed. My son slept on the upholstered lounge chair in the room for free. The housekeeping staff gave us extra sheets and blankets. The resort food is expensive. We went to Times Supermarket, which is a five minute drive away to pick up breakfast (on the mornings we didn't do the buffet) and lunch items, and snacks. We had dinner in Waikiki most nights or wherever we had driven to sight-see for the day. The Kahala is an upscale resort for more wealthy individuals so we knew what costs were involved when we planned the trip. Just wanted to make others aware via this review. If money is not an issue for you, then The Kahala is completely perfect for you!! Although most people with loads of money are probably not reading Trip Advisor - somebody else plans their trips for them. ;)Overall, we loved it and still give it five stars even though it is expensive. You get what you pay for. We just tried to watch our spending. BTW, my husband and son played golf at Turtle Bay. It is a wonderful course, but the resort itself doesn't compare to The Kahala. It has a very big, busy resort feel (I toured it while they were playing golf), whereas The Kahala feels like home. I will never stay anywhere else on Oahu unless I move there!

My husband and I celebrated our 6 years wedding anniversary there and we do not regret a minute of it.I 'd like to start to thanks all the staff at the Kahala for making our stay such a great one. They are such a lovely team and really make you feel special.Special thanks to Noel at the reception desk, you are great and make our stay feel special!Sorry for not remembering all the names but also a special thanks to James at the reception desk, Susan and Caroline at the Breakfast.Property in general was great, clean, quiet, nice beach and close enough to Waikiki by car.Room, was a bit small but perfect for a couple, very clean, and quiet.Restaurant, we tried them all and they are all very good, nice food and good service.The outstanding breakfast started out our day!Loved the dolphin area.Everything about it was wonderful from the valets to the rooms! and would highly recommend it. We went in September it was quiet although a lot of weddings going on which was nice to watch actually, the weather was perfect.Would definitely return.All the best to the Kahala team!Celine and Olivier

Beautiful resort with top notch service. Everyone was outstanding and very professional. My family enjoyed out trip and cannot say one bad thing about this resort. Wonderful food and away from downtown m Waikiki. Very classy!

My husband and and I had spent the week and a half leading up to our three nights at The Kahala in remote locations so we were ready for some pampering. The Kahala did not disappoint. Our room was ready early, staff was gracious and attentive, food at all four restaurants was very good. I swooned when I noticed Frette linens. Highlight of this property is the location and grounds. No craziness like Waikiki, just a stone's throw away. The ocean is calm due to tasteful made breakwaters. Pool is small and more for kids, but with the excellent beach, let the kids have it. Rooms can either face the ocean or the mountain behind. We were hoping for a mountain view, but we were on fist floor with a large tree. Suggest you be specific about what you have in mind. A last item is the dolphins. Could have watched them all day. To sum it up, we did not leave the property except to go to the WW II MEMORIAL.

We visited Oahu following a fun week in Maui.Kahala - Great location, away from Waikiki but near enough to travel into via shuttle or 25 dollar taxi. Unique experience for children swimming with dolphins in large lake on site, great to watch turtles, rays etc. Conceirge really helpful and can sort anything out for you. Restaurants - Arancini, Hokus, Seaside Grill all very good. Service throughout the hotel - 5 star, they try really hard. Our room was fantastic, views straight out to sea - whales in the distance. Great Resort for children. Free Wifi.Now the cons :Checkin process was badly handled and caused inconvenience, dealt with by the manager.No adult pool, small pool full of children not possible to swim, very noisy. The resort has chosen to have a dolphin pool.Not really for couples You have to rent umbrellas $25 per day.Small Cabana $40 for 4 hoursWe bought a $50 small box of chocolates from hotel shop - they charged us 50 cents to deliver to room.Plumeira Restaurant not great.Veranda louge , lacks atmosphere and music average.

As we couldn't afford to stay at the resort we just visited for (Beachfront) breakfast and to see the dolphin pool... It was amazing! Highly recommend this (or lunch) for those like us, just wanting to get a small taste of how the other half live!

My Wife and I were there for the renewing of our wedding vows. We had an a native Hawaiian minister and professional photographer. This location is beautiful, secluded andvery private. The hotel is very much first class in many ways. I've been in hotels all overthe world and this one has it's own feeling. Seems very personal, not to big, not to small.It is away from downtown, so if you are looking for the restaurants and shops you betterhave a rental car. There is no hustle and bustle here, just peace, quite, and relaxation.The hotel may not be for everyone because it is not a high rise over looking the city, but it is a place that you can make it feel like your own.

I have stayed at MANY 5 star rated hotels around the World and the Kahala, in my opinion, rates up there with the BEST. From Management to Bellmen to Concierge and ALL other staff, My wife and I were treated with respect and kindness. We are not the types to compliment but will complain if not taken care of. I find it difficult to pick out anything to complain about. Maybe I could complain about "not being able to find something to complain about". Even the guests were delightful. Probably because they ALSO were treated so well. I know nothing is perfect and on a day to day, person to person, they could possibly not satisfy everyone. BUT, they certainly did for us.One item I would like is to increase Plumeria dinning room dinner selections and add more Pupu (snack) selections to bar menus. Hope this helps with your decision making AND I FEEL THE KAHALA IS MORE THAN WELL WORTH THE PRICE.

This hotel and resort is hidden away on the other-side of Diamond Head, and is the only hotel on the beach in this area. If you have ever stayed in Waikiki, you know how crowded it is, and this is totally the opposite. The water here seems to be warmer, maybe because it is a lot more shallow, and during low tide, you can actually walk out a quarter mile and still be standing! Water shoes are recommended. This resort has a dolphin quest, where you can learn about them, and swim with them in small groups. It was really enjoyable. Most everyone here in Hawaii are friendly and nice, but here at Kahala, they seem to really take it to the next level. It all starts at the valet, where they make you feel as if they are there to do all the work for you and take care of your every need. If you call down before you need your car, it is there when you get out front. This is the first hotel that upon check in, we received a lei and a cold towel. A short while after we checked in, we received a call from the manager on duty, excusing himself for not being there when we arrived to greet us! Unbelievable! This is where Kings and Queens stay, and they treat you as such! We ate dinner at Hoku's. A five star restaurant where the service and food are great. If you like musubi, try the signature appetizer, an ahi musubi, cut in four. Really pretty large and to-die-for! I loved it. For lunch, try Plumeria, and get a table on the patio or inside on the rail. The view is really nice and relaxing. The hamburger with an egg was my favorite. The assistant front service manager, Sahng Woo Chun, was really outstanding! He actually took the time to take me up to a two bedroom ocean front suite, so I would know what to expect the next time. Everyone goes out of their way, more than one employee asked if we wanted them to take a photo of us while we were walking about the resort! This is really a first class resort, and I can understand why people keep going back!

The Kahala is an exquisite resort property right on the beach and away from the more hectic area of Waikiki. The beach offers seclusion in that it is bordered by two peninsulas and has no neighboring hotels or resorts. The rooms offer over 550 sq. ft. of space and include a very large his and hers bathroom. The very comfortable bed was made up with luxurious bedding. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning at the Plumeria which offered optional outdoor seating. We also had outstanding dining experiences at the on property Veranda and Arancino. We enjoyed the cocktail offerings in the restaurants, and the drinks and food served on the beach from the Sea Side Grill were also outstanding. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We took advantage of the very knowledgable concierge staff for off property restaurant suggestions and reservations.

We stayed at the Kahala Resort for 4 days for a short visit to Honolulu. We wanted to avoid the business of Waikiki and the Kahala fit the bill. In addition, the amenities and staff made the stay very pleasant. Great beach, restaurants, and even a shuttle to shopping and downtown. The packages were attractive as well, and we too the breakfast inclusive package. Great European style buffet. Would definitely visit again.

I was incredibly impressed with the Kahala. On my vacation, I spent a week on the Big Island and spent 4 days in Oahu visiting my cousin who lives in Waikiki. Coming from New York City, I didn't want to stay in a big bustling city and the Kahala was perfect. It was a beautifully done hotel that was right on the beach with every amenity you could ask for. Every member of the staff was incredibly friendly and went out of their way to make my stay perfect. The cab ride into Waikiki was a bit of a hassle, but the hotel operated a shuttle that went back and forth. The beach was perfect and very restful and I had a terrific time here. I would highly recommend this hotel to any and all.
user_name:
Q2019NZjamesk
New York City, New York

review_body: We had the privilege of staying at the Kahala for 5 days and service is second to none. Every staff person went out of their way to see if there was anything they could do for us. The rooms were spacious and the turn down service each night was a nice treat. The valets were quick to retrieve your car and made sure to ask if you needed directions.The food at Hoku was one of the best dinners we have ever had and I will share a separate review for that. Plumeria and the Seaside Grill also had excellent food and service. The service at the Seaside Grill is a bit more laid back.We did the dolphin adventure and that was outstanding - so much fun and such talented staff and of course the dolphins are so smart! There are stingrays, turtles and tons of fish in a couple of pools along the walkways.There are a couple of things to think about regarding the facilities - the pool is a bit small and although it wasn't that crowded in the pool - scoring chairs around the pool depends on the time of day if you need more than 2 (there were 4 of us and we all like our own chair). We bought "water shoes" for the beach because the coral reef is close to the shore and the sand is a bit muddy. We rented two rooms and required them to be connecting - there was a daily fee for this - I certainly don't understand why - it just doesn't fit with the rest of the experience and is the small amount of revenue worth upsetting a guest over?I didn't consider the previous 3 observations to be significant - just something to be aware of.
user_location: New Providence, New Jersey, United States
user_name:
Mike J
New Providence, New Jersey, United States

review_body: We just returned from our 2015 March break vacation with a less than stellar hotel stay (5 star Phoenician in Scottsdale). It made me think of our trip last March to Honolulu and our stay at the Kahala that I never reviewed! Better late than never! Just 15 minutes from crazy Waikiki is this beautiful resort. It has its own private beach and 5 star amenities. It has the island's only swim with dolphins encounter which was a highlight for our 2 daughters. We rented a car on site at Hertz (convenient but indifferent staff and not full time service) and drove around the Island, to Pearl Harbour and into Waikiki a few times. Great place to visit but would not want to stay at the very crowded hotels and beach! Breakfast buffet at Plumeria was amazing. Huge offering and such a beautiful setting especially sitting outside. Unfortunately, given the Kahala's location, you have to eat on site unless you drive into Waikiki or elsewhere. There is a regular shuttle but the drive home takes quite a long time due to stops. Our favourite on-site restaurant was Arancino where we had dinner twice - pricey but delicious Italian fare. Plumeria was fair for dinner and the Vernanda was nice for drinks but not great for food (slow and inexperienced staff). The restaurants could do a better job with their children's offerings all around, especially as it is such a family friendly hotel. The hotel was not super busy for March break (everyone was in Florida?!) so lots of chairs by the pool and on the beach. They didn't nickel and dime you for extras like a lot of resorts do. No resort fee, for example. Included in rate was Plumeria's amazing buffet breakfast for 2 (or 1 adult and 2 kids), Wi-Fi, newspapers, pool and beach towels and loungers etc. Concierge made us reservations at the Hilton Luau which was a real highlight (you don't go for the food though!). Loved this hotel and will stay again if we return to Oahu!

Just spent 3 nights at The Kahala and it was wonderful. The property is beautiful. Not too large but spacious with beautiful grounds. We had connecting rooms that were very large with amazing bathrooms. Plumeria restaurant has a delicious buffet breakfast. Overall wonderful experience!!
user_name:
EastCoastMomNY
New York City, New York

review_body: We have been coming to the Kahala for the past 42 years. Although it changes with remodels it always is the same with kind and courteous service. There are a few suggestions that I would recommend to improve my NEXT stay. 1) Improve the food selection for dinner at the Plumeria 2) Make sure who ever the hostess is that she speaks and understands both English and her or his other language equally.

Loved the Kahala!! Was treated like a celebrity! The linoleum massage was the best experience I ever had. My room was upgraded to the dolphin view. So relaxing to sit on the lanai and watch the dolphins. Plus you just go down some steps down the hallway and you are on the beach!! Compared to other spas ... this one was exquisite! Restaurants were great. My brother is booking another stay for December.

We have enjoyed having tea at the Kahala Hotel.The surroundings and food are wonderful along with their friendly staff.It is a wonderful and relaxing place for a laid back afternoon.We loved the quiet of the area and we have gone back on several occasions.The food is excellent and there is plenty to enjoy,

This is by far our favorite hotel on Oahu. Beautiful views in a nice neighborhood. Away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but yet you can get there easily. Pool and beach are amazing. Staff is very helpful. Only issue we had was weather. Sunny but very very windy. Asked for late check out but since we were checking out on a Saturday they were full - so no luck. It all worked out. Valet staff was great too. Just call down for your car and its waiting. We brought them malasadas one morning to say thanks. Fresh from Leonards!Expensive but worth it.

My partner was turning 50 so I decided for us to travel to Hawaii and take a cruise in honor of the big occasion. We flew in a couple of days early and stayed two nights at the Kahala. I chose this property because I didn't want the hustle and chaos that I've heard can be the norm when staying on Waikiki Beach. We drove up by shuttle bus at night and saw lit torches(which for whatever reason I hoped we'd see) and the glowing lights from the beautiful chandeliers in the lobby(I took so many pics of them from different angles I couldn't get enough). We were greeted with leis and proceeded to check in. They were gracious enough to upgrade us to a mountain view balcony from the basic room we had which was greatly appreciated. The balcony was spacious and we had a nice, scenic view of the neighboring neighborhood(was slightly annoyed by the groundskeeper weed whacking in the early morning from the golf course located behind the hotel however). The room was comfortable and tastefully appointed. We appreciated the iPod docking station next to the bed. The bathroom was very spacious but showed its age/dated and could definitely stand a refresh. We ate both mornings at the Plumeria Beach House breakfast buffet. I was somewhat disappointed. For the price I expected something more spectacular. There was a great selection to choose from and nice presentation but for whatever reason, it fell short. I also had expected a variety of fresh squeezed juices to be included in the price, they weren't. The view while dining was very tranquil. The sliding doors were open so we got lots of light and fresh air. The beach was quiet and clean. The water was very calm and relaxing. Beautiful scenery to be had from every vantage point. Also, the complimentary coffee/tea station each morning was a nice touch. We only wished they would've kept it open a bit longer. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our experience. It was ideal for our brief stay. I wish there was more to do in the surrounding area once off resort property, but I knew this resort was isolated from other reviews I read. ALOHA!!!

We stayed in this hotel for four nights last week. The resort is layed out perfectly on a fairly private beach close to diamond head It has an upscale feel and very unpretentious friendly atmosphere. From the moment we met Rick at the front desk till the moment we left and met Masa at the front door (hotel mgr) we enjoyed ourselves and felt like we were on vacation. By the way, alyssa the concierge was a great guide for day to day experiences. The entertainment at night was very relaxing and without cost. This hotel is an island of calm on an island with way too many cars and way too many vacationers. Thank you kahala for your peaceful retreat in Oahu.
user_name:
travelguy500
New York City, New York

review_body: The ocean side view is a must! The hotel staff: gracious, helpful, pleasant & exude aloha spirit; the hotel and grounds: old-fashioned stately & elegant; beach & pool are lovely; breakfast buffet luscious w incredibly fresh local produce; caters to their Japanese clientele with daily Japanese weddings (fun to watch!) and foods. Golf nearby, opportunities for surfing lessons, snorkeling, nice fitness center (the private hula lesson soooo fun!); beautiful coastline to drive around with wealthy homeowners in the vicinity vs the crowded condos throughout Waikiki and Honolulu. We've been to other islands over the years and this is an easy return to destination. It was nice to fly here direct and not need to go any further. Thank you, Kahala, for remaining true to your elegant history!

Absolutely fabulous. Well worth every penny spent. The rooms are very spacious, with large bathrooms and very comfortable king sized beds. The balcony was also very nice. I paid for a partial ocean view and could see the ocean if I leaned out very far off the balcony, but wasn't bothered because even the view of the mountains and grounds was absolutely beautiful and peaceful. The dolphins are a must see if you have the extra time and money. Spent lots of time on the beach, very nice and not over crowded at all. I will definitely come back to the Kahala for future return trips to the island.

Away from the busy Waikiki, the Kahala Hotel is a true getaway providing a relaxing and quiet ambience. Our room overlooked the dolphin lagoon where numerous dolphins swam providing a truly unique atmosphere. Each member of the staff went out of their way to establish a rapport and ensure that our needs were met. We really appreciated that the room price included a number of amenities, rather than being charged incrementally for each item. The restaurants were top notch and very reasonable. A wonderful experience and we look forward to our next stay.

The Kahala is a beautiful property. It is nestled in an area of million dollar homes and exudes class.The beach is one of the best around. White sand stretches on forever. It is one of the few beaches with lawn chairs out at water's edge. The pool attendants set up your pool chairs. Pool towels are huge and luxurious.The staff are friendly and helpful. After the first day everyone greeted me by name! When I had a problem one night the manager asked if he could come straight to the room to be sure things were resolved to our satisfaction. We used valet service for our car and found our car was delivered in less than 2 minutes on each occasion. On the flip side, the pool is very small. However, they have another pool for kiddies that is huge by kid pool standards! The pool was a comfortable temperature. There are trees around the pool and it was quite windy so there was debris in the pool.Rooms are large with huge bathrooms. Compared to Waikiki Beach they are enormous. You have both a soaker bathtub and a shower along with separate sinks and vanities. Toiletries are excellent. Besides the standard items there was a razor, toothbrush and toothpaste, etc. The TV was large with a great picture. However, there were a limited number of channels. Actually, the least I have ever had on this island. They promoted their pay per view movies rather than providing channels we could watch on our own.The hotel offers bicycles and suggests walking the area or walking the beach. I didn't see any other activities. The hotel has Dolphin quest onsite. Prices were steep, but swimming with the dolphins is a once in a lifetime experience. Everyone at the Dolphin Quest was very nice.Rooms have doorbells. I don't know why, except it makes them different than most. We had neighbors who had a lot of guests, until very late at night, so the doorbell was annoying. However, the staff advised us the next day that they had checked out and if they hadn't they would certainly have moved us to another room.The 10th floor is the top floor. However, that is the floor that allows smoking. We were on the 9th floor and moved down to the 7th to be away from the smoke.The dolphin rooms are in a 2 story complex surrounding the dolphins. This area is best for families. The ocean view was limited, but the lowest level rooms walked out onto the grounds.We took the shuttle into Waikiki. Roundtrip it took almost 3 hours from door to door. There was a wait for the shuttle to come, then it was 20 minutes to the stop. The return trip was 40 minutes once we were on the shuttle. Traffic was bad, and we had to make a stop at the Ala Moana shopping center before returning to the hotel. Not bad for a complimentary shuttle service, but much slower than the 10 minutes the staff said it would take each way. Just FYI.I have stayed in all the hotels at Waikiki Beach and this was on par with them. For people looking for solitude I don't think you could do better. Our visit was during very heavy winds which made it impossible to spend time at the beach, biking, walking, or even being outdoors much. This corner of the island grabs the wind more, I believe, since there was no wind when we went to Waikiki in the evening. This property is very exclusive and very expensive. There is no resort fee, but there are also very limited activities offered in comparison to hotels which do have resort fees. Overall a great experience. I look forward to returning again when the wind isn't quite so strong.

Its beautiful, safe, family friendly, great food, breath taking views. Swim with dolphins, relax ocean front, watch the sun rise and set. cant wait to return, never want to leave. Golf course across the street. Everything was wonderful, the people are so kind and helpful. I'm so ready to return. It's known as the Beverly Hills of Hawaii !!!

I recently spent nine nights at the Kahala Hotel & Resort and it was everything I had dreamed it would be. My friend and I had a 7th floor ocean front room with a lanai and the view was spectacular. Our room was spacious as was the bathroom. Our room was serviced twice daily and the staff always left extra towels, bottled water, and lotions for the bath. The staff greeted us each time we passed by them and made us feel genuinely welcome.We ate at three of the four restaurants as well as ordering room service and we were not disappointed with any of our meals. The food was first class, especially the catch of the day.We did not use the swimming pool but did enjoy swimming daily in the ocean.The staff who set up our chairs with towels or set up the the cabanas were always cheerful and helpful.I would highly recommend the Kahala Resort to anyone wanting that very special holiday away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. It is expensive but well worth the money.

Immaculate rooms. High quality fitness centre. Very attentive staff, we were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived. Exceeded our expectations. Can't wait to return to this high class resort!

I visited here at short notice and we were blown away by the beauty of the hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the beach and pool area fantastic. Being just outside the busy city centre meant we could totally relax and enjoy the luxury of the surroundings, but if we wanted were just a short taxi ride away from Waikiki.The staff were all very friendly and polite and without doubt the star attraction are the 6 resident dolphins. An amazing hotel in an amazing country.

We have traveled a lot and have stayed in many lovely hotels. The Kahala met our expectations in every way. Our room was beautiful, as were the lobby and public areas. The service was outstanding. We were pleased to have a number of fine restaurants of different types on the property. We had a wonderful stay of 7 nights.

My husband and I stayed at Kahala for the last half of our honeymoon to enjoy the serene beach and to relax. We had already did all our site seeing & shopping at the beginning of our trip while staying near Waikiki Beach. We had excellent customer service at Kahala. Everyone from the concierge to the maid were very friendly. We had a great view and were so happy we booked the ocean front lanai room. As with the previous five star reviews for Kahala, the privacy, comfortable beds, hospitality, food, and service was fantastic.Upon arriving we were greeted & were both given flower lei's. When we entered our room we found a chilled bottle of champagne and a congratulations card.We enjoyed the expansive continental breakfast every morning while sitting near the ocean. The food we ordered through room service was also very tasty. We used the workout facility with a ground level view of the beach. Both of us did a spa treatment. It was very relaxing and the room was beautiful. My only minor compliant would be the occasional clicking & clacking of high heels outside our spa room from other spa guest. For me it was very distracting but my husband stated it really did not bother him.I highly recommend this resort if your searching for pure relaxation.

This property is a nice quite retreat from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. It has beautiful accommodations and dolphins on property as well as many other things. Grea place to throw a wedding or event. Anna Hinkley was great to work with in the convention side of things. She will work with you and make your event special. If you get a chance to stay here get a dolphin view room example room 1212 it faces the Dolphins with in 10 ft of you and it views the pools and the ocean! You can't go wrong.

Had the pleasure of staying at Kahala this February for 5 days and while the property is quite lovely. I found that the my suite's cleanliness and wear and tear of furniture did not quite reflect that of a 5 star hotel. I had a suite with a balcony that had a view of the gold course and really enjoyed the quite, definitely would recommend upgrading to having a balcony. The beach has not overly busy and the staff was helpful and overall it was a great stay but the hotel could use a few updates. For more details, check out my article: http://withlovegabrielle.com/kahala-resort/

Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of january on a couples getaway. Its expensive, but not out of line for Honolulu and what you are getting. We just got a garden view and it was lovely. Rooms were nice sized and really liked the oversized bathroom with separate closets. Service was overall amazing. Breakfast was included and the buffet was fine, but not much variety day to day. Still, you cannot beat the amazing view of the ocean! It is great to be out of the crowds and traffic of downtown. Convenient 15-20 minute walk or quick drive to the Kahala Mall where we ate several meals. The Whole Foods there was great for a quick meal. Wifi was good in the public areas, but only really worked sitting at the desk in our room for some reason. But I loved going down in the early morning to sit on the veranda and work while watching the sun come up.

We didn't stay here, but I wish we did. We came to see the Dolphins at Dolphin Quest. I love how relaxed and not in the rush mode ALL the staff is. I've never seen this anywhere but here in my life and we travel a LOT. Goal is to stay here next visit. Beach is peaceful. Every1 is nice to talk to and at ease like a vacation should be. Gated well and when you walk into the hotel you are in Aww. Pure beauty and it feels like a place where classy rich people stay. Very nice place. And we ate pizza while waiting for our time with the Dolphins and that tasted just wonderful along with the pineapple coconut smoothie........delicious and the restaurant staff were PERFECT and it was a raining day. Great place to stay, not far from downtown yet u r away from the hustle n bustle crowd.

My wife and I traveled to the Kahala for the first time in six years. It was like returning home to an old favorite. The rooms are quite large--500 plus square feet--and the dressing rooms wonderful with separate sinks on opposite ends of the bathroom. We overlooked the Wailea Country Club golf course. A morning treat is to get up early, take a complementary cup of coffee and walk on the beach to see the sunrise. Follow this with what has to be the best buffet breakfast in Honolulu in the Plumeria Room fronting the ocean. You can enjoy the sun around a somewhat smallish pool for a hotel this size or set up on the beach. There are no waves in this area so swimming out to the hotel's raft is exceptionally safe.

My husband and I stayed here in February. Everything about this resort is perfect- impeccable service, quiet and gorgeous location, wonderful restaurants and amenities- I couldn't imagine why anyone wouldn't be pleased with this resort. I cannot wait to plan another trip. It was a wonderfully relaxing vacation that I will cherish for a very long time!

For my 69th birthday we decided to spend five days in Oahu and ultimately settled on staying the whole time at the Kahala, based upon Trip Advisor reviews. It couldn't have been more perfect: even though the hotel just had its 50th anniversary, it looks fresh and up to date. The landscaping and golf course is lush snd beautifully manicured, the beach and pool and dolphin lagoons are pristine and delightful for swimming or just relaxing. The sunrises are spectacular each morning! We tried three of the resort restaurants and enjoyed them all. The more casual Plumeria cafe facing the water was our favorite- delicious fusion food.We would definitely return!

My husband and I happily celebrated our 20th Anniversary here and everything way beautiful and magical. The front desk manager POK was extremely helpful,efficient,and accommodating. His friendly yet professional energy was a good sign we picked the right place to stay. Pok along with his staff made our week stay comfortable and memorable. The valet staff were always smiling and helpful especially Gary(our fav) If you have high expectations and want them met then this is your place to stay in Hawaii.Blessings The Zanes

Our third stay here and already booked for our 4th....ocean front suite was spectacular-spacious with sublime views.... Hotel staff is unfailingly gracious.... We love the non-Waikiki location- no sense of being rushed, which is, after all, why we want a beach vacation... Had a lovely dinner with our local friends at Plumeria- amazingly have not tried Hoku's yet as I went to college here many years ago and love to eat where my local friends do... For those of you who are on a first trip , give a plate lunch, saimin andKorean food a try(KimChee 2 Kaimuki and Rainbow Drive In are favorites of ours) Have had a number of dolphin encounters over the years both in the wild and in captivity-Doplhin Quest is simply superb- did the trainer for a day and the care these fantastic animals is awesome... If you want understated luxury on a beach infinitely better than Waikiki with breathtaking sunrises, the Kahala is it

This hotel did not disappoint. Everything about it was top notch - the service, food, rooms, location. I would venture to say it was one of the best properties I have stayed at.The location is amazing - just off the hotel grid with all the more touristy hotels, but still within a close enough distance to be able to go to that area for shopping etc...The rooms are so well done - not too over the top tropical.The beach is the main attraction - beautiful white sand, a quiet, sheltered alcove to swim in the beautiful clear blue ocean.Staff is attentive and friendly, but not overly so.The only thing that was a little creepy was the dolphin experience.There are 6 trained dolphins in a lagoon on the hotel property. Seemed sad to me. I had an urge to slip out late at night and set them free into the beautiful ocean just yards away.

Get away from the thronging masses of Honolulu and Waikiki beach. A classy, upscale venue with several onsite restaurants and bars to choose from.My and my wife loved the spa especially, the lomi lomi is a must do for any tired traveler. Beautiful sunrises!

Upscale options outside of the Waikiki hustle are limited, and the Kahala takes advantage of the semi-removed location, though its still buried in an (albeit upscale) neighborhood so any morning walks are around the block and mostly on the roads. That aside, it is a nice quiet location and ocean views are just what you would expect--though higher floors more towards the ends of the wings tend to give better views, and you will have to contend with either noise from the pools or noise from the front entrance traffic. The higher the better to avoid all of that. However, upgrades and room changes are hit or miss, so ask early and check often. The staff is courteous, if distant, and I don't know that I was expecting a genie in a bottle for my $800 a night, but there was some lack of efficiency and "blurry vision" towards guests. That being said, the Kahala has a lot to overcome with all the terrible Oahu traffic, fast pace and over-commercialization of this island. Sure, its tropical, but I don't know that I felt like I was in Hawaii. When I fly 12 hours to get here, maybe I expected a bit more "aloha spirit"...? We ate at Arancino's with at least three tables of crying screaming children in the background--which you can't fault them for, but definitely took away from the gourmet meal and gourmet prices. The beach needs maintenance, but was nice and shallow, and easy to go in the water. Rooms were pretty (if a bit in need of updating-particularly the bathrooms), beds are wonderful, robes were GREAT. Lanai's are definitely recommended. In the end, we were sorry that we came to Oahu, and don't know that the Kahala was able to change our mind.

I booked this resort for my honeymoon and I found this to be one of the best resorts I have ever stayed in. From the moment we arrived at the resort till the time we left the staff were fantastic, so welcoming & professional. I myself have been working in the hotel industry for 10 years and I have never met a more dedicated and professional team. The shuttle service made getting around Hawaii so much easier, the facilities at the resort are fantastic and so memorable. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. I would like to especially thank Masa, Noel & Peggy for their assistance, service and wonderful and warm personalities. My wife and I a looking forward to the day that we can return to this little slice of paradise.

5 star hotel in an exclusive neighborhood. We had stay here for 5 nights,and were kind of shocked of some things:pool area-the pool is like in cheap appt complex or something,very outdated,small,and avarage; if u are planing to use a business center(computer and printer) be ready to shed 15$ For every 30min,fax 3 per page,local calls!!! That's crazy,it's like been charge for using jym in a hotel or sitting in a lobby and be charged!!! As for the price we paid (arround 500$ per night) it's absurd! Hotel is isolated,but if u need privacy it's one for u,even though it's nothing to do here,few overpriced restaurants ,small pool,and small beach .Also they are advertising their dolphin lagoon-to swim with dolphins 10 min,my 6years old needs to be accompanied with grown up(double charge of course,what the instructors or dolphin trainers are for) 250$ .Not worth the money,pretty sure it's better deals in Honolulu than this one.

Had high expectations and they were exceeded. Customer service outstanding! Facilities great. Imagine heated seat toilet with built in bidet! Really! Dolphins swimming in the lagoon. Great to watch while drinking yummy wine. Rooms were fabulous especially the bathroom. Lots of space. Highly recommend this resort!

Still a marvelous resort. Staff is extraordinarily genuine, nice, and helpful without being patronizing. Very unique. Breakfast at the Plumeria was weak. Not the variety and quality of selections I have come to expect for a 5 star resort. Their bagels were just plain bad. However, the raman noodle won-ton soup we had for dinner was superior and a meal in itself. Restaurant and housekeeping staffs were exemplary! No need to change planes at Honolulu Airport and head to one of the other islands. Everything they have, the Kahala has without the additional travel, and with just as beautiful beach and pool area, all at the end of the road!

We stayed at The Kahala Hotel just for two nights but everything was perfect. The hotel itself and the rooms are luxurious! We had a mountain view -room but we were very satisfied with it. The bathroom was huge and the bed was really nice. The staff was wonderful and the hotel restaurants offered great food (we tried all the restaurants). The breakfast was also one of the best i have ever had. You can order breakfast to your room too if you want. The dolphins are absolutely the highlight of this hotel! This must be a great place to have wedding, because we saw three weddings in two days there. We will definitely go back some day!

We have such fondness for so many of Honolulu's lovely hotels, but none more than for the elegant and contemporary Kahala Hotel & Resort just east of Honolulu and Diamond Head.... This medium size property provides its Guests with such a scenic location, serene in composure. We love its architecture and grounds that sport beautiful dolphins and wildlife. Just a 20 minute drive from all that is hectic in nearby Honolulu and Waikiki Beach Area. Once a Hilton Hotel, then a Mandarin Hotel, this property has never missed a beat in maintaining high standards for quality rooms and service. Cannot wait for our next visit enroute to or from Kauai.
user_name:
dickgoode
New York City, New York

review_body: I was going to Hawaii on a business trip but extended my stay for a few days since I doubted I would every return. However, I found paradise and I know I will be back. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly. I enjoyed my plentiful breakfast overlooking the ocean and the dolphins kept my attention throughout the day.

Been 10 years since I last visited the Islands. I took my wife here for our 10th Anniversary. This was our first trip to the Island. We were happy in every way possible. Beach is fabulous and the water is perfect! Nice and calm for Hawaii standards which could be good or bad depending on your fancy. Great view from the room. The onsite Dolphin swimming experience is a great value add at this hotel and great to just watch. Pool? Who needs a pool in Hawaii but they have one:)CONS: Only a few and they don't matter as this PROS are too good to ignore.Beach service could be better for the price. Not enough staff. Rooms are a bit dated and on the smaller size. But still nice.

If you enjoy swimming in the ocean this is "the place" to be hotel wise on Honolulu. With a little bit of effort you can get a good table for high tea in the afternoon and whatever tea sandwiches you desire. For a resort hotel on Honolulu this is, in my opinion, one of the best. The next is the Halekulani - but not really a resort - just a very good hotel.

I have travelled and stayed on all of the Hawaiian islands countless times. For this year, I considered going back to the Four Seasons Hualalai on the Big Island, but didn't want to pay the exorbitant prices, I decided to come to Oahu and found bliss at the Kahala Resort. It is out of the craziness of Waikiki, but close enough if you want to brave it. The hotel property is wonderful. It sits on a man-made bay, so that swimming is ideal for those not interested in the huge winter waves....a perfect situation for children. There are dolphins, turtles, fish and manta ray swimming around the walkways and you are literally a few feet away from them...great photo ops! The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and the beds are extremely comfortable. You do not hear your neighbors. The staff is excellent. You come to this luxery hotel for peace and relaxation. It delivers in spades.

After reading wonderful reviews of this hotel, we had to check it out!We drove out in our rental car to have breakfast at the Plumeria Restaurant.While prices were higher than some eateries in Waikiki, it was not exorbitant. My omelette was tasty. And the smoothie was awesome---so good, in fact, that my toddler nearly drank it all....and she is a picky eater!Service was wonderful. Very attentive and considerate. Location was beautiful--nice to sit at sea level and listen to the waves.And, after breakfast, the server validated our parking! Much appreciated!After breakfast, we walked around the property...very peaceful and sophisticated. Beach looked great. Seems like a great bay for snorkelling and swimming. The float out in the water looked inviting Lovely small kiddie pool. Warm 'normal' pool. My daughter loved looking at the sting rays and sea turtles in the small ponds. And the dolphin enclosure looked very cool!In the future, we will look at staying here rather than Waikiki. While I enjoy the hustle and bustle of downtown, a few days here looks idyllic.

I stayed at The Kahala for only one night on a business trip, the last day of the Sony Open.While even the pre-paid/nonrefundable rate was very pricey, I am well aware of the cost of five star hotel nights. For that, I got excellent and professional service in all areas, as well as a large, comfortable room overlooking the golf course.
