The bathroom was unusually large and well appointed.I ate at the Veranda twice, first for the full tea (sans champagne), and for a light dinner. Again, the servers were professional and efficient, and the food was delish and not too terribly pricey (I actually don't worry that much how much I spend on food while travelling).Some TA reviewers have noted that the decor is slightly dated, but I think that's being unnecessarily picky, as the hotel is very well kept up, and the decor is neutral and in good taste, albeit rather traditional.My only small peeve was the buzzing noise outside my room. I discovered that I was not too far from the laundry for the resort! Sigh-just my luck (even after asking for a quiet room). In their defense, I am a very light sleeper, and apologies were offered at checkout. The overall locale of the resort is quiet, so the noise level in my room would probably not bother most travellers.

Its so Relaxing place all in Hawaii.You can do another experience.dolphines, HONUs, Beach, Pool, View, People, Service..PERFECT!!「Plumeria Beacch House」ocean view breakfast is also so good!!And especially "Sunrise and Sunset on the beach"its KAHALA.ハワイの中で最もリラックスできる素晴らしい場所ドルフィン ホヌ ビーチ プール 部屋からのビュー 人々 サービス等パーフェクト!!プルメリアビーチハウスでのオーシャンビューのブレックファストもまた実に良い!!特にビーチでのサンライズとサンセットは格別  これぞカハラ

We decided to get married in Oahu, but didn't want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach. I researched online and found this remarkable resort. Our friends and family stayed on Wiakiki,and when they came to Kahala Resort for the wedding, they were amazed! Our stay was so relaxing and the staff was top notch. We had the most amazing time and our memories will always be fond. What a beautiful place, with dolphins, sea turtles, and tranquility! Mahalo Kahala Beach Resort for the time of our life.

Very nice hotel. Good food and perfect atmosphere. Very well decorated for the holidays. Staff was excellent. They are accustomed to providing top notch service to everyone. Enjoyed the grounds and common areas, beach was nice albeit full of people.

Came here with my wife and my 1.5 year old baby, stayed for couple nights.I love the lcwyion the it is off the busy path of the waikiki beach. The free shuttle takes you to many places which is great. Love the dolphins there, you can watch them swimming, watch the instructor interact with them, and kids love it! The property is also on the water, a short walk you can sit by the beach, very quiet, relax, and serices were great. We tried both the Italian restaurant and the main restaurant both were excellent. I was a bit disappointed with our oom, thought it was clean, but dated, could benefit from more a modern remodeled. Personal opinion. Everything else is great.

Everything about the Kahala Hotel & Resort is truly stunning. From the moment you arrive, and greeters meet you with fresh leis, you are treated to pristine surroundings and, for the most part, outstanding service and amenities.It's hard to beat the beach at the Kahala - white sand, turquoise water, and an abundance of activities keeps you mesmerized.We were drawn to the ocean on a daily basis, walked out on the coral reefs to explore, and canoed through the calm waters. We also fished off the reefs, and caught Cornet and Sergeant Majors and released them back into the balmy sea.There are four restaurants at The Kahala. The food is most spectacular at AranCino (although we didn't dine at Hoku's, which we understand is also award-winning). But seriously, being from an Italian family, my husband and I like to think we know good Italian food. And AranCino did not disappoint. We tried the Tasting Menu and Mamma Mia, it was beyond creative and delicious. Staff at AranCino is also top-notch, especially Cirus. Ask for him when you go :).Staff at the hotel were also outstanding - polite, friendly and extremely helpful. We happened to run in to General Manager Carmine Iommazzo on our way to do some shopping at the Kahala Mall, and he offered to drive us to it! Thanks again, Carmine :).There are a couple of areas we think The Kahala could spruce up - the staff at the Seaside Grill and the Veranda are just not into it. They seem bored, uninspired and in our experience are not customer-service driven. The only other disappointment for us was - wait for it - the toilet paper. In a luxury resort like The Kahala, we expected a toilet paper to match. I know that's stretching it in terms of things to complain about but it seriously makes a big different to us. Other than that, the rooms are well appointed and spacious, and really make you feel like you are in paradise.Last but not least, the staff at the onsite Dolphin Quest are clearly highly qualified, professional and love what they do. As a general rule, we don't think Dolphins should be kept in captivity but we understand that the Dolphin Quest research program benefits dolphins in the wild and that their work helps rescue dolphins that have been injured. Our experience at The Kahala was spectacularly magnificent!

This hotel is out of the tourist frantic scean in Wakiki but close enough to make visiting all attractions easy and it is on a nice beach. The two restaurants are first rate and the informal beach cafe has a great breakfast buffet with the best sticky buns on earth. The only thing lacking is island music but that may be corrected soon

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Kahala. We wanted for nothing.. We ate ourselves silly at the Kahala's several restaurants. And we experienced the greatest time at the Kalala's Veranda restaurant, featuring pianist David Swanson. He is the greatest. He granted all our requests - - including a Motown review as we are from the Metro Detroit area. TWO THUMBS UP for the Kahala.

Although, on our last vacation, we did not actually stay at The Kahala Hotel & Resort, we wanted to write regarding the outstanding and very informative and helpful service which we received from the Concierge Desk - from Peggy, Carolyn and Cameron.We had just had an excellent and leisurely lunch at the Cabanas Seaside Grill in this Hotel, and passed by the Concierge Desk on the way out.Peggy, Carolyn and Cameron were so friendly and told us some of the history of this magnificent Hotel complex and about the December 31st 2014 New Year's Eve special celebration evening.They were so very, polite, helpful and knowledgeable, and they made our visit to this Hotel even more worthwhile.Mahalo to the Management and StaffJanet and Richard

We chose the Kahala Hilton through AmEx travel services after my husband was diagnoses with terminal cancer and we were advised to travel quickly.The staff at the Kahala helped make our stay the trip of a lifetime. Their attentiveness and attention to detail and their willingness to go above and beyond made us feel like the royalty that has been a part of the guest list for decades. The photos from dolphin experience show a smile on my husbands face that expresses nothing less that absolute joy!Thank you for creating a family memory we can hold after he has made his transition.Cyndi Dodick ~ Wilmette, IL

We honeymooned here back in 1980 when it was home to stars and celebrities. I must say that the staff treats everyone like they're stars or celebrities. Just remarkable. The latest improvements are magnificent. There's no other place like it.

We've stayed at the Kahala many times over the last five years. It was a luxury property worth the high prices. Since the new owners, their room rates have gone up and their service down. They need an adult pool. Their only pool was full of loud children. We love children! But we could not hear each other. The service at the pool was non-existent. After 4 days of this, we did not want to spend our last 6 days dealing with substandard changes. We talked to the manager and explained why we were moving to the Royal Hawaiian and they still insisted on charging us $1000 early checkout fee! Now we're paying half the cost and getting twice the service. We're not going back unless they bring back the old Kahala!

The Kahala has a knack for presenting a casual elegance and comfortable feel - understated from other high end resorts, but the quality is obvious. The staff is well trained and very professional. It is a wonderful place to enjoy Hawaii

We had one night here on our way home from our honeymoon. The hotel was out of our budget but truly worth it if your able to afford it. No details were missed, from flannels for refreshing your face/hands upon check in through to a nightly turn down service. We loved this hotel and would love to go back one day!

This place keeps amazing me every day. It keeps getting better every day I stay here. I've been to many so claimed 5-star hotels, but this place so far is my definition of 5 star hotel. During my stay, the Sony Open golf tournament was going on next door, but the hotel was very quiet and peaceful. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I've tried in Hawaii. For a true 5 star hotel, it's not really that pricey. I wish I could spend more time here. The pool isn't very large, but the private beach is pretty large, and the ocean is very calm. You can walk out at least 300 yards before hitting waves. I will definitely coming back.

Having dolphins in the yard is an unbelievable experience! You get to see and hear these beautiful creatures all day long. Guests can see how they are fed and trained! There are several packages to interact with all the animals at the hotel (sea turtles, stingrays and dolphins) which are totally worth it.The rest of the hotel is just as luxurious: neat architecture, gourmet food and royal service. The beach is simple, it is actually human-made, but it is perfect for a splash. There are better beaches near by.

I've written two previous reviews on the Kahala - the most recent suggested that the property had lost something. Well, it is back. The service has been impeccable (a real improvement). The property is immaculate (as usual). The bed is heavenly. The facilities and amenities are as good as ever. Yes, this is a premier property on Oahu!

We were not told we were given a "smoking floor" room. My wife has a cigarette smoke allergy. That is the headline. Here is the full story.We live locally on Oahu. I planned an escape for me and my wife to celebrate her coming birthday as well as some desperately needed time alone (we have a 5 yr old and 9 yr old). Having never stayed on the Kahala coast before, I though The Kahala would be perfect. A VERY nice lady helped us get a good price on a room that would normally be well above our budget. During the conversation, she said she had given us an upgrade to a partial ocean view/golf course view (the Sony Open was this weekend) on a high floor. I said, "great, thank you so much". No mention of a smoking room or floor.Upon check in, another VERY nice person told us we had been given another upgrade to an Ocean View room on the 10th floor. We could not have been happier. No mention of this being a smoking room and a smoking floor.Everyone was so nice and the interior of the lobby was spectacular, though. We arrived at our room and as the door was opened I was hit with a pretty strong and nasty whiff of old cigarette. My wife entered and we sat down. The room was very, very nice. The bathroom, bed, decor and furniture were beautiful. The carpet looked in need of replacement and the couch was filthy around the bottom. The cigarette smell seemed to grow as we sat. My wife almost immediately began to itch and I sent her to the balcony as I called the front desk. I was surprised to find out they had a smoking floor (the 10th). I told them the situation and they immediately moved us to another room. Sadly, my wife's condition did not improve. It became clear we needed to leave and fast, before she needed to use her EpiPen. Another surprise was the manager saying we had not requested a NON SMOKING room on our reservation. I told him I did not think smoking was allowed in hotels anymore AND that I did not remember a place to choose either a smoking or non smoking room on the room reservation pages on line. He then said he was willing to not charge us for our second day but that he would have to charge us one day as we were inside their 72 hour cancellation window. I said that I could see that if we were simply changing our minds. However, no one told us we were going into a smoking room. The situation was directly related to this error - an error the hotel made, not us. I told him we had to go, no matter what. If he had to charge us, while i did not think it right nor fair, we would have to accept it as I needed to get my wife out of there ASAP (yes, we could faintly smell cigarettes even in the new room). As my wife began to panic, I raced her out of there. The manager said he could not make a final decision, as he needed to talk to a higher headquarters and he did not know if anyone would be there at this time of day. Left unasked was my question as to what good is being the manager if you cannot make decisions such as this one. I gave him my cell phone as I needed to know the final outcome as soon as possible. He finally called as we were driving home to ask if we wanted to accept their one day charge and they would give us a "free" night in the future - so long as it was within 3 months. After MUCH back and forth I finally convinced him that we would really just like our money back. My wife could not conceive of going back there and being able to relax, wondering if or when cigarette smoke would creep up and make her ill.Make of this what you will. I cannot say enough about how nice the reservation, bell, valet staff were. You can draw your own conclusions about the rest. We wont be back, sadly.

The Kahala Hotel isn't what it once was. This is the 5th time I've stayed here and it loses a little luster year by year. I'll make this my last stay. There is a ton to do and it's great for a family. Golf next door holds a PGA Tour event. The private beach is great. The gym is small and run down for a hotel of this stature. The pool is a decent size and well maintained. There's an awesome experience of swimming with the Dolphins. With the rooms between over $400 you'd expect a lot of extras to be included but not here. You'll pay for WiFi. Approximately $35 a head for breakfast. Parking will set you back as well. There is a shuttle to the Kahala Mall which will help offset some expenses. My biggest complaint is a hidden policy I've never run into before. I stay in a hotel 150+ nights per year and this is a first. We booked for 6 days and informed the hotel two nights before that we would be checking out one day early. They charged us a full nights stay citing a 72 hour advance notice is required. That policy generally always points to the beginning part of the stay in case you are a total no show. The manager and reservation manger didn't budge and showed no compassion for the problem. It's the principle more than the money even though it's still a lot of money. I'd suggest to stay here for a night or two and then go to Waikiki where you'll at least be appreciated as a returning or new guest and get tons of affordable restaurants, shops & beaches.

We were a large group and found the staff to be incredibly friendly, professional and efficient. Everything we asked for was booked and followed up to ensure things ran very smoothly. We ate in a number of the restaurants and found the food to be excellent and service of a high quality. When we were there the hotel was incredibly busy due to the Sony Open golf but everything still ran smoothly. In terms of the accommodation, it was generally of a high standard but is looking a little dated and a refresh would be a good idea. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would happily recommend the hotel to anyone
user_name:
Pomsyd
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed in your hotel from August tenth to the twenty fourth. It was an amazing stay. I loved the rooms and everything else. This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in my life.There is a lot of water fun because it is near the beautiful beach. This was perfect for my young family. We all loved Dolphin quest and swimming. The dolphins were calm when I went in the water to greet them. It was extremely fun when I got to feed the dolphins. I loved swimming in the pools and beaches too.Also, there was great restaurants that I got to eat in. I loved eating at the seaside grill. The food was delicious. I enjoyed my meal while looking at the amazing view of the sea.The room was very clean and it had an amazing view outside. The bed was cozy and fluffy. The beds were clean too. Also, the room had a lot of decorations. The bathroom was very clean and it was treated very well. I also visited the gym and it was very clean and it had lots of good equipment for working out. The gym was a great place to visit because I could work out my body.I loved to take a walk in the garden because I could see beautiful flowers and I could smell the flowers which smell amazing. I loved the trees and I loved to walk around the garden.In addition, I loved the facilities were kind and they were good English speakers. The maids were kind and she cleaned the room whenever I hang the CLEAN ROOM sign. The chef was excellent at cooking and the front desk was very kind to me when I checked in for my stay.In conclusion, I enjoyed my stay and I would like to come again soon.

We have been coming to the Kahala for over 25 years. We love the location. It's very kid friendly and has a "homey" feeling. That said, I am worried about the new Kahala ownership, Japan-based Resorttrust Inc. As an example, we wanted to speak to someone at the concierge desk and were told it's for "Japanese guest only". In addition, the new Xmas Time reservation policy requires a 2 night deposit that is non-refundable after May 1st and a total payment due October 1 that is 100% non-refundable. Can you imagine being charged $4000.00 if you cancel reservations May 2 for a stay in December? Can you imagine being charged $26,000 if you need to cancel your December vacation on October 2. Yes we can buy $1500.00 in trip insurance. In conclusion, we love the Kahala. It's not a Four Seasons, but still very nice. I hope the new Kahala owners don't screw up a good thing.

The Kahala remains one of the most unique Hotels in the World. From its relaxing open spaces to its secluded location, it offers the ultimate peaceful retreat. The food and service standards are very high whilst being delivered in an understated way.

I have stayed here several times on business and it has worked out well for us. The staff is very friendly, the rooms were very clean and you couldn't ask for a better location.The hotel is way away from the busy Waikiki tourist mayhem. Its near the golf course, nice apartment locations and in a neighborhood. Very quite. What I enjoyed about it is. Its not the drunk fest tourist hotel. Its not a busy kid screaming hotel. It has the available water activities of a relaxed Hawaiian beach, which is awesome. Its well protected by a reef and kids are in no danger by waves, surfboards or running teenagers.The staff keeps the hotel immaculate. But the hotel is aging, but as all the glamour of Hawaii.

Had an awesome selection of food and deserts! Everything tasted great and even got to see Adam Sandler dining there. The cost was reasonable ($75 ea) and you get your own table unlike the other resorts where you have to share a long table with strangers. I have lived in Hawaii for 3 months, eat out almost every day and this is the best place I've eaten so far.

We spent 8 nights on the island of Oahu- I was a little reluctant, remembering our two night stay in Waikiki beach, but we were traveling with 18 family members and this island was the choice.The Kahala hotel was one of the reasons our trip turned out so great. The service was wonderful- everyone is friendly, helpful, at your service to please. Kelli-Ann in dining made sure all of our food allergy concerns were avoided BEFORE we even arrived . The rooms are spacious- not "stuffy"- just "hawaiian comfortable" - the beach is right there- does not require walking a long distance - we had concerns about the pool prior to arrival- it was never too crowded. No problem getting lounge chairs, beach chairs, etc- We were there Christmas week. The breakfast buffet was great. Exercise room was adequate- 4 treadmills, 4 ellipticals, several bikes, weights. Very peaceful, tranquil setting- not busy like waikiki beach, but easy to get everywhere.

Stayed here During spring break. Nice hotel with helpful staff. Only thing I didn't like was the location of the hotel. It was far from restaurants and Waikiki beach. It has its own private beach but it's so windy. Rooms were nice and clean. Food onsite was ok, they can do better, need more options. Not a bad hotel if u get a deal. But next time, will be staying on Waikiki beach.

Stayed in The Kahala resort last june with our 2 children aged 12 and 14. Loved it. The hotel is 15mn drive south of Waikiki beach but the hotel has free shuttle bus which is perfect for going out to dinner or shopping. As a European, Waikiki was a bit too overcrowded for my liking and the quietness of the resort was perfect. Also has one of the most beautiful beaches on Oahu. Nice rooms with 2 double beds which allowed to sleep the 4 of us in one room. The kids loved the Dolphin Experience and although very expensive, it was well worth the experience. Book in advance though as it gets very busy.

The one and only Kahala hotel which we first started going to in the 70's is now old and tired. I will admit that the beach front rooms have been redone,the staff is trying to please but this Grand Dame needs some needed TLC. The Kahala was just recently sold to a Japanese company, the staff we spoke to is hoping they will turn this beautiful hotel around. The exercise facility is small and depressing. We were told they were out of beach umbrellas at 7am in the morning, yes it was over New Years, but still no excuse when your room rate is over$1000.00 US a day. Food was just fair, a buffet that less than it should have been for that property. Let's hope that the new owners will bring this hotel back!

During a recent 5 day stop in Hawaii, we did not want to travel to another island and were looking for a luxury hotel with its own beach and slightly away from the crowds and traffic at Waikiki. The perfect hotel was the Kahala Hotel and Resort. The accommodations were spacious and very comfortable with large baths. The staff was warm and very helpful. The beach was beautiful, peaceful, and quiet. The service for food and beverages on the beach and at the pool was always quick and gracious. The views from the public areas, patios, and balconies were beautiful. However, the restaurants were a little disappointing. The food quality and variety did not always match the very high prices they charged. I would have expected a fine dining option at the hotel, a larger selection of wines, and a greater variety of menu options. Two nights, we were hard pressed to find selections that we wanted to eat. Despite the shortcomings in the restaurants, the hotel was a lovely place to stay and more than met our needs for a relaxing and peaceful getaway.

Stayed here for 4 nights family of 2 teens and 2 adults. Our agent had booked us into a family room (2 double beds) this definitely was not suitable for us the beds were more like large singles! So had to upgrade to a suite: which was heavenly ! Lovely hotel, staff, breakfast was delicious and the beach was lovely. Surprisingly hotel never felt busy although full, watching the Dolphins was beautiful but very expensive to swim with them! Would definitely return

Here over the holidays. Been here many times. Since being bought by Japanese businessman all services are not what they were. No service at pool. Nothing brought around like fruit anymore. Lower prices for rooms soooooo more kids in small pool with lots of blow up rafts and toys. All restaurants have gone down hill. Hokus used to be upscale. Now serving exact same fish of the day in preparation and presentation as coffee shop on beach ( the beach house). Hokus used to be a foodie hangout, now a hotel restaurant serving like the cheaper restaurant. Predict this will be sold again. Not high luxury. Might as well be at Waikiki hotel. If you want service go to a different island. I do recommend Four Seasons on Maui!!! Used to say this was comparable. Not any more!

We visited this hotel in November and felt like royalty! We were treated so well! Our room was wonderful and very clean. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. We had a very short stay here, but loved it. We decided to do the dophin quest and it was amazing! The pool and beach area are very nice. We didn't like was how crowded it was in Honolulu. It was nice to be in this hotel away from the crowds. They have directions to places if you need help finding something. We would love to return here someday!

I decided to celebrate my 50th birthday in Hawaii. I chose Oahu because of the many happy memories I have there, specifically the good times I had at the Kahala Hotel. I shared my excitement with several of my friends, who decided to join me in the celebration the week of October 19th. In addition to my stay, at my suggestion, 26 of my friends and family were all guests at this hotel. The rooms booked ranged from the Imperial and Presidential Suites to Beach Front and other room categories so I got to see many of the rooms aside from the one I was staying in. I personally had a confirmed reservation for an Ocean Front Suite made several months in advance of my arrival through the American Express Fine Hotel and Resorts Program, which this hotel participates in. Since we would be booking several rooms for the week, my travel coordinator suggested I reach out to the hotel's director of sales,Roger Bright to continue working with him to make arrangements for my other guest’s bookings. I spent six weeks trying to reach him, leaving numerous messages on his voice mail and with his co-workers, but never received a single call back from him over that time frame. I was told when Roger was traveling to LA, when he was at lunch, etc. and did my best to catch him around his schedule, to no avail. He never once returned my calls. (I would later ask him about this, and he stated his phone lines were out? For 6 weeks? If you are thinking of planning an event, destination wedding etc...at the Kahala , pay attention to this! You will get very frustrated trying to work with this property as they are not responsive. As the date of my arrival was closing in I was getting nervous about my event so I finally asked if there was someone else I could work with to finalize my plans and work through details of some logistics. This was when I met Jacob Keanaaina. Jacob was very nice and quite pleasant to deal with. I would not have guessed he was new at his job. A few days before my departure Jacob graciously informed me that because of all of the business I was brining to the hotel, he had taken the liberty of upgrading my room to one overlooking the dolphin lagoon, which he felt my 6 year old daughter would love. This had me believing everything was going to be great!After 13 ½ hours of flying, after months of planning with the hotel staff, when we arrived to this property, we were met by the news that not only did the hotel NOT have a reservation in my name, it did not even have a room for my family. They had lost my reservation! Despite holding a confirmed reservation in my hand for a one bedroom suite, we were told to wait in the lobby for more than 2 hours while the staff tried to figure out what went wrong. I spent those two hours looking around the lobby, noticing that this once lovely hotel isn't what it used to be. When we drove up, the first thing I saw was the old and tired looking stucco building was covered in scaffolding. It looked more like a tenement than a luxury resort. It surely is need of a facelift--inside and out. The lobby looked just old and tired. I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past and it just didn't have the same luster. The furniture in the lobby, which is more patio furniture than luxury lobby décor, sank in from overuse--it wasn't comfortable--it was awkward. It looks so 1960's dated. Not even retro cool. I found the staff was very aloof and unfriendly. I asked the concierge for the name of a car service and since I wasn't a registered hotel guest yet, she wouldn't give me that information! Not one person checked on us or offered any amenity while we waited. Our comfort wasn't their concern yet it was their error that placed us in this situation.  Several hours later, after attempting to downgrade me to a garden view standard room (they told me that's all they had available) we were in fact, FINALLY escorted to the exact suite Jacob had described to me days prior to my arrival—which in fact, had been available all along. I am not sure where, why or how this wasn’t known before our arrival, or why we were made to wait in the lobby for several hours with no apology or explanation other than Roger Bright (The first time I actually ever spoke to this man! LOL) calling me to abruptly say that Jacob was not authorized to give me the upgrade to the room we were in—(this is NOT something a hotel guest should ever be told. This is an internal problem!) I never felt more unwelcome in a hotel! I couldn't believe this was how the Kahala treated its arriving guests these days....it broke my heart. The experience we had in their beachside restaurant (The only one we could get in to, Plumeria) was mediocre at best. They kept giving us the Japanese menu--which we couldn't read--we are not Japanese and do not appear to be--not sure why they did this. The oysters we ordered were rancid-and needed to be sent back--twice. We wanted to try the other restaurants on property, but it's very difficult to get a reservations last minute, so make sure to plan ahead--something I don't always do on vacation. The Italian place looked great--I remember when it was a sushi place and it was awesome--can't say whether it's good or not--couldn't get a resi....The pool area is small for such a big hotel--and eating lunch past 2:00 is very limited. You're better off going off property because the menu offered at the beach has minimal choices--especially if you want to eat healthy. The beach set up is also challenging. I never found anyone to help set up a beach chair or bring a clean towel. It's pretty much self service--NOT what you would expect at a fine hotel or resort. I can't remember the last time I had to search for someone at the Four Seasons....or any good hotel for that matter.The Kahala is under new ownership--and changed hands the week of my stay--I don't know if this impacted my experience or not, but they have a lot of work to do to get it back to world class standards--I believe the management there is the same as it was before the change took place so it should have been seamless--but it didn't feel like it. It appears that the management and staff at this hotel just doesn't seem to have that "can do" attitude of other fine resorts. (Except the housekeepers and the spa staff...they were all very nice) Otherwise, no matter what was asked--from the front desk to room service to the beach to the management, it was if it was a bother to them! What ever happened to being hospitable in the hospitality industry? There are many hotel options when you visit Oahu--while the Kahala was once my favorite--away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but given the aesthetic downturn of the property, rooms and service, at these prices--I am inclined to go someplace else that focuses on the guest experience first--to spend my vacation time at a property that works hard maintaining and cultivating the customer service relationship and appreciates that we all have choices when we travel so they not only WANT to earn your business-but keep it. I wont be recommending this hotel to anyone.

This holiday was a dream come true to myself and my family. We stayed in three hotels in Hawaii and this was the best by far. I could not fault anything about this resort. Some of the things that stood out to me the most would include; 10min shuttle bus rides to the city leaving every hour, dolphins, opal, private beach, gym, restaurant and the friendly staff. I was also very happy with the promotions that they had available whilst booking this holiday. The dolphin quest was amazing with leaving my children speechless, they were very friendly creatures up close and personal. They were very well trained with there professional trainers. The one thing that i would change about this resort would be the activities that were offered as there weren't as many and weren't advertised whilst we were there. The fact that there were five restaurant on the resort even made it better as you had an option. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return back in a heart beat.
user_name:
LOZ S
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We planned a stay in Hawaii to break up the trip home from Thailand. We wanted somewhere a bit away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and selected the Kahala. It was the perfect choice. The service is amazing and the facility is lovely. They have several excellent restaurants. The beach and the pool are both delightful. The weather was not the best for laying on the beach (windy and in the 70's) but the ocean water was reasonably warm and the pool was wonderfully warm. The dolphin pool, sea turtles, tropical fish and waterfall add a lot of interest to the pool area too. We didn't have a single complaint.By the way, it turned out that we were there during the Honolulu Marathon. The event closes the street that provides access to the Kahala. Since part of the reason for our stay was R&R we did not mind being stuck in the hotel that day. However, it will pay to check the marathon dates if you book a stay in December.

The Kahala is great for families - but pricey. It has a great beach - but no big waves if you want to body board or surf. Perfect for swimming, paddleboarding, kids playing on the beach and in the water and relaxing. Great breakfast buffet. Close to great restaurants and shopping - but without feeling like you are in the city. Our room was great (however , when I called to reserve I requested a ground floor and when we got there we were "upgraded" to another room that was not any better and had a view of the parking lot. Thankfully they moved us back but not until we made the trek up to the room and back and around to the other room). Other than that, everything else was great!

Everything about the Kahala was top notch! I cannot say enough about the beautiful rooms,soft cushy lounge chairs at the beach, and amazing breakfast included with our stay. The Sunday brunch was absolutely the best brunch I have ever experienced. I can't wait to return. We were only able to stay for 3 nights but it was enough to feel totally relaxed and regenerated. Hard to believe this place is only a few minutes away from the crowds of Waikiki

I went to Kahala on a solo trip, looking for a nice quiet hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but close enough that I can get to it. The Kahala was perfect. Beautiful private beach, lots of activities, great staff, impeccable service. Could not think of one thing to complain about. Definitely recommend this spectacular resort to everyone.

We stayed at the Kahala on a trip back from Fiji. So we were used to not being around a lot of people. Well. Staying at the Kahala was the perfect transition back to reality. It's location is perfect, if you would like to get into Waikiki. Its not that far. But far enough away to experience that tranquility you are looking for on a trip to Hawaii. The resort is beautiful. Very peaceful. Staff very friendly. Its a large hotel that doesn't seem that large. Since the time was getting close to Christmas, it was beautifully decorated. Nice beach.The staff was very friendly, from even our arrival at midnight Thanksgiving night. They escort you to your room and show you all the features. Which was nice. You really can't go wrong staying at the Kahala.

We looked long and hard for a hotel for our parents for their, gulp, 60th wedding anniversary. We couldn't have made a better choice. The first day, they called to say the Kahala was by far, the most beautiful hotel they had ever stayed in. We were looking for a beautiful setting close to Waikiki -- but a bit more quiet. And on the beach. I think we found the perfect place. The staff was great -- the concierge could not have been more helpful. And they loved the restaurants (though they were admittedly a bit taken back by the prices). But hey, it was their 60th! And the quality, they say, matched the hotel and the hotel staff -- perfect in every way.  Close enough to the action, but quiet enough, just a bit removed, with a beautiful beach setting. Thanks everyone at Kahala for making their celebration so memorable!

Loved the hotel - it was more secluded and less touristy than the Halekulani (which seems to be it's touristy equivalent in Waikiki center). I saw the rooms at other hotels in the area and I think the Kahala rooms are the nicest by far.

This resort is wonderful. We visited for a quick weekend in Hawaii and left the resort only to hike Diamond Head (5 minute cab ride). This resort is close to the Honolulu airport, which has nonstop flights to many cities in the US. There is no reason to go anywhere else if you are making a shorter visit to Hawaii, or a longer more relaxing visit. The hotel is situated in a residential neighborhood away from Waikiki Beach and its crowds. There is a lovely quiet beach, and the views from the room and other parts of the resort are amazing. It also has lovely views of the homes on the hillsides. Oahu is much more populated than the other islands, and it was rather nice to be in a lovely hotel seemingly away from it all, but in view of the lights of a busier area. The restaurants were all excellent and the staff was wonderful. We enjoyed the frequent small weddings on the property as well. I would go back in a heartbeat!

This a great hotel if you want to be part of Honolulu but not part of Waikiki beach. Located just 15 minutes from the heart of Honolulu, this luxury hotel is in one of the nicest areas near Diamond Head but has its own quiet corner of Oahu. Great rooms, great views, and great amenities. It does have a large Asian clientele and lots of weddings so keep that in mind.

Having had an amazing stay at the Kahala 4 years ago, upon our return to Oahu we couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. We were not disappointed! The hotel has a small and intimate feeling to it - if you're looking for a massive resort, this is not the place for you! I love how sensitively preserved the 1960s architecture is - honestly, it feels a little like being in an episode of Mad Men! The location is perfect - away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu/Waikiki with your own private beach, but only a short (free) shuttle ride away from the shopping and restaurants of the city. The rooms are large, and this time we had a mountain view rather than the Dolphin Lanai room we had on our first visit, but the view was nonetheless spectacular - we regularly saw the most beautiful rainbows over the mountains from a room.Given the size of the hotel, there is a great range of restaurants on site, and we loved having our breakfast every morning at the Plumeria Beach House, looking out over the ocean with it's name sake flowers drifting down from the trees on the breeze, it really does feel like your own bit of paradise.I hope to return again in the future!

We came for Thanksgiving with our three kids. After many, many trips to Hawaii had never stayed at this property. All in all, we had a very good experience. First off, the breakfast buffet rivals any Four Seasons anywhere. You'd think you were eating pastries in France and all the other food and service in the morning was top-notch A+. The biggest negative is the pool area, but if you are staying at a not-crowded time of year it won't be a problem..very small pool and very small jacuzzi..the beach is lovely but don't expect to go body surfing, there was no surf whatsoever. I think they could improve somewhat on the beach and pool service and the pool restaurant was a disappointment.Rooms were nice but lots of hassles at check in (we were early) but they did a nice job accommodating us with any issues...ie wifi service was not great. All and all, this is a service oriented hotel that has employees who are truly committed to very good service and make a lovely effort . It's not a new modern day hotel but charming and nicely appointed for today's standards. It is on a picturesque spot on the island outside of all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I have stayed at their main competitor hotel twice (Halekulani) and prefer this hotel without any question.

I've visited it when it was the Hilton, then as the Oriental, and now as The Kahala Hotel and Resort. No matter what it's called, every time it has been a great experience. The location is ideal, the views are great, and the service is top notch. An occasional reviewer makes negative comments, but I can't imagine what they are upset about. The Kahala is wonderful place to be and I hope that I get to stay there again sometime in the future. Love the Kahala!

From check in to check out the staff at this resort are just so welcoming and friendly. From the awesome location to the beautiful views, and beauty of this resort is just AMAZING! They refer to you by name and make you feel so comfortable. The beach is beautiful and not crowded as it would be in Waikiki. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfy. My stay here was amazing i WILL be coming back here, and referring my friends here as well.

I have had the pleasure of staying at The Kahala many times and the entire experience never dissapoints. Away from the crowds and tourist trap of Waikiki, The Kahala is an oasis. While the hotel, the grounds, the private beach and the dolphin lagoon are delightful, it is the staff where The Kahala really shines. As returning kamaaina, there is only one place we stay when we visit home: The Kahala.

We happily spent 5 nights at this resort. The location is excellent. The rooms are very nice, the service prompt and friendly and the pool area and food/drink offerings outstanding. We especially liked the Dolphin experience which we didn't realize was located at the hotel and, hence, a bonus. Very much enjoyed our leisurelybreakfasts and evenings in the lounge and/or bar. The location enabled us to tour the island yet escape from the traffic and crowds found in the Waikiki area. A very pleasant first visit toHawaii and an excellent hotel choice as recommended by our travel agent.

The Kahala is just a few miles but the other side of the world from Waikiki. While we love the craziness of Waikiki the Kahala is the other end of the spectrum. Elegant, quiet, understated and lovely. We felt like we could be on our own private beach.

Beautiful hotel, fabulous room overlooking the Dolphins. Great setting in a quiet residential area with its own private beach. Amazing afternoon tea and also a great Japanese restaurant. The service was excellent 5 star standard. Lunch at the pool restaurant was equally lovely.I noticed a reviewer complained about stained carpets, not to our knowledge and our high standards however we stayed there in 2012. I do hope standards have not dropped as it was truly an amazing place and we had planned to return.

At first glance, the Kahala is stunning; amazing mid-century style hotel tower, lovely grounds, Diamond Head in the background as you sit on the private beach, but...don't take a second look for you will be seriously disappointed. There isn't a chair, sofa or square foot of carpet in sight that is free from stains. The beach side restaurant, which we were told at our 2PM check-in would be a great place for lunch, closes at 2PM. Your only option for food after that time is the pool cafe who's menu is on par with a Howard Johnson's - the chicken on my lame attempt at a salad was basically rubber and I think had drawn on grill marks. The fine dining restaurant is closed on Monday nights...I'm sorry, you run a "high end" resort and your main restaurant CLOSES one night a week?!?! Unacceptable. They have the nerve to charge $700+ a night for rooms and then make you pay an additional $65 a day for a beach chair with a built in shade that are all extremely shabby (nothing chic about it) and smell of mildew. We only agreed to pay because the tiny pool where chairs with shade are free is full of screaming children and random people roaming around after watching the poor dolphins they keep in a tank perform a show (I didn't realize we had decided to vacation at Sea World). We checked in a mere 2 hours ago and this is the experience we've already had. I'd pack up and move but we're only in town for two nights and it's just too much hassle. Seriously people, do yourselves a favor, find somewhere else to spend your time and money. You can spend less and go to the Four Seasons in Kona and have the experience of a lifetime...seriously.
user_name:
sydneyfrazier
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I have been staying at the Kahala for the last 10 years. As much as we love Waikiki we do not want to stay in the hustle and bustle. The Kahala offers 5 star quality in a peaceful setting. We love the fact that the staff always remembers us and makes us feel at home. The service is stellar and the amenities are first rate. Can't wait to go back again.

We stayed here for a week in a dolphin lanai room, and had a fantastic time. Our flight arrived very early in the morning (6am) and we weren't expecting our room to be ready, but we had breakfast and then received a call from reception to say that the room had been prepared and could move in. Given it was only 8am, we were impressed.Our room was enormous, and the bathroom great with 2 vanities at either end (it was a long large area), 2 walk in robes, etc. Given hotel bathrooms can often be compact, we loved this one.The dolphins were always playing around together so they were fun to watch, and the pool was lovely and warm, with an amazing aspect out over the blue ocean. The hotel ran a shuttle to Kahala Mall, Waikiki, and Ala Moana, which was great. You just needed to book to make sure you could get a seat as it was popular.Kahala is a fair distance from Waikiki, so you need to be prepared to use taxis if you want to get around outside the shuttle schedule.We loved this hotel because it was more like a resort than the other hotels in Waikiki.

I enjoyed the kahala although it took a bit to warm up for me:+ fantastic beach, right at your doorstep calm waves, beautiful views+ great breakfast buffet with fantastic staff+ great location outside of Waikiki. Very nice neighborhood, easy access to the highway and all attractions. No need to be stressed with downtown traffic.+ dolphin lagoon. It is your own personal sea world. Trainers are always out interacting with dolphins, they are very friendly and will answer all your questionsNeutral: rooms are larger then average but Nothing special. Strange setup with many functional parts of room in the bathroom, such as dresser, ironing board, safe. (- )was not thrilled with check-in. I requested lanai room, was told none were available. Had to call manager and one became available. Not sure why I needed management to get me a lanai room, but manager very accommodating to my request. Just wish it was not such a process. Front desk clerk could have tried a tad harder.(-)which brings me to my largest complaint. This hotel is set up with every other room having a balcony. A balcony is a must when I travel to the tropics, and the chance that getting one is 50/50, doesn't thrill me. Overall I enjoyed my experience and would recommend.
user_name:
LarryNY
New York City, New York

review_body: This stunningly set, private resort offers an escape from reality. Excellent staff, spacious rooms, excellent dining and beautiful setting, combined with your own dolphin to swim with, and tropical fish to watch. A convenient shuttle bus is operated between the resort and Ala Moana and Kahala shopping centres and other nearby destinations. This is a resort at which to luxuriate and enjoy privacy.

A beautiful resort away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Incredible service, beautiful rooms with extremely comfortable beds, huge bathroom and balcony. We very much enjoyed our stay here, but overall was a little too low key for us. Beach is beautiful and private, pool very small, as was hotel grounds. Not much to do here but chill, but you are very close to many other things like Hanauma Bay, Kailua, Lanikai Beach, and of course Waikiki. I prefer the Ko'Olina area, but this is a nice place for a couples only trip.

Spent 6 nights at the Kahala Resort for our 25th anniversary. Extremely pleased. Staff is superb, property is clean, well maintained, and quiet. Rooms are over the top comfortable with excellent bedding, furniture, etc...everything was perfect.The hotel is expensive...and so are the in-house restaurants. This was a celebration trip for us, and I'm glad we stayed here. We ate at the hotel for a few meals, but there are numerous places close by that won't break the budget. Should we return to Oahu, we will definitely stay at the Kahala.

We continue to return to this quiet oasis by the sea ... the management and staff are exceptional and provide superlative service ...we've been coming here for 30 years and will continue to return ...our oceanview suite was just heavenly ... the beach, the sun, the food, the atmosphere ... we couldn't ask or wish for anything more ...

Service received was first classRoom provided exceeded expectation in comfort, convenience, view and serviceLocation was superlative and complete with all the necessary amenities for fun, leisure and pamperingThe best of the experience was the service staff and overall enviornment

A lovely location. Beautiful rooms. Fabulous staff! Fantastic breakfast with their famous skinny pancakes (which unfortunately don't make you skinny!) and sticky yummy buns. OMG! You will think you are in heaven.

Exceptional service, world class Hawaiian hotel, close to all Waikiki activity- yet a world away. The only hotel I will ever stay in the Waikiki area.You literally are a world away from all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, yet only a few minutes.

Old hawaiian elegence at its best.James at the front desk is an outstanding employee that takes his job to heart. Well worth the price. Close yo Waikiki yet another world away. Must stay, must return.

I have been to Hawaii a number of times but have never stayed in Honolulu. When I looked on trip advisor the Kahala had great reviews so I thought I would give it a try. I couldn't have been happier with my choice.The property is exceptional, the service is 5 star, and the beach is exquisite! Blue, clear, warm water. It is in a lagoon so swimming, paddle boarding, kayaking, all water activities are awesome.By cab it's only 10 minutes to downtown where all of the fun stores and restaurants. I 100% would stay at this property again.

The Australian and New Zealand College of Notaries Conference held on 23, 24 & 25 October 2014 was an brilliant success at the Kahala, due in no small part to the exceptional quality of the Venue, the staff and the catering. - Professor Peter ZabludChairman

Very beautiful upscale hotel with luxurious finishings. Bed very comfortable, good size room and the buffet breakfast was the best I've had! Shower has great pressure and the overall hotel is stunning. Free shuttle to Waikiki and you can use the bicycles to get to nearby attractions. Staff was very kind. Especially Jamie who helped us plan out our days. The hotel is a bit far from the tourist areas which is what we wanted. There is a beach on property that is very we'll manicured. Not enough sand but the water and scenery are breath taking. Also very cool feature are the dolphins, sea turtles, stingrays, and tropical fish on site!! The nearby mall has a wholefoods which is great for inexpensive meals.

Stayed at the Kahala Resort in mid October and except for a slight problem at check in (room wasn't ready) our stay was great. Quiet location, but close to Waikiki, fantastic service, with everyone so helpful and friendly, and large clean rooms. we will be back!
user_name:
Reed O
Everett, WA, United States

review_body: My wife and I attended a conference and stayed at the Resort for a week. Everything about it was wonderful, and we have stayed at many places around the world over the last 12 ears. Highly recommend it.

sitting on the lanai waiting to go to the airport and wishing I had more time to spend at this wonderful hotel. The staff is welcoming and extremely helpful. Our room was impressive in its size with a California king size bed, divan, refrigerator, and a full soaking tub as well as a shower, double sinks and his and her closets!The grounds are lush with huge Palm trees overlooking a perfect beach to wile away the day, or visit the lagoon to view the sea life, turtles, stingrays, fish and my favorite, the Dolphins. Their handlers show them a lot of respect and love, they are well treatedRestaurants are diverse with one offering daily buffet breakfasts and weekend buffet dinners. Lunch overlooking the beach is also available, however we were disappointed in Arancino's, the Italian restaurant as the food wasn't very true Italian with extremely small portions and not small prices!One down side is the hotel does need some work, a fresh coat of paint in our room, updated tiling in the pool. Mostly cosmetic, but it wouldn't hurt!We will definitely return to the Kahala, it reminds us of a true Hawaiian resort.

We had a scenic double room in this five-star hotel, which is in a nice quiet spot a few miles east of Waikiki Beach. Our room was huge and well-appointed and overlooked a golf course with a slight sea view to one side. The hotel is suitably grand and while the grounds aren't huge they are generally nicely kept.However, our stay was marred by a few downsides.To begin with, we were told on arrival that the hotel had a policy of deducting $100 a day towards guests' additional costs. Since we'd prepaid our 10-day stay in full and given them a credit card imprint, we saw no reason for them to demand a further $1,000 as security the minute we walked through the door. Reluctantly, they agreed to reduce it to $100 when we complained. A second issue is that while the grounds are nice they are not big. The golf course that runs around two sides of the hotel is out of bounds, leaving just the beach at the back and a small area in front of the hotel to wander about in. The private beach was nice, but not very big. A small oval swimming pool and patio area sits between the hotel and the beach. The constant weddings taking place in the Kalaha Hotel (often more than one at once) mean the public areas like the beach and lobby are frequently full of people you feel obliged to avoid, so as not to inadvertently appear in their pictures - effectively making these too out of bounds. Another issue was that despite the high charges the hotel makes, it does not provide some 'basics' in the price, like shade on the beach. If you want a cabana (sunbeds with a 'hood' on them) to protect you from the sun, for instance, rather than unprotected sunbeds, they want a minimum of $40 (for 4 hrs) for it. Parasols around the pool are, at least, free. Breakfast is also unincluded in the cost of staying there, and if you want a cooked breakfast will set you back around $35 a head.The restaurants in the Kalaha are all overpriced, in fact, and are not all open all of the time - the Seaside Grill, for instance, which is situated between the pool and the beach, closes at 5.30pm, ruling out any chance of you admiring the sunset (around 6.30pm) over a cocktail or light supper on the beach. Another, the Plumeria, is inexplicably closed two days a week. Fortunately, a 20 minute walk (or free shuttle bus ride) away is the Kahala Mall, where you'll find a good selection of eateries and shops. We particularly recommend the restaurant Chillis, which serves good cocktails, excellent steaks and salads and some great Mexican dishes; and the Whole Foods Market supermarket which in addition to some excellent bakery products serves hot breakfasts and dinners. The mall also has a good selection of other shops and eating places.The high costs of the Kahala Hotel extend to the hotel's spa, which charges about three to four times what you'll pay in Honolulu for treatments.We also didn't care for the fact that hotel keeps six captive dolphins for the purposes of entertaining its guests and raising money by selling dolphin 'experiences' to them. The area they are kept in is pleasant enough, but did not seem very big. One of the handlers told us one of its dolphins had been born there 22 years ago and could not be returned to the wild as it would not know how to survive. Nice. Given all this, we wouldn't visit the Kahala again.

This was our first visit to Oahu and we arrived around 10:00 pm after a 30 hour journey. We were greeted fantastically by all the staff at the Kahala and our tiredness evaporated. When we woke up just as the sun was rising we were greeted by a fantastic view of the sunrise over the Pacific. The room was very comfortable, the views fantastic, the staff exceptional and the position of the hotel can not be bettered. The spa was a wonderful experience for both of us after the previous day's travel and the food at the Italian restaurant was out of this world as was the service. Overall a must stay hotel if you get the opportunity and I have not even mentioned the Dolphins or the turtles.

My husband and I held our wedding ceremony here, diamond head lawn.Their hospitality, services were all nice and we are so glad that all of our guests enjoyed everything about this beautiful location.

We went to Hawaii for my cousins wedding and stayed at the Kahala hotel afterwards. It is a fantastic hotel, great service, a bit pricy but I thought it was worth it.The beach next to the hotel is a great place to go fly fishing for bonefish. Very nice quiet place to go

Having first been to New York and Vegas, this was a perfect end to our holiday. The Kahala exceeded all of our expectations and we would so love to return. The staff were amazing and the facilities were top notch. We liked being away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and the dining options were great. Having our own secluded beach and dolphin lagoon was also wonderful!

The resort is very nice and has first class amenities. It's location is secluded in a residential community which is nice if you want to avoid the hectic Waikiki vibe. Our room was large and had a large balcony and bathroom. The only downside is the resort is very expensive and charges for amenities often included at other hotels. For example, the resort charges for beach umbrellas and has 2 pricing schemes for internet (regular and higher speed). The spa seemed very nice but was also very expensive. Overall, a very nice place to stay, but it will cost you.

I have been visiting the Kahala for the last 15 years. It was delightful back then, but it has only gotten better. This is what I imagine true luxury to be. The staff was warm and welcoming throughout our whole stay. The entire hotel is gorgeous, especially our room. The breakfast was beyond extravagant! Even though the hotel has a dolphin park in the center of it, I did not feel like the grounds were swimming with young children. I look forward to my next stay at the Kahala.

Beautiful resort. From the check in to the fruit platter in the room for our 33rd anniversary everything was top notch. We had a room overlooking the golf course and the ocean on an angle. The lanai/ terrace was great to sit outside and have a drink or read a book. The dolphin lagoon was pretty cool and if I had young kids they would love it. The pool bar was a great place to grab a bite by the beach. The concierge desk was wonderful and made us reservations same day for Pearl Harbor and snorkeling at the Bay. We borrowed bikes(complimentary) and rode to Diamond Head. I was worried about being away from Waikiki but turns out it was a great location. Thank you would highly recommend the Arancino Restaurant on the grounds.

What a superb experience . A beautiful elegant hotel on a stunning stretch of coastline . Our standard room was enormous and luxuriously furnished with a bathroom bigger than most hotel bedrooms. We had a bottle of champagne and a birthday cake waiting for us in our room when we arrived in acknowledgement that our visit was to celebrate our big birthdays and special wedding anniversary . What a wonderful and very well appreciated gesture. We really couldn't the find anything to fault , the service , food beach and staff were all immaculate as well as professional and friendly . The Dolphins were beguiling. I'm not going to give it all away as you should go and discover it all for yourself . We would love to return one day.Thank you all for a fabulous time.

This was my first visit to Hawaii and my first, but definitely NOT my last, stay at The Kahala.I was amazed just driving up to the front of property. The moment I stepped out of the car I was made to feel like I was coming home. The staff greeting was warm and welcoming and the Lobby is gorgeous. The atmosphere is luxurious but relaxed. Check in was easy and prepared prior to our arrival so there was no waiting for a roomAnd our room, oh my, what is not to love about our room. Decorated very beautifully in subtle yellows, blues and tans with wood features. The bed was extremely comfortable as were the pillows. Down I think? It was like sleeping on a cloud.The his and her bathroom was not only large but well laid out and nicely stocked with toiletries that were replaced constantly. Even though the pool and beach area are amazing it was nice to be able to relax in the soaking tub.Housekeeping was impeccable. She spent as much time as was needed each day to make sure the room was clean and tidy when we came back. Not that we make a mess of our rooms, but it was nice see that corners were not cut just to "get it done". And the nightly turn down was a treat, fresh slippers, chocolates, water and ice. She spoiled us!The staff at the pool/beach area went out of their way to make sure time spent there was comfortable. It didn't matter if you wanted a lounge chair set up under a tree at the very far end of the property, just tell them where and they set it up for you, and if you didn't feel like moving from your perfect spot they were more than happy to bring back refreshments.The Lagoon with the various aquatic creatures (and waterfall) is delightful. I went out daily at various times just to visit with what felt like "my" animal friends. They all are very well cared for. Their pools are cleaned often (I watched as this was being done) and the trainers were able to answer any questions regarding the sea life and their care.We didn't get a chance to eat at any other restaurants on the property other than The Plumeria. But the breakfast buffet was outstanding, so many choices of food items, all tasty and well prepared. Dinner was extremely good. I had the Rosemary Chicken, he had the Steak. Both cooked to perfection and gracious proportions. After a day of driving all around the island to see what Oahu had to offer...I was glad I made the choice to stay at The Kahala and can't wait to go back.I'd give The Kahala a perfect 10 if it were allowed.

This hotel is away from the Waikiki crowd in a really nice part of Oahu which is mainly residential.the restaurants a very good, my wife loved the spa and has a dolphin park which is not crowded since it's only by reservation ( if you have small kids it's great for them ). The rooms are nice but the best of all is that you can get from there much faster to beaches on the East side of Oahu ( great beaches with mostly locals) which are the nicest beaches with the exception of Makaha beach. The only downside is the beach in front of the hotel which I think it's man made, it's a nice beach but the Ocean is not really nice there.
user_name:
RossoDiavel
New York City, New York

review_body: Thank you Kahala for making our honeymoon the most amazing two weeks of our lives. Where do I start….a bottle of champagne awaiting us in our room, upgrade to the full breakfast, a resort credit to celebrate their 50th anniversary and every single member of staff being so friendly and helpful. To be honest I could go on and on but I want to give a special shout out to Josh and Pete from the Hans Heddemann surfing school who were just awesome and have given me a new passion for the water. We’re already saving for our return trip!!!! Neil & Patricia, London, England

Overall an amazing place to stay. A bit taken aback at having to pay for the pods or shade tents. Staff, particularly Peggy (concierge) were wonderful. The Verandah was by far the best place to eat and drink. Do not bother with Arancino, shockingly overpriced, ridiculously small meals and no idea of how to cater for a vegan. We really regretted our decision to eat there.

good hotel.one thing unsatisfactory : complementary waters and welcome chocolate were delivered after our check-in.Advantages : private beach, good condition of the sea.Dolphins and Rays were exciting.

A lovely peaceful,beach hotel. Lovely views, great staff, wonderful food, brilliant room. Go out in the outrigger with Josh and swim with the dolphins. While you are here you can relax in beautiful surroundings and not be too far from places of interest.

We were transferred to The Kahala when our original hotel was overbooked. We did not know what to expect since it was last minute. They can transfer us anytime!!!! Everyone was warm and welcoming and did their utmost to assure that our brief and unexpected stay was given as much attention as guests who had been there many times before. The resort is beautiful! Our room opened onto a patio not more than 50 feet from the beach on a beautiful Pacific shore. The breakfast buffet was fabulous. All in all, this stay was the most wonderful beginning to our Hawaii vacation that we could have dreamed!

The property is genuine, classic Hawaii. I knew as soon as we pulled up this was a classy hotel with the highest standards. It's private/elite without the stuffy attitude. I loved my room (the robe/linens/space) and there really isn't a bad view! The food was amazing as well. We will return.

The hotel is set in the quiet suburbs of Honolulu. The beach is beautiful. The hotel is absolutely lovely. The rooms are kept impeccably clean. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay perfect.

We spent 3 nights at the Kahala hotel and were treated like we were Presidents too! Every President since Johnson stayed here, and it's clear why. They treat every guest like royalty. And it's off the beaten path, a few miles away from the congestion of Waikiki and the city. It's off on its own, private and scheduled. The room was enormous, with a beautiful ocean view and a view of Diamond Head too. The bedding was comfortable, amenities were excellent, and the room was quiet. The hotel has an on site dolphin pool which offers a dolphin encounter where you can swim with them, pet them, and even kiss them. That was a highlight of our stay. The restaurants are good with beautiful views of the ocean. The food was excellent. The prices were high, so be prepared. We would stay again and again. You'll pay a lot for this level of resort, but you'll get pampered and you deserve that, don't you?

on our second trip here we were just as impressed as before, and after staying at several places on 4 of the Hawaii islands think this is our favorite. Staff are super friendly and helpful, although the one older bell captain seemed disinterested in being in the service business. Rooms are fantastic, good size clean etc. The hotel always feels relaxed, not overrun with conventions like some larger places. There are a few small things to work on, we asked if there was complimentary morning coffee at the front desk and they said no, just coffee in your room, then the next day we passed a free coffee station in the lower lobby. We hung the room service sign at 7 and at noon the room was still not cleaned, but they got it done quickly when we called, and in an iPhone/iPad era there should be more power points in the rooms. All small training and investment things that management can easily fix

Quiet, charming, great place to relax. The bell and valet staff are the best around, and the front desk is always so welcoming. Worth every penny!! The wifi is amazing at the pool area, and nothing beats watching dolphins frolic in the water. Will return!

We recently stayed at the Kahala for a family holiday, and this was our fourth stay. Standards are still excellent, our room was lovely, check-in efficient, dolphin lagoon and experience fantastic. Awesome breakfast buffet. Great restaurant - Hoku's. We must remember to eat more often in the foyer area where there is often a band / singer, and the food is uncomplicated, tasty and relatively well priced. Our extended family also stayed and had some problems at check-in. Trick is to be very clear on the room you want (check the layout before you book) and the package you are after. The staff are very accommodating at fixing problems and assisting. I think the more you stay at the Kahala the better it gets because you can determine which room you want next time, the best package for you etc. We like staying by the Dolphin lagoon which is great for the kids, and I encourage getting breakfast in your package.

Well, where do I begin I have stayed in this property when it was a Hilton, it still has retained a lot of their original charm!!!This hotel is paradise, we had a beautifully appointed Ocean Front Suite, with a breathtaking view. Many hours spent on the balcony, sipping a cocktail (which was included in our suite package) in late afternoon, or early morning having a coffee delivered to the room.We didn't use the pool as we thought the beauty of that ocean was too hard to resist!! The lagoon is so protective that ii is safe for young children.Our daughter tried stand up paddle boarding, canoeing and of course she was a Trainer for the Day with the dolphins which were all great.Breakfast was good, but I have got to say they have the best smoothies pool side!!!!!The bed was extremely comfortable just perfect for what we like.The staff were all friendly and assertive.The location for us was ideal, it's like you are on a small island away from everything. The area of Kahala is stunning.Thanks we will be back!!!!

My wife and I usually go to Maui, but we wanted to do something different this time. So, rather than the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, we decided for something more quite and out of the way. In the end, we chose the Kahala, now celebrating its 50th year. We were really pleasantly surprised. The staff there really pampered us. The hotel was very comfortable, the beach uncrowded. And the food was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel.

We used to come here every summer for many years when our children were small, and have such fond memories of the place. Their staff is outstanding, most especiall U'i Medieros (?sp) who works in the front office. I have to say that we have stayed at most high-end hotels around the world and not one did what she did, which was to call us in our room to ask if our accommodations were to our satisfaction. Something so simple, and yet so elusive in the Ritz-Carltons, Four Seasons, etc of the world. She made an indelible impression with us. Also, when she found out it was our anniversary (30th), she sent us a special treat to our room. She is a lovely woman, and I regret that I was unable to thank her personally. Having said that, the only downside to the hotel is that there is no adult only pool, so if you are interested in lounging quietly poolside without screaming children (and there were A LOT) or getting splashed, your only somewhat refuge is to lay beachside, which is of course, not bad, but sometimes you would like to sun yourself without sand.

Stayed for a week and didnt want to leave. We had a beachfront room and could access the beach directly in 15 secs. friendly staff, parking valet was quick and effecient, very good wifi coverage (even on the beach) and the dolphins swim in the lagoon next to the pool.We loved it and will stay here again if we ever come back to Oahu.

Our stay here was perfect! We took the outrigger canoe tour, ate lunch everyday by the ocean, had breakfast featuring the most wonderful buffet. This was beyond what we could have hoped for! A blessing.

The Kahala is a great resort just outside of Waikiki. The beach and pool are great, the rooms and hotel overall are top notch. The convenience of getting back to Honolulu or Waikiki is great or to escape around to Koko head or further east is perfect.

Just came back from a wonderful first trip to Hawaii and loved staying at the Kahala. The service is phenomenal and we loved our room upgrade as well. We booked the 50th anniversary package and felt it was a huge bargain, considering we received a $50 restaurant credit, plus breakfast for two each morning. Btw, the buffet breakfast is wonderful and the selection each day never disappointed. We also ate lunch at the Seaside Grill during a pool/beach day and loved the service/food there too. We were traveling with a preschooler and he enjoyed his stay as well. We were even greeted with a stuffed animal upon check-in, which was a wonderful touch to begin our vacation!We also loved the turn down service each night and chocolates & bottles of water were greatly appreciated! The valet parking is the same price as self parking and is well worth the few dollars in tips each time we used our car. The location of the hotel is also a bonus. Being away from the chaos that is Waikiki was fantastic, but we were only 10-15 minutes away if we wanted to explore restaurants & shopping in Waikiki. The hotel room was very clean and mostly updated. I noticed a slight wear/tear in the bathroom, but the size totally made up for it. I'm very conscious about the cleanliness of hotel rooms and I wasn't disappointed with the Kahala!I would say having a rental car is a major plus, but isn't totally necessary if you don't prefer to drive. There is a shuttle service to Waikiki and we used it once during one of our days....It was a great service on a day we didn't feel like driving in. Be sure to make a reservation for times before you go.Overall, I would say our family had a wonderful vacation, largely due to the great service of the hotel! I would highly recommend The Kahala! We will definitely be back in the future!
user_name:
kj660
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: What an amazing location and resort. They make you feel like one of the celebrities whose pictures are hanging on the wall from the moment you arrive. The vibe is fantastic and you get a sense that you are leaving the real world behind as you step into a luxurious resort where respect, attention to detail, and attentiveness are the norm. I love this place and look forward to returning.

Just got back from staying a week at the Kahala Resort and we fought with our travel agent in the location because it was a few miles from the due then area were all the resturants and shops are but we were so thankful she insisted for us to stay here. The Kahala was perfection from day one, the beach is private and secluded and only a few steps out of the back of the resort, the pool is nice and always had open chairs to lay in, the pool/beach staff were so friendly and engaging and really seemed happy to help in any way. The cleaning staff always had a smile on their faces every time you seen them. The bell desk guys would literally approach you the minute you walked out of the door to see what they could do for you and when you returned they were at the car greeting you and helping us with all out shopping bags every day. The breakfast buffet was wonderful (we recommend going between 6 & 7 to enjoy the sunrise, it was beautiful. The rooms were overly spacious and the bathrooms were huge and spa like.

The feeling of the propert and staff is as it should be.Relaxing and luxurious seamlessly. The location is world class.With a quiet environment, except the splashing sound of Happy Dolphins.Truly a world class Resort.

We were greeted with Lei's as soon as we got out of the cab. Everyone was extremely helpful, friendly, and polite, better than anywhere else I've ever been. The resort is beautiful as well, from the immaculate (though small) pool, the dolphin lagoons and the beaches. Be prepared to shell out lots of $$ though - the restaurants are very expensive as are the beach equipment rentals. The free shuttle to the nearby mall is very welcome for those of us without 12-figure salaries who need to get a bite to eat and buy a case of beer. The rooms are beautiful and even the mountain view is nice.

What can I say. Everything about this resort exceeded our expectations. The room was clean, comfortable and the turn down service was the best. We were welcomed by our name constantly. The only disagreeable thing was.........checking out. Can't wait to plan our next stay.

Exceptional service, the staff at Kahala can't do enough for you. Every need is addressed quickly and efficiently. Every person is friendly, kind and helpful. The rooms are spotlessly cleaned and have everything you need.

We enjoyed an extraordinary romantic getaway at The Kahala Hotel! The staff is amazing and go to great lengths to assure personalization and high quality, excellent customer service. From our arrival through departure we cannot say enough positive things about this memorable resort. The ocean views of the Pacific Ocean are breathtakingly beautiful. Hokus is an award winning restaurant with an impressive selection of delicious entrees, wine and liquor. Their service is unparalleled. The Plumeria Beach Cafe has an impressive 5-star brunch and wonderful lunch/dinner selections. Other great amenities include The Dolphin Quest, catamaran rides and paddle boarding and spa services. We cannot say enough great things about our experience at The Kahala Hotel and are recommending it to our domestic and international friends/colleagues. It's a most unforgettable pampering experience.

Could not ask for more. The greatest!!!! The personal touch the whole stay remained at the highest. It has to be one of finest resorts I have visited I'm the States. I hope to visit again when I return to the Islands in the near future.

A great hotel to stay in if you want a lovely sandy beach away from the maddening crowds of Waikiki. Especially good for children, dolphin pool attraction (not just performing for guests but also great work being carried out by marine biologists). Large rooms, great king size beds, lovely linen & large bathrooms with separate dressing tables. A classic hotel, with a wonderful entrance foyer. Staff are all wonderful, friendly & always willing to assist. A car or taxi needed but shuttle provided to Ala Moana shopping centre.
