Taxi to Waikiki approx $25-00 & Ala Moana Shopping centre $30-00.

We arrived at the hotel and were blown away by how beautiful the grounds and interior are. Great location away from Waikiki and Honolulu, but close enough that you can get to all the restaurants and fun events. The room was some comfy and homey. It was a decent size and the views from the scenic rooms are amazing. Another great surprise was the dolphin/ fish salt water "tank." It was fun watching the dolphins, turtles, sting rays, etc... The beach is small, but get's the job done. The staff is also so friendly and warm. Really a great overall experience.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
EvanF4
New York, New York, United States

review_body: we had our family of twenty four all come together at Kahala for the most rewarding vacation of our lives. The service is nothing short of professional. My wife and I have been going to the Islands for nearly 40 years now and the majority of our visits have included staying at the Kahala over the years. The staff is warm and friendly and they all have longevity so the greet you by name because they remember you from prior visits and they strive to meet your needs.
user_name:
Acts S
Santa Monica, California, United States

review_body: We have stayed at some amazing hotels but I just didn't rate this one.We were travelling with a toddler and spending over $500 per night and when we asked for a glass of milk one night after dinner after we already paid our $250 restaurant bill - we were charged $2.50!!!!!!We felt this was over-priced and not great value for money

My sons wedding was here. Yes, the wedding was almost perfect. Worth every penny. Beautiful and relatively easy. Expensive, but worth it.Accommodations are very expensive for what you get. Rooms and amenities are clean, but not updated. At least not in my room.I paid for weeklong accommodations for five rooms. I actually asked for an upgrade. First, I was told no. Then I was given an 'upgrade' to a second floor room, good view but nothing special. I did get a late check out for my room. Free of charge.

We've been to Hawaii many times, but this is our first stay at the Kahala. It won't be our last. Beautiful hotel with first class service. Our room is large, with a comfortable king size bed. Bathroom is more than roomy, with separate dressing tables and closets for 2 people. Linens are wonderful.Our room overlooked the golf course and ocean, with a large balcony.Beach is one of the best we've been to. Lots of comfy chaises and umbrellas if you want one. Water is sandy bottom unlike many coral and rock bottoms around.Staff is very friendly and helpful. Loved all the fresh flowers and vintage look of the hotel. Americans are definately in the minority here. I did hear a few guests complain about the difference in customs, especially when lining up for service at the breakfast buffet. Not a problem for us, but if you don't travel much and aren't used to differences in cultures it may be a problem for some.We enjoyed everything and definately will return.

Fantastic hotel and resort with unbelievably attentive and friendly, first class staff. A totally idilic location with 5 star services. We were truly spoilt rotten from the moment we arrive to the moment we left. Loads to do on the resort and the scenery is absolutely breathtaking. Thank you Kahala for making our honeymoon truely magical!

My husband and I stayed here. It was truly wonderful. The lobby is beautiful, as well as the lower lobby which was just newly carpeted while we were there. They did an excellent job. There was a wedding every day, and it's a beautiful place for a wedding! Everyone was very friendly - from check-in to checkout and everyone in between. The breakfast buffet at Plumeria Restaurant was very good, lots of options. We had the ocean front lanai room. The views were spectacular. The bathroom was very spacious. Yes, the room is a little outdated, but still beautiful. Housekeeping and turn down service were very good. The shopping shuttle was great. We were able to get to Waikiki in 15 minutes. The pool is great, as well as the beach. We look forward to returning.

The Kahala is even better than advertised - it's own private beach is beautiful and the pool area is lovely too. The staff are so helpful and do everything to make your stay amazing. There was some building work that we could hear from our room and they immediately upgraded us to an ocean view suite for free, which was fab! The food is expensive so we didn't eat there but the breakfasts are excellent, we found that we didn't need lunch after them. The shuttle is brilliant too and provides free drop offs and collects to three different locations - all of which have a supermarket so you can buy your own food if you like.You can rent cars on site too if you want to take a trip - would recommend the North Shore which is about an hour away. Definitely go Scuba Diving too!I was a bit concerned about the welfare of the in house dolphins but they are well looked after and very happy. (It's not like the dreaded Sea World!)

Luxury and exclusivity so close to Waikiki but definitely apart from the chaos. Every staff member at the resort was friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome and important. An overall great experience!!!

A lovely and relaxing hotel. Away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, welcoming and inviting "Ohana" atmosphere. I would definitely return again (if I can afford it) and sepnd more time enjoying all of the amenities (pool, ocean side, sprots acitivities, dolphin pool, dining, etc..)

This hotel was apparently the premier resort in the 60's & 70's for the elite, and it still looks like it. It's decor hasn't been updated, and it still operates like it is in the 60's and 70's. The food is extremely overpriced, and don't expect any efficient service if you need to get anywhere by a certain time.

We've stayed at the Kahala many times. It remains a quality destination. It is not a value resort, but you do get good service. Hoku's is not a good value and there are many other fine dining off site.

The greeting was welcoming with a kukui nut lei upon arrival. The resort is beautiful and the lobby is airy and grand upon walking in. The room was spacious and well laid out. The bathroom was large with two separate vanities on either side with 2 closets and a separate walk in shower and relaxing tub. Pool area was small but still fantastic. There is also a private beach with lounge chairs or cabanas for rental. The water in the ocean was shallow, so no need to worry about huge waves pulling you under. Breakfast was delicious and I'm sure that all of the restaurants are fantastic, it just turns out that we only had breakfasts and high tea in the hotel. All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating and upon checkout we were about to get into our car and drive away when the housekeeper calked the valet desk to inform them that I had left my sunglasses in the room. She rushed them downstairs and with 3 days left in Honolulu, I sincerely appreciated that. This is a beautiful choice in Honolulu for those that want an elegant, unhurried, vacation without large crowds and appreciate great service. We will definitely be back when in Honolulu !!One minor issue was that the internet was painfully slow and I kept losing connection. Not conducive to doing business.

it was first time to stay.we had a great time there.everything was very nice except house keeping!we asked to do house keeping on my wedding day from 8:30 but the staff didn't appear. the next day, they came around 8:30 even we were sleeping...but we satisfied the quality of this stay. we hope we can come back for our first anniversary!

My husband and I checked in on Sept. 9th and checked out on the 13th. We wish we would have stayed longer. The staff was very professional and helpful. Our room was clean and they provided the best pillows of any hotel we have visited. The grounds are impeccable and the beach is perfect. The breakfast buffet was very appetizing. Will definitely consider returning to The Kahala.R & E

We had the mis fortune to stay at the Hilton & $16 plus for drinks was out of control . We had famly staying here & loved it . The prices where half of the ripoff next door . Service was out standing.

We checked in thinking it was a little closer to Waikiki than it was but it was still very nice. Unfortunately our sea view balcony room was sold out at check in ! Not impressed. They told us we were being upgraded to a direct beach access room but when we were taken to it there were lots of people on beach beds directly outside our room so absolutely no privacy it was also very dark & our sons were still in the main hotel block which was to far away. The manager after much complaint put us in a sea view room but sadly no balcony. He refunded us the room difference & did give us a room credit for the trouble which was appreciated.The hotel was lovely & the staff too even though we wish we had stayed some of our time at a hotel in Waikiki we had a very nice time here.

I have stayed in many hotels across the globe, but the Kahala was the best one. I have rarely encountered a large hotel that maintains a family feel. The staff knew me by name; and while this may not be important for some, it made a huge difference to me! I felt really pampered and taken care off. Everyone, from the bell desk, to the valet guys, the front desk or house keeping, were friendly and courteous - they always had a smile on their face! It felt amazing to always be greeted with a warm "aloha," no matter where I went. Everyone seemed to genuinely enjoy working there! The concierge desk attendant gave us great tips in regards to where to go for snorkeling and avoid tourists, as I prefer a more quiet time.In addition, I absolutely loved the Dolphin Quest! I got to spend an hour with the trainer and the dolphins and these memories will stay with me for the rest of my life. As a matter of fact, they convinced me that I should return and maybe retire one day in Hawaii.Talking to the other hotel guests was also great! Turns out, the Kahala has a bunch of returning customers. Once you've stayed there, you don't want to stay anywhere else. Having their own, private beach that is not crowded, made a huge difference in my relaxation! For example, I ventured to Waikiki, just to see what is happening over there, and absolutely hated it!I came to the Kahala for my birthday and decided that i will make it a habit to spend all my future birthdays there as well. The place is a dream and I have told everyone I know to go there.

Great staycation away from the craziness of Waikiki. Exceptional service from all the staff. Room was nice - bathroom was spacious with separate bath and shower and two sink areas. Had a wonderful meal at Arancino.

Our family favorite has been Halekulani for a long but tried Kahala for the first time. It was overall really great experience with traditional but still relaxing atmosphere. There was a minor mix-up at checking in but it was fully made up by warm hospitality. Had great experience at Hoku's as well as dining at the room seeing sunset into the ocean. Surely want to return soon

My Wife and Kids Loved it we had so much fun exploring and relaxing we enjoyed the beach didn't want to come back home !!! The hotel was Nice and clean staff where great to!!!!! tell next time my friends

We arrived to the hotel at midnight after a flight which had been delayed 12 hours yet we were still warmly greeted by the bellman and desk staff with leis and a thorough orientation to our room which had kindly been upgraded when they heard of our difficult day of travel. Our package included the breakfast buffet which we thoroughly enjoyed on the patio overlooking the sea and Kokohead; the variety of offerings was impressive and the food fresh and flavorful. We spent many hours on the beach, under the shade; food and beverages were served by the staff who were all friendly and helpful. We found the beds in our room to be very comfortable, the room was well kept, clean and spacious. I am looking forward to returning on my next trip to Oahu. This hotel is located outside of Waikiki in an upscale and quiet residential area, close to Diamond Head and not far from the Kaimuki, Aina Haina and University business/restaurant districts. There are very good dining options in the hotel and it is within reasonable driving distance if you want to plan to eat elsewhere.

Great resort - great amenities. The staff is super nice and we did have some issues with our reservation at check-in. Though it wasn't resolved to my liking initially, once I contacted a manager the next day after I'd slept (my son and I came from Hilo and escaped the hurricane but not the stress of it!!), the matter was resolved to my satisfaction. Dolphin Quest on premises total bonus. Pool/Beach staff excellent. Plumeria Beach SIde dining Excellent!

We celebrated our 25th Wedding anniversary at the Kahala. Dinner at Hoku's was fabulous and loved that they acknowledged our anniversary. We live here a plan on returning for dinner and cocktails soon!

Spent three nights there for my friend's wedding that took place at the hotel. This is much more remote / away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Coming from NYC, I was happy to have the tranquility. I also found the beach there much more calm, relaxed and also just a better beach overall (water is calmer, less rocky, and more shallow). It's near a nice stretch of upscale homes, so also a great spot to walk around in a quiet pretty neighborhood or go for a run to diamond head. Hotel itself is very pretty. The lobby is impressive and has an awesome Veranda where we spent a few nights listening to the piano player or grabbing a quick drink or bite. Room itself was nicely decorated and I liked the bathroom - spacious and had sinks on opposite sides. Robes and slippers are a nice touch. Laundry/steaming our wedding outfits was quick and easy as well. We had a partial ocean view that was nice - we could see the dolphins from our room, only block was from the ceiling of the lobby that extended out.Got room service a few times - only complaint is that it takes a while - took about an hour+ to get our lunch while we got dressed for the wedding.

This is a beautiful, peaceful, elegant resort. You feel far from the busy atmosphere of Waikiki, yet you are minutes away. This hotel is all about service, cleanliness, pampering and Aloha. Hoku is a fabulous restaurant in its own right - you have only steps to a special dining experience. We found ourselves reluctant to leave the resort!

The Kahala gave a fantastic and sweet memories to my wife, daughter and me.Everything, room / service / food / pool and beech, was better than expected.I'd like to recommend to everyone with confidence.

I stayed at The Kahala Hotel & Resort in October 2012 for a week for my first visit to Hawaii/Oahu and I was impressed. Resort is absolutely gorgeous, staff is friendly, rooms are clean and the resort is located on a private beach. There are dolphins at the resort that you can swim with for an additional fee. Restaurants are good although overpriced for the quality. Every president since Lyndon D. Johnson has stayed at the Kahala and when you see how beautiful it is you'll understand why. Pricey but worth it.

One of the best hotels I have stayed in. The location is amazing. Unlike Waikiki beach, the beach at the resort is relaxed and tranquil. The bedroom and hotel is very clean and well decorated. The staff are very friendly and efficient. The view from the room is breathtaking. A taxi is required to visit Honolulu and taxi's are expensive in Hawaii.

I couldn't have asked for a better hotel to stay at in Oahu! It has everything. I was sad that we actually had to venture out of the hotel to do the other site seeing tours! Walking on the beach is like walking on pillows! The dolphin swim is NOT to be missed. The people are friendly and know what they are doing. It was really one of our best family vacations ever. The hotel was very accommodating too all our needs and it is just a great place to stay. There is so much activities on the beach we never even once had the kids in the kids club because who has the time!

This is a beautiful hotel located away from the busy-mess of Waikiki and Honolulu, yet close enough to access both areas if one so desires. Get the breakfast buffet with your room as it is away from restaurants and is well worth the it (lets face it, you would probably spend as much on the a la carte breakfast menu anyway). The staff goes out of their way to make sure you do not have to do anything but rest and relax while you are there. Then there are the dolphins....what could be bad about them! We will definitely be staying here when we come back to Oahu.
user_name:
Evelyn E
Chatsworth, California, United States

review_body: We recently stayed at Kahala Resort and were blown away! The hotel, dolphin pool, beach, restaurants, décor, hotel employees etc all far exceeded what I had anticipated! Best resort on Oahu!! the beach and shallow ocean are perfect...warm, blue water and beautiful sand!! we loved everything about this hotel!! we definitely are planning to return!! if you want to be pampered in paradise, this is the spot for you!!

I would love to stay here more often. This place is nothing but tranquil. I loved my experience and would recommend Kahala to anyone! I can't wait to visit again and look forward to talking story with the amazing staff. Mahalo for making me feel welcome and at home.

The resort is beautiful and the staff and property are all first class. The staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are spacious and extremely comfortable. Stay here if you want to be pampered and out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Just returned from celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary at Kahala Resort. Our experience was dreamlike. We never expected to be treated so well by everyone from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. We were treated like royalty and the resort comfort and amenities were definitely worthy of royalty. It was the vacation of a lifetime, and we highly recommend it. Worthy of a sixth star.

Recently I was in Honolulu for several weeks on a business trip. For most of my visit I was accommodated in beachfront Waikiki properties, but as my stay grew to an end, I felt I deserved a few days of relaxation at one of Hawaii’s best resorts. I had previously stayed at The Kahala over 25 years ago. It was like being on an outer island resort, but literally ten minutes cab ride from Waikiki, so I booked three nights at The Kahala Resort to end our Hawaii stay.On arrival my wife and I did a quick walk around the property and were enticed by The Seaside Grill, situated literally on the private beach where we enjoyed a casual lunch under the palm trees before going back to our room to unpack.The foyer area with its huge chandeliers and high ceilings, takes one back to the elegance of yesteryear. The hotel’s décor throughout the property is tropical casual and just sitting and enjoying one’s surroundings is a pleasure. The hotel offers several dining options. We particularly enjoyed having high tea on the Verandah deck one afternoon. Each morning we ate our buffet breakfast from the huge selection of items available (including great crepes) in the Plumeria Beach House. The made to order egg white omelette and the Eggs Benedict were a favourite.All the usual amenities one would expect in a five star hotel are on hand. The Japanese Toto toilets with built in bidets and many gadgets, were most welcome.Rooms range in price from around $440 to $12,000 for the 2 bedroom Imperial Suite. Our room had the highest beds we have ever seen, almost needed a ladder to climb into bed, but very comfortable.The Dolphin pool/lake area, is home to 5 bottle nosed dolphins; one can pay a fee to swim with the dolphins, under the strict supervision of a marine biologist. Feeding the dolphins is also a popular option. This has enabled the resort to donate millions of dollars to help dolphins and other marine life. Although we did not take these options, we had an enjoyable time watching others participate. The dolphins appeared to be having as much fun as the guests. The number of interactions with the dolphins is carefully monitored.Every inch of the spacious grounds adds to ones enjoyment and relaxation. Overall, although it had been many years since I had been to this very elegant property, I was still impressed. Service, room quality and overall ambience was still very much five star.When only the very best will do.

We just returned from our first family vacation with our little one and we are extremely grateful that we chose the Kahala resort over other highly rated resorts in Waikiki. There are just too many positive things too say about the resort and the experience. The room, grounds, service, amenities, food and staff were great. We chose to keep our island activities to about 1/2 the day, then the rest of the day we would relax by the pool and the beach. A wise choice since there is we ultimately wanted to relax on our vacation and the Kahala helped us achieve this. The Kahala is about a 20 minute drive to Waikiki but perfectly secluded from the tourist madness as other reviewers have noted. We rented a car and the valet/self parking was not an issue.The room we booked was the partial ocean view lanai on a higher floor with a main view of the golf course but the balcony goes out far enough where you can see the ocean to the east (good enough for us).As for specific tips and comments, we did notice the pool was mostly families and children. Not an issue for us since we were one of them, but I wondered how couples on a romantic getaway or singles felt about this. Perhaps an adults only area would address this? We tried to book the shuttle to Waikiki because our daughter wanted to ride on a "bus" but it was often full. Because we had a rental car this wasn't an issue so if you are on the fence about getting a rental car I would get one. Having a car was also helpful when needing to run to the nearby Whole Foods and the mall for basic supplies etc...When it came time to check out we did not want to leave and mentioned to each other we will most likely try and make this an annual trip. Amazing time!

My wife and I are laying here on our last night just amazed at this experience. Shane Kathy and Steve at the bar was outstanding! The one issue we had upon arrival was promptly corrected. All of the food and amenities were impeccable. Good grinds.... (broke the mouth)!!! This has been the absolute best vacation we have ever had. We both recommend staying here. The entire staff was nice and very friendly. I'm making plans for our return asap! We want to thank everyone at the Kahala! Mahalo!

Our family of three (child 7 yrs) stayed 4 nights. Grounds were immaculate as were the rooms. Loved staying in the Dolphin Lagoon Wing as we were less than a minute to the beach and no need to take the elevator. We loved siting at the bar for breakfast each morning for coffee and light fare. We aren't fans if buffets so I can't comment on the food.The rooms are gorgeous. Bathrooms we're beyond gorgeous and very thoughtfully done. Beds we're extraordinarily comfortable. The beach was beyond perfect. I would ditch the intertube as it's easy to lose control of it as the current gets strong. Looks can be deceiving. ..we saw a parent unable to control their kids in it and told them to let it go.The spa was great! Work with Spring as she won't steer you wrong. I had an issue and it was easily resolved. The specialists are incredibly nice but be sure that you're satisfied. Ask for Spring!We got our food from Whole Foods. Not ideal but it was close and convenient. Lastly, they do pay more attention to Japanese guests but we enjoyed the grounds so much that it didn't bother us. We waited for a while for our room (they told us the valet was getting our luggage) but noticed three Japanese families checking in after us got quicker attention hence into their rooms faster. We asked if we can have our key without waiting for the bellman or valet. Never once were we greeted when we walked into the lobby or offered water, like they did to others.As I mentioned, the grounds and rooms were so immaculate that we really didn't care if we were greeted. It was just something we noticed and laughed at. Another family noticed it as well. Our daughter loved dolphin quest and would do it over and over.Worth the stay and can't wait to go back whether I'm greeted or not.

We had a lovely vacation at the Beautiful Kahala Hotel & Resort. The Resort's Décor, Staff, location, restaurants, entertainment, and beach were absolutely perfect. The Resort has such a relaxing atmosphere. We Loved the Dolphins!! My family and I cannot wait for our next vacation at the Kahala Hotel & Resort.

This is a very belated hotel review as we stayed at Kahala a while ago. I just want to add that this must be the best hotel in Oahu as it is so tranquil, away from the hustle and bustle of Wakiki. We stayed there twice in a room close to the dolphin pond and our 3 year old was extremely thrilled to see these lovely animals just in front of our balcony. The hotel is very kid-friendly as it was able to provide a nice/big crib, kids' amenities, and even a baby bjorn potty seat. The service and food was also top-notch during our stay. The only problem we had was with the mattress--it was way too soft for our back. We asked for a firmer mattress during our 2nd stay a few days later and our request was timely served. We can't wait to stay there again!

Love the location of the Kahala Resort - close to everything, but feels more like local/residential feel. No hoards of tourists, but close to Kahala Mall, great restaurants, grocery store. Friendly staff that respects privacy.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. So glad we stayed here rather than Waikiki as it was it was so much nicer to have such a beautiful beach all to ourselves.Breakfast was very good, the kids loved the smoothies and their personalised cookies on our first night were a real treat.The rooms were luxurious with lots of space. The beds were comfortable but quite a small queen size. We were a family of four in the room and found the beds a bit of a squeeze.The courtesy bus was vey good but we would have liked it to be a little more frequent as we didn't have a car.We only tried the Italian restaurant, the staff were very friendly and the food was good but rather pricey considering it was actually just pizza.Would happily stay again

To relax, I chose this hotel. I booked the room of Kahara Tower. I could the sea very well and I felt the earth is round. SPA and Italian restaurant were also excellent. I think it is the best place in Hawaii to relax.

We celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary. Kahala Hotel treated us almost like royalty. Champaine and dessert in our room when we walked in, very comfortable bed, and amazing bathroom/shower. Service was pretty much impeccable. The staff is very attentive. Will go back again. It's only 5 minutes away from our house.

Kahala was a wonderful place to stay! I'll break down the review into sections:1. Checkin: Very prompt and fast. No issues with requested rooms. 2. Rooms: There are different types of rooms, as the hotel will describe to you. I stayed in two different rooms, and one was not the ocean view side but I think that both sides are equally gorgeous and tranquil and great. The hotel is quite old, but the rooms themselves are clean, updated and most importantly, CLEAN!!! It doesn't smell or look old and everything is tastefully done.3. The Grounds: The location of Kahala Resort is perfect because it has a secluded beach that is sort of a crescent so that the waves are not strong and the beach itself is not crowded. The hotel covers a large area and within the property is a "dolphin lagoon" where they keep dolphins. This is the only downside to this hotel. I am sure people will be excited to see these dolphins but the fact that this lagoon is so small and dolphins are known to swim hundreds of miles each day with their pod, and the lagoon is basically a pool is unfortunate. I know that Kahala is "partnered" with the dolphin program and the resort themselves do not run this so I would expect their response to be that they will " pass this information to the organizers", but that's really not my point. Those dolphins are trapped much like the way we would feel if we only have our ensuite to live in for the entirety of our life and I am sorry to see that such a gorgeous resort supports this, regardless of how well they are "treated" and fed and etc.4. The Staff: Everyone is very helpful, from checkin to concierge and beach staff. 5. Proximity to Waikiki: Although this hotel is separated from the "centre" of Waikiki, it is only a 10 minute drive to the centre and the resorts location in respect to beach and quietness cannot be beat . It is worth the drive each day/night you want to go into town, and you are much better off staying at this location rather than fighting the crowd in Waikiki. The atmosphere is much more tranquil. Taking a cab would be approximately $30/ one way. 6. Food: I'm sorry but I didn't eat at the hotel so I cannot make any comments, but the breakfast buffet is always busy and the spread looks great. They have morning coffees setup in the lower lobby and also by the breakfast buffet section that is complimentary each morning and that was excellent coffee! They do have several restaurants on site.I hope you all enjoy your stay at Kahala; it is a wonderful resort.

best service staff ever - delicious, eye popping food - nightly, very classy music & dancing - wonderful room with the most comfortable bed - a totally gorgeous, swimmable beach with a dock to enjoy; probably what Hawaii was like back in the '60s when it wasn't so crowded - all the lovely amenities one would expect @ a luxury resort - oh yes, we would love to return to the kahala! :)

I'm not sure if the recent sale of the hotel had any impact on the property, but some things worth noting. We last stayed at the Kahala 9 years ago when it was the Mandarin. Here are some positives and negatives that overall kept this from getting an excellent review from me. Positives: great beach and property, quiet away from the hectic Waikiki scene, rooms that are large and up to date, good breakfast buffet choices and the assistant front desk mgr Sahng who really went out of his way to accommodate us..Negatives: shuttle service to Waikiki (runs infrequently/needs a reservation), check in (when we booked, I requested connecting rooms since traveling with children and I called and confirmed that we had connecting rooms the day before arriving only to be told on arrival that it was not available), mixed experience with staff (Marc in Concierge was great but another concierge told us on arrival after an 11 hour trip with kids that there were no restaurants open at 4:30pm so sent us on a taxi ride to a mall yet later we learned that the pool restaurant was open until 5:15pm), long lines for breakfast buffet even though there were plenty of tables open, no airconditioning in some of the halls.Overall, you stay here for relaxation and the beach and that's 5 stars, but these other issues really detract from the experience.

I stayed at this hotel for seven nights and what a surprise. Ever room is large the only difference was if they had a balcony and a beach view. The rooms are unbelieveable. The bedroom is very large with a couch and table and desk. There is a very large bathroom with wash basins up each end double hanging space and separate toilet and large shower. The rooms are very well kept and the best beds very comfy. It was fully booked on our arrival so had to wait up to 4 hours for our room as the first one we where offered was a long way from the main building but the second was on the 7th floor without a balcony as we couldn't upgrade, would prefer balcony as felt hemmed in not being able to open a window. the buffet breakfast was great, the best pineapple I have tasted.The pool area is getting very tired and not bigger enough. Not a lot of shade and lounges and umbrellas need replacing. The beach is greatvery clear and safe for swimming. The Dolphins are a great attraction to have on site. You can watch them all day and still see something different and the staff are great and will answer any questions who have. They run a free shuttle bus to the local mall, Waikiki and Al Mona through out the day and you can go in for dinner if you want to. The only downside is if you don't have a car you are isolated from eating at local restaurants. This hotel is very professionally run with very friendly staff. This is a very popular with Japanese visitors who are very polite and trouble free tourists. Great place for children.

I was lucky enough to have my fiance whisk me away to this tropical paradise early in our relationship. It was a stunner. The room was lovely, the staff was courteous, the food was delicious and the beach was spectacular. If you are looking for a fantastic getaway I can highly recommend this one. Can't wait to return.

Had a wonderful stay here for 6 nights with my husband. Great location away from the hussle and bussle of Waikiki but close enough to venture in for some activity when desired on the free hotel shuttle. Beautiful beach, great food (although simple at times) and service. The rooms are large with fantastic bathrooms. We have stayed in many resorts around the world, this is certainly up there with the best. The only draw back is that virtually everything at the hotel is an extra cost, including if you want shade at the beach... Otherwise a luxurious and relaxing stay. Highly recommended

Stayed here for four nights before staying in Waikiki for three nights. This is a truly great resort with large well appointed rooms and generous sized bathrooms. The view from the balcony facing ocean is excellent but even the golf course facing view is great. The beach is calm and feels very private. Pool/beach service is excellent. All the staff members we met were very friendly and professional. We always looked forward to come back and relax at the pool and beach after a morning trip out. Much more relaxed compared to touristy Waikiki. One aspect they really need to improve are the restaurants. Even the flagship restaurant Hoku left much to be desired both in terms of food quality and sophistication. Ate twice at Plumeria and the food was ok at best. Next time I would choose to eat out in Waikiki.

Having been to Oahu many times I never understood why you would stay at Kahala but this time I thought it was worth a try. Now I get it! As Waikiki keeps getting busier and busier this resort is an oasis. I had to keep reminding myself I was still on the same island. We stayed in a dolphin lanai and that was magical we sat on the balcony a lot just enjoying the view. The rooms are tastefully decorated huge bathrooms. Staff where all friendly and welcoming. While the pool is not huge it does the job but the beach is a great substitute no waves and a perfect temperature my 4 year old loved it. I hired a cabana on the beach one day so could sit and watch her play with other kids. Food and beverage prices are reasonable so you don't feel like anything is overpriced because it is a luxury property. There is a shuttle to a local mall or $10 in a taxi or a shuttle to Waikiki or ala Moana and when you go in you just want to head back! My biggest complaint you don't want to leave. If you want an island experience on Oahu this is it

Among other hotels where offer servises which they would like to sell,this hotel offer services based on custmer needs. Customer oriented hotel services made me happy and feel comfortable during my stay.

Just back from a 50th wedding Anniversary with our family and friends. This trip was almost a year in the planning and many, many to Grace Chan the Banquet Manager who was wonderful to work with. She and her lovely waiting staff put together a delicious buffet on the lawn. Together with the sound of the waves and a rising full moon it the evening was just perfect. I had purchased a combination of Ocean Front Suites, Dolphin Lanai rooms, and Beach Front Lanais all the rooms were perfect. Water was plentiful but ice erratic. We did a number of activities, including a snorking trip. The activities staff were all helpful, ethusiastic, friendly and diligent.We had a series of tented cabanas which everyone enjoyed. Both the adults and children enjoyed the swimming.The staff and the meal at Hokus were both outstanding. About the Plumeria, the less said the better, although their sea food buffet and their buffet breakfast were good.The reception staff were always very friendly and helpful. They handle a large group deftlyAll in all it was a wonderful experience at a really great hotel.

I have been frequenting the Kahala Hotel and Resort for about 10 years. This time I was disappointed. The carpets in the hallways were not clean as usual. The pool area had standing water near the lawn. There was litter on the beach. The seasonal fruit water in the lobby was empty more often that filled. It just wasn't as it had been. Perhaps it is because of the ownership change. The staff was still very good. But I will look at alternate accommodations for my next trip to Oahu. It isn't what it used to be. Hopefully the new ownership will correct these problems.

Having never stayed at a 5 star hotel we weren't sure of what to expect. As we arrived and were greeted with a Hawaiian necklace and a warm smile and introduction of the hotel we were sure this would be the most relaxing stay of our lives. The rooms are lovely and so clean. The maids come in the morning to make your bed and give fresh towels and at night to dress down your bed and leave chocolates on your pillow and put out your slippers and closes your curtains. These finer details make this hotel the most personal service Iv encountered. Everyone goes above and beyond to ensure you don't have to lift a finger! From the pool staff who lay out your towel for the day on your sun lounger to the concierge who book your complimentary shuttle bus to Waikiki and post your post cards free of charge for you. I will be sure to stay 5 star more often as the service is impeccable. we ate at hoku for brunch on the Sunday and wow is all I can say! All you can eat of the finest sea food and meats. Totally delicious. The meals at the seafood grill and plumeria beach house were also delicious. The fitness centre is great and came in useful for burning the calories from all true amazing food. The sea at the hotel is beautiful and the palm trees set the perfect setting. There are only a couple of things that are room for improvement and that's that the wifi in the rooms isn't good and keeps cutting in and out and the that the pool area does get very busy and so if there were plans to refurb id recommend expanding this area so that it feels more peaceful. But these are minor things and we had the best stay of any hotel we have been.

Very good place to conduct business. The room was nice and the hotel was perfect. The only issue that I ran into was getting bottle water. That is really a non issue. My customers and vendors enjoyed the hotel also.

This was our first visit to Hawaii, and what a splendid vacation it was! A truly magnificent resort with all the flavors and amenities that perfectly echoed the Hawaiian life. Getting there was a challenge, but not a bad experience. (Apologies for the tardy review!)The shops and restaurants were very nice, and I would highly recommend this property to one who has never visited Honolulu. I look forward to a return visit again very soon! Bravo, bravo!!

We found the hotel met all our requirements - good food - our room was spacious and kept clean - the hotel staff whether working in the restaurants , rooms , front desk etc were all efficient and very helpful - we had a great time.

Great food at Hoku's, Aroncinos, Plumeria, Terrace and Seaside Grill. The concierge service was efficient and helpful setting up all the activities at the Dolphin Quest and surf lessons right there on the beach for my grandson. What was not up to an excellent rating was the consistency of room service and housekeeping. Both were hit and miss and required extra calls as reminders. Some of the service people forgot to ring the bell and just walked in. The room was next to the elevator (never wonderful,)and I had requested two double beds which I did not get. I did get one bed and a roll away for my 9 year old grandson.Be aware of these inconveniences and mention them before a reservation is made, because overall, the Kahala is worth it.

Wow, if you are not into all the tourist things & prefer a quieter location, this is your place!! We had an oceanfront room in the Ko Ko head wing. We had a great view of the ocean, the dolphins, & the pool. We had a nice large balcony. Not all the rooms have balconies, just so you know. We have also stayed in the mountain view rooms & they have pretty views of the lights from the houses on the mountain! The beds are very comfortable & the bathrooms are large! Ho ku's & The Italian restaurant at the hotel are very good as well as the breakfast buffet! We loved the beach in front of the hotel. It was very relaxing sitting in the trade winds & we also bumped into Mr. Jerry Seinfeld!! I highly recommend the Kahala for anyone that likes to be spoiled & desires a peaceful & relaxing vacation!!:)

Wonderful service, great food and lovely accommodation. We had a scenic view room which was great, lovely view of golf course and mountains - not another high rise in sight. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The hotel was full when we stayed but you would never have known, we never had to wait for service and the pool and beach area was pleasantly busy - not cheek to jowl like some resorts. Would love to stay here again. Thoroughly recommended.

Loved the Kahala resort on our recent trip to Hawaii. The resort was sensational with our large room opening out on to the Dolphin pool. Lots to do (although everything was an extra charge) or great doing nothing at all. The best restaurant was Arancino. The staff were friendly and accommodating and there were lots of them around. A great resort out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We were mesmerized by the gorgeous dolphins and spent many hours watching these majestic creatures. A real treat at our back door.

For our 30th wedding anniversary we made our first trip to Hawaii and chose to stay at the Kahala Resort. We were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel special. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The room we had (although not a sea view) was stunning and had views over the golf course and Diamond Head. The facilities were first class. We dined in all the restaurants and with the exception of Arancino, were not disappointed. Given the chance we would definitely return and have no hesitation in recommending it for others.

I came here for a three day stay after a stint in Maui. I have to say this resort must be one of the world's best. It is not the biggest place but you can easily get hidden here. It's super laid back and the staff is unbelievable. From initial arrival and the bell desk, to check in, the pool cabana attendant, the bartenders, and other staff are all so friendly and quickly remember your name and greet you personally the next time you see them.You get the feeling you can do whatever you want there, or nothing at all which is perfectly fine.The rooms are super spacious and well appointed. The hotel itself is in it's 50th year but the rooms were renovated and have all the right amenities including bathrooms that are sizable with their own shower and bath separately.The flagship restaurant Hoku's is one of the best restaurants I have been to in the US. This is where you get true impeccable service, creative and dynamic menu offerings, and an amazing wine selection. The wait staff are experienced, confident, and know how to help you truly enjoy your evening.

I really love the location and service at this hotel. It is out of the hub bub of Waikiki and located in a quiet neighborhood. There is virtually no visitors there other than the hotel guests so there is a private feel to the hotel. They also have a great breakfast in their restaurant. The main complaint I have with the hotel is that is in in desperate need of a remodel. I believe its been 7 years or more since the rooms have been renovated. This equates to stained, worn carpet, cracked tiles and chipped furniture. The staff is excellent so for me that outweighs the condition of the room but I would only recommend the hotel to friends who are not picky about the room condition.

I used to visit the Kahala regularly when it was at its best, under Hilton management. I looked elsewhere when it changed operators and slid downhill. It has been spruced up. The service is now back to its best and the grounds are manicured and impressive. My only concern is the food. Both restaurants look good and the service is competent, but the food is at best unexceptional and at worst unpleasant. I had meals at all outlets and I am sorry to have to say the best meal I had was a tuna sandwich at the beach bar. Fix the food and it will be once again the jewel of Honolulu.

The Kahala is our favorite place to stay on O'ahu. It has changed hands several times in the last 15 years, only once going through a rough period. I am happy to say it is back to it's high standards. The rooms are lovely and elegant without being uptight. The scenic view rooms are our favorite, because although they overlook the mountainside, there is a constant breeze coming down. There are a few rooms which are low and close to the hotel's entrance, which aren't the best. The kids club staff is really kind, but the activities are mediocre. That said, my daughter loved her time with them. There is a Dolphin program on the property with a (almost) affordable sting ray visit. Again, my daughter did both and had the time of her life.

We decided that we would attend the Pro Bowl and wanted to stay off the beaten path of Waikiki. I did a ton of research and decided that this hotel was just the place we needed. It has it's own private beach, a lagoon where you can swim with dolphins and a golf course. The beach is absolutely beautiful as well as the hotel. On our first night there, we dined at one if the hotel restaurants where we met Kenny Albert and Daryl "moose" Johnston. That was highlight! However, the restaurant was beyond overpriced and food wasn't good. The rooms were beautiful, clean and well maintained but at $600 per night, I expected a view of the ocean not the mountains. We had a great trip and plan on returning to Oahu in a few years but will look to rent a beach condo instead.

If you're looking for a place out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, yet close to all of it's amenities, Kahala is the place to be. While the hotel is a little tired, we found it absolutely charming. The service is very good, and the beach was inviting and almost private. We will certainly stay there again.
user_name:
Kathleen T
Rancho Santa Margarita, California

review_body: I was here on business and was so sorry that I didn't have more time to take in the mellow vibe and wonderful amenities that this resort has to offer. The resort is placed in a beautiful and quiet part of Honolulu on the other side of Diamond Head. My standard room was two or three times the size of any other standard hotel room I have stayed in. The bathroom was equally spacious and luxurious. I had a stunning view of the ocean and beach and my balcony overlooked the dolphin lagoon which was nice, but made me sad that the dolphins lived in such a small space. I had lunch in the casual dining restaurant and the food and service were top notch. You can easily get to the busier part of Waikiki by hotel shuttle if you want to go off property for meals or shopping. I would definitely return to this lovely location for vacation.

The Kahala Hotel wants to be a Four Seasons but it falls short on every front. The location is great but the hotel placement is all wrong. We upgraded to an ocean view room and all we got was a view of the parking garage and the front lobby. Beep, beep, beep as trucks and buses would pull in all day long. No ocean sound just the nice sound of a garage. Just a glimpse of blue off in the distance. They were sold out and couldn't move us to even a garden view until the last night. Did they reduce the price when they did move us? Nope. The staff and service is just not up to par with other premium hotel properties. We left early and won't be coming back. Be careful what you book and where they place you. Call and ask very detailed questions. It also needs some basic maintenance. Our room railing was covered in rust.

When my daughter and I decided to go to Hawaii and do the Dolphin Quest Trainer for a Day, it was only natural to book our room in the attached Hotel. When we arrived and our luggage was being unloaded from the back of the transfer bus, the outside staff greeted us with a warm welcome and a beautiful shell lei. They let us know where the front desk was to check in and not to worry about our luggage as they would make sure it was sent to our room.Our room was very spacious and I was thrilled to see a coffee maker with coffee and tea supplies. Thank YouOur luggage was delivered shortly after we got to our room and the porter asked if we wanted luggage racks set up and if we had any questions about our room.On a whim, we called the spa and asked if they had time and space for a massage. They did and off we go. The personal touches and consideration they should my daughter and I for our comfort was wonderful. We were truly no longer flight weary. Off we go to the Italian restaurant on the property for dinner. My daughter is a very picky eater and after she viewed the menu, she was worried about what she could eat. The waiter came by and she asked if they would be good enough to make a ham and pineapple pizza for her. She beamed when they said "yes".We went back to our room and opened a room service book as the Plumeria wasn't open for breakfast until 6,30 am and we had to be at the Dolphine Quest office at 7.00 am. When I spoke with room service and explained my dilema and the need to have an enjoyable meal, they said they would deliver breakfast to us at 6.00 am. They were prompt with smiling faces and a newspaper.Off to spend the day with the Dolphins - Fabulous.Have dinner at the Plumeria - Wow! Huge sizes and affordable.Back to the room for the night and we were tickled at the chocolates on the bed with a card telling us about the hotel being on TV. The was a nice mat on the floor on each side of the bed with a pair of slippers set out. Wow! This continued each night of our stay. I must say, this is a very nice touch and truly appreciated.I would like to thank everyone at the Kahala Hotel for making the start of our much needed holiday one to truly remember. I will definitely recommend your hotel to anyone going to Oahu.

The Kahala Hotel is the kind of place one could imagine the "rat pack" enjoying because of it's keen seclusion from the crowds of Waikiki and the classic styling of the rooms and dining areas. The pool area is rather intimate which makes this more of a luxury hotel than a resort, but there is plenty of beach space and two-chair cabanas for rental. The ocean is literally waist deep or less out to the sandbar which makes it easy to swim around kayak or even paddle board. However, if you are in the market to fight the waves, this isn't your spot. There is also a dolphin pool and stingray area for those who want to be "one with nature." There are also different levels of dining casual, medium, and formal (and this hotel adheres to dress codes). The spa services are out of this world and the rooms are well appointed with an "old world" feel. In all, I think this is a perfect spot for couples and a little less perfect for families with teens who are into activity based days. The breakfast room (which later serves lunch) had plenty of great selections and seems to cater, in particular, to Japanese guests. In all, we had a wonderful experience.

My wife and I had a vacation in Hawaii in June. We started in Maui staying at Ritz which we found out to be a poor choice - 3 star service and 4 star facilities at 5 star price. Luckily, The Kahala compensated us thanks to its top quality service, friendly and helpful staff and nice facilities. We will certain be back

The Kahala is absolute perfection: a quiet little oasis away from the bustle of Waikiki beach, but close enough to everything you could want to do in Hawaii.Picking out any one highlight is impossible. The room is impeccably clean, and decorated to a very high standard, with incredible attention to detail. The onsite restaurants are universally excellent. The beach area is well maintained, with great amenities. The staff really couldn't be more helpfulThe only downside was having to leave to come back home

First time even in Hawaii. We spent 10 days at The Kahala. Had a small hiccup at checkin about the room, but it was quickly rectified. The entire staff is nice and helpful, from the pool staff, to restaurant, the cleaners, the turndown service, which includes chocolate. Property is beautiful and quiet, but their shuttle takes you to Waikiki or local malls if you want shopping and more restaurants.I could go on...

The best in the world !! Clean and tidy rooms with fabulous views from the balcony ! Fabulous food and great clean pool ! There's also lots of things to do such as , swimming with the dolphins , hire a paddle board , go to the spa or relax on the hotels private beach! For the ten days I stayed here I didn't have a single problem and would highly recommend it !!

I really liked this hotel/resort because its away from the busy waikiki beach area. Its a little secluded with its own private access to the beach. They have water activities available, a dolphin lagoon, and a great breakfast. The rooms are nice too. It was a relaxing stay and we'd go back again. Definitely recommend this resort for couples or families.
user_name:
svpepers
New York City, New York

review_body: From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the Bell boys to our departure and check out we felt that we were treated like royalty. All staff are courteous and helpful with the simplest of enquiries. Choice of two great restaurants as well as a pool side grill. And then there's the dolphins-wow!We had a mountain view room on the first floor. It was huge and well resourced. Our balcony was almost as big and also had glimpses of the ocean.This is a great place to stay as it away from the 'touristy' areas of Waikiki. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to the Kahala Mall where you will find a great range of shops.One fantastic hotel.

Fantastic resort - 50+ years it has been around, but the rooms and hotel are updated and ridiculously comfortable. It hasn't tried to hide its history...it is comfortable with its age, but the facility has kept itself relevant. You are 15 minutes away from the insanity of Waikiki, it feels like you are on the slow side of Maui. Uncrowded beach, very family friendly , excellent food at breakfast buffet (Plumeria - the view alone is worth it) and the three other on site restaurants. Having the 6 dolphins on site just add to the experience. In 6 days, we had two sub par wait staff, but that was easily the exception rather than the rule. We had excellent service the rest of the time, and they were kind enough to extend one of our rooms until late afternoon to accommodate a late flight out. Stayed in a Scenic ocean view suite - which had a nice corner shot of the ocean (viewable from balcony), and great views of the adjacent golf course and hillside. Beds excellent, shower/bathroom were well equipped. Will return without hesitation.

Excellent service, professional staff who anticipated all our needs. 13 of 24 of our family members stayed at the Kahala on this trip. All 24 enjoyed breakfast at the Plumeria. The resort staff met all our needs and beyond. We have made more than 30 visits to your resort and each stay always exceed our expectations..

A most enjoyable hotel and resort. Relaxing, yet there are enough activities to tire even youngsters! Try snorkelling in front of the hotel - beautiful fish to be seen. A truly worthwhile holiday experience.

I have stayed at eight different hotels in Hawaii, from the overrated Helekulani to the always excellent Four Seasons. However, on Oahu, the Kahala is the best.The property could use a face lift, but the structure has been well maintained with some upgrading over the years from its days as a Mandarin and is on one of the better parcels of land in the Waikiki area. It is about 10 minutes in taxi from the more centrally located Moana Sufrider, and is located in the Diamond Head/ Kaphahula area. The beach is private and away from the congestion of Waikiki central, the hotel maintains a dolphin pool, and is adjacent to one of the best golf courses on the island where President Clinton once played. Our suits was spacious with self cleaning toilet seats overlooking the beach and golf course. At a rate less than the Halekulani where most views are of another hotel room, I thought that the Kahala was a good value.Perhaps the best part of the experience was the service. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate you. They are pleasant, friendly, and knowledgeable -- three traits I seldom find in the many five star hotels I stay at throughout the year. The food is good and better than most hotels in the area. However, Oahu has some exceptional restaurants on the island, so if you want fine dining, you might try some of the other spots like Alan Wong and La Mer.
user_name:
Antionio10
New York City, New York

review_body: The place is very tidy,clean and the staff were wonderful to us.Always polite and helpful.The private beach is safe for the whole family and not crowded, even at this time of the year.Restaurants very good with great service.

My husband and I visited The Kahala in June 2014. From the minute we arrived to when we left we felt welcome and well looked after. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. We requested a wheelchair accessible room with wheel in shower and the room was just as requested. The hotel is totally wheel chair accessible and we had no problems getting round anywhere. Cameron on the Concierge desk was extremely helpful finding us a wheelchair accessible trip to Pearl Harbour. We ate in most of the restaurants and the food was always wonderful. We would certainly visit again if we had the chance .

I just got back from a wonderful 5 night stay at the Kahala Hotel & Resort. The purpose of my trip was to relax, let go of stress, get in the healing Hawaiian ocean and see friends that live nearby. The resort exceeded all my expectations in every way! So much so that I'm returning in December with my Husband! I had many, many choices as to where to go. I had always wanted to stay at this resort and finally, I made it happen. Elegant, comfortable, excellent restaurants and attentive staff. The room I stayed in was on the 7th floor facing the mountains. Beds, pillows, size of the room, the lanai - all fantastic! I slept well each night! The breakfast buffet was included in my room price. You could not want for anything more. The buffet had everything anyone could desire.............I especially enjoyed eating dinner at Hoku - their specialty Poki appetizer is not to be missed! I also loved their new Italian restaurant - AranCino. The presentation of the food was so much more than I expected. I loved the square rosemary focaccia bread and their heirloom tomato salad. Their wine list was great and the service so friendly! I had a massage and was very pleased with the service I received, although very expensive! The only downside of my trip was that I did have very noisy neighbors across the hall from my room with lots of kids that continually played in the hallway, cried and yelled at their parents. It's amazing how parents these days cannot be respectful of others. They seem to lose touch that there are others in the same Hotel that may not want to hear their children crying or yelling in common areas...........I called the Front Desk and they took care of this problem right away and offered to move my room. The Hotel Manager came up to my room to apologize. I was pleased with the attentiveness of the staff in regards to this problem. Apparently, I was not the only one complaining about this family..........All in all, I came back relaxed, tan and ready to face the "real" world again! I can't wait to experience the Kahala again.............

I have virtually no complaints about my stay. The staff are amazing. The room was fantastic. They went above and beyond to acknowledge my birthday. The food is exceptional. The views are unreal. We especially loved that the hotel is outside the city. The privacy factor was a huge plus for us.

We Stayed here last week for 5 nights. I must say the service/employees go out of their way to make sure your stay is as pleasant as it can be. The location is great, away from the hustle of the big city, but central enough to visit any location on the island in a short time. The beach and pool are perfect. There are so many serene and peaceful places to hang out and enjoy this paradise on the property. The breakfast buffet is a great way to start the day. An amazing view accompanies each breakfast. We had dinner at Hoku's (I wrote a separate review) which was the best. The service there was better than many NYC restaurants and the food was just outstanding. Being called by our names at the restaurant was the perfect touch, and the manager will make sure you are taken care of. He was very personable. Little extras like the nightly turndown service, chocolates, bottled water, and the overall friendliness of the staff makes you feel very special, no matter what part of the hotel you are staring in. I can go on, but don't believe any negative reviews. We did have an issue upon check in, but it was rectified beyond our dreams and we thank Flora for that. They will go out of their way to make sure your stay is beyond perfect. Just ask them or tell them and they will react in the right way. If there can be such a rating as 6 stars, I think The Kahala should be the first to get it! If you are visiting Oahu, do yourself a favor and go straight to The Kahala. You will not be disappointed. Trust me,

Small but very friendly. Dolphins are a great attraction even if just watching. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are beautiful. The hotel itself is a great place to stay during your vacation. Everything is close by, within a few min of drive. Highly recommend this place!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Kahala and were happy not being in Waikiki. The staff were friendly and accommodating, the room was clean, spacious and quiet. Nice mix of couples and families. Loved it and hope to be back.

Wonderful experience...wonderful secluded location, yet access to Waikiki is easy. The scenic view room was beautiful overlooking the Golf course and view of mountain. Their employees are warm and friendly nod the service is great. It is not an inexpensive vacation.

I stayed at the Kahala Hotel in January of this year. It was my first stay at this hotel and hopefully not the last. The location is quiet and feels secluded however it is a quick taxi ride to downtown Honolulu or an easy walk to the nearby mall. The beach is beautiful and quiet. My room was an ocean view that also had a view of the dolphin pools and was worth the upgrade from the mountain view. I noticed the mountains seemed to have rain clouds every day which is exactly what I was trying to take a vacation from! The only problem was that I left my swimsuit at the hotel and admittedly it took me 4 months to realize this. I called the hotel and spoke with a gentleman hoping by some slim chance they might have my swimsuit in a lost and found. He told me the maids get to keep any items they turn into the lost and found if it they are not claimed within 1 month. He told me he would check anyway and call me back. I didn't hear back from him. Considering the cost of the room it would have been great customer service to call me to let me know I have forgotten a swimsuit. I would have been happy to pay to have it shipped to me. I'm not upset...it was my mistake. Moral of the story... unless you want the maid wearing your swimsuit.....don't forget it!

I stayed four nights with my little dog. The resort was silent and very relaxed. My dog also enjoyed her stay. My dog is very silent and good in manner but unfortunately, I could not bring her any of the restaurants even for the outdoor tables. It would be very much nicer if this point is improved.

Recently stayed at the Kahala Resort and Spa June 27 through July 3. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted by the bellhop staff, luggage promptly handled and shown to check in. The reservationist that handled our check in was Noel. What a pleasure. Just the right amount of cheerfulness to make you feel instantly welcomed!! Throughout our stay, the hotel staff was always there to assist, everyone from the cleaning staff, the front desk, the shuttle service the concierge. A special shout out to Rose and Sarah of the cleaning staff, and to Cameron, and James, concierge staff and last but not least, Noel, front desk. Our room faced the mountainside what a beautiful view. The room was spacious and relaxing, the bathroom contained both a shower a huge soaking tub with double his and hers sinks. This is a family friendly resort, but exceptionally quiet. My favorite part of the resort was the Veranda where you could sit out in rocking chairs and overlook the hotel grounds with an unobstructed view of the Pacific Ocean and listen to the live jazz nightly while enjoying a cocktail. Truly paradise!Dee G. Chicago
user_name:
Monica L
Mount Vernon, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Kahala for the first half of our honeymoon trip to Hawaii and were blown away. The service was unbeatable and the resort itself was amazing. No other place on our trip matched the Kahala.

It was many years ago but good/great memories last forever and this is one of them. Had spent some time in the middle east and we needed a break to something entirely different. The Office suggested and arranged it as a reward.Well I do remember so well our arrival at the hotel . Firstly as habit would in 3rd world countries arriving from the airport limo to the hotel I grabbed my suitcases only to be told "mam please" as the doorman a true gentleman escorted me firstly and took all my luggage.This was merely the beginning , as I said coming from a 3rd world country mucky horrid and not in the slightest feminine. Aaah the luxury of the bedroom so beautifully tropically designed and the view of the Pacific and Diamond Point.The true glory of all was the breakfast room in the morning at that time on a little island on the grounds and entered by a bridge with beautiful dolphins swimming underneath.I seriously thought I'd passed to heaven . As said this was many years ago but check it out as I don't think this kind of wonderful vacation place could ever be lost. Staff great so helpful and by far the best of the Pacific .enjoy and love it. avril hagan

Aloha All!!The service was excellent and the 'Aloha Spirit' was encompassing from our arrival to our departure. All the staff from valet, front desk, pool, and restaurants...welcomed us as if it was our 'home away from home' and MORE!!The room was well appointed, large and wonderful oceanviews and large lanai area. Please know not all rooms have a lanai (Balcony)...if important to you, be sure to book a room with a lanai. Location was fabulous, off the mainstream of Waikiki and the beach was clean and in its own alcove. Excellent pool and beach staff, always ensuring if you need another towel, food, beverage, chairs, very attentive and courteous.We ate at Seaside Grill, Plumeria, and The Veranda. The Veranda is a must, try the ahi musubi and short rib tempura...ONOLICIOUS!You will not be disappointed anything that you order at the Veranda. We booked three rooms (8pax)s and everyone agreed the amenities were great but, it was the thoughtful service of the staff making us feel very special and pampered...Our family had a wonderful stay and in one word the staff made it 'MAGICAL'.On another note, we did the Dolphin Quest...another must...the experience is unbelievable.IF anything for improvement (nothing to do with the hotel) would suggest City or State not sure who is responsible to repave Kahala Avenue before the hotel driveway. Mahalo nui to the associates of The Kahala Hotel and Resort.

The view was perfect, service was friendly and excellent. Concierge services are excellent, they gave us great recommendations. There are a lot of choices for food. My favorite is the plumeria restaurant. Room service was excellent. Maids were great. They leave chocolate and water on your bed. Its kind of out of Waikiki but they have a shuttle bus that takes you into town. 6 out of 5 stars!!!!

We stayed for 3 nights and The Kahala was a wonderful place to stay. The room was spacious and we had an amazing view of the ocean. The staff was very attentive. The breakfast buffet every morning was also very good. The beach and pool were great as well. Although we didn't swim with the dolphins, they were so fun to watch. This place was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki which we enjoyed. We hope to return in the future.

Our first experience in Hawaii and we chose absolutely the right hotel for our stay on Oahu.You will read that this hotel used to be the Kahala Hilton and used to be and still is the destination of high profile celebs, royalty and people who wanted a smart environment away from the hubbub of the majority of Hawaiian travellers. If you want peace and quiet in smart surroundings away from the madness of Waikiki beach then this is it. The hotel has a shuttle bus that will take you to Waikiki several times a day and will collect you too. Taxis are about $40 if you wish to make your own way.Before I review the hotel, if you travel from the mainland (LAX) to Honolulu use Hawaiian Air as this will set the scene for this fabulous group of islands. Run by Hawaiians they really are so proud of their home land that you will really feel part of Hawaii before you arrive. We visited 4 islands and Hawaiian air were on time and excellent as an airline. I must also mention that if you hire cars in Hawaii, use Hertz and hire a Ford Mustang convertible, again our cars were ready and the service unbeatable. The weak link in our trip to Hawaii could easily have been the flights and cars but they just worked perfectly, I cannot rate either company more highly. Fell free to contact me if you need any more information.Back to The Kahala, an easy drive from the airport at Honolulu to the hotel. On arrival we had a great welcome from the valet staff who took the car and luggage away and we were adorned with the Hawaiian Lei Garlands - Heavy beads for blokes and a multi coloured flower Lei for the ladies. LOVELY! We were taken to the reception desk (you will find most properties in Hawaii are huge and it is useful to allow yourself to be directed by staff to the reception areas). Rick Rogers was our receptionist and he very professionally dealt with our check in accompanied by the reception Manager Pok Kung. We had a fabulous suite on the 8th floor. The lounge area was a large sitting room with a drinks bar and even a sink with running water - excellent! The room had an en suite shower and toilet area, TV and phones. There was a balcony facing the ocean and swimming pool area. Off the sitting room was the bedroom with a Juliet balcony, lovely matching furniture, a desk, TV and phones. Off the bedroom was a fantastic dressing room, his and hers or his and his or hers and hers to be politically correct. At each end of the dressing room was a wash basin and dressing room area. One end had a toilet with an automatic personal washing system, (if you have never used one of these you are in for a treat!) The other end had a shower. Quality toiletries and plenty of hanging space and drawers. In the middle of this area was a large bath tub. LOVELY!!The hotel has a main quality restaurant used for general meals and breakfast, there are other restaurants which we did not use. Breakfast was a massive buffet which catered for a very diverse group of people. There is a predominant amount of Japanese guests at this hotel, probably because of the proximity to Japan. Every day we saw at least one Japanese wedding taking place and on one day we saw 4!There is an excellent bar area off reception where they serve drinks all day and afternoon tea.Near to the swimming pool is a dolphin pool and every day they were taking people to swim with them - the children particularly loved it - it was great fun to watch them. There are also turtles and sting ray fish in another pool. Access to the beach is very easy, 10 steps from the pool and managed very well by the pool staff who offer chairs, towels and tables. There is an excellent pool bar serving food and drink all day.All the staff at this hotel are excellentThere is a shuttle bus which runs several times a day to Waikiki if you wish to visit the madness of the area. You must go to see Waikiki to see the extreme contrast of the areas.Kahala is great if you want a quieter smart time in Oahu, Waikiki will be for you if you want fast pace, huge hotels and what I see as Las Vegas by sea kind of holiday.

Stayed here on my honeymoon. Definitely want to go back. The place is nice and clean. The staff were always helpful and courteous, especially Cameron at the concierge's desk. He basically booked all of our activities for us. All we had to do was show up. The dolphin encounter is amazing. You can't beat the views. Best of all, we wanted to be out of the very busy Waikiki district. The Kahala isa bit secluded from the madness of the city, but just a short taxi or shuttle ride away. I can't say enough about how much my wife and I enjoyed staying here. We will definitely stay here again on other trips.

We celebrated an anniversary. Everything was done with kindness and friendly service. Our family and grandchildren had a safe, fun, and memory making time. Everything is done with great courtesy. The food is excellent.

Fantastic resort, perfectly located close to all attractions but still private for a restful stay. Friendly and detailed staff. Wonderful suites we all possible amenities. You don't want to leave. We are a family of 4 and stayed for a week. We used the hotel concierge for all island reservations and tickets. It was a stress free stay.

Just spent 5 days at The Kahala that is set on the most beautiful private beach. The rooms were huge and the bed was sooooo comfortable! Food was fabulous and so were the spa treatments. We went canoeing and saw a family of sea turtles and swimming with the dolphins was the most amazing incredible experience and to top it off you can watch them in the lagoon every day...very special place.

The Kahala Hotel and Resort was amazing. The minute we stepped out of our car we were treated like celebrities. The food is great and the service is awesome. The beach alone is worth the price. You can sit by the private beach all day and get waited on by the staff. The water is warm and if you don't want to get sandy, you can head to the pool/spa. The staff at Kahala is very friendly and professional. This was the best vacation we have ever been on.

We were looking for an Oahu stay, for 4 nights, that had the resort feel, not in the strip of Waikiki. The Kahala was a great choice! It's in a perfect location, not too close or too far from the Oahu highlights. That being said, here is what made the hotel great:-The RoomLovely mountain view, swing out TV, 2 sinks, and a personal shower separate from the bathtub.-The Dolphins They were so fun to watch, right on the resort!-The BeachVery calm, great for swimming.-The BreakfastEverything tasted fresh and the layout was wonderful.-The ServiceEveryone was friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. We were greeted with cookies upon arrival to the room, and water+chocolates were provided via turndown service.Overall- perfect!

This hotel is just amazing, words can't describe how in love we are with this hotel. We spent two nights of our honeymoon here and we wished we could have stayed 2000 more. From the moment you get there you are pampered, I've never experienced such a high level of service. Some of the workers would ask if you would like your picture taken together without even being asked. The rooms are sophisticated and detailed, I loved the charm of the furniture. As you walk in hawaiian love music is on (we later purchased the cd), we had complimentary champagne sent up to our room that night too as well. We stayed on the mountain side and the view from there was great, could even see the ocean. The food was incredible, from the poolside bar to the breakfast buffet to the Italian restaurant, Arancino. In fact, Arancino was probably some of the best food we've ever had. They even gave us complimentary macaroons since it was our honeymoon. There is a dolphin pool there and although we didn't do the dolphin encounter (probably wish I would have), I loved being able to watch them - they seem to be well taken care of and they explained that they are atlantic bottlenosed dolphins used to being in that environment. The pool and hottub were nice, although we didn't spend much time there as the beach was beautiful. The water was warm and they had a nice floating deck that you could jump off of. They have beach side service and make the best lava pina coladas. We also loved the location since we didn't rent a car for the two days and were still able to do Diamond Head and Hanuama Bay - next time we'd probably rent a car - although parking is pretty pricey. This place is amazing - we will definitely try to be back - although it is expensive it is worth every cent.

We had a fabulous 4 nights here recently and it was not long enough! Stayed after arriving at a hotel in Waikiki and checked straight out as location was awful. The Kahala was a breath of fresh air - loved everything about it and would not hesitate to recommend it. The rooms are spotless, staff are friendly and everything is just so easy. Fantastic beach location too.

The Kahala is a lovely place to relax and enjoy Hawaii. The staff were efficient, helpful, and friendly. The rooms were beautiful and spacious with wonderful views of the ocean. Can't wait to go again!

While staying in Honolulu on business, I stayed at the Kahala Hotel on June 26, 2014. The absolute competence and kindness of the staff made the entire experience so much better. The three types of chocolate covered macadamia nuts were a real treat!

We chose this beautiful resort as we knew from maps and other posted on line reviews that we would be close enough to Waikiki but not in the middle of the City madness.
