The location for us could not have be more perfect. Waikiki is a beautiful City, however for us we wanted a more relaxed and quiet atmosphere which is exactly what we found at the Kahala Resort. The resort itself does not look like much from the outside, however once you enter the outrageously beautiful lobby you can't help to feel as though you are among royalty. The entire staff could not had been more welcoming and eager to please. In fact, after previously living in New Jersey and being poisoned by bad attitudes for 10 years, I couldn't help but to wonder why the check in desk attendant was so happy and smiling so broadly upon arrival. It did not take long to figure out that this is friendly highly personal treatment that one can expect from every employee at this resort.We found the actual room and bathroom to be comfortable and spacious enough for our needs. The bathroom had 2 separate sinks and vanities (opposite sides of the room which was nice), along with our own closets. You will also find a nice soaking tub, separate tiled shower along with the toilet room. We did struggle a bit with our room selection at the time of reservation as we were not sure if we wanted to spend the extra money on partial ocean view, lanai, ocean front, etc as there were many room options to choose from. We ended up going with the partial ocean view (with diamond head views) and we did select the lanai. Once at the resort I re-visited the pricing structure and decided for the cost different of a partial ocean view versus ocean front was not worth the extra expense as we did not plan to spend much time in the actual room. The partial ocean view however is extremely partial, therefore if you want a decent ocean view, and don't mind spending the extra money, I would strongly suggest booking an ocean front room. We did however really enjoy and was glad we chose a room with a lanai as we used it as an additional sitting area when we were back in the room. We had a great time and would definitely return to this resort should our travels take us back to Oahu! Stayed June 2014, traveled as a couple 5 of 5 stars Value 5 of 5 stars Location 4 of 5 stars Sleep Quality 4 of 5 stars Rooms 4 of 5 stars Cleanliness 5 of 5 stars ServiceReview collected in partnership with this hotelAsk Michele D about The Kahala Hotel & ResortThis review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.The_Kahala_Hotel, Public Relations Manager at The Kahala Hotel & Resort, responded to this review, 2 days agoAloha Michele DThank you for taking the time to write such a thoughtful review. It is with complete joy to read your kind compliments about the staff and the exceptional services you experienced first hand.Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons the staff is so proud to be a part of The Kahala Hotel & Resort.We will be sure to share your compliments with everyone. We look forward to welcoming you back to the resort soon.Report response as inappropriateThis response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

My wife and I opened our honeymoon at this beautiful hotel. We arrived after a ten hour flight from Newark tired and hungry. Those feelings quickly disappeared when we opened the door to our room and were stunned by the beauty of the Pacific Ocean through our giant sliding glass doors leading to our balcony. This is truly a beautiful hotel with its own secluded.beach, a dolphin cove, well manicured lawns and a pool that felt like it was heated. Everything is absolutely first rate including their restaurants. The biggest seller in my opinion is the calmness of the resort as opposed to the hectic pace down by Waikiki beach. After spending an afternoon down there you just cannot wait to get back to The Kahala to unwind. No hustle or bustle; no tension just the pampering and relaxation you look for. This is the place to stay on the island.

The Kahala is a beautiful and peaceful paradise. I cant think of anything bad about it. Perhaps the smallish pool is the one thing that is lacking. Its just a simple oval. Yes its a fact - its expensive. Dont stay here if you are going to be counting every penny because this is not a place for budget travelers. There is an automatic tip added to everything. You need to understand that Honolulu is probably the favorite destination for Japanese tourists. There are many many many at this hotel and all over Honolulu. In Japan it is not customary to tip. Therefore, If part of your income is based on tips, and most of your customers dont tip its completely understandable that it is added automatically. We found the hotel shuttle very handy and used it exclusively as we did not rent a car. Granted, you may end up waiting for it at stops in town - sometimes it might be late due to traffic. And if you dont have a reservation you may not be able to get back on whenever you want. Do reserve your spot! We were not touring the rest of the island and preferred the minor inconvenience to the hassle and cost of a rental car. Buffet breakfast was included in our rate and we had breakfast there everyday. We found the selection extensive- there is everything you could possibly desire. In addition to the buffet, there was a made-to-order omelet station. In addition to breakfast, we also ate at the Veranda and Arancino during our stay. We enjoyed both meals. Arancino is called an Italian restaurant but it was sort of Italian with a twist. Very modern and inventive. The Veranda was also nice. We werent inspired by anything on the dessert menu so we kind of came up with one of our own and they were happy to put it together for us. Beautiful setting. Do request a table on the Veranda rather than inside.We stayed in two different rooms. We had reserved a partial ocean view, but it was on a low floor so we mostly had a view of the porte cochere. The next day we moved to a higher floor facing the mountain, but it also had a view of the ocean if you stepped out on the balcony. Both rooms were exactly the same. The room was extremely comfortable- good bed and good sheets. I loved the bathroom-kind of separated into 2 parts each with a separate closet and sink. I really like a 2 sink thing. Lots of bathroom amenities which were replenished every day.The grounds were lovely. The hotel has its own private beach. It feels like you are very isolated but Waikiki is just a short ride away. It was so peaceful that we stayed on property alot. The pool as I mentioned is just a simple oval as you see in all the photos. My husband could have spent hours watching the dolphins. I disagree with the review that said the dolphins are confined to a coi pond. They actually have a large lagoon and if they are feeling antisocial parts of it an inaccessible to guests. I think they like the people though because most of the time they are over there with all the people. They have trainers and handlers on site all the time and these dolphins are not in any way mistreated. The big lobby area is much more impressive in person than in the photos. Its really beautiful. Very high ceiling with interesting chandelier and sort of "island" decor.We had a his/her pedicure in the spa. If you can get your husband to do this with you I recommend it. I had to twist his arm a bit but he enjoyed it.The area where the Kahala is located is in a very ritzy area. You pass lots of mansions on the drive into the hotel. There were several that were quite run down which we felt was really strange, but found out that a billionaire named Kawamoto had bought all these mansions and neglected or tore them apart and just left them. When we were there they had recently been sold to a real estate company. If you see any run-down properties on Kahala Avenue they were probably his. This doesnt have anything to do with the hotel, I just found it interesting.We had a most enjoyable stay and I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone who is not on a tight budget. I would love to stay here again.

They greet you at the door with delicate leis for the ladies and solid leis for the men and have a relaxing slack key guitar soundtrack playing when you arrive to the room. Everything in the room screams plush and no matter which room you're in it feels as though you get to see the best of Honolulu whether it is the beach or a look at the mountains. The grounds are easy to walk through and navigate but still maintains a feeling as though you are away from the crazy tourist environment that is Waikiki. The beach is semi-private and the hotel offers many amenities for the beach area itself. The grounds also has a dolphin lagoon and small sea creature lagoon also for those who are traveling with families. Downsides would be the high price- but with this place you get what you pay for. The restaurants on site do charge an arm and a leg but friends who have been here rave about the unique cuisine they have here. I would definitely come again! But maybe after saving up for a while.

Last week I returned from a fantastic week at The Kahala. I stayed there once before, for one night about thirteen or fourteen years ago, but I was so busy on that trip (and it was such a brief one) that I honestly don’t remember very much about the experience, except that I had absolutely no complaints. It’s almost as if this was my first stay at the hotel.I cannot say enough great things about The Kahala. I have been familiar with the resort my entire life, as it’s where my parents spent their honeymoon in May, 1970. It was The Kahala Hilton back then.It was such a pleasure to vacation at The Kahala this month. I stayed in room 724 in the Diamond Head wing, and I could not have been happier with the accommodations. I noticed that some TripAdvisor reviewers have complained about the beds. I had a great night’s sleep every night, so no problem there, and those individuals will be pleased to know that the mattresses have been replaced! The one in my room was replaced (swiftly and discreetly) on my second-last day, so I had the pleasure of trying it out for only one night. Honestly, I didn’t notice a difference (same good night’s sleep), but hopefully those who are sensitive to such things will be pleased. Also, it’s nice to know that the hotel continues to invest in upgrades.A good description for The Kahala is “quiet, understated luxury”. Consider some of the fantasyland resorts on Maui. Yes, they’re impressive to look at, what with the huge open spaces, dramatic architecture, and fountains and waterfalls everywhere, but quite often less is more. While there’s nothing wrong with those places, they’re usually very large (sometimes too large for their own good), and they’re most often situated right alongside one another. One of the special things about The Kahala is that no matter where on the property you happen to be, you don’t see huge neighbouring resorts. In fact, you don’t see resorts of any kind - just beach, mountains, golf courses, and quiet residential neighbourhoods. This means a lot especially when it comes to the view from one’s room. The location really is ideal. I’ve read some reviews that claim the hotel is isolated. One reviewer stated that “there’s nothing else within walking distance”. First of all, people should determine what is or is not in close proximity to the hotel *before* they leave home. Do your research! Also, it is not isolated. It is located in a beautiful residential area, and the hotel provides complimentary shuttle service to the nearby local shopping center (The Kahala Mall), to Waikiki, and to the enormous Ala Moana Shopping Center. Even if, for the sake of argument, we’re going to say that the property is isolated, well - that’s a huge part of the appeal for me, and probably most guests. Complaining about how little is within walking distance is like staying in the center of Waikiki and complaining that it’s not quiet and tranquil enough. The staff is fantastic. Several individuals stand out. Brian (or Bryan?) who escorted me up to my room with my bags when I arrived. Shayne (or Shane?) at the Seaside Grill, who went out of his way to sort out a great table for me when the place was essentially full. Heidi, who did a wonderful job of looking after my room every day. It was a pleasure to see her in the corridor each morning. Those three deserve special recognition, but all of the staff were superb. Also, Wakako Sasaki, Sherrilyn Uganiza, and Ellen Maki of the Reservations and Guest Services departments were extremely helpful when I dealt with them by e-mail prior to my arrival.I didn’t dine at Hoku’s or Arancino, and unfortunately I had to cancel my reservation for Afternoon Tea at The Veranda, but I was always pleased with my meals at the Seaside Grill and Plumeria Beach House. I enjoyed some delicious meals from Room Service, too.The Kahala is the perfect place to visit on Oahu. You truly do have the best of both worlds: tranquility and serenity at your home base, with the island’s many attractions and plentiful dining and shopping options just minutes away.A very big MAHALO to Carmine Iommazzo, Ryan Fitzgerald, and the entire team at The Kahala. I can hardly wait to return.Have a great summer!D. Walker

My husband and I had our Wedding dinner and out Honeymoon here and We LOVED our stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort! We live on the island of Oahu about an hour away and we still felt that we were away on a hawaiian vacation because of its remote location. Everything is so beautiful and relaxing. Huuge Bed Huuge room. Really cool AC. We couldn't leave! we had to extend our stay...another two days! The food at the Plumeria Beach House was superb, perfect for a wedding! And BRITTANY MATSUSHITA is such a professional coordinator. She and her staff were so accommodating, helpful and polite. I didn't worry about a thing! I was in good hands! So thankful for her!  needed advil and some hygienic supplies at 1 o clock in the morning, and the sundries store had closed at 7 o clock. They sent down a security guard and a clerk to take care of our transaction! What service! Many famous people and people of great influence have stayed at the Kahala (Princess Diana, the Clintons, Steve Martin) and i can see why. Its amazing. I felt that i was being treated as they would have been treated.AND House keeping was amazing! They would even fold our clothes that we left out! WE changed rooms and forgot our shampoo and conditioner and they made sure it was returned to us! The staff was so polite and professional. WE will defiantly be returning!! LOVED our stay! We miss it every night!

We chose this beautiful resort as we knew from maps and other posted on line reviews that we would be close enough to Waikiki but not in the middle of the City madness. The location for us could not have be more perfect. Waikiki is a beautiful City, however for us we wanted a more relaxed and quiet atmosphere which is exactly what we found at the Kahala Resort. The resort itself does not look like much from the outside, however once you enter the outrageously beautiful lobby you can't help to feel as though you are among royalty. The entire staff could not had been more welcoming and eager to please. In fact, after previously living in New Jersey and being poisoned by bad attitudes for 10 years, I couldn't help but to wonder why the check in desk attendant was so happy and smiling so broadly upon arrival. It did not take long to figure out that this is friendly highly personal treatment that one can expect from every employee at this resort. We found the actual room and bathroom to be comfortable and spacious enough for our needs. The bathroom had 2 separate sinks and vanities (opposite sides of the room which was nice), along with our own closets. You will also find a nice soaking tub, separate tiled shower along with the toilet room. We did struggle a bit with our room selection at the time of reservation as we were not sure if we wanted to spend the extra money on partial ocean view, lanai, ocean front, etc as there were many room options to choose from. We ended up going with the partial ocean view (with diamond head views) and we did select the lanai. Once at the resort I re-visited the pricing structure and decided for the cost different of a partial ocean view versus ocean front was not worth the extra expense as we did not plan to spend much time in the actual room. The partial ocean view however is extremely partial, therefore if you want a decent ocean view, and don't mind spending the extra money, I would strongly suggest booking an ocean front room. We did however really enjoy and was glad we chose a room with a lanai as we used it as an additional sitting area when we were back in the room. We had a great time and would definitely return to this resort should our travels take us back to Oahu!

My family had a great 6 night stay at the Kahala. We stayed at the Kahala 10 years ago, and a lot had changed since we were last there. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are all very nice and attentive. I particularly loved the various fruity waters that were served every day in the lobby.We had two rooms: one facing the ocean and one facing the mountains. Both were incredibly spacious. My room (mountain facing) had two large beds and a huge bathroom with two sinks which was very nice! The beds were comfortable, and we got two waters and two delicious chocolates every night before bed.Our package came with complimentary breakfast every morning. The buffet at Plumeria was one of the best buffets I have ever had! They had essentially any food you could think of! The waiters were all very nice, too.The beach was beautiful and usually quiet. However, because all beaches in Hawaii are public, there were a few days when VERY noisy teenagers came and disturbed the peace at the beach. It was very distracting, but I understand that the hotel could do little about it.The poolside bar and grille was certainly convenient, but, of course, overpriced. I had a delicious peach and mango smoothie once and a Caesar salad, but that was it. Service was good and it was great to be served on the beach. The only other hotel restaurant we tried was Plumeria Beach House for dinner, and that was good too.I used the fitness room nearly every day during our stay. It was wonderfully located to face the ocean, and I was usually one of two or three people there. It had all the equipment one would need, the only annoying thing was that the wifi didn't work there (I'm not sure why). The wifi usually worked in other parts of the hotel, but it was frustrating to have to keep reconnecting every time we wanted to use the wifi.Overall, the Kahala is a great, great, great hotel! I will be back!

This is the pace to stay. From the outside you cannot tell how beautifulthe place really is. The lobby is lovely leading to gorgeous outdoor views of the ocean. It does not have the hectic crowded feel of Waikiki hotels. It is more subdued and classier. The rooms are elegant and similar to a Ritz Carlton quality. The Dolphin Quest is here and it is a must also.

We are in our 70 s and have traveled widely and often. The Kahala is the very best place that we have ever stayed. The service and staff were unequaled in helpfulness and appropriate courtesy and friendliness. The Kahala itself is a absolutely beautiful, elegant but nosy gaudy. The room accommodations were superb. The beach and pool facilities were terrific and the restaurant selection good all with beautiful views of the ocean. It is in a secluded setting but in close proximity to many activities. It is a real treat and great value. We did find Hokusai restaurant, a 5 star restaurant, to be overrated and would not return. The Italian restaurant and the Plumeria were infinitely better in terms of service and meals. Joan and Ray Arnold

We didn't expect to stay at the Kahala but when the resort we were suppose to stay at was so terrible my husband picked up the phone to find out if we could get a room for the next 2 nights. Lucky for us they had 1 room left! The resort is pure luxury, the lobby, grounds and rooms are gorgeous. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. The restaurants have great food, in fact we prepaid for breakfast while we were there and it was the best breakfast buffet I have ever had. Worth every penny! Our room for being the standard mountain view room was lovely, the bed was comfy and the view was actually great. The only thing I didn't like about the room was that the tub/shower is a little hard to step into and out of if you are short. The beach at the resort is very nice and quiet. The waves break far out so not really a boogie boarding, play in the waves type of beach, more of just a beach for relaxing. The shuttle service into Waikiki is quick and a nice way to go into town if you don't feel like dealig with the traffic. The dolphins are fun to watch also! I am so glad we ended up at the Kahala

If you complain about this Hotel,the Help,Room or Food,You shouldn't leave your house. Except for not being able to walk anywhere,(they have a free shuttle) its great.If the world acted like the help,it would be a better world we live in. The Hotel was like one big happy family.

We had the opportunity to steal away to the Kahala Hotel and Resort for just one night and it was AMAZING. This place gave the last Ritz Carlton I was at a run for their money.Rooms are spacious and even the view of the mountains is lovely. The reason you stay here isn't for the room though, it's to let them take care of you. How you ask? Well stroll on down to the pool or better yet the beach and they don't just hand you towels. They set up your chairs or cabana for you, placing their special lounge chair fitted towel down, handing you additional towels and then asking if you need anything else....I bet a server might swim to the little floating dock in the ocean to bring you a drink if you asked.That was the theme for the day and a half we were there. Whatever we needed, a staff member is only too happy to oblige.Couple tips for people that haven't been here: a) you probably know but check out the dolphins on prem b) the gym is super nice and they offer TRX classes on this little structure out in front facing the ocean (additional cost but would be awesome) c) if you are staying to hang out after check out, you can use their complimentary concierge room to shower up (it's the same place as the business center and it's staffed d) while you have a coffee maker in your room, they serve coffee/tea free of charge in the mornings on the ground floor e) if you can get breakfast included in your room, it's worth it.

We stayed in a room that overlooked the dolphin lagoon for 2 nights prior to joinning a cruise at the end of May 2014. The room was beautiful, spacious and elegant and the outlook to the dolphin lagoon and beyong to the ocean was heavenly. We were able to sit on the lanai and watch the dolphins at play for hours. The service at the Kahala is truly wonderful and the staff did everything they could to make our stay memorable. Although the Kahala is a bit of a distance from the action of Waikiki the beach was so much nicer and it was good to get away from the rat race. It was well worth spending a bit extra to stay in paradise and we will return to the Kahala when we next visit Hawaii, hopefully for longer next time.

Beautiful room, great location, and the staff, in every single department, was the best of the best! They have thought of every little detail, and it is beautifully reflected in the way guests are treated and cared for. We will certainly visit The Kahala again and we highly recommend it if you want a really really great Oahu experience!

We enjoyed our stay at the Kahala, and loved the dolphin pool, and the old world charm. The views were amazing from every aspect, and the beach was stunning. The pool is impossible to sit at, because the wind is so strong! So choose the beach!Staff were a bit slow, and seemed to be too busy with all the weddings that were happening all day long. In fact I believe the hotel is understaffed in many of the bars and restaurants, though everyone was obliging and tried their best.I am happy I stayed at the Kahala, but, prefer other hotels that are more modern, and better value.

Such a lovely grand old hotel. So much history and character. Rooms are very well kept and lobby is lovely. The reception area and the pool could do with some sprucing up but everything else makes up for it. Dolphins on the grounds add to the whole experience. Love it.

The staff was extremely attentive to us. They made wonderful suggestions about whatever we asked about and we felt so comfortable and pampered. We have never had such a relaxing vacation as we had at the kahala. The breakfast each morning was scrumptious and the variety and presentation of the food was beautiful.

This place is beautiful! Very Hollywood glamour of mad men! I love sitting at the seaside grill enjoying a cocktail with a wonderful staff and watching my kids in the ocean. The rooms are clean, roomy, and I love the style. So many places throughout the hotel to enjoy a drink or tea while reading or admiring the view. My kids loved the stingray lagoon and the Kahala Keiki Club. I don't play golf, but the course looks amazing. Has become one of my favorite spots!

I stayed here for 7 nights last summer whilst on honeymoon. Firstly it is in a great location, just outside the city but lose enough to drive to. The hotel doesn't strike you as beautiful as you drive up but the inside is very different. Beautiful lobby & veranda. We stayed in a balcony room with full sea view, it also overlooked the dolphins which was great. The rooms were of an average size, good sized bed & very comfy. The bathroom was well equipped with a great shower. But I don't personally like to have the wardrobes in the bathroom. Room service was great with a good selection. The beach is beautiful, however the cabanas are too small (my husband is 6ft 2in) and he struggled to get comfy on them. The pool is pretty disappointing in terms of size, and has very few sun beds. The restaurants were very varied, and the food was good - however after reading the reviews on here I was expecting the food to b more memorable but sadly I can't say it was. The staff were excellent, very friendly and always smiling.

We stumbled across this resort while out driving early one morning...the road came to an end and we were greeted by a security guard asking where we were headed. When we told him we were looking for somewhere to have breakfast he pointed us towards the carpark explaining that if we had breakfast at The Kahala the parking was free. What a wonderful experience! We had a beautiful breakfast, we sat outside appreciating the quiet, the view of the beach, and the great service. After breakfast we wandered around the resort, all very tranquil and very private. We came across the dolphin pool where the Marine Biologists were very welcoming and explained the research they were doing. We will certainly return on our next visit to Hawaii.

Full disclosure...I've been visiting this hotel since I was a child. When my father would visit Oahu on business decades ago we would always stop by the Kahala to meet his clients and friends. As a regular visitor to Hawaii I never miss the chance to stop by for drinks or a meal. This time we were lucky enough to spend 6 glorious nights at this fabulous hotel. From the moment we arrived we felt welcome. The staff is trained, professional, helpful and truly wants to make your experience magical. We were greeted warmly by the valets, the front desk staff and our luggage arrived to our room within moments. This beautiful mid century modern hotel is located outside of Waikiki beach, but a mere short drive or shuttle bus away. We had rented a car and it took us about 10 minutes to drive alongside of diamond head into town. If you are looking for a gracious, authentic experience, this is your hotel. Will you pay more for the beautiful private beach and exemplary staff...yes...will you pay a bit more for the cleanest and most lovely rooms, some with a private oversized lanai...yes....is the fabulous Hoku's restaurant worth the high price tag...absolutely! We have stayed at all of the major 4-5 star hotels on the island at some point...nothing compares to the Kahala. When there was a slight discrepancy on our bill it was addressed by the staff in a quick and efficient manner. The live music in the lounge is fabulous and only adds to your enjoyment of the beautiful grounds. The Dolphin Lagoon (not where we stayed) is fabulous is you have children or like the idea of watching the dolphins swim by your room. We chose a beautiful partial ocean view with a lanai and loved it. While you don't see the ocean from your room, you can sit on the balcony and catch a glimpse. The view was stunning so don't let that put you off if you "always" have an ocean view. We liked being on the 6th floor, it was quiet and the view of the lush golf course below was spectacular. We wouldn't change a thing, and will be back again very soon.

We have been visiting the Kahala Resort for over thirty years and have always had a fantastic stay. The hotel being 20 minutes drive away from busy Waikiki makes for a more relaxing vacation . The hotel is set on a private beach with the more expensive rooms overlooking the sea,we always book the mountain view rooms which are more economical and overlook the golf course to the hills. There are really no standard rooms as all rooms have spacious bathrooms and the rooms are as large as junior suites in other resorts ,half with large balconies.You are not isolated at the Kahala even if you do not have a rental car as a complimentary shuttle takes you to the local mall,Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana the worlds largest outdoor mall.Breakfast on the beach is a highlight at the restaurant which it is advisable to get included in a package rate.

For the closest you can get to a perfectly wonderful, restful and satisfying luxury hotel experience on O'ahu, your top choice should be The Kahala Hotel. It's every bit as high-end and gracious as the Halekulani, but without subjecting guests to the frenetic Waikiki environment. The Kahala's food venues are wonderful (usually there will be as many local residents as visitors enjoying the tasty fare). The rooms are spacious, airy, and beautifully appointed. The staff are well trained and know how to behave professionally, but without the obsequious or overly-informal attitudes you might encounter elsewhere. "Aloha" is more than just a word at this lovely resort hotel. Highly recommended!

We just returned from another stay at the Kahala.Perhaps the biggest indicator of the hotel is the fact that we keep coming back. At this point, we have lost count of how many times we have been - close to 10. And I will definitely be back again.Room:We booked the Ocean Front Suite on an advance booking deal. We had stayed in this room category before and had forgotten just how panoramic the views are. They are spectacular. We were on the 8th floor and spent many hours on our balcony enjoying the view.Food:We tried the new Italian restaurant (Arrancino?) and found it to be good but perhaps not great. We also enjoyed the food at the Veranda (the Ahi Musubi and Short Ribs are a must try!). Far and away, our favorite is the breakfast buffet. You must try the thin pancakes, the Kahalasadas (by the omelet station) and the sticky buns!Given that this is my fourth review of the hotel, I won't re-hash but will say that we still love the hotel. Close to the action of Waikiki if you want it, but also quiet. The perfect combination.I did notice that they have changed their suite packages a bit in terms of what was included. Just make sure you know what is and is not included (the partial ocean view suites used to come with complimentary cabana use and evening cocktails/pupus, but now does not appear to).The only small negatives I can point to are two: first, hubby found the bed to be too firm. Second, the wifi was extremely frustrating. It would work, but you had to re-click the terms of service agreement far too often.We will definitely be back and highly recommend it.

Absolutely fantastic experience. It is fairly expensive, but you really get what you pay for. Definitely recommended as a hotel, and then the location (away from Waikiki) is also recommended. The breakfast buffet, included with the room with our package, was excellent as well!

It was expensive for the room but everything else represented better value for money than Waikiki. The rooms were pure luxury, the lobby sensational and the restaurants were excellent. Staff made you feel welcome.

There was huge expectation with this resort, famous in everyway.Loved the fact it seemed quieter, less chaotic and more secluded than other resorts on the Island.Service was generally good, the only time we had an issue was around ants in our bathroom. Not much was done about it, and they were all over the floor both days.Decor is amazing, but was in its heyday in the 80s, still worth a visit. Bed seemed like it was original from the 60s!The guys at the bar are fantastic, combined they have worked at the resort for over 80 years, their knowledge and friendliness was outstanding, really enjoyed talking to them - thank you!From a gluten free perspective it was easy, gluten free bread, soy sauce all available and a good understanding from the staff.Would I go back - probably, but would have liked more done about the ants.

As the gentleman who drove us from the airport* said, "There are a hundred great hotels on the east side of Diamond Head, but only one on the west side."Anyway, we had splurged on a reserve-way-early-and-pay-in-full offer to get a Presidential Suite, but upon arrival we were upgraded to the Imperial Suite. That's a once-in-a-lifetime experience (unless you happen to be William and Kate, who had been there several weeks prior). So, our "room" is so far out of the ordinary that the only purpose to include it in this review is to share some photos.More realistically, and thinking of the entire hotel for we common folk: it is a jewel in an upper class neighborhood (think Beverly Hills Hotel with a beach), so there's no Waikiki hubbub. The staff is warm and professional. Shuttle busses can take you to nearby shopping or "name" restaurants in other parts of Honolulu if you choose to leave the property, so unless you plan to do some touring, you're actually better off not renting a car at the airport - and paying the extra airport fees and overnight fees at the hotel. You can rent a car at the hotel (cheaper and easier).There are three restaurants on property: the Plumeria Beach House (indoor/outdoor seating, breakfast buffet), Arancino (indoor/outdoor seating, three or four course menu (no a la carte), and Hoku (indoor, dinner). We found Koku to be our fave, and ate there twice; ask for Bob if he's working on your night there, and he and Tony will guide you the best locally caught items of the day. We found Arancino to be a little overpriced and, strangely, misplaced; it's right on the portiere, so if you are dining outside you may have shuttle busses belching natural gas fumes a few feet from your table (we asked them to turn off the engine, and they promptly did - but why set up a situation like that in the first place?).Bottom line: if you have been to Oahu before and don't need to drive around this time, you may just spend your entire vacation on the property.*Driver to and from the airport? Yep! The last time that I tried to find the car rental return at 6:00 am I ended up in the military base two times. Honolulu traffic and driving IS worse than here in Los Angeles!

The Kahala is located out of the downtown area on a beautiful property, which is very nice and secluded. Other than that, the rooms are out-dated and the service quality is low. Stay elsewhere and get better value for your cost!

This Hotel is amazingly large but quiet.The rooms are exceptional large and comfortable.The service is great and it is recommended to keep small $ notes handy.The restaurants are pricy but the food is great.

I use Tripadvisor a lot but rarely write reviews. The Kahala Resort is exceptional in every regard. The scenery is beautiful and picturesque. The service was friendly and attentive but not overbearing. Our room was just lovely with luxurious furnishings and awesome views. What are you waiting for? Just go!

It has to be the best place to stay in Honolulu. The staff is great, the rooms felt like home, and it is so peaceful, and relaxing. They have a shuttle that will take you around free of charge to Waikiki. We will be staying here again.

From the moment we stepped foot on the Kahala grounds, they treated us like royalty. My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon following a 7 day cruise. Everything was exceptional at the resort, and exceeded all expectations.My wife and I have traveled very frequently growing up since both of our Mothers are travel agents. While this was our first time to Hawaii, I must say that the Kahala is likely the best resort we have ever stayed at.While everything at the resort was absolutely perfect, the thing we enjoyed most was the service. Every employee at the Kahala is extremely welcoming and they truly treat you like royalty. We were happy we chose this beautiful resort as the final stop of our two week Honeymoon.

Unforgettable experience shared with my daughters, priceless. Breath taking views. Our room was very comfortable, spacious, no dust , clean . 20 mins. away from Honolulu Airport. Amenities: You never need to leave the Hotel & Resort.

We have been to the Kahala many times and enjoy it more each time. It is nice, peaceful, relaxing and quiet. We like to be out of the hustle/ bustle of Waikiki so it is perfect for us. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiul, large and comfortable. We plan on another trip next year!

Things we did and loved.... Swim with the Dolphins wonderful for the whole family! Breakfast Buffet every day excellent! Massage with 2 massage therapist "Star" was fabulous yet the whole thing was great both therapist were together with pressure and timing it was sooooo awesome! Room was upgraded to an over the dolphin lagoon. I think we had the best room there very pretty and could watch the dolphins every day! Wanted to try surfing they arranged it all and were so helpful with any questions, needed directions to another activity and they were on it with maps. Valet was nice didn't have any problems with getting my car whenever I needed it. Hotel is beautiful. Pool is warm. Beach quiet. Very clean grounds need more garbages yet didn't see any garbage laying around. I just had to walk to throw away lol. If you stay here it is away from Waikiki which is so nice. Make sure to take the 30 minute scenic drive away from Honolulu from The Kahala it is beautiful! Would definitely stay here again would not stay downtown Honolulu. Hope this helps

Wow! What a nice surprise this stay was! We moved from another hotel on waikiki because we were so disappointed. This hotel was a complete 180 from the others on "the strip". We were greeted with genuine smiles, beautiful bead leis and warm hospitality. Built back in 1964, this hotel has a beautiful old modernism to it that fits in with today's newer, sleeker designs. Inside it is filled with warm tropical decor, wooden accents, beautiful floral arrangements, cozy furniture and lots of natural sunlight. The staff was lovely from the housekeepers to the front desk to the pool servers. We loved our room. It was a standard with an upgraded lanai and view of the golf course. I typically would prefer an ocean view but was happy with the peaceful greens out our windows. The room was large and decorated in neutrals and light blues with a large bathroom - two vanities, soaking tub and shower. The robes were soft and the toiletries smelled awesome. The bed was the worst part - saggy and worn with no firmness. We were going to dine at the Plumeria house for their seafood buffet. Upon inspection, we were underwhelmed by the set up and selection and felt it was just a few notches up from a Hometown Buffet. We decided to eat at Hoku's instead which is their fine dining restaurant. The entree prices average around $55. With this being said, we expected a very high level of service and attentiveness. Instead we had typical "island time" service meaning dirty plates stayed on the table too long and water glasses went empty. We ordered the small seafood tower and a salad which was perfect for two people. It was good but not great and we felt overcharged for a very expensive dinner that offered a so-so experience. On the other hand, the food and drinks and service at the pool grill was great. We enjoyed the edamame, cheeseburger and complimentary watermelon. Without a doubt, I'd recommend the Kahala. I was afraid we might feel too distant from the action of waikiki but it was a nice escape from the crowded streets and touristy hotels. I loved the feel of this property - very Klassy and Klean!! I'll be back!

We've stayed at many 5-star hotel in our travels and I have to say this hotel ranks near the top. The room, with a gorgeous view of the mountains and golf course was nice and spacious and well appointed. It was also nice and quiet. A nice touch was when, shortly after arriving to our room, housekeeping brought 2 large cookies for my daughter stating "Aloha" on one and "Ally" on the other. The staff we encountered were all polite and accommodating, we felt welcomed. The grounds are well maintained and the private beach was great. Every picture we snapped looked like a postcard. Turndown service was very nice with slippers laid out, water by our bed, and chocolates on our bed. The only area that we found inconsistent was the bell staff. We had our own car and frequently left the hotel for various reasons. The staff, especially early in the morning, were at times, rude. One time, we asked for our car and when we went to get it we were handed the keys and pointed in the direction of our car! What happened to the 5-star service of bringing up the car and holding the doors open for the ladies? Another time we asked for some water (which they usually provide when leaving) and were told they didn't have any, "they didn't receive their delivery"! This is not an excuse I would expect from the Kahala. We would definitely return to the Kahala. I would hope that the bell staff would improve however.

Stayed 4 days. Wife loved it. I'm not a beach guy but my significant other said the sand and the overall quality of the beach were fantastic. Apparently sand is important! It's not so very fine that it will stick to wet skin and not so coarse that it hurts when you walk on it. We did the buffet breakfast every morning. If you can include it in your hotel rate, do so. We also tried the fusion asian restaurant, but didn't like it - nothing was wrong with the food... we just didn't feel it. Overall, a very excellent experience.

The pool alone is a reason to return. It was remarkably warm as compared to other hotels and resorts. I didn't want to get out. There was no acclimated to the water like there is at other resorts. We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani, which is a great resort, the month before, and the pools were like ice chests.
user_name:
Joe S
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: A dream come true! The Kahala is a special resort with huge clean rooms, spectacular views, excellent restaurants, and awesome staff. Make sure you swim with the dolphins! It is an experience not to be missed.
user_name:
Debbie G
Bay Shore, New York

review_body: We came back again this year after having a wonderful stay in April 2013. There were a few little things that I noticed that could use improving, and for the most part, those issues had been addressed.The food offerings at the pool seemed improved in both taste and options. There were a few more healthy options to choose from, which is appreciated. The staff was very attentive - we received a "good morning" or an "aloha" from nearly every staff member that we encountered, even in passing. It was my parents 45th anniversary (primary reason for the trip), and I had called ahead to let the hotel know. They had champagne waiting, wished them happy anniversary, welcome back, etc. Between my parents and I, we ordered room service several times, and it was excellent food and received in a reasonable amount of time. My dad got bitten or stung by something, and when my mom called to ask the front desk if they had some Benedryl or Cortaid, there was a security/EMT guy at the door practically as soon as she hung up the phone ready with remedy. If you pay the "rack rate" here, yes it is expensive. However, they offer packages regularly, most of which include a breakfast for two, 4th night free, etc., which brings down the cost. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and so extensive, it pretty much eliminated the need for lunch for me, anyhow. We never encountered any issues with sitting right down to eat. We ate at Hoku's the last night, and the service and food were both excellent. The only time we were a bit flummoxed as to what to do for food was Sunday night, when the Plumeria is a buffet dinner. It is expensive and I'm not an all you can eat type person, so it wasn't worth the money, although it all looked very tasty. We will come back any chance we get. For those that complain, please do go stay in Waikiki and leave this oasis to those of us who love it!

Our stay at The Kahala was perfect. We felt so pampered. Our room overlooked the Dolphin Lagoon and it was wonderful to wake up each morning and sit on the patio watching the dolphins. We were only there four nights and it went by way too fast. The Kahala spoiled other resorts for us as we compared everywhere to The Kahala and nothing comes even close to matching the experience we had there.

Had a room with the dolphin lagoon view, very pretty. The beach was private and calm and the property is beautiful. It is away from Honolulu so you will need a cab or use their transportation. service is excellent.

We stayed here for just one night. I can't imagine why anyone would want to pay $700 a night for a room here. The hotel itself is nice but unremarkable. The service was terrible. Room service took two hours. No choice but to use valet service for parking, so it costs $25 to park. After the valet takes your vehicle, you're a captive audience as there's nothing else within walking distance. All restaurants required reservations and all were full. Everything costs extra, and it is assumed that since you're staying there you can afford their fees. We were surprised to find a number of "fees" billed to our credit card. When we asked their accounting department what the fees were for, they couldn't tell us. And, they did not return further emails. The dolphin pond is made for koi, not for dolphins. The dolphins slap their tails all night long, just to have something to do. I was appalled by their lack of space. I am a PETA member and will be making PETA aware of their plight. They are being exploited so guests can experience petting them. There are so many other beautiful hotels in Honolulu, why stay here?

We celebrated my husband's 60th birthday here and had a lovely visit - the staff was uniformly excellent, the hotel was beautiful, it was an elegant and relaxing trip. I particularly apprecated multiple references to my husband's birthday - it made him feel special.

More spectacular experience than expected. Everytime have Awesome event with hotel person, fishs, amazing two turtles and special 6 Dophine. Very quick and excelent room services. Especially it is possible to use most convient valet parking service all the day.

First time at the hotel, the staff were very friendly, the two main restaurants excellent, the bus to and from the shopping centers a great service. The concierge arrange all restaurant bookings in and out of the hotel and we received preferential service due to that booking. Tour arrangements included pick up and return to hotel with knowledgeable guides. Great holiday and we will return.

Having visited this resort for over 30 years, we were thrilled with our 7 day stay, and have returned home feeling totally relaxed and happy. All staff everywhere were polite, friendly and helpful at all times. The food was extra delicious that we often felt like eating in and not leaving too often. The Kahala is a little paradise which we know we will visit again soon.

The Kahala Hotel—situated between Diamond Head and Koko Head—is a beautiful resort with excellent 5-star service. The entire staff—from the bell desk, to the check-in desk, housekeeping—works to ensure guests have a pleasant stay. They staff during my stay was unfailingly helpful and informative. The facility itself is as beautiful as the setting. Rooms are generously sized with refined décor. The bathrooms are well lit with plenty of towels. Everything is spotless and in good repair. The breakfast buffets are excellent and a good value. Lunches and dinners at the hotel restaurants are excellent, if expensive—but not out of line for a hotel in Hawaii. About half the rooms come with balconies and about half face the ocean (full or partial views). I was in room 219 and all the rooms on that side and in that wing of the hotel have an ocean view, but the ocean is partially obscured by the parking garage and the entry driveway. If you like to sleep with the windows open to enjoy the breeze, the noise around the front of the hotel makes that difficult. However, with the windows closed, almost no noise is heard. The website provides a useful schematic of the hotel room features and prices. Two charges to be aware of are that overnight parking is $28/night and that the hotel adds $3/night housekeeping gratuity to the bill. These charges are listed on the website, but are easy to miss. On the hotel grounds, Dolphin Quest runs a number of different programs for hotel guests and others to interact with the 6 dolphins in the hotel’s lagoons. It’s a once in a lifetime experience worth every penny. The keepers/trainers are enthusiastic about their careers with marine life and clearly love sharing what they know and love about the dolphins.

My husband and I stayed at this resort during the Easter 2014 weekend. My sister was getting married here on Easter Sunday. From the moment we arrived to the resort to check out, we received excellent service. I love how it is away from the hustle of Waikiki and truly feels like someplace to escape and relax. We were lucky enough to see Bruno Mars at the resort as a guest! We stayed in a scenic room. We thought it was pretty spacious and larger than many suites we stayed in at other hotels. We loved the chocolates that was left for us at turndown service. We plan to stay here again if we ever need nice getaway.

Came to Hawaii for our daughter's wedding from Australia. The Kahala is a beautiful resort. We were extremely satisfied with the room, service and food. The staff were helpful and courteous. Had an opportunity to swim with the dolphins in the dolphin pool. Highly recommend. Even and courtesy shuttle to Waikiki. Fantastic stay.

We just returned from our 7 night stay at the Kahala and enjoyed every aspect! The beds are more comfortable than we imagined, the staff is genuinely friendly and helpful, the beach is spectacular, the pool warm and the property secluded yet only 10 min. from the action of Waikiki beach. Our two children - 12 and 15 - want to bring their children to the Kahala someday. Now, that's an endorsement!

This is our second visit to Oahu and we would not consider staying anywhere else for our return visit. The Kahala gives one a sense of luxury and elegance but at the same time makes one feel overwhelmingly welcome and all members of the staff make their guests feel relaxed and personally attended to. This is a beautiful resort located in an exclusive part of Oahu that rests between Koko head and Diamond head craters. It rests atop a gorgeous stretch of beach. Depending on your room selection , you may have views of the ocean, mountains, lagoons or golf course. This is an excellent choice for ones visit to the island One visit will always becken your return to The Kahala

I have been coming here on and off since 1973. This IS my favorite place to stay on Oahu as you get a quiet peaceful vacation but you can still experience the insanity of Waikiki in only 10 minutes away.We spent 6 nights here over Valentines Day/Presidents Day weekend with our 17 year old son to check out University of Hawaii Manoa and Hawaii Pacific University as he had been accepted to both. We booked golf/mountain view rooms with no balcony as were were not planning on spending too much time in our rooms this trip. The rooms here are really beginning to show their age and could use a renovation in the near future. Our room #816 had the added plus of being a corner room with an added window over the bed with views of the ocean and koko head. You could also see Diamond head. The tradeoff is a smaller bathroom with only 1 vanity and 1 small closet and combo tub/shower. I have stayed in this room before and unfortunately it still has loud plumbing noises 24/7 as well as the old doorwall window which rattles in the wind. The mattress on our bed was so old we each fell into holes on our respective sides. I have never complained about a mattress before, but we did go down 2 the front desk after 2 nights and ask them to please change the mattress. We came up from the pool 4 hours later and the room had been made but it still was the old mattress. My husband found the maid on our floor and asked for a new mattress. She agree a new mattress was needed, made a call and one was delivered within 5 minutes. Our son was down the hall in 804 and while his view lacked diamond head, koko head and the ocean, he did have the larger Kahala bathroom with 2 closets, 2 vanities and seperate bath and shower. He said his room was very quiet. Breakfast was included in our room each morning. The buffet was good and was constantly being restocked. The wait was about 10 minutes to be seated each morning.Unfortunately it rained 90% of our stay. Unusual for this time of year. We only got 1 day plus an hour our last morning out on the beach. There was a large convention of insurance agents there (1st time we have ever experienced a convention here) and they took up a good portion of the beach. We were shocked to see them bringing 12 packs of beer out onto the beach. In the past all Hawaiian beaches have been alcohol free zones. If you wanted alcohol, you had to go to the bar to get it and then drink it discreetly. Hotel servers would only serve you alcohol on the grass. The pool attendants happily set us up with lounges further down the beach. The hotel servers served both food and alcohol on the beach this trip and said nothing about the outside alcohol which was a surprise. Service the last morning was awful. We stood in line over 20 minutes just to get towels as many people were having staff set up chairs and blow up beach toys. We elected to get our own beach chairs so others could be served quicker. There was only 2 staff in the hut, definitely not enough as everyone wanted to be outside that morning after all the rain.We had 1 lunch and 2 dinners at Plumeria Beach House restaurant including the Valentines night buffet (I usually HATE buffets, but this one as great!). The food was excellent, servers excellent and full of the aloha spirit. This is where this hotel excels. We had 1 dinner at the verandah. We wish there would have been a bit more on the menu, but the food and drinks were again excellent. We had dinner at Hoku's and as always the food was exceptional. Our son was congratulated for his acceptance to both universities upon being seated by both the hostess and our server. Our only complaint was that we had ordered a very nice bottle of vintage french wine. Large wineglasses were brought to the table and we were told the manager had to go downstairs to get it from the cellar. Our entrees arrived and still no wine. About half way through the entree we were told they couldn't find the wine and needed to reselect. Since we were almost done we just had another cocktail. A bummer, but we saved 600!The hotel has a new Italian restaurant out in the front by the valet that used to be a nice Japanese restaurant. Unfortunately it requires you to order an expensive pre fixe multi course menu unless you go after 9:30pm and then there is a very limited menu. We chose to skip it and instead drove into Waikiki for a great steak and bottle of wine at the venerable Hy's steakhouse which is always great and a must do.Will we be back. Most definitely yes as we love the location and staff. We were surprised that our son liked The Royal Hawaiian where we stayed in Feb 2013 because the Kahala was sold out better. Our other sons who did not come this trip have always liked The Kahala better. The rooms are large, we just would like to see them gutted and completely redone.

Just returned home after five luxurious days and nights at The Kahala. What an experience. Everything was top notch - accommodations, service, the restaurants, the beach...we are beyond thrilled with our stay and can't say enough nice things. The resort is magical and the staff is superior. Nothing goes unnoticed and they have every detail covered. We had such a lovely getaway.Location was great - private and away from the city / hustle bustle of Waikiki but still so close to everything. The beach was uncrowded and serene. Ate dinner at both Plumeria and Arancino, the four course dinner at Arancino was spectacular. Our room was very comfortable and I wanted to take our bed home with us - the best nights of sleep I've had in a very long time.

Just came back from spending a few nights at the Kahala and we absolutely loved it. We were a party of 6 made up of two children and two grandparents and it was perfect for all of us. It was small enough where my kids couldn't get lost and not too big that it was a great distance for my parents to travel. Loved that it was not in Waikiki and that my kids could either swim or watch the dolphins. The only problem with the hotel is that it was so beautiful and relaxing that nobody wanted to leave and go and explore the rest of the island. We are definitely planning on coming back, miss it already!
user_name:
candygirl32
New York City, New York

review_body: Since the early days as The Kahala Hilton, little has changed, as it still looks the same, is the same. The same friendly attentive staff (some have been there a very long time) ensuring a relaxed stay. The rooms are large and comfortable and the pool, dolphins and private beach area are a haven away from Waikiki. A short drive away and you are at Ala Moana or in the thick of Waikiki. Expect to pay extra for a beach cabana - but overall the Kahala has not lost any of its magical appeal. If you have never stayed here you have missed out on possibly the best hotel experience in Hawaii - even though there are newer and flashier hotel options on the other islands.

I hate staying at hotels, but this is not a hotel experience in my opinion. This is luxury, with a staff that seems to anticipate your needs, without being intrusive. The staff are friendly, professional, and helpful. Requests are tended to quickly and efficiently. The property is beautiful! The hotel exudes relaxed elegance. The food at the breakfast buffet is wonderful. I would recommend this resort without reservation and whole heartedly. Thank you to the Kahala staff for a wonderful stay!

Stayed at the Kahala for 3 nights/4 days. Would most definitely stay here again. Great service, clean updated spacious rooms, wonderful service, close to other things yet tucked away. Clean beach and nice pool area. Hated to leave.

We stayed in an ocean view room. It was a great size and the view was amazing. The service was good and the food in the restaurants was really good. Great setting and nice to be out of the bustle of Waikiki but still within ways distance. If only there for a short time and you're planning to shop probably better to stay somewhere central.

This hotel is beautiful. Upon check in, you get shown to the front desk by the valet and receive a warm towel for your hands. The room is beautiful and the bathroom is the best on this island. You have a deep soaking tub as well as a shower on the other end of the bathroom. Only complaint I can even foresee is the toilet is tight. You have to close the door before you sit down, but really not that big of a problem once you figure it out. Pool and beach services are great!

Kahala has a long story of quality and that shows in the small details. I've stayed with my family in a 2 bedroom ocean view suite and everything went smoothly. No surprises during the 8 days stay and i've experimented all the restaurants , spa, etc. Arancino (the Italian restaurant) it's a must with it's creative modern italian cuisine. Two small negatives but they are so easy to correct that it's a pity that the management doesn't takes care of it. Wifi it's dreadful (difficult to connect, always asking for the password, bad speeds and a number of other problems that i prefer to forget).... And as many other revisors of trip advisor keep saying - Pool staff is really needing a strong review - it's not only the fact that they only work if you tip them generously... it's their attitude, rudeness, unavailability to help and also the bad quality of beach material (the beach towels are worst that any 2 star hotel)......

We had reservations with the Dolphins and arrived early and they allowed us to park and said we could go to the beach and enjoy the outdoor areas until our Dolphin time. I had to post about the hotel even though we didn't stay there. It was so peaceful, security is TOP NOTCH! You pull up and r immediately approached. Yep, High Class! It was not overcrowded like where we stayed on Waikiki. So personally if u want a peaceful vacation and can afford this place GO! Relaxing uncrowded beach, several hot tubs and AGAIN not crowded. The atmosphere was lavishing like a place I feel Donald Trump would stay at, figure of speech. Didn't see the rooms but the outside was perfect if u want to truly relax and if u love Dolphins this is the place for you. Just watching the cuties can take your heart away.

My wife and I stayed at this resort last week and really had a great time. We upgraded our room from Dolphin Lagoon view to Oceanfront, with Balcony, and really enjoyed the spectacular view. We also got complimentary breakfast for the duration of our stay and free parking. Well centralized location and minutes to the Diamond Head Crater as well as to the Waikiki Beach. We really enjoyed the resort beach and pool. 15 minute walk or 5 minute drive to Kahala Mall. Its better to rent a car, but not from the Hotel. We rented from the airport and saved about $400. I would give this Hotel a 5 star with the overall experience.

We stayed at this resort for 7 nights. First impressions on arrival were that this was truly a special property. The lobby, entrance and public areas were tasteful and suitably impressive without being over the top. Our check in was smooth and efficient and we were told just enough about the hotel to keep us going without overloading us with details. The room we took was large, overlooked the golf course and mountain and was extremely clean and well presented. Although there was no balcony, there was a huge sliding glass window that could be opened completely that gave the room a bright and airy feel. The bathroom was well appointed with everything you would expect of this standard of hotel. The bed and linens were as comfortable as we have ever experienced. Free WiFi was easy to set up and available throughout the hotel including the pool and outside areas. As this hotel is a little far away from Waikiki, there are limited options for dining within walking distance. To this end the hotel overcomes this obstacle by providing 4 or 5 dining options which range from reasonable to expensive - there is also a shuttle bus that departs regularly for Waikiki and the shopping centres which we used a few times during our stay. Everything we ate at the resort was delicious as were the wines which had clearly been well selected and were priced well. The daily breakfast buffet was well catered although for the price some alternative options for coffee such as latte or cappuccino would have been nice. Service was exemplary throughout the stay with the only negative being on the last night at Veranda when the drinks took over 30 minutes to arrive and actually came after the food was served. The only other negative was probably that the pool was small and got very crowded with kids. The dolphins were great to watch and never particularly crowded. The hotel benefits from being just a walk away from Diamond Head but if you don't want to walk, hiring a car is all taken care of on site and is very simple. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Kahala exceeded my expectations and was welcoming in every possible way. Traveling as a younger couple, it was especially refreshing to be treated with respect, quality care, and personal attention. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was attentive and friendly. The concierge was especially willing to go out of his way to make our trip special. The best part of the Kahala was the close proximity to the beach and the mall. While it is close to many popular locations, its individual location and space feels quaint and non-commercial. It was very peaceful and relaxing without too many tourists or a kitschy feel. If you get the opportunity to dine at Aracino's, I would highly recommend their meals and wine pairings. My travel companion is a chef and said it was one of the best meals he had ever had. I'm not a chef, but I definitely agree. Delicious!

We stayed at the Kahala for one night of our vacation in order to stay in a Dolphin Lanai room. My sister had done this on her honeymoon years ago and wanted us to have the experience. During the daytime hours we loved this hotel. The Hawaiian music CD in the room was a nice touch. The room was gorgeous and the bathroom was beautiful. We sat at the beach for a while and my husband took out a kayak. The view from the water, looking back at the island, was amazing. We had room service dinner out on our lanai. Completely relaxing and enjoyable. We didn’t eat at Plumeria for dinner because it was buffet style. We did eat there in the morning and enjoyed that buffet. Sitting outside right by the beach for breakfast was incredible. A beautiful setting. However, if we were ever to return to the Kahala I would only stay in the main building. In the Dolphin Lanai room we could hear water running, toilets flushing, etc from other rooms. It sounded as though it was in our room. We also heard knocking and the doorbell ringing next door in the middle of the night – it went on for a while. I am giving the Kahala an excellent review because in a room in the main building, without noise, it would have been a true 5 star experience.The hotel is magnificent and peaceful with very friendly staff. A very different feel and vibe from Waikiki, so it depends what you are looking for. I would not hesitate to return, I would just ask for the other building.

We have visited some 53 Countries and stopped in hotels in all these places but probably for the first time, 5 Star at the Kahala actually meant a 5 Star experience. From the time we got out the taxi from the airport and the Bell boy took our bags, to the time he put them back in a week later we were swept off our feet. The Kahala experience is unique in a world were 5 stars can mean anything. Look it's not cheap so lets not pretend but it is the best and for us it was worth every penny.

Great Resort!!!! Most courteous staff that we have ever had experienced during our many travels.Excellent food. Great beach. Fantastic rooms and amenties. Booked thru COSTCO Travel and it was an exceptional experience.

Beyond our expectations in terms of service and quality of food. Everyone was over the top helpful and nice. It was a dream vacation We had a two bedroom oceanfront suite - remodeled and worth every Penny. Here is why I didn't give it five stars: 1. I was hesitant when we pulled up - the outside of hotel is old and dated looking. Needs a new coating paint at the least2. The pool is also old and dated. 3. The spa is not much to see - no relaxing room even. The massages we done in a renovated guest roomOverall though - my husband and I agree this was one of our favorite family vacations. This place is worth the price tag

We stayed at the Kahala for two nights before flying over to Maui. We booked a 1 bedroom partial ocean view suite and were thrilled with our accommodations. We were warmly welcomed upon check in and then escorted to our suite by the manager. Our suite was a corner unit with a beautiful view of the golf course, dolphin lagoon and ocean. The suite was spacious and the bathrooms and closets were large. Even though we were there during spring break, the pool area was not crowded and quiet. The beach was private, quiet and beautiful. The lounge chairs were comfy and the Kahala provided chair covers as well. Our kids had a blast and we were able to relax. It's a beautiful location away from all the crowds of the Waikiki area.

Had a week at the Kahala in August 2008 as part of our honeymoon trip. It was meant as a relaxing stop in between Las Vegas and San Francisco...and it was pretty much perfect! We had a garden room opening on to the golf course and being our honeymoon I may have dropped a few hints prior to our arrival and we weren't disappointed with a bottle of champagne and fruit basket waiting for us. The 'almost' private beach was fantastic as was the dolphin lagoon. The on site restaurants were reasonable value but excellent quality (Hokus!) but I don't think I would have got my monies worth out of the breakfast charges. I soon realised drinks at the bar etc would be on the expensive side and just charged them to my room so I just had one big gasp on checking out rather than several over the week. The barman did recommend some good bars in town which was worth his tips! Free (not including tips) shuttle bus into Waikiki was great and we ended up sharing the hotel with half the cast of Lost...then Barrack Obama turned up on his presidential quest....at which point we were questioned by a secret service agent in a bad Hawaiian shirt and funny earpiece every time I needed to take a pee! Quite fun though!

We didn't stay here, but remembered this place as tourists when my wife and I visited Oahu, before our daughter was born. It has an accessible beach which is excellent and the water is warmer than Waikiki. Also, it has a little kids pool that our two year old, stayed in for hours and hours. Last but not least, there are pools of water in the area, filled with exotic fish, huge sting rays and a dolphin show. Amazing!

very nice resort, secluded beach. Staff are friendly. The room is big and very clean. I really like the fact that they have housekeeping service often enough to keep our room clean and well supplied with towels, shampoo, even leave water bottles for us (for free!).

If you're looking for a resort away from the chaos of Waikiki, this is it. You feel like this is your own private resort. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Staff is wonderful and friendly. It is a bit pricey, but the food and atmosphere is second to none. Shuttles are available to take you into Waikiki. Just a wonderful experience.

The most beautiful ocean view and a most charming olde world hotel with a unique dolphin pool - Need I say more! Warm, friendly and helpful staff everywhere added to the delightful experience. Ocean view room is a must. We slept with the windows open - natural air conditioning with the sound of the ocean waves lulled us to sleep. The walk along the beach was lovely including a small promontory to sit and reflect while soaking in the beauty. Location is away from the crowds of Waikiki but fairly close to a small shopping mall and a short drive from Hawaii Kai and Koko Marina Malls.

What a great experience! It was our forth time in Oahu, and Kahala was the best hotel for sure! Rooms are big and comfortable, just as the bathrooms!Pool is warm, the beach is so beautiful and service is perfect!Also, breakfast is very good!Only 7km away from busy Waikiki, with it's private beach, I think it's the perfect choice in Oahu!I have a blog with lots of tips from Hawaii! It's jeitomilladeviver.

The staff were very accommodating and made us feel welcome and relaxed. Our only suggestion is to ask about transportation. We didn't feel it was easy to get around the island and shuttle service needing a reservation was an inconvenient. Better if on a more frequent schedule so we didn't feel rushed to make the shuttle if knowing another one was coming shortly. Overall, our first time in Hawaii was excellent! Thanks to all staff members!

I love the Kahala experience: Helpful staff (such as Rick at the front desk who took the time to use a satellite photo of the northeastern shore to help us locate a beach we had found four years ago during another stay, but had not been able to relocate on our own while driving around), knowledgeable concierges (who told us about the wonders off the coast at La'ie), great food (chicken salad in papaya with macademia nut ice cream for dessert at the Plumeria -- and their superb breakfast buffet or a snack by the water) and the quiet of being near but not in the hubbub of Honolulu. I would recommend not booking in late December if you want to avoid the many families with young children who come during school breaks.

I am staying at Kahala and despite it having a nice ambience and trying to selling it as having excellent services, I have just experienced one of the worst services levels I have ever had in all my travels.From my room I called for a bucket of ice, the front desk told that would ask housekeping for it. To make a long story short, after 1:40 minutes,3 calls and many apologies over the phone, I have not received the bucket of ice! A hotel with an AVERAGE level of service would not let that happen!

Words can not capture how wonderful our experience was at Kahala. Great location too. Easy to get to Whole Foods, close to juice bars, and a short ride to Waikiki or hiking. Can't wait to return. My only objection as an animal rights supporter is the resort's decision to imprison dolphins in small pools (that for dolphins are the equivalent of bath tubs). I was also deeply disappointed at how small the storage prison was for the sting rays and turtles.

My wife and I were in Hawaii and after going thru a wide number of resorts (and reviews on Tripadvisor); we decided on KahalaWhether you are a couple or a family, if you are looking for a place to stay which is at the perfect distance from the city centre of Honolulu, then you have found the right place. A lot of people like to stay on the Waikiki strip, but to us, its just too commercial and looks more like a regular city than a beach destination.The beach is nice and ample; tho the waters are a bit shallow around the resort (which I guess is fine if you are with kids). The pool is definitely small and thats where Kahala loses out: but its a small issue given the luscious ocean waters around you.The rooms are large and comfortable and if you can: go for the Ocean View Lagai room; it overlooks the dolphin area and you have wonderful views of the ocean. The sun is ample and if you are feeling lazy; then you can sun yourself on the balcony (why would you do that, tho, is a different question!)The staff is just amazing: I've been to multiple hotels and resorts in the US and I think, at times, resort staff forget their hospitality; but you won't have this problem at all at Kahala. We enjoyed our stay at Kahala so much, that we cancelled our intended travel to Miami and ended p spending 2 more nights at Kahala.Dining options is one place for improvement. They have limited choice and while the buffet spread etc (for breakfast) is good; the restaurants, otherwise, need to explore much more with what further options they can provide. Menus are, by & large, basic.All in all; I would give a 9/10 rating to the resort: most to do with the staff and location.

The Kahala is a bit off the beaten path from Waikiki, and the short extra drive is worth it! The property is immaculate, the staff exceptionally friendly, and the private setting memorable. We can't wait to come back!

Nice retreat from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Felt like an Oasis. Very relaxing. Food was delicious. I got a great haircut from Stacie at Reve Salon and the SUP yoga was challenging and fun. Breakfast on the beach at Plumeria was wonderful.

Spent two nights with our family. Exceeded our expectations. Staff was great, room was very good. We had a two bedroom suite which was plenty big for the family. Pool and beach were terrific. Kids did the Dolphin Quest - loved it, very unique experience. Hotel was full but did not feel crowded. Food was also good - a good selection and variety. Breakfast was top notch. Great spot. Would go back.

Our third visit here and it continues to prove to be a favorite destination. Even when the hotel is near capacity, it still feels peaceful and relaxed. This time just my husband and I and we are really enjoying all of the facilities including a great workout room. Plumeria breakfast is one of the best ever. Pass on new Italian restaurant, Arancino. No ambiance, food very mediocre.

The Kahala is famous as a hotel destination of presidents and actors. If you ignore the hype and focus on the actual experience it comes out as very good but not excellent. Location is off the beaten path which is great for me but some might prefer to be in the hubbub. Rooms are ample and clean. Free internet and breakfast with our room. Layout has a modern feel. Lobby is expansive and open air. Beach is a mix of families and romantic couples. At least 70 percent of visitors are Japanese. But that is true almost everywhere in Honolulu. Food is very expensive. Breakfast buffet is amazing. Dinners are good but not top gourmet. I recommend going out for dinner if you want top good at reasonable prices. Very relaxing. Nice romantic feel. Great views.

This resort exceeded our expectations - from the attentiveness of each staff member to their effort to make our stay unforgettable, they have certainly won over a family who will return again! mahalo!

Dolphins and sea turtles are on property. The food is amazing while the staff are very attentive and helpful. The views are breathtaking and it is a quick drive to anywhere you would want to go. The concierge should be more forthcoming about some of the excursions, the ATV ride was so mild it's safe to bring your grandma even a week after her hip surgery. I was hoping for more adventure..... The snorkeling excursion was a blast though, captain mark was able to show us whales, multiple species of dolphin, turtles and 50 types of fish.
