It's a really nice place: clean, quiet, outstanding quality on everything and pleasant surprises: the room & size, the food, the service, the swimming pool with dolphins and turtles, the distance to the beach.We were on our honeymoon, and while they congratulate you, there was no extra greeting, so that was a bit off.Pros.The breakfastThe size of the roomThe many food optionsThe distance to the beachCons.They charge every little thing. I understand the profit driven goal but 28USD per day/valet parking. And they ask for tip everytime.Speed of room service: E.g. Huge cockroach into the room. They sent someone to get it, they couldnt get it, we had to slept with the bug crawling around.We asked to take away the dinner table from room service, 20 minutes and it still was there.Overall, excellent experience!

Westin and Four Seasons have their own beds for a reason. The Kahala is a wonderful hotel. The service was excellent. The food was excellent. The location was excellent. The staff was excellent. The room was excellent and the view was excellent.Ufortunately the bed in the room sucked beyond belief. There was a sway in it that was disguised by putting a thick pillow top on it. Simply the most uncomfortable bed I have ever had in any hotel including the cheap ones. This made the whole stay far less enjoyable when you couldn't sleep and woke up with your back aching. So I gave it 4 stars for everything but the bed. I wouldn't go back unless I knew the beds were different. I was in room 925. Avoid it!

After staying n many hotels through out Hawaii over 28 years,I dont think I have enjoyed staying at a hotel more than I did at the Kahala. It was exceptional. There is always some fault you can find in a hotel no matter what star rating,but at the Kahala it was a perfect Hawaiian experience,faultless.

What a great place to stay. You cannot fault the genuine warm friendly service. The kids loved the dolphins and turtles. It is worth that little extra, promise. Recommend a hire car as the resort is located out of the Waikiki hustle and bustle (Nice and quiet). Close to the Kahala Mall and the main freeways east and west.

The cancellation policy is outrageous. We had booked the room for a week and the room was located to the elevator shaft which we had to put up with a lot of noise at night. The hotel is located 20 minutes outside of Waikiki and the shuttle service is insufficient and you need to make reservations to assure you can use the limited shuttle service.

We spent our honeymoon here 37 years ago. We wanted to come back to the Ecstasy of that trip.I never thought the the Kahala could out shine itself. Never the less, It is the most divine Hotel.Between the welcome mint washcloths to the Comfortable slippers we received. It was heavenly!

We stayed at the Kahala in dec on an extended family vacation. The Kahala is well maintained, clean and all one would expect from a luxury resort. I liked the room decor very much as it was comfortable and practical altho I would think some would find it a tad dated.The beach is lovely and very private and we had a blast at the beach doing paddle boating. The beach was pretty calm so my daughter aged 10 could paddle boat on her own. Having said that, it is not a big beach.I loved the location of the Kahala too. It's like in a little enclave. Near enough to Waikiki and great restaurants but just far enough from the busyness of Waikiki. The breakfast at the resort was great and good for celeb spotting.The only thing that I felt was really dated was the pool area. The pool is very small and looks old and seems to stick out like a sore thumb from the rest of the beauty of the resort. Dolphin quest was so much fun too and it was integrated nicely with the resort.Service and all was great! But I did feel it was a little pricey. Would be great to hv some options with little kitchenettes for families with young children. I was traveling with my 18 month tho and I have to say we were ok.

I searched high and low for where I wanted to spend my 50th Birthday in HI. We spent part of our trip in Ko Olina and had a great time, but today checked into the Kahala Resort are so glad we saved the BEST for last! :) This resort is celebrating it's 50th birthday, like me...one reason I picked it. BUT, we also wanted to be outside of the city yet, on this side of the island for part of our vacation. We were greeted with such a nice welcome from the staff. In our room was a incredible birthday desert and a nice card from the hotel manager welcoming us. The room is clean, spacious and has a beautiful view. Honestly what I love about this place is the energy and feeling when you are here. It is not pretentious. We had some great conversations with guests that have been coming here for years and the reason they return is because they feel comfortable and welcome. While some reviews may say the drinks are expensive or it is outdated...none true in our eyes. The drink pricing and our dinner (which was fantastic) was quite similar to the other resort we stayed at on the west side. Considering the resort is 50 years old, it has been updated and maintain with great care. The history of it is interesting and the views are amazing! Granted we are celebrating a special occasion and typically may choose a more modestly priced resort...but this is worth every penny. It has that more intimate feeling that large hotels can't offer. I thought I better write the review before I get home and move on with life and forget. We are excited to have 2 more nights here to relax, enjoy and hope this review helps you either decide to book here or else get excited about coming here if you already made a reservation. I know I always look at these reviews and especially the most recent ones. A great find...we will return for the next special event in our family!

This hotel was gorgeous, but expensive. It is far off of the path of Waikiki and took $30 each way for a cab. We figured out to take a cab to the city and we could catch a shuttle back. This hotel has everything you could need...a dolphin lagoon, a quiet beach, a big pool, many restaurants, and many helpful people.

We enjoyed our stay at the Kahala, staff was friendly and plenty to do around the resort. We didn't compare any of the other resorts as far as price but had a good time. We had a poor event in one of the restaurants due to lack of staffing I believe but that was the only issue

My husband and I stayed at the Kahala Resort and upon check in, the entire staff was very helpful and courteous. Our room was beautiful and the housekeeping staff was always very good at keeping everything nice and clean. And the turn down service at night was wonderful! We could not have asked for anything more. It was by far one of the most beautiful places we have ever been and everyone was so nice and helpful. We hope to return one day and hope to stay again! Thank you Kahala for making our vacation wonderful!

The Kahala is staffed by wonderfully kind and attentive people. The property is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and offers 4 different restaurants. We went off property for some sight seeing and hikes, but other than that felt very comfortable to stay and enjoy the beach. There were long boards, lounge chairs and umbrellas always available. We sampled 4 out of 5 of the restaurants and found the food to be mostly excellent. It was a beautiful time. Thank you Kahala!

HUGE rooms, very well appointed, sweet and attentive staff and a 5 star restaurant. This was by far he best place we stayed while visiting Hawaii. We really enjoyed the restaurant and private beach area.
user_name:
Rod F
Wilmington, North Carolina, United States

review_body: One of the hidden gems of Honolulu. Personalized service, expansive well appointed rooms and a well laid out pool area all combine to make this a must stop hotel. The fun begins as you exit the hotel to the enormous lake, home to 5 bottle-nosed dolphins. Cross the bridge and relax by the pool or take a stroll to the private beach on meters further on. Dynamic and attentive service is a plus poolside while the food in any of the onsite restaurants is superb. Everything is at your fingertips at this five star resort
user_name:
Travis F
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Room was large, nicely decorated, very comfortable, nice bathroom, tommy bahama toiletries, nice knitted robe, Staff very friendly, respectful, accomodating. Restaurant and seaside grill had good selection menu, prompt service, absolutely no complaints and i stay in alot of hotels and can be critical.

This is a beautiful place. The room was spacious and clean. The staff is very attentive and makes a point to know your name. The ocean animals--dolphins, turtles and so forth make for a nice environment. This place is secluded and expensive. You will pay hefty prices for anything and everything but they do have a shuttle that will take you into Waikii. Watching the sun come up from our balcony...priceless.

I have reviewed the Kahala on each of our 2 visits. I hope that this review isn't too repetitive but what can you do. The Kahala is what it is. A perfect retreat. This year our family booked 2 connecting rooms as our daughters are teenagers. One of the beauties of the Kahala is that it's big enough that it has everything you would want, yet it is small enough that we are comfortable with our girls having a little privacy and freedom. The staff goes out of their way to welcome you and remember your names and that really allows you to relax when the kids are doing their own thing. It feels as if there are 100 employees there looking out for you.The resort is breathtaking, as are the rooms. I feel like anyone can see that on the Website. I want to get across things you can't see. Flora LaMontange who is one of the managers is one of the main reasons we return here over and over again. Sounds crazy? Well, when every single detail of your trip is taken care of to the extent that she does it makes you want to return. She searched us out almost every day to say hi and to make sure all was good. It is such an amazing little touch and you can tell it is the philosophy of the staff from the top on down. They can't do enough for you, and it is NOT done for the tips. The staff at the bell desk runs to help you and you never feel like it is because their hands are out. The servers at the bountiful buffet run like crazy to get you whatever little extra you want though I am sure most people don't tip buffet breakfast servers well. Randy at Plumeria gave us remarkably good service each day and made sure my kids had hot and fresh Plum donuts every day. You are treated like a VIP, though regardless of what I feel like when I am there, I am not. The walls are covered with VIP's who have stayed there, from President's to Queens, to sports and movie stars. I have to believe it is the service they receive that brings them back. There are many beautiful resorts and when you stay at the Kahala you understand why those VIP's come.The beach at the Kahala is a private one that is very calm. It is very beautiful and they have many activities you can do there. My kids snorkeled and paddle surfed off the calm beach and we were able to take an outrigger canoe out and see Whales that were literally right off shore. For us that was another area that shined. Pete who oversees all of the beach activities, aside from being just a really nice guy is so great with the guests. He helps them surf, always has interesting info and is just a really nice fixture to have on the beach.If you are looking at the Kahala please think of all these things. You can see for yourself how beautiful it is. These things you will only see when you stay here. Any negative complaints here are just from people who either like to complain, or ones who like to nitpick over inconsequential things. Hawaii is expensive, it just is. However if you stay at the Kahala and your big complaint on trip advisor is that the drinks are very expensive than aside from doing your fellow travelers a disservice, you really should see the big picture. This is a top notch, first class resort and you feel special every second you are there.

I really loved this hotel! From the moment you get out of your car it's all about you, you and what they the staff can do to make you happy. I will start with the hotel it's self. It is stunning. The dolphin pools the water falls the beach the restaurants, all were just mind blowing. The room overlooking the dolphin pool was so great. Every morning walking out onto our lanai and watching them play was so much fun. The room was five star all the way,just beautiful. The staff at the beach were on top of there game. You can rent whatever you need to play in the water. Just rent a cabana and soak in the sun. We stayed four days and ate breakfast at the plumeria room everyday, and it was really special everyday. I almost forgot, they have a shuttle that will take you to Waikiki and a few other places. The shuttle comes and goes all day until about ten at night. I would recommend this wonderful getaway to anyone who love luxury.

Our Family stayed at the Kahala Hotel and Resort the weekend of Valentine's Day. I am a very picky person and there is not one negative I can come up with about the Kahala. Every element of our stay was perfect. We had a dolphin lagoon lanai room, and we loved it. We could see the dolphins swimming and playing from our room. Upon arrival and entering our room the kids had little dolphin stuffed animals waiting for them on their beds that said Kahala on them. It made them feel so special and welcomed. The turn down service was great. The whole family enjoyed our Dolphin Quest experience while staying at the resort. We dined at Hoku's on Valentine's Day and the service and food were outstanding. My husband and I ordered a 5 course meal with wine pairing. Our waiter brought a special little something for our children with every course. It was so thoughtful. The great thing about this resort is it is top notch without being stuffy. It is a relaxed, beautiful, and friendly environment. The beach was beautiful, clean, and the water was nice and calm. All of the restaurants were great. We rented a car from Hertz, which has a office located in the resort. It was easy and convenient. I recommend the Kahala to anyone who is looking for a relaxed, luxurious resort. They made us feel welcomed, pampered, and appreciated. It was heaven!

Our visit to the Kahala this past week over our kids' mid-winter break was our fourth visit over the span of about 8 years. It is one of our favorite places for a relaxing vacation, and it is nice enough that we have never wanted or needed to try another hotel on Oahu. The ocean view rooms are the nicest, and you should know that the partial ocean view rooms don't really have much of an ocean view but they are otherwise just as nice. The service is top notch. Many of the staff have worked at the hotel for a long time, and there are faces we recognize from prior trips. All of the staff are gracious, helpful, and patient. We have occasionally seen demanding guests, but never a grumpy staff member.When many people think of Oahu they think of Waikiki, but that is not what draws us to the island. We are there for a quiet break away from the crowds so we like the location in the Kahala neighborhood near Diamond Head. The Kahala Hotel is right on the beach and their pool is very kid friendly. You can buy or rent just about any pool toy your kid will need or want (the snorkel set was a hit this time). The same goes for the equipment at the beach (both kids tried the stand-up paddle board in the calm waters off the beach). You can have lunch either in your cabana on the beach (there is a rental fee for the cabana) or at a table near the pool. The food comes quickly and the menu is just right for the casual setting. Some people may not like the fact that it is not an all-inclusive resort and that you pay extra for things like the cabana, the pool toys, the paddleboards, and boats. But they are clear about what costs extra, and I am happy to pay for what I use. For the days we spent away from the hotel, we rented a car at the Hertz counter at the hotel for a day at a time. They have a limited number of cars, so we have learned to book ahead, but it is one of the few places where you can get a single day car rental without having to leave the property to fetch the car. This time we ventured out to see the Bishop Museum and did some kayaking in Kailua Bay. In the past, we have gone to the Polynesian Cultural Center, but skipped it this time since we can recite most of their jokes by memory now.The food at the hotel is great. The breakfast buffet has something for everyone. It includes the American breakfast basics (eggs, potatoes, sausage, pastries), healthier options (yogurt, salmon, fruit, oatmeal, tropical juices), and even some Asian breakfast items. Dinners at the Veranda, Hoku's (seafood theme), and Plumeria were all fine - well prepared and nicely presented. The fish dishes were especially good at all of the restaurants and at poolside. We did not try the new Italian restaurant; we get enough Italian food at home.The Kahala is a popular location for weddings, and while we were there this time there was also a corporate event going on. We have never found these other activities to affect our enjoyment. The hotel is big enough that it would be a destination for group events like these, but there are many far larger hotels in Hawaii where I would imagine that such activities would be even more prevalent.Overall, I would say that the service, the setting, and the convenience are what bring us back to the Kahala again and again. It is a family favorite.

We thought the rooms were fine and the staff was very friendly and professional. I don't want my criticism to take anything away from the these very important assets of the Kahala. But honestly, we were disappointed. The hotel is 50 years old and it shows. The common areas/lobby are in need of a major overhaul, as is the pool. The pool is really pathetic for a resort. 4 1/2 feet deep? The stores in the hotel were lackluster, and that's being charitable. To call the little corner of one store the convenience store was joke. It's unbelievable that a resort that is really not within easy walking distance to a convenience store would not have better selection than that. Every other hotel in Hawaii that we've stayed at was FAR better in that regard. We were also treated as second-class citizens to the Auto-Owners, as they were given priority over us "paying" guests. Overall, my wife summed it up best for me. It wasn't really a resort we were staying at. Just a hotel.

We stayed 4 nights in a Scenic Lanai room. The room was big and having the lanai is worth the extra cost. The bathroom is very large. They have a nice turn down service and my wife and kids loved the salted chocolates the staff brought them. Breakfast was included with the room and had a large variety of tasty food. The hotel was full but we never had any trouble getting seated. Before we came, I was a bit worried the pool would be small and overcrowded but it wasn't. There were always open recliners adjacent to the pool and the pool was active but not crowded. The pool was heated. The beach was very nice and they groomed it each morning. It was easy to get a nice spot on the beach and there were many staff to help with whatever you needed there. The snorkeling was there was okay but there are better spots to go. Our kids went to the Dolphin Adventure and loved it. Overall, the hotel was excellent and I would recommend it.

this was our 6th visit to The Kahala. The Kahala is getting better with each trip, especially the SPA. The staff at the SPA were the same people we have worked with before, and they remembered what our preferences are. We are already planning our next trip!

My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at the Kahala Hotel and Resort and enjoyed every moment of our stay. The hotel location is private and great for a relaxing trip. Beautiful atmosphere and friendly staff!

Date Saturday 8th to Saturday 15th FebWe arrived at 8 am after our flight from Sydney, to find the staff from the front desk to the room staff trying their best to get our rooms ready quickly for us to settle in, we knew that this is a late departure hotel 12pm they set us up in a private room so we could freshen up and rest this was 4 rooms 12 people with children to complicate issues, thank you to Lyn and Caroline at the front desk for this.The staff around the pool where very helpful throughout the week, the breakfast restaurant staff set up our 14 person table for us every breakfast and where quick to supply coffee and tea and they remembered this for the whole week, thank you. We had meals at several of their restaurants and the food was great especially the Bolognese from the Veranda... yummy! We also had a terrific experience with dolphin quest those dolphins where beautiful to pat, hold and swim with the staff where so professional with 14 people at the one time thumbs up thank you.Willy on the canoe gave my wife and son & myself a nice ride late one day thank you.We found the rooms all 6 (when the rest arrived a day later) very clean and spacious no one of the 12 adults could fault any rooms or staff, as Aussies tipping was an issue of understanding we all forgot at times however we never once had any staff get uppity or not offer to do something for us they were professional with us for the week.The only negative I could say something about was the contracted free shuttle service and this was more to do with their maintenance of their buses one had leg heating issues towards the back right side.Thank you for a terrific experience at this wonderful Resort.

If you are looking for a property away from the hoards of people in Wakiki this is a great choice. Close enough for easy access but far enough for some quiet downtown. Nice beachfront, great food and well-appointed hotel rooms.

Enjoyed every minute of our vacation. Our room was outstanding, quality & service is superb , everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Our room package came with breakfast which I highly recommend, breakfast can be pricey if purchased separate. The shuttle service provided is great, as it takes you directly to Waikiki, or Ala Moan Mall, so much to see and do, or just enjoy a relaxing day on the beach. Or spend a day at the spa, well worth it. We are looking forward to our next trip to Hawaii, definitely staying at the KAHALA.

The hotel was wonderful, the property beautiful with lots to do, but our favorite were the SUP lessons with Willie. Each lesson resulted in a marked improvement in my son's ability. We even squeezed in one last lesson on the morning we were leaving. Willie was a wonderful teacher and he made our trip that much more special!

You'll tip all day - tip the beach guy (can't drag your own chair out), tip the valet each time you take your car out (coffee run in the AM, activity run midday, dinner at night), tip the guy who takes you on a canoe ride. Also you'll be nickeled & dimed for all snorkel gear rentals (kids went multiple times each day). Beds very soft and mushy - challenging w a bad back.

Was there last week for 7 days; February 9th-16th, hotel/service and food was amazing...love Hoku's restaurant. Their breakfast buffet are amazing/delicious. Our favourite hotel..if you like the Four Seasons, then you'll love this hotel...it's even be better than the four seasons of Maui. Thank you to all the great staff at the hotel. Thank you for always making us feel at home.See you all next yr.K and A Pearce

This resort on arrival seems fantastic, I stayed there for 7 nights. The rooms are no big deal small infact we had a ocean view. The cleanliness of the room leaves alot to be desired. Toilets made me want to throw up biggest germ harbour ever, they have the TOTO toilets when they were last sanitised I don't know. The carpet made your feet dirty underneath, and the chairs in the room were not the most comfy, and as I said before SMALL ROOM. Not worth the price. The food is repetative within the hotel, reservations even though you are in resort are a must. On two occasions we couldn't get into the new italian resturant on resort as they said they were fully booked, but when we walked past they seemed empty. The afternoon tea is delightful. The other resturant is ok and again repetative. Breakfast room beautiful looking over the ocean. The pool area is smallish, with the coldest swimming pool I have ever encountered, I saw a couple of people in there but other than that it was empty. Im talking about freezing and painful to get into.The buses to Wakiki were always packed and that again was a pre book deal and if it was booked you waited a futher 2 hours for the next bus or took a taxi, most of the time we had to take taxis as who wants to be on a timetable with buses when they are on vacation? The bus on the one occasion we managed to get on it was clean. It was a 20 min run to Wakiki. Thoughout our visit the main thing we witnessed was wedding after wedding which takes priority over the guests in the hotel, such as closing down the afternoon tea restaurant, taking over the reception/seating area. The people at the spa were fantastic, very clean spa and relatively easy to get a appointment.

I have seen a few bad reviews on this resort but I didn't see any of the problems listed.Place was one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed at.The staff were always helpful,courteous,and friendly.I would recommend this resort to anyone wanting to get away from downtown Honolulu.Dolphins are an extra bonus.

Our family comes from Asia to spend Chinese New Year here several years in a row. Great hotel for children (ours our 6 and 1) and does not feel too crowded even when full. Positives- The beach - Cannot say enough good things about it. Beach is mostly self-contained, such that my older child could wander up and down it without us worrying about him straying too far off. Water is extremely calm and clear. There is very good snorkeling on the reef about 50 feet out. My 1 year old could walk in 20-30 feet on the gradual slope down. Plenty of water sports rentals available (though no sailing), but the staff who run the outsourced rental program were awesome - very attentive, patient and supportive, especially with the children- Breakfast buffet - Plenty of options and we never got bored- Location - if you want something a bit more secluded, this is it. No other hotels within 10-15 minutes of here, but that means it is about 10-15 minutes to get to Waikiki and the various hotels and shopping, if you want that. We spend most of the time on the beach and loved that it was not overrun.Negatives - Wifi is terrible. Signal strength is weak and it kept cutting out. Not a major issue given that we are on vacation and trying to get away from the constant electronic interruptions- The restaurant service is the only thing that really drags down the rating, if at all. Most of the restaurants appear to be slightly understaffed or staffed by people that move a bit slow at times. Ordering food at the beachside cafe can take a long time. Strangely, room service and ordering directly from your beach chair seem to be much quicker or predictable (or perhaps you do not notice the wait as you are engaged in other activities instead of waiting at a table)- Some water sport rentals are a bit pricey. After paddle boarding for several days, I think it would have been cheaper to buy our own equipment and just leave it there. But the quality of the surf instructors more than made up for itWould we go back?- Yes, we have been going for several years and likely will go back again next year. The hotel staff treat our children great and the location is perfect for a beach holiday

Went with our two daughters, 4 and 7. Spent the entire time at the pool and beach. Very relaxing. The dolphins were an amazing way to start your day. Restaurants were great. The water by their beach is very calm and shallow so great for little kids.

We spent six nights at this resort, having stayed here years ago when it was a Mandarin Oriental and even earlier when it was a Hilton. The best thing about it, in our opinion, is the location: close to the center but free of the hubbub of Waikiki.The rooms are spacious and comfortable, although the hotel exaggerates a bit in describing those with "partial ocean" views. Considering the property was opened 50 years ago, it remains in good shape and has been renovated well. The bathroom, often a problem in older hotels, was particularly well done.The staff were friendly, although this is pretty standard in the Islands, and helpful when asked. I was a bit surprised that there was no reaction when I informed the concierge in advance of our stay that we were celebrating an important birthday. Normally one expects some sort of recognition in a hotel of this price range and quality.The beach, swimming pools and dolphin pool are all very nice, as is the well equipped gym. If you stay more than a couple of days, however, you should get out to eat. The hotel restaurants are just ok and the breakfast buffet, in particular, can grow monotonous pretty quickly.All in all, a lovely location and a very good hotel ... also fully priced.

This is a lovely hotel...nicely decorated, roomy rooms in a beautiful setting. Their beach is secluded and protected, making it a nice area to swim and paddle board. I had heard such amazing things about the hotel's service, so it was interesting that the valets were far more informative than the concierge. At the time we visited, the resort was not hosting the usual cultural/resort programs that we had come to expect, so that was disappointing. But, the restaurant service and food was great and, as stated above, the setting was great. Wonderful location...especially if you want privacy, but easy access to Honolulu.

I'm in a good position to comment because I have been staying here since it was a Hilton when I was a kid. Let me start. The rooms have not been renovated in 20 years since the time when Mandarin Oriental took over the hotel, they are dated, tired and shabby.Staff are universally grumpy and verging on rude, especially at the breakfast buffet and at the activities hut by the pool. The food at the breakfast buffet never changes and there is a lack of quality healthy produce, it is all rather supermarket in style.Lunch options are poor, and the Seaside Grill closes randomly for corporate functions leaving guests with nowhere to eat lunch in the entire hotel other than room service.We stayed in a $1000 a night room and were presented with a cheap and nasty bottle of $10 sparkling wine as a welcome gift. You have to be kidding me! No flowers, no fruit, nothing. Stingy mean, cheap and tacky.There is little to no personalised service or interest shown by the staff, no special touches at all. Of course the location is still excellent. It's a formerly great property going to waste. And at the price, they have to be joking.I think it should be re-named the Kahala Motel.I had several other concerns and wrote a letter to the manager after leaving but recieved no reply. Nice.

Beautiful beach...brought in their own white sand. No other hotels nearby, so it's not crowded on the beach or at the pool, but the resort is big enough that neither seem empty. We were standup paddle boarding throughout the beachside lagoon and reef the first day. Very sheltered and calm. Hotel and staff are excellent. All the more so after we went into Waikiki and I learned in what a cluster I could have stayed. Still, if you must have Waikiki it's a short drive or shuttle away. The room was clearly designed for a different layout but they did an excellent job with the renovation and it works as a modern space. Oh. And there are dolphins in the lagoon, and that doesn't suck. Also small pools with sea turtles and rays.

Wonderful rooms on the beachside ground level to the east of the pool - lounge chairs on private patio steps from the ocean, rooms nice and quiet. Not sure about the tower rooms. Would definitely recommend this resort for couples or families. The fish, turtles and dolphins in the pools were fun to watch and staff friendly and knowledgeable. It was January so we were able to spot some whales during breakfasts out front too- long way out but definitely there to see

This hotel could not have been better for our honeymoon. The rooms were massive, the toilets incredible, the view spectacular and all a short way out of town so it was very quiet. They have a free shuttle to the places you want to go but why leave? they have a turtle pool, a heated pool and spa (heated at night too!), a dolphin sanctuary and a beach right at their steps!! Amazing.

We stayed here for one night because we were signed up for the Dolphin Quest Encounter for my son's birthday. We were so glad we decided to stay here because we will definitely be back to enjoy the hotel. We didn't get to eat anything but breakfast because our flight came in late at night but the breakfast was awesome. The Dolphin experience is a memory maker!

This resort was something more, it was extra special. My husband and I felt like we were important and cared about the entire stay. It gave the WOW effect. I highly recommend this resort for a honeymoon or anniversary destination.

I and my husband want to be relax and resting trip for celebrating silver wedding. My choice is very good about kahala hotelit has nice private beach and lovly Dorphins ㅋwe will revisiting kahala at 30th wedding anniversary

Stayed at The Kahala for 4 nights in January 2014. In a much quieter area of Honolulu than Waikiki which made it feel more private. We were greeted with beautiful shell lei's upon arrival. We were upgraded to an ocean view room at no additional expense. What a pleasant surprise! The suite was very spacious and the beds soooo comfy. The hotel grounds are immaculate and loved the on site lagoons with turtles, stingrays and of course the dolphins. Wish I could've stayed longer and hope I am able to return!!!

Always impeccable service and a gracious aloha welcome. Watch for specials that include the breakfast buffet and extra nights. If you're a golfer, the Kahala is right next to a championship course. The hotel is right on a very nice swimming beach as well as having freshwater pools for guests and a network of salt water lagoons and pools filled with sea life. Being away from the concentration of tourism in Waikiki has both benefits and drawbacks - depending on what kind of experiences the traveler wants.

We booked this hotel for 7nights through Costco travel because we kind of trust their choice.We go to Oahu twice a year for vacation and have been tried several hotels there.The hotel is old,which we already knew,the interior of the room is old but no complaint.The first day we checked in the room,there was still water from ice left from last customer in the ice bucket.The everyday housekeeping seems not doing anything.No new shower cap added,bathroom floor mat was dirty.The water faucet was leaking and there was someone drilling the wall while we trying to get my 18months old into a nap.Now we still have 3 nights to stay here,wish I have booked the J.W.By the way,the pool is small,however the view is good.

The Kahala Hotel & Resort is simply world class. This is my favorite destination worldwide. It is truly a class above most. The facility is great. The staff is beyond great. Yes, it is a little pricy but worth it if luxury is the goal. I try to stay a few days every six months or so.

My mom and I just stayed at the Kahala for one week. Wow what a great resort!!! We have stayed at other resorts on Oahu but the Kahala was one of the best resorts we have stayed at anywhere. We loved seeing our turtle friends, stingrays and of course the dolphins! All the staff was beyond amazing and friendly! I love nothing better than a calm beach to float on and this beach is fabulous!! Beach service was great. All the food was amazing!! We had a breakfast package and we loved going for the incredible food each morning. Always new items to look forward to. Kalahadas donuts and guava fan Danish I will dream about forever. Shopping shuttle was such a great way to get around since we didn't have a car. Can't wait to come back to this resort to see all our friends again!!!!☀️

We visit Hawaii over New Years every year staying in the best hotels on Maui, Oahu, the big Island etc. Although other hotels are comparable for beauty, service, restaurants, spa etc the thing we love about the Kahala is it's probably one of their busiest weeks of the year but the service is still excellent and the hotel never feels overcrowded. You can still get a lounger on the beach or by the pool, you can head to the poolside restaurant when you're hungry and get a table easily and the staff seem genuinely happy and not stressed. Our boys, ages 9 and 12 found friends to play with and they could safely have some independence around the hotel. The beach is a good size so your lounger isn't so close to someone else they're practically sitting on you. I feel that if they can make me this happy during their busiest time it must be great all year round and I'm not the easiest person to please. We've only stayed here a couple of times as we like to try different places but I would recommend it and will go back for sure.

the Hotel was as you would expect a four star or above to be clean friendly and plenty of choices for dinning. Rooms very good, clean, and comfortable bed.breakfast was very good plenty of choice and all fresh. staff helpful and friendly. would recommend this hotel. the hotel made us very welcome

It is a nice hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach, is employee attitude is good, old hotel the breakfast was plentiful and a wonderful time spending.Are staying at various luxury hotels in Japan is for the first time was such a great experience.Want to visit if the opportunity arises again.

We visited The Kahala Resort in January 2014. We had enjoyed the stay very much. The service was absolutely perfect. Whenever you need help, there was someone available. The food at the restaurants was excellent. The hotel had its 50th birthday – but it doesn`t lost any of its charm! Looking forward to our next stay at the Kahala!

The Kahala offers everything we wanted. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and has a staff that knows the meaning of service. After a somewhat early arrival we were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary room upgrade. From there we scheduled a last minute spa treatment and found the staff very accommodating and the therapists both professional and efficient. Totally relaxed, we opted for room service that night. The food was great with many choices. Linens were luxurious and the bed super comfy making for a great night's sleep, especially since the hotel was very quiet. Our package included breakfast buffet at the Plumeria which did not disappoint. Later Cameron, the concierge supervisor, helped us plan and book a variety of activities. He was the best! Winding up the week, we spent a lot of time just relaxing beachside. Again the staff there was always ready to assist with lounge chairs, cabanas, towels, food and drink. You will want for nothing at the Kahala! We found all the facilities, grounds and room to be exceptionally clean and up to date as well.The only "negative" we experienced was the arrival of a conference that took over the Plumeria a couple mornings making the restaurant noisy and congested which spoiled the peace & quiet & restful mood we had been enjoying. Overall, the resort is a winner!

We had just come from a" luxury " hotel on another island. The Kahala was "luxury"! For us not being in the middle of Waikiki was perfect. The beach was uncrowded with great service and beautiful! Everything was #1, everything!

Although I haven't stayed at the hotel, the restaurants are great. The location just off the beach with lovely shade, good service. The beach is open to the public, but uncrowded, so it is a great place to relax and enjoy.

My family took a wonderful vacation to Honolulu and we stayed at the beautiful Kahala Resort for a week! The location is perfect & the hotel staff & amenities are outstanding. We had a fabulous visit!

My family and i stayed at the Kahala from December 7th through December 12th and what an amazing vacation it was. We stayed at the Kahala after a week on the NCL Pride of America and it was the perfect finish to a 2 week stay in Hawaii.The staff at the resort were all great. We had the breakfast buffet included in our package and highly recommend it. The rooms were great and spacious... the bathrooms were very spacious and had a shower and soaking tub and his and her robes and slippers. There is a shuttle that will take you into Waikiki but it gets filled so be sure to reserve space on it in advance when you want to go into waikiki and return. We could have stayed another week at this resort, very relaxing and secluded. Spring from the spa was very accomodating and was very concerned with customer satisfaction. Special mention of the gentleman that made the Omlettes... he was excellent with a great attitude.Overall ... great stay.. a bit pricey but we would go back!
user_name:
Sadie G
New York City, New York

review_body: My review should be read in the context of my expectations of the Kahala Resort which were based on the majority extremely enthusiastic reviews on Tripadvisor, and also the price I paid - nearly $900 per night including breakfast. Well maybe you need to be an 'A lister' to get the level of service some have experienced. We aren't, and we didn't.Problems (some may seem niggly, but remember $900 a night.....):Check-in was basic. No cold towels or drinks offered.Room directory has no list of services as in most hotels, just phone numbers.Room has a drip coffee machine and three filter packs plus three tea bags of different types, plus creamer. We requested fresh milk and were told that it was available at a charge through room service. We requested more tea bags and these arrived, no problem. Next day back to the basic three.......No complimentary cookiesNothing in the mini bar.One pair of slippersNo cutlery at all, just a wooden stirrer a la StarbucksTurndown service arrived for two nights, then nothing. We followed up on this and it took hours for Reception to communicate with Housekeeping who arrived at 9.00pm.We stood around at the entrance to the Poolside Bar waiting to be shown to a table. Serving staff carefully avoided our eyes for some time, then someone volunteered that it was free seating (not indicated anywhere). Had a similar issue when I sat at a table the next day and waited to be served for 15 minutes - plenty of staff around, but I felt invisible. Once served, we were asked every few minutes if our drinks were OK, but when we tried to get the account everyone avoided our eyes again.At the breakfast buffet we were charged $6 extra for espresso coffee.There are charges for all pool/beach equipment except towels. The hotel website has an expansive description of all the complimentary services available to the occupants of a suite, including beach equipment, but it isn't clear what a 'suite' consists of (some hotels use this term for rooms) or that nothing is available for others - one reason why a room directory with this sort of information would be useful.We arrived on 1 Jan and asked the Concierge what dining options were available for that night. He told us that all restaurants were 'fully committed' without any hint of regret or any suggestions of alternatives. This hotel is remote from Waikiki and in an upscale residential area with no other restaurants or cafes within a mile. It would've been helpful if the hotel had communicated the need to make a restaurant booking in advance of our arrival. In fact this is the only hotel I can remember that didn't make any communication at all before we arrived - it is standard in my experience for all better hotels to email an advance welcome and offer to assist with any arrangements.The shuttle service is too infrequent and is often fully booked.Not one staff member remembered our name in the five days we stayed there - not an issue for me, but other reviews have mentioned the opposite experience. In fact it wasn't until the last two days that a new breakfast server remembered our coffee order (and we breakfasted at the same time each day - very early).With the exception of one or two star performers - such as that breakfast server - the staff did not seem overly friendly or overly efficient, just going through the motions. Again, this is not acceptable at a hotel of this grade.Good things:The room was excellent - well furnished, good bed and bed linens and I liked the large bathroom/dressing room arrangement. Bath plus seperate shower stall, two sinks.The dolphins - fabulousWe booked a Dolphin Lanai room and I contacted the hotel in advance to request a room with the best view of the dolphins in that category. We absolutely got that, which was much appreciated. the interraction with the dolphins was endlessly entertaining, and the rooms weren't noisy as there are no dolphin 'shows' as such, just small groups with trainers and dolphins.I requested a late checkout, for payment, and a very pleasant reception clerk organised this for a $50 per hour supplement until 6.00pm. (It seems that they also charge for early check-in which I haven't seen at other hotels).In summary, my overall view is that the hotel falls short of the standard of their Westin, Trump, Sheraton etc peer group in delivering consistent quality of service and should really look again at some of their penny-pinching policies.

My husband and I and our 10 and 8 year old stayed here for five nights in January of 2013. Our room was large with an over sized bathroom and beautiful views of the ocean. The property has a fantastic calm and secluded beach, that after staying in Waikiki is a very pleasant and calm respite. Staff was superb all the way around and the employees seem to genuinely enjoy working there.The hotel is in a great location to head north and explore other gorgeous beaches on the island. The concierge was great at helping us plan those excursions. We pre-arranged a rental car that we picked up at the airport and used the entire duration of our stay.Around the corner from the elevators near the shops is a wall with many photos of celebrities and personalities who have stayed there. It was fun to look at those.I can't say enough about the surrounding beauty and tranquility of this hotel and its beach. We loved it and when we think back on it we say "Ahhhhh"! I have been to Oahu several times but only stayed in hotels in the Waikiki area. Staying at the Kahala gave us a relaxing experience that was like being on the other islands.

Returned here for several days of R & R and to celebrate a friend's birthday. We have been coming here for years, and have never been disappointed in any way. Accommodations remain stellar - we were upgraded to an oceanfront room, which was delightful. The service remains impeccable - the staff here is the best - anticipating your needs before you ask, and the food here is very good - particularly in Hoku's, which is outstanding. Look forward to our next visit to this Hawaiian paradise. Since our travel agent is a Virtuoso agent, amenities include the full buffet breakfast each morning, upgrade if available (which it was - I believe we had a double or triple room upgrade) and late checkout.

The location and setting is fabulous. The property is a heritage style building and the foyer had a beautiful Christmas tree which made the hotel very festive. Reception staff were very welcoming and upgraded our rooms on arrival. Our rooms were at the back of the hotel overlooking the golf course and even though they were on the smoking floor, we were pleased with our rooms which were spacious with a nice balcony. The furniture and decorations are perhaps a little tired and old fashioned.The cafe restaurant where breakfast is served was so-so. My parents arrived in the morning and as their rooms were not ready, they joined us for breakfast and were immediately told they had to pay, as breakfast was not included on their first day! Even though breakfast is expensive, they still charged extra for cappuccino/latte which was really annoying and unnecessary in a hotel of this calibre. In fact, the whole 'push for tips' every time you ordered food or drink was hard to swallow, especially given they already charge a minimum 18% for groups of 6 or more. Housekeeping told me she had her day off on the day of our departure but her colleague would be happy to pass on my tip!! On the day of our departure, the 'new' housekeeper kept asking when we were checking out. When the luggage was being collected, she darted into the room as soon as she saw I had left an envelope.Three incidents are worthy of mention. The first involves the reserving of pool chairs. On our first day I sat on a chair at the pool. I was there for over 3 hours when I was approached by another guest advising me that the chair was 'hers' and I needed to move!! She told me she had been coming to the Kahala for over 20 years and pool staff always reserved her chair even when she wasn't at the pool!! She then went over to complain to the pool staff. I was dumbfounded by her audacity and also went to question the pool staff on this ridiculous policy. I was told it is not in fact hotel policy to allow guests to reserve chairs and the Manager did come to apologize, however it didn't escape my attention that this woman continued to have the same chair reserved throughout our entire stay!! The second comment is in reference to the hotels dolphin programme. Undoubtedly a wonderful touch for hotel guests and we paid handsomely ($700 plus tax) for our daughter to be a 'dolphin trainer for the day' (5 hours) as her combined birthday and Xmas gift. It should have been a 'once in a lifetime' experience but the trainers were so busy accommodating other guests who had paid for dolphin photo and swim experiences, our daughter had to fit in and join those other groups. She was given very limited 'one on one' attention and left feeling disappointed. Over the five hours ( or to be exact 4.5 hours, as they finished early) they didn't even offer her a drink or snack. 98% of the professional photos taken as part of her package included other families and the photos themselves were poor quality. On our final day when we were checking out, the hotel had a stand in the lobby with snacks/coffee where kids were icing Christmas cookies etc. We automatically assumed it was a Christmas activity the hotel was putting on for the kids as there was no signage or staff to indicate otherwise. My daughter, Mum and I joined in. To my horror, we were later handed a bill for $125. When I complained, I was told it was a paid event.... Very poorly executed and embarrassing. It was also our last impression. We won't be returning.

As first time visitors to Hawaii, I was looking for a place that was relaxing, peaceful and a little bit special as I had heard that staying in town can be very noisy especially over the Christmas break. The Kahala is a really beautiful and peaceful resort and did not disappoint in these aspects. It has a lovely old world appeal which I really liked. Our room was beautiful and comfortable, a little worn in some areas with scuffing and wear but not too bad. The staff is fantastic and extremely helpful. Not much in the way of supplies in the room especially tea bags. I hate to sound picky but I expected these things to be in much more plentiful supply and variety for such an exclusive resort. I guess the idea is to order room service but it is nice to be able to make a cuppa in your room when you feel like it. It was lovely to wake up on Christmas morning and open our door to find a gift from the Kahala, that was a really wonderful touch! Just a couple of small things, we thought it was a bit much to have to pay for cabanas and beach chairs to use on the beach. As hotel guests, we assumed these things would have been supplied and to have to pay extra was a surprise. Our in room dining menu was missing/removed from the folder and it was difficult to convince staff that it was missing and we were not imagining it. We eventually received a photocopied version brought to our room. Just one more thing, I realise when I booked this resort that The Kahala has captive dolphins in the lagoon. I'm not sure in this day and age if this is still appropriate, it just seems cruel. They are obviously well cared for physically but they are intelligent creatures and I wonder about their mental well being. I am no expert by any means and I know they are used also to educate visitors and are a big draw card to the resort but, I just don't know if it is right, this is just my opinion.

The hotel is located in a fabulous part of Oahu with a lovely beach however the hotel I believe does not have the high service ethic it should. When we arrived, we had to wait some time to be escorted to our room. After 15 minutes I went back to reception and asked what the delay was. We were not offered water or a drink on arrival. When I asked for water I was directed to a water urn on a desk. Seriously! We were then taken to our room by the receptionist I'd complained about the wait, to find the concierge with the luggage already in the room. We stayed in an "ocean view" room which had a large view of the car park with some ocean view. When I mentioned this I was basically told "this is what you booked". Perhaps they should be a little more honest with the "view" component. The room was okay but the furniture scuffed and scratched. The bathroom was positively claustrophobic with no air circulation. The mattresses were lumpy and uneven - extremely uncomfortable. Not at all what we expected for a property with such a high reputation. The best thing about the property was its location.

Where to start...everything for us was just perfect...the room was fantastic and so spacious and so very clean and comfortable..and the weather so hot every day....just wish we could have stayed for another few weeks....

My beautiful wife and I had the most amazing wedding and reception at Kahala and are now celebrating our two year anniversary. Since then our guests continuously comment on how perfect everything was, from the rainbows before our ceremony and the beautiful setting to the incredible food and great band for a drink upstairs afterwards. If you don't just want a good wedding, but an amazing wedding I thoroughly recommend Kahala. Everything will be seamless from the moment you make contact until you leave (not that you will want to). The only challenge we had was that the resorts on our honeymoon didn't compare, so you may wish to stay on at Kahala for your honeymoon afterwards. I also recommend a live band during your reception

What's not to absolutely love about the Kahala? Nothing whatsoever. I've been going to the Kahala for over 30 years. I fell in love with the place when I was a student at the University of Hawaii studying Travel Industry Management. Even then, the Kahala set the standard for luxury, grace, service, and setting. It was aspirational to us starving college students as a place that someday we'd either have the chance to work at or stay in. I went as often as I could to enjoy the setting, the architecture, and the service. Sometimes I could only afford ice tea but every staff member made me feel that I was as just as important as one of the many heads of state or Hollywood elite that were frequent guests there. When my parents visited Oahu or when my aunt sent me birthday money we went to the Kahala to dine in the Maile room or have drinks on the beach. Fast forward through the years.In my many subsequent visits to Hawaii, and there have been hundreds, the Kahala was always in my itinerary. And it never disappointed. The same grace, beauty, and excellence in service. Just a few weeks ago I made a short two night visit to Oahu and checked in to an ocean front room. I'd forgotten how large they are, how well appointed, how quiet. The carpet seemed 10 inches thicker than before. The lobby was spectacular, decked out for the Christmas holidays. The classic lines of the property's architecture are even more stunning today. The guest mix was what you'd expect. Well heeled, sophisticated, international, but nice. No pretentiousness. The staff anticipated and accommodated every request. Quickly, thoughtfully, gracefully. Smiles everywhere. If there is heaven on earth, I'm sure the Kahala is part of it.

Everything about the visit was quite perfect. The room was lovely as were the amenities in the room. The restaurants on site had excellent food and the range of choices (Italian, Seafood, beach restaurant, beach bar) served our needs well. The dolphin lagoon was the highlight -- we spent a few hours each day just watching and photographing the dolphin training and special activities with guests. It was fascinating. The beach was lovely -- wide sandy area, plenty of spots to relax. The pool was closed one of the days of our visit, but it was not clear why. I didn't play the golf course, but our room overlooked one of the holes as well as the ocean. It looked like a great course.Definitely an upscale place but with a very low-key atmosphere.

This was our second trip staying at this lovely hotel. The lobby, rooms, and grounds are wonderful. The dolphins entertained us for hours. The breakfast was great on the patio. The staff was friendly and efficient. But! The bed still soft and in need of replacing. A shame that the bed was the only downside to this hotel.

We had a special wedding anniversary to celebrate and the Kahala was the perfect holiday retreat. The rooms are well designed and spacious. The staff were all helpful and thoughtful. The beach is beautiful. We enjoyed the cabanas. When we booked the hotel we didn't realise we were arriving in the middle of Thanksgiving festivity season, so it was very busy everywhere, but also a nice experience for us. The shuttle service to Waikiki and the shopping centre worked well including going to the local Kahala Mall. The Veranda Café and bar was our favourite for relaxed evening meals. The menu for the Italian restaurant in the hotel was a bit unusual and a little sterile, which was a surprise as the rest of the hotel, had a comfortable and beautifully designed welcoming décor. We look forward to returning.

Our time at the Kahala resort was outstanding! The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly had some great conversations with the bar tenders. Swimming with the dolphins was awesome and we never got tired of watching them swim past our balcony. Thank you for making our stay special and we will see you again.

Last few days we stayed here as a family and it was beautiful. You dont need to go anywhere else. The buffet breakfast is devine and pleanty. The lagoon with various water creatures is amazing and lying on the foreshore was a lovely peaceful way to spend your days. There is a small shopping centre just up the road which is perfect if you feel like doing some retail thereapy. I had a few hiccups with my travel card but with the assistance of some wonderful staff Bart and Carlos they were very kind and supportive. Rooms are a great size and we really enjoyed our stay. It is a tad pricey but it is a lovely resort away from the hustle and bustle of downtown.I would definitely stay there agin but I would book in advance.

We have been coming to the Kahala for over 30 years for the Christmas holidays and have stayed with it though all the changes. Many of the staff remain the same year after year and remember you. This year, with new management, the hotel seems well run and our stay has been exceptionally pleasant. The staff is eager to please and happy to accommodate your needs (in my case, vegan food). We love that it's a relatively small, quiet hotel away from busy Waikiki but close to great restaurants and shopping. It's a wonderful place for families and small children as well as adults. We look forward to it every year; it feels like a second home!

Booked two 2-bedroom Ocean Front Suites for a family of 7 -- pricey but worth it! The 2-bedroom suites consist of a master bedroom (king bed) and a normal ocean front room (2 twin beds) with a living room connecting the two. Here's my review:Booking:Book in advance taking advantage of their 60 or 90 day advance booking. I did mine 8 months in advance and got the 45% off Suite rateOcean Front Suite Amenity Program:1. Free pickup/drop to HNL Airport. I had a rental because we wanted to travel, but they reached out to offer a SUV pick up so I know it was available.2. Welcome amenity (chilled mint towels at check-in, stuffed dolphin toys for the kids, fresh fruit and chocolate macadamia nuts in the room as we walked in)3. Evening appetizer and cocktail in suite -- this is awesome, just tell them what cocktails or kids drinks you want in the afternoon and they are delivered to your suite along with a changing appetizer every day (mini pasta salad on day 1, ratatouille day 2 . . .etc)4. Daily breakfast at Plumeria Beach house (2-bedroom suites -- we got four breakfast per suite included in the package). We are early birds and got there at 6:30am when in opens -- gets busy starting at 7:30am, so be ready if you are late breakfast kind of person. The selection is great -- recommend the fresh papaya from the Big Island and the Kalasadas (doughnut).5. Newspaper and morning coffee/tea delivery to suite -- love this. Got it delivered at 6am, served in a thermal carafe to keep in warm along with the local newspaper.6. Complimentary beach cabana -- these are really loungers on the beach with pull up covers to block the sun. You get a 2-chair lounger per suite. Best part is they give you flag poll -- raise the flag and the staff comes over to take your drink/food order. We used it today and the guy was there in under 3 minutes!Videos/Pictures:See my uploaded video (uploaded separate from this review) to see the 2-bedroom Ocean Front SuiteSee my photos of the view from each of the rooms.

These guys are obviously trading on the legacy of fame and fortune of the days gone by. While it is a great spot just out of Waikiki and provides a sense of tranquility and seclusion. The best parts for me were the beach and the grand entrance.Apart from that, the staff seemed detached with a hint of attitude. Right from the point of driving up for check-in. Since all we could get for a rental car at the time was a minivan, we were greeted with some shock when we advised we were staying and not just "dining" as they suggested when we drove up.At near $US900 / night our room was comfortable but a tad too traditional, with some attention to detail lacking. The beds were also too soft and lumpy, with amenities such as body wash, soaps etc etc were limited compared to other hotels of this ilk. Even water, was NOT included.The fitness centre was well equipped, but the locker rooms/steam and sauna didn't look as though they had been revitalised since the 60's when this hotel was built.We did not eat at the signature restaurant, instead favouring Arancino, which is located within the resort, but is a separate entity.So if you like things a little olde worlde (but dont expect the quality standard to be associated with it), with a sense of celebrity and exclusivity (yes there were celebs there when I was staying)... go for it. But compared to other hotels like the Park Hyatts or the Andaz or W's this just doesn't cut it.Oh... and noisy a/cBut nice big double bathrooms

This is place is really amazing. The private beach is hard to beat. The hotel offers a shuttle service to the main shopping area which is great because you are 20 minutes away from the city. Friendly service also.

We spent three nights at the Kahala. The resort is gorgeous and we found the service to be polite and prompt. The hotel is a 15 to 20 drive from Wakiki, but I liked being away from the noise and crowds. We did not use the spa services or attend any exercise classes. We loved the breakfast in the Plumeria restaurant.

We have been coming to Kahala Resort to celebrate our anniversary for many years. Mahalo, Kahala, for the welcoming touch of a chilled bottle of champagne waiting in our room! Thank you, Herin for the room with a balcony, a wonderful way to dine on our first night!This year, my impression is that service and attention to details seem to have gone up another notch. It started several weeks ago with an email from the Concierge offering assistance. Lauren was most helpful in arranging our dining reservations at the resort. Every employee we met upon arrival starting with Herin at the front desk has been gracious, friendly and helpful. It was wonderful to have some of the employees, such as Julie at Plumeria Restaurant, welcome us back. Service is comparable to that at the Fairmont and the Four Seasons in Maui. The beautiful beach without huge waves (not for surfers) made swimming a dream, which makes up for the aging pool - one area that could use improvement.Tips: best to book package that includes breakfast, complimentary coffee at 5:30 AM, don't drive to Wakiki Beach, use complimentary shuttle and be sure to reserve.In the past we have usually come in November, but this year our stay coincide with the Honolulu Marathon in early December. The road that lead to the Resort was closed for most of the day during the race. I was impressed with the Resort’s efforts to ensure that guests were able to leave the Resort during the Marathon. I was provided transportation to the point where the road is closed, escorted in crossing the road where the runners were passing through and then put in another vehicle for the short ride to the Kahala Mall. Thank you, Heidi, for seeing to it that I got back to the Resort, and for your big smile!Kahala Resort is for those who wants to enjoy gracious experiences in Hawaii. It is tranquil and yet only a 10 minutes drive to stress yourself out with the crowds on Waikiki Beach. The resort offers a complimentary shuttle to several locations; it makes getting around very easy. Mahalo, Kahala! See you in 2014.

I've been wanting to stay at the Kahala for awhile now having stayed at the Halekulani and Royal Hawaiian in the past.....I was not disappointed. The resort is beautiful has that quiet elegance and is away from the hustle /bustle of Honolulu. We were there Thanksgiving week and while the resort was busy it was not overcrowded. At the check in we were offered a suite upgrade at a discounted price and decided to accept it after being told about what was offered.....however a short time later we were advised the suite was not available after all....we were disappointed and no alternatives were offered....but our room and the view was beautiful. We had an oceanfront w/lanai. The lanai's were larger than other hotels which was nice. Room was lovely with Tommy Bahama products which were really nice. We had the breakfast buffet as part of our package and Plumeria House was beautiful with outside seating. The buffet itself was good but it was not a large or varied as other hotels...we stayed at the Fairmont in Maui last week and that buffet was great. The same items were offered each day and no real variety or changes daily. Also we had Thanksgiving dinner at Hoku's and while it was good, we had Thanksgiving dinner here as well in 2006 and it was much better with choices and much more food. This time for turkey you were given one piece of white meat turkey with some sides. Again the food was good but it was definitely lacking when compared to our prior meal. The focus seems to be more on presentation and trying to make it "fancy" rather than a traditional meal. I will give kudos to the chef for working with me on an allergy problem I had with the appetizer. We absolutely loved the beach! Did not use the pool as we prefer the beach and the pool was small and overrun with children. It was confusing the first day as there was an attendant on the beach and when he was done setting up one couple we stood there right where the couple waited and he walked right by us, not asking if we needed help or even hello. I finally figured it out and had to go to the hut by the pool and was told there was a $25 fee for renting an umbrella! Wow that was a first - but since they do not charge a resort fee, they have to get you somewhere. But the beach was beautiful and water calm. Gym was ok - but small - I think there were 4 elliptical and 4 or 5 treadmills....but they had what was needed. They should offer bottled water rather than paper cups you get in a dentist office for water. We had no problem with the shuttle service - as other posters noted they had problems. I inquired about it and was told you can make a reservation on the shuttle up to 24 hrs in advance....we did and no issues....unfortunately we did not know what time we were going to come back so we took a cab - $22 - rather expensive given traffic was at a minimum. Service was wonderful and we would definitely come back again!

a nice resort with a very attentive staff. The wifi is very unstable and the prices are a bit inflated, but the setting is beautiful, there are free dolphin shows all day due to the dolphin research facility on site. We had an issue one morning when we did not get the wake up call that we had requested, but the management reacted fast as soon as we reported to issue.I would recommend the property.

Our family of 4 (children 12 and 9) stayed at The Kahala Hotel and Resort during Thanksgiving week for 7 nights and had a wonderful time. Just about everything exceeded our expectations. Our room was a spacious mountain-view room, with tub, shower, and “his and hers” sinks and closets…and immaculate! Some of the niceties on our arrival included cookies with ‘Aloha’ written on the top one, a stuffed dolphin on the bed for my daughter, and a cd of Hawaiian music playing as we walked in to our room.What really made this hotel exceptional, though, was the staff. Everyone we encountered was friendly, knowledgeable and polite. The concierges, maids, and all of the staff made us feel welcome and made our stay as enjoyable as possible. Our maid and some of the restaurant staff called us by name. When one of the waitresses heard that we were disappointed that there was no more acai sorbet at the breakfast buffet, she brought us 4 fresh ones just a few minutes later. The concierge was so nice to take many pictures of our family in front of their beautiful Christmas decorations. The pool service catered to our special request of a real coconut with straw and spoons. I could go on.The pool was great for both children. My daughter, who is 4 feet tall and gets cold easily, loved that she could stand in parts of it and it was heated. The dolphins, turtle and sting rays were all fun to watch in between swims. While the pool is a little small, we were always able to get two lounge chairs together. The Plumeria breakfast buffet was exceptional, with the usual buffet breakfast choices as well as Japanese fare, cold coconut tapioca soup, acai sorbet, made to order omelets, fresh papaya, coconut syrup for waffles, among others. There is inside and outside seating, and the sunrises there are just beautiful. Although the hotel is in a secluded area where one needs a car or taxi, it was not too far from shopping or some Oahu attractions. In addition to it being close to Waikiki, The Kahala Mall is approximately 2 miles away. It has a Whole Foods grocery store and a pharmacy, so we could easily buy some snacks and drinks to fill our non-stocked refrigerator. We also found some less expensive restaurants there. Diamond Head is just a couple of miles down Kahala Avenue, and Hanauma Bay is about 15 minutes away. We rented snorkeling equipment from the hotel to use at Hanauma Bay, and it was good quality.I took a sunset paddleboard yoga class through their fitness center that was just amazing. It was just me and the instructor, Daniel. Having never been on a paddleboard, I was a little nervous about falling off, but never did. The yoga instruction was perfect for an evening workout, and the sunset was beautiful.We enjoyed the beach, too. We rented a paddleboard a couple of times; no lesson was necessary. We enjoyed the calmness of the bay and swimming out to their anchored dock.Our family would definitely recommend this hotel to others, and we hope to come back one day. It is truly a gem.

I've stayed at the Kahala twice previously and in the interest of full disclosure I'm going to be staying there again this year. Very candidly, just being honest here, I’ve never written a hotel review before and I’m doing so now in the hope the management reads this review and takes the necessary steps to make sure my family has an enjoyable stay - they can feel free to reach out to me directly ahead of time if they like. You see, this place frustrates me to no end because it has such amazing potential…and it just doesn’t quite meet it. Look, I totally get the laid back, tropical life style/attitude but there is a lot of mismanagement and laziness…PROS:Pretty kid friendlyNice staff (generally speaking)Some great good on-site restaurantsSafe and secure locationWonderful breakfast buffetPretty good fitness centerDecorated beautifullySome rooms have amazing viewsFriendly/fast valetsCONS: Poor quality food choices/options when ordering at the beach or poolFor these prices and 5 star rating you would expect better care when booking cabanas/beach chairsOur hotel rooms were located all over the hotel and not close togetherSome rooms have a view of the parking lotThe pool area is bananas – there are kids screaming everywhere and it is surely exceeding the limitsThe front desk staff always seems half asleep and/or confusedThe first room they gave us had a metal ladder and tools haphazardly throw around in it as they were in the process of repairing something.Another guest already occupied the second room they gave us - we scared the hell out of that guy.The staff didn’t seem shocked that they gave us rooms with tools and guests in it already.No hotel supervised transportation to/from the airport.NEITHER PRO NOR CON:The staff calls you by name. This is cool but not necessary – I wish they put this much effort into making the experience better.There is a dolphin lagoon – Cool for the kids but seems rather cruel in many ways.CONCLUSION:I really like the Kahala. I really do. But I don't love it. I could if they would take the simple yet necessary steps to ensure thet the price paid commensurates with the experience. Stay tuned for a follow up because I'll let you know how my upcoming trip works out.

Great location to be with teens. Wonderful and spacious beach, nice neighborhood away from the bustle of Waikiki. Easy 15 minute drive into Waikiki for great dining and shopping. Also 15 minutes away from fun outdoor activities, snorkeling, hiking, parasailing, etc. Breakfast buffet every morning is a great way to start the day, so much food options we skipped lunch. Everyone at hotel very friendly and service oriented. It was a very relaxing week. Only drawback is hotel is a bit tired and expensive but if you can ignore these flaws you will not regret staying there. (Expensive in that it is priced as a Four Seasons but not in same condition, for example our lanai chairs did not match, bathroom was tired, etc.)

This was our 4th visit in the last 5 years (during Thanksgiving), 2nd time in a suite, and I believe the service has improved, esp around the pool and beach area. The staff have clearly made an effort to remember your names and preferences for cabana locations on the beach and at poolside. While some of the lunch food choices have disappeared some new ones are remarkable including the grilled fish sandwich and Hawaiian drinks at the seaside grill and Plumeria bar. Plumeria House also served us a wonderful Thanksgiving dinner buffet and has some additional dinner offerings and a curry lunch on Wed. While on vacation having access to good quality food and beverage onsite is clearly a draw for us and many of the other repeat guests. I only wish the Japanese restaurant did not leave. It has been replaced by an Italian restaurant which we did not try on this visit. My visits to the spa were exceptional esp the 1 hr deep tissue and the 30 min lomi lomi foot massage. They have a shuttle which we utilized several times to visit Waikiki for some offsite dinners and shopping. This is a very good resort for families with young children who love to see the dolphins, turtles and stingrays next to the pool and want a calm beach that is on the same level as the pool and seaside grill.
user_name:
Pamela K
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: We went to this hotel for our 25 wedding anniversary and we were not disappointed. On our arrival we were treated to a bottle of champagne-a lovely touch.All the staff try to get to know you by name which is a nice touch.The rooms are large, comfortable and the views are wonderful. we had a partial sea view room which was just great.The resort is nice and quiet and relaxing away from the hustle and bustle of waikiki-you can even walk to the Kahala shopping mall down the road if you dont feel like going into Waikiki.The dolphin experience was my personal highlight-the team there were excellent and the dolphin experience although expensive is well worth it.What makes this resort so special is how staff and other customers treat you-with respect and thoughtfullness-when we were there an A list movie star was staying there, no one bothered him for autographs or photos and this says alot about the resort.I cannot wait to return one day.

We spent one night at Kahala before departing for home after five days on the Big Island. It was a really indulgent treat to stay here. Our room, 1209, was in the dolphin wing overlooking the dolphin's pool. We spent so much time on our balcony watching them swim around and play, we didn't want to leave our room. We did make it to the beach and enjoyed a late lunch and cocktail on the chaise lounges. Really a heavenly, carefree experience as the beachfront and pool areas are gorgeous without the maddening crowds experienced elsewhere. Breakfast the next morning at Plumeria is delightful, right on the beachfront. At the Kahala, quality of service and accommodations are exceptional compared to everything else on Oahu. We cannot wait to return next Thanksgiving!

The Kahala Hotel and Resort is great for families and romantic getaways, and is a good hotel for business travelers too.There are several onsite restaurants, although only a couple of them serve diners in "casual" wear. This hotel has a very formal feel to it. That being said, the beachfront Plumeria restaurant onsite is a great place to enjoy a sunrise breakfast or a sunset dinner. The setting, just yards from the beach and with a view of Koko Crater, couldn't be more beautiful.The hotel is in a upscale neighborhood, walking distance to Kahala Mall. It is advisable to have a car when staying here or plan to hire a taxi or car service because this hotel is slightly off the beaten path, though only a few miles from Waikiki.
