The hotel has an in-house taxi drivers as well (I really enjoyed riding around Oahu with Doug, a driver who is also a survivor of the Pearl Harbor attack and who seems to love to share his knowledge about Hawaii with guests).The rooms were nicely decorated, however the were minus some of the niceties that might be found at other resort hotels (i.e. no TV embedded in the bathroom mirror or other such things here).The facilities of the hotel were wonderful although, again, the swimming pool wasn't nearly as fancy as some of the "free form" pools available at other resorts. However, the no frills pool is right next to the on-site dolphin and sea turtle ponds where, for a fee, you can swim with dolphins. Hard to beat.And the beach, though small and with a very close in reef, is a good place to go for a convenient dip in the ocean or to learn how to snorkel or paddle board. Rental equipment is available right on the beach.Overall, I don't see how you could go wrong by staying at the Kahala Hotel, as long as you can stand looking at your credit card bill afterwards.

The Kahala Hotel is the most beautiful place I have ever stayed. The staff are exceptional. My best friend and I stayed for 5 days and celebrated my 44th birthday. I felt very special and even received a room upgrade. I went swimming with the dolphins and paddle boarded for the first time. I can still taste the breakfast buffet. The food was very delicious and fresh. The room was beautiful and comfortable. I miss the bed.....I'm looking forward to next year when I return :)

The only place that comes close is the Hale Kulani in Waikiki, equally as superlative. But Kahala is off the beaten track, and the Hale Kulani is smack in the middle of it.Kahala possesses so many qualities that it is difficult to list them all. Old-fashioned elegance and charm. Highly professional and courteous staff. Incredible use of space in the rooms, not remotely cramped. Beautiful ocean and mountain views. Excellent restaurants. A beach/poolside bar that is wonderful. On site ponds with dolphins, turtles and tropical fish. Did I mention dolphins!? Tasteful and discreet management of celebrity guests. More Japanese weddings than one can count.This was the back end of a 50th birthday party -- we sent the others home after a week at Ko Olina, then sunk in at Kahala to lose ourselves to its charms. Close enough to Honolulu for social needs, far enough to be quiet and private. Perfect launching spot for a round the island drive. We entertained local friends and business associates at a few of the venues on site.There you have it. Kahala is a perfect tie with Hale Kulani, easily the most exclusives spots on Oahu. If the hustle and bustle of Waikiki is not your thing, then choose Kahala. We will be back to this special treasure.

This is not our first and will not be our last visit, we paid the little extra this time and had a dolphin launi room , room 1113 .We were captivated with the dolphins and found we sat for hours watching them.We also swam with them so amazing.I also had a facial given by the lovely Naomi , wonderful ,relaxing and fantastic skin afterwards I purchased the creams etc ,so my skin is the best it has ever been in the english winter weather, so I feel worth ever penny.We ate in all there restaurants ,had high tea, and room service,all wonderful, my favourite meal being the Rosemary and salted roast chicken on the room service menu.We booked the North shore trip with the Kahala ,even in the rain it is a fantastic ,beautiful tour.The Kahala has a lot of water sports to try and reasonable costs.All the staff as always helpful, polite and smiling, I would just like to thank the turndown service ladies for there attention to the little things that made us feel special extra english tea bag as they noticed we didn't drink other tea or coffee.thank you.see you soon

I travelled here with a buddy for a convention and had mixed feelings on the hotel. The location is far from downtown and Waikiki Beach but the setting would have been great to avoid the hustle and bustle of those areas if that is what we were searching for. The hotel is quite a distance from the airport as well and its best to arrange car service from the airport if you wish to stay at this hotel.The grounds were really nice featuring a semi private beach, small pool and its own dolphin experience. I found that most of the people staying at the hotel were there for conventions or were families, so if your seeking a night life or a bustling beach this would not be a place for you.The hotel rooms I would rate a 7 out of 10. They have definitely tried to rejuvenate them but they have odd layouts and didn't really impress us. The staff was fairly friendly except for the reception on check in. We were booked for a room with two queen beds and ocean view but were told that even though thats what we booked that wasn't guaranteed. Really? It took two managers and a little strong arming in order to get them to mysteriously find us a room with two beds that the initial 2 people we spoke with didn't have. They gave us a golf course view room but didn't lower the price to reflect it either.All in all if you are a family trying to get away this may be a good option for you, just make sure you have it well documented on which room you will actually get when you arrive.

What an excellent place to relax. We stayed for 9 nights, being 2 adults and an 8 year old child. The setting on such a beautiful swimming beach is great with some coral reef to swim on and see some fish. Having the dolphins right outside our door was great and our daughter loved going to see the fish, sea turtles and sting rays. The room was awesome, being a great size and having a good layout and amenities with large bathroom as well. The beds were very comfortable.Things that we did not like were few. The pool is very small and I could imagine when the hotel is busier (was about 50% occupied when we were there) it would be a big problem, although having the beach should ease the strain. The kids club offered some good options - crabbing, net fishing and more - but it was too expensive and nobody else was willing to pay. There were plenty of kids at the hotel but we had to cancel our daughter's time at the kids club because she was the only one there. They should use the kids club as an attraction to attract families, making it free, rather than trying to suck more money out of guests (other hotels we stay at with free kids clubs are always better than paid ones). Not much else to complain about except perhaps the $28/day for parking - something they could possibly justify in Waikiki where parking is tight, but not so much a way outside the main centre. You did feel you were being sucked dry of money sometimes.We went into Waikiki and wandered around resorts there and the Kahala is miles ahead of those - crowded and dirty around the beaches with drunks lying around in some places.We would definitely recommend the Kahala and will stay there again when we return to Hawaii.

We just returned from a one week stay at the Kahala resort and had a fantastic time! The staff are extremely helpful and friendly everywhere you go on the resort. The resort property is unbelievably clean and there is tons to see and do, there are five dolphins that call the Kahala home, you can spend hours watching them play in the lagoon. You can lounge pool side or 100 ft away on the beach, both have food and beverage/ bar service. The beach is great, the cove in front of the beach allows for a safe swimming area for the kids, also morning yoga class in the water on a surf board……that was really cool. The resort has several restaurants, the food was fantastic, all but one have a great view of the ocean. The rooms are beautify appointed, the bathrooms have his and her closets and sinks, we made the mistake of cheeping out and not getting a balcony suite, that won't happen again. The breakfast that happens on the beach side patio every morning is spectacular, but pricy and is the only option we found on the resort, take my advice and book the breakfast package deal with your room. Saying that, a resort of this caliber does not come cheaply. If you are working on a limited budget or looking for a cheap getaway……this is not your place. The property is about a 15 minute drive to downtown Honolulu and Waikiki beach, this works well as it is an easy drive or short evening cab ride to head out and see the sites, or head east and go up island and enjoy the scenery. We did this trip as a couples trip however there were tons of families there as well. I am rating this resort experience as a five star, as it truly exceeded our expectations. We will be returning in the future.

I could never stay anywhere else in Oahu. This is seriously the best hotel I have ever stayed at. From check-in the staff treated us like we were so special. We were upgraded to an ocean view room for our 25th anniversary. The room was amazing! Very clean, spacious, comfortable and we loved the decor. They really think of everything with so many special touches to make you feel welcome. The resort itself had a casual eligance. Absolutely loved the dolphins! The beach was beautiful and clean. The pool staff really takes good care of you. They provide lounge chairs free too the guests and will place them where you want and even give you covers for them. The pool is nice for those who like hanging at the pool. Not three/four rows deep of people all around the pool like we saw in Waikiki. That being said... I could NEVER stay in Waikiki! That place is crazy busy! Although it is close enough to visit when you want for more attractions, dining options and shopping. The valet is very helpful getting you where you want to go. The breakfast buffet is a must! Loved it! Great selections. On our last day I expressed to our server how much I loved the sticky buns and she was so sweet and brought me some in a container to take home. I could go on and on. We have been forever spoiled and will always be comparing all other hotels to the Kahala.

This is a great family resort. We stayed here with our 20 month old and we absolutely loved it. The hotel staff is very attentive and the rooms are pretty big size. The dolphin lagoon was very entertaining and the beach itself is very clean and peaceful.

This is a luxury resort with exceptional service. It is kind of secluded away from the business of Honolulu. The rooms are very clean and decorated nicely. The food is great and the staff is very friendly.

We decided to stay at the Kahala since we had three nights in Honolulu before a conference and have friends who swear by it. After three nights we are sold. While not having the luxury trappings of the Four Seasons type hotels, this hotel is a throw back to the 1960's in a good way. The service is as good as we have experienced. Every one of the staff we encountered was friendly and competent. The drink and restaurant prices were reasonable for a 5 star hotel. Free wifi was appreciated The spa services were excellent. The Dolphin encounter was a highlight for my husband and we both enjoyed the waterfall and dolphins in walking the property from the hotel to the pool. We loved the live music in the Veranda and even had dinner there one night--the food and cocktails are very good--to fully enjoy experience. The definitely downside to the property is the smallish pool with a lot of small children always there which is not a peaceful pool environment. But the overall relaxation, elegant, low key and unpretentious atmosphere of the hotel will bring us back.

We have visited Hawaii many times and have stayed in Waikiki at least 5 times. We wanted to go to Oahu but did not want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We took a chance on this property and were not disappointed. This was the last stop on a 5 city vacation so we wanted relaxation and were not disappointed.This resort is about 15 minutes further than Waikiki (coming from the airport) but well worth the extra , small amount , of time. The beach was calm (we paddle boarded) and secluded. They have casitas (2 person ) on the beach and cabanas (tents you can fit 4 chairs under) right at the edge of the beach. Reasonably priced. It was quite windy when we were there- not sure if it is this area in general (Waikiki was not as windy) or if we just caught a windy week. Pool looked nice but we stayed on the beach so not much more to say about the pool area except that the staff was friendly.EXCELLENT restaurant by the pool-- it is in the sand so you don't have to wear shoes (perfect for coming off the beach). Lots of shade there too-(sails in the trees) which was much appreciated. Who wants to eat with sun beating down on you…My 12 year old did the dolphin encounter and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is right in the main area by the pool- perfect to have it on site-- we just walked from the beach and were there. Room (2 bedroom suite) was really nice. Clean, beautiful motif, and service was excellent. Room service was great too. You get free drinks and snacks late afternoon (with the rate I purchased) and that was nice too.My only disappointment was the new italian restaurant. I don't mind fancy but this was very "fru-fru"-- with a fixed limited menu (you could do 4 or 5 courses-- no a la carte). If you want that type of "tasting" dining experience it was good, but not what I expected so I was a bit disappointed. Service was excellent there as well though.We went into Waikiki one night for dinner and the taxi ride was quick. Tell them to take the back way- much nicer a drive than the highway.We will definitely be back.

i just got back from 5 nights at the Kahala with my husband, and two small daughters. we went on two friend's recommendations and we weren't disappointed. our room was really big with a huge bathroom.The pool was lovely with a view of the secluded beach. After visiting Waikiki I'm glad we didn't stay there. The beach was crazy! At the Kahala the beach was so peaceful and great for kids. There is a free shuttle bus that takes you to waikiki, the ala moana mall or the Kahala Mall (not that special) the shuttle service is great.the buffet breakfast was delicious with a great choice. We also ate at the Plumeria restaurant for dinner and the service and food was excellent.The dolphins, turtle and sting rays in the lagoon were great to watch too.We will definitely go back to the Kahala Resort and would highly recommend it.

Whlile we definitely encourage travelers, vacationers, adventurers to visit Hawaii and to make their stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort a must, this review is directed more to our Hawaii residents. What a perfect place for a getaway and a renewal of vows, a resurgence of energy, profound relaxation...all without the stress of airports, car rentals, etc. There was no need or urgency to leave the hotel grounds as we celebrated my milestone birthday and our approaching milestone wedding anniversary.The nicest and most capable hotel staff ever! As a realtor on O'ahu I have always encouraged visiting clients to take advantage of this secluded yet accessible resort. Mahalo!
user_name:
Marc M
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: I couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience. The hotel caters to your every need and want from check in to check out and everything in between! Great restaurants and room service with an almost private beach gives you that intimate experience. You almost don't even have to leave the grounds.

We loved the Kahala. We had 2 nights in Waikiki when we first arrived at Halekalani which is my favorite hotel, decided to try Kahala for our last 3 nights. So glad we did the hotel is beautiful. We got upgraded to a room with a a balcony with lovely mountain & partial ocean view, the rooms were huge and beautifully decorated. Our room wasn't ready as we arrived early having access to the courtesy room was great. We loved the Dolphins it's wonderful being able to see them whenever you like. The restaurant on beach front is beautiful such a great aspect, we didn't think much of Italian restaurant. Only negative was the shuttle it was booked out on 2 occasions so we caught cab into Waikiki which cost us over $50. Would definitely stay here again

My wife and I started our honeymoon with a 4-night stay here in early October. Things started off on the right foot with a complimentary upgrade to a room right next to the dolphin lagoon, and just got better from there. I made arrangements with the concierge to surprise my wife with some champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries in our room -- the spread was outstanding and beautifully presented. We felt like royalty. The Kahala staff knows how to provide a truly luxurious experience free of ostentation or the kind of over-the-top Vegas-style gaudiness you find at other resorts. I hope we can return for our anniversary.

For the second part of our tour we picked The Kahala to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary after enjoying the delights of San Francisco. The hotel is lovely, beautiful beach, not very crowded and always helpful staff to find you sun beds and towels. The staff are a real credit to this hotel, always happy, they made our holiday. Would especially like to thank the lady on the reception desk who helped get us a taxi and contact the tour we were mis-sold by our holiday company (they didn't realise tour didn't pick up from our hotel - doh!). Restaurants are brilliant, lovely food, I recommend Hoku, lovely meal, they even bought us a dessert with Happy Anniversary on it, lovely touch. Yes, the hotel pool is not very big and was popular with families but this did not stop our enjoyment. I always prefer the beach anyway. Much of the grounds are given over to the dolphin lagoon, we did not swim with them but saw that this was popular. After visiting Waikiki and looking at the hotels we were going to choose I think we made the right decision. Thank you Kahala, lots of happy memories!

My husband Bill and I spent 8 beautiful days at the Kahala to celebrate my 60th birthday and my 1st trip to Hawaii. I can not even begin to describe how beautiful the hotel was. I am a Virgo and a "clean freak" and I walked the halls and even my room in my bare feet. The room over looked the mountain and to the right was the ocean and below us was the Dolphin Quest lagoon. Every night we had turn down service with fresh towels and bottled water and our robes and slippers laid out for us. The CD played romantic and relaxing Hawaiian music upon our return to the room. We loved having breakfast overlooking the ocean and sitting outside under the Plumeria trees. We had dinner at the Veranda several times and the service was outstanding. Had lunch and drinks at the Seaside Grill and as with all the restaurants the food and service was exemplary! Have seen several reviews that some of the food items were pricey One word HAWAII. How can you put a price on the ambiance of the sun and the ocean and all that is Hawaii. A very special Thank You goes to Cameron Frithsen who planned all our activities from my "bucket list" and was instrumental in making this the best birthday vacation ever. Linda at the front desk for our pain free check in and use of the visitors suite on our last day there. Michael and her trainee ( sorry can't remember her name) who truly went all out to make my birthday special all the way down to a candle and happy birthday written on my dessert. And last but not least our house keepers and turn down service who were friendly, efficient and went above our expectations.

I have always, always loved the Kahala and followed it through its changes, name changes, and everything else. I have stayed here now twice in the same month and, quite frankly, if it was not for the people, I think I may have to change my allegiance. Instead of rewarding frequent stays, they tend to do just the opposite. This time, for the first time in 40 years, I got a room without a lanai (usually get that as a complimentary upgrade) and the package I usually get which included breakfast for 2 (still a great deal for 2), was not an option for me at this time. I felt that they have finally gotten to a point in its wonderful history, that they have turned into just another expensive hotel except that the location remains excellent. I think they forgot who the customer is and this is coming from a long time guest of the Kahala. I will say that in all of my visits this is the first time I have ever given an "average" rating. I don't know what happened but it has changed.They will probably hate me for this review but I'm stating facts. I'm kind of disappointed and this is after talking with the latest general manager. You would think???

My wife and I have stayed here twice and if you are going to Honolulu, THIS is the hotel to stay at. Very well kept and just a great property. We LOVED having breakfast out by the water and watching the sunrise come over the mountains. I actually surprised my wife there as that is where we got engaged! If you go there make sure you get the Acai bowl as it's probably the best Acai dish we have ever had. The dolphins in the back were a nice touch and their chocolate covered macadmias in our room were way too good. Highly recommend this hotel!

My husband and I spent 3 nights here and wished that we had booked a longer stay. The experience from the greeting by the valet, the check in to the check out was superb. So many of the staff have been there for years (one I met over 40 years) I believe this is telling of how wonderful it is. A real test of staff to me is if you report something that you think is a problem and they take care of it right then and there and don't suggest that you speak to someone else or say they will report it, I had this happen twice here, I was impressed. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable (though I must say the mattresses in room 927 could use a flip!), the amenities are nice, the lighting and television well thought out. The best part of the hotel is it is away from Waikiki. You have to see it to understand. The breakfast buffet is great, and FYI if you want eggs other than an omelet, ask. We ate in Hoku's twice. The first night we had their 50th Anniversary dinner with a wine pairing. It was well presented and tasty. The wine pairing is a bargain. The second night we had a sushi/sashimi appetizer, I am wishing for that right now! We shared the lamb chop dinner, the lamb is encrusted in salt and roasted, they break it out of the salt shell at the table for you. We also had a tempura appetizer that I could have done without. My one comment is that the pool is small and there were a lot of children running around. It would be much nicer if there were two pools. There is a baby pool but the babies/children all seemed to be either in the big pool or the Jacuzzi. Otherwise, the pool is nice, chairs seemed to be plentiful and there is good service. You can have lunch at the Grill (needs a more diverse menu) the Chinese Chicken Salad was very good. The dolphins are right next to the pool area and are a good source of amusement to visit throughout the day. Cannot wait to visit again!

This may have been the best hotel or resort experience that we have ever enjoyed. The facility was simply beautiful and elegant. The rooms are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The view from our balcony was truly eye-popping. The service was outstanding - with the staff trying to not just meet but exceed your expectations at every turn. We ended up ordering room service several times because we couldn't beat the view from our balcony. The Dolphin Quest adventure was beyond words and we spent hours watching the dolphins and trainers from our balcony during our visit. First class - all the way and a fabulous vacation experience.

My family had a great time! We loved the quiet location and friendly attentive staff , Great food . Spacious updated room. Lovely grounds. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet overlooking the ocean in the morning which was in our package.. My grandson had a great time at the pool.  He also swam with the dolphins at Dolpin Quest which is on location. They have a great staff educating the public about marine life. Great calm beach to swim on and only a short drive to Wakiki! Thanks! See you next year. Mahalo

our vacation at the kahala was one of the most wonderful we have ever had. the hotel itself is airy, beachy, and gracious. although every hotel needs to upgrade at some point, i hope they never change their lively-yet-elegant signature decor! i have enjoyed many of the newer properties in hawaii but i especially love a place that has character and an aesthetic that speak to a particular time and place. the kahala is one of those. the spectacular postmodern chandeliers in the main lobby say it all! we actually came up with excuses to walk through the lobby a few times every day.our room was outstanding and the people at check-in were very helpful with it. the first room we received turned out to be a handicapped accessible room, which, while lovely, had some modifications that we did not need. carolyn was wonderful in finding us another one the very next day.we enjoyed the resort restaurants as well. our favorite meal might have been the breakfast buffet every day overlooking the ocean at plumeria -- but we also really enjoyed the veranda and the seaside grill. we had just come from a week in waikiki, so we had been at lots of different restaurants already and did not feel deprived of options.we were not interested in the dolphin lagoon,and travelers looking for a larger pool area (or multiple pools) might be disappointed. however, the smallish pool was fine for our needs.at a resort like this, the service can make or break the experience -- and the first-rate service was really the cherry on top of a perfect week. the kahala is highly recommended and we would love to return.

My girlfriend and I chose the Kahala because we wanted a quiet, high-end resort experience with close proximity to Honolulu's amenities, but away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The only property that fits this bill on Oahu is the Kahala (the JW Marriott, Disney Aulani and Turtle Bay are all located far outside the City, while all the other hotels are located in Waikiki). To be sure, in its location, the Kahala was perfect. Situated in a quiet, upscale residential suburb, the Kahala offered us the tranquility we were looking for, with a great little beach, but only a 10-20 minute drive to all the major shopping, restaurants and historic sites of the city. The actual resort is small-ish and characterised by a subdued aesthetic. If you're looking for a grand, sprawling resort with huge pool features and amenities, then this is not the right place. I liked the low-key atmosphere, which I found relaxing and unpretentious and a far cry from the maddening crowds of the larger resorts on Waikiki.The rooms were large and as with most luxury hotels, came with a very comfortable bed with ultra-soft pillows and a pillow-top mattress. Amenities included free internet, free daily bottled water, Tommy Bahama bathroom amenities and evening turndown service. Decor was island-style but still felt up-to-date and not particularly dated. Service was satisfactory, though not quite up to the standard of other 5-star hotels in major cities. One day, the maid service just failed to come despite our having hung the "Please Service" hanger on our door knob from 8:30am. Some of the concierge's restaurant recommendations also did not turn out to be particularly good. Further, unlike at other 5-star resorts and hotels, we just didn't feel that the service staff made efforts to truly anticipate our needs. At other 5-star resorts, while at the pool or beach, attendants will often come to serve you cold water or pineapple slices or chilled towels, but this was not the case at the Kahala. Service was definitely friendly throughout, I just did not feel that it went the extra mile that I would expect from a 5-star hotel. We ate breakfast at the Plumeria House buffet every morning which had a limited selection. It was not impressive, but again was satisfactory for our purposes. We also dined at their fine dining restaurant Hoku's which was overpriced for what was offered. I would recommend going to Roy's down the highway in Hawaii Kai for better food at cheaper prices. All in all, I would not describe the Kahala as 5-star luxury, so much as 4.5 star high end. Everything was satisfactory and I would definitely come back again because of its location and relaxing atmosphere the next time I am in Honolulu, however I cannot say that it truly stands out among other comparable resorts.

The arrival lobby is reminiscent of an era of style a d elegance with a huge well furnished sitting area with flowers and vases. The hotel is located about 10min away from the touristy bustle of Waikiki and allows the adult guest a somewhat relaxed atmosphere with a beautiful and placid beach ( unpatrolled so caution). Check in good with the usual upsell of better rooms for a fee when you arrived which was enticing.The rooms somewhat ageing as most of its Honolulu competitors ( beside the Trump) offer decent sized accomodation providing you take a upgrade to the Laguna fronted rooms where you will entered by the antics of the resident dolphins. This is one of the highlights of the resort that prides itself with its performing troop of dolphins which you can interact with for a hefty fee of course or $100-200. The food options are ok with breakfast being served in a roomy cafe while you line up like cattle to fill your plate with the usual American calorie rich breakfast intake. There two other restarts being an Italian and and a modern international fusion restaurant at five star prices. For convenience they pass, but there are better offerings in Honolulu centre. As a family of 4 ( two kids aged 4 and 6) the food was o.k but we started getting tired of tipping and taxes and our way to the Wailea shopping centre where wholefoods chain provided excellent healthy foods and also there were other USA franchised food places to keep the family happy.One major complaint was the poorly run kids club which was small, lacked diverse activities and was run by staff who were not very flexible or compassionate to the needs of young children. They required advanced booking of activities and were not very friendly in my opinion. The resort being a five star should move the kids club over to numerous vacant spaces on the lower ground floor and provide a real kids club with games, outdoor play areas ect Overall, the place passes but is ageing with a need to upgrade the infrastructure especially the on,y small pool which had us packed around like sardines. If management asked the owners to expand and renovate the pool the experience would have been enhanced.

This was the most wonderful place i have ever visited in my life! My wife and I were here for our Honeymoon and had the most romantic experience we could have ever imagined! The private beach was Great! The staff was Great! The food was Great! The Kahala was Great! The resort is not that far from shopping and .......! I could go on and on about this place! Lower the price for the dolphins and give a better native experience for the guests like a luau and it would have been mind blowing. Over all a great place to visit. they aren't letting me book our trip to The Kahala for next year yet because it has to be within 330 days or so but you can bet we will be there next year for Sure!!!!!!!
user_name:
Michael Y
Memphis, Tennessee, United States

review_body: Enjoy the peace and beauty of Oahu...away from the crazy crowds of Waikiki!!! Worth the extra $ just to leave the crowds. Love the private beach and lagoon area. Comfortable large rooms. Nice staff; Food is wonderful. Only negative was they were doing some construction...which seems to be the norm this time of year on Oahu! If you want to hit Waikiki...they have a shuttle to and from. This is a must return hotel. Huge breakfast buffet with everything you could want. Dolphins, Stingrays, Turtles ... really amazing. And check out the Orchid Wall...quite lovely

Beautifully sited, lovely beach and quite swimmable, and quiet and luxurious. Everything here is a five star experience, from the bell staff to the restaurants to the speed of the elevators. Some of the best room service ANYWHERE. Comfortable and frequent shuttles can take you to the local mall and into Waikiki and Honolulu. The concierge staff is aMAZing, and has arranged all manner of ministrations for us. The staff remembers your name. Flora de Montagne, the Manager, attends to guests personally and wands away problems like your own fairy godmother. The steep discounts for advance reservations put suites in a human price range. This is a hotel I go back to whenever I can.

Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, wonderful food. The Kahala is a must do. Everything about the hotel is brilliant from the warm aloha greeting at the door on arrival through to the wave goodbye. We had a dolphin lanai and woke each day to see 6 dolphins playing! There are ponds of tropical fish and rays meandering round the gardens. The restaurant on the beach us buffet style and magnificent. So much choice - for dinner AND breakfast. Can't wait to go back.....

First time in Hawaii, first time at the Kahala hotel and what an experience! I was a little nervous looking for a kid friendly hotel (we have 2.5 year old) and I'm so happy we took the right choice. From the moment we got off the taxi to the moment we were leaving (we spent 8 days at the hotel) we had a wonderful experienceThe beach, the swimming pool, the restaurants.. eveywhere nice people ready to help us in anything we need, and very attentive with my son. We definitely will be backTIP: check for the hotel's shuttle schedule. No need to pay for taxis to Waikiki or to the Kahala mall

I will be listing my review of the hotel in a different post... I had a wonderful massage with a very kind gentleman named Fred. He gave me an incredible massage, completely tailored to my needs. I also had an amazing 4 hand Hula massage at the hotel earlier in the week. I would highly recommend the spa!

Staying at the Kahala hotel is a great escape from reality. Its not busy and congested like hotels in Waikiki. There are several great dinning options right on the hotel and other food options off site at the nearby Kahala mall. Hoku's is a great place for a romantic dinner and Plumeria has a great breakfast options with the added bonus of having ocean views while eating. My wife and I were married there, so it does hold a special place for us and we hope to visit every anniversary.

This vacation was our 3rd two week stay at The Kahala in 4 years & my wife & I have had the most fantastic time - again. The staff are so fantastic at maintaining this hotel & resort to it's high 5* standard. We would not stay at any other place in Hawaii. You are treated like royalty here & nothing is a problem. We dined at Hoku's & Arancino's and the food & sevice at both was exceptional. Mahalo to Flora & every one else at The Kahala. Can't wait to return. Colin & Michelle N.

Wonderful, wonderful time! Beautiful establishment on the beach, their own dolphin lagoon (you can even swim with the dolphins), fabulous employees, very attentive, just a very lovely resort! Amiee Graham (sales manager) went above and beyond to ensure we had a trip of a lifetime and catered to our every whim. Tony, the bartender on the beach was fabulous (incredible Mai Tai's), Todd in Valet was great and you couldn't ask for more than Cameron in Concierge. Everything was GREAT! Beautiful rooms, lovely views and very attentive staff. Of coarse you do pay first class prices, but you get first class service!

The Kahala is the best hotel ever, as you walk into the reception area you are transformed into luxury and splendour your eyes not knowing where to look first. Orchards growing up walls to the most magnificent chandeliers and furniture. Our room was large, the bed was super comfy and the shower was strong with the most fantastic views of mountains, sea and sunrise. Breakfast was 5 star and really set you up for the day, overlooking the beach with the fragrant smell of the plumeria ( frangipani) all around. The beach was cleaned everyday and no matter what time of day you went down, there was always a bed for you. To have Dolphins, stingrays, turtles and an array of tropical fish to see everyday was a bonus, all of them looked after so well with lots of enrichment programmes in place and first class food to eat. Swimming with these beautiful creatures was the highlight of our holiday the trainers were so knowledgable and you could tell they had a special bond with each other.We did not experience any problem with the shuttle service we got a ride every time, sometimes leaving it to the last minute. Waikiki is very busy, which made the Kahala even more special being away from the hub bub but near enough to visit and join in the fun of Waikiki. One of the most important things that makes a holiday are the staff. The staff at the Kahala were amazing, friendly and attentive. A special mention to our housekeeper who always maintained our room to the highest standards, putting on Hawaiian music, turning down our bed leaving us slippers and recipes, it's these little things that made our day.Also a special mention to Cameron on the information desk who booked all our excursions, gave us good recommendations, booked taxis and restaurants for us, nothing was too much trouble.We will definitely be returning to the Kahala resort, you are in our hearts forever. Mahala

Hotel is a first class property, as one would expect from a Leading Hotels of the World---so why only three stars from me? Because for $500 a night I'd like to take a swim in the pool, virtually impossible with hordes of Japanese toddlers being pulled around in inflatable rafts and when I say hordes I mean hordes, like 20-30 blow up rafts of various sizes. Now I realize that without these Japanese tourists upscale hotels like The Kahala might as well shut their doors, but for those of us in the minority, older folks who are looking for a true resort experience, the 90% majority, all of whom seem to have a toddler in tow, pretty much take that option off the table. Hope this review helps another traveller not make the same mistake I did. Too bad, Kahala could have been great!

First trip to Hawaii for wife and me. Stayed two nights before our cruise around the islands. It was awesome. From the greeting by the valet parkers to the bellman's timeliness with luggage delivery and retrieval, the front desk staff, the restaurant and bar staff, pool staff, and even a conversation with one of the dolpin trainers was delightful. It's a great resort, a little past Diamondhead in a high end neighborhood surrounded by a private golf club (not available for guest play). Mr.Sweeney and his team have quite a gem, and while more expensive, you truly do get what you pay for. Congrats and keep it up. Hope to be back!

We had three things happen that I find totally acceptable at a 5 star property. First I noticed on the second day of our trip (after pre-paying for our stay) on Expedia that the hotel had re-charged my room rate. And it wasn't just a hold it was a $4,000 cleared charge that the hotel needed 5 days to reverse. They admitted to the mistake. As if to rub it in the hotel continued to hold amounts on my credit (impacting my available balance) of $9,000. The manager admitted the holds were excessive but had no explanation. He said "it seems totally excessive". I agreed given I had been charged twice for my rooms and spent only $2,000 while at the property that $13,000 was "totally excessive". Next while moving a dresser to use a power socket for my laptop I noticed a large red stain that seemed to have flowed from the headboard down to the carpet. My wife and I both thought it was blood (it had gone dark brown) the head of house keeping agreed, then disagreed. The on duty manager said it was red grease. we were skeptical and irrespective it was disgusting.The nail in the coffin was that my wife sent out her white jeans for cleaning and the came back as if they had been dropped in the dirt. They were filthy. It was the last straw for me. I complained about all this and was given a $300 room credit or a 3% discount on our entire stay. It just did not seem like enough.If you want to be out of Honolulu head to Turtle Bay, if you don't care the Halekulani and Royal Hawaiian are just much better hotels. Given our experience The Inn at Schofield Barracks would have been a better choice.

This is one of the best resorts on Oahu. I've stayed at luxury hotels in Waikiki and Ko Olina. Ko Olina is too far away from the action and Waikiki is too much in the middle of the action, but Kahala is just right. It doesn't have the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but it's only 10 minutes away. The rooms are huge and luxurious. The bed was one of the best I've laid my head on! The pool is a bit small, but their beach is perfect. There is a reef right in front of the hotel, so no big waves and it's so easy to snorkel and/or kayak out there. The service was excellent and friendly. This is definitely my new hotel destination on Oahu!

I rarely take the time to write reviews, but after spending part of last week at the Kahala I feel compelled to share what a great experience that my wife and I had. Yes it's expensive - but for us it was worth every dollar.The location is excellent, the grounds are beautiful and the beach is perfect. If you are looking for restaurants and shops nearby, stay in Waikiki which is about a 15 minute drive away. If you want to get a beach cabana and forget about the world, stay at the Kahala.Our room was nice. It was clean, tastefully decorated without being over the top and quiet. The staff was warm and friendly to a person and discreet. Each and every staff person went out of their way to make you feel welcome.We will definitely be back to the Kahala for another visit. For us, it was a top 2 hotel experience.

We spent 3 days/nights here in August and loved it. The setting in Kahala is quiet and attractive. The resort is compact and it was busy, but we never felt crowded out or overlooked. Even when there were functions on, things were business as usual for the hotel guests. All the facilities, from the beach and pool to the rooms, were beautifully clean and felt fresh, and the staff were quick to tidy up at the end of the day. The public areas are airy and welcoming. We had a very spacious room looking out over the golf course and the hills beyond, and it was lovely sitting out on the lanai enjoying the cooling breezes. The bathroom was large and very well equipped. We dined at Plumeria Beach House, The Verandah and Hoku's, and found the food to be excellent, and for us, genuinely different. One of the aspects of the hotel we liked best was the staff. They were very pleasant while always being professional, were never at a loss, and really added to the holiday atmosphere. Their recognition of our birthdays was very much appreciated. Plenty of families and children were at the hotel, which we didn't mind at all, but it's something you may want to bear in mind if you're looking for a couples-type romantic getaway. There are dolphins and other sea creatures to watch in the ponds at the centre of the resort, which can be surprisingly relaxing.Special recommendation: have afternoon tea at The Verandah.

Indeed, it is also the most expensive place I have ever been. However, it is worthy every single dollar. When you arrive you directly get this Hawaiian feeling of joy and happyness. They welcome you with several gifts. It's just amazing. Service is perfect in every single detail. Its ambience breathtaking. Kahala is located 10 minutes away from Waikiki but in comparison to Waikiki hotels it offers a lot of privacy and relaxation (not commerzialized at all). Pool and (private) beach are directly connected. Breakfast buffett offers a great variety and is very delicious. There is also a pool with 6 dolfins and other beautiful fishes. As animal-loving people we thought the pool is too small but dolfins looked quite happy. And there are probably a lot of other nice things that I didn't mention. We thing this place is unique and if you can afford it you should definitely come!

We stayed at Kahala for 5 nights. First 5 nights of our 4 week honeymoon & we couldn't have picked a better place.The resort was lovely & secluded. Exactly what you need for a honeymoon. About 15min drive away from Waikiki.Although check in wasn't till 2pm, we were able to check in at 10am. Which was great as we had just flown in from Australia!We had a lovely ocean view lanai room. Our room was spacious and clean. The bathrooms were quite impressive in size. The room was cleaned twice a day & we always had a lovely selection of chocolate strawberries & champagne. It's lovely to see management go out of their way to celebrate our honeymoon with us!The bed was comfortable and if we had any requests they were always fulfilled! The staff are courteous, bubbly & helpful.Breakfast Buffet was amazing! Always fresh. Always clean & a good choice of foods.The gym was great. Had all the basic equipment and allowed us to work off our daily breakfasts!!!The pool was slightly small, not a grand resort style pool but there are plenty of beds around the pool & the pool staff are very attentive. offering sunscreen, water and plenty of clean fresh towels. The beach is lovely, just a 10m walk from the pool area. Also plenty of beds and lounges to use at the beach area.If you are looking for a hotel which is quiet & secluded in Oahu, then this is it!A BIG thank you the Kahala staff for making the start of our honeymoon so brilliant!We cannot wait to return!

Kahala to the rescue! Thank you Kahala hotel for saving us from Waikiki hell. Our stay here really made up for the nightmarish one night (which we barely lasted through) at the Sheraton Waikiki. We had such a lovely 2 week stay on the Big Island and planned on rounding our trip off in Oahu for a few nights before returning home. After the horrible experience we had at the Sheraton Waikiki, we quickly checked out early and decided to head over to the Kahala and it was the best decision made!The rooms are spacious, service first class and the private beach exclusively for Kahala guests was the cherry on top. Even the clientele here were a lot less obnoxious and more laid back. Above all, the service here is outstanding. From the valet/bell desk boys, front desk staff (James - thx for trying to help me print out my airline tix), and Lynn from housekeeping, you guys are all top notch. It's the little things that really count when it comes down to the competition between 5 star hotels on the island and yes, in my eyes you have surpassed the Halekulani in that respect. Just to give a quick example...the first night they only had king beds available for our small family (two young toddlers) and after returning back to our room later, the housekeeping staff had brought in a crib during turndown service without even requesting for one. Also, all our bath towels were replenished, my personal toiletries re-organized, my kids' stuffed toys were neatly tucked into bed & the iPhone/iPad chargers were all neatly looped and tucked nicely by the bedside table, beautiful Hawaiian music playing on the CD/ipod player and plumeria scent in the air, along with cold water bottles and ice filled in our ice bucket. It's the nice personal touches like this I appreciate as it separates this resort from the rest on the island. Even the basic mountain view room we booked had a spectacular view of the golf course and a side view of the ocean. The rooms were very clean, however, I agree with some of the others that some repairs may be needed - particularly a half-opened vent in our bathroom which probably needed to be hammered back into the wall. We will definitely be staying here again on our next visit to Oahu.

After extensive Trip Advisor research on where to stay in Oahu, we picked the right place. We were met at the airport by a car service provided by the hotel. Our driver Paul whisked us away and brought us to paradise.  The Kahala is located outside the city which for us was perfect. The lobby is beautiful. Understated elegance. The staff from the concierge to the front desk to the bellman were fantastic. Friendly, helpful, always smiling.  The room was gorgeous. A partial ocean view was quite nice. Not oceanfront but pretty good. The grounds are beautiful. Love the dolphins, stingrays, fish. Always fun to watch. The restaurants were nice. Fresh fish, lots of choices & beachfront.  The Kahala was probably one of the nicest hotels we've stayed at over the years. It's not cheap but you certainly get your money's worth. If you want a hotel away from the hustle-n- bustle of the city, this is the place.

We have stayed at the Kahala for years, returning almost every year. It is a good value if you book 60 or 90 days in advance. Far away from the crowds at Waikiki, close to the restaurants in Kaimuki and a nice walk to Starbucks in the mall is easy. The beach is seldom crowded. Pool area and pool is too small, but great for kids. We like the large bathrooms with a full shower and a separate tub. Wifi is weak. No resort fee, but parking is not included and cabs are expensive to Waikiki. The hotel as looked the same for decades. Maybe it's time to upgrade. We love it, but understand its not young any longer....just like us.

Located about a 15 minute drive from busy Waikiki is the Kahala Resort. Tucked away at the end of where some Locals call the "Beverly Hills" of Honolulu, this resort has all that you need for a nice Hawaiian getaway.Private beach is quiet and good for a dip or casual snorkeling, paddle boarding, or kayaking, it is not ideal for surfing or boogie boarding. It can get a bit windy although we did not have any issues while we were there.Service is phenomenal, and even though we were there in the summer season, we did not feel overwhelmed by small kids running about, nor did the hotel ever "look" like it was worn out by the rush of vacationers.A rental car can get you to Diamond Head in less than 10 minutes and to Waikiki in 15. We are usually traveling against rush hour traffic and that is always a perk.

We returned to Oahu for our 20th wedding anniversary with our children this year. I was reluctant to stay on/near Waikiki based on our stay "on the strip" 20 years ago. We were considering a stay on the North shore, possibly at the Disney Aluani or Turtle Beach and I am so glad our travel agent recommended the Kahala. The resort is a bit of a drive from the "strip" so be prepared to either rent a car or pay for taxi fare to and from that area. The resort was far enough away from the strip that it felt like we were on a different island this time. The resort is absolutely beautiful as soon as you walk in and see the beautiful open airy lobby that overlooks the wide deck to the ocean. I was impressed by the open and beautiful decor in the hotel hallways -- right up there with any Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons we have stayed at. The rooms were very spacious and the bathroom had two separate vanities, a separate toilet, jacuzzi tub, and rain shower stall. This bathroom also held two separate closets, a small fridge and coffee maker. The large room size was wonderful for our family of two adults and two teen girls. We never felt like we were stepping on each other. The resort grounds were just as beautiful. To get to the beach, you walk over bridges and ponds that hold seas turtles, sting rays, and dolphins -- we saw something different each time we crossed these ponds. The beach is long and pristine with private cabanas for each guest. The resort offers surf and stand up paddle lessons, and will take you out on a sailboat or canoe for a fee. We received a package that included the breakfast buffet each morning, and the food was delicious. My kids looked forward to the fried "malassadas" (donuts) each morning. Lunch by the ocean was nice as well as the drink service at the beach. We ventured outside the resort for dinner most nights. The one night we did stay, we had the resort buffet dinner. It was a bit of a let-down for the price we paid. I think that was the most expensive meal of our trip and we had a hard time finding foods that we could all enjoy (we felt the food choices were geared toward the Japanese/Asian guests). Aside from that one small blip, this resort was fantastic and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for luxury outside of the Waikiki strip.

This hotel definitely deserve 5 stars. The hotel and the service is amazing. It is a 20 minute drive to Waikiki, so a car is a must. We each had a rental car, and used them every night! A tip: You probably will save money if you get a rental car, because there aren't too many restaurants nearby and we drove into Waikiki everynight and there are PLENTY of restaurants there! The hotel has a private beach, with water as calm as the Caribbean. There's always enough lounge chairs and towels. If you want a relaxing few days and just want to spend it at the beach, you won't be disappointed. The pool was OK, and small for a luxury hotel, but with such a wonderful beach, we didn't use it at all. They do have a Dolphin pool and you can swim with the dolphins. So, if you have small kids, that may be a fun thing to do one day. It's expensive though.The rooms were very nice & spacious, and beds super comfortable. The only negative is there's no ice dispenser on the floors, and you have to call for it. But they deliver very quickly. Their Breakfast buffet is another amazing thing at this hotel. The only other hotel I've had comparable quality breakfast at, was the Four Seasons hotels. So, don't miss the breakfast buffet. Usually breakfast for 2 is included with each night's stay, otherwise it was kind of expensive, but well worth it.all in all, it was an amazing stay. I have recommended it to many friends, and everyone who has gone has loved it.

We stayed 4 days. The moment step out of car...better use valet, otherwise don't expect warm welcome. Lobby is beautiful nice deco but room is just normal, especially please check bed spring before choose the room. I had a backache and my little girl fall down because the middle of bed pop up. Breakfast is good, private beach is good.

Not only is this an Amazing Resort, it has a Dolphin Pond, Turtle pond & Stingray Pond. You can swim with the dolphins or just watch them play all day long. Literally a mini Sea Aquarium at the hotel. The beds are made of something special because I never wanted to get out of them! Staff, Service & their hospitality gets a 5 star rating from me. Stayed 5 nights & 6 days and loved every moment of it.
user_name:
Marsha G
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We spent 4 nights at The Kahala. It is a beautiful hotel, for us the best place to stay in Honolulu mostly because we do not like those tall hotel buildings in downtown Honolulu with all the noise and traffic around. The rooms are what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel, however in our room we could hear the wind whistling through what we think are windows that do not shut well. First day we thought someone in a neighbour room was playing a flute until we realized it was the wind. Not a big deal for us, we slept very well. The location is great, the staff is very nice and friendly, food is good. The thing that makes this place a no go for us is the bad experience at breakfast. It seems the tables are not cleaned properly, if you touch the table or the table mat you can feel how your fingers get gluey from the things the people who were there before had for breakfast/lunch/dinner. This is not 5 star experience, table at Mc Donnalds are cleaner + it was not an exception at one table. We had breakfast 4 times and it was the same at all those different tables. We were thinking of getting wet towels to clean up our table. Can you imagine that in a 5 star hotel? The restaurant management really needs to think about it and either have the staff clean the tables properly before they offer the table or use tablecloth. That is not too much to ask for in a 5 star hotel

I stayed 5 nights at this hotel and it was very nice. About 20 minutes by taxi or mini bus to waikiki. For me I would prefer a 5 star in waikiki but work paid for it so cant complain. The hotel was had a private beach and gold course attached. It was very nice.

My family vacation here every summer for the past seven years. We have noticed many changes and cut backs due to the economy. We enjoyed seeing the long time employees like the valet guys, bellman, and housekeeping ladies. They are always helpful and friendly. The pool this year was a bit crowded with all the giant turtles and dolphins floaty that should be at the beach, not in the small pool. The kids seem to have a blast but it made the small pool very crowded. My daughters and a lot of kids love the colorful beads that was part of the decorations on the center flower table in the lobby. It was fun seeing kids get creative with them.

We have been guests at The Kahala 50 times over the last 40 years and are looking forward to our stay On Sept 2,2013 for 12 nights. We have literally travelled the globe and have stayed at top rated resorts only to compare the experience to The Kahala. We have known many of the staff for decades and have so much fun each time we visit to take a trip down memory lane together.2 Years ago we were visiting with the head concierge and talking about some of the famous foods The Kahala is known for like the celery seed salad dressing, explaining that Martin, the original chef of the hotel was responsible for. We suggested inviting Martin back to the hotel for a special weekend of nostalgic menu items and they did just that.Duck Waialai being my favorite!The staff of The Kahala is second to none! and is one of the reasons we return year after year.Lloyd and Nicole at the pool and Barbara and Joy at Plumeria and Todd and Heidi at the motor court are just some of our "Hawaii family". We look forward to another 50 stays!Jeff and Wendy Zaas

We stayed at the Kahala again in July to celebrate a special occasion. As always the hotel was outstanding. The staff were warm and friendly and did everything they could to make our visit special. We have stayed at the hotel many times in the past but this time decided to try a ground floor garden view room with a patio that opened to the golf corse. We were not disappointed. It was a short walk around the corner to the beach and pool areas. The room was typical Kahala with all the amenities and qualities as described above by other guests. It was always neat and clean with twice a daily maid service. On a prior occasion our entire family of thirteen stayed at the hotel together. The staff were very polite and accommodating in arranging room locations, breakfast and lunch together, as well as transportation. It is true that the hotel is older and the swimming pool could be remodeled, but overall it is exquisite. In fact, the age and location of the hotel only adds to it's charm and prestige. The hotel is located in a very quiet, exclusive area on a beautiful bay with an adjoining golf corse. While there use the free hotel shuttle to travel to Honolulu and the near by Kahala Mall to eat and shop. The breakfast buffet at the Plumeria Cafe is one of the best, with marvelous views of the water from the patio.. This is truly a very special hotel that we regularly recommend to everyone. Already looking forward to our next visit.

Without a doubt there is no better hotel in Honolulu than The Kahala. Best location, only a few minutes from Waikiki in an oasis of calm. The suites are better than years ago when it was a Mandarin Oriental. The staff at Plumeria restaurant outstanding and great food. The beach feels like its private even though there are no private beaches in Hawaii. This is our seventh trip to the Hawaiian Islands and one of the best.

We stayed at the Kahala resort for 9 days, and the entire stay was exceptional. The resort is beautiful with spacious rooms and nice bathrooms (with "his and hers" sinks, shower and a bath tub). Service is excellent everywhere: the front desk, the housekeeping, the beach personnel, and the restaurant personnel. Breakfast selection was great. There is a line for a breakfast table between 9am and 10am, so try to get there earlier or later. The best restaurant is Hoku's, their whole fish and free-range chicken are amazing. Do yourself a favor and ask for Lisa's table, she made us feel like part of her own family. The Sunday brunch is great but reserve a space for it several days in advance because it fills up quickly. Also, if you want to use the free shuttle to Waikiki, reserve your space the day before.
user_name:
Ann V
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the kahala for a week for our honeymoon best 7 days of our live! The hotel was beautiful! The staff was wonderful, very helpful and friendly! The restaurants have amazing food well worth the expensive cost of food and stay, we had the breakfast package I would recommend that to everyone for both of us breakfast would be close to $90 a day (well worth that price) but we didnt have to pay anything, the food was so good included 5 buffet tables 1 was the most amazing fruit we have ever eaten! And also on top of the 5 buffet tables they had an omelet bar where they make whatever omelet you want in front of you, we also ate at hoku's and the plumeria in the hotel both great restaurants. The hotel room was amazing such a beautiful view a huge room the bathroom was so wonderful included 2 vanities a walk in shower a soaking tub, 2 closets with robes, a fridge with free bottled water you can also call room service and have them stock the bar with whatever u want, coffee maker with a basket of coffee teas things that go with that, ice bucket (you have to call room service for more ice but they do fill it when your room is cleaned and also during turn down service) a full sized hair dryer that was nice since most places give you a Barbie sized hair dryer! Lol The bed was so comfy and there was slippers by the bed and with turn down service they turn romantic Hawaiian music on the CD player every night. We also received a free bottle of chilled champagne for it being our honeymoon! They have nice boutiques to shop in at the hotel. There is also a nice private beach where only hotel guests swim and nice seating area by the ocean,they have a nice pool with lounge seats all around it, an outdoor hot tub was nice, they have a waterfall that goes into the lagoon where they have 6 of their own dolphins, 2 mana rays, and a sea turtle. The only bad thing is on Wednesday you can't get a drink to save your life, the plumeria is closed that day (closest restaurant to the pool) they close the outside bar at 5 pm which is usually when people want to start drinking, and room service takes 1 hour that day, the other 2 restaurants 1 you can't go in while not wearing dress clothes the other one my husband sat in for an hour and nobody talked to him!! We where not the only people wanting a drink and it was the 3rd of July so they should have left the bar open longer!! The best thing was how quiet and secluded feeling the hotel was! Was like being in your own world! If you stay here you won't regret it!
user_name:
Lindsey H
Cadillac, Michigan, United States

review_body: Don't go to kahala resort hôtel:Very expensive for a scenic(mountain view Room on the 1 floor with no lanai )Old bathroom, Old towels with holeI asked to up grade the Room, nô problem 200$ more per night to have a Room on 6 floor with sea view and parking viewTo expensiveWe are 3, I Ask for a 2 queens beds rooms: only on océan view: 400$ more per nightEverything is money, you need umbrella to the beach: 25$ a dayLocal call even free call: 1 $ eachSwimming pool to small for a resortBut you can see turtle, dolphin, fish in the gardenConcierge is 0: we would like to book a restaurent: nô neccessary, she shaid, we go and 90 min waitingBefore arriving, we were at four seasons maui during 5 nights: paradise

Large rooms with good amenities. Pool area tired. Staff overall a little unenthusiastic and did not make you feels special in what is considered a premium sty in Honolulu. Poor shuttle services into Honolulu. Was not impressed with queuing for breakfast and then being told a 45 minute wait until,we could be seated. Breakfast itself was quite average. While perfectly pleasant I did not feel this place went above and beyond to make you feel special as expected for a resort of this calibre.

The Kahala is not to be missed! The hotel will be celebrating its 50th birthday but it sure has kept up with the times! It truly is a 5 star hotel, but did not feel stuffy at all. The rooms are beautifully decorated and quite large. We were very fortunate to have a beachfront room and it had the most beautiful view. If you are lucky enough to have a ground floor room, you can open your patio door and walk directly out to the beach. I don't think that you can do that anywhere else on Oahu. The rooms in this wing are a bit of a walk from the lobby, but well worth it. The rooms on the opposite side of the beach front look over the dolphin pond. I was told these rooms are just as popular and are in demand from many time repeat guests..The beach here has little wave action, so safe for swimming. All of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly, especially the valet and bell staff. When returning to Oahu, we will come back to Kahala.....FOR SURE!

I am not often blown away by a place but this place was great. You are not in the hustle and bustle if Waikiki but close enough to go for the dinner. The beach is great. The service is excellent and the buffet breakfast is to die for. An excellent intimate upscale hotel. The concierge is great also. She told us about a great scuba spot on the north shore and an excellent food truck (giovani shrimp truck) near the scuba spot. She also told us about a great sushi spot.

Just returned from staying at the Kahala Resort and Hotel. My family and I stayed there 7/31 thru 8/3/13. This hotel is so beautiful has truly wonderful rooms, bathrooms and grounds and friendly helpful staff. It was my daughter's 8th birthday and there was a piece of mango cake and two large cookies waiting in our room when we arrived. We were upgraded to a premium ocean view room! Just perfect. great pool and beach. My daughter swam with the dolphins on site and had a wonderful experience. The buffet breakfast at the Plumeria was very scrumptous! This is a great location and is far enough away from downtown Honolulu that you get to truly enjoy the Hawaiian experience and really relax! We will definitely return to this hotel next time we are in Honolulu!!

Just arrived home after our dream holiday in Hawaii. The Kahala is a stunning hotel with exceptional staff and quality throughout. The food is very nice in all areas (if a little pricey)Car rental was easy as hertz are onsite. Beautiful calm beach always had space for us and the kids,and the Dolphin lagoon was very special as we took advantage of the opportunity to interact with them (at a price)The pool area can be crowded and is unsupervised by staff which needs attention. There was an incident involving the pool while we were staying.Overall The Kahala is easy to recommend to family's looking to experience Hawaii without the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Love this place. Residential district that you can walk in, own private beach protected by reefs so fun bathing experience, and a dolphin lagoon with people that love what they do. The bell staff is great. The front desk and concierge helpfull but stiff and not very friendly. Great place to stay, can be pricy depending on season.

Stayed here for two nights while passing through Honolulu. The hotel's setting is wonderful, especially if you are looking for a place that is a little more private than the other parts of Honolulu. The hotel and rooms were spotless and the staff extremely accommodating and professional. The room we had featured an ocean view that was worth the extra charge. The beach adjacent tot he hotel was excellent - not as big as some of the other areas of the island but not crowded at all.

How many hotels have their own private lagoon with dolphins in it ? The amenities are fantastic with private calm beach, plenty of restaurants, great rooms...But we had severall disappointing experiences with service: shuttle is too small and making reservation is a pain, spa is very expensive and way below asian competition, room cleaning is not as efficient as expected, waiting at the restaurant is unacceptable...Could be excellent but, with all these minor but real annoyments, does not deserve a top notch review...maybe weren't we lucky this time...By the way if you want to go shopping or enjoy the excitement of the waikiki beach do not choose the Kahala unless their shuttle matter is resolved. If you want privacy, and a more "remote" place (honeymooners...), or if you have kids (dolphins, private beach...) the place is perfect !

This place is amazing. We stayed here on our wedding night as we got married at the resort. Getting married here was great. We origninally had a mountain view room booked but they upgraded us to a dolphin lagoon room. It was great being able to see the dolphins from our balcony. The room was very clean, you walk in to hear Hawaiian music playing on the stereo, the bed a massive, and there were 'his and hers' bathrooms. I loved this place. Unfortunately because it wasn't cheap to stay at, we may not stay again, but you definitely get your money's worth here.

Everything was fantastic. We loved everything about it! It looked just like the pictures, which doesn't always happen.. it was very classy, clean, beautiful from top to bottom and the service could not be better. We did go into Waikiki and Honolulu, which was great, but the beach here was much less crowded so better for us. Our room was beautiful, the bed was extremely comfortable, we loved the turndown service, bottles of water on each side of the bed and Hawaiian music playing on the cd.. the room and the whole hotel smelled great everywhere.. the workout facility is small but has anything you want to have! Ate at all of the restaurants except Hoku's,(it was dress shoes and slacks only so not what we wanted) and they were all good. The breakfast buffet at Plumeria has it all and the view was perfect. Seaside grill has good food and is on the beach.. just a few steps away but they have shaded trees and canopies so if you don't want to eat right on the beach..(they will serve you there) you can go cool off and still have a great view! All around for us it was perfect in every way. The pool is small and it had kids in it the whole time but again, for us, this was ok. We spent our time on the beach.. and there were kids there as well but was not overcrowded and they did not bother us..just might have to bring our kids and grandkids next time! Also did the 15 minutes with the dolphins and loved it.. staff was informative and it was a great experience.

Located in a residential neighborhood minutes away from Waikiki, you will find this peaceful place! I stayed a mountain view and was very happy with my view & room! The bed was very comfortable & the bathroom spacious with Tommy Bahama bath products. As far as the resort goes, it is very nice!! There is a dolphin lagoon, a small pool, and a private beach. There is plenty of shade options at the pool & beach. I love the free option of my lounge chair underneath a tree & it is very breezy here! If you want to get spoiled, stay here!! I never want to go back to the craziness of Waikiki!!

After checking out from Aulani, we stayed here at The Kahala with my family for 2 nights. I wish we stayed here longer....:) I was impressed with the staff and the hotel itself. Our room was spacious, clean and comfy. The family had fun in the beach. Love that it was not over crowded, it was private and secluded from all the noises. Beach/pool service was good and I was really able to relax and enjoy myself. Did not have a hard time renting a cabana for the day. The only negative thing was the water system in the bathroom. It seems each time our next door guest used the water, we could here it from our room, so I am assuming they heard ours too. Overall experience exceeded our expectation.

We chose The Kahala for a staycation last month and it was just about everything we were anticipating. For us, getting away for a few days means none of the crowd and all of the peace without wanting or needing to leave the property. We can and do frequent 'the city' all the time. We're customers of the restaurants already, so our first stay still felt familiar. Ocean view room. Perfect. The dolphins were directly below our room! The Kahala has a homey, classy feel. There is a mix of modern and 'needs updating', but that's fine with us. We've stayed in upscale hotels in major cities before and the feeling of home was hardly present in those places. Why no 5 star review? Well, we would have loved better beach service and communication. 1) We were told that we could order breakfast from our cabana. Not true. I was told this prior to our stay and during our stay. 2) We wanted to have a cabana. I reserved one well before our stay, but when I did, I was told that even with a reservation, it was best to get it first thing in the morning. Guess what we cancelled? The buffet breakfast. That was upsetting. We wanted our buffet and our cabana and didn't see why that was something we had to stress about or not have guaranteed to us. 3) There were changes in our charges that didn't make it to the final bill. At check-out, the employee assured me all was set, but a quick glance at the itemization showed that we still had a buffet charge on there. He was gracious, but a few seconds of attention to detail would have been great. We work hard to relax and I did feel that we had to 'work' a bit during our stay for a simple breakfast, cabana and accurate charges. Loved 99% of the hotel and food service staff, the housekeeping service, our room, our view, the cabana, the Dolphin Quest/staff, the valet staff and the overall impression. I'm ready to return before the end of the year, but I do hope that a cabana reservation is just that...a reservation. It was a bit odd to order to-go from The Plumeria House in order to eat and enjoy the beach. Maybe it's not a cut throat situation, but that is how it was communicated to me by the pool staff. First come, first served, reservation or not.

We experienced outstanding service from all the staff. The partial ocean lanai room was spacious and had a breathtaking view of the golf course, mountain, and ocean with a nice balcony to sit and relax on. The room was very clean and well stocked in addition to having a wonderful turn down service where they came and replenished supplies and cleaned up again. The bathrooms are nice and big with hers and his vanities, that was great. Also enjoyed having lots of drawers and closet space with many nice hangers for all clothes. The self serve coffee in the room and fridge were great. Loved having a large in room safe that fit everything. The Plumeria restaurant was nice with relaxing ocean view and good buffet. Loved having the privatebeach with staff that would set up chairs or cabanas for you and showers conveniently placed for showering once you left the beach.The hotel is only five minutes away from Wholefoods and the Kahala mall as well as being about 25mins from the airport and Pearl Harbor and close to Waikiki beach. The Kahala is a wonderful hotel were you can relax and feel pampered.

We are currently staying in The Kahala Hotel. Its our 4th time here during 4 past years. Its the first time we decided to share our opinion of the hotel. First and foremost, its certainly a unique hotel in Honolulu with great location and great privacy you can't find in Waikiki or around it. However, there are some developments the frequent visitors of The Kahala should be prepared for. 1. Restaurants:  - Instead of 'Tokyo Tokyo' there is a new Italian restaurant named 'Arancino'. They want to sell you a 4-5-course dinner for $85-100+tax+tips per person. Its a questionable value-for-your money when you are free to take a cab and go to Nobu's or Morimoto's in Honolulu and pay less money for a dinner from a developed brand name. - Also Arancino is now positioned as an ad-hoc restaurant for dinner available 7 days a week, while 'old dinosaurs' Plumeria and Hoku's are open 5 days a week only. + Watching Japanese guests of The Kahala at the moment when they are attempting to navigate through the Italian menu of Arancino, instead of the familiar waters of Tokyo-Tokyo, may be entertaining and make someones day. - 15-18% tips are printed by default on all bills for restaurant food/spa services etc. You must have a strong determination to wipe them out or modify the tips amount every other time. Its an old and legitimate revenue boosting trick, but we still couldn't figure out why there are tips included in a bill for a buffet breakfast we got within our accommodation package. Its a self-service, guys, its a pre-paid self-serices buffet breakfast. 2. Hotel quality: - Many places of the hotel are really worn out (by really we mean REALLY). For instance, the rugs from the main lobby to the dolphin and beach-front lanais have not been replaced for a century or so. Our fridge in the dolphin lanai was louder than a modern jet, etc. You may find in many similar reviews below a valid explanation to why its happening with many Honolulu hotels (high occupancy is warranted almost anyway). But the property is really crying for a refreshment. In comparison to many modern Caribbean hotels most of Honolulu hotels bring you back to 70s and 80s. It maybe a really nice thing if you are 50 and this is your 30th stay in The Kahala Hotel, but if you are only 30 it may be a little bit depressing. + Dolphins in the lagoon are really awesome. Its still very difficult to beat Kahala dolphins with anything in Honolulu.

I recently went back to the Kahala hotel and as always it was like walking into my home. I first went there at age 14 and it has never disappointed. The staff always treats me like a king and many have been there for decades. My room on the lagoon is breathtaking. While very secluded the hotel is only 15 minutes form all the fun and restaurants in Honolulu. I highly recommend a stay hear to make memories of your own.Mahalo

The Kahala is indeed a unique experience. Service, cleanliness, staff dedication are all hard to beat. Cuisine is excellent, and the environment is great. Concierge is top quality. Rooms, even mountain view, provide you with great comfort and you won't miss anything (matresses are too soft though for my preference). The pool area is very confined however, with the pool itself being rather small - unbalanced with the rest of the resort. The Kahala maintains a large enclosure with dolphins; the mammals are very well taken care of, with dedicated curators and staff, and the water quality is top with careful monitorization.
