But keeping these animals captive - even weighing all the educational aspects of it - goes against current trends of thought and sensitiveness, and does not bring value to the resort, on the contrary, in my view. For me, it created a strange tension from which mixed feelings remained alive long after I left the resort. Still, the Kahala is very hard to beat, I want to emphasize that.

The kahala is a beautiful resort with very friendly staff. The room was beautiful and over looked the golf course . What makes the kahala so special is that after a huge day of shopping etc at Waikiki you come back to this quiet peaceful resort . The dolphins are magical and you can spend hours just watching them or you can swim with them ... Your choice . Paddle boarding , surf lessons , private beach , amazing food , totally fell in love with it all . Yes ! We are going back yearly now .. This is our choice of hotel for life
user_location: Rose Bay, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Bridgette M
Rose Bay, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: All I can say is that I have been coming to the Kahala just about every year on the 4th of July for over 40 years. First came there in 1970 and fell in love with it. That should say it all. I love it in every way.

We spent 4 nights at this hotel with 2 kids before moving to one of the islands. Hotel is nice enough, we had two adjoining rooms of good size but very tired. Pool area also tired. Beach average. Food not bad but generally a 3-4 star experience. Staff very nice and helpful. In saying this, most hotels in Honolulu are very tired as they seem to have high occupancy so don't need to bother refreshing them.Honolulu is an excellent destination for shopping and some nice restaurants but if you want the idyllic island get away go to Maui or Kona (I have only been to these two islands). 2 nights in Honolulu is heaps, if no kids go to Halekulani but they hate children and noise there so if young kids Kahala probably not a bad option. Just don't expect 5 Star facilities (Halekulani not perfect either). My advice is go 4 Seasons Kona or Maui and do your shopping at home. The fish and dolphins on site are special.

This was our second visit after a 9 year break. Still as good as ever. The service is impeccable, as you would expect from an Okura owned hotel, and the resort itself is in a brilliant location. Not on Waikiki, but 5 minutes from everything. Kahala Mall is close. The pools are small but perfect, and the beach is very safe and not too busy. White sands and palm trees. Restaurants are very good if a little pricey. We were with the family and so the Plumeria was the pick. Buffet style at breakfast and Friday and Saturday night "fish fests". Staff was very helpful and service quick.Rooms are a little chintzy and the beds are small doubles. Great amenities in the room, double sinks and shower and bath. We paid for a partial ocean view and could indeed see the sea if we leant off the balcony, but didn't expect more. Didn't do the dolphin thing as it seemed absurdly expensive as all small children need to be accompanied by an adult thus doubling the spend.Apart from that, a splendid stay at a terrific hotel. Hopefully we'll be back in less than 9 years.

We have been coming here for 30 years.It feels like home. Actually it's a santuary..with sandy beach, refreshing pool, great food,( especially the buffet breakfast) wonderful environment and away from the maddening crowd. Daily sauna and steam, and the message with spiritual Raina are totally relaxing. The personable staff will do all in their power to make your stay memorable.

My wife and I stayed at the Kahala recently and we had a delightful experience. The staff were professional and attentive. The hotel is immaculately clean, the grounds are nicely manicured and very clean, the pool is very clean, and the beach area is just perfect (not crowded). We enjoyed are stay thoroughly and plan to go back in the near future. Breakfast was fantastic and Spa areas were exceptional. Kahala is the way to go...

One of the world's great hotels, and quite possibly THE best in Hawaii! Service, food, location, tranquility, amenities, The Kahala has it all. And, if you need the action of Waikiki, that's just 10 minutes away by car or cab.

Stayed at the Kahala in January after several days at the Hilton in Kona. We loved it- small and quiet with a nice beach, very nice spa ( I had a wonderful facial), good fitness center. The food was outstanding at all of the restaurants!! Cocktails were great as well. I hated our day trip to Waikiki - so so glad we were not staying on that crowded, awful beach. The Kahala is wonderful.

We stayed here as a family and were quite pleased with the large rooms, the well maintained building, the friendly staff and the food. It is not cheap, but that is Hawaii. Our only concern was that the concierge is all about taking advantage of guests and not taking care of them. These folks don't work for the hotel so are focussed not on satisfaction but on upselling and squeezing you out of more .....
user_name:
Tally11111
New York City, New York

review_body: Kahala Resort Hotel is far and away the best hotel experience we've ever had. Warm, extremely friendly, accommodating and consistently outstanding staff every where in the hotel. And I mean every where. Location is very private in residential area with private beach, dolphin lagoons, and beautiful pool. Our mountain view room was gorgeous with view of hotel waterfall. Bathrooms are to die for--dual sink areas in separate parts of bathroom. Don't waste time running around Waikiki or elsewhere to dine. The hotel's Plumieri Beach restaurant right on the ocean was our choice for dinner most nights; lunch right across the way at the other outdoor restaurant on the ocean. The island cocktails are fantastic. Get the Hawaiian Cooler or Mai Tai. Buffet breakfast is over the top outstanding. Rooms also have coffee maker and small frig. Lobby is truly beautiful with outdoor terrace to sit and enjoy ocean view and warm breezes. In a word; GO! You'll never regret it. What has the Kahala Resort left out? Nothing. They have thought of every single detail for a truly spectacular vacation. Will be returning for sure!!

Excellent staff, rooms, food, landscape.If you want a time away but close to Waikiki, this is the place.The beach front hotel has its "private" beach protected by a coral barrier which provides to guests a natural swimming pool with calm and warm water.The breakfast , food is very good, view is amazing, depending on the season and time, lines are unavoidable.Restaurants , Hoku and Arancino provide very good service and food. Reservations are required though. Swimming pool is a bit small, but with a natural one available, who cares.Project related to dolphins are interesting although having a close contact with them could be very costy for a family of four people (starting from US$ 125.00 per person for 15 minutes).We got this room with partial ocean view and lanai facing a golf course. Not bad at all. Good space and house keeping twice a day. Room service brought us good quality food in a fast and efficient way. Concierge got some issues depending on the person who gives us the directions. We managed reservations for a luau and other restaurants in Waikiki through them.Vallet service also fast and efficient. Check-in and out, efficient and fast.You may bump to some celebrities in this hotel. Excellent choice when staying in Honolulu.

Kahala resort is a 5 star facility without the stuffiness I have experienced at other similarly rated hotels.The service is excellent. We ordered room service and got the white table cloth set-up as if we were dining at the restaurant downstairs.The kids had a blast. They have a dolphin experience and a lagoon were my 6 year-old learned to snorkle.The beach is white sand and the water is blue. This is a boutique hotel so there were only 4 other people on the beach, it was amazing.Ask for table #8 for brunch. You're right on the water and the restaurant has the best made to order waffles.Overall 5 stars and great for the family.

We were looking for a little down time in Hawaii where we could just bliss out, relax all day and catch up on a little rest. Now I know picking Oahu is not necessarily the island for that as it is more fast paced than the other islands, but we have friends that live here, so we also had some visiting to do.Over the years I've been to Hawaii roughly 12-15 times and have visited Oahu, Hawaii, Maui and Kauai. I've also stayed at the Four Seasons in Kona and the St. Regis in Princeville, so these are some of the luxury hotels I'm judging Kahala against, and it simply cannot compare.I think the first issue I have with them is expectation. In reading their current ads which seem to be everywhere lately, they purport to be a very high-end, luxury hotel. And their prices are up there. But they do not have the service, amenities or style to compare, nor are their rooms that great. The lobby is lovely, and I think the rooms were probably really nice in the '90s. They provide a CD player, and some of the furniture has been painted in shabby chic stripes to hide its dated appearance. The bathroom has old composite granite for counters and in the shower where it is pulling away from the walls, the tub was old and had the built-in non skid surface that collects years of dirt no matter how much you clean it and the tile floors are pitted and cracked. Again, if we were paying for a basic hotel, no problem, but we were advertised a "luxury" stay, and this was not it.While the friendly people at the front desk can be lovely, I found the service around the pool to be lacking to non-existent. And while I'm on the subject of the pool, please be advised that they advertise the pool as luxurious. I kept wondering if there was another pool they were speaking about, because the only one I saw was extremely small and there was nothing relaxing about it. The lack of an adult pool in addition to a family pool simply means that the one and only pool is a veritable water park of children splashing and screaming. There is nothing at all wrong with that in itself, but if you expect to chill out by the pool and have some cocktails between naps, this is not the place where it's going to happen. At least not during summer break.A few other items: -Tropical Drinks: Not one restaurant in this complex can make a decent mixed drink. I don't know if they are using cheap booze or bad recipes but over the stay I tried 3 and gave up. The mai tais are just terrible. Go to the Royal Hawaiian or Halekulani if you want a great mai tai, you will NOT find them here.-Breakfast buffet: The free buffet that they serve in the morning is plentiful but (again, for a "luxury" hotel) inferior to almost any other buffet I've ever had on the island. The Sheraton is superior. The Sheraton. Kahala's eggs were rubbery, the oatmeal was too soggy to eat, the mashed potatoes tasted powdered and the waffles were dried out, overcooked and hard. All of the muffins and breads tasted pre-packaged from a big box supply house. Even though we had five days of free breakfasts coming to us, we gave up after the first day and ate elsewhere.-Fitness center: it is one of the most institutional I've ever seen. Not inviting. It's just a place to sweat and get out of there. I wound up working out in my room instead.All in all, this hotel is very average and quite basic. Do not be fooled by the high prices or the advertising luring you into a luxury hotel. I've stayed at many a luxury hotel, and this is not one of them.

We spent four nights at the Kahala early July with our children aged 7 and 9. We were upgraded to an ocean view suites, a high-end retreat facing the ocean. The service throughout the hotel was excellent. The free breakfast buffet included in our package offered some healthy options and tasty pastries. We swam with the dolphins and dined at Veranda. I particularly would like to recommend this resort for families: the beach is clean, the water is calm, the scenery is gorgeous, the pool and hot tub are family friendly. This hotel offers privacy, helping keep an eye on the children. We felt safe, pampered and relaxed during our stay. The hotel is only a 10 min drive from Waikiki and a 5 min drive to Wholefoods for tasty snacks.

My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Kahala last week celebrating our 20th anniversary. The hotel's 5 star rating is well deserved. Service is exceptional. Not only did we receive personal greetings from nearly all of the staff, we also received authentic friendliness and conversation. Our partial ocean view room was spacious and extremely comfortable. And we never tired of greeting the dolphins in the lagoon on our way to the beautiful beach. Cusine is excellent - good enough that we ate at Hoku's twice. Next time we're back in Honolulu, I know where we're staying.

Stayed here for a few days to celebrate a family vacation. This is a high end hotel with many high end finishes and thoughtful touches. It is about 10 minutes away from Waikiki at the end of a long road in a residential area (very nice residential area, I might add). It is very serene, calming, and gracious. The food at the hotel is outstanding - not your typical hotel food which easily rivals some of the best restaurants that I have ever been too. If you are here on Friday or Saturday evening, consider the seafood buffet where you can stuff yourself silly with ahi poke, mussel poke, octopus poke, sashimi, sushi etc. There is a free shuttle service to Waikiki, but be sure to call ahead and reserve it as it only holds 15 people. The hotel itself is beautiful with many thoughtful features. Is it pricey? Yes...but oh what a memory of those few days.

Usually when you see the words "family friendly" you conjure up images of children run a muck, rundown, used up and abused decor in addition to chicken nugget food options. The Kahala is not these things. My husband and I had our daughter later in life and before her arrival were lucky to have stayed at many fine establishments and do our best to find accommodations that incorporate those expectations while embracing children. The Kahala is comparable to many high end resorts in most ways and ideal for a 6 year old in tow. Is it the ideal romantic couple's resort? Probably not in my opinion, but we saw at least 5 weddings while we were there. So a lot of people thought so! In all honesty one of the main reasons we chose the Kahala was for the location of Dolphin Quest on the property. We had a fabulous experience and I am so glad we chose the program for our daughter's birthday. Another prime reason was location. It was removed enough from the main tourist tract that the resort felt isolated, which was a good thing. Go to Waikiki for craziness. We had excellent care given from all staff. Friendliness knew no boundaries. A few standouts were Ms. Carolyn Chung at the front desk. She added extra special touches to our stay, such as a piece of birthday cake waiting for our daughter. She also recommended a change in room location after hearing my girl was was a huge animal lover. We couldn't have had a better situation overlooking the dolphin lagoon. Her kindness was so appreciated. A second employee to mention was the manager at the Keiki Club. She was responsive from the beginning, returning phone calls and assuring me of the proper credentials she and the staff had. My girl had a great time and asked to stay longer. However, the clubroom needs an overhaul. Give her some upgrades in toys/supplies and ambiance! We looked forward to the breakfast buffet as it was part of our package. It rotated each day with options and the food was high quality and lacked the mass produced feel/taste of a kid friendly buffet. Lastly, the Seaside Grill had some really boutique style cocktails which were exceptional and well beyond the standard mai tai or pina colada. One suggestion for the Grill: Add just a couple more options to the menu. At day three we wanted to eat there because of its spectacular location (our girl could frolic on the beach as we ate) and the fancy drinks, but man, we wanted something different to eat! Oh yes, one extra tip. Take advantage of the tea service upstairs. It was pretty substantial and the setting was impressive. Spend 2 or 3 days out at the Kahala to experience Hawaiian hospitality at its best and then spend a couple more days out on the big island to experience something all together different. You will appreciate the Kahala even more. Okay,so a few are going to balk at the expense. Its not cheap at the Kahala, but here is an instance where you get what you pay for. Aloha.

The hotel and staff were above and beyond what we expected. The staff is amazing, the hotel has a relaxing atmosphere, it's beautiful and immaculate. The beach area is great. Can't say enough about the staff, truly a wonderful hotel. Dolphin experience was so much fun, great experience for the entire family. Breakfast buffet was excellent, great food, wonderful staff.

The hotel is fantastic,great beach,great views,great rooms,we stayed at the left lwing w partial ocean view but plenty view of the dolphins,the perfect spot,it was wonderfull to stay at the porch watching the dolphins playing and exercising,the breakfast buffet is a must so dont left the opportunity of buying the breakfast package,it cost 20 pp when the real cost is aound 40.great staff,must come bach!

I had a great stay in the Kahala hotel, you are welcome with a necklace when you join and a free drinks, I was in the inside Lagoon with access to the Dolphin, the room were nice but pretty basic, sleep quality was good though.Breakfast buffet was amazing, plenty of fruits with view on the beach, I really felt I was in heaven.The spa is very poor, and the massage were for me very bad, my back felt worse after than before.The hotel is away from the main beach but has it's own small beach.

Spent 4 nights at the Kahala and then 4 nights at the Halekalani, arguably the 2 best hotels in Oahu, this past June. It was an amazing time spent away. The Kahala was truly a fantastic hotel, from the reservation people in the back offices I spoke to when phone booking, to the bell hops who greeted us on arrival out the front, the pool waiters, the barstaff, the breakfast staff, the conceirge, to all the people who looked after us so brilliantly, the Kahala team could not have been more helpful or friendlier. And, I've got to say, to me, this is what a really great hotel experience is all about- people. The people working at the Kahala seemed genuinely happy to be working there, and it showed. To each and every one of them, thank you.Loved the island style decor of the room at the Kahala, mountain view king bed number on a lower floor with a picturesque view of palms trees and greenery, and its size and layout. One small point, although I really liked the size/ layout of the bathroom and closet area, it was out-dated looking, a bit tired. Bed was super comfortable, and the room lovely to arrive back to with the turn down service done.The whole experience of staying at the Kahala was a fantasticly memorable time and I can't wait to go back.

First rate room with great amenities. Comfortable bed and everything totally spotless.Great atmosphere with music left playing in the background.Fantastic options for breakfast (American and Japanese)Outstanding view both in room and at breakfastTop-notch service during check-in, check-out and in between.This stay was a gift to us, so I cannot comment on the prices. Overall, wonderful stay.

The Kahala is a sophisticated, strikingly beautiful, serene, beachfront resort located at the end of the road..... Soft background Hawaiian music is heard as you enter the public areas. Our stay got better and better. Check in was oddly delayed by lots of keyboard clicking and repeated promises that room would be ready... soon..... Once we cleared that hurdle and made our own way to the room, we were pleased to see the pretty Tommy Bahama style room, with 2 double beds, a chaise lounge, desk, dresser and round table. Our balcony overlooked the golf course, with an ocean view. The bathroom was wonderful-his and her vanities, his and her closets, shower, tub, with hand held shower spray, lots of drawer and cupboard space, coffee bar counter, safe, and a separate toilet room. Tommy Bahama toiletries, chenille robes and wonderful big white towels completed the bath. WSJ delivered daily. Turndown service was provided nightly. Housekeeping staff was quiet and courteous. Parking is valet or self-park in the adjacent several story garage. For self-park, you will need a parking pass to exit the garage. Plumeria buffet breakfast was included with the room. The buffet included different specials each day, as well as Japanese options, and an omelet station. Try acai sorbet, guava juice, kahalasadas, rolled crepes, Japanese pickled vegetables over rice, Kahala coffee, and fresh papaya and pineapple! All excellent! For early coffee drinkers, visit the cart at the bottom of the staircase by the orchid wall. We booked our tours by phone with the hotel concierge prior to our arrival and all were ticketed and ready at check-in. We spent our afternoons at the Kahala beach and pool; chaircovers and towels are provided by the pool staff. Fascinated, we returned to watch the trained dolphins daily at the hotel's renowned Dolphin Quest. We often just stopped to sit for a moment on the rocking chairs on the porch to watch the dolphins play and the ocean spray! Resort was only 20 minutes from airport -maybe 35 at high traffic times.

The terrible rating is due to the WAY OVER-THE-TOP PRICES. Hotel was nice enough; bed did not lend itself to a good night's sleep. With the outlandish pricing, each room should have their own private chef and butler. At the least breakfast should be included in the price. COULD NOT BELIEVE the prices charged by the hotel restaurants. The hotel did offer a free shuttle into Waikiki, which we took advantage of to find places in town to eat.The staff were very accommodating; Concierges Cameron and Frank were very helpful in reserving activities.Would never stay again or recommend. So not worth the money; find a place for less and put the money saved towards your adventures.

Beautiful place with great people. We had a very nice time and were very pleased with everything from the concierge to the front desk staff to the cleaning staff. We will most definitely return! There was only one downside to our stay.......when we made reservations at one of the 3 restaurants at the hotel, no one mentioned that I needed to have long pants. My wife had told me she had read online that everything in Hawaii was casual so I never even packed any pants. It was no big deal and everyone was very nice about it. And, it was my own fault for not packing any pants. But it would have been nice to know ahead of time.

Beautiful hotel, great choice, as it's far away from busy Waikiki. Best breakfast ever. Excellent housekeeping service, beautiful silent beach, good pool area. Hotel employees are super friendly and very efficient, from bellman to concierge. The recently opened Italian restaurant is too sophisticated to be Italian, and super expensive...There should be more choices of casual restaurants for dinner. The one at the beach is excellent, but only opens for lunch.

The most amazing destination you could wish for, the hotel is top quality. The staff cannot do enough to ensure your stay is a quality experience. The views from the rooms are stunning. A must for a quiet relaxing holiday for couples or families. The dolphins in the hotel's lagoon are quiet amazing.The hotel is away from the resort of Waikiki but a courtesy bus is available throughout the day.Not a cheap option for a holiday but worth every penny a must do!

My wife and I stayed at the Kahala in June of 2013 and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel was luxiorious and the service was astounding. We had great interaction with every hotel employee we came in contact with, from the bellman to the concierge. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it, as I see the cost as the only downside. The food at the Kahala is very expensive: $37 pp for breakfast and $55 pp for dinner at the "casual" restaurant. Also, if you plan to book activities through the Kahala they can be very expensive as well: $25/hour for a kayak, $200 for a snorkeling trip, $15 to rent a snorkel and fins, etc.We rented our own car, took advantage of the incredible valet service and hospitality, and drove to our own locations for food and activities which is the only way we were able to afford to stay at The Kahala. This hotel is in a prime location. The bottom line is this: if you can either afford to stay here or if you can get the room at a discount and eat elsewhere, I highly recommend The Kahala Hotel & Resort.

The service at the Kahala matches the quality of the resort. Outstanding. The staff are polite and very happy to meet all requests. Although being 15 minutes out of Waikiki (they run a shuttle bus) the location and facilities are awesome. The lagoon with Dolphins, turtles and fish adds a nice touch to the resort although I would not choose a dolphin view room (they can be noisy when playing). The resort is not cheap, but the service and facilities are more than a match for the price. We will be back.

Beautiful hotel in lovely grounds with added benefit of residence dolphins who amused me never mind any children no end. We were very lucky to be upgraded to a beachfront room which came with complimentary use of a cabana. Bonus is that they will set it up in same location for you each day and leave a cooler with water in for you. Loved the system of flags for service. Very useful shuttle into Waikiki and Honolulu which gives benefit of being away from it all but with easy accessI did some yoga and Pilates classes which take place outside fantastic.

We spent 7 wonderful nights at the Kahala Hotel and Resort at the end of April/beginning of May. While there were a few areas that they could improve upon, overall, it was a fabulous vacation and an excellent value in reality. I stayed at the Kahala Hilton many times as a child and had very fond memories of the vacations spent there, and wanted my husband and son to experience the same thing. We stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea for our honeymoon, so my husband's expectations were very high. The lobby still has the same awesomely vintage chandeliers, but the furnishings have that Hawaiian plantation look to them and there are plenty of spots to just sit and hang out. The rooms are quite large, as other reviewers have mentioned. We had a room with two double beds, as we shared a room with our 7 year old son. We had planned on he and I sharing a bed, but when we saw how large the divan that is in the room was, it was a perfect sized for him, so we just got extra sheets and blankets and he slept very comfortably on that the entire time. There have been a few complaints here and there about the bathrooms, but my husband I loved it. There are two sinks at opposite ends, each with it's own closet area nearby. The toilet room is a tad small, but really, how much time do you spend in there? We had a partial ocean view room, for which the rack rate is quite high, but with a promotion (which they run all the time) it came out to being quite reasonable in comparison to other comparable resorts. We could watch the sun rise over the ocean and Koko Head and that wasn't craning our heads around the balcony either - it really was a partial ocean view.For those expecting a giant Grand Wailea type pool, this hotel, as others have mentioned, was built in the 60s, and is surrounded by homes, etc., so is not getting any bigger. The pool is plenty big for kids and adults to hang out in, but this is not an amusement park type pool with waterslides, etc. The beach is maybe 50 feet from the pool, and speaking of the beach, it is a fabulous one if you have kids. There is a coral reef about 100 yards offshore, so it acts as a breakwater, and there are no waves to speak of. You won't be surfing here, but it's a wonderful spot to let your kids just hang out. My son spent a couple mornings in kids club, and the only bad thing was that there were only one or two other kids each day, as we were there when school is in session and not during a break. He thoroughly enjoyed the activities and wanted to go back. The food, overall, was excellent. We ate at the terrace restaurant (can't recall the exact name) that is between Hoku's and the lobby. We dined there twice and both times, it was very good. The breakfast buffet at the Plumeria is outstanding. We had a breakfast for two included with our room, and it was an excellent deal. There are many healthy options, as well as the more decadent ones. My only complaint, and it's not really that (because the fries were AMAZING), is the food by the pool. I wish there were more healthy options for ordering at the pool and beachside restaurant. My parents ate at Hoku's and said it was very good. One of the best parts of the Kahala is that you are 15 minutes away by car from Waikiki but you are hours away from the hustle and bustle and crowds of Waikiki. The Kahala has a free shuttle, which we found convenient most of the time. We did rent a car, but there is a Hertz car rental right in the hotel, so as long as you reserve in advance, you have the car right there. You can even rent by the day, which we did.They have excellent classes available through their Chi fitness center. My mom and I took a TRX yoga class which was great. I really wanted to the stand up paddleboard yoga class, which looked really nice as it was first thing in the morning when the water was like glass.The whole ambiance of the hotel just makes you say "Ahhhhh" and totally relax. I do have a few things which I think they should pay a bit more attention to. First of all, the servers by the pool could be hit or miss. The first day we arrived we waited quite a while to be served at the beach side restaurant. They are all young, so I understand that they may be new or what not, but perhaps a bit more training could be in order. Additionally, there were a few little things that one should not see at a five star hotel. There was a bit of rust at the bottom of the chairs at the pool bar, and some of the metal furniture on the balconies (which are huge) has rust as well. It is a tropical climate, and these things will happen, but some better emphasis on maintaining the little things would go a long way. There was some peeling paint on our bathroom door - not really noticeable unless you looked closely, but still...All in all, the Kahala is a wonderful oasis close enough but worlds away from Waikiki. I love Oahu and love the fact that I can get this kind of peace and quiet so close to the big city.

My wife and I recently spent a couple of days in the Honolulu area before we flew over to Maui. I chose the Kahala because it is not in the "heart" of downtown Honolulu and it is a much more relaxed atmosphere compared to the other 5 star hotels in Honolulu (The Royal Hawaiian and the Halekulani).I booked a partial ocean view one bedroom suite through Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to an Ocean Front One Bedroom Suite, a big upgrade over the regular partial ocean view. The view from the room was breathtaking, with views from Koko Head to Diamond Head, a great view of the pool, beach, and ocean, as well as a great view of the dolphin lagoon.Our first room had an issue with the air conditioner in the master bedroom, but the front desk quickly moved us to another room (the first room they tried to change us to had not been cleaned yet, but they quickly found us an ocean front suite that was clean and had a working A/C unit).Pros:-Great service-Great room/amenities-Awesome view-morning coffee and afternoon snacks delivered to the room-Great restaurant for or complimentary breakfast (AMex Plat.) -Dolphins!-A semi-private beach that you could always find a quite place on-Away from the hustle/bustle of WaikikiCons:-Not a big fan of the Tommy Bahama bathroom supplies-A/C issue described above (but quickly taken care of)-Very family friendly, which obviously is not a con if you have your family, but we noticed all the kids when we were trying to have a "second honeymoon". Not a big deal, however.Overall, The Kahala will be our home when we come back to Honolulu and I would recommend it to anyone.

Spend 5 days at the Kahala Resort and loved it. This hotel was built in the 1960's so the rooms are quite large and are today very well appointed. Balconies are also large enough to party on !!The hotel has great views with rooms facing the ocean as well as the Waialae Golf and Country Club at the rear of the hotel - and then the mountains in hte background. All very spectacular !Kahala is located about 10 - 15 minutes drive from the main Waikiki precinct and that suited us very well. The hotel has a free shuttle to drop you off and pick you up.Service is great with staff that really enjoy looking after you. Cameron at the consierge desk did a great job for us. Of special note are the dolfins who have their own pool in hte middle of the Resort - so dolfin feeding and even guests swimming with dolfins make for a memorable visit

Stayed at the Kahala for our honeymoon July 2013. Absolutely loved every minute and plan to return one day! Best hotel for honeymoon, away from the hussle and bustle of Waikiki which is great to visit but returning to the Kahala was the best! Staff great, hotel spotless and dolphins amazing! Thanks again Kahala!

This hotel gives you a lovely vibe, all the staff remembering your name and greeting you everyday. We had the 4th night free with breakfast special which was fantastic, a beautiful buffet every morning which has been one of the nicest buffets I have ever experienced. Exceptionally clean facilities throughout and a great selection of restaurants to choose from so you dont even have to leave the grounds to make life easy when travelling with a young family. We particularly enjoyed our stay and will definatey be returning!

lovely room. lovely beach. lovely staff. awesome food. great prices. great deal. 4th night free with breakfast. great location. romantic. gorgeous view of the ocean.away from the other busy hotels on waikiki beach. central , yet private.

Thought service was awesome but had some issueswith hotel. Thought Internet was almost nonexistent and they had small card saying they were upgrading and to go down to lobby. This is unacceptable in this day and age. I thought hotel was in need of facelift as room looked worn. Coffee at breakfast had a chlorine taste and although my husband complained, it could not be rectified. After second day of it, went elsewhere. My reason to stay at the Kahala was location, I hate the overcrowded Waikiki area, but with the Trump and Halekulani about same cost it might be worth the crowds. In fairness to the Kahala, we did not use their beach or pool and were there to visit family. As other reviewers have stated, this might be a big reason to stay here also.

We stayed here on our honeymoon thirty years ago. The hotel then was the Kahala Hilton. They graciously upgraded us to the lagoon and we fell in love with the dolphins. We were celebrating our 30th anniversary and returned. The quality and beauty were still there. The staff was amazing. The attention to detail was noticed and appreciated. Dolphin Quest has taken over the lagoon and dolphin experience. I was hesitant to utilize their program for several reasons. But, after reading of their experience, care and quality of program, I jumped in the water. I would recommend them highly. The dolphins are not bored and the interaction was a highlight. It was hard to sleep at night as they splashed and played and I just wanted to watch.We ate at the Veranda and enjoyed a wonderful buffet each morning. The location is perfect. Can't wait to go again!

I've never written a review for anything on any site ever in my life, and that's about to change because I want to tell the world that that this resort is one of the magical places I've ever been!From the minute we drove up to valet, I felt like I was in a fairy tale. Every single member of the staff was friendly and knew my name by day 2, my room was heavenly, the pool staff was available at all times to refill my ice tea or bring me a lunch menu, the front desk was more than helpful, the access to the beach was so close to the pool that I could go back and forth so easily and there was always staff available for any requests or questions. I can't say enough amazing things about this place. I also need to mention the bed and the bedding! If there was a way I could put it all in my suitcase and take it home, I would have! Honestly the best bed and bedding I've ever experienced. This trip was worth every penny! I can't wait to go back next year!

Endless views of the ocean, waves dancing off the reef, a hotel that has everything and located in the heart of exclusive properties nearby. The Kahala is just amazing. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the bay ..... beautiful.!!!

We just returned from our seventh stay at the Kahala Resort and it was one of if not the best stay we have had. I have gone into great detail in prior reviews so I will focus on something new.We booked our stay after receiving an email about a limited time offer they had. We have received these before and used them. If you are considering the Kahala, get on their email list. It is definitely worth it.The offer we used was a greatly reduced rate on the Partial Ocean View Suites and we are thrilled that we booked it. We have tried several room categories from Dolphin Lagoon, Ocean Front Lanai to Ocean Front Suite. Obviously the Ocean Front Suite was awesome but not exactly the most cost conscious. So when we received an offer for the POV Suite we decided to give it a try. First of all, I thought based on the room map that the view would not be great. I could not have been more wrong! In some ways, the view was better than the Ocean Front. We had a much more panoramic view of the hills, golf course AND the ocean. Yes, it is not as flat out ocean view, but you absolutely can see plenty of it. (We were on the 5th floor of 10 which was great.)Having the extra space was awesome including two full bathrooms, a living room and the lanai.Plus, with the suite, even at the special rate, we had the suite amenity package which included transfers to and from the hotel, a beach cabana every day, breakfast, afternoon drinks and snacks, morning coffee, etc. For us, it was definitely worth it, especially given that the offer was at a rate lower than some non-suite room categories.As always, the food was uniformly awesome from the breakfasts, to the Veranda to the fish tacos on the beach. I particularly appreciate the hotel’s flexibility. We had originally booked only 3 nights but we were able to add a 4th night at the original rate no problem at all.The hotel also delivered a nice bottle of champagne in honor of our anniversary which was an improvement over last year.If we had it to do over, we would have stayed all 7 nights at the Kahala, but such is life.We will definitely be back as this may well have been the best stay.

This property is amazing. The beach is perfect for paddle board, snorkel, kayak or just floating. There is a reef off shore where the waves break so the water is like a calm lagoon. The staff absolutely reflect at 5 star hotel, always friendly and asking what they can do for you, from unpacking your bags, bringing extra bottled water, always addressing you by name, having soft tropical music playing in your always clean room....it's just amazing. The beach cabana boys set up your beach chairs and towels (not an extra charge like most resorts) anywhere on the beach that you choose and there's always someone checking if you need drinks or food. The buffet breakfast and dinners were outstanding. It was very hard to leave!

Wow!!! This is a hotel we will never in our lifetime forget about.My husband and I visited The Kahala on our honeymoon back in October 2010! Right from the word go it was an absolute delight. We had a beautiful mountain view room, a chilled bottle of champagne on arrival and the soothing, sweet sound of 'Hawaiian Dreams' escaping from the speakers in the room. We couldn't get enough of the food in the resort either, from their exotic buffet breakfasts, lovely salads and refreshments whilst sunbathing on the beach at lunch and fresh fish at dinner. Additionally, walking past the dolphins every morning was an experience of a lifetime! Our first night dining at Hoku's was extra special too as we were served a congratulations cake at the end of our meal. No holiday or hotel will ever compare, all I can say is we cannot wait to return again one day! Thank you Kahala Hotel for making our stay so amazingly wonderful :)

The best vacation I've had in some time ! The Kahala was the most amazing beach resort I've ever been too. The staff , dining , location , & Dolphin lagoon, will have me going back!! I didn't want to leave.:)

We have stayed at The Kahala Hotel and Resort several times and have never been disappointed! It remains one of my favorite hotels in Hawaii, and I have stayed at several on the different islands.One of the things I like best about The Kahala is that it is tucked away in a serene and beautiful part of Honolulu. So, if you prefer not to stay in one of the hotels located on the crowded, noisy, and "touristry" main drag of Honolulu, The Kahala is the perfect place for you.The service is impeccable as is the food offered in the on-site restaurants, namely Hoku's and the Plumeria Beach House. The lobby and grounds are lovely and very well maintained, as are the guest rooms. And, the hotel is noted for the array of celebrities who have stayed at this beautiful and secluded hotel over the years. Make sure to check out the "Wall of Fame," which features photographs of numerous celebrities who have stayed at The Kahala. Who knows, you may even catch a glimpse of someone famous while there!Note that the hotel rates/fees can be quite expensive, but during the low season some decent rates and packages can be had. Make sure to check on-line for Kahala's "Internet Rates" and special packages no matter what time of year you go.Last but not least, the entire staff goes out-of-their-way to make sure that you feel special and pampered. They often go above and beyond to accomodate you and your requests and to ensure you have a wonderful and memorable vacation.Even if I don't stay at The Kahala while in Hawaii (we sometimes stay at the Hale Koa military hotel), I still have to stop in at The Kahala for lunch or a coctail, because my visit to Honolulu just wouldn't be complete without a few hours at this beautiful and timeless landmark!

We've stayed at The Kahala over twenty times in the last few years and each time it's like coming home to family. From the bell staff, to the front desk, to the beach attendants, the servers in the Plumeria restaurant, housekeeping, etc., all welcome us by name and treat us like their own family. Away from the hustle, bustle, crowds and noise of Honolulu, the Kahala is a peaceful, setting halfway between Diamond Head and Hawaii Kai. We first stayed at The Kahala for a company training class, but have since made it our Thanksgiving Day destination each year since. The rooms are spotless, the ammenities first class and the service impecable! Whether you choose an ocean-view or mountain-view room, the vistas are spectacular. You can't go wrong choosing The Kahala as your destination when on O'ahu!

The Kahala is a top-notch, 5-star resort, comparable to any in the country. Right on the beach and close to but away from the tumult of Waikiki. Breakfast overlooking the ocean every day is a great treat! The rooms are large and the beds and bedding are luxurious. Incredibly attentive staff fulfills any needs you might have. The spa is world class and provided incredible massages. If you are staying in Oahu, this is THE place.

It was a great hotel, the room are spacious & the restaurants are great s well. They had turtles in captivitie for five years and they just released them. It was fun to watch, as well as the dolphins.I would love to go back , this is a real special place.

My stay at the Kahala hotel was almost too perfect! I couldn't have asked for more. We were greeted immediately upon arrival by very friendly hotel staff, and check in was very smooth. The hotel room was impeccably clean and very spacious. I loved the his and her sinks in the bathroom. There were even his and her closets!I would say my absolute favorite part of the hotel experience was eating at the breakfast buffet every morning oceanside . We were lucky that it was included with our package, otherwise i dont know if we would have paid for it every day. The breakfast buffet had every possibly breakfast option and then some! The food was delicious and very well made. Service from the waitstaff was also superior.I will definitely return to the Kahala as long as they continue to provide the breakfast buffet at the plumeria cafe. :)
user_name:
Kimberly C
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Kahala Hotel from May 13 to May 2013, celebrating our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful time. Our room, an Ocean View Lanai, was in the Diamond Head Wing on the ninth floor. It was very tastefully furnished with a very comfortable bed, and quiet, both inside and while sitting on the lanai. Housekeeping was efficient and included an evening turn down service that one would expect at this quality of hotel.All the staff we came into contact with in the restaurants, front desk, concierge, poolside were very friendly and addressed us by name. The Kahala is a luxury hotel and the prices there reflect this fact, however they are what anyone staying at this quality of hotel should expect. If you are looking for a relatively quiet vacation as opposed to Waikiki then the Kahala is the spot.

Loved the resort. Wonderful service. Beautiful beach. Dolphin Quest was memorable. I'd return as soon as my budget permitted. The stay was pleasurable. There is nothing more to add. It is a great hotel.

I stayed at the Kahala for 5 nights in April 2013. It was a truly memorable and beautiful experience. Incredible service on a beautiful property. There is an understated luxury at the Kahala that is a highly worthwhile and wonderful experience. The beach, dolphins, and Sunday brunch were great highlights at the Kahala. The private beach is an oasis, the dolphins a joy to see and the Sunday brunch, a superb dining experience. The croissant and ahi musubi are a delight and must be had more than once!!

When my wife, 2 teenage children and I arrived at the Kahala, our hectic schedule and responsibilities came to a screeching halt...left behind, was the hustle and noise of LA. Every day, for 10 straight days, was fabulous. After a day of delicious food, beautiful weather, great service and miles of gorgeous beaches, you can put the top down on your convertible and take your relaxed and tanned body 10 minutes away to the center of Waikiki. Shop, eat and people watch - come home to the most comfortable bed you've ever slept in while you look out at the ocean and fall asleep healthy and happy...and than start the entire day all over again. That's life at the Kahala. Oh, but go easy at breakfast on the thin pancakes at the Pulmeria Beach House...they're addictive!
user_name:
mark S s
Pacific Palisades, CA

review_body: This hotel is worth staying at as it was the best experience on our trip. It is a little quieter than Waikiki but the relaxation and enjoyment you will have will be worth it.We checked in early and they provided us with a magnificent standby room so we can refresh ourselves from our flight, haves shower and just relax until our room was ready.Only around 35mins we waited and they provided us with a room which was super quick as we arrived at11am. The staff and service was wonderful and they all knew your name straight away once you gave it to them once.Our room was lovely. It was huge, big balcony plus huge bathroom with separate shower and separate bath also with a shower. 2sinks so I used one side and my husband the other which was great.The room we had faced the mountains with partial ocean view. Honestly this was breathtaking. Even if you can't afford an ocean front room, it doesn't matter because mountain view is also stunning.The resort is very nice as there is a private beach which is fabulous as it isn't busy like Waikiki and the service is great as they bring you towels and fold out bed towel covers. The ocean is at first very shallow which is great for kids or not confident swimmers. The pool side is lovely as there is a smallish pool but one for adults and one for kids plus a hot warm spa too. The best thing about this hotel is that there are dolphins.there were 6 male dolphins and I could sit there watching them all day as they were magnificent. The trainers are very informative and friendly and its very good for taking pictures.Overall amazing. Only down side is location but it makes up for it with the little touches such as providing water for you every day even when you go on a trip, extra towels, directions how to get anywhere, wireless Internet, shuttle bus to go into Waikiki.Only thing I would suggest is to have more shuttle times and a bigger bus because you have prebook as they get busy. The last bus is at 845pm which isn't late at all. But I am being picky hah?..I would highly recommend to stay here even for a few days it is well worth it

So many people shy away from Oahu due to the craziness of Waikiki. What they don't realize is that outside of Waikiki and Honolulu, Oahu has the most beautiful beaches in the Hawaiian Islands. Fortunately there are other places to stay while on the Island. One such place is The Kahala Resort in the Kahala section of Honolulu - basically it's the Beverly Hills of Oahu. This area, though only 10 minutes outside of Waikiki may as well be on another island completely. The road to the resort dead ends into the hotel in an area nestled between the Pacific Ocean and the Waialae Country Club Gold Course. An oasis of comfort, quiet and relaxation. Every room is decorated in color palates that are peaceful and serene overlooking either the ocean, the dolphin lagoon, or the golf course - with the exception of the least expensive rooms - which overlook the vast courtyard and circular driveway in front of hotel which has its own unique charm. The rooms house the most practical and fantastic bathroom areas you will see in any hotel. They have sinks on opposite sides of the bathroom and all your closet and drawer space is essentially in this room - allowing the visitor to basically store everything out of their immediate sleeping area. The staff is exceptional. One would assume that the best hotel employees of the island work here. From check in to maid service. From the pool service to food service, this place is unique. You even get your own beach (though beaches in Hawaii are all public, this beach is not easily accessible if you're not staying at the hotel - so it may as well be private). The beach is protected by an enormous reef, so it's very calm for the kids. Speaking of kids, there are dolphins housed in the lagoon overlooking the pool area. The sounds of the dolphins jumping in the water, the gentle trade winds, the gentle crash of the ocean waves all contribute to this celestial experience. Save your money, treat yourself and go here. Vacations are meant to create memories for families and should never be marred by hotel horror stories in the name of saving a few bucks. That's how vacations are ruined! This simply won't happen here. Be prepared to feel some guilt as you will undoubtedly feel you don't deserve this. I assure you, you DO deserve this.

Wonderful, secluded and up-to-date! The Kahala is specifically geared toward the international community! Everything about the resort has those special touches that you would normally see while travelling overseas. The turn-down service at night, the in-room slippers, toothbrush and toothpaste kit, the spectacular room service, and the bi-lingual front desk. We had a wonderful stay and the staff at the Kahala were so helpful and you could feel the energy that they enjoy working there!

If you have the budget, you have to stay at this beachfront resort. Out of the hotels that my group stayed at, by far this was the nicest. When you step into the lobby, you can tell that the resort is unique. The lobby looks like a Pier 1 store on an elegant level. They have some shops and a nice long wall covered with photos of the celebrities that have stayed at the resort. The most impressive part of the resort is the spa. No matter what spa treatment you pick, you have your own suite to enjoy with a tub where the water falls from the ceiling. I truly wished I could have experienced a treatment there. The rooms are beautiful as well as the views. Each room decor is different and hand picked so each room is different. You walk into your room and light music is already playing. The balconies are huge as well as the bathroom. You feel more like you are staying at a friend's house than at a hotel. There is a fun lagoon where dolphins live. You can swim with them (for a price) and you can watch them be trained and fed at your own leisure. The view of the ocean and the beach is out of this world. Just so beautiful. It is really calm.I had breakfast at the breakfast buffet. It was delicious. They have the usual breakfast food, but they also have specialties. They have a bruschetta bar and mini maple pancakes that are so good. They also have fresh, all natural smoothies. I had one that had a least 6 fruits blended together and no diary. Overall, I would love to get back to this resort and stay there longer. Not only is the place beautiful, but it is a unique resort where it cannot be compared. Thank you VIP Vacations for getting me a stay in this resort!

Hotel is located right in front of the beach, it is quiet and bautiful, service is Excellent, staff is nice and always looking after you. Since we arri e they treated us so well, they even upgraded Our Room, the room Was so confortable, bathroom Was huge two closets, tub and shower.They have activities for the kids a nice spa and yoga clases in the morning. They have jogging trails maps available and a place for renting a car in the hotel, wich made things so easy.The location is so nice, away from the crowds. Hotel also has a complementary shuttle to Waikiki and the mall.

Stayed at The Kahala from 27 APR 2013 through 03 APR 2013. This was our first trip to Hawai'i for our 20th anniversary. I cannot say enough great things about The Kahala!Even though I just mentioned the reason for our trip in passing during the reservation process, the nice lady on the other end of the phone took notice of this small detail. When we arrived, we had a bottle of champagne and a slice of cheesecake for two waiting for us in the room.The valets were awesome and always on point. Always making sure we had directions to where we needed to go, make sure we had towels, maps and extra bottles of water if we needed them. The most impressive thing was when we went to check out. We were waiting for our car when we turned around to see it was already parked curbside with our bags (all eight of them) already neatly packed in the trunk!The bellmen were constantly on top of every detail. From a great lei greeting to meeting every need. On our arrival to our room, our bellman showed us around the room and where to find whatever we needed.Check-in was quick and smooth. The cool towel hit the spot after 16 hours on an airplane. Anytime we needed anything from the front desk, the response was quick and results were outstanding.The restaurants -The Plumeria Beach House has an awesome breakfast buffet. Be sure to get the breakfast package. Well worth it. Lunch and dinner also wonderful with great views of the semi-private beach.Hoku's was an awesome experience. The Seafood Tower (which was ordered accidentally when the server misheard "seafood chowder") was wonderful. Our dinners were right on.The Veranda is a nice cozy place to eat. I enjoyed the tables with the couches. Great live music from the piano at night.Seaside Grill is a great place to grab lunch while swimming in the pool or snorkeling in the ocean.The view from the room was great! We had an ocean-view lanai with a king bed. We were on the second floor and still had great views from Koko Head on the left to Diamond head on the right. The dolphin lagoon directly below our room was entertaining as well. A higher floor would have been nice, but we enjoyed where we were all the same!The housekeeping service was also on point. Always with a smile and a warm Aloha. They took care of our room as if it was the room of the biggest VIP.The best part of the room was the nightly turn down service. They would always leave a small surprise on the bed (orchid buds) and have soft Hawaiian music playing on the CD player. Two bottles of water would be left on the nightstands. They even replaced a small cup of water my wife had some flowers in with fresh water for the flowers. It's the attention to the small details that makes The Kahala so special!The concierge always had directions and great suggestions at hand. Never without ideas for things to do and see and places to eat.Every staff member seemed to remember us by name and was always ready with a warm, welcoming smile and a friendly Aloha. The Kahala and its staff made our first stay on Oahu very special and memories that will last forever.We will definitely be back!

Late April 2013 was our 3rd trip to Kahala in the last 2.5 years, so obviously we love it there! It is truly one of my favorite places to be. The staff is outstanding, frequently calling us by name and always helpful and friendly. Breakfast buffet at Plumeria is a standout -- I wish I could eat there every morning! And the dolphins make the place even more special. I could sit and watch them for hours (and sometimes did!), plus the trainers are so personable and will happily answer any question. Perfect for a tranquil couples retreat. We really needed a relaxing break from everyday life/work and Kahala provided it many times over!

Beautiful Hotel. Get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki by moving just a bit down the beach to The Kahala. Family friendly, romantic hotel for couples, with activities for everyone young and old. Swimming with the Dolphins was a high point of my life. Great experience. The staff is "Hawaii" friendly, the food is delicious with out door Lani dinning. The rooms are lovely with nice beds and bedding. Good size bathrooms. The beach stretches all along the hotel and in front of private condo's but access is open to all the beach. Great stay. Will stay again.

Our family of 3 adults stayed at Kahala Resort in April 2013 and enjoyed the open air design, expanse, and old Hawaiian charm...felt like a high class resort from the past. The location is great for those (us) wanting to get away from all the tourist traffic, as it is about 15 minutes from Waikiki. (car necessary) The rooms were a good size, extremely comfortable beds (note: 2 beds = 2 doubles, not queens), and the bathrooms were very spacious...overall lovely. The staff were professional and pleasant; good service but nothing offered that was above and beyond. The grounds and beach are very nice, and the dolphin encounter must be their claim to fame (great for just watching ... probably a blast to participate). My criticisms were that they charge for parking (I find this tacky...like someone charging a house guest to park in the driveway), the website is misleading about the tennis courts (They belong to a club next door and it is $30+/hr pp to play!), and the biggest downer for me, the attention to room cleanliness. Although our room was lovely at first glance, it had soiled upholstery (a chaise lounge, which they did remove at my request), a tired carpet, and tile missing (only one) in the bathroom. These concerns would be not as big a deal if I were staying at a place where the price and reputation warranted it, but this place is expensive by Honolulu standards and has a high reputation. Overall we really did enjoy the resort and would recommend it...it's just that first impression when you walk into your room with high expectations and were a little let down. The concern was addressed, but nothing additional was ever offered. (Note: I had paid for 4 nights and only used 3 (my doing), but thought that because of that and the room issue that they would upgrade me to a better room...they didn't).

Not far from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki the Kahala more than filled our expectations of a great vacation and greeted upon arrival with shell of nut leis. We were upgraded to a "partial ocean view" but the "partial" was more than adequate; also included was the sumptuous breakfast buffet. We ate almost every night here as the food was amazing, varietal, local and seasonal, which coming from the midwest is saying something in the winter. We were advised well by the concierge for activities-especially the tidbit of taking a taxi to/from Diamond Head-the parking there is so very limited, and to get there early.  We loved watching the Dolphin Experience, the fish, turtle and ray lagoons as well as having yoga in an outdoor setting, seeing beautiful flowers everywhere and anything you could possibly want at hand. Truly a beautiful although not inexpensive resort to enjoy your time in Hawaii.

Our duaghter had a wedding this May 6 at the Waterfall at the Kahala Hotel. She also held her wedding reception and celebration at the Waialae Room, and stayed at the absolutely fabulous suite at the hotel. Though we are far from VIPs, everyone at the Kahala bent over backwards, went the extra mile, and tried to do everything possible to make this wedding and reception the best, with the quality of service usually reserved only for the most elite and special clients. No task, no detail was too large or too smail ---- they would always walk the extra mile to insure that their guests were comfortable, happy and well taken care. They truly want you to have an absolutely wonderful experience.The reception cuisine was outstanding --- from the main courses (mahimahi with special sauce), to the the various salads, veggies and desserts.There are so many outstanding Kahala Associates --- starting with former Wedding and Catering Coordinator, Aimee Graham. Though promoted just yesterday to Sales Manager at the Kahala, she nevertheless kept her word and was there today as our wedding coordinator. Everything went just like the bullet train -- so smoothly, seamlessly and on time. She did anything and everything to making it all work. Like the duck that seems to glide on the water, she seemed to do everything so easily and gracefully, but underneath the water she and all the other Kahala Associates were working so hard on our behalf. Your services will be truly missed at future Kahala weddings.Nicole, one of the first that we knew and met at the Kahala - thank you so much as the Kahala wedding experience was everything and more. We cannot thank you enough for everything small and large that you and all the Kahala Associates did for us today.Carolyn M. Chung was the second person we met by phone and then in person in connection with our daughter and son in law's suite and check in. Though it wasn't part of her job description, in coordination with Aimee who was at another wedding at the time, she made sure that we could rehearse in the ballroom because it was raining outside by the waterfall. Together with Aimee, they made sure our wedding party's parking validation was taken care ---- no task was too small for them to make sure it went right. Like Nicole, Aimee, Carolyn made us feel welcome --- like we were now part of the Kahala family.The suite was outstanding ---- the view terrific from the lanai and everything so special and perfect. Our son in law said it was one of the best rooms he has ever had the privilege of enjoying.Michael at the Waialae Room thank you so much. I have never seen anyone try so hard to make sure that everything went right at the reception for the bride and groom as you did. We noticed when you even wanted to make sure that the bride got special tea, and always made sure the guests received anything and everything to make them happy and comfortable. We noticed that you stayed until the very end to make sure everyone got their validations for parking, had all their stuff and packages taken to the cars or rooms, and even, together with Aimee, helped snuff out the candles and pack the glass candle holders so they could take it with them. It wasn't their job ---- but it just got done, with a smile and with grace. When we thought we should go, Michael, I will always remember you saying "no need to rush, you are our special guests, we want you to have a wonderful experience." Duane also was always there to make sure the set up was right, and everything went smoothly.The Kahala Associates that helped us with our packages and things, got our cars so quickly, and always had a warm smile and welcome to the Kahala when we arrived, and a thank you and come see us again as we left were also the best.No one at the Kahala ever says it's not our job when you ask for help. Anna Hinkley who I think may be the new wedding coordinator answered the telephone when I called Aimee's telephone number. After not being able to contact Aimee, Anna asked if she could take a message for Aimee or help us. When I explained that someone had lost a family heirloom in the ballroom, she asked if she could have my phone number as she was a floor above the ballroom and could go right down now and check the ballroom for the item and call me back. Fortunately, meanwhile, the family heirloom was found, but it just goes to show you how far each of the Kahala Associates, I believe, will go in order to make it a wonderful and special experience for all.The Aloha Spirit is NOT dead and gone in Hawaii --- it is alive and well at The Kahala in each and every Kahala Associate. I hope this review is printable and that the general manager at The Kahala will see it and will pass it on to the several named individuals above and to the many other Kahala Associates not mentioned by name but who played a part in making this such a special and fantastic celebration.As legendary Bob Hope would end, I borrow in saying at the end of this thank you ----- TO ALL THE ASSOCIATES, "THANKS FOR THE MEMORIES."  You made today a truly special one for all of us.

Our daughter had a wedding this May 6 at the Waterfall at the Kahala Hotel, had their reception and celebration at the Waialae Room where the cuisine and service was excellent, and rented a absolutely fabulous suite for them at the hotel for several nights. Though we are far from VIPs, everyone at the Kahala bent over backwards, went the extra mile and tried to do everything possible to make this the best wedding and reception ever - service usually reserved only for the most elite of clientel. No task was too large, or too small --- the always went the extra mile to see everyone was happy,comfortable and had an outstanding time. Everyone loved the food from salads, main courses, and desserts.Among the persons we'd like to special mention is Aimee Graham, wedding coordinator, who through promoted effective yesterday to a new position, kept her word and was their for our daughter's wedding ---- her last as wedding manage at the Kahala. Everything happened like the bullet train --- on time and to perfection. Aimee, your services will truly be missed at future Kahala weddings.  Carolyn M. Chung was the second person we were so happy to have met, became our friend at the front desk when our daughter checked in at the hotel. Carolyn went out of her way to help our daughter and new son in law for a great room and all the amenities. Because Aimee had another wedding, Carolyn and Aimee, did everything to make sure the rehearsal went ahead despite the rain --- and thank you both for opening the ballroom so we could practice despite the rain outside. Nicole, that you so much, as the Kahala wedding experience was everything and more --- we cannot thank you enough for everything large and small that you and everyone at the Kahala did for us.. Michael at the Waialae Room was always their to make sure the bride and groom had everything possible to make it a truly special time --- for example, he made sure that the bride and groom had the special tea, was always their if something needed to be done. He was helpful until the very end ---- he told us we did not need to rush out we are their very special guests, and, as such, he wanted us to have a wonderful experience. He stayed to the very end to make sure everyone received their parking validation, helped us pack up our things, asked if he could get us assistance to take our things to the room or care, and even, with Aimee, blew out the candles so we could pack up the glass candle holders. we good everything we needed. Duane was also always their to make sure the set up was right, and that everything happened so smoothly. Kahala's associates that helped us and all our guests with their stuff and packages, got our cars so quickly, and always had a smile and warm welcome to the Kahala when we arrived and a thank you and come see is again as we left were the best.No one at the Kahala ever says it is not our job when you ask for help. Anna Hinkley who answered Aimee's phone when I called to ask about a family heirloom that might have been lost at the Kahala first tried to find Aimee, then asked if she could take a message or help me. when I explained what had been lost at the Waialae Room, she said give me your phone number. I'm right above the ballroom, I'll go down and look and call you back. It was found by the groom, but this goes to show you how it's the job of everyone at the Kahala to make the guest experience a truly memorable and special memory.The aloha spirt is NOT dead and gone in Hawaii --- it is alive and well at The Kahala in each and every Associate. I hope this review is printable and that the general manager of the Kahala will read it and pass it on to the several indididuals above and to the many other individuals Associates at the Kahala that I may have not mentioned by name but also played a part in making this such a special and fantastic celebration..As Jackie Gleason said on the Honeymooners ------ to all The Kahala Associates "Thanks for the memories." You made it truly a special one of the kind day for all of us.

We loved the opulance of this resort. The staff were great too all of them. Loved the layout, the beach, the pool, the fish, turtles. Its a comfortable place. We had a mountain view, no lanai. It would have been nice to have a balcony but we only stayed 2 nights. We arrived after a long flight and travel and found our room was ready. Very impressed! The rooms were a great size but the beds were small. We had two doubles. They were a little small for a child that moves around all night and an adult. They were comfortable though. It was extra for a rollaway and the rooms were expensive anyway, so we didn't get one. The rooms are very quiet, relaxing. The Kahala has its own slice of paradise.I also liked two vanity basins in the bathroom. This was very convenient. If you are an Aussie be careful about what is on offer on the TV for children. Unsensored TV in the daytime (after 11pm stuff here) scary sci-fi. So we just turned it off. Maybe ask the staff which channels are best. The beach is very nice with many sunbeds. If there arn't enough the staff will get you one. No umbrellas though unless you paid for a cabana. The water temperature was beautiful. We loved seeing the dolphins everyday and never tired of their antics. An inclusive kids club would have been good. No free activities during our stay. The other strange thing was that other families (not sure whether they were local) didn't let their kids play with our daughter. Weird, stranger danger taken too far!!!! After all it cost over $3,000 to get to Hawaii just in airfare alone. Breakfast was good and we got an inclusive package. Good selection, nice omelettes, attentive staff. The tables were near the ocean i a lovely setting. Other food at the hotel was good too, pricey but its what you expect from a 5 star resort. It wasn't too far from Waikiki but we stayed in Waikiki after our time at Kahala. Check out whole foods at the Kahala shopping centre. Great food, great selection of fresh food.We had a car so explored the coast south of Kahala (a must) and had dinner at Roys at Hawaii-Kai. A great place to eat and watch the sunset.! We didn't use the shuttle but it seemed to be available. Worth a stay. We only heard the construction on the day we were leaving, so unless you were staying in the front rooms it wouldn't really have an impact.

Perfect location directly on private beach but only minutes away (by free regular courtesy bus) from the buzz of Waikiki. Dolphins, turtles and sting rays in pools were a great bonus for kids. Breakfast practically on the beach in beautiful setting and plenty of choice in buffet. Beautiful lobby and staff very friendly. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We just came back from 8-day stay at the Kahala resort and our experience was excellent, though there are several areas that I would like to point out for future visitors in my review of this resort.We traveled with 9-month old baby and I spent a great deal of researching what would be the best location for our vacation. Overall, I am happy to report that my choice of the Kahala resort did not disappoint. It is located only 15 minutes by taxi or shuttle away from Waikiki (which we visited several times for dinner and oh boy, it is like a human zoo in concrete jungle), yet Kahala resort totally felt like a piece of paradise away from crazy crowds and super crowded Waikiki beaches. The resort is located right on the beach front and it is a perfect location for romantic getaways and families traveling with children.We stayed in Partial Ocean view room and paid extra to stay there versus Mountain View room. Was it worth it? Absolutely not! Don't take me wrong, the room itself was absolutely perfect with everything you need, very spacious, with super comfy bed, huge bathroom with shower and a separate deep bathtub, lots of space to feel like you are living in a spacious apartment. However, the Partial Ocean View is truly a golf-course view room. There is absolutely no way you can see the ocean or any part of the ocean from your room, but you can see a tiny piece of beach and tiny piece of the ocean if you go outside on the balcony, get very close to the railings and look all the way to the right. In my honest opinion, I have no idea why Kahala even came up with Partial Ocean View category and charges more for it. We were not able to take even one single photo of us standing on the balcony with the partial ocean view on the background unless we compromised our safety while trying to capture tiny view of the ocean. But, regardless of this issue, we were so pleased with the room itself that I would not take down any stars from my review. In all fairness, Kahala website specifies that partial ocean view is only available from the balcony, but I think they should make it much more clear that it is hardly any view at all so that people don't pay extra $$ per night for something that doesn't really exist. On a very positive note, the view from Partial Ocean View rooms to the surrounding golf course with swaying palm trees and mesmerizing mountains is just as breathtaking and truly remarkable. I was not disappointed with the view even though it was not what I originally expected. To top it off, we could clearly see the Dolphin Lagoon right down below our room from the balcony and all rooms in this category that include a balcony should have a very nice view of the Dolphin Lagoon. Now, originally I debated if I should book Dolphin Lagoon room, but decided not to because I wasn't sure if the water in the lagoon would be fresh and free of any smell. I am happy to report that these issues are of no concern at all. We spent every day hanging out at the dolphin lagoon and the water is sparkling clean in the lagoon. In fact there is a waterfall that pumps water from the ocean continuously, so the water is always clean and fresh. If I were to return to Kahala, I would definitely book Dolphin lagoon room. Rooms in this category are located in a separate 2-story building that surrounds the lagoon and each room had a balcony or patio area and all appeared to have great, unobstructed views of the lagoon and playful dolphins. If you do consider booking a Dolphin lagoon room, I would recommend requesting a room on the second floor as you would get a much-much better view of the entire lagoon and dolphins playing in it. Now on to dolphins! This is probably one of the best features of the entire resort. Absolutely amazing!! The dolphins that live at the resort are so well cared for and so loved! I read some reviews prior to our arrival that spoke negatively about dolphins kept in captivity, but you should definitely take time to get to know people who care for them to learn each dolphin's story before jumping to any negative conclusions or passing on judgement for the resort. Each dolphin caregiver that we met was delighted to share their knowledge about dolphins and share with everyone who is willing to listen interesting stories about all their dolphins and various projects that the resort is participating in. It is quite an experience! I could see that each and every dolphin is so well taken care of, so loved, and so happy to be there. They play day and night even when noone is around them, it's just so incredible to experience. Our 9-month old baby was way too young to appreciate the dolphins, but older kids would definitely have a lot of fun learning about dolphins at this resort. The resort also has sea turtles, fish and manta rays and hotel guests can participate in daily feedings as well as learning about their life. Definitely a great experience to be part of!The resort grounds were beautiful, clean and never appeared too crowded even though the hotel was pretty much at full capacity. There is always something to do around the resort. They offer daily exercise classes that are pretty unique ($25 per class), such as balance yoga in the ocean on the paddle board, TRX suspension training, foam roller classes and various yoga classes. They also have a nice gym with modern equipment and super spacious area for women/men jacuzzi and sauna (it is hidden near the gym and we didn't even discover it until several days into our stay.) The beach was always perfectly cleaned and we never had any issues finding a great shade area to relax. Pool staff was always super friendly and helpful, setting up chairs for you and generally making sure you are having a good day at the beach. Everyday that we stayed at the resort there was a wedding going on. On weekends there were two per day.
