The resort has a nice white gazebo near the beach where all weddings took place and from what we saw all weddings were nicely organized. However, if I were to look for a wedding location, Kahala would not be on my choice list to consider. It is an amazing resort but in my opinion, not a great setting for a wedding. Why is that? First of all the location of this wedding gazebo is just truly unfortunate. It is located just literally steps away from the main restaurant where all guests have daily breakfast buffet and lunch (and morning weddings take place at 11am during breakfast hours), so you have bunch of hotel guests sitting literally 7 steps away from your wedding location eating breakfast while you are getting married. And another thing is that wedding gazebo is located directly in front of the entrance/exit from the gym, also about 20 steps away and it looked kind of weird having beautifully dressed people and lovely brides in flowing white dresses standing right next to the gym where sweaty people enter and exit with towels hanging across their shoulders. I don't know. Maybe I am too picky, but in my travels I have seen much better choices (more romantic, more dramatic, more interesting) than this particular location. However, people who we actually observed getting married over there (pretty much all of them were Japanese from Japan) didn't appear to care and truly enjoyed their special day. Now about the restaurants on the property. We had breakfast buffet included in our room rate, otherwise it looked like breakfast buffet was about $85 for two people on weekdays and about $94 for two people on weekends. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful: eggs made to order, fresh fruits (watermelon, papaya, strawberries, melons, etc.), lots of hot items (meat, fish, potatoes, baked zucchini, etc.), yogurt, pastries and even acai sorbet - delicious! I never got tired of breakfast buffet, it was yummy and fresh every single morning. We also had lunch in the restaurant by the beach (can't remember the name) - it was delicious and a great setting - right on the beach with excellent service. Other restaurants were just as good and delicious, with friendly service and interesting menus. The resort offers complimentary shuttle bus to Waikiki and nearby shopping mall - Kahala Mall, that has Whole Foods in it. Make sure to get shuttle schedule from front desk and reserve your space on the shuttle, we learned a hard way that shuttle spaces in the evening to and from Waikiki are often booked in advance. So, few times we had to take taxi to Waikiki for dinner (read my reviews about restaurant experience in Oahu.) Taxi would cost you about $20 each way, sometimes even more depending on traffic in Waikiki, so free shuttle bus helps. We had a great experience with concierge service, always friendly and helpful, though it seemed like they recommend exact same restaurant choices to everyone (usually on the expensive side.)Overall, a great vacation at Kahala, I really loved the resort and would highly recommend it to anyone. Unless you are familiar with Waikiki and know exactly what you are getting yourself into, don't book any hotel in Waikiki - it is super crazy, busy, dusty and just looks exactly like something you would see in Las Vegas - tons of people moving back and forth inside huge hotel lobbies and overcrowded beaches that don't resemble paradise. The Kahala, on the other hand, is a true paradise on Oahu.

Wow, this place is amazing! At the Kahala, they take care of every detail, from start to finish. The rooms are so nice/big, and the view is amazing from any room. I also liked how the hotel is small and intimate. We stayed there as part of a wedding party, and everyone in our group was thoroughly impressed with the service. When we checked in, they asked how old our child was and what her name was. They brought up a crib without being asked, and our nephew had his name put onto 2 giant cookies. They also gave all the kids in our party stuffed animals. The bride and groom had 3 complimentary bottles of champagne + chocolate covered strawberries delivered to their room. Every time we saw someone in the hallways, they were super friendly, and the dolphin staff was also very approachable/educational. I never thought of this as a kids hotel before, but the nice pool, calm/secluded beach, and animal/recreational activities all make it a very kid-friendly hotel. It was well worth the price, and was much more bang for our buck then any other hotel we have stayed at with similar cost. The location is awesome- outside of the hustle of Waikiki, but close enough that its very convenient, plus plenty of great places to eat in the Kahala area. I absolutely recommend!!!

Stayed at the Kahala for a week and it was terrific! Great location, beautiful grounds and beach. Staff was outstanding! The Kahala area around the hotel is very nice with easy access to highway and downtown.

Food - The buffet breakfast was to die for - there was everything under the sun you could choose from! Beautiful food and excellent service.Room - very clean and beautiful. We did have the whole family in one room but the beds were excellent quality and the cleaners came daily, leaving us little presents on our pillows.Dolphins - one of the most amazing experiences I have ever had. We got to swim with the dolphins at the hotel, with an instructor. It was so much fun and they treat the dolphins so well so dont worry about any form of animal cruelty.Beach and Pool - We spent almost every day by the pool or at the beach. The beach was spacious, clean and beautiful. The pool was much the same and there is really nothing to complain about!Highly recommended - enjoy your stay!!!

Stayed here four nights before venturing over to Kauai, and later Maui, this last visit March 17th, 2013. We have stayed here three times now, over the years. We keep coming back because it is just such a carefree and comfortable way to enjoy Oahu. We usually take a taxi from the airport here when we first arrive from the mainland. It helps to know we don't have to make a connection or rent a car, etc., upon our arrival. The trip from the East Coast of the mainland is arduous enough without dreading further hassles upon arrival. Taxis are always waiting in front of the airport (check in with airport attendants at the taxi stand, who will make sure you get the next available cab, and that the taxi is legitimate). Taxi fare from and to the airport averaged us around $46.00 before tip, one-way.We find the staff at this resort just simply OUTSTANDING. We are older, seasoned Hawaii travelers...so we've sifted through all the options and now only stay at hotels with great employees and management. Almost all my hotel reviews are five stars because of that. No use traveling 5 thousand miles one way to stay less than great. Please don't think I hand out praise indiscriminately, though...I just choose very carefully to begin with.Loved the latest stay and wished we could have lingered longer. Next time we will. Rooms larger than average, beds super comfortable, atmosphere relaxed and welcoming, staff attentive. Best of all, though, is the BEACH. It's large, sheltered by breakwaters and its natural cove shape, right out front of the hotel, soft sand, free lounging chairs which the pool attendants will cheerfully outfit with chair covers and towels (we tipped of course, but no formal charge for these). The beach is easy for children or older people to negotiate, but anybody would love it, and it's gorgeous as well. The water is warm and gentle, the underwater slope EXTREMELY safe and gradual. You could sit there all day and never grow tired of the view. I especially like sitting under the spreading shade trees where the grass meets the beach. Really sweet. AND the folks from the poolside cafe make regular trips out there to serve you...even if you're all the way down the beach near the end of the property.No resort fee. I like that because I don't want to be burdened with a car there, and I hate paying a resort fee that includes parking...like so many large resorts. If you want to go to Waikiki or the Ala Moana Shopping or Kahala Shopping Centers, you can take the free hotel shuttle, which runs about every hour. You can tell by this review that I expect to pay top dollar for my room or my meals (if they are worth it, as they are here), BUT I do NOT like to pay for a lot of extras). I don't feel nickeled and dimed here like I do at many other Hawaiian resorts.Food options were in flux while we were there. We were surprised that our favorite on-site eatery...the beachside Plumeria Beach restaurant was closed on Sunday and Monday nights. We arrived on Sunday, ready to relax there for our first night's decompression... and that made us sad. Hope they change that, and soon.They were getting ready to open a new Italian restaurant where the Japanese restaurant/Sushi bar used to be (on the front-side of the hotel), but it wasn't open yet. Dinner and lunch menu at Plumeria Beach has changed since our last visit, and now includes more Asian type dishes (we'd like to see just a bit more choices). Staff there treated us like royalty...especially Joy, the superb hostess/manager. The breakfast buffet (also in Plumeria Beach) is just excellent. Definitely get a breakfast package when you stay here. Another treat: high tea on the Veranda lounge...even my husband liked it (yes, it's true, and he is NOT the high-tea (or even middle or low-tea) type! : ) We don't eat at Hoku's (not feeling like dressing up or making the effort most times). All food and drink at the Kahala is, well, it's just plain expensive. Just understand that going in and plan for it...it's no different anywhere else worthwhile in Hawaii. At least, you get what you pay for here.Here's a tip about restaurants in this hotel: they are heavily patronized by local residents, especially at holiday time, so if you're coming then, make your dinner reservations before you arrive (we stayed once in December and many office parties, family gatherings, etc. were being held both in public restaurants and in private banquet facilities). We also noticed many local families in the restaurant this time (March) as well, because the schools were on Easter break. I'd eat here regularly, too, if I were lucky enough to live in the Kahala neighborhood.We are thinking about making another trip from the DC area to Hawaii some day soon. We figure we could take the new non-stop flight from Dulles Airport and be in Honolulu by mid-afternoon, taxi out to the Kahala, and just settle there for the whole vacation. As we get older and airports get more annoying, we look for ways to make it easier on ourselves. If you have to pick one island, Oahu has a lot going for it. We also find that there are more attractive flight options (wide-bodies, non-stops, lower prices and more frequent flier seats available) for incoming mainlanders as opposed to outer islands. If you stay here at the Kahala, you have the outer-island feeling of being isolated and on the beach...but you can have a wealth of other cultural, entertainment, and scenic options easily at hand. The concierges are SO helpful...and can get you a car any time you want it, so you can explore the island.Lots of families with children were staying here this time (spring break). Usually I avoid hotels with this demographic, but you aren't really affected so much--especially if you sit down toward the end of the beach, away from the swim platform (I like that better anyway). The hotel does not FEEL crowded, even when it is full (not noisy at all, and I attribute some of this to the fact that it is not U-shaped like so many hotels on the beach...those high-rise hotels that have pools in the middle seem to serve as echo chambers for children's delighted squeals...the kind that can cut through you like a knife sometimes). It also has cleverly-designed landscaping and made-made waterfalls that absorb noise.You just have to understand that there may be a lot of children in the (rather small) pool and the one nearby hot tub. If that takes away from it for you (it does me), then go to the free fitness center beachside and use the adults-only hot tubs (gender-specific)...really hot, really clean, and usually empty. There, you also have the use of saunas, steam rooms, showers, exercise equipment, and lockers at the same time. Quite nice! And all perfectly free. (and did I mention grownups only?)The Dolphins are always enchanting, the waterfall landscaping lovely, the grounds beyond beautiful. It's easy to get around without hiking long distances. I honestly love this place.

We had a wonderful stay at the Kahala Resort, the staff was friendly and full of suggestions. The beds are a little small but you melt into them for a wonderful nights sleep. The Dolphin experience is very educational and great for any age. What can I say, we were in Paradise.

This is Great Hotel with very quite location, spacious and very comfortable rooms and breakfast that with great selection of food for all tastes. Pool area rather small but Dolphin Lagoon adds unique atmosphere. We had a really great stay and I would recommend this resort for everyone looking for great family stay. Hotel provides free shuttle if you are looking for Waikiki crowds. Hotel staff provides first class service at all times.

Awesome old classic Hawaiian hotel. Beach is great with no waves for little kids. If you want wave just rent a car and go about 15 minutes to Kailua Beach. Only complaint was the rooms have small double beds.

I went there last week and stay a week in Kahala Hawaii on Apr 14-19, 2013, my first step to Kahala is just amazing, I greeted by friendly staff and receive a beautiful garland as a souvenirs, along they way to lobby for check in meet with other friendly staff and was help by them for check in process...once entering the room i found another awesome view of facing the ocean and the mountain, and i can tell that all rooms in Kahala have an amazing view from any any aspect! really just so great!I highly recommend you all to visit there and stay there to experience by your self, you may will agreed with me that all just a great!.

I wish I had good things to say about our stay at the Kahala. This was a big disappointment and by far the biggest waste of money. I've put my point form review below.- First impression was one of bad service. Not greeted very well as our car, then rushed through the check-in process. Literally rushed, and told they were busy.- The room was adequate, the view over the parking lot did distract from the sea. I would hesitate to call is an ocean view room. The washroom amenities were definitely not 5 star, more a 3 - 3.5 star if I'm generous. - The cleaning staff did not speak english (those we dealt with) and was very difficult to communicate our needs.- the concierge was ok, although woefully out of date on restaurant changes.- the staff at breakfast were excellent and very well trained, the view was also spectacular, although every morning at that same time there were workmen grinding the tree branches that they had previously cut down. This happened every day.- They were terribly stingy with their water, they only gave us 2 bottles at turndown and wanted to sell us more at an exorbitant price. That left us with no choice but to go off site and buy our own water. I had not seen this at any 5 star hotel in the past- The staff at the pool was non-existent. There were staff there, but they didn't acknowledge us or help us in any way. All of the chairs were stacked up and not available to use and the pool was uncleaned, with debris floating in it. There was also no shade available. Needless to say this was not an inviting environment.- Since we couldn't be by the pool we went back to our room. But there were people smoking on the balcony beneath us and we could not sit outside. This is a non-smoking hotel. I think what amazed me the most was that the valet could clearly see what was going on and did noting. We did call and they came but am not sure what the resulting action was.- during our last 2 days there was construction taking place and shook our entire room so we couldn't even be inside, we decided to leave the hotel as that was our only option. I told the front desk about the problem and they said upon our return they would have a solution. When we arrived back, they said we could have a choice of some different rooms that were better than ours. That was untrue as they were the exact same, only offering a reprieve from the noise. However, the rooms they were recommending were in the same area just a little higher and still had the sound of the construction. I was paying full price for absolutely horrible service and a horrible environment. - the equipment in the gym was old with only 2 of the 5 treadmills functioning properly. You could see that the other equipment was not properly functioning either.- this hotel has a lot of hype that is not at all true- Unfortunately I can't recommend this hotel to others, as it was by far and away our worst overall hotel experience on the islands and even compared to other trips we have done. I only hope they make some changes to improve the customer experience.

My husband and I were invited for a company trip to experience The Kahala Hotel and Resort. From the moment we stepped into the lobby everything was exceptional. The location was perfect and the shuttle to some of the desired attractions was quick, efficient and appreciated. 'The housekeeping team was pleasant and kept our room fresh the entire stay. We had some of the best nights sleeps in their beds! We loved our stay at the Kahala and would definitely recommend it!

Just spent 6 days here. Location is some way out of Waikiki and very quiet. Private beach was great for kids and their Mai Tais are to die for! Staff were exceptional. Friendly and helpful. Rooms were huge, and even the mountain views were lovely. The shuttle to Waikiki was great and having a Hertz rental on site was an added bonus too. Buffet breakfast included in the rate was lovely. We ate in all the restaurants and the food was excellent and overall the resort was exceptional.Lots of little things let this place down though.. The hairdrier in the room was cheap and didn't work well. Very small clothes line in shower was not suffucient for a beach resort. The double beds were too soft and none of us slept well. A lot of 'locals' came in and used the pool and beach area on the weekend which made the small pool area very crowded and pushed out the paying guests.

Stayed here for 10 nights as part of our honeymoon, it was amazing. Loved every minute of our time here- staff attentive, food gorgeous, room lovely and the grounds were great. The staff couldn't do enough to please you. Would love to go back. Would definitely recommend swimming with the dolphins.

This hotel is definitely expensive, but the food is great, amazing location with free shuttle to/from the malls, beautiful views of the beach and pool, excellent pool attendants, services is great, pool bar food is excellent. My only compliant is that it is pricey, but you pay for what you get. I loved getting on the shuttle and going to the malls. The beach is also near by. My husband and I enjoyed our trip very much. We swam with the dolphins (a must) and took a boat to swim with sharks. If you can afford it, do it!

I am still dreaming about The Kahala Hotel 3 years later. It was the most amazing hotel I have ever been to, and it certainly lived up to our expectations. We loved that it is away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu, and that they had a small bus that left on a schedule to and from the main parts of town. The pool and ocean view are charming and intimate, the lighted pathways with torches were beautiful, the dolphins were a highlight for our 11 year old who took a class with them. The breakfasts were amazing...especially the maple butter pancakes!!! Someone is still dreaming about them. The hotel staff were very helpful for booking day trips and any information. The only thing that I would suggest changing is the double rooms have 2 queen beds instead of 2 double beds for families. But, it wasn't a big deal. We loved a side trip whale watching that we took and you must go to the Polynesian Cultural Centre it is so nice for families and adults...it's like a mini Epcot Centre without the rides!! Enjoy your Hawaiian Adventure!

it is like paradise. everything that you could ask for from a hawaiian vacation is available at the kahala. the spa is spectacular, the rooms are all roomy and lovely, the food is great, and the people are wonderful. it's a 2013 version of visiting old hawaii. i can't think of another place - outside of maybe mauna kea beach hotel - that has the same feeling. the beach is quiet and never over crowded. you can swim, snorkel, kayak, paddle board, and just relax. if you're interested in world class cuisine you can go to hoku's at the hotel or go 15 minutes to waikiki - visit the action there - and quickly get back to the glorious kahala. i can't recommend it enough.

Well established and the gold standard for all other Oahu resorts. Granted, there are newer, flashier hotels but what this place excels in is good, old fashioned service. We stayed in March, 2013 for a week and experienced only positives, from the front desk staff, bell men, pool attendants, housekeeping, serving staff and business office. All swent the extra mile. Kudos to a great bunch of people.

I just got back from staying at The Kahala Hotel for five nights. The experience from this trip is incredible! They are extremely nice there. Everything I wanted was easy to get. The beach was right outside my sliding glass door of my room. Every night there was something going on. One night, I watched a fireworks show that was on the beach in front of my room. I loved it! The Kahala Hotel is one of my favorite hotels in the world. I'll go back. I love this hotel!!!

We stayed at Kahala for a week in late February (my husband, young son, and myself), and truly appreciated the commitment to excellent customer service while there. The outstanding focus on service is evident from the moment you arrive at Kahala with with valet parking staff. This group of individuals perfectly balanced friendly service, professionalism and enthusiasm. They were always willing to provide directions, give recommendations and typically would address us by name. Upon checking in, we were pleased to learn that we had been upgraded to a partial ocean view room. While it overlooked the front entrance of the hotel, it was a nice treat to see the ocean from our room. We sacrificed having two beds (our son slept on the small sofa at the foot of the bed) to have breakfast included with our room rate. This was a well made decision. Breakfast at the Plumeria Beach House is excellent with a wide range of choices, more than enough to suit every palate. That said, if it hadn't been included with our stay, I doubt we would have eaten there as our daily bill for breakfast was over $80 and that seems exceptionally steep (considering how much we actually eat). If you do plan on eating there, I strongly recommend arriving close to opening at 0630hrs as it gets very crowded and busy as the morning progresses. We went around 0800hrs on our last day and it was too busy to enjoy. The location of Kahala is excellent for those looking to be away from the business of Waikiki. It is an easy drive into town and is close to both Hanoma Bay and Koko Head Crater. I agree with other reviewers that the pool is small for the size of the resort. It was very windy during our stay so we did not spend much time on the beach. The pool was full of families playing (worked well for us having a child but I can see how adults looking to relax might find it a bit annoying). Those we spoke to who did the dolphin experience said the enjoyed it greatly but it seemed a bit cost-prohibitive for a short period of time with the dolphins.As other reviewers have mentioned, Kahala seems to cater to the wedding (on the beach) crowd. During our stay, there was at least one wedding daily, sometimes two. It is a beautiful location although it felt a bit strange to be returning to our room following a dip in the pool or ocean as a bridal party was preparing in the lounge near the elevators.I believe having a rental car is a must when staying here though as the shuttle service fills up quickly and you must book your return time in advance (we tried to change our return without success so found ourselves killing an extra couple of hours Waikiki while waiting to return to the resort). Overall, our experience at Kahala was positive and I would recommend it to anyone who was looking for a relaxing holiday away from Waikiki but who was keen to leave the resort for meals and activities.

Exceeded our expectations, I actually didn't want to write this review to keep Kahala a secret and keep it from being booked out. :) The reality is, it was a perfect vacation for myself, my husband & two kids (6 & 10). The entire staff from the valet, bell, front desk, concierge, restaurant & pool were all accommodating in every way. I wouldn't say the pool area is too small as others have posted, but it was just the right size to have an eye on the kids in any direction and feel safe with them having some independence. The pool service, bar & food were all excellent. I loved the ability to have a private cabana, chairs or a lounge on the beach and have beach service!My husband & I had the best time relaxing on the beach while the kids played in the sand, then ordered lunch with some delicious cocktails. All with the raise of the flag they provide for you to use when you needed service on the beach. That is a vacation at its best!The dolphin lagoon was a big hit, we could view them anytime of the day, including the turtles & stingray. Very educational in a fun environment...yes to swim with the dolphins was at a high price, but this is Hawaii & a resort, so everything will be at a cost. The Plumeria restaurant was excellent, breakfast, lunch & dinner. All of it is worth the price since the food was consistently good. They also have Hoku (fine dining) and the Veranda, which is in the main area and on the balcony overlooking the pool & beach. They offered the kids menu in all locations, so my husband & I could eat a nice meal knowing the kids had an option. We really enjoyed the wine menu and all of the specialty drinks were great, if you are into enjoying a few libations on your trip.Our room was in the main tower 9th floor with a beach view, we also had the valet driveway underneath, but it was never loud, one thing I worried about for a good nights sleep. We had a nice sized room with 2 beds, the bathroom had a great tub, shower, 2 vanities & 2 closets. A great perk!It was busy at times with 1-2 weddings a day, but they usually were not there long, only to do the ceremony & take photos. I never saw an actually wedding party or dinner that was larger than 20 people and most of them were not guests so they didn't bother us. It was nice to see the beautiful brides and flowers. Our last night there was a huge company party, but we were able to enjoy their private fireworks display off the beach... it was like our own special farewell to an unforgettable family vacation.I hope that I am not leaving out any other details about this perfect paradise.The best part for us was being away from Waikiki, Kahala resort is its own secluded oasis. We did take the free shuttle into Waikiki a few times to do some shopping, some people watching and grab a burger at a local place. Overall, I think you really need to be aware that Kahala is off the beaten path, so if you have teenagers or are looking for a fun night life, then you should stay in Waikiki. We loved the simplicity of the private beach at Kahala, then having the ability to go into the main strip was an easy balance. The resort can be busy at times and maybe a bit hard on the wallet, but if you want the best vacation ever you need to realize there is a price. I can't say enough about how this place made our trip drama free! We were all happy everyday... it helps when you don't have crazy expectations and can just relax & enjoy the ocean.The website offers some great packages & deals, so many of the complaints/reviews can be remedied if you plan ahead. We did have the free breakfast for 2 adults, so instead of $100 every morning, it was only $30 for the 2 kids buffet.Also, the work out facility was nice, it is located on the main floor and overlooks the water. We also had alot of fun with the private paddleboard & surf lessons from Peter. He is the best!The concierge can set up many of the island tourist attractions like Pearl Harbor, snorkeling or whale watching. Hint: book your these activities before your trip or as soon as you get there since it fills up quickly. We were lucky to get tickets to Pearl Harbor after there was a no show.Overall, I can see our family staying here again & again until the kids grow alittle older and needs change.

We stayed here as part of a business trip and it was wonderful! Our room overlooked the dolphin lagoon and it was so much fun to watch the dolphins interacting with the guests and the trainers. Everyone we encountered who worked at the Kahala was so friendly and I cannot say enough good things about this resort. We stayed here for 5 nights and every night was so peaceful - no loud noises from other guests to keep you awake, excellent turn-down service, and a very comfortable bed. The in-room CD player playing a CD of Hawaiian music was a nice touch! The beach and towel service was great and the restaurants were excellent!

I liked the idea of being apart from the madness of Waikiki Beach, but found it too isolated to accommodate the closure of one of their main restaurants. During the Valentine week period we had to scramble for reservations and drive to dinner every day as we didn't want to eat yet another meal (in addition to breakfast) at the overcrowded Plumeria Restaurant in-house. Their modest sushi restaurant was always fully booked. It is a beautiful property with calm surf, nice beach, very comfortable rooms. But the pool is smallish and mostly for families at play--not always a bad thing--but for relaxing adults, not so much. I believe the hotel management has a strong focus on drawing the wedding-on-the-beach crowd...the parade of photo-op brides and limos was a bit off-putting. Over-all it seemed a bit hectic, but I also believe management is trying very hard to remedy some of these problems as they were quite attentive to our observations when we contacted them.

Last minute trip to Kahala - booked the night before our trip. Great reservation agent. We heard about Kahala from friends who love the place, but were a little suspect as we usually travel to the FS Maui and FS Hualalai and really didn't know what the hotels on Oahu were going to be like.Food at the Plumeria for breakfast exceeded expectations. Amazing buffet breakfast. Beach was awesome, swimmable, beautiful. Pool was nice and warm. Staff was great and super nice. Room had really pretty view, nicely appointed, two big closets and two separate sinks which my wife and I loved. Shops were great.Food at the high end restaurant exceeded expectations - we expected over hyped food and were ready for disappointment. We followed waiter on recommendations and they were spot on. He guided us not to order too much as it would be plenty of food. Fun dolphins which our 4 year old loved to watch, great fish to watch feed, amazing sea turtles which brought lots of enjoyment.If I am trying to come up with any downside to the hotel.... the only thing on my wish list would be a bigger pool. At the same time, our 4 year old loved it and we loved the fact it was a super warm pool and not chilly.Waikiki is a short 15 minute cab ride. Babysitters on call were awesome.Truly, we were braced for something to go wrong given the last minute nature of the booking and being suspicious of Oahu versus the other islands. We were dead wrong. This place is great. Oh yes - we were there over Spring break and it was packed - they handled the crowds with ease.

If you want quiet beachfront resort living, this is the place to be. This hotel has everything: dolphins, sea turtles, fish, impeccable service, atmosphere, cleanliness, beauty. Ask the concierge desk. They even have beach service at off site beaches if you need chairs and umbrellas. I cannot find a negative thing to say about this Resort. Only 10 minutes from the rush of Waikiki.

We were celebrating our birthdays and after a long day we arrived at Kahala...It was perfect, absolutely perfect. The room was Oceanfront. Large, comfortable and clean. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The view was spectacular. The beach and pool area are great and well kept. The staff was extremely professional. Get the breakfast package is unbelievable. The resort is convenient to Waikiki but far enough away to remain peaceful and quiet.

Perfect, absolutely perfect. The room was fabulous. Large, comfortable and clean. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The view was spectacular. The beach and pool area were great and well kept. The staff was unreal. They knew my name and welcomed me as their friend. The resort was peaceful and quiet. The Dolphin Quest was amazing. I enjoyed just watching the dolphins play. I rented a car and paid the resort parking fee. that is not uncommon at many resorts I stay at so I had no problems paying for it. When I needed my car, the valet ran to get it and had it to me within minutes. They were the nicest valets I have ever met. Thank you for providing us this experience. I will be back.

One of the most wonderful hotels I ever stayed at - beautiful, serene, secluded (not in noisy Waikiki - but an area they call the Beverly Hills of Hawaii) - with a gorgeous private beach that never feels crowded and the most breathtaking ocean views from my room I have ever seen.Breakfast buffet is outstanding - the other menus are a little limited if you are health- weightconscious or a vegetarian (no low-fat cream cheese, joghurt, multi-grain bagels) mostly toast bread, no baghuette/brioche-however, Hawaiian donuts, and Kahala pancakes absolutely divine!Also had a mushroom appetiz at the Beach, which was delicious, but again, drenched in oil... But the breakfast buffet is superb!!Staff is superfriendly and helpful-only exception the concierge (had a few snafus with them, but after complaining to management they more than made up for it and did everything they could to make my stay extra-special - which is the sign of a well-run hotel - snafus can happen, but how it's dealt with is what makes the difference - and management here definitely gets 5 Stars!! A disaster is the Hertz rental on the premises - rude, sloppy and unreliable (didn' even fill up the gas fully and still tried to charge me for it, the car had not been cleaned, but they threatened a $200 cleaning fee, if it wasn't returned pristine.....the worst car rental ever!!So look no further, there is nothing better and more beautiful than the Kahala in Hawaii - the locals also LOVE and recommend this hotel!!
user_name:
gg345271
Santa Monica, California, United States

review_body: i booked for a 2 queen bed room. but when we check in the staff in front told me that there's no available 2 queen bed room. i reserved through internet a month before. it so sad, so sad after expecting so much someone must sleep in a roll over bed. what do you think about this? do i have the right to feel sad?

My wife and I just had a 5 night stay at the Kahala Hotel and Resort on Oahu. We were there with her company for a special event. She had company meetings for two days and the rest was open. We never ate dinner at the hotel since we felt the prices were just too high, I had breakfast once and never again. I understand the cost of putting on a buffet breakfast and have paid in the high $20 dollar range in the past. I just thought $38 was absurd. I was also planning on doing work a few times during the trip but it took the hotel 3 days until they solved the problem of getting my computer and IPAD hooked up. They kept saying everything is ok, then on the third night like magic it started to work. I sensed they had a problem, too bad they just didn’t admit the problem. This hotel is an adult hotel. simple pool and beach, great place for adults and order kids. I have stayed at nicer hotels on other islands and never paid what I paid for parking and other amenities here. I am not the fan of resort charges, always pay attention. Would I go back if I wanted a hotel on Oahu, no, I would choose another hotel. I have to give this hotel on thing, the rooms were outstanding. My wife loves having her coffee in a real coffee cup, rather than a paper one.

This was our first time staying here!!! Amazing location, away from all the busy , tourist traps. Very private, quiet, relaxing stay. The service was very personal and prompt! Would defiantly recommend and come back again!

This was our second time at The Kahala and again we enjoyed all that there was to offer. The hotel is situated on the quiet side of Diamond Head and away from Waikiki. Our kids loved the safe, calm beach and shallow ocean waters to swim in. Pool area is great too. Overall, a great stay especially if you have kids. The kids loved the fun Keiki Club and actually asked if they could go! The sea-life and dolphin lagoon is an added bonus. Views are everything you would expect in beautiful Hawaii.

We will definitely return to The Kahala! The hotel is great for kids!!...the beach is super safe and the pools were perfect! The service was beyond our expectations! My 6 year old son and I are both gluten free. The hotel brought in all kinds of gluten free products when I let them know we would be staying...bread, pancake mix, GF buns, pasta...even a few treats like cookies and muffins! Joy and Jamie the restaurant managers were awesome!!....this is the only place we stay when in Oahu, the location is great and the shuttle service makes it even more ideal!

Beautiful views, excellent service, great memories. Although restaurant choices are a bit expensive for picky children, the staff was very accommodating. We were able to enjoy the dolphins, paddle boards, canoe. Staff at hotel from housekeeping to surf instructors were extremely friendly and helpful.

Wonderful wonderful hotel. Beautiful! Oceanfront room was amazing and they are energy efficient! A/C turns off when you open up the patios. Nice perks, pool and hot tub open 24 hours, you get to see LOTS of weddings held there, and housekeeping had our beds turned down with soft music playing and new bottles of water waiting when we would get in for the night. Keep in mind if you get a package that includes Breakfast, you do have to eat in the actual restaurant. It is not the same as room service. We discovered that once we recieved a bill for a few breakfasts we ordered in. However, because of the confusion, Kahala hotel took the charges off for us with no problem. Also, if it's the first time you've stayed in a 5 star, be ready to tip for Valet and Roomservice. It was our first and we did it out of custom, but no one ever asked for anything. Overall amazing trip to Hawaii and Kahala was the icing on the cake!

We first stayed at the kahala 4 years ago with our kids and loved it! We always planned to return, just the two of us, for a romantic getaway and we were just as impressed this time! The staff were wonderful, so attentive to our every need, the food was wonderful and the beach, pool, our room, in fact everywhere, was fabulous! We had opted for a partial sea view and were given a room on the top floor, facing the mountains. If we went out onto the balcony, and leaned over, you got a bit of an ocean view. My husband is scared of heights and could not go out there to enjoy the view. We asked to be moved to a lower floor. We were given the choice of a lower floor for the same pricer or a full sea view also on a lower floor but at an extra cost, but kindly reduced by one of the managers, both available the following day. We chose to pay extra for the sea view, which we had loved on our first visit, and it was wonderful, so much better than looking at the mountains. This hotel is pricey but if you can stretch your budget, it is such a treat! We couldn't afford a full week at the kahala, so spent the first 3 nights in a cheaper hotel in Waikiki and then the next 4 at the kahala. The two hotels were worlds apart!!!! Would definitely recommend the kahala to everyone and hope to return again one day!

The Kahala is gorgeous. We first discovered it on our honeymoon and just went back for our third time. My husband and I love Oahu since we are the type of people who love the beach, but need other things to do as well. Waikiki is like the mall at Christmas though. I love it, but the beach there is not the relaxing Hawaiian vacation you'd imagine. The Kahala has a great beach which is relaxing and has affordable cabanas. They have free shuttles to Waikiki and other shopping so you aren't missing out on anything. I am very picky with my hotels, and the Kahala has always been extremely clean and luxurious. We love stopping to watch the dolphins play on our way out or to the beach as well. A great hotel! We will be bringing our kids the next time we come, and I'm sure they will have a blast!

The Kahala remains a great resort. Perfectly pleasant but missing a few things like mini-bar service. The rooms are spacious but prices are equally so. Of note, while requesting a 2pm check out, an $80 charge was requested which is unusual. Most hotels easily allow 2 - 4 pm checkouts for program and return guests. For my taste, such little perks makes the distinction of a true 5 star hotel.

The staff provides a relaxing and comfortable environment with personal service and incredible attention to detail. We were debating between an Oceanview (Diamond Head Tower) and an Oceanfront (Koko Tower) room and chose the Oceanview to avoid noise from the pool. The Oceanview was fine, although set back a little farther than the Oceanfront. The pool area was not noisy as some resort pools can be, so if the view is important to you, I would recommend the Oceanfront (we'll choose Oceanfront next time). The beach in front of the hotel extends north for about a mile and affords a lovely, quiet walk (see photos). The breakfast buffet is a good value considering the numerous options offered and the convenience of the location - and the view could not be better!

We have stayed at Hotels all over the world, including many in the luxury category. The Kahala is, hands down, # 1. The location is superb. The food is almost without exception absolutely first class. The staff are the best trained of any we have experienced, only 4 Seasons comes close. While pricier than many NO OTHER HOTEL IS BETTER VALUE.

This was our first time staying at the Kahala and we were blown away by the excellent service, fabulous dining options, beautiful and extremely comfortable guest rooms. Loved the serene location, but also loved the fact that the Kahala offered hourly shuttles to and from Waikiki.Cant wait to go back next year!

We've stayed at The Kahala Hotel & Resort three times so far and will continue to go back anytime we're in the Honolulu area. From the beautiful location, beautiful and clean rooms, private beach, to the very friendly and helpful staff, you won't find a better or more peaceful place to stay. My kids also prefer staying at The Kahala vs. staying in busy Waikiki. The dolphins are an extra plus and I highly recommend going for a swim with them. Truly a great experience!

Wow is all I can say. I thought of writing this review when I returned home, but I just could not wait. I have been traveling for many years and would say that I am a bit finicky, but I was absolutely blown away at the service they provided us and the hospitality received. My positive experience began weeks before I even arrived. I had some issues with my booking and management was able to take care of any concerns I had even before I arrived. The management is superb and you can tell the staff has been managed well. From the minute you arrived, the warm and sincere welcome you receive is just unbelievable. i honestly felt like royalty. My bell hop Trevor was so enthusiastic. He showed me the amenities and facilities including my room as if he had built the resort. The rooms are beautiful and so spacious and amazingly clean. The beds was like sleeping on clouds and I felt like I was sleeping in my own bed. The turn down service was awesome, coming home each night to hawaiian music playing in your room and bottles of water by your bedside. The waiters at the restaurant again wonderful. When my daughter was upset returning from the buffet claiming they were out of their famous sticky buns, "must try", Eric our waiter who was cleaning the next table and overheard, went and brought my daughter some. i was so shocked at how attentive the staff was. The beachside attendants set up the loungers for you even laying out your beach towels. The front desk who when you ask for wake up call, asks if you require a reminder call in ten minutes or if you want to know the full weather for the day. The room service who not just delivers the food on a tray like most resorts, but wheels in a table with places settings even if you just ordered a simple burger. The list goes on. They truly go above and beyond the industry norm for service.mHonestly, I have never experienced such hospitality and service anywhere. There may have been newer resorts, but the service here is so genuine and sincere. The staff are really happy and as a result you see that everywhere you go at the resort. I did not once run into any staff member who did not greet me or have a smile all week. Truly amazing resort and this is the one and only resort that I will come back without a doubt!!! Private beach, dolphin lagoon with sea turtles right at the resort, wonderful restaurants with excellent food, free shuttles, valet service. This resort has everything you want for a perfect vacation. This was the best decision for my family to stay away from the tourist Waikiki area where everyone normally stays and truly experience Hawaii and the Hawaiian hospitality. Thank you Rosann, Yoshimi, Kathy, Trevor, Eric and all the wonderful staff at Kahala!!! Mahalo.

This was second visit to Honolulu, first time visit to the Kahala. Came for a conference and originally was going to stay in Waikiki but a lot of the hotels were booked out. This place was amazing. The service is top notch, people were all very friendly, and the location is a bit secluded off the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Restaurants were all terrific although felt a little bossed around in the lounge with some overbearing suggestions from the wait staff leading to ordering plates I didn't really enjoy. The beach is pretty swim friendly with quiet waves. Decor was great, clean and tasteful although I also overhead they are planning to do some renovations and replace carpets soon. Overall, felt very pampered and didn't want to leave. Would consider coming back to Oahu just to come back to this hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Kahala Resort March 1 - 7, 2013 it was truly wonderful and AMAZING! The staff was just awesome! We felt very welcomed from the time we enter the resort until the very last hour of us leaving. The staff was so kind and always greeted us with a smile and Olaha! :-) The resort was simply just gorgeous! The food was delicious! The beach OMG.... breath taking views. We met some great people that was visiting and staff. Hello Rita! Hello Delva! I wish I could remember everyone names. Oh and the bartenders....We are going to disco next time! LOL! Also would like to thank the Chef for making the awesome eggs (scrambled/mushrooms/spinach). :-) We truly enjoyed ourselves and recommend the Kahala Resort for a great place to stay. Michael and Latonya Johnson

We were at the Kahal for five days for daughter's wedding. Excellent ambience, superb staff that all called us by name, and a bautiful location on the ocean. Don't miss a swim with the dolphins. Food as very good and an extra restaurant is about to open. Very nicely appointed rooms, wonderful pool area, and kudos on the wedding arrangements. Expensive but well worth it!

Overview - Pros: great location, good service overall, excellent spa services; Cons: so-so value My GF and I recently stayed at the Kahala for 4 nights. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, we had high expectations given the amount we were spending. While we were very happy with the location (what a beautiful and calming neighborhood), overall we felt that the Kahala was not such a good value when compared to its peer hotels (Four Seasons Manele Bay comes to mind), and that in particular there were service gaps that one should not be experiencing when spending many hundreds of dollars per day. Before I cover the service gaps, I do want to thank the front desk manager (Tobias) for patiently listening to our feedback and for immediately acting on it by delivering some goodies to our room and comping a small portion of our bill. Tobias is an excellent listener and someone who the Kahala should be very proud to have as an employee. Also, while we had massages scheduled during our stay, there was construction noise next to the spa, so the spa staff kindly offered to do in-room treatments at no additional cost, which was very considerate. The massage therapists were excellent and provided some of the best massages we're ever had! Our complimentary room upgrade (courtesy of my AMEX Platinum card) was honored at check-in, and our subsequent request for a partial ocean view room upgrade was honored at a nominal fee (nice gesture), as well as the complimentary breakfast and $100 spa credit. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and many items were labelled "GF" (gluten free), which we really appreciated. Service at breakfast was quite good most of the time.The grounds are immaculate and quite beautiful, security is ever-present but low-key, and the dolphins are amazing to watch.Finally, we had an early flight our last day, so the front desk kindly suggested that we order breakfast via room service and provided us with an ample credit to cover most of the expense.The service gaps included: nothing in the room to celebrate our anniversary despite being asked (when I reconfirmed our reservation the day before we arrived) by one of the MODs whether we were celebrating a special occasion (what we felt was the biggest fail); no call-back from Housekeeping after we reported a missing shirt from the room we moved from; slow service one day at breakfast; Housekeeping not cleaning a dust-laden fan before installing it in our room; a malfunctioning phone which was not fixed during our 4 night stay (the button for the car valet stopped working 2 days into our stay and Housekeeping did not follow up). While these are not major fails, for the amount we were spending, we kept asking ourselves "would this be happening at the Four Seasons Manele Bay"?Also, the "partial ocean" rooms actually face inland and have but a sliver of an ocean view so if you want a true ocean view, be prepared to pay a pretty penny for it. We would definitely consider returning to the Kahala if the service levels are raised to meet/exceed those of the Four Seasons to provide better value.

At the risk of becoming a bore (this is my third 'rave') once again it is a true pleasure to report that all is as it should be at this beautiful gem of a property. Physically of course the property is still as immaculate as ever and more importantly the staff are as wonderful as they ever were.Arrival was a little different this time as the airline (no names) decided not to leave my bags in Hawaii this time around, however they did find them and return them to me the morning after my arrival.At check in this provided another opportunity for hotel staff to show their warmth, kindness and hospitality. The moment it was learned my bags were missing, Tobias (Front office Manager) assured me he could provide anything I might need in the short term, and Carolynn offered to provide items from her home. My room of course was ready and as anticipated and expected, in perfect condition. Without a doubt this is the most peaceful and attractive location on the island and the beauty of the location is more than equalled by the unending efforts expended by every member of staff you will come in contact with to ensure that your stay is as it should be. If a special day falls whilst you are here be prepared to be feted from morning till night, if, as in my case, a birthday is involved elastic waisted pants are a must as birthday cake pops up at every turn! No matter where you choose to dine you may rest assured that the food and the service are of impeccable quality. Each restaurant does what it sets out to do and succeeds admirably, from casual on the beach to the slightly more formal Plumeria to the more formal Dining in Hokus, rest assured wherever you eat you will not be disappointed in either the food or the service. For a light and refreshing break in the afternoon, tea in the Veranda is the perfect spot. As for the staff, in many instances more like friends than employees. I have been fortunate enough to reside at many fine hotels in my life and nowhere are the staff more kind, friendly, helpful and courteous than at the Kahala. As some of my 'friends' retire it is most gratifying to see how quickly the newer and younger members become part of the magic that is the Kahala.Individual kudos and appreciation, the list is way too long to include everyone but I must mention a few with no slight intended to the ones I don't list!Wakako, where it all starts, Two really special ladies, Angelie and Saori in the spa (the number 1 rated spa in Hawaii by the way) Jaimie,Julie,Joy and everyone in the Plumeria,Carolynn,Noel and the ladies on the check in desk, Tobias of course and the lovely Flora who took time out of her busy schedule to chat for a pleasant half hour. Terri who takes care of my room and so many others to whom I extend my deepest gratitude for always guaranteeing more happy memories.Not surprisingly my return visit is already booked.2

Beautiful hotel, make sure to get a view toward the ocean and ideally overlooking the dolphin pool. Dolphins in the lagoon in the courtyard are spectacular, magical creatures cavorting all day. Kind of expensive to do any of the dolphin programs, but worth it; even without signing up, they're fun to watch. The beach is nice - a little boring with the breakwater killing any waves, but beautiful nonetheless. Grass lawn and palm trees on the beach, with beach chairs and popsicles in the afternoon, wonderful big breakfasts on the veranda in the morning ... Darn it's so nice! They locked down the day we checked out because Hillary Clinton and the State Department team were coming in for some kind of summit ... it's that kind of quality hotel. For lunch or dinner we would walk through the quiet Kahala neighborhood to the Kahala Mall and Whole Foods to pig out.

Stayed here for a corporate event recently and it was excellent. The location is unbeatable if you want some peace away from Waikiki. The beach, the pool and those Dolphins are brilliant.Must admit if you stayed here with a family it would be great but also quite expensive so probably best to look for a package deal I guess.The room was beautiful and quite large and the service was very good, in particular the housekeepers. They made up the room so nicely and it was spotless with al my things in order every day.

Having spent 10+ years in the luxury hotel business, I always look very closely at how a hotel operates (I can't help it!). At Kahala, I was impressed at every turn. From the point of reservation to check in, activities, concierge, dining... they didn't miss a beat!If you're considering a place to stay on Oahu, this is it. Near Waikiki, but far enough out from the crowds and over populated beaches. This is a true paradise.Carolyn checked us in for a romantic stay over Valentines Day weekend. Flora escorted us to our room. And both were so kind and attentive. In fact, every time we called or spoke to someone in person, the staff was exceptionally professional and personable.Housekeeping service was impeccable! We never saw housekeeper, but the room was always serviced exactly when we would have liked it. And it was done superbly. And of course, the rooms are excellently designed and have a very calming effect.The beach area is private and beautiful, the dining is outstanding, and the lomi lomi massages were... well... awesome is the only word!I can't say enough good things about our experience. Thank you so much Kahala team!

I have never experienced such hospitality from a hotel. The staff here are like one big family and treat their guests with the same generosity and warmth you would expect from friends. Worth particular mention is the Director of Guest Services, Flora, with whom I hope you have the pleasure of meeting on your stay at the beautiful Kahala Hotel and Resort. The property rooms are wonderful, watching the dolphins on your way to breakfast is a real delight, but ultimately it is the service which makes the Kahala an international standard luxury hotel.

The rooms and service at this hotel were exceptional. The property is in a suburban country club setting. They have a beautiful setting on a quiet beach with a small pool and a dolphin sanctuary. The rooms are large and luxurious and the staff in the restaurants, front desk , porters and maids were exceptional. There are a lot of kids at this resort and the place is very kid friendly. You are about a 10 min cab ride from Waikiki if you want to go there and they have a shuttle to the Ali Moana Mall. If you want to be out of the hubbub of Waikiki this is a good choice.
user_name:
RaymondJP
New York City, New York

review_body: The knock on staying on Oahu versus Maui is the "touristy" feel of the Honolulu area. I agree that Waikiki is way too touristy to be there all of the time. In fact, if I had to stay in Waikiki, I would not enjoy Oahu at all.Thankfully, The Kahala solves the problem. It is located in a high-end, residential neighborhood and when you are at The Kahala, you do not know there's anyone else in the world. It is private, safe, and has everything you need right there. Yet, you can be in the center of Waikiki or Honolulu in 10 minutes to enjoy the very nice restaurants and shopping in those areas.The Kahala is 50 years old so it's not like staying at a place like Aria in Las Vegas. To follow the Vegas analogy, though, it's very much like staying at Paris in Las Vegas. It's clean and it's quaint. It reminds me of what the resort from the original Dirty Dancing movie is like, but the beach version, in that it's the kind of place that you want to go back to over and over again because it feels like "home".Expect to see a wedding on the grounds everyday you are there, because it really happens. Apparently, it's a big wedding destination for Japan. The dolphins and fish are beautiful and add to the flavor of the place. The staff calls you by name, and the views can't be beat.The beach is so peaceful because there is a reef about 50 yards out that stops the waves from breaking on the beach. You can see the waves, but the water in front of you is as still as a pond.Don't leave this place without renting a cabana and getting the chance to raise your flag. You will have a cold beverage in your hand in your cabana 5 minutes later. Seriously, this alone is worth the price of admission.In summary, my wife and I love this place and wish we could just live there. Because of The Kahala, we love Oahu, and have be all over that island as a result. Don't be mislead into thinking all of the beauty of Hawaii is on the other islands. There's not a more scenic place in the world than Makapuu Park on the southeast coast or Ke'ena Park on the northwest coast, and I could sit on the North Shore and watch the waves forever.If I were smart, I would give The Kahala an awful review so that demand does not drive up its prices, but if you have a chance to go to Hawaii and stay at The Kahala, you will never forget it.

Location of The Kahala is wonderful: in less than 10 minutes driving on Diamond Head Road, you can be at Waikiki, yet the hotel grounds are quiet and peaceful: best of both worlds. Within the hotel grounds the beach is also beautiful, and the pool is not huge but very comfortable for the crowd: we never felt it was too packed for an entire week. The service is great: they always address you by name when you call the front desk. The breakfast buffet was excellent and for our package included for up to two adults per room. Wifi was free. We did not do the Dolphin Quest swim, but we saw the dolphins playing plenty of times just standing on the fence of the pool. Hoku's restaurant was excellent.Things to be aware of: the beach has no waves, since it is a tide pool (as is much of Waikiki) and the outer barrier blocks the waves coming in. Nice for swimming, but not if you're looking for body surfing. (The beach park right next door might not be a tide pool.) Also, if you have a car, it is almost required that you valet park it. I think there is self parking option but the cost per day is about the same. There is no street parking as the resort is surrounded by a private golf course and private club.We had a very nice stay and would definitely consider going back again.

What a wonderful hotel!We took our teenagers to the Kahala for the first leg of a Hawaii trip. We hadn't been there before, but we had heard great things about it. We were not disappointed. Every aspect of our stay was spectacular. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms (we had adjoining suites) were wonderful. Spectacular service. Great food. Nice beach. The hotel was at capacity, but we never waited for anything. There are not enough superlatives to describe this property. It is not inexpensive, but as Hawaii hotels go, you get a decent bang for your buck. One thing we had to adjust to was hanging out with the celebrities. "Hey look . . . there's Matt Damon!" Doesn't happen to us very often in Kansas.

A hotel unlike any other. Upon arrival was treated like royalty. Wonderful staff--very attentive. Food was out of this world. Best sushi ever! Mango chutney a must on anything but particularly the burger! Hammocks outside were so relaxing and the pools, watching the dolphins were amazing! The rooms overlook the ocean and sleeping with the balcony doors open was like heaven. An absolute must stay when on Honolulu! Romantic sunrise--simply outstanding!

Our first time to Hawaii. Lovely setting, staff and facilities. Interesting to people watch the families, frequent onsite weddings and other guests. Obviously a popular Japanese destination.Families with children are not intrusive. Breakfast buffet overlooking ocean is great start to the day. Easy access with car to sights of Honolulu and Oahu while avoiding the overdense Waikiki experience for those over 30. Management should give some thought to line up for table for breakfast and the pleasant but disorganized servers on the evening Veranda.Philosophically, I think Kahala should get out of aquarium and dolphin business. Would we recommend Kahala to others ? Yes - an upscale resort you will enjoy.

Traveling alone with a child overseas can be a challenge. However, The Kahala is an excellent respite and a stress reliever.We checked in to an Oceanfront room and quickly changed to a suite- some Ocean front rooms do not have a patio and we covet outdoor space.We used 24hr room service which was prompt ordering things from Hoku's menu which was nice since my child fell asleep and I could not go out to dinner.Breakfast buffet was lovely and has a wonderful assortment. My suite had a view of coco head and diamond head- gorgeous! Bathrooms need new tile and fixtures to compete with Four Seasons hotels.Lobby lighting and glasswork is gorgeous but flooring needs to be updated. Not enough flowers in entry and checking area. Needs updating.Some rooms are carpeted and attractive. Some need new wallpaper seaming.Some rooms have excellent upgrades. Some do need refurbishing.Beach is perfect for children.Pool is rather small and needs upgrading- larger new tiles more depth- expanse.Guests are a wonderful mix of International and Americans. The hotel has a fabulous history and patronage.We will stay here again and again.Thank you, Kahala!

I was in this property for a business meeting. However, considering it was Hawaii, I alway try to make time for the beach. The hotel is nice and comfortable. The room is big and the bed is perfect. The beach is nice, but the pool is small. They have a dolphin lagoon right beside the pool. I took a dip on the beach one afternoon, but noticed that as you go a few meters away from the beach towards the sea, the nice sand on your feet turns to mud. And this seems to go all the way out to the sea. Over-all the facilities are nice, the staff are friendly and helpful. But all of this comes with a price.

Our stay at the Kahala was amazing. Expect to be welcomed and pampered as you enjoy your stay at this resort. The food is delicious, the service is excellent and the location is stunning. You will never want to leave. The people who work at the resort are warm, funny and charming. Any question you have is answered about the island, places to visit or even the shopping. It was our first time to Hawaii and we cannot imagine going anywhere else. It is just far away from the busyness of Waikiki and yet close enough to other sites. The beach is secluded with a beautiful view. If you like you can rent cabanas or just lay on sun chairs. Either way, your stay at the beach is complete.

I love that the Kahala has consistency in their rooms. And through the on line booking tool, visitors can easily ensure they can exactly the room they want and at the rate the visitor wants to pay. I always book the ocean facing rooms/suites and love the sun light and wave sounds. The yellow walls and white bedding create a true area of relaxation. The king size bed is super luxurious. An elegant ceiling fan allows one just the right amount of island air circulation. The large bath with separate shower and tub are spacious and I enjoy the additional drawers and shelving space in the bathrooms. The robes and slippers are nice to use during your stay. I was surprised by the rather large amount of children at the resort in mid-March. (Parents, please do not allow your children to run up and down the halls at any time of the day yelling to their heart's content. Many guests try to enjoy peace and quiet in their rooms,) I was watching several of the Academy Award nominated films as I waited for the winds to calm down a bit.High winds thwarted our beach visit this week. If you are beach walkers, wear shoes as the hotel's beach is rather short, but a walk can easily be extended around the area, if one wears flip flops or sneakers.While not the most accommodating staff, the room attendants are pure delights. They are always so helpful and want to make sure everything in your room is perfect. I did not have the chance to visit the spa on this most recent trip, but I have had some of the most amazing massages at the Kahala Spa. Highly recommend the Spa and the massage services offered. I did want to mention that the Bell Staff is usually helpful. Our front desk reception and check in was handled very professionally by Ralph. We did request an additional room up check in, and I think we may have thrown him a curve ball, but he handled the requests like a pro. The food available around the pool and on the beach is typical beach fare. Fish tacos, ask for a corn tortilla or you will receive a flour tortilla. The nachos are pretty good, but ask for a side of guacamole and pico de gallo. The hot dog is served on a long roll, not a bun, so be prepared.In my room, 409, I could hear a guest in another room taking a bath and each time another guest in a close by room closed their door, I thought it was very loud. The sounds outside the room were very much a part of my room. Not mentioning the kids running up and down the halls, ringing door bells and using their outdoor voices. Perhaps some sound dampening measures can be taken.I like that the Kahala is not on Waikiki, but if it is morphing into a year round family destination and children will be running around as if they are at a Disney resort or a Marriott, i may have to return to the Halekulani.

The rooms and the views are beautiful, as you would expect. But the service is what gets you - warm, genuine, going out of their way to make your experience special, from the room, to the food, to the careful advice about your daily choices for fun and relaxation. I'm a frequent visitor to hawaii and used to stay at other hotels to save a little money. I found the extra I spend on the Kahala is repaid to me 100 times in added experience, relaxation, and feeling pampered before it's time to go home. I also like the location a short distance from Waikiki, but not so far that you can't go in for dinner or shopping.Coming here as a single woman, I feel completely cared for by the staff -they look out for you. The concierge and bell desk help with recommendations and directions. The restaurant staff and the beach/ pool staff are plentiful and look for ways to serve you. This is not one of those places where you need to flag down someone or where the staff do not make eye contact - EVERYONE across all levels seems to really care. The beach is uncrowded and gorgeous. The breakfast buffet is scrumptious, with healthy choices, fresh omelets, and fresh fruits, large selection of homemade jams and baked goods. The staff are warm and catering even when the place is packed, as it was on weekends ..... the buffet was the highlight of every morning. I can't wait to go back. The Kahala spa was out of this world. Beautiful spa rooms, luxurious treatment, knowledgable about their products and delivered a customized massage with lots of aloha..... unbelievably serene and relaxing. I highly recommend the Alii Detox massage, which really helped me relax and recover from a cold and sore muscles from a hike the day before. The very fun Diamond Head hike is just 10 minutes away and offers spectacular island views at the top. It's not too hard, just bring stable shoes (sneakers) and take your time.

We have been to Hawaii several times but this was by far the best ever! The resort is classy and elegant, the service was great: at the front desk, room service, plumeria restaurant, by the pool, at the grill, at the beach. Highly recommended! Will go back for sure.

Quiet and elegant hotel away from the busy streets in Honolulu. Food is great and the service is the best. Very friendly and efficient staff. Only thing is if you're looking for night life and a bar to mix and mingle after dinner, you should grab a taxi into town.
user_name:
Gary F
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great resort -- the best in Honolulu because of the private secluded beach. You can't get a lounge chair on the beach anywhere else in Waikiki. The room was wonderful although I was initially put in an accessible room and I did not like the bathroom. I was moved to another room the last three nights of my stay and it was exceptional. The service is good but not Four Seasons standards. All of the food was exceptional and I dined at all the restaurants. The breakfast buffet

My wife and I spent 7 days at the Kahala. We really enjoyed the quiet beach and grounds of the resort. Food and service was excellent from start to end. The only reason for a one point down grade was the lack of WiFi in our room. No issues with connection in other areas of the resort and we had wired connection in our room, so not really an issue. If you have a car there is a charge for parking $25 per day, but valet service was excellent and having a car to make the quick trip to Waikiki and others areas of the island worth it. The main attraction for us was that this resort is not in the crazy traffic and crowds of Waikiki. It was a very relaxing environment, with all the amenities you could want with 10 min drive (stay off the H1 if you can) into the restaurants and bars of Waikiki.

We spent two nights and three gorgeous days here. It was a very busy time in Waikiki and we had a difficult time finding accommodations on short notice. Instead we ended up at The Kahala and had a fabulous stay. The location is gorgeous and the staff are all friendly and helpful. We had a mountain view room and enjoyed sitting and looking at the hills and homes on that side of the hotel. At other times we enjoyed sitting beachfront and looking at the ocean. Our room was super comfortable and beautifully decorated. The bed was great too. It was fun to see the children and guests being entertained by the dolphin experience which we watched. Ev ery time we called for our car it was there before we got downstairs. We will definitely return.

We loved the Kahala Resort. The staff at the restaurants and on the property went out of their way to make us feel special. However, our room on the second floor was showing signs of needing new carpet. Stains and faded carpet have no place in a resort of this caliber. After experiencing the Waikiki Beach crowds and noise we were very glad we had chosen the quiet elegance of the Kahala... Sometimes you do get what you pay for.

After 3 perfect days on Hawaii big island we then had 7 great nights at the Kahala.Having 2 teenagers we had a large room/suite with adjoining rooms which was sensational and very well appointed and beautiful views of the bay and pool area. It's located in a lovely quiet stylish location 10 minutes drive from the main hub in Waikiki and 20 mins from the fabulous Alo Moana Shopping "town" as its huge! They have a free shuttle which is great - just book your spot early.We were also with a large group and the buffets and functions were very good for large numbers. Casual dining was also very good and well priced. The dolphin pool is a real treat - initially I was concerned about this but my son and I booked a session and it was really interesting and a great experience and realised those dolphins are bred into that environment, extremely well looked after and monitored and is a great insight into these wonderful animals. Having them swim around in such close proximity to the rooms must be unique to this hotel. Pearl Harbour, Hiring a convertible Mustang for a day trip around the island to visit the stunning natural wonders of Northshore and the Windward side of Oahu are a must...

This was our second stay at this resort.If you want total luxury and professional service then this is the place.The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated.We had breakfast each morning and there was the most magnificent selection of food and fresh juices.The service is first class and the staff cannot do enough to make your trip a most pleasant stay.The resort a provides a free shuttle bus short bus to the busy waikiki district .It is so busy there it was just so lovely to go back to our quiet piece of paradise of an evening.The resort has its own beach so there is no fighting with the crowds.This is without any doubt the best place to stay in Honolulu.

We have stayed at the Kahala several times previously, and it is definitely a gorgeous property. We love the lobby, rooms, and pool area. This time, we splurged with family and stayed in the presidential suite. Again, the room is beautiful, comfortable, and a fantastic place to enjoy Hawaii. The housekeeping service was prompt and excellent as well as very courteous. We also enjoyed the very warm, professional service at the pool/beach area.With this said, we were disappointed with a few areas of service, and when you are paying several thousand dollars a night, we thought it should be perfect. First our room was not ready at 4:00 pm. They finally took us to the room at 4:20, but even then housekeeping took 20 more minutes to clean before we were allowed into the second bedroom.Our other disappointment was with food services. We were supposed to receive drinks and snacks every evening. It took over an hour each evening to receive the food. It was delicious, but delayed. We tried to make breakfast reservations twice, and were placed on hold for over 15 minutes each time. Basically, if want to enjoy a gorgeous hotel--this is the place for you. Unfortunately, I don't think the service is what it once was.

The rooms at Kahala are lovely, very grand! We stayed in the Dolphin Wing with our 2 kids aged 10mths & 3 yrs, so overlooking the Dolphins from our balcony was great! The beach is great - we hired a beach umbrella ($25) for the day as there isn't much shade on the beach. The pool is slightly heated so it took the chilly bite out of the water which was great! Restaurants were good - but remember to book if there's a group in house! Lunch options were limited - when it rained the outdoor place closed :(. Service everywhere was great. Remember to plan ahead & prebook the shuttle service too. Only a short trip to Waikiki, but great being away from the hussle & bussle. Having a quiet beach was great! There are also Turtle, Fish & Stingrays in the ponds near the dolphins, so the kids always had something to look at.

Gr8 service , 3 restaurants, bedrooms and amenities simply sensational!Short drive from Waikiki, recomend to rent a car. Nothing beats it.Also good to beout of the commercial hype of waikiki. Fich tacos are very good at the Plumeria restaurant!

Had the best time at the Kahala. Was with my family and we all loved every part of it. What a great hotel. The food is yummy and loved the Veranda. We dined in Plumeria every morning for breakfast, yummy food and excellent service the staff always remembered my Uncles quirks and really took care of us. My sister had her best massage at the spa and I had the best manicure and pedicure. Loved Hoku's and their signature seafood table side display. We also had fun with tea service at the veranda, Grandmother is British and it was super comforting to her.

We have stayed several times at this resort because it is by far the highest quality for hotels on the island. The service is exceptional, the staff incredible and helpful. It's a distance away from the city so getting there by bus or car tends to be time consuming but it's a great escape. Sometimes more children than you'd want to deal with and sadly they only have 1 pool that most are occupying but other than that it's a great romantic getaway.

My husband and I just returned from a week stay at the Kahala and it was paradise ! When we first arrived at the hotel we were greeted outside by friendly staff. The lobby of the hotel was lovely and had many nice seating areas. Our room was nicely decorated and had a beautiful view of the ocean. The bathroom was spacious and had his and hers sinks as well as a closet for both of us, which included slippers and robes. Going out to pool was an amazing experience because the Kahala has a lagoon with dolphins ! It was so fun to watch them everyday just playing.
